reviews.review: Fancy shopping centre. This is a more upmarket shopping mall. Good range of brands and great facilities ie airconditioning and toilet. Conveniently located between Siam Discovery and it is very close to Central World.

A Luxury shopping experience all under one roof.. Alas I did rather a lot of window shopping but how much fun was that. The window displays and communal areas were a delight in themselves. Oh and there's air conditioning here mmph we liked that.Amazing range of designer shops as others have said you could buy anything from soy sauce to a designer dress and a car all in one shop We enjoyed visiting shops unique to Thailand and retail chains not available in the UK .On two separate occasions big promotions were happening inside and outside the centre They were having a Benefit makeup exhibition on one of the floors the artists demonstrating were beautifull and thier expertise was incredible seeing the transformation of some of the young girls was quite breathtaking to watch.The food hall on the ground floor was vast and you were very spoilt for choice French macaroons looked good then Thai banana rotis looked better oh boy the choice was immense.if food shopping is your penchant come to Siam paragon they have an amazing selection of everything you could want and if you are self catering for yourself this is palace to buy ingredients.Come to Bangkok with an empty suitcase and big wallet and if you like structured shopping without the heat haggling and hassle of markets and street vendors come to Siam .Make sure the men in your party do something else whilst you experince this wonderfull shopping mall there is an aquarium downstairs for younger children and bored men to enjoy.

One of the best. One of the best shopping centres on the planet! Where else can you visit a world class aquarium before shopping for your new Lamborghini upstairs and catching a bite at one of the numerous excellent restaurants, food trucks and pop ups..

Luxury branded shopping . It easily accessible from the Siam metro station and it's a luxury shopping destination, u name the brand and it is there. An expansive shopping mall to satisfy ur brand craving. On the top level u get the authentic Thai aromatic room freshers n diffusers. It's the best place I have seen to shop.

Lovely shopping.. The sale is very good and worth looking.The shops cater to the discerning shopper and have some good worthy stuff. They are not the usual touristy shops. There are some lovely costume jewellery too.It is connected to the MBK mall by a walkway so one can spend the whole day here.

Luxury brands. Connected with Siam Center, Siam Square and Siam Discovery. It took about half a day to vitsit them all (if you don't buy anything and just looking around). You can find mostly everything you need here from cosmetics, accessories to clothes here. Whatever you like luxury brands or not, still worth a visit :)

Great food court and shops. We like to window shop here. There are many posh shops and some more affordable stores like H and m. Whenever we visit Bangkok we shop at Siam Paragon. The food court is fantastic! There are so any choices - fast food, Japanese, Thai, Chinese, etc. there's also a decent supermarket in the basement. We also like the bakery Flavorfield. The curry fried bread is yummy.
Great place to meet old friends. So much to see and shop for. Where else can you do your grocery shop on one floor and buy a rolls Royce or a Maserati on another!? Simply magnificent!

Bangkok South Coast Plaza . Like the other reviewers said, this place is good for window shopping. A lot of high end brand name stores. The place is HUGH! Very clean. Too bad I can't afford anything there.
Great shopping mall. Great shopping mall where you can spend the day ! You can find everything inside and the have great food court with all kind of kitchens.

Good for window shopping. Siam Paragon houses the best brands in the world under one roof in Bangkok. These are normally out of range for normal travellers. However, that shouldn't stop us from visiting this place and see them. Enjoy watching the best brands.

Shopping extraordinaire. Shopping isn't usually my thing, however I enjoyed wandering around window shopping and impressed with the gorgeous displays and attractive layout of this store. The 'gourmet market' downstairs was a good place to buy culinary affordable gifts to bring home. I preferred eating in the foothill at Terminal 21. My Vietnamese meal was dreadful, and the foodhall extremely noisy and barn like.

Always our first port of call in Bangkok, why would you need to go elsewhere?. There are so many great stores and restaurants in this gigantic mall that even a whole day isn't enough. Superbly air-conditioned and with wide, spacious areas to move through the various levels of world-class stores, the Siam Paragon is a must visit highlight in Bangkok. Been there dozens of time now and will still find new and exciting shopping opportunities when next I visit. Truly a world class attraction for top quality service and merchandise, and then there's the many top class restaurants from cheap to indulgent. Not to be missed!
Good option. Among many malls all situated next to each other. It has original good brands maybe some expensive. It's a large space.

Shop till you drop!!. Siam paragon is one of those places you would want to visit if you want a dent to your pocket. Its a costly affair as bangkok has other places where you get stuffs for cheap bucks. But quality will be so different. Looking for brands and quality, this is the place. It also has other attractions hence you can spend hours here.
outrageous. This is a superextra big Shopping centre in Bangkok. Unbelivable big and extraordinary articles. Not cheap but the majority brands of clothes and stylish articles to find

Quality shopping. If you're looking for original top brands this place is for you. The mall offers several floors of shops and restaurants. The mall is not overcrowded like mbk. Great place to enjoy shopping.
Un believable N imagination mall . One of the top malls all over the worldYou can enjoy and have very nice time You will find what you like
perfect mall. you can find everything here ,, several foods in this mall. i love to walk around ,, you can have fun and enjiy whole day in this mall.. dam n love

More shopping.... It's just an upmarket shopping centre, nothing more, nothing less.Outside the shopping centre are plenty of street food vendors, clothing stalls & crowds, so the contrast between inside & outside is actually what interested me the most.

Overall experience Good. Always check out their weekend promotions, there might have something suitable for you. I was there during a weekend in August, some promo on lingerie going on, not bad at all. A variety of choices for food at the basement foodcourt, need to get a card at the service counter & top up with money first before purchase with the card at the food stall. Nonetheless, be prepared to expect a decent crowd over here.

Something for everyone!. LOTS of varied shops, with about everything you could possibly want. From high end designers and expensive sports cars, to world renound retailers, to boutique specialty stores, Siam Paragon has whatever you're looking for. For as large as it is, it is excellently marked and mapped, with help desks conveniently located as well.

International brand mall with MTR access. We stay in the hotel connecting to the mall, lots of International brand and also with MTR access. Due to that the mall is quite crowded. Have big food court with many food selection and also have many good restaurants.

Way too crowded . I'm sure if you go midweek it might be more enjoyable. But on the Saturday we went we were pushed and jostled at the entrance at each escalator and the food court was very noisy. We left fairly quickly and went off to the quieter malls we know.

The best place in Bangkok to get great food for a great price. Siam Paragon is a bit excessive in some ways, and you might wonder how the Gucci-type establishments can survive with no apparent business. But go downstairs to the food court, mosey into the upper-scale market and you can make your own salad, pick whatever kind of steak your stomach may desire (Wagyu from Japan, the best Black Angus from Thailand, and the best available from Australia and USA; or any of a broad range of sea foods; or a wonderful selection of ham, salami, etc. from Spain and Italy. Plus a wide range of wine to suit any taste or budget. And it can be cooked right on the spot, however you want it prepared, with various sauces on offer (you don't want to use any sauce with Wagyu, which is wonderful just the way it comes off the grill). Cooking costs THB 100. OK, the atmosphere is far from great, just sitting in a nice supermarket. But the food is fantastic and you would be paying at least twice as much (maybe 3 or 4 times as much) if you ordered a comparable meal in an actual restaurant. So atmosphere is poor, food is fantastic and the price is the best you can find for the quality of food you can consume.
Lots of luxury car brands . Porsche maserati etc on display. Clearly for the high end crowd. Its perfect for instagram happy tourists

Officially the best shopping experience!. This mall is so big that you'll need a plan to roam around! There are multiple towers spread across multiple floors, each catering to various genres of consumerism and shopping experiences!Madame Tussauds and Ocean euros are right inside this mall.You'll find almost all the luxury brand outlets, major official electronics and appliances showrooms at the ever popular value budget of Bangkok and what not!A must visit place even if you aren't buying anything!

If you are very wealthy. Lots of high end goods for the Chinese hunting for labels to wave in the face of their friends once home. The food court is good, and there's always a lot of young locals avoiding the heat outside in residence.

High end shopping mall, expensive and not the place for a bargain . There are lots of wonderful high end and expensive shops in this mall, as well as some high street names. It's pleasant for a visit and the food part is good for lunch or dinner. Definitely worth a visit if you are in the area but it isn't the place to go for a bargain.

Great but not if you want a bargain . I love this shopping mall for all the kids activities in the one place (kidzania, bowling, Sealife etc). However I wouldn't recommend it if looking for some bargains or every day things. Seems more targeted to rich tourists.
Wow!. Everything you could possibly want or need to shop for! Lots of high end designer ships, great flood places, fantastic theatres, department store... We loved it!

Shopaholics' heaven . Centrally located shopping experience for the whole family. The place has it all: a cinema, kids make believe city - a "fish tank" , just kidding - an aquarium and various restaurants cafes and ice creameries.
Big mall. This is a world class shopping mall where you can spend hours shopping. If tired sit and have a meal. Must visit

Visit again the shopping mall where I work in 2006. Review again the shopping mall where i work for permasteelisa on facade in the year 2006. The shopping are on a international price level and this why more farang visit this. Especially nice cars and motorbikes from countries with high quality.

Super mall for super people. This Mall is made with a great planning and selective hi-end brands. Most of the people come for window shopping only as there are a lot of other malls for cheaper shopping. Overall its definitely worth a visit.

just a normal big city mall. it got all the things a mall should have and more from big brands to local stuff. the food court is good and the mall is very big to cover .we still managed to squeeze in as much as we could, however most of them are high brands and really expensive.still worth a visit.
Hi end shopping place . Cool Air condition, crowded nice place for shopping it is one of the best shopping mall in bangkok since 2005

Has it all. It is so huge with so many different shops went here twice and still did not cover even half, also great place for kids as had the aquarium which was very good to keep kids busy, will definitely go back again

Institutional . large shopping center with 8 floors of shops, services, cinema, gym, supermarket, food etc etc !! certainly the most central and most famous of bangkok. because then my low score ?? because despite being famous and luxurious (top luxury brands are all present) at the end is not interesting nor fun, nor satisfactory in anything! full of people, and in some places you can not even move, all that offers shopping level and 'dearest (Cartier, Vuitton etc) or trivial (H & M, Zara etc) in the cafes and restaurants same thing (noble and nothing interesting), and other services are all exactly find in any other mall in the city (with fewer crowds and casino) .... moreover it needs to renew the image and style (now old is granted even in look) ... . that's why the low score !! perfect for a ride of tourists to view and also for groups of crazed and rowdy kids who do selfies .... that's All !!!
Great food hall. The shops are luxurious with most main brands being represented. The highlight of the mall has to be the food hall, it has over 20 places to eat and the food is very good.
Best shopping mall. The best place to enjoy your time with family or friend specially weekends , cinema , shops , food court, resturants, every things very good

Upmarket shopping at its best. This is an upmarket shopping complex. A pleasant way to roam the shops (fully airconditioned) and plenty of lovely coffee shops to have a break. Some great specialty stores, great if you want that something a little more upmarket.
One of the best . It's one of the best malls in Bkk with a sea life park under the mall with more then 8000 creatures if you going no to Thailand you must stop there

Great as usual!!!. The place has been renovated! It is much better use of space at the foodcourt but the price is a lot more expensive. Used to get chicken rice for Baht50 now Baht 80!!!!There are still a varieties of other restaurants. The gourmet market is still as good. A place where one can find everything needed. For tourist, bring your passport and get a discount card (of 5%) before shopping. The card is good for about a week and can be used in shops in the Emporium. Also note VAT refund available if you spent more than Baht 2000 in the same day at the same store. Great place to roam and kill time.

Top of the line. A great shopping experience but Strictly for the well healed or those wanting to show off .It is hideously expensive dont expect a bargain here ie : i saw a leather belt for 7500bt thats $300 Australian and it wasnt a Gucci or Armani name brand ...yiikes

1st Timer. Another massive bloody Shopping Centre with anything and everything at a more higher end $$$ range.It's across the road from the MBK so you can do both and the arts centre on the same day.When on holidays you shop so visit it.

High-end shopping with lots to see and do. The Siam Paragon is one of my favorite destinations in Bangkok. It is very easy to get to on the Skytrain as there is a station directly in front and served by both Skytrain lines.You will see mostly high-end shops on the ground floor, but the upper floors are far more reasonable. If you have never been to a Uniqlo before, I suggest a visit (it's on floor 2). It is a large clothing store with a very good selection for men, women and kids. Their prices are quite reasonable and the quality is very good.Kinokuniya (on floor 3) is, I believe, the largest bookstore in Thailand. They have a great selection of Thai as well as English books, maps and magazines.Be sure to visit BeTrend on the floor 3 for some interesting gadgets.On the lower level you will find a very large selection of restaurants as well as a top-notch supermarket with a fabulous selection of meats, deli, rice, dried fruits, etc. The restaurants range from the usual fast food outlets to some rather high-end establishments. For good, inexpensive lunches I recommend Au Bon Pain or Piri Piri.

Nice place for watch IMAX. IMAX here is bigger than another IMAX in thailand. ไอแม็กซ์ที่นี่ใหญ่สุดในไทย แต่แพงกว่า แต่ดีเพราะได้ไปทั้งชอปปิ้งดูหนังทานข้าว ใครเป็นแฟนไอแม็กซ์ต้องมา If you're IMAX fans, you need to come here because the price is very cheap when compared with IMAX in another country. ^^
Good Shopping Center. One of the most luxurious shopping mall in Bangkok.You can find everything here.The restaurants are good as well.

Big mall. Luxurious shopping mall in Bangkok. Many shops to walk and buying things you need have everything but long walk. Clean and easy to come here. Very popular for tourists people many expensive brands. Nice to sit and have a coffee at restaurant and looks around. We love to be at Siam Paragon Bangkok Thailand

My fav mall in bangkok. This one is my fav mall in Bangkok with all high class brands and an amazing cinema at the top floor... this mall has rolls Royce show room too... it's connected with isetan an another amazing shoping experience with decent brands like Nike, super dry etc

Biggest shooping on Bangkok. I went here just now, it's easy to reach. You can take BTS only 42bath. Many vendors branded you find here. This location on the central of Bangkok.
This place is very touristic and secure for everyone. I recommend you to visit here if you are shooping lover.

Nice Mall. this mall is really nice. it is huge with many designer stores (if that's your thing). it has a really nice aquarium and Madame Tussauds. The aquarium was really nice and we enjoyed it. Madam Tussauds was also nice. there were a lot of Asian wax celebrities that we didn't recognized but it was fine. The food court is enormous and you have lots of options to choose from. wear comfy shoes as you will be walking a lot.
Shopping experience. Many places to eat, a choice of anything you want. Lots of shops & places to sit have coffee & watch the world go by.

Holiday Shopping . This shopping centre is unbelievable . It offers fabulous designer stores and food. Unfortunately before buying any designer goods double check the prices, I was going to buy a Tory Burch tote bag the price being 25,000 bht approx £600 GB sterling On checking the official Tory Burch site for pricing we were surprised to learn we could purchase It for £441.00 which is considerably less that here at the store. We have also found this with other designer goods so check the official designer sites for pricing before you buy!!!
Too many people. Always packed, if your looking for a quiet mall this is not where you want to be. However, there is everything you can imagine here.

High end mall. It mostly has all the high end brands like Louis Vuitton, Armani , Fendi etcMaddame Tussauds, Sea life Bangkok is also inside this mallFor kids they have Kidzania Bangkok, a good activity for younger kids

Good mall. This is a super mall. It has all kinds of shops catering to almost all pockets. From the cheaper H&M to the local designers. The food court on the 5th floor is a definite visit. One important thing to note her is that there is absolutely NO restaurant that serves veg food other than Burger King which also doesn't taste very veg. So best carry some stuff for yourself if your vegetation or else pick up a sandwich form the food court.
love the food down stair. there is a food court, there are many restaurant to select, i love a vietnamese dish, great taste. but please bare with the queue, many people there!
Expensive. Shopping in Thailand is not cheap any more. Prices are almost same(sometimes higher) with the other countries.

Good place for family but you need many time for directions . Want to go Kidzania and Sealife Bangkok Ocean World It is almost no directory and instruction foundAdvise people ask for direction before start seekingKidzania on 5/F, you cannot walk through the exhibition hall to reach it (but the info machine shows it is possible) Looking for direction for almost 20mins and someone told us need to go down to 4th floor pass through the mall then go up againP.S. No shop number / area shown I. Website or else It just states Kidzania on 5th floor!!!!

Good mall. Always drop by this mall when we visit bangkok, variety of designer/ high street shops,good variety of food/restaurant also, easy to access by sky train as its all connected,taxi also easy to get below at the cab stand (just traffic might be a problem here)
Awesome mall. Food court and grocery is the best. Free samples prices are pretty cheap considering your in a high end mall. The mall it self is clean and very busy. Bts is right there.

Love it. I could stay at the food court all day. You will need to buy a card to use at the food court. ( no need for restaurants) The supermarket is also very good for good quality souvenirs. It is also a fruits paradise. There is also money exchange counter on the first floor near entrance where you might find good rate.

A real feast. This the best shopping mall in Bangkok mainly because it combines many elements. The food hall is breath taking, the are many places to have a cheap meal or a more expensive one in a restaurant. The range of shops is broad though there not many bargains to be had.
Must visit . Great food places...aquarium and very experience designer stores Aquarium is amazing Service is great

High End Mall. Many high end brands stores in here. Very nice mall. What I like most is the ground floor full of nice eateries and restaurants. It's here that I'd found one of the branches of After You Dessert Cafe.

Nice. Slightly expensive but everything is high quality. There are food stalls near the Gourmet Market. The Gourmet Market is nice, some items cheaper than other places. Nice shopping mall and has air con which is always a plus

Generic high end boutique. It's a typical shopping mall filled with high end boutique such as Chanel, Prada and so on. Maybe I'm biased as living in Singapore, working near the shopping district known as Orchard Road, these boutique malls are plentiful and they bore me. Only saving grace i found was the cinnabon shop. Cinnabuns is love. Cinnabuns is life. A must have whenever I'm in bangkok.

A cool mall for imported items. Western brands are luxury items in Thailand. If you love them, you will love this mall.It is quite conveniently near the Siam BTS station and is open until late night. There are many food and drink options. There are also cheaper markets nearby if you are looking for bargain shopping. The farmer's market is an upper-class grocery store, worth a visit.Be prepared to spend. Nothing is cheap in this mall.

Big luxury shoppingmall. Very big and modern shoppingmall, with a lot of shops.
Too big to get lost sometimes, luckily they have signs to find your destination :)
Upmarket shopping centre. This is one of many upmarket shopping centres around Siam. The surprising think was the cost of things. Cheaper than what I thought. Well worth a visit

Shopping paradise . It's in downtown, near BTS station. Has all kinds of luxurious brands for both male and female, connected with Siam center with bridge. Also close to other shopping centers like MBK and Tokyu. Also has big food court, gourmet market. Near the place, there're also street market at night, of cheap things, especially women clothing. Also has refund counter in ?2nd floor, near H&M women clothing.

A Generic Shopping Experience. If you love luxury brands, then this is the place for you. Food courts are reasonably priced and the food is somewhat tasty.Didn't see too many shopping bags, it seems that the locals come to escape the heat.Not sure why anyone visiting Thailand would spend a lot of time shopping in a "modern" mall. Local markets are much more raw.
Nice food & great place for shopping. Many good resturants here (Here After desserts) & Gourment supermarket.Fitness first is on 4th flr.

A Very Expensive Shopping Experience . If you are into brands, then this is the place to be. This is a huge shopping mall right next to Siam Central station.. Has all the expensive brands that will cost you a fortune but it is indeed a very beautiful mall

What an attractive . If we said the we will speak about shopping mall, it means that's the best one in the world If we are talking about food court, you can chose between 20 food courts available If we are talking about entertainment, you will have cinema, underwater world, kids playground and Madam Tussauds wax museum and many other things Actually you need 3 days to explore Siam ParagonEnjoy and have fun You will find everything you need in Thailand in one place

High end shopping mall. This is a high end shopping mall with all the branded like hermes, gucci, lv, dior etc. There is also the siam departmental store for clothes, comestic, kids and a hugh section for ladies lingerie. The basement is a food heaven with many varieties of food stalls from thai, chinese, japanese, vietnam, western food. A must try is the roast pork from mk gold and for dessert, go to this shop call after you.

love that place and area. I recommend this shopping mall, not only its interesting to see the stores, but the area in front is good for relaxing and the always have some live music or events in front of the main entrance.. Last time I was there the had Nikon Photo Show. This is also the central point for the metro trains.. You can switch to all the trains at this station ! Pattaya.red
Beautiful and amazing mall. This a amazing big mall with lots of big and expensive brands! Lots to see and do!the foodcourt is also really lovely with great food

Loving this mall. A mall with lots of food choices and also must visit the Gourmet Market for variety of snacks and food choices. Also, ground floor has a few kiosks of food that serves everyone from western, thai, chinese cuisine. There is an After you branch here. This place is where Harrods and laduree is

Just a luxury mall. For those that expect to see what makes Bangkok a unique city, a piece of advice: Stay away from Siam Paragon. It is a nice mall, agreed. But nothing else. The same you'd find anywhere else in the world. So, why waste your precious time doing something you can do at home?

Incredible place. There is a food court unlike any other I have seen before, and the shopping in paralleled, just out of this world. More stores than a forest has trees. Plus some good art work very close by.
Awesome place. Awesome place for spend time. Many eateries and the cinemas centrally located in the heart of Bangkok.

A shopaholic's paradise.. A shopaholic's paradise.The shopping god must be residing here.Siam Paragon,a large shopping mall right at the heart of Bangkok, anchored by the Paragon department store and also featuring the Siam Ocean World aquarium.If you're looking to indulge yourself with all the designer brands in the world, you've come to the right place. Worth a visit.

Upscale shopping center near Siam Square. We were looking for our old favorite restaurant Café Chilli in the basement of this building but that whole section was under renovation. It's easy to get there from any BTS Skytrain station as this mall is directly connected to the station. There's a wide selection of nice restaurants and the shops inside are of the range Bulgari, Prada and so on. The Paragorn Department Store has a nice toys department for kids. They could be busy there for a while. Aquarium Sea Life is also to be found here, it's in the basement. We didn't go there this year as we went there a few years ago.It's nice to do a shopping run from Gaysorn Plaza (not much changed since the last renovation, except for the escalators) to Central World Plaza. Then follow the skywalk towards Siam Paragorn, Siam Center and Siam Discovery (very beautiful at this moment!!). Ultimately, if you're not tired yet, you could visit MBK as well. Shopping will come out of your ears by then ;-) Although Siam Paragorn is nice to walk through, it's expensive shopping there. For dining there are some very nice options to be found!

Shopping paradise! . So many quirky shops and good mix of cheap/expensive. Rolls Royce dealer in there for the more financially well endowed! Looks pretty and Siam Discovery nearby. Just walking round it is a treat
Shopping Heaven!!!. The largest, most beautiful & best mall. If you love high end brands & want authentic sales as well. Siam paragon is the way to go. I love the food selection here. Awesome ✌

Expensive and branded shopping place. If you are looking for branded and expensive products you should go here. All the big brands of the world are present here. Well connected to the sky train and sky walk from other malls.

Nice place to escape the heat. This is very typical of the high-end shopping malls that you see all over Asia. Beautiful but expensive shops. That said, it's a nice place to spend a couple of hours browsing and escaping from the heat in air conditioned comfort.

Nice!. the Siam paragon is nice. this is must go shopping center for everyone.
you can buy a lot of branded stuff here and you alo can find a lot of restaurant for sure. just usual shopping center with nice atmosphere and design

Brand name Shops and Restaurants. Nice shopping mall in the middle of Bangkok easily accessible by BTS (Siam Square). Consists of many brand name/ high-end shops and nice restaurants. Good place for dining for Thai food, western food, Japanese food, Mexican, salad/veggie lovers or fast food like KFC or Mc Donalds...or just go there for picture taking outside of the mall.

One of the best shopping mall. Elegant and luxury mall whuch u can find most of high end brands.
Useful tips:
1. Restrooms at the backside are less crowded
2. Food court at Basement is ok and has reasonable price
3. Best way to get here is by Skytrain
Expensive. Beautiful centre with free wifi and aircon, however we found it to be too expensive for our liking and budget.
Class. cool modern shopping mall in Bangkok, a must-visit if you visit Bangkok. There's everything you need here.

Amazing Thailand . One of the nicest shopping malls I have ever been too. There are a lot of high end goods but the food hall can suit all pockets and tastes. Its fairly Americanised but still fabulous and it next to sky train and has blissful aircon! Worth visit.
Great place to go in the afternoons . Well it's a busy part of the city in a shopping area zone. Good experience overall and best in afternoons.

Wanting a real shopping experience check out this place. This place definitely knows how to showcase the products. There are staff around wanting to help out. Its a great place just to people watch too
High class mall. Very good air-conditioned in a hot place here in bangkok, however things are all branding stuffs just not my target. It is a nice mall tho.

Got everything A ~Z. From top brands, to local food , bakery and local garments as well.
Overall good place to shop had pretty much everything required

Luxe as usual. Nice upmarket hang out to shop, eat and people watch. And to buy a Rolls Royce and count Hermes bags lol!
Ocean World is fun too especially with kids but go in the morning while the sea life is awake. Went at 5pm and feedings and shows were done.
A mall. What else is there?. Restaurants, clothes, supermarket, cinemas. Just like what you would expect from any other malls around the world.
A luxury shopping center.. Siam Paragon has many lucyry shops, restaurants, cinema and many things.... It has almost everything you seeking for. Very beautiful and great place for shopping....

Nice. All the Siam malls Siam center,,Siam discovery are connected and we can hop all of them without getting out to the road..classy mall with all the branded shops..underwater SeaWorld is in this mall..impressive food options especially there was a fresh bread n baked goods next to gourmet market..really good..nice place
Excellent shopping experience. One of the best shopping malls in the world. Beautiful design, a huge choice of shops in different department. Very competitive prices.

I Love Siam Paragon!. I've been coming to Siam Paragon for years. It's a high class, state of the art, shopping mall which has everything including a wonderful movie theater, countless restaurants, shopping of all kind, a modern grocery store, and art work galore. It also has a nice aquatic sea center at the mall basement. This a place is for anyone of any age and any price range. There is so much to do and it's always changing. It is so easy to get to with it being adjacent to the Siam BTS. There is no reason not to visit this place while in Bangkok and with it being adjacent to Siam Square, there is even more things to do. I will continue coming here as long as I stay in Bangkok.

A very upmarket mall. Having lived in Singapore, I was very familiar with the "Paragon" name and as soon as I walked in the mall it felt a lot like walking into Paragon in Singapore. The main difference is that this mall is larger and that there was almost no one in the mall and this was on a Saturday afternoon. There are lots of very nice department stores and boutiques and all of the luxury Brand’s.
Luxury and luxury. Nice to walk and look at all the luxury brands from Louis Vuton till Rolls Royce. Armani till lamborgini. Don't expect any bargains, same price levels as in the West.
Luxury Shopping mall. Siam Paragon has many shops, restaurants, cinema, aquarium and event hall.you will enjoy to shopping here as it has almost everything you seek for.
.. Great range of shops, little high end but a great place to get out of the heat. Food court has lots to choose from
Luxury. Amazing place to visit and shop. All major brands available. Very well connected via skyline. Beautiful ambience.

High End shopping . Great mall. High end stores and high end designers. If looking for trendy stuff place to be just ensure you have the money to go sheek. Great food courts if you want a more easy going on stomach menu from the Thai foods.
It's biiig. Massive mall. Everything you could need available including a cinema on the top floor. Very pricey stores though.

Wonderful. Very wonderful mall in siam square
Many restaurants with delicious food , it is good also for those who like shopping
Great shopping hall. Siam Paragon is a must visit place in Bangkok, everytime when we go there, we will spend a few hours inside.

Very hi end. All the very hi end boutiques are there from Louis Vitton to Hermes to Nina Ricci. I highly recommend the mandarin Oriental coffee shop for lunch. Delicious salads and sandwiches and amazing deserts.

Ocean world. We visited Ocean world at Siam paragon. It's a must see place as the children would really love seeing the aquarium. They have live feeding shows. It's very well done up with amazing variety of fishes. The children really enjoy and it's value for money. The food court is amazing and not very expensive. International cuisine is available and Indian restaurant is also there at Siam paragon food court. The shopping mall is huge with several brands available under one roof. It's a great place to do brand items shopping.

Great Mall for Tourists. We normally go to here to shop with our kids. It is a crowded mall but it is considered to be organized and clean. We love their Ground floor food court (Food Hall) since it is providing excellent choice of food with reasonable price. Highly recommend to visit when you are in BKK!

Huge but interesting. Very huge shopping mall with many interesting structures and shops.. forget about shopping as stuffs are out of your pocket limit. We visited ocean world here. Sign boards are not so clear to access metro or ocean world.

Simply Stunning . I have visited Siam Paragon Centre twice in December 2015 and May 2016In my opinion it is the best Shopping Mall in South East Asia it's a must to visit,You could spend all day here and never get bored its that good,It offers absolutely everything and I mean everything The shops are as good or even better than you would find in Europe Competitively priced you can buy anything,If you need a break stop at the numerous food halls offering food from every corner of the world but don't forget to buy your food card before you go to the Food Counter,It's simple you just pay what you feel is sufficient they credit a card , then you choose your food and pay with the cardAny money not used is refunded Siam Paragon is No1 for me

Best place to hangout. This is a huge mall which is easy to locate and is directly connected by the metro. There are a lot of high end shopping outlets where even luxury cars like lambhorgini can be bought. The mall is flooded with beautiful quaint cafes and has a huge food court. There is huge multiplex as well.

Family trip . Another massive shopping mall with original brand.
We enjoyed first classe cinéma with lounge , a 15 M' free massage be fore your movie , with limited seats.. You feel very exclusive.!

Superb!. I have been to a lot of malls in Jakarta, the city of so many malls where I work, but Siam Paragon in Bangkok is definitely on a higher level. The food court, the cinema, the supermarket, the Kinokuniya bookstore, the facilities, everything was just on a high standard. For those on a tight budget, this is not a good place to shop, but window shopping is free and this is definitely the best place in Bangkok to do it.
Big big big. If your looking to while some time away and escape the heat and humidity then go to the Siam Paragon. It's a nice centre with hundreds of shops and good eating food court.

Only 1 vegetarian option in this place . This food hall is really big and has a lot of little food stalls. It all looks tasty but out of about 20 booth, they only have 1 with vegetarian option (which didn't look great). Very disappointing!

Not in my 20's anymore. . Let me start out by saying that I'm not a 20-something backpacker. This place is similar to Bourbon street... Well it's worse. There's nothing of quality around. You will constantly be approached by creepy men trying to sell you anything from suits to tuk-tuk rides to wherever. Visit just to walk down it once if you must but don't stay in the area long term.

Popular high-end shopping mall. A popular shopping mall located in front of Siam BTS Skytrain station. The mall houses a host of international high-end fashion brands providing mainly luxury items for visitors with cash to splurge. Prada, Louis Vuitton, Jimmy Choo, Hermes and Versace are some of the exclusive stores here. For the well heeled visitor looking for something special, this is the place for you.

Wow. Shopping mall can be easily reached by skytrain.Station itself is Siam.One of the best shopping malls in Bangkok.Beautifully designed with eye catching window shopping everywhere.Mall has got everything.

Good for your eyes . Beautiful mall centrally located adjacent to BTS sky train. From Chit Lom only cost 15TBH. This mall have all real brand name products. If you are looking for a real name, this is it. Prices as expected for all brand name products, this is not a bargain place.

Shopping and more. An excellent place for shopping, breakfast, lunch and dinner, many restaurants and coffee shops. You can enjoy shopping while kids enjoy cinema in the movie theater or experiencing the sea life ocean world in the largest aquarium in South East Asia. It also has a bowling alley and karaoke centre.
Shopping and dining, under one roof. A place I visit daily during my trip to BKK. You will be spoiled for dining and shopping choices! Love the supermarket too!

Top class shopping mall in Bangkok. Right in the center of Bangkok at Siam Square. Connected to BTS sky train. Lots of brand name stores as well as department store. Food court is large with variety of cousine to choose. Parking available.

2 great places for children under 10. Very clean, nice for people who don't have access to ask the luxurious brand-names. Greatest places would be the aquarium and Kudzania if you have children under 10!

Great Mall. I went to the ocean world, which is located in Siam Paradise Mall. The mall is easily accessible by the BTS. The station to get down is SIAM. You can walk straight into the mall from the station. The food court is located on the lower floor, and offers a lot of different food options. Below the food court is the ocean world. The mall is huge and has all the good brands.

At the center of everything.... If your mall is directly connected to the busiest BTS station, then chances are your mall will be one of the busiest in foot traffic. Such is the case of Siam Paragon - connected via Siam BTS through several channels. This mall is not hard to miss - everyone knows this, it's huge, it's flashy and it has a lot of interesting stores. The food hall is impressive, carrying a lot of local and international chain of restaurants. One's shopping experience can range from luxe (think Hermes...) to street (Uniqlo). There's a quiet part of the mall - towards the other end of busy H&M, Kinokuniya and the cinemas. I have lingered there long enough to see several establishments come and go over the years. Still, Paragon is an experience - to be enjoyed for what it is.

Wow!. The first thing you notice as soon as you enter the mall is the huge food court. Tens of places to choose from. Once you are done with eating, you will find plenty of options to shop, all the high end brands under one roof and in the basement is the Siam underwater aquarium. The tickets are a little pricey but worth a visit.

Shopping mall but have seen better. Maybe it's because I have a favorite shopping mall in Kuala Lumpur (pavilion) that it's hard to give another one 5 stars. I found this shopping mall clutters and to much of it is used just for showing off some nice cars.
Good to look around but expensive . Very nice with lots of posh shops - some very expensive ones - I like to look around and then buy on Amazon when get home. Food court downstairs is great

Best in Bangkok . Must visit Siam paragon as high end shopping All brand names Plenty of food options and shops Beautiful place to shop Expensive place Connects to Siam discovery etc Connect to Siam BTS Great photos near fountain outside

Just another modern shopping mall. It is just one of the high end malls in Bangkok as you can find almost all the expensive brands in here. Good for only window shopping if you have swallow pocket. The supermarket at the lower ground floor is good, lots of thai food and selection.

Huge mall and expensive stuff. Huge and expensive things.. we had visited oceanworld in this mall.. however since im from dubai so i didnt lik the oceanworld since there is better things in dubai..
Howevr the mall was huge.. But sad part is thy dnt have any econminal resto.. All bug names and we had to use Mc donalds store only...

Very deluxe mall. This is one of the nicest malls in the whole world. It's extremely nice and very deluxe. Almost all of the stores are so intensely expensive that I could never actually afford anything here. Well, except the coffee, because they have some reasonably-priced coffee stores here. It's right by the BTS, so it's very convenient to get to. There are more modestly-prices malls down the street if you're like me, and you just go here for window shopping.

Superb location and superb mall. Directly located at siam BTS. You can ask and directly take exit which leads to mall inside.The mall is huge. With all range of companies store you can see here.Aston martin, bentley, maserrati and all.Food court is huge. Its always full. There are 6 floors.You will find all store with shoppers . Rather it be costliest garment store also.I loved this mall.
Expensive but nice to visit. Prices in most stores here were very high, but the mall is very upmarket and nice to visit. Good food hall as well. Close to Siam BTS station.
Beautiful mall with lots of luxury. Very luxurious mall were you can find all designer stores. Many luxury brands are available. Food Court offers lots of restaurants and local foods at good prices.
Shopping Paradise. Shopping paradise, need a garmin and sedgeway as the mall is extremely huge. Expensive abs the staff are unfriendly.

Great mall. Visited this mall and was really impressed,huge mall with a lot interest shops to visit,buy souvenirs (you can find same cheaper in street small shops).Totally one of the places that should be in "should visit" list.

Fine place.. Paragon department store has a fine layout with the department store on one side and the rest of all the free standing shops settled on the outer bound. Many brand names for leather goods are here and also inside the department store at their kiosk.There is a nice section for Thai products in the department store from insecense sticks, souvenirs to nice Thai textiles clothings. Theatres for movies are on the higher floor along with bowling section. Food will be down on the same floor with supermarket, whether fast food, food stalls, proper restaurants, and coffee booth are all here. Aquarium will be underground. Easy accessibility to reach Siam Paragon by BTS. A fine half day can be spent for shopping and enjoying here.

High Class Luxury and More.. Not many shopping centres can boast dealerships for Rolls Royce, Tesla, Lotus, Ferrari and more. Those are nestled amongst the plethora of high end designer shops for almost everyone 'name'. Then there is the cinema on the roof and the food court on the lower ground floor. Lots to see, experience, eat and do.

Shopping . The heart of bkk for the shops and stall Plenty of places to get expensive and cheap stuff Use sky train to get in and out of location traffic mad Always ask cost of Tuk Tuks before you get in or used meter taxi if not using train You will not get ripped off by street venders they are polite and good people Just be careful of the ones that approach you trying to sell you something Overall great area to see Bangkok

great place to buy stuff and go to the cinema. Very close to the sky train and has everything you need for buying accessories for travelling, theres a really good cinema there to cill out and relax and have a bit of western culture.

Luxury shopping . Visited here 22nd Aug 2016 lovely shopping mall if you want to buy luxury items but of not food hall downstairs is impressive and next door to Siam Square for more affordable shops!! Good to see
mall great design but not for the prudent shopper😋
Pokemon Go!. Was here for a meeting and discovered a haven for Pokemon trainers. Numerous pokestops, airconditioning and many varied food opportunities! Perfect really.

Mall for everything. Bangkok well known for it's big and huge malls which has everything you need from cloths to food ,entertainment and so much more.I have visited this mall during my first visit to Bangkok few years ago ,and since then I always visit it .It's a huge mall and if you spend a full day in it you won't be able to see everything there.Shops are vary from luxury top high brands to budget or normal bands which includes every thing such as cloths , shoes , sportswear and equipment and many more .The mall is located in heart of Bangkok commercial area which is surrounded by other big malls and some hotels and you can visit them just by walking from one to another .Also there are many restaurants inside the food court which is really huge and has many to offer from international cuisine to local , and there are some stuff to check such as Madam Tussaud and aquarium  Prices in shops also varies as there are extreme expensive world class brands and there are some mid-range goods which is possible to be purchased by every one .Overall I always enjoy being in this mall and I spend good amount of time there , and I recommend shopping pals to hit it .
Perfect for a shopping experience!. big, Big and BIG! You'll find it all for all types (almost), but still mainly for advance consuming!

Best shopping in Town. At siam Bts station thereis the absolute best shopping expirience you could have in Bangkok. Best will be on Rainy Days there you can speed full Days for eating , entertaining and shopping quality goods.

Everything You Need under One Roof. This shopping complex has a good mix of high end and mid range brands. Lots of choices for tourists. They also have an awesome food court that has hundreds of food stalls that are all delicious and authentic. A large supermarket is on the ground floor and has an extensive range of local as well as imported products.

Where to eat in Siam Paragon - Kloset Cafe. "Home cooked from heart. Just like your parents cook for you". This was written on the napkin. This is a real Thai food restaurant. We had creamy crispy duck curry and kanom jeen numya gai. We just finished the last drop and cleaned the plates.

Shopping in Bangkok. Great shopping mall, it's connected to the MBK and Siam centre. For whatever you look for it is there. In the basement you will find an amazing amount of restaurants, it's food every where!

Killing Time. If you are a bit boring to see so many temples of bangkok in a hot day and very crowded people. Maybe you need to relax in mall, cool AC unlike the hot sun outhere will be a luxury. Siam paragon is huge, with so many store, we spend hours in here just to walk from each floor to another floor.

Huge mall. This is a very huge mall located next to Siam BTS station.
There are lots of high end signature shops and also a big departmental store.
On the ground floor, there is very nice food court and also a wide selections of restaurants.
For entertainment, there is an ocean world aquarium, cinema, and bowling alley.

Ben & Jerry's Ice Cream in Food Court! That is worth the trip if you are an ice cream lover!. I am from the East Coast USA where Ben & Jerry's was founded. I have been to the farm where it was founded and the business where it is made and distributed in Vermont, Massachusetts! That is worth a field trip if you visit Vermont! It is the best hard serve ice cream ever! There it was in Siam Paragon Food Court! I thought I was in a dream! Today I got 2 scoops of "Caramel Chewie Chewie with chocolate chunks with caramel in them! Whoosh! The line was moving. I got 2 scoops because I noticed in Thailand that a large is often like a small where I am from. But today was the first time I ordered 2 scoops and really got 2 scoops. Today in celebration of the Queens birthday and Mother's Day any son that went in the line with their mother got a free cone! That may be going for the month? I shopped and got groceries at Gourmet Market - amazing! Had lunch at the Royal India. It was great delicious! But Ben & Jerry's Ice Cream was the Gold Medal in the Siam Paragon today! They even sell the same funky T-shirts there!

So well looked after it almost sparkles. This shopping centre is incredible. It's spotless, classy and we lost hours just wondering around inside. Whilst it is pretty busy, it's nice and cool and you dont feel stressed out. We popped in to the aquarium and fell in love with the food hall. The choice is so overwhelming we went back a second time to make sure we didn't miss out.

Best place to shop and good restaurants . World class shopping mall, all modern shops from Chanel,Hermes, LV , Cartier etc......There is a lot of restaurants from fast foods to fine dining. Lots of patisserie restaurants typical French extremely good. The restaurants differ you get Italian, French, American, Japanese , Thai etc....
Huge Mall and every type of shop you can imagine. Really nice big modern shopping mall, a very wide range and selection of shops also a food selection of places to eat.

Higher class of shops . Better class of shops than Central World but not as much choice. Has a Sea life centre and was full of kids. Overall, worth a visit, if getting a train get a day ticket before you go.

Great Shopping . Lovely shopping paradise. A must visit for business or leisure. Love the ample shopping space with international brands and basement supermarket with almost everything at great prices.
Up market shopping. Easy to reach via the Skytrain. You will be able to shop till you drop here, anything from an ice-cream to a Porche. Do try the desserts at After you desserts.

Go for the food. First make sure that you are not in the Siam Centre which is beside the Paragon. Like major malls in Bangkok Siam Paragon offer all the major foreign brands in addition to local ones. What makes Siam Paragon unique is their endless number of food shops, restaurants, food stalls located in the basement. Beware the crowd could be overwelming at lunch time and waiting time to get a table/seat groes accordingly. Go mid-afternoon. The upper floors are deserted. Direct access to Siam station. This is a selfie paradise.

difficult exit way for tourist. big shopping mall; expensive brands but available products...difficult to find the food court and exit way. i had trouble and couldn't find taxi..its hard to communicate with the guards who suppose gave the taxi ticket..we were not aware of it..and couldn't find taxi booth either.
Center shopping. Located at center of Bangkok where around with modern building connect with other shopping convenient with public transportation. but also too many traffic and crowded

A complex Complex!. Marketed as the fashion centre of Bangkok this is certainly one of the largest 'high end' shopping centres in town.
Hundreds of shops, a department store, a fantastic supermarket, lots of restaurants and a huge walk-they aquarium/sea world attraction.
Adjacent to Siam Skytrain hub and plenty of taxis available.

Valuable for shopping. In my knowledge, Bangkok is most expensive city for shopping luxury brand but somehow if you know how to shop, you could still find decent products. I have shopped this place couple times and I think it is the most famous shopping place in downtown. Compare to other brand new such as Gayson or central embassy I think Siam paragon is still significant department store in Bangkok
Wow. Siam parragon is amazing place . All high end stores .nice display. High prices .not recommended for shopping
Huge!. This mall is huge and has tons of shops and food choices - literally one stop shopping and a great place to visit on a hot day for free AC!

Great shopping and foods. Its good to shop here. You can find almost everything you like. Eat anything you like. Plenty of shops and cafes and restaurants and great supermarket. Many foods for tasting. They offer discount for tourist. Just go to their information and get discount card.

Nice shopping center and large food place. Nice shopping center - a lot of things to see but you need to have the means to go to the top branded shops. Otherwise, treat yourself with good and a lot of variety of food places at the food court !
Over crowded but gd shopping. Constantly overcrowded with pokemon go people which makes it highly annoying for shoppers. However has a gd selection of bags, clothes etc. Overpriced thou.

good place to spend some time. Siam Paragon is centrally located and easy to get to.The mall and the area is a good place to go if its raining, if you need to get out of the sun and heat or if you are looking for a place to go in the evening. There are many food options and most weeks there is some sort of entertainment inside or outside the mall.

Shopping at Siam Paragon. Wonderful place with plenty of nice shops and an extremely big food hall/court. Very good food at a low price. Having food in restaurants will cost around 300 b per person. In the food court, good and tasty food starts at 75 b. All the high brands are there, CK, Azzaro, burberry etc. They are however at international prices but good quality. If you want to get locally made items, specially clothes, shoes try Platinum Fashion mall which is around 10 mins walk from siam square.

One of the best malls in town. A lot of fashion brands here in 4 floors: luxury high end, women fashion, man fashion, kids fashion. Many restaurants on ground floors. Its very crowded here. After that you can visit Siam center nextdoor as well

Fill your mind and bag. Siam paragon is the most convenient super Mall in Bangkok and probably the most sophisticated complex as well.Shops all all with cars, bikes, books and sea wold at underground added the charm. SIAM BTS works as a doorway to arrive at Siam Paragon who are staying a bit far and accessing the BTS.A must visit Mall to understand the charm of Bangkok

Fashionist's dream. We found the diverse and exhaustive array of high end brands rather intoxicating as we couldn't wrap our heads around how could so many stores sell haute couture in this turbulent economic times but truth is that this shopping mall is any fashionist's candy store. There are 2 more shopping malls contiguous to Siam Paragon which offer more affordable fashion, articles and souvenirs, which we actually enjoyed more as we are not several thousand usd for a bag type of shoppers.

Modernised Mall with fantastic food court!. Overall mall is good like every other mall in metropolitan cities. The food court in this mall was one thing which really differentiates to other malls. Madame Tussauds and Ocean World were also located in this Siam Center.

Care to purchase an Aston Martin or a yacht!. This is one of the largest malls in the world (look it up) and one of the priciest. High end clothing and jewelry shops. A couple of stereo shops with over the top components and then there are the car dealers on the second floor: Rolls, Aston Martin, Bentley, Lamborghini, BMW.However the real reason to visit is the incredible food court in the basement! We pop in for lunch one day every trip to Bangkok
The best mall in Bangkok. All you need or all you like you can fine in Siam paragon very elegant and full everyday , this place have more than 100 different food and cake.

Upscale mall for the shopaholic. Hmmm what to say... it really is just another shopping mall but most of the boutiques inside showcases foriegn well-known brand and logos. You can say it's for the people with cash to burn.I have to appreciate the interior designs thou. They are sophisticated and glamorous.

Shopping shopping. People makes shopping like a crazy and nothing is special more. You even do not feel like that you are in thailand. You are more like that you are in singapore and hongkok. Actually it is not my travel type...

Elegance and Convenience in a Shopping experience. With a very wide range of designer name shops, local outlets, and excellent choices for food, everything from a simple Thai style "street food" type snack, all the way to high quality restaurants covering a variety of cuisines, Siam Paragon is always on our list of places to take friends when they visit Bangkok.There is a bit of a focus on Japanese food, but that is understandable given our large population of Japanese expats, and in any case, Japanese food is extremely popular worldwide.You can find almost anything you would normally expect and more in this very modern, spacious and comfortable shopping centre.The convenience of having the connecting BTS (Skytrain) station right outside with direct covered walking access, completes the picture.As a Bangkokian, I definitely recommend Siam Paragon for a fun and quality shopping experience.

Bangkok's premier upscale shopping mall. Bangkok's premier upscale shopping mall; it is one of the largest in Asia. There are many interesting specialty stores (your typical global brands such as Starbucks) as well as local ones. There is a huge food court specializing upscale Thai fast-food. There is an aquarium in the basement. Movie theaters, large bowling alley, open air concert. You can be a mall rat and just wander for half a day.

Up class shopping center will lots of happenings. . There are always a lot of activities going on in Siam Paragon. Lots of food, lots of shopping, and lots of people! The supermarket at the basement is one of the major attractions of the shopping centre. The shopping centre has a lot of restaurants too, both up class and middle class ones. If you feel like spending, there are the expensive restaurants with exotic food; if you feel like saving a bit on food there is a food court at the basement which serves delicious food too. Visit Siam Paragon if you have not been there before, it will be an exciting experience for you.

Beautiful mall in Bangkok. Siam paragon is situated at a great location just next to the train station and also accessible via city bus.This mall has so much to offer right from global brands to some great eateries.
A High End Shopping Mall With A Twist. Situated at a train interchange, this high end mall also houses nice eateries, cinemas and interesting outlets.

Still has a few good shops . This place has still got a few good shops and restaurants. Been to centre a few times on my travels in Thailand and still like the place even though a few more have opened.

nice for shopping dining cinema. you can find everything you can imagine to buy there. all brand names and cinemas, good education centers on 3rd floor for kids in case you want to leave them there while shopping or enjoying a cup of coffee.

Everything under one roof . The is the biggest shopping mall in Bangkok they Hanover every single designer from the top higher to high steert all original a lot off choice off food coffee shop restaurant basically any thing you want its not cheap it's very clean and high service like anywhere else in the world also you w I'll find variety off different shop which very deferent if you have time must see
Ideal place to shop . Lots of variety and amazing mall. Different floors for toys, men's and women clothing No bargains but watch out for dealsStaff is great and super helpful

Favourite shopping mall at Bangkok . The mall that you feel the safest and cleanest. Nice and grand with lotsa shopping and eateries. The same brands worldwide but cheaper in price than most major cities. Good time to shop

The SHOPPING. Needless to say much. This is indeed one of the top shopping center in BKK. From high-street wear to posh stuffs. Foodhall is as well excellent. Choices of restaurant. Only down point is traffic jam.

Bangkok's Hi-end Mall. Most hi-end shops that one finds in cities around the world are found here. Unlike many of the other malls where one might find copy merchandise even in their department stores, Siam Paragon has the real thing, There are numerous jewelryshops and a host of various types of different stores that offer everything from upscale childrens clothing shops to furniture and appliances.The kids and adults alike will enjoy Oceanworld, where the family can enjoy viewing live fish, whales and sharks swimming around in large tanks and offer a great photo opportunity. Unfortunately, the exhibit post their prices for Thai people in Thai so foreigners are not aware that they are paying a much higher price. There is a large choice of restaurants that include fast food, like McDonald's and Burger King to some upscale Japanese and Italian food as well, There are also donut shops, chocolate shops and the likes.

Lovely luxurious mall . All the top brands you want. Designer clothes are generally more expensive there than in Europe. They have I think 5% discount for tourists. I got there some Pandora that is Asian-exclusive. Not so far (maybe 15 min walk) you have the Central World mall which I felt is a bit more for popular brands and is cheaper.

Must visit place. Siam paragon is a square where many plazas are interconnected with each other all under the umbrella of Siam I.e Siam paragon. Siam discovery etc . In this square the museum of Madame tausede and fish aquarium is also located

Great spot for family. Great shopping, not as huge and crazy as Central World so you won't get lost. It has aquarium, IMAX theater and Kidzania which is supposedly the largest in Asia. It's also supposed to have a great Gourmet market downstairs but I didn't visit so can't tell you much. It has all the local Thai spa brands and the clerks were really nice and attentive. Right across from it is Siam Square One which has a lot of restaurants and massage parlors so it's nice to end a day of shopping with good meal and a foot massage :)

AN OASIS. When we wanted to get away from Bangkok traffic and heat we would come here to rest! Great place to shop and eat.Nice temperature, good smells !In particular, to buy take away food there is the Gourmet Market. It is a very nice supermarket with all kind of food (both ready to eat or to cook). There is also the possibility to choose your meat or fish and they will cook it for you the way you want!
Big shopping mall and enjoy shopping.. at the hot Bangkok, siam paragon is a good place to enjoy holiday. with air condition and all kinds of brand , shopping lover will love here definitely.

Nice. This is a great place to go if you want to go shopping it's a good place to go eat it's a wonderful place to go see a lot of different things that I couldn't afford. If you're a Westerner and you miss it this is a good place to go.
Amazing mall. this mall is even one of my favourites as it has a good vibe to it as well as many decent and nice shopping stores too.
Nice luxury mall. Very big with nice fancy shops. A nice stroll is guaranteed. Connected to siam square and the sky train.

Enjoyed the day with my kids.... A great mall. Spent the day watching movies in the Siam Paragon movie theater followed by a visit at the toy store, lunch and dessert at Ben and Jerry's. My biggest complaint is the lineup and waiting for a taxi which took forever. We waited for approximately 45 min to finally get a cab.

Woody. Absolutely love this mallEvery thing you dreem of you will find in there The ground floor is a restaurant court of many restaurants you can choose what ever food you want, wither it's Asian food, Italian food, international food. Have a pleasant shopping you all ;)

A little bit of Bond Street in Bangkok!. V modern shopping Mall. All the elite brands goods the same prices as London or more. Suspect it is for Bangkok's elite and v wealthy tourists. Good but very expensive meal in food court, £15 per head seemed reasonable on our first night in Thailand we now know that it was very pricey! Food court at Terminal 21 much better and also on Sky train route.

Cheap to expensive...throw in food and what more could you want?. Great place. I needed something nice to go out to an important dinner, they had it. I needed stuff to just knock around in, they had it. The market rivaled any upscale grocery store I've ever shopped.

Pretty Cool. I'm not a huge fan of malls, but I thought that this was a must-go since a photo of me in front of the huge Siam Paragon sign would be a good indicator that I've been to Thailand. I also came here in search for books and CDs, which was actually the highlight of my visit here. Went to Asia Books on Level 2 which had a pretty impressive selection of English books and a decent shelf of books in Thai language. The staffs were helpful and friendly. I also found some CDs that I wanted at Mangpong, located at the same level. Kinokuniya on Level 3 was massive but I didn't have enough time to roam around. The food hall on the lower level had a good selection of food to choose from. Overall it was a really pleasant experience.
Shopping and Dinning. Great place for shopping and dinning with wide range of food and dessert choices and lots of branded stores for shoppoholics

Brand name goods. Paragon was an accident for my wife and I to visit. ( missed it by 6 stations). This would be the place if you were looking for brand anything, we were looking for Dior. Found it. I paid the price. Go here best expensive.
Wow what an amazing shopping centre . Extremely high end with designers galore, jewelry and watch designers even Rolls Royce, Bentley etc car show rooms, kids area, cinema and amazing food court.

Good for brand products and great fun to shop here. This is a super huge shopping mall in Bangkok. Those who like shopping Siam Paragon is a MUST to go and shop. It is a great enjoyable, nice, and cool place to even walking inside for shopping and seeing all the fashion of people around the world who were there. It is very easy and convenient to access by BTS train, cheap and fast! Not recommend visitors to go by taxi, the traffic on this road is really terrible! Next to Siam Paragon, there will be Siam Discovery Center, Siam Square, or walk in distance to Central World etc. One spot to start from here then move to enjoy shopping in various mall within walk in distance. A must go for visitors! Have great time shopping and spending money.

The biggest and probably the best . ... Mall in Bangkok.It has it all, extensive food court with plenty options available, huge supermarket, lots of stores with all sorts of clothes and appliances, big electronics section and quite a few cinemas. All in all, ultimate destination for all interested in shopping and entertainment when visiting Bangkok.

Medium to high class Mega shopping mall. Siam Paragon basement food hall must try. Value for money n taste Thai flavour rather then some famous Thai cousin. Beside of food hall is a gourmet market. You should take a look to find some souvenirs with reasonable then airport

Splendid. A very spectacular and a splendid mall just by the Siam station of BTS. With the ground floor comprised of Ocean World, the mall spreads over a huge sprawling area.Not that it is spectacularly unique (malls care more or less all same though), the mall maintains the uniqueness of its own. A must visit for those who loves strolling along the malls and for the mall shoppers.

Decent shopping mall. This was actually the first shopping mall we visited in Bangkok, we were meant to go to Siam centre intially! Both malls are right next to each other. Siam Paragon is more of a departmental mall, selling high end fashion clothing! Overall of you're going here be prepared to spend big!

High End and Comfort. It is a very comfortable place to do your shopping. Loads of branded stuff. For ladies, do visit naraya as for the men, be thrilled to see a superb displays of cars. The LG floor has good varieties of food selection. Once you are done, take a stroll upstairs to their cinema. Pavalai boasts of 1,900 seats! A spectacular place for blockbuster.

Visit Siam Paragon. We do not visit for the high end stores but for the dining experience and the large supermarket! Well worth a visit even if just for the huge variety of dining choices offered and the reasonable prices! Canal side Cafes offer additional ambience and you can relax for several hours. Metered taxis at door, plus direct entrance to BTS.
Give Yourself A Whole Day ….. Love shopping here . The Food . The clothing . Shoes . Gifts . Everything you need plus more . You need a good day to have a look around .
Shopping at its best. The girls will love it. A great break from the markets. night time is great also with live music and licensed bars. Transport by train was great.
They have everything but books😊. Siam Paragon and Siam Center lies volde to The national stadium, 5-6 stops With sky train from The river! Eventful Shopping opportunities and A Nice foodcourt!

A big luxury shopping mall but.... Worth going dor the amazing and huge food halls and food court at the bottom! And also for the cinema in the adjacent mall Siam Center. Make sure to buy tickets for the luxury cinema room where you get a reclining sest, blanket and pillow and free drinks from Starbucks!If youre into designer shops then you will love Siam Paragon but if you are jnto markets like me, get out of the mall and you will find tons of little shops and markets talls.

Luxury heaven . If you are tired of over crowed mails and shops selling replica and cheap Items this is the place for you . It's a luxury shopping Mecca , with everything from Chanel to Hermes . The crowd here is very well dressed so I would suggest you leave shorts and vest tops etc at home as you may feel left out . The prices in the designer stores are more expensive than the uk but cheaper than places like China , for Louis Vuitton etc it's about on par with USA for items . The cinema here is insane , they have beds or you can see a film in 4D with moving chairs and smells etc . There is also a harrods cafe where you can both eat in luxury for around £35 pounds , so it's much cheaper than if you were to actually go in London .I wouldn't recommend here for children unless you are going for the cinema but if you want a break from the hustle and bustle or simple want to shop for High end goods all in one place with air conditioning , this is the place for you . You also get free wifi and there is an uber pick upPoint ( cheaper than taxis )

Big and convenience. Easy to access by BTS sky train (Siam station), located at the central of Bangkok. Many thing to do in one place; shopping, greeting, food and restaurant, movie, beauty and salon. Variety of choices.

Nice but expensive. Very high end mall. Yes you have your Zara + H+M but not much else to bridge the divide between them and Balenciaga/Gucci/Prada if you know what I mean. I know MBK is next door, but that's fake cheaper stuff. Was just expecting more variety. Not really any affordable homewares either. However the food court is really great, has everything you need and the food is great as well. Had the best Som Tum of my life there!

Easy way . Getting to siam paragon easily just use the MRT out side the Grand Mercure ride two station and simply transfere into BTS and takes you directly to siam paragon again avoiding the traffic .

Upmarket mall with plenty of food options! . A mall synonymous with most tourists and locals in Bangkok, the mall continues to draw decent crowds throughout the day. So if you are looking for a meal during peak hours, make sure you arrive early enough at your favorite restaurant. That said, most restaurants in Siam paragon tend to be huge so don't fret! With a tenant mix of mostly higher end brands, Siam still has its departmental store where decent deals can be found for the average tourist. However if its wholesale prices you are looking for, you are in the wrong place. Head to the markets at platinum or pratunam then.

For lunch . We had a nice time walking there. We had lunch there in indian restaurant. We thought macdonalds there was halal but it was not. So shocking. Harrods there was amazing for coffee and shopping for chocolates but its more expensive there

Beautiful mall filled with luxury items!. Lots of expensive luxury items available and beautifully laid out. Great if that's what your looking for. Otherwise, you can window shop, visit Ocean World, shop at an awesome gourmet market or have a meal in an international gourmet food court. Although this place is wonderful, the prices of similar items in nearby food courts keep it from being five star i.e. MBK

Typical-posh shopping mall. I 've been to Siam Paragon since the day it's opened. This mall is a high-class mall, full of branded name stuff with lots of food/restaurant choice, Aquarium, cinema, fitness, education zone, Bowling, Karaoke as well as a department store. It's pretty amazing that there are so many things in this mall. In general, the fact that this mall is in central of Bangkok made it so convenient for people to visit.

Luxurious Shopping Mall!. If you are into Designers and have spare cash, this is the shopping mall for you you so that you can shop till you drop. It is beautiful and some of the major designers like Hermes, Louis Vuitton, Prada, Jimmy Choo, YSL, etc have stores here. The window displays are amazing and eye catching and the layout very good. They also have a large Cinema Complex, Car Showrooms, Restaurants, Technology floor etc. Not to be missed,

Disappointing. This shopping centre was high up on the trip advisor list so we thought we should check it out. It's really not worth it. Most of the shops are top end designer- not something we are interested in! Next door is the Siam centre which was much better!

Something for everyone . I've been going to Bangkok for years and wherever I go with a lot of people, I always make sure to allocate a day for Siam Paragon. There is just something there for everyone. There is a kiddie world, aquarium, the most amazing food court I know where everyone can eat whatever they want. There's a high end shopping mall for the moms and there is pavilion level for affordable gadgets for the teens. On the top floor, there's a cinema for everyone else. The number of restaurants in there will astound you, you wouldn't know what to choose!
Awesome place. I love their food court and cinemas. So many restaurants to choose from. The supermarket is also a nice one with lots of western choices too. My favorite place for eating.

Bigh & High End Shopping Mall. A very nice mall to wonder around. Very expensive shops and brand are available here. Nice place to walk around and enjoy. They also have the ocean world center "aquarium" which would be quite interesting if you have never been to it before. 4D cinema is quite interesting experience in the aquarium. Worth a visit.
Good mall. Nothing amazing. Many stores with large areas. It is charming but we did not't feel the Asian touch.

Great shops. Great shops and restaurants,
I advise u to book hotel near to it. Its near to Siam centre.
It is in the centre of Bangkok
The metro and sky train near to it
Luxury brands . Many of people shopping in Thailand for low prices,thats what you'll not find it here,normal shops for brands you can find it everywhere in the world.

Great food court. I stay in the Kempinski Hotel and it is right across the street. The shops inside the mall are more or less the same as what I can get in Hong Kong. But the food court and super market at the basement is excellent. You can have all kind of food you want and the seafood and fruit that you can get in the super market will makes you happy.

MEGASTORE: TAKE LOTS OF CASH IF YOU'RE SHOPPING . I'd heard about Bangkok shopping malls and chose this one at random. I didn't want to buy anything but just to rubberneck and see what all the fuss was about. Siam Paragon is giant and has all the usual outlets that you'd expect in Europe or the US with a few local ones thrown in. The prices reflect paying to build this place. If you've been to the world's biggest mall (Edmonton was the biggest then in the 1980s and is sure to have lost that crown by now) I was slightly underwhelmed by this place. These sorts of establishments are not my most favourite places but it's air conditioned and there are plenty of coffee shops to revive your spirits when needed. Apparently the food court is good but I was there between breakfast and lunch and did not eat. I wouldn't go out of my way but it is very convenient for the Skytrain if you want any old mall.

standard upper end shopping mall. Siam Paragon is one of the upper end shopping malls in Bangkok. Expect all high end brands to be there but din't expect any cheaper prices than anywhere else in the world. A place for shopping lovers with a lot of money :)The shopping mall also hosts a large cinema as well as multiple family attractions (Kidzania, Siam Ocean World) which is why I give it a 4 star instead if 3 star rating

Impressive . We walked around here, enjoying the place for a good couple of hours. The kids enjoyed the size and dazzle of the place. It's got everything, including a cool glass elevator. Definitely worth a visit when in Bangkok.
