Luxury Mall with eye catching brands. They have many renowned brands in this place and its like one stop mall for all. If you love brands this is must visit place to go as they have latest brands and colors and very beautiful ambiance

Shoppingheaven!. This shopping center give you all you want. Big brands. I love to go shopping in Paragon Departmentstore. Very clean and easy shopping. Sometimes its a lot of people so eat food before you go. Be patient ;-)
High level Center. Siam Paragon is one of the historical department store in Bangkok and sure one of the more High class . interesting to spend same time for good shopping, eating and relaxing .
me like to go shop in Siam Paragon. many good product. I go bangkok many times to shop. Good looks house and many shop it sell good many product.

Class. The place is huge with lots of branded products. A complete place to spend your day. Shops, dine in, relax, movies and recreation. The grocery at the lowerground is enormous! A well manage place and available tourist assistance. This is good for family

Amazing after being out of things . If you need a day off, it's raining or you just want to chill, check out this theatre! Honestly, you will never have been in one so nice that it's an experience in its own.
The downstairs supermarket will have all the western amenities you miss and every kind of resultant you could imagine.
Nice chill-out. Aircon oasis in the middle of busy Bangkok. Selection of supercar shops upstairs. Good food court...

Easily the best shopping mall in Bangkok. This shopping mall is easily the best in Bangkok. Most of the high end brands are located on the second floor (including LV, prada, Chanel, Celine, AMQ, Givenchy and a lot more). It also contains popular stores like Zara and Massimo Dutti on the third floor. The first floor contains a variety of different restaurants, so grabbing a bite during a shopping break is no problem. It does however lack a decent pizza place.The mall is clean, and the staff is helpful.The toilets are easily located and free to enter. All in all a great experience!
Nice shopping mall. If you are tired to walk around in Bangkok, it is a good shopping mall to take a rest,to eat some food,to go shopping and to play with your children in there.

My Favorite shopping center in Bangkok. One of my best spots in Bangkok, huge wonderful shopping center with plenty of shops. Harrods, Cath Kideston and many others. Also their is a huge aquarium and kidizania so ir provide fun for all ages.
Intriguing . A rich assortment of top end cars clothes and msny other things. Good for shopping or just a day out.

Shopping. We were very dissapointed that even with the VAT return the prices were still more expensive than at home. We often come to Thailand for shopping and did Paragon once but will mot go again. Plenty of cheaper value shopping opportunities in Bangkok.The movie theater and bowling on the top floor were very fun and brought some positive to our day.
Exceptional . You get everything from appeal, electronic to the best food in gourmet. Bangkok is the city of colors and crowds and Siam paragon is the true picture of the city.

Best shopping is in here, it's a must. Liked the interior so beautiful, from food court to stores to people all are just perfect, visit the aquarium at the afternoon is nice, almost all the brand names are here, also their vio page cinema is beyond expiation, coming again

Favorite shopping centre in Bangkok. Siam Paragon is located next to Siam skytrain station, it's a huge shopping centre with a great variety of shopping and dining options. I would strongly recommend this place for tourists.

shopping shopping !. Huge shopping center with lots of modern shops. Prices are the same as at home so the experience wasn't out of this world :) Good Ac to get away from the heat if you like shopping.

My second home in Bangkok. This mall is fabulous. I love everything about it. The luxury brandnames are here along with other popular brands. The restaurant choices are great. The gourmet market is the best supermarket ever with all the amazing produces.

World Class shopping. Good places to eat. Big cinema complex. Bowling, Water World. BTS Station. Siam Paragon offers world class shopping. Expensive but excellent quality and service.Take the BTS because getting a taxi to depart sometimes have to wait long time.TIP: Buy your return BTS tickets when you arrive to avoid long waits to buy tickets later in the day.Modern well maintained bowling. Very helpful employees.Modern cinema complex. 4D, 3D, large well maintained theaters, modern sound systems.Karaoke top floor.

Best Shopping Center. I like the place because I can get whatever I want in one place. I buy clothes from H&M and get books from Kinokuniya and watch movie here. Actually, I come here every week even I live outside Bangkok which I usually come by BTS. I must say I love it here.

Impressive. Very impressive mall with lots of floors and great air conditioning to get you out of the heat of Bangkok. It's much pricier than any of the local shops or markets, but it's a fun place to visit and walk around on a rainy day.
Must visit Siam Paragon. Must visit this place. You will find branded things at very cheap rates. And must visit to Madame tussauds Museum. Excellent Mall

Good shopping but the supermarket inside is one of the best of the world.. Everytime i walked in i smiled, nice clean place with good stores but given the tax not so interesting to actually buy stuff. But the supermarket is like a dream, truly a must visit during your stay in BKK

Loved the Siam Paragon Gourmet Market. Paragon Mall is a great destination with everything in one place plus UniQlo, H&M and Zara along side. The Paragon Gourmet Food Market is a place to visit if you like dried and fresh fruits, nuts and Thai spices.

Shopping Shopping Shopping. A very large and comfortable, not feel crowded.
Also suitable for those who donwt like shopping.
  Take a four-hour break and go down to the aquarium
Fancy but expensive. Kind of what you get back home. Very American like and pricey compared to everything else in Thailand. State of the art, amazing displays.

Luxury department store in CBD. Siam Paragon is an luxury department store in Bangkok, if you need something local or reasonable price, I don't recommend there. However, it has a bit upper price product in the department section and H& M. If you love the Ocean World or want to close-up with the celebrity at Madam Tussaud. Welcome here.

Nice place to visit. You can find most of the brands at the same time you can enjoy your time in eating.it is linked to other mall where you can walk through . For cinema lovers there is a located section for them. Food every where and for most resturant brands where you can enjoy many flavors

It's a shopping mall. Ok it's quite big and it's got different themes on each floor but at the end of the day it's a shopping mall, there are bigger ones nearby and it didn't have any guide of what was where that we could get to make any sense.
Expensive. A beautiful mall, but very expensive. One block in each direction there are many other shopping malls that offer value for money.

A great place for spending your money ;). This shopping complex is very high end qjality with a lots of choices for most of famous branded around the word. Find your favorites outfit here or just look around and enjoy the set up of this shopping mall.Love the concept of the building with a nice fountains in front and a garden set inside the shopping mall.No wonder if Bangkok is one of the highest demand for shopping holic around the world.

Siam Paragorn. Siam Paragon is a shopping mall in Bangkok, Thailand. It is one of the biggest shopping centres in Asia.How to Get There : SkyTrain to Siam Station(CEN : Interchange Station for both lines) and then take exit 1for direct link to Siam Discovery and Siam Center and take exit 3 for direct link to Siam Paragon and exit 5 for direct link to Siam Ocean World or cinema complex
The best in Thailand.. I like siam paragon shopping mall because it is big and you can get all what you want , My suggestion is to close the mall at 12 AM Not at 10 PM.

Nice but unaffordable and not very thai. Impressive looking and nicely air conditioned. Full of very exclusive designer shops. Unaffordable. It isn't very authenticlly Thai, you could be in London or New York. Easy to get there and it is close to the MBK centre which is worth a look!

Good Shopping Mall. Siam Paragon, Central World and MBK are three malls are shopping destinations within a 3 kilometer radius. If taking a BRT(Skytrain) get down at Central station and the skywalk allows one to walk either to Siam or Central malls. Siam is a well laid out mall and is more upmarket with prices also steep.

High end, high prices. If you've got the money, this is up your alley. High quality goods at high prices. The sports floor was impressive especially the golf section which was huge. Prices 15-25% more than Australia but there was an excellent collection of accessories I've not seen before.

Good mall in good location. Nice mall for a visit though items and stores are a bit on high price side. Since quite a few Siam malls one after the other along with close proximity to MBK as well as Central malls, its a good visit to have.
Brand conscious!!. Super place for branded stuff.. Huge mall.. almost all brands and super cool place... Go with loads of money..

Everything you need can be found here...... Top fashion brands, classy eating outlets, banking halls, telecom service providers, row of aromatherapy shops, underwater aquarium, trendy Cineplex... even luxury car showrooms! But beware, it's a top class mall with top dollars (or in this case, baht) expected to be offloaded from you. And it gets very very crowded during weekends, public holidays and event promotions. The trick is just to find your own little inner peace and concentrate on what you need to do without being distracted.

Convenient mega-mall in Bangkok. Siam Paragon is ubiquitous in Bangkok for its limitless range of high-end designer boutiques and showrooms. However, it's actually much more than that - from High Street fashion to fast-fashion brands, high-end and upscale restaurants to an excellent food court - Siam Paragon is an all-in-one mega mall which caters to visitors of all ages.We particularly enjoyed the huge Gourmet Market (supermarket) with its extensive and excellent range of Thai snacks and produce as well as the wide array of restaurants, cafes and food outlets at the basement. In fact, on our recent 4-day trip to Bangkok, we enjoyed no less than 4 meals at the Siam Paragon - including MK Steamboat (Thai style steamboat/ hot pot, Taling Pling (Thai food) and Beef Noodles at the food court.For us, the best part of the mall is the fact that it is seamlessly connected to the Siam BTS station (interchange) and is within a 5-10 minute walking distance to the other shopping precincts in the area like CentralWorld, MBK and the Siam Center/ Siam Discovery malls.

Everything you need is here. If you want to do a serious shopping, Siam Paragon is the recommended place. From high street fashion brands to luxury brand names, you can find everything here. Just take your time to walk around.
Good choice of clothes and nice and neat place for foods. It was the first mall we visited , but no none is better than Siam paragon , since the others are two big with lots of faked goods
Shopping . The best place to do shopping and there is allot of brands available in this shopping mall .I recommend to all to visit the shopping mall

Food court is great . I have visited this mall many times with my wife. Dining options are plentiful. If you would prefer to spend less on food, head to the food court. It serves a decent variety of Thai food at reasonable prices. We buy most of our Thai snacks and Thai food seasoning from the supermarket at Siam paragon. On the overall, a place to drop by on your next trip to Bangkok.

An elegant mall must see for first timers in Bangkok as it houses Madame Tussads and Siam Ocean World. It is a good mall from Bangkok standards. Don't keep high expectations if you have been to The Avenues, Kuwait or Dubai Mall or Mall of Emirates, it won't meet that benckmark. Cost wise same as any other country.

amazing assortment of retailers!. Bentley, Porche, Lambo, for cars, the high end retiler list goes on forever.
Gret food court, sea world, IMax, theater, etc!
Right off of BTS Siam stop.
Foodie delight . The absolutely ludicrous range of great food at very reasonable prices is mind boggling. A must visit place for a good feed. Shopping is super too, but don't expect bargains.

Go here for food!. In my opinion the best mall in Bangkok. It compares to Suria KLCC in Kuala Lumpur (the one at the Petronas Towers). Whether you go here to buy luxury brands or not, it has ample space.
The food court was the main attraction for me though. Go for the grilled cheese and kebabs!
Insane mall!. Unbelievable shopping here, though no one was in any of the actual shops. The real attraction to me was the massive food court. Sounds lame, but seriously, go see it.

From Mclaren to Hermes to Japanese candies. OK, so if you like malls you will like this one because this one has it all, from high end luxury cars to handbags to mid range brands like Zara, Victoria Secrets etc.It also has a beauty section where you can get an Eyebrow Wig?BUT the real gem and feature is in the basement where there is the best luxury supermarket ever where you can get local and imported foodstuff. And there is the most amazing food court I have ever seen. Could not get enough. If you are not game to try street food on the street then you can get it there! MUST DO!
Many eateries and great supermarket. Many eateries and great supermarket.Many interesting things in the supermarket.Outside supermarket, many stalls with delicious food.

Good mall. This mall is great right in the centre of Bangkok. Pretty much any luxury brand you can think of is on the ground floor. Good food area downstairs. Vast selection of other shops. The great thing is the Bangkok Airways cinema on the top floor which offers luxury style cinema with waiter service on huge Lazy boy seats :)
Just a mall. There's many malls next to each other (almost) and it's one of them. It's just having same shops as others so if you started from other ones - then this one is boring.
Modern shopping mall. We only visited starbucks here to meet some friend...located in front of BTS..easy acces..you can walk from MBK centre

Always here. Been to Bangkok more than a dozen times and I must say I'll visit this mall almost everytime I'm here.This is definitely a high end mall and even though many other newer high end malls have been sprouting up all over Bangkok, none can replace Siam Paragon as it's an iconic mall in Bangkok that is easily accessible with a BTS interchange at its doorstep.The food level at the basement boast a huge variety of cuisines and the Thai food there is as good as they get.Therere always events going on in this mall and that's the reason why I always drop by and people watch when I'm in Bangkok.

Great foodcourt and shopping. Great shopping mall with Zara, H&M and all the big brands. But most importantly, it has an amazing foodcourt. Buy a card, decide how much you want in the card to purchase food and drinks and desserts, get reimbursed if needed.
luxury and convenient mall. this mall is plenty of luxury brand names, easy to go by BTS and located on the center of bangkok. Moreover, there is sea life bangkok ocean world beneath the mall.
Big shopping mall in Thailand. you can find every brand as you like in here and easy to travel by Sky train or BTS and connect to Siam Paragon

Good experience. Very good choice of food in the supermarket, went in for a wander around to see what they had. A lot of imported brands, found Scottish, highland spring water. Very thankful for that, Thai water isn't brilliant. Lots of Scottish products which was interesting to see. Very Thai orientated though. Had a nice little bakery at the front. The actual mall itself was huge, nice to have a look but didn't stay long.

Super Mall. Make note of the maps! You will get lost. I love the way it has a theme for every level. It also has indoor connections to other shopping in the area. Some nights they hold a show out in the court yard area as seen from the BTS.

Up Scale Shopping and International Restaurants. Checked out the Siam Paragon Mall during my 6 day visit to Bangkok. Wow, it makes most U.S. malls look small in comparison. With several floors of designer jewelry, apparel, and services, it is the ultimate luxury experience for those who want Vuitton, Long Champs, Hermes, Rolex, Cartier, Zegna, and a host of other designer shops. You can even order your next Rolls or BMW. Although luxury shopping wasn't on my things-to-do list, I went to experience the delicious international restaurants on the lower level where they also have a gourmet food store. There were Japanese, Italian, Chinese, American (McDonalds), French, and Thai restaurants in abundance. Interestingly enough, with a proliferation of malls and shopping centers, this mall was jammed packed with visitors from opening till closing. There was a parade of school children walking through the mall, not to mention there are always a parade of tourists from all over the world. I especially liked the authentic Japanese Restaurants which served fresh sushi and delicious tempura and salmon. Prices were very reasonable for the amount of food. I paid about 350 Bhat ($9.95 U.S.) for a Japanese teriyaki salmon lunch with rice, salad, tsukemono, coffee or tea, water, and a small desert. The McDonalds was very crowded by the way. I would highly recommend Siam Paragon as it is conveniently located just a few steps from the Siam BTS station and offers a glimpse into the Thai's love for shopping. Also, it's a nice respite from the heat and humidity.

ok, so I normally hate malls, but.... ... Siam Paragon is an experience that any traveler should have. I spent over an hour wandering through the mind boggling gourmet market in the basement. I live in New York City so am not typically bowled over by sheer size, but this place is unreal. There are foods from all over the world and everything I bought was delicious. I even found clementines from Italy which made my day. There's really no reason not to visit Siam Paragon, even if you're not a shopper, as it's right off the BTS and therefore very easy to get to.

Shopping. So in this place you can buy everything from a pair of Louis Vuitton shoes, a Chanel scarf, a box of Krispy Kreme and a Rolls Royce phantom. Absolutely crazy. All the big brands under 1 roof. From clothes to home wear to cars... They even had a pop up shop selling luxury apartments.Madness!Love it

Perfect shopping mall and join in some events. A shopping mall with many famous branches and quality daily deals to shop!And you can easily catch up some events here to meet some famous Thai celebs with their promotion for branches or companies.
wow. its big and beautiful and nice and all biiiggg brands. not good for shopping becaus its costly but great for window shopping

Too big, too much people, too chaotic. If you're in the mood for a stressful shopping experience with too much to choose between this is your shopping centre. A lot of the things are overpriced as well.

The Best Mall ever. if you are in Bangkok then check this mall out , its absolutely stunning, lots to see and do they have the kids aquarium (Huge) on the bottom floors they have the biggest cinema complex in the city, lots of shops and lots of restaurants and cafes one of my first stops whenever im in Thailand.
Best shopping area and fun for kid. There is theme park inside which is enable kid to enjoy their day and for Women and Men to enjoy their shopping.

A great mall with luxury brands. Visited on my trip to Bangkok and was a great mall. Had a great food court with cuisines from all over the world. Had all the major fashion houses and brands that you see worldwide from Hermes to Zara. So a wide range to suit different budgets. I would recommend you visit it when in Bangkok as we dont really have such attractions in the west (I can positively say we dont have any like these in London!). A must visit even if only for the experience!

Shop till u drop!!!. ThIs shopping mall it's really big..u can find so many well known brands over here...for Muslim..don't worry at the food over here also got stall that selling halal food..it's Yusuf biryani.. This stall sell white rice,friend chicken,biryani rice,curry and others.. U need to change ur money to coupon(just at entrance of this food court) price is reasonable. + food hygiene is tip top
Lovely . Exciting. Class and expensive. Sale now in July. Enjoy shopping. Was exciting. Lovely food. Enjoy the royal India food. Serving people.

Cheap deals or exclusive buys. You can get both here. Got branded jeans here cheaper than in MBK. Choice of Addidas sports wear was very limited at this visit. Food area and supermarket downstairs are a must visit.
Famous shopping mall. One of the famous shopping mall in Bangkok. Seawold is located here. You can find lots of local, international and fast food here.

Great place to shop and Sea life Ocean world in the Mall is a must to visit!. Large mall with a large variety of brands mainly for branded shopping. Very nice Food court with a large variety of choices.The Sea life Ocean world in the basement of the mall is a fantastic experience.

You can shop and eat till your legs drop dead !. One of the largest and most modern shopping complex located in the center of Bangkok. We used to come here a lot but not so often at the moment because there are too many people and it's very hard to find parking space. However it is very convenience if u travel by BTS sky train as there are connecting walk way to the mall. In terms of variety u would find almost everything here from clothing, food ranging from Japanese, Italian, Chinese, International, etc even it be fast food or find dinning, Furniture, Fashion-all brand name are there, Cartier, Channel, Hermes, Prada, Gucci, Dior, Louise Vitton- to name just a few, of course with tax refund for tourist, to Entertainment - movies, concert hall, bowling, Aquarium plus Madam Tusso wax musuem within 5 minutes walk. There are even school for kids, e.g. ballet, music, art, sense math etc. as well as super car show room. The super market called goumet market located on basement floor offer good & foods all over the world. U can eat and shop till ur legs drop dead !

Amazing. With sea world within the building this shopping center puts the best of hong kong to shame. Never seen such a huge collection of brand outlets and super upmarket shops. This place offers you the ability to eat local and international food from the sit down resturants and carts and then to shop your sicks off. The place is clean, well maintained and extremely good value for money. Not to miss.

Best Mall In Thailand Situated At The Heart Of City. Best Mall In Thailand Situated At The Heart Of City.It is one of the biggest shopping mall in asia. Largest in the city.Best place to visit with friends and family to spend quality time.A must go i must say when you travel to thailand.
So much to see!. This place has every shop that you could like of, so much to look at, lots of places to eat as well, definitely try some food from the fresh bakery! Easy to get to on the sky train
Great shopping . Huge and well organized but several constructions and renovations are taking place. I enjoyed it here for shopping and eating.
Luxury Mall. Easy to visit via mrt and has direct access on it. We went here because of kidzania and oceanarium. We enjoyed a visit here though its a luxury mall.

Great shopping mall. It's one of my favourite malls in Bangkok all the brands you can find it there , furniture, everything very nice place for shopping also many nice coffee shops and restaurants it has the biggest aquarium in town and great cinema it's very nice for shopping must visit
Amazing shopping centre. Amazing shopping centre which has so many floors packed with amazing shops. One floor even has car show rooms! Air-conditioned with great facilities.

A fabulous place as one stop shopping. One of fabulous shopping center in Bangkok, Siam Paragon Department Store is a one stop shopping, eating and overall things in Bangkok. You can find a selected stuffs and delicious foods and resturants here.
Super high end mall. I don't think the average Thai person is shopping here but they do co,e to enjoy the air conditioning. The mall looks right out of Sputhern California. Even the food court!
👌. Been to is mall when we went to the Sea life Ocean World,situated in the basement of this mall.. Lovely place

Nice but very crowded. The mall is very nice and has a spectacular food court, which is mainly the reason behind my 4-star rating. The food court has a wide variety of food options ranging from pasta to thai to burgers to organic food. I would also recommend visiting the gourmet market at the food court for thai products. The shops are expensive high-end brands for the most part and there is also a Siam Paragon department store. Overall nice mall with awesome foodcourt; however both are extremely crowded. The mall is easily accessed using the BTS Skytrain. The stop to the mall is Siam however this is also very crowded! I would recommend visiting!
for tourist and high spending customer. have a great food court with many international food. also, most of international luxury brands are located at there as well.
High class mall . This is actually same as most mall in Jakarta, high class mall with very2 expensive famous brand sold here. Nothing special, just deluxe mall in town.

Fabulous place. A place to go and a place to be in Bangkok, high end shopping centre, top notch, upper class and expensive. All the well known, expensive brands are there, Gucci, Prada, Hermes etc, you name it, all in one place. Apart from that, it is also a place to dine and wine, tons of restaurants, Thai, European, Chinese, Japanese, Other Asian food is there and not to forget, the hips food court. Recommended.

High class shopping mall. Went this mall with my family. Very strategic place and easy to access. It's just next to Siam BTS and provides many shops for you to shop around.Great ambiance, full of mass.

Luxury mall with the best cinema. A luxury mall that is modern and clean. One of the best cinemas I've ever been to is located on the top floor and the food court on the ground floor has enough variety to suit all tastes. Sometimes you will find promo events happening if you're wandering around.

Escape the heat. This is the only shopping mall in BKK which I constantly come back to for no particular reason. There are loads of things to do here. There is an excellent bookstore, great food, and excellent cinema complex and a department store which is well priced. Excellent location
Have a look around this mall. Plenty of brands and high end stuff. Window shopping and food courts. Just a cool place to walk around and kill some time
Centrally located. Good place to spent time with family and friends having different cousins watching movies and shopping

High End Fashion . This large mall oozes of high end fashion labels across all floors. Great for window shopping if on a budget. The food court on the ground floor is a lively place filler with a large variety of food items from the usual Thai specialities, Western influenced food chains to delicious cakes and desserts. Pricing of food fits into the overall class of the mall itself. Worth a visit especially to see the differences between this mall and the other 2 Siam malls next to it.

Great Shopping Center. Siam Paragon is my preferred shopping Center in Bangkok. Easily reachable vis the BTS Siam station, it offers great shopping in a luxurious atmosphere. It also has a great food court with an abundant choice of delicious food, an aquarium, and on one of the higher floors they even have luxury cars on show. Don't miss it.

Good mall with great options. This is a superstar mall in bangkok. Located just at the exit to the skytrain station, it offers many options from madame tussauds to ocean world and food+shopping.We found even an indian restaurant inside the food court area. Must not miss this.

House of luxury items . On the last day of our Bangkok holiday, we visited this shopping mall. I should say this is a five star mall, with luxury items. If you're looking for locally produced item, I don't find any here, or maybe I don't walk around every corner. End your window shopping with an evening tea would cap your memorable day.

brands heaven. omg the mall is too beautiful and veryyyy biggg... i shop alot there and went 2 days for shopping and spent all day there shopping and eating.. u can find anyyyything here.. men women kids... best place to shop i 100% recommend

Best shopping place. We decide to go to siam paragon for eat lunch . But when we enter this mall its amazing mall . They has branded things in here and another building they has their own brand . And all look so luxury . And finally we bought some couple wallet from sheep leather and the price not too expensive . But if u looking for good material and luxury things with cheap price u must go to siam paragon . The price litlle bit different with another country (branded things) . And u can go to this mall by bts skytrain

It's a cool mall to hangout. We go to this place often and it is a nice and great mall with almost every good brands in it. Lots of coffee or tea shops and restaurants and very classy. Walking distance from Skytrain and almost everything and everywhere. It is highly recommended to visit this mall although is expensive to buy almost anything here but it is worth to spend some quality time with friends and family members there.
Great food and shopping. I loved to walk around the mall. It is so big and beautiful. The food court is amazing! So much to choose from. I am going back there if I will go back to Bangkok.
Modern. It is very modern mall with many luxury brands of clothes, cars and more. Very good varied food court with food of all kind. Heavy traffic around.

Good brands, bookstore. I love coming here because the interior is designed so elegantly. The mall houses a lot of international brands so it is a good place to shop. They also have a grocery that sells interesting Thai products. Their bookstore on the third floor has a diverse collection of local as well as foreign books. For a bookworm like myself, it is one of my favorite attractions in Bangkok

Spolit for choice on food. We always come to Siam paragon with an empty stomach. We just want to try everything!!! There are so much varieties of glourious food that we were so spolit not knowing which to go for. And we ended up buying one in most of the stores to try. We were so engrossed by the beautiful displays of food. The display of food is so deliciously creative!

Wow, food court is amazing!!. Hard to move through without buying something to eat and it is all top quality food. We couldn't walk away and ended up going back again for late lunch after visiting the aquarium.

Posh upmarket and expensive!!. The Paragon is a very upmarket shopping location with all the designer labels imaginable. The clothes and jewellery on offer are very obviously expensive. Yhe Paragon easily found via the skytrain close to Siam station. The food court downstairs is amazing and worth a visit.
Wow is the word for this place . Awesome shopping great location Great food court and other restaurants also great people it's humongous Awesome theatres for movies I'm loving thailand
Beautiful mall. We just loved the mall. Beautiful ,vast and well maintained.Many fountains and green area.All high grade merchandise.

Shop till you drop. I was here during Christmas and it was a amazing. There was a great deals and discounts on each shops. Nice collection from retailers. Lots of international shops. Worth the time. Tips: bring more cash. Looking forward to be back.

Is it big? - it's huge.... Enormous shopping complex in the middle of Siam area. Exclusive shopping , food and entertainment. Definitely worth a visit whilst in BKK. Btw, the pun was intended..Check out the cineplex on the top floor!

Not much value. To be honest u get much better stuff and at better prices in Kuala Lumpur malls. Here highly overpriced and poor choice of stuff unless u want to buy high end branded goods in thousands of thb. Go to platinum much better for actual low priced shopping.
Great Mall . Unique concept, very crowd in the food floor. The food market is excellent live the variety. Is a high end mall. But is a nice place to spend an afternoon, the cinemas are great.
good vat service. many good shops. prices not negotiate but many vat return for airport. good food in low floor. shopping here is great.

Good mix of class and affordability. Should have taken more photos. The level 1 entrance was classy with mini glass water falls with greenery. The basement food hall and level is HUGE. With many different resaurants, cafes and shops from themed food carts/court. The mango sticky rice was such a pleasant suprise with different flavoured rice.(my photo dont do euff justice as i took away and ate at the airport, still taste mangolicious!)

Yet Another Mall? . I have to say that although it's yet another mall it is massive. One thing going for it is Greyhound Cafe. It's crowded so you may have to wait for a table. But the must trys are iced tea done Thai style and the salmon sashimi in their special seasoning. I also like the new twist they put on mango sticky rice. Other notable shops include the iconic Jim Thompson with its fine silk work on bags and clothes. The usual shops eg Zara, uni glo, h and m have a wide variety different from those in Singapore and Malaysia. So although the shops are the same the variety means they warrant a second look.
Great place for luxury and branded. I visited there many times,but never boreing to visit there due to newly attractive luxury goods.It's really nice and great place for shopping.

Massive, glitzy, glamorous, cool, worth seeing. Even if you don't like shopping, go to the Siam paragon shopping centre, it's massive, clean, air conditioned and sells just about everything from Aston Martin cars to food.mthe food court on the basement level has loads of really clean nice places to eat, it's very busy and although it's not cheap it's worth it. The sheer size is amazing, it is just nice to wander round,Mohave a cup of coffee or water and enjoy the AC. The clothing departments upstairs are worth looking though though if you want clothing then you should also visit the MKM mall which can be reached by walking on the sky train walkway towards to the stadium station about 100metres, it's much cheaper and the vast range of stalls and outlets selling everything from phones to shorts is worth a look see. It feels safe too.
High end Mall. All the top brands are here . The location is good and it is a must visit for window shopping . The food court is huge and offers a lot of variety .

So many things I did not know I needed.. I have found this to be the go to location for any expensive and hard to find items. I was recently looking for an aged balsamic vinegar and was able to find 25, 50 and 100 year old options. They have a great liquor store with a wonderful wine selection (for Thailand).

Good eateries. Items sold in mega shopping Malls were getting expensive. I could easily get the same stuff back home at lower price. Hence unless you are brand conscious, I would suggest sticking to platinum mall or chatuchak market for your Low range shopping needs.Great selection of eateries in paragon though. There are some must-eat desserts cafe at the basement (outside gourmet market).

Best Mall In Bangkok. In spite of all the New Malls that have opened up at Bangkok which are much bigger then this,this is the best mall in Bangkok.It's very easy to go here because of the BTS sky train that takes you directly into the Mall.The Mall has every thing from the Huge Food courts to the Big Cineplex [Imax,4D,Multiple Screens] and sells everything from Luxury Cars,International Fashion Brands as well as The Local Thai Brands.It's so Huge it took us a whole day just to explore this Mall.

High end Mall. Has also the brands you can think off. So go there if you are into this only. Food court is nice and has enough variety. Not cheap , so be prepared to shell out . Has got sea world in the basement floor which is great

Great shopping mall. We went there for the Siam Ocean World, located on level B. Lunching at the food hall. Great choices of local international cuisines affordable prices. Take a browse around. You will be astonished with array of food and more food. You need to purchase a "Food card" to be used as a credit card on the day. Remaining balance is refundable.
Great shopping mall. At this mall you can find pretty much everything, it's a great place to spend some time if you don't know what else to do. A lot of good restaurants and shops.

The best mall in bangkok. This is the favourite mall for the entire family,
The verity of restaurants available is just amazing there is aquarium and kidzena kids will love it you can spend whole day in this mall

Luxury cars inside a mall. Amazing high end mall with luxury cars on exhibit on one floor. The ground floor had a good variety of food but was rather pricey. The supermarket had very fresh produce and nice ice cream. There was a mid year sale in most department stores and we could even find a good hoodie at 200 baht in the H&M sale.

Huge, upscale mall. This is a tremendous, upscale shopping mall conveniently located next to the BTS Skytrain stop. I'm not a big shopper, but it is an interesting place to window shop for the experience.
BRANDS😍😍. All the top brands you can imagine are out there.. Huge infrastructure and too many branded stores.. Display of many cars including cars from maseratti mercedes mini cooper bmw ducatti etc

Awesome Shopping Mall for Everyone . No, it is not just another shopping mall. It is one of the best I have visited. It has something for everyone, from coffee to food, whether fast or fancy, and from shopping to activities for kids and grownups. You could literally spend a whole day here. It has affordable shops like H&M and Uniqlo, and perhaps all the major brands names, like D&G, Versaci, LV and so on. We just walked around with our kids, window-shopped, drank the worst coffee ever at Coffee Beans by Dao, tried Thai Coconut drink with sago, and are at the food court. Just a relaxing day!

Only extremely expensive stuffs on sale. This place holds all the top brands and is real pleasure to go window shopping at. It is nearby to other shopping centres which are selling cheaper stuff as well because this place is not for everyone.

Good mix of dining, shopping and entertainment for family with young kid. With so many new malls coming up over the past few years and relatively quiet, it makes me wonder why Siam Paragon is still so bustling always.Location wise it is the interchange of both BTS lines. So it is really easy to get there without getting stuck in the traffic jam.There is a wide selection of dining choices from east to west, from economical to high end. I have been to the After You outlet there for 3 times in the past one year. There is always queue but manageable wait.For my son, he has been to Kidzania and Sea Life Ocean World previously. Costly entertainment but good alternative when it's too hot or raining out there. Do check out if your hotel concierge has any discount coupon for these two places. Large selection of luxury goods and well known chains such as H&M there. I like the Naraya at Siam Paragon compared to the Central World one as it is less crowded. Other than that, they also carry the higher end Nara and men's collection. Currently if payment is made using overseas Visa card for 3500 baht and above, can collect a free gift from cashier. Do remind them as it doesn't come automatic to them.It's definitely one of the shopping malls I don't mind going whenever I am in Bangkok.
Good place for shopping. This is good place for shoppingm i am prefere here to shopping than MBK. So far i found here are cheaper than shops in MBK

If you like shopping, thats right place. For those who likes shopping when they are traveling; also there is a huge choice of restaurants of different cuisines; there are some penguins in the aquarium

Great place to window shop. Branded goods galore, not exactly cheap. Good for window shopping though. Ground floor food court and gourmet market offers wide variety which is very nice. A visit to the underwater sealife is a must!
Worth a quick walk through. Although I am not a big mall shopper, the stores in this mall were really high end in this pristine shopping venue. I did buy a few things at Jim Thompson.

Amazingly Huge Mall. This place is massive. With stores galore - you can shop till you drop, and then cross over the road and find another massive mall to do it all again. Many nice stores along with the wax museum and aquarium.

High class shopping mall. We visited the supermarket and had our dinner in Fuji restaurant. The place here is big and had lots of restaurants and cafes. Is really crowded during weekends as you need to queue the popular food.
Shop till you drop. Lovely place to shop and walk around. They had this orchid show when I visited. Beautiful blooms indeed. Adjacent to another shopping mall.

World class mall and a destination on it's own. This is a fantastic mall and has a movie theatre, aquarium and a few incredible food courts. I would recommend it as a tourist destination it is so good. The amount of food offered at this mall is amazing and I would spend a half a day here and eat in one or more of the food places. Modern, upscale and air-conditioned it is world class.

Many thing to shop. There we're so many shops and food to choose from including a madame tussauds and a sea aquarium. There is also a kinokuniya for all those book lovers and a cinema for you to enjoy a movie

The craziest mall complex EVER. It's not just one mall, it's three huge, jam-packed, shopping heavens. Or hells, depending on your shopping tastes. There's Siam Discovery, Siam something or other, and Siam Paragon. The first was more like a modern fashion/interactive museum. Lots of people, no one carrying bags or buying! The second one I just walked through to get to the third. Everything in this one! From Hermes and Chanel boutiques to H&M, not to skip over the luxury car dealerships! Gigantic and confusing. The food court it really a whole floor of beautiful--and packed-- restaurants. Exotique Thai on the fourth floor was perfect for quality souvenirs, not much more expensive than on the street markets and with air conditioning, no haggling, and guaranteed quality. Lots of people and attraction watching, like two girls in evening gowns doing underwater synchronized swimming in a gigantic fish tank and taking selfies... To sell the new waterproof Galaxy phones. Insane.

Luxury shopping. Come here to buy the same luxury brands that you find at home to the same prices you pay at home. However, for a rainy day it could be worthwhile just to walk around and take in the athmosphere! The food court is very good, but more expensive than other places in the neighborhood.
Beautiful shopping mall. Very big and cool shopping mall. It houses the Sealife Ocean world. Lot of restaurants available inside.

Very nice mall. We stopped here for lunch, very good selection. The mall has a grocery store attached to it. There is paid parking in the garage. It is very clean and nicely decorated. Some of the items, like kids toys are a bit pricey. Just gotta watch what you buy.

All time fav shopping mall. This is one cool and Super huge shopping mall. There's always something new, restaurants fashion etc, and there's so much food to select from. The gourmet market is also amazing with Wide selection. However it's crowded all day round, so I prefer Central World which is equally good
shopping mall!!. Very clean and presentable shopping mall lots of designer stuff. But remember mostly small sizes. However on a super hot or rainy an option.

EXPENSIVE !!!. Very elegant and modern mall in Siam square area. It is one of the most expensive malls of Bangkok. As soon as you enter the mall, you can smell class. It has all the niche market brands on offer. Though too heavy for my pocket, window shopping never harms This is also a home to kidzania and Siam ocean world. Food court on ground level has good choices; we enjoyed crispy Kreme doughnuts there. Some restaurants are also on the higher levels. This mall has direct access to BTS. I have seen mostly rich Thais shopping there instead of tourists.

Lost the sparkle. Once used to be the prime and only location for the rich and trendy Thai, Siam Paragon I reckon has lost its sparkle. With Emquartier shining far brighter as well as other mid range options that are friendlier on the pocket, seems like the only people who swipe cards at Paragon these days are the Chinese nationals.Yup the PRCs are the new Japanese in Thailand. Once decorated with jap wordings, most shops are now with Chinese characters. Who can blame them? China folk from the vast and many farms in the Chinese province have become richer and able to travel. And many find Thailand providing them more joy and bang for buck... or reminbi in this case.Skip Paragon if you are looking for authenticity. Head to an outdoor market or heck go to Central Ladprao.Siam Paragon is now a little Chinatown.
Best mall i think. I really love this mall. They even have car showroom inside.Recommended for those who love branded item.

The real deal of Bangkok. You get all the high end brand names in this mall. In fact the whole street is mainly for branding purpose and is a high end district for shopping.Perfect place to window shop ;)

Many people and busy mall mostly for tourists. Brand names are here in this mall. If you like brands that can usually be found in your country you can drop by Siam Paragon - H & M , Mango , Uniqlo , etc. Nice to take photo infront of this mall. Super accessible via skytrain Siam station. They have a huge and busy food court and groceries. Nothing extra ordinary. Typical mall . If you don't have much time just skip this.

Really nice place . I really liked the place but the prices of the branded goods are way over priced compared to rest of the world. Sales associates are also not friendly at all. Where else in the world when you walk into a Valentino store and ask for price all they do is to type on a calculator and shove it into ur face. Felt i was in a flea market. Good to walk around but dont bother to buy anything
Similar to Orchard ION. Definitely a place to go if you want designer brands and classier restraunts.You can find most brands here and variety of expensive restraunts.Easily accessible by Siam BTS
Holy movie. The movie theatre is huge and very comfortable. Pricier than other theatres i have been to but still nice. Had food at one of the many resturants and the food was decent though pricey.

The best place for family. Siam paragon is a huge place at center of Bangkok.There are large department store,many super shops,theaters,fun park for kids,a lot of good restaurants.There are a lot of tutor schools near by. It is the place that moms can wait her daughtersduring their classes happily.If you are high fashion lover, this is your place.The best way to come here is BTS (Bangkok sky train) at siam station.By car, you may have some distress from traffic.

Expensive but Attractable. I was here for a lot of time but never leave a chance to see my favourite movie at siam paragon .Movie tickets at 240THB & 280THB .It was good to be here a lot of time .Whatever you buy an item it is from a trusted one from clothes to mobile .You wont get huge discounts here as compared to other shops which sell fake items .

Well named. Not my cup of tea,but,it is impressive.Where else would you see a McLaren 360 on display,every designer label in clothes,watches,electronics etc under one roof.A must see if shopping malls are your thing.Great food hall.

Shopping paradise . If you are into high mend goods this is the place to be. It is so accessible by the BTS. The only set back is that prices for designers goods is bit more than in Singapore. Example a large size Longchamp bag which cost SGD385 in Singapore but here in Siam Paragon it cost SGD445.

Best shopping experience I have had in Thailand. Here I feel comfortable... it is not quite as crowded as other malls I have been to.Also, I am able to find imported goods, speciality items, and quality merchendise here.I found that despite the exclusive feel of the mall, the prices of similar goods were the same at other malls, so no worries there.Probably has the best kids department of any of the department stores I have been to in Thailand.
Many many dessert places . Shopping mall with many many dessert options Big clean air conditioned Good place to chill when the weather is hot Connected to Siam center and Siam discovery
Visit to Siam paragon. Siam paragon is an upmarket mall of Bangkok. It's nice and clean with good high end shopping arcade and a good food court but nothing exceptional really.

Shopping City. Great place to be and be seen.This is shopping at the extreme. There are shops for everything and anything and between them, you should be able to get almost everything.Of particular mention is the display of the car manufacturers. We got to see the Aston Martin Vantage and the Vantage S, the Mini, Mini Coopers and the Cooper S but the new Mini cabriolet was sadly missing. The Roll Rpyce was also there in all their glory.What a treat.The food department is nothing to scoff at as they have it all covered and there is a pretty good selection to tempt your taste buds. Close by to the Central World and Siam Square so you are in the middle of the action

Upmarket items. This place is more for upmarket, boutique shopping...The departmental store was well-stocked, loved the children's section - huge array of toys! But what I loved was the Food Hall/Food Court! The Food Hall had local delights like meat sticks and fish cake which tasted delicious for affordable price, and especially good if you have a weak stomach and can't do street food too well!There are also comfort options that remind you of home - McDonalds, Starbucks, etc! Plus of course, Kidzania is found here!

good shopping venue with the renown bookshop "Kinokuniya". One stop for shopping, we could find almost everything we need.
good location, right opposite to the Siam Kempinski.

Massive complex, shop til you drop. This is a huge mall that has almost anything and everything you can imagine. From designer clothing and jewellery to stuffed animals and Toyland for the kids. You can spend hours on end walking this place. We enjoyed the food court downstairs (caution, don't put your bags on the ground as cockroaches scurry around there) and bought a few things at the supermarket to enjoy for later. Note that the food court operates on a cash free system. At a specific booth, you can purchase a card with credit on it or use your Rabbit transit pass to tap and pay.

A beautiful, yet expensive, shopping mall.. This is one of Bangkok's best high-end shopping malls.The place is meticulously maintained with a lot of high-end shops (and prices to match).There are also numerous food venues in the mall.

High dollar shopping mall. Located just off the Siam BTS station, this multi level mall is primarily for Thai high society or rich travelers. Many over abundant shoppes offering Prada handbags, Jimmy Choo shoes, Tiffany jewelry, Rolls-Royces- McLaren-Lambo) Ferrari, high end electronics, etc. Fun ti look around and dream.

If you like shopping....... Huge sprawling place selling everything from an Aston Martin or Rolls Royce to a bag of apples. Things and prices to suit everyone from Hiso to soso.There is a great foodcourt offering a good range of freshly cooked food at a fair price....excellent. Also a large number of restaurants and fast food places. Hugely busy especially at weekends. Just get off the BTS at Siam and you are there.If you like shopping you will love this place.
It reminds me of KLCC, Malaysia. This mall is accessible via the Siam BTS. It has many restaurants and their food court has many interesting choices. Ocean Bangkok is located in this mall.

Great shopping centre. This is a great shopping centre. Not as big as the Central World but not as expensive and expansive. The department store in this Centre had a great sale on . Overall I didnt buy alot in Bangkok as I found upmarket merchandise in all the Bangkok Shopping centres to be as expensive or even more expensive than home in Sydney Australia.

Quality Shopping medium - high end. Quality Shopping medium - high endSiam bts (Sky train) will get you to Siam Paragon, Siam Discovery and Siam Centre. These three malls are very large and vast towers consisting of a huge range of branded well known shops. Siam Paragon is more high end - Gucci etc, where as Siam Centre has H&M, Zara, Nike, Adidas etc. Have fun

Modern mall with a nice artistic touch.. It is an little confusing mall, butt really cool because of the artistic touch added. You'll see when you are there.A lot of diversity in stores and in the weekends you might see some demonstrations of products. Easy accessible by sky train or cab.

Everything You Could Ever Need. imagine you arrive on this planet butt-naked, with only an unlimited credit cars. And as this weird fate is, you materialize right in front of Siam Paragon, next to the water fountain. Fear not - the first three minutes will be a bit awkward, but you walk into the mall and by some underpants and a bra or T-shirt and the embarrassing stares seize. Next swagger into one of the many high end brand designer boutiques and buy some proper thread. Now you need shoes, you can be accommodated easily. There are also a surprising number of stores catering exclusively to the discerning audiophile. By now word has gotten out and the mall management has provided you with a valet to carry your purchases. Since you have your unlimited credit card, you decide to get some wheels. Lamborghini, Porsche and MANY other luxury car manufacturers are competing for access to your coveted credit card. Finally, if you are in the market for a house, condo, apartment, penthouse he are many agents waiting to do business with you.In summary, in less than sixty minutes have you gone from butt-naked stranger with a credit card to highly respected member of the Bangkok's Old Money Society.Siam Paragon is the must see opposite of MBK. Quite impressive and extraordinary for a country with a lot of poverty.

Awesome shopping experience and a great place to grab a bite to eat. I walked to this mall from my hotel but you can get the BTS service or taxi. They have an excellent range of mid to high range shops. Everything from Chanel to Zara and H&M. Ground floor has a food mall where you can grab a bite to eat. This mall connects to Siam Centre and Central World are not far away either.

Giant center.. The giant center with its shops worldwide brands. I especially recommend the level of the Food Hall restaurants with cuisine from different parts of the world and a great aquarium at the lowest level.

Shopping Galore. Siam Paragon is a collection of high end shops. The dramatic entrance and the display of expensive stores were overwhelming. The place is huge and walking around was fun. There are also fancy eateries in each floor. A great visit to a very extravagant shopping center in Bangkok.

High end mall that sells clothes to Lamborghini. This is a top end mall with all the top end brands there from H&M, Zara, Selfridges and many more. For Hi-Fi music buffs there is Meitner, JBL, Bose. For Auto lovers there is BMW, Ducati, Lamborghini, RR. Kids can have fun at the Sea World which is not up to international standards but good place to spend time. However if there is one thing which stands out is its food court. Super huge. Gives all types of food options. One should just go there for the food court as every type of food option on this planet can be found there.
Luxury . You can get all the luxury items here. If you are searching for branded stuffs. Here is the good place for you.

I like Siam discovery more. There are 3 mall near eachother. On this place u can eat various foods drinks etc. Almost all brands here. Even I dont know many of them. Easy to find lots of things to do. In siam discover u may find design products and technologic stuff

Go to any Steakhouse nearby. Was really expected much in "You hunt we cook" as it cooks the fresh ingredients handpicked by yourself. However, 50 mins is way to long for waiting.... Ridiculously slow service and not helpful staff. The cooking was not bad at all, but you can taste similar but better food else where for sure.

Great Mall in a Convenient Location. We stayed at the Renaissance Ratchaprachong which was only a 10 minute walk in the middle of the shopping district. The first thing you notice is how clean and modern the building is. It opens at 10:00 and is spacious enough to house a drone of people who flock in every day. We went to Sea Life Bangkok (Ocean World) which is located at the lower level in the mall. After being thoroughly impressed by the indoor park, we tackled the food court. Yes, they have typical recognizable stores such as Cartier, Louis Vuitton, Channel, and other high end shops that could be found in any premium US malls, but what makes it stand out are the restaurants. We had lunch at Crystal Jade which had an impressive array of dim sum and yummy seafood dishes. We also had Ladurèe macarons. Honestly, there are a bunch of stands that offered macarons for a lot cheaper that are just as good. We had foie gras and white truffle macarons outside the gourmet supermarket in the lower level that cost less and much more memorable than Ladurèe's. Don't forget to try the eclair stand. I tried the Siam coconut cream eclair and it was heaven!It's extremely easy to take by Sky Train since its a major stop. Definitely worth visiting.

Another beautiful shopping centre in Bangkok. Another high end shopping centre in Bangkok, amazing food court on the ground floor and the cinemas on the top are nice to escape the heat. Movies were in English also.
Specialised shopping. Great food hall. Worth a look. Even to see how the other half live & shop! You can buy anything here - even a Bentley. Great food hall on lower level

Food Heaven. Siam Paragon is a high end shopping mall, self-claimed Gastronomical Heaven yet they never lie.The moment you enter the mall from BTS, you will see Laduree, take an escalator downstair, you will definitely see food heaven! They have literally everything, you name it!They have a gorgeous supermarket with plenty of interesting goods.They have foodcourt, dessert places, as well as coffee shops and restaurants.

Amazing. This is an amazing shopping experience especially if you love to shop so much variety and food the atmosphere is just overwhelming, I tend to get a little excited when it comes to amazing food and the people who make it. The supermarket is just state of the art I brought home ingredients that I just can't get in my country.

Best shopping in the world!. This mall has the best the of the best stores; amazing selection, pretty much anything you could think of. Make sure to check out the gourmet grocery store in the basement!
Convenient and comfortable . Easily connected by the Sky Train. Hung out for some eats and enjoyed the crowd there. Fun place to be. Got a suit from Peninsula, great tailors!

Typical mall. It's a typical mall with all the big brands. Honestly there is nothing special but the upper levels have some good fine dine local cusine options. So if you want to try Thai food but are afraid to eat of the street, this is a good place to check out.

Good only if you like indoors!. This ultra modern shopping mall is just as another mall in singapore or malaysia. It's catering to the high end shopper with reknowned brands, for me personally i think you can skip this place if you are not looking for shopping at malls.The items here are available in any other malls and prices is not cheap either, however the foodcourt is impressive. The choices of food under one roof is superb. Although the prices are steep but it's well worth.
Epic mall. Probably one of the biggest mall complexes I have seen. Gormet food hall and market were amazing! So many free samples and food choices! Epic
The most famous shopping center in Bangkok . Very nice and peaceful place to walk and have fun . You can find many international brands with sometimes reasonable prices
High end mall. Nice to walk around and enjoy a nice desert with coffee in the place where many of Bangkok's high end beauties go for shopping.

Very nice. Amazing architecture and beautiful stores. One of the nicest high-end shopping centers i've seen in my life. It is worth to go the the Siam Paragon just to walk around and take a look. The food court was also delicious and the prices were reasonable.

High end shopping & wonderful desserts. We only ventured at the basement for the dessert and also to access the sea life centre. The F& B choices are staggering. If you are on a strict not cabs no dessert diet, stay away from the basement. The photos are proof of the challenges we faced. *haha*

Nice to walk around. Very beautiful, modern and clean mall. Very high end stores in a number of building. Each building has its own distinct interior design. Nice to walk around and people watch and see the cars for sale on a rainy day. Many options available for reasonably priced food.

Shopping at Siam Paragon. I can spend my whole day here. They have many well-known brands and up to date product (both Thai and International). Moreover, They provide super market which you can select very fresh and

Premium shopping center. Huge shopping center. Takes almost half day to discover the shops. Food court is pricy but full of choices. Quality is there. Walk a while to check out the choices before ordering.

Huge shopping centre with a huge cinema complex and aquarium. Lovely shopping experience with almost everything you need here. Love the huge food hall with many interesting food choices and the Gourmet Market at the basement where I never fail to visit every time I come to Bangkok.

Love the place. A really good mall with lots of branded stuff .
Variety of food..caters to all .
The sea life at the LG is really good.
Connected with siam city n discovery all the way upto MBK...so also serves as a qalking path for ppl willing to go to MBK.
An overall good experience.
Shopping with reputable brand. Dont expect to find cheap thrill here.All brand is of Reputable company. A good variety of food and beverage.A decent Shopping Mall

Easy way to spend a day. We had lots of spare time in Bangkok so got a taxi here from Khao San (about 100B). There are dozens of cafes and restaurants, plenty of shops of all types, and one of the best cinemas I've ever been to. Spent all day here without even realising.

Shopping. A very beautiful mall with everything one can imagine under one roof. One can get good and original designer brands here thus its a little expensive mall then mbk. It is in the heart of city and also a depot for catching the underground metro too.
Heaven for shopaholic . Would love to spend whole day in this huge place. Many kind of restaurants, boutique etc. this place completely heaven for shopaholic to spend the time.

Loved it!. This was by far our fav mall in Bangkok. It's got pretty much everything you need for a days entertainment with an awesome cinema, loads of high end fashion stores and an amazing selection of cafes and restaurants in the lower ground level as well as a fantastic international supermarket.

Massive. This is supposably the largest shopping mall in Asia, boasting many shops and several other business. As well, also has a cinema with about 15 screens, one of these is the largest screen in Asia.

Siam station BTS at its door step, great cinema and Kidzania!. Took the BTS from Pathuwan Princess Hotel/MBK (National Stadium to Siam Station (1 stop away) for 15 baht/pax. The children had fun in Kidzania and the cinema is great!!!

Worth a Visit - If You Like Shopping. It is one of BKK's upscale Malls. I must say that the overall layout is easy to get around, unlike Central World.Particularly loved the basement level where the Gourmet Market is located. The food stalls located outside are divine. Spent an hour there. Haha. When in BKK, one should be eating street food but when in Siam Paragon, one must eat all the food located at the basement. Haha. One of the levels sell luxury cars: Maserati, Bentley, BMW, etc. Feast your eyes on the latest car models if you're into such things.Try it. Accessible via the BTS train.

Fancy mall. We went there to eat, since just some shops are good for us! You can find a lot of good restaurants (Thai and not Thai) in the ground floor!Is a nice place to walk if you want to escape from the hot and sun in the streets!
Paradise. Its a paradise for shopping. NYC does not have massive malls like in Bangkok. Its a 1 stop visit for dining, movie and shopping. Will be back.
What a mall!!. If way to spend your bahts imaginable. From a Rolls to a Rolex. Don't miss the most amazing food court in the world. A must see

Food Court. It was too hot to walk around the touristic spots, so we just headed to this mall. Since we didn't intend to do any shopping, we stayed at the food court at the basement. It was like a heaven. I can't say non-Thai food they're selling are anywhere close to authentic, but the sheer amount of choices made it a worthwhile visit. The choices are literally endless. I think we could've easily spend all day there just eating away. Would love to visit again to try more food.

shopping . upscale shopping department store with good food court on the ground floor and a fancy spices market inside the supermarket many restaurants and fast food too.from 1st floor up there are brand name boutiques and coffee shoppes  as well as electronics, bookshop and more
Another Mall. Another Mall, it is really Another Mall. Some of the eateries at the basement looked good, though. The supermarket has some interesting finds.

Definitely the most upscale mall in Bangkok. Siam Paragon is by far the most upscale shopping mall in Bangkok. It has everything under the sun - from Food and Beverage restaurants, cafes and outlets to famous retail brands and famous branded goods stores. It is a mall not to be missed in the heart of Bangkok.
I don't like it as much. A little bit too mainstream... I prefer the less crowded emporium and EmQuartier. Cinema overcrowded, Comic con was very appalling, with nerds everywhere.

Best mall in Bangkok . This is the best mall in Bangkok which I found.
Branded clothes available and near by the metro station and fisible also. There are food court in mall. So you can hangout there and beautifully made.
So if you looking forward to branded clothes than this the best mall.
Thanks.

Up class district . This is a high class shopping center and most of the things sold here are either branded or expensive. But still this is a nice place to explore as it is massively big and houses a underwater aquarium in the basement and even sell sport cars in one of their shop. They also have nice food area at the basement with After You cafe which is not to be missed!

Ten pin bowling centre. Looking for a change from shopping and eating, this is the place for fun, went there on a lunchtime, had a great time, beer on tap, great food fresh, and the staff are very helpful, old video and music plus plenty of people watching.
Heavenly Shopping.. All brands under one roof. Excellent shopping mall with lots of choice. The Paragon store itself is huge and offers so much of choice.

A shopping Mecca, a place to be seen. In the strip of shopping malls that can be perused in this part of Bangkok, this supposedly is the ultimate shopping experience, or perhaps more accurately was as there is a growing number of similar malls. The only part I can really recommend is the basement area which does have excellent food, and an overpriced and underwhelming aquarium, good to keep the kids busy while you shop. MBK mall is far better and less expensive, or for even shorter walk, and more varied experience, unfortunately away from the A/C, wander through Siam square.
Good, clean mall with wide food selection. Great place to have your meals, chill and relax. The cinema here is wonderful. The stores here are selling high end stuff
Big mall selling high end goods. Siam Paragon is a big mall at Siam station and it hosts many well known luxurious brands. We spent an hour or two strolling in Siam Paragon to escape the heat.
Nice place to hang around . It's too big and we spent most of our time in ocean sea world. The food court was amazing with wide choice of food.

Biggest mall and branded store. In Asia is not many place with all the branded store in a place. Singapore of course... but others are not that easy to find branded store. As a city of fashion trade center in Asia which is profide many copy product. This mall placed just beside those place and I m immpressed with all branded shop they have. Kind of shopping kingdom

Luxury. Siam Paragon, located in one of the most luxurios and busiest shopping centres in Bangkok. Get there by BTS and get down at Siam Station. The design of the mall is really nice, even the entrance is already eye-catching. Various of luxurious brands, you can find your favorite outfit, health goods, skin care, cosmetic products, travel goods and so on. We were there not only for shopping but also to look at the Thai hotties! Tons of Thai beauties walking in and out or working in the mall, no matter they are gentlemen, ladies or transgenders. The basement is a huge food court, you can find Thai, Japanese, Korean to Western, Food Stalls, Fast Food, Casual Dining to Fine Dining. Anything you call it, they have it. Amazing shopping experience.

Great High End Mall. If you like exclusive brands and shopping malls then you will be in heaven here. I live in London and whilst we have all the same shops and brands they are scattered all over London. This is in one incredible immaculate mall. All Western Brands seemed really expensive but perhaps you can recover the tax?The area this is in is Siam square and it's a busy area with lots of malls so the sky train station is pretty busy.I particularly like the food hall and food court in this mall.

A huge mall. A really big mall with lots of stores, you can spend at least a half day here wandering around for high end shopping or have meal at the food area, there are lots of food and beverage providers, most of them are really good and always busy, we had to wait in line to get our meal at Pepery.

Better than central world . We actually went here just to see how big of a shopping centre it was said to be..... It was huge. I mean huge. Like 7 floors of shopping with about three floors of food. It was a variety of all foods from around the world and a market outside. It's only a ten minute walk from. Central world. So. Heck them both out. But this one for me was a lot better.

Just a mall. This was a great mall with a lot of awesome shops but it wasn't anything special. It had a lot of delicious food options and also affordable shops compared to malls like the central embassy. We went here on our first day of arrival while waiting for our hotel room to be ready. It's a great place to get away from the heat, but just like all other malls.

high end shopping. Well this is the place if you're looking for high-end. Absolutely stunning you'll find from the Rolls Royce showroom to the finest designer clothes everything and I mean everything you can forget London or Paris all leading fashion brands off the world a present not to mention the fine restaurants. And if you're really not to spend too much on food there is a typical THAI food court not that expensive. If you like to see one of the finest movie theaters in the world you just go on the 5th floor and enjoy the latest in sound quality and 4K absolutely fantastic. And the service is second to none coming from Europe you just on another planet so to speak.
Mall. Many important fashion shops, jewelry, expensive cars, unuseless... Not for me but cold and toilets are very clean

Huge mall. This mall is really huge. It offers all kinds of shops. Most of them are high price so more like a tourist place. Seems that young locals like this mall as they also do concerts and do on. Nothing special to me.

Has everything including activities for kids! Check out the food court!. This mall has it all, pharmacy, grocery store, aquarium, Kidzania, H&M, a Department store with an amazing selection of kids items and electronics (upstairs). There are charming restaurants and a fabulous hawker food court. Yes, it can be spendy depending on where you spend your Baht. The Gourmet grocery store has a huge selection. They even has some natural or close to natural/eco products. There is a lovely selection of cold pressed fresh juices and green drinks. This is the first place on my travels in SE Asia that I've been able to find cold-pressed fresh orange juice not to mention passion fruit juice. Huge downside of the Gourmet Grocer was the amount of plastic used on the cheeses and especially in produce. I will bring my plastic back and try to reuse, but it is not possible to buy fruit free of single-use plastic. After picking up bag after bag of plastic on Phuket Beach, I'm shocked by the zeal with which grocers use plastic. There is literally no way to avoid packaging in this store.This best part about this mall for us are the offerings for kids and the food options. It isn't uncomfortably busy during the week, but gets pretty packed on the weekends, especially the restaurants, where you most likely will need to wait for a table.
Bit over rated. Good shopping complex but over priced. There is about 8 floors and a very good food hall. Every large brand is represented.

Beautiful. The mall is beautiful and has a huge variety of everything from Garrett Popcorn to Harrods and MAC cosmetics. A little bit of Thai flavor, but overall very cosmopolitan and what you'd expect from any shopping mall in a major destination. Walking in and seeing Garrett Popcorn was interesting! Don't get me wrong- I'm addicted to the stuff but was shocked to find it in Bangkok!!

Accessible and fancy, not cheap shopping. This mall is accessible as it is nearby the Siam BTS station, but its not a cheap shopping destination for those looking for affordable goods. But its a really hip, trendy and fancy shopping mall.
Always a great time. . I love this mall... always a pleasure to come here. Clean, bright, quiet energy. The food court is interesting, and lots of upmarket choices for all preferences.
Best mall in Bangkok . Nice and big place..You can find any brand..Good location..Best food Good for family's and kids. .. you can spend great time there....

Go for the window shopping, stay for the food court. Filled with bigger brands than some of the other shopping malls nearby, this is a pretty fancy shopping centre that's relaxed, cool and airy, and very easy to find. Though I didn't buy anything, I did try the really amazing food court, which is filled with a huge selection of pan-Asian food at affordable prices.If you're a little bit scared of getting stomach trouble from the street food in Bangkok, Paragon's food court offers the same kind of delicious Thai and Asian food (primarily noodles and rice dishes) in a super-clean environment – though obviously not quite as exciting as grabbing it from a street food vendor.There's also McDonalds, Costa and various other chain brands should you be craving a coffee or milkshake.Really easy to find, right by Siam BTS Skytrain stop.
For shopaholics only. . For me it is not the best place for shopping. Poor signalisation and insufficient orientation. And normally it is crowded with windows shopping tourists.

Siam Paragon. We visited the Siam Paragon mall which I think is definitely worth visiting. We were prepare to only window shop as we already knew that the prices there were not affordable. Really clean and their food court is amazing. It's like street food but in a clean environment and it has a gourmet market. I definitely wouldn't plan on shopping there. This is more a place just to window shop, see the cars, eat at the gourmet market or any of the restaurant and take an air condition break from walking. It's easily accessible and easy to get to. You can get here on the TBS or just by walking. It's close to the hotel and embassies area as well as three or four other shopping malls. We never really shop when we go on vacation. But I think this place is definitely worth seeing.

Brand name shopping. This is a well located mostly high end brand name shopping experience. It is well laid out and a pleasure to browse around in the air conditioned comfort and away from the hustle and bustle of the street. And home to Sea Life Bangkok which is run by Ocean World.The food court has many choices and some of the best eateries in town, you will not be able to leave here hungry. if you are frightened by the high end names don't be the food court has excellent quality food reasonably priced.Also there is a supermarket "Gourmet Market" behind the food court where you will be able to purchase a wide variety of european/american brands of food.

Excellent shopping mall for big brands. Excellent ambient mall in heart of Bangkok for shopping of big brands. For most of the tourist who come to Bangkok for affordable Shopping, for them it is one of tourist spot only and can enjoy food and ice cream only with window shopping.

Yes yes yes. Yes. All you can get and all there is as well. Super nice shops ( all brands) abd very nice stores..
Wanna lunch?
Go to the basement and the foid court is ready for you. Almost too much to chose from. Also this location I like it!!
It is a hotel and shopping mall. A good place to cool off but it really is what it is. If you have shopping malls where you come from, don't plan on being impressed.

Elegant . If you love Hi-end brand name you must visit Siam paragon! There are hundred of luxury shop! For example Hermes, LV, Valentino, etc. but everything in this shopping mall are expensive as well.
Far east trip . Nice selection of shops and restaurants. We briefly passed through one day and speed for some delicious ice cream
Shopping. Posh upscale shopping mall if you are about to do some shopping of this kind in Bangkok or if you are interested to see another face of this diverse city.

Expensive shops, nice shopping centre!. This centre is huge with a selection of expensive designer shops in comparison to the MBK centre. It is a very different experience! It is nice and cool too which is a god send in the Thai heat! There is a huge food hall which sells a selection of food but also a food court with restaurants we went in the peppery Thai which had lovely Thai dishes although the service was a let down.
