Shoppers paradise . Loved the aquarium best ever experience... excellent dining places.. shop till you drop.... lively atmosphere... I liked the local thai brands... good quality... prices are reasonable
Shopping . There are many shops and many famous brand in Siam paragon. It's a good place for shopping. There are any types of restaurants.

Upscale shopping mall. High end designer brands are found here.The food court is average though. Environment is clean and we were spoilt with the choice of restaurants available.Cheese Bake Tart is available at the same level as the cinema. The queue is not as long as the one in Singapore. We waited about 15mins.Located next to BTS Siam.

Love this Mall. There are some incredible malls and places to shop in Bangkok. This is the high end mall. With very , very nice places to eat. If you are in the market for a high end car, you have many options, then you can go downstairs and buy high end jewelry.You can also go across the road to another huge mall for us not so well healed folk.
Very big mall. Humongous mall with lot of options to shop and eat. You can easily spend 3-4 hours easily here. Closely located lot of good hotels.

Great Place for Food. High end shops, a USD 100 a seat (bed) theater, an aquarium, KidZania, and luxury cars (Roles Royce, Bentley, Maserati, Lamborghini, etc). I rarely purchase anything here but I do like the food options. They have everything from gourmet burgers and a taco truck, to Asian and French cuisine.

Not Enough Public Spaces. Siam Paragon is one of the biggest malls in Bangkok and the conjungted Siam Centre and Siam Discovery give even more options for shoppers with money to spend.There're restaurants and food court in parts of the mall.For shoppers with children, they can always visit the Sea Life Bangkok on the basement.But unlike the similar malls in Bangkok, I can't remember if I ever find a public space where visitors can sit or take a rest during their visit.There's a fountain and open space available in front of the mall but there's no chair, so visitors must find a cafe or restaurant to get a chair to relax.

The best shopping centre. If you want to buy the best brands, from a Bentley or Lamborghini, to an expensive watch, this is the place to come! No bargains on offer though, so also a good place to window shop

Shopping and Food Paradise. Leave your kids at KidsZania and you and your spouse can spend quality time shopping and feasting. Lots of shops to choose from and very good selections of restaurants depending on what you like.

High end shopping and no deals. High end shopping, no deals. Terminal 21 is best if your more middle class like us canadians. Nice stores... Just very exclusive and expensive. Food court sucked too. Not our kinda place. Still neat to see though!

If you want to buy a McLaren or Rolls Royce go here . Right next to skytrain and other good malls.Never seen high end car dealerships in a shopping mall before.Go here just to look at what you cannot afford. The standard of the place makes Sydney shopping look really shabby indeed. This is a very high end mall catering to the top level of Thai consumers. All the top European and American brands are here, prices are the same as the US and Europe. If you are a western tourist you won't buy anything here.. Still your girlfriend will gladly drag you through here. Worth looking at some of the mobile phone shops, I thought it was a the lobby of a five star hotel.

High-end mall. Seldom will you see exotic cars of different brands having a showroom in a mall. This is the definition of luxury. If you don't have plans on splurging, window shopping here is still a lot of fun.

Mall of Malls in Bangkok. The mall has high end and branded labels. Food choices is plentiful. There were a lot of japanese restaurants which i truly appreciate since I needed a variety of food on our 3rd day in Bangkok. A must visit mall in bangkok.

Beautiful place to visit. The mall was very expensive with lots of expensive stores, but its definitely worth it to walk through. the stores itself are almost like art exhibits, and its nice to look around. Really great food court too!
Luxury mall. Dis mall is pure luxury... prices are high as expected..almost all brands worl wide products available...
A huge mall with everything for sale . from luxury cars to food hall. Movie complex. It's a bit overwhelming so treat it like a small city and don't try to "see" it all.

Don't bother unless you are a millionaire . It is a sight to be seen, very fancy, every designer shop you can imagine, even a Maserati delership! But unless you have gazillions $$$$$ you won't be shopping.
Super nice mall. This is such a great mall. In this mall you will find all the high end shops and also a very nice foodcourt. The supermarket has all the things you might need.

The best place to shop in bangkok. Whatever you can think of they have it, unless of course you are into more of a market goodies .
Nice Ac, not too hot , taxis are in front of the mall , food court down, what else you can think of .
Love the place !
Excellent. Good place to shop there. You can get famous brand fashions,men and women cloths. Even you will get brand toys for your kids.
Mall . Is a very big mall, like what we have in Europe or America. Have all big brands of clothes, technology and food. Great break during a visit in Bangkok

Gourmet market. This is super market is fantastic, you can eat what you buy there inside the market, they have live oyster bar, very good. And the fruit are amazing. And the market is surrounded with the food, cake, restaurant and many more, its heaven for the culinery lover like me, love it
Upscale shopping. Upscale shoppig. All the stores that can be found globally. The food court is excellent, cheap, and excellent food.

Way to,high end mall. This is a very high end mall. Unless you need to add to your Gucci, Valentino, or diamond collections this mall is just nice to walk around. If you are looking for bargains then don't waste your time.
Real mall. It's like a high end US mall. Really nice inside and okay to walk around on a hot day but don't expect any bargains here. I'm not paying full price for stuff I can get in USA.

Very good and easy VAT return. Very luxurious shopping mall with many high end brands and haute couture designers.Prices are a little bit lower than in Singapore but you can apply for VAT receipt at every shop. A tasty food court on the lower floor, Sea life center on the lowest. Big movie theater on the top floor. They have lots of activities and shows in the main hall of the mall. A perfect place for those rainy days.

Shopaholic Paradise!. Paradise not only for the shopaholics but also for food lovers.. All of the popular food, shop, cosmetic brands in one place.. Enough to keep people busy for quite some time! Supermarket products vary from local to international by a wide margin. Siam Paragon never seems to empty!
Great huge mall. A city in the city. Air conditioned. Shopping paradise, but also restaurants, cafes... entertainment... A must go.
Stunning .... You may not buy any thing there (we always do), but you could buy anything - including a Bentley or Ferrari ...

High-end Shopping. It is easy to get to Siam Paragon Shopping Centre as it is connected to Siam Centre, which in turn is located next to Siam BTS Station. So you can just walk through Siam Centre to Siam Paragon Shopping Centre.This is a lovely high-end shopping experience, but as always, you will not find bargains here. We found that items such a make-up, perfume, aftershave that is imported into Thailand to be more expensive than the prices in Melbourne, Australia. We found some wonderful shoes for a reasonable price, but sadly, we couldn’t find our size available for sale. This is often a problem for us when travelling around Asia.Being a high-end shopping complex, the toilet facilities here were very good.
all brands under one roof!. excellent place to find all the brands you want such as H&M, zara, Bebe. you got everything from a food court to cosmetics!
Very good. Very nice environment mall with very nice coffee shops and many signature brand. Good cinema theater. Big supermarket with quality brands nice food court

Great Shopping Mall. Siam Paragon is my favorite shopping mall in Bangkok, especially the supermarket, I have to spend there at least 2 hours to buy all souvenirs, like curry paste, coconut oil, snacks...

Good place.. Perfect shopping place for everyone, I especially like the food court. Menu food is plentyful, clean and delicious. I regret because within one day is not enough to go out there. I will come back.
Variety. . Love this mall.. It's got everything you ever want.. Accessible by BTS (Siam station).. I'd say good place to shop instead of central world
Modern and sophisticated . The mall of high end brands..connected to several surrounding malls and walking distance to central world through the walkway..

All your luxury desires. Siam Paragon is a luxury shopping paradise. The tech section in the department store has the latest, futuristic devices and the Kinokunya store is large enough to get lost in. If you're not there to buy anything, I recommend for the air con and a reconnaissance of the latest fashion trends and appliances.

Superb . Superb and undoubtedly the best shopping mall in Bangkok . Better than all other malls we saw. Even the food court and restaurants here are much better than the rest . It's a one stop solution for all travellers as far as shopping is concerned.

So much to see. We spent ages here, great to get out of the heat, lots of places to rest and get a drink, very modern place.
Lots of different stuff to see, easy to pass a morning away just wondering around.

Loads of shops and eateries! !. This is a mall not to be missed. It's always filled with events on weekends and this place is very crowded every evening. The gourmet place has many nice restaurants and cafes worth visiting. The gourmet market is a supermarket frequent by foreigners or locals looking for imported food. Surrounding the supermarket are snack stalls which you can grab and go. Prices are reasonable and there is a salad bar counter within the supermarket which caters for the healthy lifestyle. You can also find table settings within the supermarket for people who wants to enjoy fresh seafood dinner.

Siam Paragon Shopping Centre - High End Shopping. We visited so my wife could go to the movies at the Cineplex with friends. Afterwards they had a late lunch in the huge international food which must have at least 100 restaurants, cafes and food outlets. Parking can be difficult but the BTS train stops at the entrance. A large number of shops and stores including luxury cars, Harrods and similar. There are a number of water features.

Not Particularly Attractive . The shopping mall opens at 10am but restaurants remains shut till 11:30am! By then, there is a long queue for tables. Not a conducive environment. Restaurants are NOT open for all day dining & closes at 2:30pm. Last order at 2pm.Unlike Central World, the walkway are small, so on a weekend, you're literally at elbows with people. Shops are disorganized. So you have to search for it.Not my usual favorite.

A nice Mall with a lot of Brands and Food Outlet. Had gone there for a business visit but found the place very good to hang around. Almost all the major brands have outlets. The food court is mouth watering and a not to miss place. Location is very convenient next to the Siam BTS Station. Highly recommended.

Shopping, Dining, Entertainment Heaven. No matter is you just come here to people watch, grab a bite to eat, do some shopping, go watch the Aquarium or catch one of the many movies (5th Floor).... everything is big, shiny and beautiful. Make sure you dont leave your wife to long with you credit card here. There are endless amounts of ways to spend money here. The food court can get really busy - but offers an endless selection of all kind of foods. Also you will find all the typically food chains here.

Beautiful mall but SUPER EXPENSIVE!. The mall itself is beautiful, however the prices at the stores are even worse than western prices. If you're in Thailand why would you want to go to a mall that is even more expensive than the malls at home? Stick to the markets. Not worth going to in my opinion.

Superb Place! The all-encompassing mall.. Want to shop for luxury products while keeping your children entertained? Want to watch movies and feel as if every single show you catch is the Premier? Want to uncover penguins and a gigantic aquarium hidden in a shopping mall's basement? GO TO SIAM PARAGON!!! Exciting things begin here. I came here for two to three consecutive days in a row. Spent a day at KidZania, another at the Underwater Aquarium. These are excellent places to take your children and family. Love the array of snacks and food choices here. Siam Paragon is also home to the much raved about <After You> dessert establishment. Prices for the food court is exorbitant by Thai standards, but still an affordable option, if you're on a budget after purchasing a Prada bag and Gucci wallet that is. Also, I managed to run a couple of errands here to! There's a large AIS store where I was able to address some issues with my SIM card. I also bought an SD card for my camera and a portable charger for my mobile phone. Generally, the staff were all able to speak English proficiently. Service was good. Overall, Siam Paragon is great for all ages. I hope I've given you enough reasons on why you should check out the mall. And also, if you've a bad craving for Krispy Kreme after backpacking Southeast Asia for weeks, COME HERE all the more!!!

Love it!. Love this mall! Initially I was like I have no interest since I can't afford all the high end stuff but it has a good mix of everything. There's a supermarket on the ground level that is considered a little pricey by Thai standards but it has a good selection of international products. There are a lot of shops and restaurants you can choose from which is expensive from Thai standards but really you're paying prices that are similar to American dollars. The quality great! Highy recommend even if not buying at least try the restaurants or coffee shops.
Luxury department store. A bit of luxury and great food.Food court is extremely busy at peak hours, wide choice of restaurants across the different floors. Shops very high class.

Nice enterteinment. A good place to spend some hours, mainly if raining. A large shopping center, connected to many other through some alleys. You can find anything you can imagine and it is complemented by a nice dining area

HUGE NICE SHOPPING MALL. One of the best shopping mall I have ever seen in Bangkok having superb quality of ready made dress, again 90% is for ladies only. Also a very very convenient mall as Siam Metro Station is just in walking distance. 4th floor food path is excellent.

Luxury Shopping Paradise!. Not the go to place for everyone but a must try for tourists visiting BKK for the first time. The shopping complex also consists of Sea World, which is sheer brilliance for animal and aquatic life lovers. The food court at Siam Paragon has a lot of options, so you won't be leaving the mall with a empty stomach!

Huge mall. This mall is very updated and has all your shopping needs. From a huge grocery store and restaurants downstairs to all your major brand name shops along multiple floors. Connected to bts skytrain which makes it convenient!
High End Shops. Very convenient to reach as it has direct access to the Siam BTS station. There's a department store, supermarket, cinemas, food court and high end fashion boutiques.
High style. Great variety of goods. Lot of things for everyone. Also some entertainment like Madam Thousands museum and Aquarium

A big and fancy shopping center. This might be one of the biggest and fanciest shopping center in Bangkok. I happen to have a chance to visit this place during my company managerial meeting. I happen to found one big supermarket downstairs with a complete selection of traditional snacks. I believe the price is much more expensive compare to the one that you can find in the traditional market.I spent 2 hours in this place, including coffee. Which is more than enough to spare your time while you're in Bangkok, for a shopping malls.
Great food. This high class shopping is great, also very good restaurants many many choices. Food is great. The shops are nice. Little pricey.

Nice place to go sightseeing . I don't have much time at Bangkok, but I want to visit this big mall anyway. It's a satisfaction mall with on stop shopping concept. There is Kidzania to bring our kids to have fun. Branded outlets to go shopping or just window shopping. Great food hall to try local culinary.

Worth a walk through but not for bargin shopping . This place is pretty amazing to walk through, on really hot day would be good as its air conditioned or a rainy day as its a shopping mall.You won't find bargain clothes here and things alike. It's just like a shopping mall in any other country including the prices really. It's is 8 levels though! Lots of cute decorations and cafe like shops on every level.

Great Shopping Centre- But HIGH END. The shopping centre is exceptional in terms of the artistic design of the shops, the surrounds and good security. Very expensive and often more costly than Australia,

LOVE THIS MALL!. This mall was my favorite mall in Bangkok. Wide variety of stores and restaurants to choose from. Especially loved the amount of restaurant outlets there were inside this mall. Every cusine could be found in this restaurant and there was a good selection of fast food. If you want to eat and shop in Bangkok ... this place is a MUST GO.

A Big Mall with Expensive Brands. This is quite a big mall with many things. But don't come shopping here as it is mostly branded goods and the prices are expensive here. Its a fancy mall though and come here to see the SEA LIFE.
High End Mall - No. 1 in Bangkok. Excellent food court and great for high end shopping. All the luxury brands are available. Superb ambience.

Luxurious mall, great cinema. Luxurious and grand mall, with many upscale shops. We came here mainly for food and the cinema. Many options for food and loved the supermarket at the basement. Cinema was huge, with as many as 16 theatres. Seats were really comfortable and the sound system was superb. Really enjoyable experience.

Aof 9B #CS. I think its the greatest mall in bankkok.Its alot of expensive stuff .Also under of the mall its food court. It is so delicious and I like to go there but its a little bit expensive.So i regonize lf you can choose another like local shop its way better bacause its cheaper and some of them are more delicious #CS

The Best Mall in Bangkok. All the big brands are here along with the madame tussauds and the sea world. If you are a fan of big brands, you will get all of them here. The mall is huge and there is no reason to dislike it. I was traveling on the Comicon day so it was even more interesting for me!

Nice shopping mall. The price is standart. They have a lot of shops, mostly pretty expensive. Madame Tussauds and SeaLife located here. It is always crowded. Have their own BTS station so it is easy to reach.
Huge mall. Lovely mall in the heart of city ... has many attractions like water world, madam tusads etc ... plan a full day for visiting this mall.

Big & lux Department store. Big n luxury + lots of brand name shlops. Have underwater WORLD
for children at basement. restaurants on many floor but a lot at ground floor. It is opposite Siam square at night selling cloths n shoes n etc along the street. Can bargain.
Good mall, well connected. Shopping, restaurants and cinaplex. Wonderful experience. The food court always crowded. Best to walk it or take the metro. Taxi was always a problem.

Another amazing mall. Very impressive, a large variety of upper scale shops and some amazing little boutiques. It is worth just going to have a look and get out of the heat for a couple of hours . There is a very impressive aquarium downstairs and a wonderful food court upstairs. The array of food was mouthwatering and it was hard to decide what to try it all looks and smelt so good. It was not expensive and you had to purchase coupons. It is near the BTS so getting there and back wasn't a problem for us and kept us out of the famous Bangkok traffic jams
Good shopping mall. Nice place to shop and eat and next to it is next Siam Centre where all the local designers located there.

Awsome place for Shopping. This was my first time to Bangkok. As usal its a great place for shopping. Sepecially Siam Paragon. Its a must place to see if you have ever visit to Bangkok. Almost everything you can get under one roof. Highly recommend
Shopping . A very huge shopping mall in heart of Bangkok provides various levels of shopping brand and non brands the main attraction is the food court
Very fancy. If you want to shop here I hope you have a lot of money! Every designer shop you can think and also bowling, cinema and the sea life centre in the basement

Big, glitzy and packed with everything. This is a glitzy nice mall. Everything is just big and spacious. And you can find everything from luxury items to local food here.
Security staff are very professional and serious, which is a plus point.

Shopping, Aqua World and more. There have been new addition to central and emporium, but Siam paragon has its own charm. Always crowded and buzzed, the mall has visitors for the food court, as much as for the branded stores above. Was nice to take my niece to the aqua world, a little distraction from shopping and a walk to burn the calories earned eating :)
Awesome mall. Lovely mall, big food court with a lot of variety. If you've got time be sure to check out the aquarium downstairs! There's something for everyone :)

Impressive!!. Very impressive! The biggest food court i have ever seen. The shops were all upper scale but worth going for window shopping because the windows are beautifully decorated (kind of the motherload of flagship stores).

Food court of Paragon. I've been in Thailand last summer, on last day I went to the very grateful shopping mall. It is Paragon, there are a lot of shop inside there. I really like the food court inc there because it have a lot of food that ypu can choose such as Thai food, Indian food, and ect. The price is ok, not too expensive. You need to change to coupon first before you buy. It's easy to go because it's near BTS. The food court is on 1st floor. If you go to Paragon, I recommend you to try food at there.*kt

Kidzania, bowling, movies and about 100 different restaurant options. Great place to take the kids. Aquarium, Kidzania, movies, bowling and the cinema. Even Comic Con was on when we visited!A great place to steel away from the midday heat. It is also a nice place to try out "street food" in an indoor atmosphere.In addtion to having Uniqlo and H&M they also have high end dining and shopping.If you get bored of the (loads of) stores in the Paragon there are two other malls a courtyard or ped-way away.The Paragon also have a grocery store so you can load up with snacks before you return to the hotel.
High end shopping. The mall houses almost all luxurious international brand. There are plenty of good restaurants to choose from. Don't forget to bring your credit cards.
Good. Visit Only If You have good budget to buy anything , Too expensive ,Similar to central world.Nothing special

Great place. Finally a Shopping mall that has real shops and no rip off articles. The Platinum fashion mall was fine it you want to buy cheap cheap stuff and nothing wrong with that especially the shoes. However it was a breath of fresh air or should i say GOOD air conditioning and no rip of clothing etc that bought us to this place. Highly recommend this shopping mall and was Clean as well. We still managed to buy clothing like nike, Adidas at a fraction of the price we would pay at home. Managed to but a couple pair shoes here at very reasonable prices. Also found the perfume at a reasonable price as well, actually better that Duty Free .

Amazing range of food!. I really like this shopping centre. The food court is AMAZING! We usually go to MK Gold for lunch or dinner for hot pot. The ingredients are very fresh and the stock really tasty. There is a wide variety of brands in the Department store to browse and shop.
Ultra modern shopping complex. Worth a visit just to look. Definately not a bargain basement. Here you can buy the most luxurious goods from around the world including a Rolls-Royce
Love the place. Been coming here for a couple of years great shopping and great food, many different varieties and make sure to visit the supermarket and check out their fresh juices

Just another 'posh' mall in Asia. It's a posh mall with posh restaurants and posh shops. Nothing to shout about, just another mall, where you end up paying more than you should.There are much better places to be than this place.

Got a rose after finished shopping. Was the last day and had to hurry before leaving. We decided to go Siam Paragon for short time but it ended up with spending all the day inside, and we were pleased by the luxurious goods from the M level to the 3 level. What ever you can imagine, will be available there. Perfumes, Cosmetics, bags, jewelleries, watches, underwears, menwear, and home appliances are all available at different prices. All famous brands have stores and showing goods. Sure, we enjoyed the day shopping and paid thousands of baht without hesitation. Shoes and watches are so expensive. Finally, I took a voucher equivalent to 400 baht SO I bought 2 extra lipstick :))) At the exist door, I got a rose from the man there. A simple nice touch. Don't forget to eat Italian pizza in the food court and go to the toilet in the M floor. Note: take a bag with wheel to carry your purchased stuff as you will spend many hours and might feel tired at the end. Take the BTS, Siam station. If a tourist, Go to the vat refund in the upper level and have a seat, relax & serve your self with mix coffee!! I can say, it is one of the best mall I have ever visited.

Center of Bangkok !!!. If you visit and stay at Bangkok, this glamorous and spacious department store that you must to visit it. Siam Paragon , big shopping store and has many flagship brandname store such as Louis Vuitton, Chane , Hermes ,Prada and plenty of brandname shop. It has many famous dining place and dessert bakery shop. If you stay at Bangkok you must to go it!!!! You can reach by BTS skytrain at Siam interchange station that the biggest and most traffic sky train station too .

Shop, eat, shop, eat.... Siam paragon was a day well spent with family.My six year old daughter had awesome fun. Running around and picking her toys and clothes.We had tea at Harrods and had a late Indian lunch in the food court.Loads of shop for everyone. From luxury shopping to Street side take away. Shop till you drop..

The Top Shopping Mall in Bangkok. This must be the most high end shopping complex in Bangkok with all the top names, Chanel, Fendi, Cartier etc etc including special local makes.The fashion area is on the first floor with other retailers on floors above.On the ground floor are a great choice of restaurants and cafes, Bank and ATMs plus a fairly large super market with excellent local produce and delicacies which could make perfect little gifts to friends back home.You could visit the Mall by taxi obviously, but also by the BTS Skytrain and get off at Siam station.If you enjoy utilising your "plastic" or just window shopping then this is the place.A taxi rank is just outside to take you back to your hotel.

You have to see this mall. We spend a lot of time at Siam Paragon and loved this shopping center. It has an enormous food court with loads of variety, various levels with all the branded stores you can imagine. The center is spacious, well designed and offers something for everyone. Although the mall is busy, it never feels crowded.
Another good mall in heart of the city.. A huge mall with lots of young chaps of Thailand. You can see the fashion of Bangkok here and enjoy some time while shopping and food.

Location for food. Siam Paragon is high end for shopping but for first timers will be good to drop by if you are in the vicinity just for the experience. For foodies, the basement of Siam Paragon is indeed a foodie haven. The selections are just mind boggling and one will definitely be spoilt for choice.

WoW . A great shopping & dining experience in the heart of Bangkok. I had a great time here watching live music, shopping, & eating amazing thai food in the downstairs food court. Definitely worth a visit.

Expensive . Lots of market type stalls around this area the heart of bkk
The plaza expensive up market
Great area for shops and markets plus food lots to see

If you feel the need to shop. This mall is huge. Seems to have pretty much everything. But felt like if I wanted any of these products I could just buy them at home. The prices are pretty much the same as they would be in NY and pretty much the same stores. If you need to kill time and it's raining outside I guess you could spend a whole day there and still not see everything. I personally didn't go to Thailand to shop in a mall.

Expensive top end stores. Worth a visit but be prepared for the prices!!!! Goods can be cheaper in the UK !! Lovely food hall on the lower level, very light and airy classy shopping centre, very popular with the more wealthy locals
Shopping!. Good place for fancy shopping and fancy dining. But in Bangkok, this would not be the place for bargaining, oh how i wish!

Outstanding shopping mail. We travel to Bangkok almost each year and we always shop at Siam Paragon. Compared to European shopping malls you have much more choice. We also like to have lunch and Dinner at their food court. Also the variety and quality here is excellent.

Very dissapointing... From outside looks like milliono dollars but inside same old shops and a bit lifeless.. did not find one decent coffee shop apoart from the usual chains..was expecting more from this place..

Shop around. So many stores, restaurants and plenty of air conditioning. You can find any name brand store you can think of here including high end shopping. There are numerous dining options including restaurants and fast food from around the world. This is an easy stop on the BTS Skytrain and there is a fountain in case you want to just have a peaceful minute. Bags are checked by security at all entrances.
nice shopping mall!. One of the largest shopping malls in Bangkok! It's nice to jump in to cool off on a hot, humid day. We found a delicious ice cream place on one of the floors.

Great . The best mall in the world ... Every one is soo nice and we are treated with care.All the main brands are in there.Close to my favorite hotel, kempinski , it offers you the best services you can expect from luxury.In a rainy day a good place to chill

Come here for the foodcourt!. One of the best foodcourts in Bangkok! An amazing selection of places to dine plus a foods market for those in search of gourmet ingredients. We also went to the underwater world which was nice. In terms of shopping it doesnt really offer that much - it is so large and spacious you really have to have an idea of what you are shopping for or you get lost in the vast mall just passing most shops. More high end shops than your usual.

Fantastic mall..in Siam Bangkok. On my return after visiting Jim Thompson house i walked up to Siam Paragon Mall which is an immensely popular shopping mall in Bangkok housing a host of international high-end fashion brands shops , Southeast Asia’s largest aquarium, a 16-screen Cineplex, and a comprehensive selection of world cuisine and food court. Located prominently in front of Siam BTS Skytrain station - the interchange of the two BTS lines - it is considered by many to be the centre of Bangkok .The location is always a busy spot for travellers and locals as it's has good transportation connectivity on road and BTS train.The mall is compact in its size and layout and it provides mainly luxury items and cosmetic and high end branded products selling shops and retail outlets for well-heeled Thais and international visitors with cash to splurge. If you are looking for something extra-special then Siam Paragon is definitely the place to find it. I jus went inside the mall and walked around the shops and outlets and made my way out after having some refreshments in the mall..It's definitely not a place for budget travellers....

Tip of the Iceberg for Shopping. First of all, it's a mall full of Brand store. If you are looking to spend your money toBuy original/genuine product without any hesitation... This is the place. Like other malls, good food option and Connects with BTS skytrain.

Blown away. The most luxurious shopping centre I've ever been to. One level almost dedicated to luxury cars, Rolls Royce, McClaren etc. Whilst the rest of the shopping mall is so large, you could walk around for hours in the air conditioning to escape the Bangkok heat.I spent the bulk of my time in the bookstore 'Kinokuniya' which from memory was on the 3rd floor. A great range of titles were on offer but prices to match the luxury of the centre.No wifi available was a bit of a let down after spending some time in Terminal 21 which does offer this service free.

Retail therapy. This is a decent sized mall. It is very close to the Central Plaza mall and there is actually a SkyWalk that connects the two malls so that you can walk in the shade. A large food court and all the expensive brands are present here. There is also the Ocean World aquarium situated here.
Roam around. Generally malls closed at 9 to 10 pm. Doesnt suits the night life. At least they should be open upto midnight. Else its good place. Good food joints good shopping ideal place.

Sheer Amazing !!. Amongst the Best mall in Asia, Siam Paragon surpasses expectations !!With presence of all Brands, the shopping experience is very Good. The Food Passage on 4th Floor offers you amazing variety of Food Cuisine which is Truly value for money !!A must visit to your Bangkok trip !!

AWESOME MALL!. This mall was really pretty impressive! The food level at the basement was quite something on its own. A wide variety of stalls from many different cuisines were available. We had lunch at Taling Phling which was great! We also went around trying out foods from the different smaller vendors.The gourmet market was huge - wide range of fresh fruits and produce. They even had a big salad bar for days you feel like having a 'healthier meal' or when you need a break from all the Thai food =PWe prob spent a whole afternoon here exploring the mall and also hiding from the Bangkok heat. ha.two thumbs up!
Awesome and expensive . Everything is available at a considerable cost. Many branded stores are available and easily reachable through MRT and BTS.

Beautiful mall with upscale stores . We went to watch a 4D imax movie. The mall was gorgeous and full of expensive stores and dealerships. This is the place to go for luxury handbags, cars, food, etc. A rich persons dream....but not for us. We had a fun time at the movie theatres. A 4D movie for two people with 2 regular sized popcorn and drinks were about $50 CAD. Not bad...we just went for the experience. They had 3 flavours: sea salt, cheese, and matcha (like caramel popcorn with matcha). I've never tried 4D so it was fun with all the extras.
WoW!! WoW!!!. This is the hub of the branded shop! Here you can find most popular brands of the World! The mall is not so big but the shops will blow your mind!

Great Shopping Center. This is more than a shopping center. It has an aquarium in the basement.Local food center at the ground floor with other fancier restaurants. The grocery shopping is also on the same level.Above that are all the branded goods shop. Once in awhile they will runway sales, where the shop puts their older season stuff on sale, then it becomes very cheap.On the 4th level there is gourmet food alley. The top floor are the cinemas with imax.This place is directly attached to the mass transit sky train. The stop is Siam.on the opposite side is Siam square, very local environment. So you can spend a whole day here. Lots to see and eat.

to try. The food court on the ground floor of the Siam Paragon Shopping Centre is huge. There's kiosks that operates under the "Food Court" banner where you'll need to add credit to a card to be able to purchase food from these vendors (N.B. Ensure you get your refund of any credit remaining on the card on the same day as the card is only valid it midnight of the day of purchase). Then there's independent stalls restaurants which accept cash/ credit card payments, and there's some fast food outlets ( KFC) and restaurants too. And to top it off, there's also a big supermarket too Cheap and large variety of local dishes.

Cheap eating place with air-con. People might think Siam Paragon would be an expensive place to shop and eat. Despite luxury brands located in the building, the foodcourt at the basement has wide varieties of food, ranging from international to local. Price is cheap. Other than food courts, there are many restaurants at the basement to choose. A great eating place, especially for family with toddlers.

Shopping Paradise. There is anything you want at Paragon - it is an up-scale shopping mall on the order of Mall of America (not as big). Excellent movie theater and many interesting restaurants-I like the food court and an adjacent food area which is like upscale street markets from around the world. Fun to visit!

Glamorous. I don't like shopping so much, but for people who like to spend (a lot) of money, I would definitely recommend going there. The mall is very big with a vast array of shops and restaurants. Great location too

One Stop Shopping in the Heart of Bangkok. It is like a must-go place to shop as there are millions of things you could possibly do, starting from a very high-end fashion to a day-to-day life style. Big restaurants from all over the world to food court are what can be found and enjoy eating. They have got a sea aquarium for you and your child to have fun with as well as Kidzania.A big long shopping day for you and your family are waiting!!
Great shops . Loads of high quality shops here and lot's of restaurants to choose from. Nice to escape the heat in their fabulous aircon.

Good visit . Easily accessible. Location was perfect for tourist and very accessible to public transport and walking tourist.Host a wide variety and selection of shop from electronics to clothes and food. A must visit place !
Space age. Again as a Sydneysider this place rocks much more modern than we have in Australia,great shopping,beautiful people great place to spend some leisure time

Quite the shopping mall!. It's the Wandering Yank here. Mrs. Yank and I have visited Bangkok a couple of times, always staying in the Pathumwan Princess (see my forthcoming review) next to MBK Center, so it was only maybe a 10-minute walk through Siam Discovery and Siam Center to reach Siam Paragon.It's 7 stories of pure shopping and eating pleasure. I'm not really much for malls, but I'm very impressed by the layout and presentation of the place. America has a lot to learn about building interesting shopping malls. High-end shops at one side of the ground floor (Cartier, Louis Vuitton, etc.), a multi-story department store (if you like watches, check out their ground floor watch department - massive!), high-end automobiles upstairs, a big electronics section in the department store, a section for high-quality Thai-made handicrafts, quite a few restaurants in the basement and upstairs - it just goes on and on. I've visited several times and I know I haven't seen it all. I skipped the top floor entirely, which I believe has movie theaters and other entertainment options.2 thumbs up!

Upscale shopping centre. If expensive designer chic is what you are after, you can find it in Paragon. Clean, not too crowded, cool, and well ventilated (unlike MBK). Some very nice restaurants, great department stores, and helpful staff. Kinokuniya Books has a large branch here which is, as you'd expect, well stocked and endlessly entertaining. Food court and neighboring stalls downstairs can get crowded but is good for specialty bakery things or Thai treats.
Nice upscale Mall. Lots of premium brands, nice place to hang out, Retail shopping, Food hunting and cool place to be, Nearer to Siam Centre another mall.
Good. Luxurious Mall with Branded Item. The design of whole building is really beautifull. There is dancing water infront of it. It's near BTS.
Luxurious Mall. Nice mall and shopping complex. Nice dining options. Most importantly, there is a big aquarium at the basement.
Fun shopping and food. A lot of food varieties to choose from.. Just right on the bts station. Good shopping area. Fun with kids
Cheaper in other Asian countries . When price is converted it's better to shop in SINGAPORE or Malaysia or even in Australia. I've seen better.
Modern. Beautiful mall! Very stylish and busy. Great selection of high end clothing. Right off the Sky train it was easy to find.

Absolutely MASSIVE!!!. I don't know how to describe this place other than it's huge... I think it would be possible to spend several days here - we were there for a full day and didn't even get to the clothes shops.Food area has every type of food you can think of.Grocery shop in the basement has an amazing display and very friendly staff.Very confusing navigating the centre.

You have to see it. From a floor of cars (BMW, Bentley and even a McLaren) to the best supermarket I have ever seen to every high end fashion outlet imaginable. You have to see this place to believe the extravagance. I strongly suggest eating dinner in the supermarket. There is a place called You Hunt We Cook. Simply choose your meat from the butcher and they will cook it for 100baht and you get a sauce and side of about 120baht. The best steak I have ever had. Cooked and seasoned perfectly.

high end mall. This is one the high end malls of Bangkok with every possible brand having a store there. There are lots of stores housed on each floor. It’s definitely very expensive coz of the posh brands, so we didn’t spend too much time looking around. We just visited the few stored we wanted to look at and left. There are however, a few nice looking eating joints around, but we didn’t visit any.
Modern shopping mall with nice restaurants. We go often to enjoy shops and foods. It has many different kind of restaurants and nice supermarket.

Huge Shopping Mall. Huge with wide range of international brands like any other big city mall.Located just couple of block from Grand Hyatt Erawan, good choice to shop.The highlight was the food court on ground floor. Huge selection of Thai street food and other cuisines. Fair price good taste. Avoid the peak lunch time 12 to 1.30pm as you will have to literally hunt for seat. Great desserts choices, so if you had sweet tooth this place is a paradise.I also love their stationery floor at 2nd floor. Lots lots to choose I can spend whole day there. The prices were good too. Lower than what they charge in Gramedia.

The most popular shopping mall in Thailand. You can find everything at Siam Paragon.Seriously! All brand name are here.They always renovate especially the restroom with the high and quality and expensive material that make it superb.It is a must for tourist! I love Gourmet,you can stay there for an hour if you are food lover and also good for tourist to find all Thai food you need.For Thai people,a bit hard to get a car park but if you have many credit card,your car park is reserved.Their cinima is one of the best in Thailand.Many types and differnt price depend on your preference.

Pure luxury. Ok, there is a nice foodcourt, supermarket, H& M and ZARA shop, but to be honoust, most shops are only for happy few. AND there is a real THAI Jim Thompson shop, expensive but real good quality silk. Beautiful scarves.

Good for shopping and eating. This should be the most crowded mall in Bangkok with a lot of brands. However I like the food court in the lobby here most with hundreds of dishes from Thai and Asian to European.

Siam P. A very nice mall. Its very accessible from Siam square and BTS. Lots of shops and a bit posh. If you like to shop for Hermes, LV and that kind of stuff then this is were you want to go. Especialty boutiques are here.

Shopping . Here's everything you probably (not) need in your life. Every brand you can think of is represented. Real fresh and nice shopping mall. Good cafes and restaurants inside. Clean and proper. It's direct opposite to MBK. You can even bye cars on the 3rd floor.

Shop shop shop or just look look look. Endless floors of shopping, luxury and eateries. From the cheap to rolls Royces on display, this has it all. Spend and hour or get side tracked for the whole day. A great way to stay out of the hot humid weather and site see or eat or of course shop

For shopping lovers. This is a huge shopping mall with fancy stores (Gucci, Ferragamo, Prada...). I wasn't particularly interested in this type of shopping, so did not spend a lot of time there. It is worth to check it out though.
Nice but expensive shopping mall. the prices are the same as in europe, so no bargains to me made. The choice is big and everybody can find something.

"Upscale Mall". Big and beautiful, great location – connected to the BTS station. The stores are all famous and luxury brands with many good restaurants, I think this is the one of the best shopping malls in Bangkok. You can end up spending a full day here.

Nice, but pricy mall. The mall has a fascinating architecture and it feels very relaxing to spend time in there. Besides stores there are also little restaurants. If you are, however, expecting, to buy nice clothes at low prices, this is not a good place to go. There are definitely premium labels, but I i got the impression that prices are even higher than in many European cities.

Amazing mall to spend all day!. My hotel concierge recommended this mall and I ended up spending the whole day. There is something for everyone and anything at all price ranges. High end shopping from luxury brands, food courts, movie theaters, auto brands represented, beauty shops and an aquarium for kids and tourists.I was looking for Thai and Asian designers and the men's department had a nice selection at reasonable prices. One of the plusses is they have an amazing food court in the basement to get lunch or refreshments. At one point in the day I even got a Men's facial in one area of the mall where they have health spas and other range of health and beauty departments. Was happy I went there and also to Siam Center across the street!!

Siam Paragon for Bangladeshi. For all Bangladeshi Point to be noted:1. Very expensive but very latest and upcoming products world famous all shops 2. Nice food court variety of foods price is average3. siam ocean world must go with your child average per person 800 bath4. Take thousand of picture for better memories.5. Outside of Siam Paragon After 6 p.m there is a street market must visit.

Good if that is what you are into. This is an absolutely massive mall featuring all the upscale european name brands that you can find in every other airport and mall in asia. Never the less, if this is the kind of shopping you like, The Siam Paragon is heaven. It seemed a bit less crowded than the other malls (maybe because of its size) and seemed to have a good food court

Good for shopping. It was near our hotel. Its a good place to shop. It has all the top brands. And you must go to the cinema on the 5th floor. It has a 4th cinema and watching batman vs superman in that kind of screen and effects is sooooo much fun and exciting.Must try it

A must do activity. Siam Paragon is amazing, the best mall I have been to. Often I go there just to relax, get some food! Everything needed is available here, there is a great choice of cafés and restaurants and probably the best cinemas/multiplex in S. E. Asia.
Amazing. A little higher in terms of shops and brand showrooms, Siam is more famous for the Ocean World & Wax Museum.

One of the biggest luxurious mall. Siam Paragon is one of the biggest luxurious shopping centres in Asia,The building includes a wide range of stores, restaurants , food court,supermarket, a multiplex movie theatre and the Siam Ocean World aquarium.

Beautiful Mall. Nice and modern mall with three buildings,department store,luxury designer shops one whole level for food and restaurants. Easy by access by sky train. Has electrical stores with everything you can think of.

Nice mall. Siam Paragon is excellent very large shopping mall. I hate malls in USA but in Asia malls are great and good way to get out of midday heat. Food court has good food and unhealthy fast food options. Overall great shopping experience.
Very nice mall. Siam Paragon is maybe the mall I enjoyed the most in Bangkok. It is nothing special but stands out by quality for a fair price. Definitely worth a visit.

Amazing. Good mall.. Spread over 3 buildings...
Has ocean world and mdm taussaud..
Bought coupe of stuff from the electronics department(be trends)..
100% advisable to go there..

Cinema. Mall is right at the station Central / Siam. If you ride the sky train then it is easy to find this mall. Food center is huge and always crowded, not suitable if you want a classy meal and formal atmosphere. Bookstore here is great and complete, there is a great cinema with a film-film is also present.

Impressive luxury mall. Siam paragon is an impressive luxury mall in central bangkok. Super luxe and haute couture French iconic brands including LV Hermes Cartier Balenciaga CHANEL Dior and others. Fantastic shopping.

Beautiful mall. This mall is quite beautiful. There are car dealerships within the mall. The prices f clothing are rather ridiculous. Siam Paragon is worth the visit but not to buy anything. The 4D movie theatre was nice.

Typical mall. Typical big city mall which isn't necessarily a bad thing especially not in a city like Bangkok. Huge variety, ability to pay using credit instead of just cash and the comfort of knowing you are not being scammed into over paying. Also, if you're not in the mood for shopping you should check out the aquarium on the bottom floor.

good location. siam paragon is a big and good mall , which is located exactly next to the siam station of monorail ,so you can get access to that very easily.
there are many brands you can shop there , also you can find exchange inside the mall
,
Huge but boring. This is just another shopping centre same as home great escape from the heat did kill a few hours browsing

Great one!. We enjoyed it a lot, mainly for food, sea world visit and Madame Tussudes wax museum at paragon discovery mall, amazing one
You can spend a full day there

Ridiculously expensive . We didn't realize this was a "designer" mall so spent a couple of hours here but couldn't afford to buy anything! only good for those wanting genuine designer items at designer prices, not for the average tourist.
Big Store. Every weekend I will go to Siam Paragon because very good of atmosphere very cold has many restaurant are there and a lot of shop

The best and most luxurious of all the malls in Bangkok. If you've got money to burn, this is where you want to be. All the finest and most luxurious brands are here. You want to spend 45K on a watch? Come to Patek Phillipe store. The food court here is also very gourmet versus other typical mall food courts. Keep in mind, you'll pay for the quality, but it's worth it. Best place to buy high quality food and snacks to bring home to friends and family. Come here to blow some cash, people watch, window shop, and eat some great food.
Siam ocean world. Great place to visit in Bangkok,wonderful theme with beautiful creatures. Don't forget to visit Madame Tussaud's wax museum with it.

Unbelievable. An amazing place with a huge selection of shops , international luxury brands, Asian brands and specific Thai brands. Big, big, big!Donot miss the impressive food halls in the base levels
Very good. There are lots of gadget stores and electrical stores, a massive food hall with lots of know and Thai restorants and a very nice Lamborghini shopHope you enjoy
Luxury shopping. Huge and very beautiful shopping place, however all is very expansive (top brands like Dior, Burberry, etc.).

Elegant and spacious shopping place. As a tourist, you can find almost every local cooking ingredients at its paradise supermarket, good quality and good packaging, easy for self use or give out as a souvenir. Siam paragon next to it has many local designers outfit. Must go place in Bangkok

What a place this is!!. Weather was rubbish one day during our stay in Bangkok so we visited this shopping centre. It has everything you could ever wish for! If you like shopping then this is the place to go. Whether you want to buy a sandwich or a Lamborghini it has everything.The food court is nothing like ive seen before. There is also cinema, gym and many other activities to do.

Opulent luxury mall. Home to international designer brands, this mall is definitely the place to be for those who are into luxury goods. That said, the food court also provides a huge variety of cuisine ranging from Thai to Japanese and Western. The famous After You cafe (their toast is delish!) is situated on the ground floor of the mall, next to the food court.
Just like another high-end mall. Nothing special. Just like other high-end malls in Singapore and Jakarta. It's big and sell branded items.
Massive mall. Huge mall with nice boutique shops, all sorts of brands are available, lots of street shops outside the mall.

Everything you could imagine in one place.. This place is huge with floors and floors of shops, food, entertainment, and more. Plus it is nicely air conditioned. If you need something, this is a place to find it. And it is nicely located off of public transportation.

Very big useful shopping center. We stayed at the Lit Bangkok, about 10 minute walk to Siam Paragon. I was really impressed with the place, it's like 5-6 floors, the basement level is a food court.I was really surprised by the amount of places to eat, at least 50 restaurants, many different cuisines. My wife and I mainly ate there during our one week stay in Bangkok, some of the restaurants was really worth the money cost us about £15-£20 for two (consisting of side, two mains, two drinks). The have banks there too so you can exchange currency etc.Overall if you're in the area give this place a visit.

Spotless high-end mall with great food court. Great place to cool off and have lunch. This is a high-end mall with shops like Cartier and car dealers like Maserati. On the basement level you can find an aquarium to visit if you are traveling with young children. The lower level has a huge variety of dining varying from quick pick-up meals and coffee to fine dining, and is a great place to take a midday break away from the heat. Paragon also has a great food store to pick up souvenir treats to bring home from your travels. This mall also connects to other shopping centers like Siam Square and MBK through tunnels and walking bridges and is great if you end up with a rainy day.

Very big place to find good and quality international food at Bangkok. So many variety food to choose, serve by international food chain. Good place to spend spare time to taste international food at the one food court. commanded to fellow traveller to taste a good food.

Great Shopping and Dining. Siam Paragon is huge department store, there are many many shop there. I would recommend for the dessert there, especially CAKE! When i'm think to buy a nice cake I will go there for it. On the Ground Floor, in front of Gourmet Market, there small cake shop there. Check it out you may like it!
Amazing shopping experience. A really great place to shop and look around. The 4D movie experience is awesome! Movie watching will nver be the same! Loved all of it!

Good to be Around. Nice to be around for shopping esp. if you are looking after branded and genuine products,at the same time it's very expensive but it's worthy too. Recommended to those who's brand conscious and fun to be around even for window shopping.

Great for almost everything . Many brands, great cinema, also has a lot of fun thing for kids. Convenient location, just right at the door of BTS Siam. The mall is big that takes days to see it all :))
Good Hangout place for visitors. This is a very good hangout place for visitors if you are a foodie, shopaholic or even want to be a trend setter...
Upscale mall with everything. Very nice mall with everything you need, food entertainment, & shopping. Conveniently located near the sky train stop. A great place to kill time during rainstorms.

Awesome. Siam Paragon is one of our favourite mall with many choices of cheap to fine dining options. Cinema on the 7th floor which we always plan a movie when we visit Bangkok.
We love this mall as we love the choice of food in the basement. Thus is a must for my group to spend at least a day here.
So much to do. Perfect rainy day venue for families. Amazing food court, kidzania, iMax theatre and aquarium - perfect to keep kids (and adults) occupied all day!

Expensive . Really expensive but the aircon is great. Nearly impossible to get a seat at any of the coffee shops as they are all occupied by students that seem to be doing most of their studies there.

Rich. Cusomer mix: HiSo and middle classThais, other Asians, and Farangs - and some poor who wander around star-eyed (and of course those poor who serve), I confess I wander around in the cool, escaping the hot outside, and end up on the floor with the restaurants...I like Scoozi with itl home made Italian sausage wiih pasta and a carafe of wine (not expensive).....Near Power Mall, a good place to find computer stuff., Might go there tomorrow and have something red.

Food and Fancy. See the 1% shopping experience at this lovely mall. Rolls Royce, Bentley, and other high end cars on display. As others have mentioned, the food court is phenomenal with tons of options for little bites or full meals. Even if you don't buy anything you'll find plenty to do: bowling, movies, kid art projects, light plastic surgery...If you arrive right around 10 a.m. opening be prepared for a crush of people.
Hugh Mall with Attraction. a Very very Big Mall with Lot of Attraction for foodies. Contains lot of variety of Cusines - Indian , Japenese , Korean.
Premium mall in town. Lots of international fashion and food brands. There are many other malls nearby which for those looking for more affordable shopping

Designer shopping Paradise. Whilst you get the duty paid back at the airport, be prepared to pay considerably more than you would if you were buying back in the UK.I like to shop in these places, but what cost me £65 in the uk on line would have cost me £300 plus in GA and jeans in Boss over £200 when in the Uk £120.Lovely though. Fantastic shopping and not all these names. I would definitely revisit and so too would the family.Great security and extensive, just watch the cost of imported items...

Best Food Court. The shopping mall itself has a lot of great stores - but with most items at the same price as everywhere else in the world. It's worth a look around, but would advise that you buy elsewhere (MBK shopping complex is much more affordable) unless you're after the high-end ticket items. The food court was my favourite part of Siam Paragon, everything you can imagine is located on the lower floor. My husband and I would often catch the BTS from where we were staying each morning, to have breakfast at one of the stalls in the food court and it was always well worth the trip, and price!

Great shopping . Enjoyed shopping here with many designer stores. Spend a lot of time also shopping in Zara and H&M with a VAT refund offered to tourist.This was claimed back at the airport on departure. Must have a look at the food court on the lower floor lots of amazing food.

Everything you can imahine. This shopping centre truly has it all, Aquariums, amazing food courts, literally every shop you can imagine is here. You can easily lose a day just walking around here. It's a bit pricier than others but a much nicer experience

Beautiful Mall. Siam Paragon is my favorite mall in Bangkok. It's got the right blend of brand names. Lots of coffee shops to relax from the hard work of shopping. If you like Starbucks, go to the one on the 2nd or the 3rd floor, they are less crowded. If you want royalty coffee and cakes, go to Harrods's Café, or even better go to the "Oriental Café".

High End shopping. We went to Paragon after trying Central World which we didn't enjoy due to loud pumping music. Paragon was a much better shopping experience- no loud pumping music and no market-type shops. This is the place for Designer brand shopping.

Just like Westfield . It is like being in Westfields back home prices are very expensive no difference than in the UK, all designer shops are here, you can spend lots and lots of money worth a quick look but would advise to buy elsewhere
Just excellent. Luxury mall! You can find everything there! It is really HUGE!! We visitted not only for shopping, but also for dinning!

Big brands are here. All the big brands you are looking for is here. Shop until you drop.The mall is clean and staffs very profesdional.Food court place have good design and well organized. The foods, to me, didn't meet my expectation. Hope that they will meet yours.

Most amazing foodie floor!!!. This is THE mall of Bangkok. It is everything from Rodeo Drive /5th Ave to every day department store. The first floor is Foodie Heaven. Many food restaurants and vendors plus a huge grocery store. The world is your oyster. The department store is confusing but amazing. Men's floor for example. It's many different shops all Laid out like a regular department store. I needed golf pants. Walked through that area until I found the designer and pair I liked. Then you but from a central cashier. Added vines was the sales lady actually hemmed them by hand in 30 min while I did other shopping!!! This mall is connected to Siam Center and Siam Discovery. If you want local designers and unique finds choose these malls. All are connected to the sky train as its main hub.
A one stop center for families with children. Good place for families as it has plenty of shopping, food and children activities to satisfy everyone's need.
Nice place. Nice place to go to and shop. Alittle dark but overall nice experience. At the heart of the city area. A must go place. Recommended

Best place for international desserts. Siam paragon is a high end shopping mall which houses international brands from all over the world. If you have kids and would like to bring them to ocean world, it is at the basement of the mall. We love the mall because it has many types of desserts and its a never ending choice.

great. Siam Paragon is a shopping mall in Bangkok. The mall ranges from multiplex stores and restaurants to multiplex movie theatre. The main attractions of this place was firstly “Sea Ocean Water Aquarium” which is the largest aquarium in South Asia, I have not seen such a large & beautiful aquarium in my life. It was so eye charming & mesmerizing that I was feeling that I am also one of the part of that aquarium. The second attraction was “Thai Art Gallery” which contains the best paintings from different parts of Thailand. And yes The Fuji Thailand Restaurant serves the best Thai I have ever eaten& it has made Thai cuisine as my favorite cuisine.

Must Visit for All Visitors. Firstly all visitors using BTS as their mode of transportation to see Bangkok can not avoid the junction of BTS at Siam Square and Siam Paragon is next to it. Therefore visiting the place few times while they are in town is not unusual. The landmark frontage and the outdoor court became the most frequent photographed sight. The crowded Food Court became a place to try, at least once. The Siam Paragon Complex constantly held events to attract locals as well as tourists. All-in-all the place is always exciting and worth a visit and spend at least an hour in there.

Great mall. There's a nice show/ride for kids where they can feature sharks and different kinds of fish all 3D ! Great experience for the younger ones. The mall is nice with many eateries and lots of outlets for shoppers!

Lovely shopping centre . Lovely shopping centre where you can find stuff like h&m, pull and bear, American Eagle outfitter but also all the designer stuff.Lots of food places, coffee shops, ice cream parlour, frozen yoghurt etcGreat place for a shopping fanatics!

Salad Bar-Fresh&Clean. What I can tell you here is very very fresh, good quality and very clean indeed! The salad bar provides me such a very healthy fruits&vegetables, low fat dressing and tasteful. As such, I do like keeping myself healthy and in shape by buying the salad bar at Gourment Market, Siam Paragon.
Nice mall. Located near to Central World. This mall are well manage and completely comfortable for family visit.
Nice View Mall. The mall is big and nice. Especially the front of it. There was fountains. Nice building view. And a lots of people. You could buy international brand perfume and cosmetic in there.

Great High End Shopping Centre. . This shopping centre has it all and is absolutely huge. There is a Sea Life centre which is worth a visit, biggest in Asia apparently and some high end supercar brands including Lamborghini and McLaren, the cars are displayed in shop fronts, pretty surreal! If you like designer brands, pretty much all the big names are represented here, Louis Vuitton, Prada, Jimmy Choo etc. Siam Paragon also has an excellent food court with plenty of options. We visited Happy Beef which has delicious soup based noodles, the pad Thai here is also worth trying! There is also a place for melon ice cream (it's orange) for dessert which is delicious. Recommended! There is also a very nice supermarket next to the food court with lots of Japanese grocery items, we stocked up on our favourite Japanese items here to take back home, prices are reasonable. This place pretty much kept us busy for whole the evening! Definitely worth a visit even for a wander.

Best relaxed shopping. While it may not be the market experience, those can be tiring day after day. This is more relaxed and offers a range of food as well as shopping. There are still bargains to be found and great coffee / snacks for you when you start to tire.
A place for high end shopping and photo shoot. During your city tour you can roam around one to two hours in this high end shopping mall and it’s a nice place to capture few clicks.

Soak in the luxurious ambience here.......... . This is a very nice mall, no doubt. As with any high end malls in major cities all over, such malls are usually luxurious, very nice & an extremely pleasant to be in.Obviously many tourists are just like us. We don't come here to shop for branded stuff, but just to look around. After all, shopping is the main tourists activity in Bangkok. And if possible, to visit every mall available if time permits. Perhaps also to search for new or 'different' dining options. It's always nice to dine & relax in a beautiful luxurious mall than a budget one.

Luxury shopping. This place have luxury shopping. But also amazing cinema experience at 6th floor. The shopping mall has it owns metrostation called siam so it is very easy to go by sky train. Also close to MBK

Captivating. The Siam Paragon mall is an upmarket mall featuting all your luxury designer brands in clothing as well as cars. The food republic in the design quater was such a nice experience. Good food at reasonable prices. Definitely worth a stop whilst in Bangkok.
High end shopping centre. Trendy place to buy upmarket stuff.Must visit the food hall, many things to eat and taste.Prices higher than Street food sellers but it's clea

Good shopping. If that's what you like. You can find it all under one roof here. Good food can be found too. And of course when it's blazing hot outside you can enjoy the cold air. But be warned, Thais like to keep it very cold.
Good . Very good for Shopping person, at a very good location. Food court is variety and everyone looks good. Supermarket is a nice choice for buying souvenir.
Beautiful centre. A stunning shopping center with loads of restaurants and brand name shops. Not to place to go to if you are looking for bargains but definitely worth a visit.

Whole family enjoy. This shopping mall is very big and felt comfortable to walked around . Inside got a aquarium for kids , adult to visit , it is so nice to tour . Got brand fashion , bag and other things too. If felt hungry , there got many restaurants and food court ( many kinds of food can choose ) , very value to go .

This is the best place. This is the best place for you love shopping.. many2 branded you can see at thereAlways new arival... And this place have masam tuso and fish land... And at here many2 food can you eat... Delicioussss

Very Impressive mall. Have been in malls all over the USA, Canada, Mexico and Europe and have never found one that comes close I comparison with the Siam Paragon. From all the places to eat on the ground floor to the massive number of stores found on the upper levels including auto dealerships such as Lambo, Bentley, Aston Martin, Porsche, etc. Add in the aquarium in the basement level and this is a top notch destination for shopaholics.
Holiday. The is the best Mall to shop in by far, it has the all the top brands and some very good local stores, the food court is massive and the variety of good is extensive.

Swanky upmarket shopping mall. A shopping mall to rival the best in Singapore, Hong Kong or Taipei. Most of the major brands are represented here. Try the coffee shop on the first floor that serves a good durian mousse cake by the slice.

A good option for window shopping. A premium mall having all luxury brand under one roof. The auto gallery is a must visit with Lamborghini, Maseratti, Rolls Royce, Porsche, Aston Martin and BMW all side by side. Not to miss is the connector to Siam Centre which has a dancing fountain which is quite refreshing to see.If you are few of the privilege ones who shops at Louis Vuitton etc. This is the mall for you.

Number 1 I. Bangkok. Today I've been in Siam.paragon for shopping and also to see I side acquarium I think is the best in Thailand there are a lot of fish shark inside.Came back to siam paragon if you are looking for food the ground floor you can have I think more than 200 different place to eat.For shopping you have 10 floor full.of big signature griffe.The best place to.spend one full day.

Number one Mall in Bangkok . At a price you can find everything Thai non Thai of quality.Easy access by BTS or skytrain and surrendered with walking distances other huge Malls.Not to be missed at all costs.If comparable Harrod's London ( much older ) is similar in many ways....
Decent mall but expensive. The mall has some good restaurants, but the shopping options seemed quite expensive. Centralworld just next to it has many more options and just as food restaurants.
Very expensive shops. Quiet expensive compared to other malls but also less crowded. Unfortunately no free wifi as in many other places in Bangkok.
You won't get bored here! . So much to see at Siam Paragon! We just loved it and spent most of our day exploring the Forrest malls. We took our 3 years old to Sea World - 10/10!

Great mall. Forget about all the luxury shops just head directly to the bottom floor find the gourmet supermarket and start hunting for meat fish seafood whatever. They will cook it to perfection and you will enjoy a fantastic meal

High class shopping . High class shopping centre that sells all the branded stuff. You can find almost all branded goods here in this shopping centre. Easily assessible by bts train. Stop at Siam Station.

Good for luxury shopping. If you are interested to spend your money just for nothing special you can go there. Prices are more expensive than normal markets but the quality is quite the same.
BTW, air conditioner is perfect and toilets are clean.

So nice and luxurious. And, CLEAN!. Top commercial centre, huge, many many shops and franchises you can imagine from all over the world. From Zara to Louis Vuitton to Krispy Kreme and KFC, you name it, they have it. Very nice to go in after the heat and dirtiness of some streets in Bangkok. One of the cleanest and nicest places to hang around. You appreciate the A/C!
Malling. The reason why we went there... is the Kidzania and the Madam Trussads.. thank you chanyang! (Tour with Tong)

Great shopping and eating . The aquarium is very interesting especially for youngs. Great shopping experience. Good food court with tasty and effordable food alongside with good restaurants. Fully air conditioning. What else needed?

Our visit to this mall. This is a beautiful mal with many restaurants and high quality shops and a supermarket. It has also on the lower floor the Sea World which is a very modern and beautiful aquarium.
BEST FOOD COURT IN ALL OF BANGKOK!. The choices are many and like all food court in Asia they are relatively inexpensive.! Recommend. Recommend. Recommend!
Nice place to shop. There is many things you can buy in siam paragon. Is nice to shop. It is near MBK shopping mall, just walk around 8 to 10 mins.

Love the food court!. The food court in Siam Paragon has such a great selection of Western and Asian food! It is very easy to get lost in though.
Shopping is good if you want real designer goods and it has a good selection high Street shops as well (prices were similar to UK prices though)

Luxury shopping mall. Nice shopping mall that cater lots of luxury and middle range brands including chanel, hermes, zara, h&m, naraya and paragon. Everything is there including good food at LG. They have HALAL food also for muslims. Bit crowded during the weekend. Convenient and nearby train station.

My first stop for my BTS trip. Wanting to experience the BTS train, I bought a day ticket for140 bahts. My goal was to see the various neighborhoods that the BTS train passes by. Having seen them, I decided to get off at the Siam Station and visited the Siam Paragon Mall. I just did some window shopping and ate at one one restaurants on the Fourth Floor. I also walked around near the entrance of the mall and took pictures of the fountain.
Elegant mall!. This shopping center is so elegant. You can find luxurious shops and restaurants here. The architecture is really good!
Posh and expensive. This is a posh and expensive place. You will need to be very wealthy to shop here. Good for a look though

My Favorite Shopping Experience. Siam Paragon is my favorite shopping centre in Bangkok, sadly my favorite restaurant in next doors Siam Centre (T42) is no longer there since their upgrade some time back and inclusion of "Food Republic" so I have moved my taste buds to Siam Paragon (even though "Food Republic" has some great choices). I often find myself eating at Greyhound which goes under a modified name now and cannot recall what it is. I generally eat at their Central at Chidlom outlet. On my last visit to Siam Paragon my friend discovered "Garrett Popcorn". No wonder there was a long queue, it was super tasty with every mouthful expanding my waistline. Lethal but ever so good. It was located on the basement level with all of the food outlets. So glad I haven't a "Garrett Popcorn" store near my home.

Label heaven. This is along with central world are my two go to shopping centres when in BK. Siam is definitely the more up market and the department store with in is the centre is fantastic. Where else in the world does a shopping centre have car showrooms! If your in BK just go for the experience
Bog shopping center. A maze of shops and restaurants. Products sold arent cheap though....Easy to get lost. But part of the experience Alot of good food. Big variety

Up market shopping center. . Went to paragon many times its one if the up market shopping centers in Bangkok, it has nice up market shops like LV and not bad prices. Went to harrods for lunch was good value.
Good place. This place have modern design I"m so like. In side sales brands name then quite expensive. Teenage walk quite a lot.
Massive shopping outlet. This is a very upmarket shopping complex if you want to buy a Rolls Royce this is the place to buy it, food hall at the basement top class with massive variety

Just amazimg. What a beautiful centre! It's full of shops and even a sea life centre at the bottom and cinema at the top! We loved it there as we could go to shops we have at home and get good quality items. The facilities (toilets) are also fantastic.
Great but expensive . Superb mall and you get all brands I loved it and loved the superrrrrb food court in basement . Wow what food and all food chains . Great goin SIAM PARAGON MALL .

Shopping paradise with best English bookstore in town!. Like many other glizzy shopping towers in Bangkok, the Siam Paragon offers plenty of "standard luxury" shops. What really stands out however is the Kinokuniya bookstore on one of the upper levels, providing an excellent selection of fiction and non-fiction books in English language. The store is well organized, has a pleasant "browsing through" environment and attentive staff. Best choice when stocking up on reading material during your trip through Asia!
Guauu!. I didn't expect this place to be this luxurious nor big... Super brands like Valentino, D&G, Emporio Armani and others fit perfectly in this mall. Check the downstairs food market! Awesome

Grand Cinema. We did not shop very much at Siam Paragon as we were not there for upmarket shopping. We went to the cinema instead. The cinema lobby is very good and there was a good choice of English movies. The seats were very comfy and with lots of leg space. Interesting we had to rise and stand for the national anthem before the show started. It screened the king when he was young and his contribution to agricultural development in Thailand. I could appreciate the respect to the King.

The luxurious one . High end shopping centre, so called "The Pride of Bangkok". Certainly not a place for budget travelers. Cars displayed there are impressive, only the best and most expensive ones get on display there. Paragon Food Hall offers food from all over the planet.

One of the popular shopping mall in bangkok . Centrally located this mall is very popular among locals and tourists despite strong competition from other big shopping malls within the vicinity. This is an middle to upper scale shopping malls with anchor tenant Paragon occupying 6 stories. All international branded names are available here including F&B outlets. Harrods Cafe Restaurant is situated on ground floor. Very cosy shopping mall, huge with air-conditioned. Lots of food and drinks restaurants located on lowest floor. Food courts with cheap and delicious stalls situated in one corner with nice and cosy settings. Food coupon needs to be purchased before using in food court stalls with balance credit redeemable. The Siam SeaWorld located one floor below the food court is a must to visitors.
