Just another Mall. Just another mall prevalent in southeast asian countries. Could skip if you are not so fond of these establishments.

An excellent of designer labels. We felt assured they were the original items, we bought osprey,coach and Italian leathers and bags and felt they went jimported. If changing money take your passport and eat at camp for a different event. I personally find goods expensive but I am told by my friends that the designer labels were cheaper than Perth Australia. I am not a label person as I would rather travel

welcome luxury. After wandering throught the streets of Bangkok in the humidity, heat and food odors Paragon offered a welcome break to the luxurius side. Immense and cozy cool environment housing multiplex and a very big aquarium that's worth a visit. The food court offered a lot of alternatives with nice decorated restaurants and a break from the local tastes. On the shopping floor we found shirts of very good quality and price. You can find really good offers.

I never get this mall out of my list. Everytime I go to Bangkok, I always come to this place. I especially love their grocery and food court! So many things to see and eat! Their cinema is pretty nice and huge as well. I also go stroll around and give this place an hour or two to clear my mind and get ready for the day's adventures.

The best shopping mall. I was really impressed by the high level of Paragon Siam shopping mall: not only the structure itself shows a beautiful architecture especially in the central hall with the scenic escalators, but the gourmet store was a massive display of some of the best gourmet products from all over the world. Worth a visit.
Nice . One of the best and big mall in bkk u can find what ever u looking for the food the cloths shoes what so everybody there should visit it
One of the reputable mall. . This is one of the mall to get original goods. And most expensive clothes, brand bags and watches. If wanna visit, take more time then have a enjoyable day.

One of my favorite. So cool shopping mall in the centre of Bangkok. Never see before such a big area for food in a one shopping mall, a lot of variety of food from all around the world. Big choose also for the shops, you can find everything that you need.

Huge mall, good bookstores. If you like huge malls filled with expensive, designer stores I guess this would be the place for you. It was really crowded and noisy, and we didn't like it very much. There are a couple big English-language bookstores that I would recommend.
Good for a rainy day. Its a good option for a rainy days, you can always visit it for free, but its not more than that, luxury brands, not for people on a budget
Huge mall. Was cool to see such a huge shopping mall with a variety of shops and a huge area to eat downstairs with so much choice at the food hall

International branding shopping center. Excellent shopping center in Bangkok with most of the international brand here. Located at the central of all the shopping malls. Item that selling were from international luxury brands. If you were shopping for cheap good you may skip the shopping center. However is a very good experience to enjoy the international brands. Very much like the basement grocery area with all a sort of international cuisine.

Weekend watching and sore feet respite. We took the BTS to Siam see how the Thai people spend their weekend and were not disappointed as the flow of weekend mall traffic was a delightful mix of families strolling girlfriends and couples, foreigners and Thai women that looked like they loathed to share a space with the common people but secretly enjoyed people seeing them in their fur. Fur in the 100 degree Thai heat? What a wonderful way to show you step from AC to AC locales only. I digress. Siam Paragon was the most instagrammed place worldwide in 2013 we are told.Also, Siam as a stop is a must see weekend Bts stop for people watching if you are new to public transit as the volume moving slowly but efficiently is no New York or London or Toronto or any other transit. No one is pushy no one cuts anyone off, it is very Minnesotan.At Siam Paragon we tried to take the elevator straight to the 5th floor where the theater is but it was full multiple times it arrived so we had to escalator our way up. The movie was enjoyable just to see the opulence, chandeliers and all and sit on a couch to see a movie in VIP seating. It was good to snack on popcorn rather than dried squid, Bangkok banana and dried peas as we have been. It is not a cheaper activity. 700-900 baht per person. FYI when the anthem plays at the beginning, stand up and stand still. You'll see this done around you.We also had a sit down meal in the food court which had great lunch specials for reasonable prices (something Pepper near the Dairy Queen). Who would think malls would have good food but we heard something like 50% of Thais prefer to eat out. Perhaps a questionable stat but we saw people eating out everywhere all of the time.There are luxury brands, high end cars on display but more importantly cold AC and a place to get off sore feet for a few hours.Also a Sea Life aquarium on the ground floor, just like the Mall of America.Check out the adorable Cloud Forest the restaurant of the same name had built.
Great shopping. Great shopping center with nice selection of high end brands and lots of places to eat. Taxistop outside that we used every time we went

Great. . Large shopping centre with lots of things to do with children. We visited the sea life centre on the ground floor which our children really enjoyed. We also visited the kidzania (which was hard to find) but once we found it, it was Fantastic. Really worth the money and children love it. You need to spend the whole day there. Definitely worth a visit with children. I highly recommend visiting the Siam paragon there's lots to do. Thai people are very friendly and they love kids. Definitely definitely worth a visit.
another mall. I think this will be the last review of a mall since all malls are pretty much the same. This is another huge mall with lots of shops and an aquarium at the base.

Luxury shopping. Beautiful shopping mall with luxury brands. This shopping mall is worth visiting if you love shopping malls. Great place for high-end shoppers. As for me, I enjoy studying the mall's architecture, tenant mix, decoration, and its shoppers.

A shopping extravaganza. Amazing shops and great food options especially the Gourmet Market. Clothes, books, electronics, a huge cinema complex. I really enjoy going there and always crowded. Madness! The shopping mall next door Siam Center is also impresssive and maybe even more beautiful.

Awsom. This is a beautiful mall where you can find whatever you think you could want! Gorgeous and luxury cars, jewelry, clothes, accessories, crystals..... Also lots of different types of food, desserts and ice creams!

Very good shoppingmall. Great mall with many brands and luxury products. The complex itself is very clean and has a nice decoration. The stores are of very high quality and all the employees were friendly and helpfull. They make no problems for giving

One of the best shopping malls in the world. I always get amazed by the standard of quality that this mall maintain. from great selection of local and International designer houses to the best variety and selection of food in their food court and outlets as well as gourmet restaurants. the fruit selection at their Supermarket is exceptional , expensive though. very convenient and high standard movie theaters especially the IMAX. a place for adults and kids where kids can visit the aquarium and its interesting activities. its a Bangkok icon that shouldn't be missed while visiting.

The best luxury shopping in Bangkok. A lot of brands is thereIn 6th floor you can find kids planet awesome place for kids toys and gifts and clothesIn the lower floor a lot of restaurantsThe mall is a few steps from the sky train station

One of the best shopping conplexes . This shopping center in my opinion has it all three floors of any type of food from organic,vegetarian Mexican Italian Japanese Korean etc etc you would not be disappointed can recommend also you should go to the supermarket there is sections there for seating in there food restaurant area if you love fresh oysters this is a must definitely recommend to take time while in BK to check out this shopping complex
Great luxury shopping Center . Wonderful high end shopping Center connected to the Skytrain station with all the luxury brands and a great choice of restaurants. Worth a visit !

Summary. Siam Paragon is located next to the Siam BTS station, where it is considered as the centre of Bangkok city. One of the most luxurious shopping mall in Bangkok with the availability of many international brands.
Amazing place. A plenty of foods and lots of thing to do here. Shopping, learning, eating, meeting. Comfortable & convenience. Easy to hop off to another place by BTS.

Smart shopping centre. There are many shopping centres in Bangkok but this is one worth visiting. It has a good range of high quality brands; its easy to get around and its laid out in a sensible fashion. Its close to the BTS so its easy to get to and from. airconditioned? Of course.
Universe of brands. An amazing window shopping experience. You will find all the international brands under one roof. Great food court. Interesting experience (but not cheap).

Easy access and lots of choices. A favourite among local and tourists with a huge food court downstairs and wide selection of local food. The prices are appropriate and shoppers can get anything that they want.

Shopping and some more . It's luxurious and has pretty much everything you want in an A level shopping mall... from cinema and aquarium to lounges and brand names. Bought some camera gear here. Excellent services
Nice luxurious mall. A mall close to BTS skytrain. The skytrain stops right at enterance of the mall. Clothing, cars, department store and all shops have beautiful design
Fun indoor shopping. I live in a small town with no shopping centres so I may be easily impressed, but this shopping centre had so many stories and lots to do! Enjoyed exploring.

Shopping and Food. The Siam Paragon is about a one minute walk from the Siam BTS (Skytrain) Station. There's lots of shopping here but I went for the food. On the lower level there are dozens of places to have lunch/dinner. If you are a donut fanatic like me, this is paradise - there is Mr. Donut, Duncan Donuts, and Krispi-Kreme. My last visit I had a small dinner, got my Krisp-Kremes and stopped by Dairy Queen on the way out.

The Pride of Bangkok. At its beginning for sure it was...Maybe this is the price to pay by its success now..Still pleasant and some still very nice boutiques to explore...However to avoid the week end as well public holidays

Why do I like this mall?. It's just a big mall, like in any other big city. Perhaps the urban chaos of Bangkok makes this place a fortress of solitude where one can temporarily escape the stickiness, stinky-ness of street life for the space, order and calmness of a temple to consumerism. Great restaurants are here plus a few interesting stores...if you can afford them and the clothes fit ( Thai are small). Ok...I will be honest...great air conditioning and safe food stalls without fear of guy rot.

Vast shopping mall. A vast mall with all the top international shops, and many others. Some things in the international shops are very expensive, so compare the prices from back home first. Good food hall!

Exceptional luxury mall. Great gourmet food court. This mall has all the high end stores you'd expect. They have a great food court on the ground floor with a gourmet supermarket. It can get quite crowded. The high end stores were not a bargain by any means and I found some of the prices higher than found in the US due to the heavy tariffs on imported luxury goods. Great place to go to take a break from the heat and easy to get to via sky rail

A mall for luxury shopping. This amazing mall houses luxury car makers, all household electronics, luxury designer clothing line, watches, food outlet -possibly everything is found at Siam Paragon. It is one of my favorite mall in Bangkok. It is connected to BTS sky train and Siam center.

Great food places, superb supermarket, interesting mall.. Walked here from Amari Watergate Hotel for food which was pleasant and found much more adventure in the supermarket. Live Oyster is something that I will try for my next trip.Food choices here are plenty. We loved the food at Aoi Japanese Restaurant that Japanese also dine in, had dessert at Bake a Wish (taste okay but not spectacular), tasted Fuji Japanese restaurant that is catered more for locals (taste not as good as Aoi but then, price cheaper).Definitely a mall that I will want to revisit for my next trip.

A tourist's one-stop shop. The basement teems with food providers for all budgets-- elegant cafes and restaurants, hotel cake and sweet shops, fast foods, drink stalls and a food court offering a handsome variety of Asian meals. It also as an extensive supermarket and a well-stocked drug store, as well as ATM machines.The upper floors house luxury and high-end fashion and sports stores, and even car shops (such as Lamborghini and Bentley). Siam Paragon, like Siam Centre and Siam Square One malls, is easily accessible from the Siam station of the BTS.

High end brands and next to BTS. Like all the big malls in other city like HK with luxury brands as well as local brands. There is certainly discount on beauty and other stuff. Overall very big and the location is perfect.

Nice Place to shop signature brands. Comparable to KLCC, where lots of signature brands, and high end restaurants to choose from. Good thing is, its walking distance in other shopping facility via SkyWalk.

Will meet all your needs . It is a huge mall which houses everything from a dessert shop to a car dealership it has all the major brand stores and a very impressive range of restaurants and other food outlets, its a must visit if your a shopaholic, tourist, teenager or a car enthusiast (as they have brands like Lamborghini Bentley Rolls-Royce McLaren Ducati BMW and others as well)

Amazing. I was recommended to stop here by a friend, so I did and the moment I walked through the door I was blown away by how big and modern the siam paragon is, the food area in here is huge you could lose an hour or more just looking at all the food stalls, a lot of the shops here are very up market but if you have time it's worth a look.
Beautiful mall. This is a very nice mall to walk around,all the big brands are represented and you can spend a nice bit of money if your a shopping freak :-)
Shopping mall. You can find almost everything there. Many known brands at a luxury environment. Easy access with sky train.

Massive shoppers haven. Busy big shopping centre full of luxury stores and almost every food you could dream of. Enjoyed shopping there a few times. There is also leather repair shop and jewellery repair shop downstairs from gourmet market

Shoppers paradise.. This shopping centre is great as it has a very big supermarket where we bought lots of Thai food and we had our dinner in here and it was lovely (Mos Burger). However the prices for clothing shops are more expensive compared to Europe,so we didn't buy anything from them. I would recommend this shopping centre if you have some spare time from sight seeing.

Beautiful. This shopping centre is stunning both inside and out. Spotlessly clean and well maintained. It had a fantastic food court with many top notch restaurants and equally brilliant selection of shops and a botique supermarket. The cinema on the top floor is also worth a visit where they have a 4D screen (this is brilliant). Everything is a bit pricey as far as Thailand goes, but you must remember it's a luxury shopping centre equil to ones I have visited in Dubai.

Exquisite. A beautiful & spacious luxury mall offering the best labels, all under one roof. Obviously these are items you can get at any major city in the world. The best for us was the food hall and the food court, some quality stuff available there especially the spices.
Expensive. As with most big shopping complexes in big cities but especially Bangkok, the rent is so high they have to inflate the prices to compensate, cheaper buying at home unfortunately.....

Beautiful mall to wander around. Lovely to walk around, all of the high end fashion labels are located here as well as luxury cars for those not keen on fashion. Movie theatre located right at the top with huge screens and good range of ticket prices, good to do on a rainy day (or a very hot day!)

huge mall connected to siam bts. decided to spend valentines day going around the different malls along the sukhumvit line of the bts. siam paragon is the largest and most complete. well known expensive western brands abound. checked around to compare prices. a the prices were similar to back home. so just ended up walking around to window shop.

LUXURIOUS SHOPPING. UMM WINDOW SHOPPING... . You go there. Ensure you have kept yourself aside atleast 10000 Baht. There is a lot to see. There is a lot to shop. Fabulous culture. Great Place to visit

Must see in Bangkok - #1 shopping experience . We have seen many interesting spots for tourists but non beat the over all good feeling for all our senses. It's likely your most memorable visit in Bangkok.

GREAT SHOPPING CENTER BUT VERY EXPENSIVE.. Next too the skytrain station Siam very convenient.If you are on a budget keep your hands in your pocket.There is a very large self serve restaurant which is reasonableand the usual american branded restaurants which are ok these are all situated on the ground floor.Great very large shopping center with a great cinema complexwould recommend anyone too take a look but for the wealthyThais.

Luxurious shopping makl. One of the more fancy malls in bkk with brand such as Gucci etc. I don't think I've ever bought anything here but we always go here for the restaurants, movie theaters and the supermarket on the ground floor.

Super convenience, everything you need is here!!. As you know, it is very convenient to reach here by BTS - Siam Station, direct connection to the mall. Apart of the luxuries brand, there are many Thai products section which you can find good souvenirs for your love ones. The price is not cheap if comparing to Chatujak but good trade with shopping in air-con :)

5 star shopping in one maze like location. The best shopping experience outside of Singapore. The place is gigantic and has every upper class store you could dream of. Its not all riches and there are plenty of stores for your average Joe tourist to peruse. Just remember where you entered, it's easy to get lost

Shopping Paradise for High End. Well I have to say this place is a grand shopping center. You will find most of the high end fashion label here and off course the price that come with it. I have to say I am not into this place because I am not a fashion hunter and not a shopaholic for high end fashion label even for window shopping. I preferred the good quality of street fashion so this is not for me. I just wandering for an hour and it feels like wandering at Pavilion back to my country so we decided to skip out to The Platinum Mall which located across.

Surprising. We live to shop, and not a fan of open air markets, which are plentiful in Thailand. Paragon has it all, from your daily milk and bread to a new Lamborghini (yes a Lamborghini).I recommend the furniture department in the department store, some very unique pieces there. Great array of eats, on the lower floors.
Good Mall!. This mall is a nice to see and your shopping experience here may be more expensive. The stores are aimed at medium to upper class shopper in my opinion when compared to MBK.
Shopping mall. Huge shopping mall in Bangkok! Easy skyline access, a lot of places to eat inside in the food court.

Huge, high variety, special sale events and more. Nothing too special compared to bigger malls in Western countries. What we found special was the special sale event that was set up on top floor, though there was hardly anything for men (gf was happy). Crazily, there are actual car manufacturer sales stands from all sorts of luxury brands which I had never before seen in a mall. You'll probably find every standard and more chic European/American brand here that you'd expect. Not a must see, but if you have time, it won't be a waste.

A beautiful shopping archade. The design, space and the Shops are very beautiful and attractive,All the world Class Brands are under a roof, great. Prices yes afordable those who deserve. Problems are information center is not up to the mark and maximum sales staff don,t know English. Otherwise its a Shopping paradise for the Brand community.

Excellent shopping and dining. I came here for a long weekend and to do some shopping for things I can't find easily in my current country of residence. The shopping was fantastic and the food court was incredible!

Has southeast asia's largest aquarium. Siam Paragon is an immensely popular shopping mall housing a host of international high-end fashion brands, Southeast Asia’s largest aquarium, a 16-screen Cineplex, and a comprehensive selection of world cuisine. Located prominently in front of Siam BTS Skytrain station - the interchange of the two BTS lines - it is considered by many to be the centre of Bangkok.

One stop shop. If you only have time for one mall to visit in Bangkok, I would suggest Paragon. It has food, clothes, watches, cars, gadgets, furnitures, souvenirs, and everything else you can think of, ranging from mid to high-end luxury brands. It's clean, well organized, and well managed with many weekly events and promotions

Massive shopping centre that packs the crowd each weekend. This seemed to be the favourite shopping mall in bangkok! Despite new and glitzy new malls, siam paragon packs in the crowd each time! The food level at basement is good but can be mind boogling with the crowd and huge selection to choose from. Famed four seasons duck from london, krispy creme donuts , costa coffee , you name it..
Big mall. This mall is huge and can get lost at times. Nice mall with many shops and eateries. Take time to explore and shops and spoilt for choices for food.

High end shopping!. This is an expensive mall with designer shops in abundance. If you budget doesn't quite stretch to these, there is an interesting food supermarket and food court in the lower level which should cater to most tastes. Branch of Swensons ice cream here - a good reason to visit

The best place to visit.. For both Indians and foreigners.. Hey hi. The mall is located quite center well.connected with skytrain and road taxis.Bangkok siami ocean world is located here.where I enjoyed the sea life with ample varieties. And it contained ROYAL INDIAN RESTAURANT located opposite to gourmet mall in the ground floor of siami paradon mall only.I ordered butter nana and panner butter masala those are really delicious If u have time enjy the shows in this mall.

Poor Foodcourt. Dont waste your time in the foodcourt. I had diarhoea from eating their shrimp chilli fried rice. Instead try going to the gourmet food hall. We were able to get some nice fresh juices there and some cleanly packed food to go. You can also get some food gift packs for home here. Its a little dearer but it looks fresher and the packaging looks better too. Oherwise a standard mall for shopping with your usual branded labels.

Remember to check what you buy here.. This place is always my wife favourite spot on getting cheap and beautiful clothing, bags and accessories. But during our last visit, my wife get an unforgettable experience as she bought a pant and find out that it was not what she paid for when she open up. Unfortunately we have back to where we belong. The stall here doesn't allow testing on the cloth they sell. So bare in mind make sure you all know what size you are wearing and double check what they give you after you paid the money.
Big Shopping Mall. Big Shopping Mall, u can find good restaurant good shopping things here many kind of food. Very easy to go by bts u can get off at bts SIAMU can spend whole day over there.Enjoy

Massive Mall. Definitely worth a window shopping experience at the very least. Massive food court on the ground level and a shopping /grocery market where you can find just about anything you would want. Several escalators will bring you to the top floor where an IMAX movie theater is. One of the higher floors is a high end auto mall of sorts with vehicles on display in their respective stores from Roles Royce, Bentley, Lamborghini, Austin Martin, etc. was pretty cool to see. Definitely worth the stop. We were able to get a local sim card in a telephone store DTAC where they helped us set it up.

Family Vacation. Wide ranges of shopping options.its a very good shopping mall.Very good modern clothings,expensive and non expensive both options available.being weekend it was quite crowded,so better to go on weekdays to shop peacefully.

Great place to hang out, shop, eat and watch movies at. Loved sea world and the food court. The krungsri imax theater has a full format imax screen and is a great place to catch movies at. The mall has an entrance that connects to the skytrain so its really easy and convenient to reach. Overall, great place to hang out.

The most expensive shopping center in Bangkok, but the best!. Great shopping, you can almost find anything you desire. A lot of great restaurants to have lunch and or dinner. Its a place for everyone, but I have to be sincere, the money counts. The location is also fantastic because you can go to other venues from there easily.

Nice mall & love the supermarket!. The mall is very exclusive & big. There are a lot of restaurants inside. But unfortunately because my husband prefer to eat street food in bangkok so we didn't try to eat there. I especially love the supermarket. The supermarket is so big, clean & complete! You can find lots of local snack, imported snack, chocolate, many2 local & imported fruits & even traditional food there!

Beautiful!. There's a lot to do in Siam Paragon, it's an incredible mall and full of lots of different things to do.There are several shops and restaurants inside, all very good and there is even an aquarium on the lower floor. The aquarium is really impressive! But be warned, they have the prices written in english as 1000 THB per person but next to it written in Thai is 500 THB for those who aren't foreign.Overall, a really great mall and if you get the chance you should definitely visit it!

AIR CONDITIONED LUXURY. Large shopping mall with luxury brands as well as a department store and enough shops offering reasonable competition. Visiting on week-ends is to be avoided as locals use it as an air-conditioned recreation area, even sleeping on the sitting areas provided.

If you want expensive products, come here.. If you are a millionaire who do not care what causes traffic jam, this is the place for you. Because the vehicles coming to and going out of it cause a lot of problem to the traffic in the city. Nothing in here is interesting for me.

Brilliant Shopping Centre. This is one of the best up-market shopping centres anywhere. Every major brand is represented. Great cinemas on top, and a great aquarium below. Excellent food court, and the gourmet supermarket close by is fabulous. For anyone interested in international shopping, this is a must-visit destination.

For the more affluent society. This is a lovely clean polished shopping centre.
It offers real brand name clothing at a price! Handmade and unique designer products are here too. Lovely coffee shops to people watch from.

Died And Went To Heaven In The Food Court. . .. Very expensive shopping upstairs but heaven can be found in the food court. Dozens of small restaurants serving a variety of Asian cuisines that are reasonably priced. I tried a dumpling restaurant and a Vietnamese restaurant both amazing. Counter after counter of desserts and specialty items. Our eyes were bulging. There is also a food store/gallery on this level which is the largest I have ever been to selling EVERYTHING; spices, fruit, ready made, meat. Siam Paragon is a destination. Please go hungry and with BAHT.

Best shopping mall in Thailand. This is the best shopping mall in Thailand, linked to the sky train with very easy access to MBK (another shopping mall), it is worth a visit for all brand names shoppers.
Very classy. One of the best mallard I have seen , the high brands is there surly with a lot of varieties. It's in Siam place , I recommend this place for all its very organized and beautiful

Top notch food options and good shopping. Siam Paragon is one of the nicest malls I've ever been to. The food selection is superb. The paragon department store has nearly anything one could want. Also, there is a great bookstore on the fourth floor that has an amazing kid's section. If you're looking for bargains, this probably isn't your cup of tea. While there are cheaper stores like H&M and Uniqlo, most are designer stores or pricey. If you're an expat looking to buy imported food, there is an excellent grocery store on the main floor.

always love it. one of my favourite shopping mall in Bangkok. So many kind of food was had in their supermaket. when i came there they still have a fair in front of gourmet supermaket. So many things you can find. you can find any brands in the mall. And the access is very easy to get there

Luxury. Luxurious shopping mall with everything you need to kill time. Bowling alley, movie theater, food court, etc. I spent about 4 hours here before my flight because it was too hot out. Watched a movie, ate curry and all was good

Siam Paragon. Luxurious stores and vast variety of restaurants.However we struggled to find a cafe or restaurant which serves normal English breakfasts.The Gourmet food hall is amazing but expensive.I was pleasantly surprised to see a Laduree stall.Their macaroons are the best in the world and should not be missed although they are not cheap!

Just like any other mall in developed countries. Buying from street shops near Nana BTS is more fun than shopping here. However their is a lot of restaurants in this mall to make your taste buds tickle

Convenient to get to, with plenty of good shopping and food outlets. Siam Paragon is a bit of an icon in Bangkok. Despite the proliferation of other shopping malls, this one is always busy and is a popular place for locals to hang out in the evenings and on weekends.There are plenty of good restaurants, and the food court downstairs is very cheap. There are also plenty of food stalls where you can take away food, and the variety is staggering. The quality and variety of food generally is incredible, and it's nice to be able to find so many in one place! There's a gourmet supermarket downstairs next to the food court, with lots of ready-to-go meals, fresh fruit, and packaged Thai food that you may want to take back home.There is a cinema and bowling alley upstairs, and plenty of designer shops if window shopping is your thing. There are other popular stores like Zara and the Emporium dept store if your budget is not so generous. The Kinokuniya book store is a fabulous store where you can lose yourself for a few hours.Hop off at Siam BTS station and Siam Paragon is right there. Easy Peasy. At Xmas time and various other occasions, Siam Paragon is decorated beautifully and it's always fun to see what they'll come up with next. They also have exhibitions of art and craft inside from time to time, so it's worth checking those out too.

Luxury Shopping. High end to luxury shopping. Lamborghini dealership in the mall. My wife and I go to visit the Kikokunya Book store and the World Market. Love them both, its worth the walk there just for those two spots. One of these visits we will remember to check out the aquarium.

This is one place you can Shop till you drop!. Siam Paragon is a beautiful mall with a wide selection of stores for high end shoppers. They also have a movie theater and an Aquarium. If you want to have something to eat they have a good court on the bottom floor and restaurants. Great shopping experience in Bangkok.

Huge, luxurious, with good eating places. Luxurious stores, but we were positively surprised by the food hall where there are good, thai prices.If you have the skytrain Rabbit card, you can upload money on it and pay with it.

Fantastic spot, would go again . We ate here a couple of times, mainly lunches, and the food court was amazing- it was like the street markets in layout but inside in the air conditioning and cleaner. The shops had an amazing range although it was often dearer than Sydney so didn't buy much, even with duty free. The only shopping we did was the brands we love but can't get in Australia. Didn't try the activities like aquarium but they always seemed busy. I love the fact that everything is open until late which is normal in Asia but frustrating about Australia.

Essential in modern Bangkok. As a part of modern Bangkok is important to see and take the pulse of Thailand´s capital. Sofisticated and huge, you can stroll many hours there. Go to the movies, nice option. Cinema ocupe two entire floors. To eat is better go to MBK, with more typical food court and cheaper.It´s close.

Amazingly busy mall. Originally went to see site of the excellent Intercontinental hotel which was demolished to make way for this mall, and was quite prepared to hate it, as we loved the old hotel. Was overwhelmed by this mall. Its the busiest we have ever seen, and all the food outlets are extremely fast, good food, and at reasonable prices. The Skytrain goes straight into the mall.We never go on holiday to see shopping malls, but glad we did see this one. Asia loves to shop. Even a Harrods outlet. Amazing
movie theater . apart from movie theater and big supermarket in the ground floor this place was a total bustalthough we did enjoyed movie theater

Best upscale shopping mall. You name all the top brands and you can find it here at siam paragon. From luxury car makers, luxury designer clothing line, watches, food outlet possibly everything is found at siam paragon. One of my personal favorite mall in Whole of Thailand. It is connected to bts sky train and siam center.Ocean world is right below ground level floor. You should visit this place. Awesome place on the weekend or the weekdays . I would highly recommend this mall. And will definitely visit next time I visit bangkok.

Great shopping centre . It's a great shopping centre right next to the Siam BTS station. They have pretty much all you need with restaurants on the top floors, food court and a hugh supermarket at the basement. Shop wise, mainly international brands, so if you are looking for local brands, would suggest to visit Siem Centre which is right next to Siam Paragon.

Classy place. Great place to find that thing that you never knew you wanted but it comes at a price. This is a very upmarket mall especially on the ground floor where designer stores do battle. For those on a tighter budget the upper floors have lots more to chose from. There are good place to sit down and have something to eat or drink all in wonderful air conditioned comfort. There is some great people watching here.
luxury designer brands. its a place to for designer items very pricey for luxury brands. we did not stay too long at this mall but its really worth to see
The Best. The Best for shopping, cinema, location, food outlets. Simple.Shopping followed by the cinema is a perfect day out!
Unbeleivable Mall.. Luxury all around. The best stores in the world, cinemas, restaurants, etc. very nice place to spend an afternoon and walk around.

Uber Chic mall in bkk. Class Class Class. Thats Siam paragon mall for you. Great branded stores and lots of shopping options. Great dining options too with an array of restaurants. Love the 2nd floor of the mall where all the jazzy Cars are on display. You can easily spend a full day at the mall.

Movies. 2 to 3 times a week usually double features. Great places to sit while waiting for a movie. Starbucks, MacDonald's Cafe, Hagan Das. ice cream. 10 Pin bowling.Of course mega shopping on the 4 lower floors, and BTS direct access, or near by a bus at 1/4 price. Why take a taxi, where night taxis to go a few blocks can cost farangs 200 to 500, where day taxis are 40 to 60
Fantastic mall for shopping!. Here at Siam Paragon you can find many international brands. 3 shopping malls are connected. Very good location, easy arrive by taxi or subway.

Neat toy shop. My son and I don't much enjoy shopping, but we heard the toy shop in Siam Paragon was worth the visit. Most of the other shops I saw were luxury, but the mall itself is lovely and had a huge Star Wars display when we went. The toy shop has tons of imported things, as well, though the Lego section is not terribly up to date. Oh how we wish Legos had more of a presence in Asia!

Shopping. Busy shopping mall with good mixture of international brand and local brands. B2 is the Sea Life aquarium. Food hall is located at the B1 with food from all over the world, from McDonald, KFC, Cinnabon to Thai and Japanese street style foods like mango sticky rice and takoyaki. Next to the Food Hall, the Gourmet Market provides organic food and imported products from all over the world, but quite expensive. You can relax a bit by reading a book at Kinokuniya bookstore @ 5th or 6th floor (I cannot remember). Anyway, typical mall overall.

Shopping. Paragon is a nice place to go shopping. Almost every brand available and prices rang from reasonable to extremely expensive. If it's on sale you will save money. Plenty if nice food both western and local. Just step off the BTS train and into the air con. Vat(tax) return for tourists on the lower floor.
luxury place to shop. For the shopping lover, you can find a lot of luxury product, variety of very good restaurant, cinemas, etc. Don' t miss out Kidzania -- best world for kids -- happy & fun.

SIAM PARAGON..... Great place with many fashion and food options to select from and the atmosphere is amazing you can really experience a mixture of Thais and foreigners, only difficulty was to find taxi's to go back and the drivers can be very very rude.

Standard Shopping Mall. Paragon is your standard shopping Mall in Bangkok. They have a great food court in the basement where you can safely try all the local "street" food in a clean and climatized environment. The selection of shops is very standard with all the Big brand names as well as a few Car! makers who Display their best and newest models. It's centrally located and connects a few other malls with a Walkway. It is also connected to the BTS station. This mall is great for people watching or if you want to escape the Chaos of The City for an hour or two.

luxery. It was one of the high end shopping malls you could visit in Bangkok. There were all the high end fashion designs, lots of delicious small food places, and a great movie theater inside.In central Bangkok, right next to the sky train and close to a lot of the hotels.

Great shopping!. This is a great shopping center, but not my favorite in Bangkok. Too many high end shops that most people can´t afford, and mostly brands that you can find everywhere else. The food court is VERY noisy and it is difficult to find a seat (and very few restaurants have baby chairs). The gourmet grocery shop is highly recommended though. Nice place to buy gifts for families like local tea, candy, spice etc. For fashion shopping I prefer Central World Plaza.

Huge Mall - right on the Sky Train. Massive mall complex that adjoins others and the Sky Train (BTS station Siam). Its at the main BTS station so all lines lead here. You can get a bit lost in Siam Paragon but there's loads of stores and shops and restaurants on offer. If you get bored, there's Siam Ocean World and across the street there's local shops to explore.
BEST SHOPPING. I think this is the BEST place who want to go shopping. There are a lots of things to do like watch movies in cinema, supermarkets, fashion shops, and restaurant.

a legendary shopping mall.. right in the center of bangkok you can find the legendary shopping mall siam paragon. a very elegant and classy place to shop, and dine and see what is hot and trendy in the world. a very modern and upscale place to visit while staying in bangkok.

voyueristic adventure ! High end mall. Voyueristic pleasure as this high end mall has every top name brand stores like Gucci, Cartier , jimmy Choo but also more familiar ,Zara, H&M, Mango There is an amazing Food Court with great choice of restaurants, Krispy Kreme as well and great fresh foods in the supermarket. There are car showrooms on the upper floors, yes you read that right, Aston Marin, Rolls Royce to name a couple. You can walk around this mall and not spend a penny but enjoy. Not forgetting that there is also Sea World aquarium in the basement ! Get out of the heat , Siam BTS station and follow the signs.

shopping spee. Nice and spacious shopping area with lots of different varieties of goods. Good space area of supermarket and you can find everything you want from this place.Nice place to hang out and pass time.
Best shopping center in Bangkok. You can find your favorite brand here. Located on Siam square area connect BTS (sky train) Station. It is very convenient.

Siam Paragon . What a wonderful experience. Shops of every description in every direction, a true shopaholic's paradise. We we spent our time watching Chinese New Year celebrations and eating fabulous Thai food. There are many choices of food available. The quality of the Thai food was excellent and reasonably priced. Siam Paragon is easy to find as it has its own sky-train station. Well worth a visit, but to some it will be just a shopping centre. We loved it!

Never stops amazing me . Please arrive through the main entrance with the arches, waterfalls, and fountains. That gives you a taste for what's in store. All of your high end shops will be found at Siam Paragon Mall further if you're in the market for a Rolls Royce, Bentley, Maserati, or most other ultra high-end cars you've come to the right place to make your purchase.

Awesome mall. I come to Bangkok about 3 to 4 times a year. I spent most my days at Siam. They have everything from an aquarium to a taco truck in the food court to a dentist to a nail salon to a movie theater.

Top Brands store. I recently visited this mall and I must say if you want the best of the best high end brands either in bags shoes cosmetics or any other high brand this is the mall to visit in Bangkok. You can easily access it by a metro station which is the most convenient way to travel in Bangkok what with the traffic on the road.

My family favorite. Every time I go to Bangkok alone or with my family , I have to visit this fantastic center .my family go shopping in the department store and I go walking around . After they finished shopping and get tired we all go to the food court to what ever we feel to eat .
Fancy shopping mall. Fancy shopping mall at Siam. Many nice restaurants, top brands or everything for high-end that mean everything a bit expensive! Anyway it's famous for local and tourists!

$£¥ Luxury shopping in the heart of the city*****. Went to 4th floor to buy myself a Lamborghini but the color didn't match my socks so I ha d to postpone the purchase.Great cinemas on the top floor, nothing like in Europe, for a bargain price you get ridiculous luxury and top viewing and acoustic experience like IMAX.On the lower floor is food court with budget thai foods, whatever you could think of or go and have disgusting shark fin soup for ridiculous money.If you have a sweet tooth try "after you desert cafe" chocolate lava

Magnificent Mall. Very well laid out mall with walk-in link to Siam BTS station on first level. The information desk staff were very courteous & helpful. Food court housed many multi cuisine open restaurants. Separate dedicated children play area. VAT refund for tourist counter & ocean world entry from basement make it a one stop for all your family needs. Luggage deposit desk was a welcome addition.

High end mall. Location at the siam bts station. Its a popular attraction for tourists but only high end brand. Interconnected with several other malls. Go at night because usually there is local performance outside the mall.

Awesome mall, great food court!. Siam Paragon Mall is one of the nicest malls I have seen globally, it is very high end but has a great food court located on the bottom floor. Be sure to grab some cookies at Famous Amous, they are sosooss good!

High-end Mall. If you are after high-end branded items then Siam Paragon us for you.It doesn't cater to everyone-- only for mid to high end customers.New & clean and nice things to see.Will definitely satisfy your eyes-- especially the nice cars inside the mall.Siam Paragon definitely not for everyone but definitely a nice place to stroll around-- msy be grab a coffee & muffin and just relax.

Everything is bigger in Bangkok. Wow, high end shopping mall. What ever you need you can find here. Authentic brand name, out of this world cinema,you name it,it probably has it Of course this is a tourist spot so it is pricy. Still worth a visit.

"Exclusive mall in BKK". The first mall I visited, where I got almost all world class brands under one roof. Designed beautifully. Always an attractions for the tourists. Nice food court. Loved the theatre on top. Electronic section is always an attraction for me, where i got my choice brands and the products.
Pointless unless hungry. I have no idea why anyone would pay for the over priced things in Paragon. The food court downstairs is very good though. Just hate the whole snobbery of the place.
Amazing. This mall is amazing, so much good food and shopping. We ate in the food court was so cheap and tasty Thai food!

Shopping paradise! . This place is huge! You can find almost everything here. Not very cheap. Things made outside Thailand is more expensive here than home. Don't miss the kitchen floor, here you can find bargains. Top floor is a massive movie theater with so many different movies and IMAX. In the basement there is a aquarium that should be good.
Great shopping. Then great selection of food.Cinema is the best I have experianced.Had great fun Bowling on the same floor.
Good for branded items.. Good place for branded items... Expensive place.... Nothing great...,........... If you are looking for items with good price, then this is not the place.

Easy to navigate and fun to wander. One of my favourite malls in Bangkok. Very easy to find your way and plenty of lovely coffee shops and ice cream parlours to keep your energy levels high. The food court is the basement is wonderful too.
Everything you need. Also linked to Siam and Siam square and now joined to Central World by the "Skywalk".

Their food court definitely worth a visit. First of all, it is a very big mall with a lot of shops, but we went their mainly to eat. You have a good choice of restaurants but also a food court of the mall. In order to eaten the food court you should buy a cart and to put some money on it as at the counter they don't take cash. As for types of food, there are mostly thai dishes, such as Pad Thai and Tom Yam. And it is nice since it is a real thai food made for thai people and not for tourists. I tried pad thai with omelet from the first stand and it was delicious, but a bit spicy.

Great Food Haven!. We were searching high and low for Thai food but if you're unfamiliar with the streets and prefer air-conditioned experience, then head to this mall where they have a variety of amazing food fusions from Thai to Japanese cuisine. Cafe/Dessert ethusiast will go crazy over the wide range of endlessly quaint spots for that relaxing afternoon dessert/tea.

OMG what can I say?. While the upper levels of this shopping mall are typical shopping mall it is the food court that rules this place! I have never seen even state side a mall or shopping area with such a huge collection of restaurants and places foodies love!We went there 2 days in a row as they had so much to offer we just have to try more.One we ate at was Amici and it is a fabulous Italian restaurant. We had a Whitefish dish that was to die for it tasted fabulous!Must try this place if you are a foodie it is a place not to miss!!!
It's a mall. Close your eyes - no in fact open them and your in another mall that could be anywhere in the worldIt's clean, modern and just like thousands across the world Hey its shopping that's all
Food court needs more veggie options!. Tried to find vegan food and it seemed impossible to find. You would think they could make a vegan curry with vegetables in such a high end place.

Beautiful, diverse and fun.... The first time I came here (2010) I went nuts...every 'mall' I'd ever been to back home in the U.S. simply didn't compare- not even close. Awesome movie theaters, bowling alley, eateries, restaurants, shopping, ocean aquarium, internet/coffee cafes. Bring a book, bring your camera, bring your headphones and chill.
Up scale mall. Very well connected to the BTS and a huge mall . Upscale as compared to MBK. Food varieties is also there for all travellers .

Luxury!. Siam Paragon mall is perhaps the best mall in Bangkok in terms of luxury. It is extremely high end mall. Every possible brand in the world is here if you want to shop or just look about. Everything is way too overpriced. I wouldn’t dare buy anything here again, but I will go back to just window shop maybe. It takes at least 2/3 hours to go through the whole mall. The interactive information screen is very helpful for those who want to plan their shopping.

Expensive & closed. Clean, smart and cool. A lot of the high-end shops in this mall close pretty early, so don't leave this mall as an evening attraction. Prices for most branded goods are way above European and Western prices, so you may be disappointed if you came looking for a bargain.Only gripe is the poor signage makes it pretty hard to get out of!

Good complex everything there. As for shopping and eating in bangkok, Siam Paragon is one of the best place for local as well as tourists. Almost
everythings you want will be there.

Ocean world is nice . The ocean world is nice for children to recognize sea creatures! And they are presented in a pretty way! You can go under the water or ride a glass bottom boat to see what's under the huge tabk!

Go here if you are loaded. High end shopping mall, the outer surrounding is astonishing. Great decoration outside with many tourist taking photos before entering the mall. On the inside you can buy mid-high end product and brand. Easy to reach via Siam BTS. Go to the 4th floor if you want to eat (food passage), or the ground floor.

Wow. Wow, it's a great place to window shop or just see what folks can afford when they are not busy. Amazing for someone without lots of money it's like rich people museum. Get a fancy dessert and have fun being looked at like a wallet.

Great, but expensive. Siam Paragon is easy to get to with the BTS Sky Train.
Large and modern shopping mall with a lot of opportunities. Mostly there are big brands and expensive stores, so depending on what you are looking for - don't go here if you're not ready to spend some money..!

Best shopping mall with European and American Brand . It's a big mall with so many big store .You can find what ever you need from clothes to electronic accessories (Food-Entertainment place-Clothes-Shoes-Jewelries-Watch....)It needs at least one full day to visit it
Great. Large modern shopping mall. Great for dining and entertainment as Siam Ocean World is in the basement. Very nice to spend some time there.
Swanky. I hate shopping but visiting this place is insane. So rich, especially all the buggati's, royles Royce etc upstairs.

The best Shopping Mall in Bangkok.. Easily accessible with the Sky Train (BTS), Siam Paragon is probably the best Shopping center in the city offering all sorts of brands, restaurants and Entertainment. You could easily spend 3 hours there and enjoy yourself.
Amazing. So much to see and do. This place gap it all and caters for all. However you got to be very well off to shop to ya drop in this place. Wow

Wonderful place. Siam Paragon it's the best mall of all Thailand, very big, clean and full of different shops. It was incredible to see inside so many italian shops and italian brand. I bought many souvenir and they were all nice, even it's expensive. but level is high! THe restaurant are marvellous and foods great, toilette clean and neat, it was a really nice experience.Recommended!!!

Entire world under one roof. You name it and you will get it here. From all the cuisines around the world. Biggest brands and high end cars. You should definitely carry big bucks if you intend to shop here. Try buddhy belly yogurt for sure

Elegant Shopping Mall. Very clean very spacious and a lot mid range brands to shop around. Like your usual shopping mall in your own country, not much of a surprise for us travellers. But if you're those who like travelling to go for shopping purpose, this place is one of the best spot in this area! You can go to Madame Tussaunds from this shopping mall around 10-15 minutes walk.

Siam Paragon. Beautiful luxury shoping centre, in the centre of Bangkok lots of big brands and designer shops. 1xlarge department store, easily reached by sky train. An oasis from the heat, bustle and hustle of down town Bangkok . Also large array of restraunts catering to all tastes and prices.

Big Expensive Mall. Siam Paragon is one of the largest shopping malls in the world, with an incredible array of restaurants and food outlets for every budget. Shopping however is very expensive. What else can you expect from a mall where one can literally walk in and purchase a Lamborghini? If you're an avid booklover, don't miss Kinokuniya bookstore on the 3rd level. Check out Siam Square next to it for a more budget friendly experience.

Great but bad deal for westerners . It is a very luxurious mall with different buildings. I check the western brands and they are about 30% more expensive than in Europe for the same things. And some brands like guess even 50% higher. There is one of the buildings that is not the main one where you can find local brands and I really like it. It is not a must go
High end shopping. Branded items where you can find at most country. Huge food court below lots of choices of food available . Spoilt for choice here
Great but very expensive . I like the design & the decoration of the mall mainly. Otherwise it is very expensive. But you must visit the aquarium ground floor very nice & lovely staff.

Great shopping . Siam Paragon is a good shopping mall with every type of shop on offer. Plenty of bargains to be had also. All the high end designer stores plus lots of Thai merchandise very clean surroundings and lots of good restaurants.... A really good shopping experience

Lovely mall. A really nice thing to do if you want a break from the busy, hot streets of Bangkok! This is a lovely, clean mall and has a wide range of shops from the super rich to the regular high street shops! We went for the H&M which was good, but loads of other nice ones too!

Big shopping mall in Bangkok. Siam Paragon is located at the city center of Bangkok, on Sukhumvit Road. It's one of the big shopping mall in Bangkok and you can find a lot of your enjoyable here ; shopping either brand name and local brand in both department store an plaza. Many of very nice restaurant of international food, Thai food, Sea food and many of dessert, coffee shop and café. You also can enjoy with the movie program with nice Cinema. Kid zone also available here for your kids. If you're coming to Bangkok, don't miss this one.

Luxurious and spacy. Not your ordinary mall experience. From top designer stores, to luxury car showroom such as Rolls and McLaren, to great restaurants and attractions. Do not miss Sea world, right in Siam Paragon mall!

Beautiful mall with an impressive food level. I have travelled to BKK many times and often gave this mall a miss, in favour of Central World where I usually stay nearer to (that also looked more wallet friendly somewhat). This time round I took some time to really walk around the mall and I am impressed. It is huge with many big brands and had an aquarium within the mall. If shopping for big brands is not really your idea of shopping in bkk (like myself), you should really check out their cinema level which is amazing. Other than that, give their ground floor food level a try. There were range for any type of eaters. Some cafes and bakeries are so fancy you really don't know which one to go for as everything look so yummy. And the thing is, if you have been paranoid of eating street food at bkk's true blue street vendors, there are stalls here selling Thailand's street food at a much better hygiene level -- and not at any more expensive price too. I had this fried banana fritters snacks at 30 Bahts for 8 pieces and a Thai milk tea at about 35 or 40 Bahts. I would say this is heaven if you love food, and especially if you are traveling in a group and can share the food varieties.

The gourmet market . I literally love the gourmet market very much. There are lots of delicious food, souvenir and snacks of Thailand, blue elephants products... I m particularly into the food counters. The lobster linguine costed 590b was great. Unfortunately, my photo couldn't show how nice it actually was

Grand and amazing !. This is one the finest malls I have ever seen .It is massively spread and is connected to all the modes of transport. The place is a one stop shop for all the people specially tourists. You will find a wide variety of various brands and local products as well .

Worth visiting if you would like to see exclusive mall. A lot of brands, VERY big place, however (compared to European and US pricing) would not recommend to shop there ans the prices are rather high, even during sales season. Great foodcourt at level 0.

The cinema is amazing. Another big shopping mall in Bangkok, although the mall is a bit dated compared with other malls along the road. It is still full of a wide variety of shops to wander around and is very crowded, like the others, though. However, the best bit I would recommend is the cinema inside the mall, especially the 4DX (a 4D cinema experience) is amazing: it is like you are in the movie, and I would recommend it especially for action/adventure movies, like Star Wars (which we watched) or Jurassic World. It is also cheap, and is as much as normal 3D in the UK, so is great value for money!

Locate in the central area of shopping. Easy to travel, go by BTS or Bus, and also close to Siam Discovery, Siam Center and MBK. It's also have night market which locate opposite Siam Paragon.So it's quite a good place if you want to shopping

Very busy and expensive, but amazing. We have malls back home, but nothing like this place.Level after level of huge stores and thousands of food options. We aren't big fans of designer brands or spending thousands on jeans but this place had many of those options if that's what your looking for. We took interest in people watching and the cars we'll only dream of having more than shopping. But we can definitely say they had something to entertain any age range.Worth checking out for an hour or 2.
Big mall. This Paragon mall is so big. Its mostly shops and restaurants but has some stuff for kids and good cinema too, we watched a movie was good.

Great shopping experience ! Amazing food court . Great selection of shops but more commercial . There is a great food court to try on the ground floor. Good place to stop to cool down in the Bangkok heat

Wow. Wow! This place is huge! Coming from UK I have never seen anything like it 7 (maybe more) floors packed with so many brands. Lots of English ones too, including: Boots, Costa, Starbucks, Mcdonalds which is reassuring in a foreign country, especially as a solo traveller a mcdonalds every now and then is a huge treat!

Time to kill. Done with all the sightseeing and looking for a cool civilized place to cool off with delicious food, dessert cafe and ready for some retail therapy Siam Paragon beckons. Close to BTS Siam. If you have more time to kill there is a Cineplex, spa centre and car showroom. Cool hangout place!

Lots to do. Wow, not only are there a zillion places to eat and shop, there is a movie theater and bowling on the top floor! Many places to sit and read while you drink coffee or eat ice cream! Clean and average prices.
Luxury but expensive. If u need expensive brand names goods go to Siam paragon the most luxurious and fantastic malls in bangkok

Shopping with international flair. Not far away from the BTS train, this Mall is definitely Luxurious International standards.
Most European brands are there: French, Italian, American, Spanish...
Here you can spend your money.
The premises are clean , spacious, very agreable.
A/C very strong though!
However I am not sure a lot of Thai people can afford these prices.

Lovely shopping mall. I go to Siam paragon every time I visit Bkk. They got every brand I need. The only one thing is some stories sellers weren't every nice..gave pol attitude ...seriously ...need to improve this.
Typical mall. For those who like to buy expensive brands, you can visit this mall. Though to be honest, nothing is special here. Just same as the other malls.

most attraction shopping mall. “One of the most attraction shopping mall in Thailand”
I've been there for many times and most of the time I went to watched a movie with my friends and had a lunch or even a dinner .
Shopping. Lots of shops lots of fun. Also food court and small restaurants! All choices of food. Many japanese eateries. Great for desert lovers as well.

A place where you like to buy expensive staff. Siam Paragon is really expensive Mall to those who is looking for A BIG SHOES this is a place and the price is too expensive. If you want to buy expensive staff this place is for you. But there's a lot things that you might enjoy in this Mall. Go to Cinema Theater, 3D Museum, Computer Video Games, Siam Ocean world and so many things they upgrade it, so it might not in my list.
Good Mall. Very nice ambience and have lots of Resto. Tried Happy Beef for Thai food and everything we ordered was surprisingly tasty and good.Siam Paragon is very baby friendly.

World class mall. Has all the entertainment and shopping options imaginable. Great movie theaters with many special effect and luxury viewing choices offered. Bottom level has great casual dining options to choose from.

One of the most attraction shopping mall in Thailand. I've been there for many times and most of the time I went to watched a movie with my friends and had a lunch or even a dinner but the price of this shopping is high as well

Waste of time, overpriced. Why go to the malls in a city like Bangkok which has so much more of interest to offer than these dreadful tempels of commercialism? Who wants two Philippe Patek stores only 100 metres apart when you're not going to buy these ridiculously expensive show off items? Prices are much higher than in London, where I live.
awesome place to visit.. Paragon is one of the most popular place in Bangkok. There are many activities to do here like siam ocean world, department store, restaurant, cineplex.

visit my blog for more info and pictures. Siam Paragon a very well noted tourist attraction, even for the locals. I love the shopping in BKK! It will surprise just about any shopaholics. The plazas are huge, like every single one of them. Not going into full detail, you will be able to waste hours at the mall, especially Siam. It is catered towards high-end fashion, all Chanel, Hermes, LV streaming in your face. So we had a quick snack here before our movies (another post). The way it works here is that they devote an ENTIRE floor or sometimes even two, to just food!! IT'S HEAVEN! Prior to ordering any meal from the counter, you must acquire a reloadable card to use in substitution of money. That's their only acceptable method of payment. The stalls are divided by cuisine and beyond. It's slightly overwhelming at first.

Excusive. The time we visit Bangkok is always the start of the festive season, and the Siam Paragon is always adorned with Christmas to the highest of standards especially the main entrance. This shopping centre is of a high standard and has all the usual high standard ranges from Gucci to Levi , with an excusive food hall in the basement . and a cinema on one of the upper floors. During the working week it is very spacious and easy to get around so you can browse at your leisure , however of the week end it is very busy and can be a bit of a push and a shove as you try to negotiate the escalators . A very pleasant shopping centre with high standards , but avoid the week ends if you can.

You can buy everything from fancy denim to mochi to cars. . This place has a floor full of designer cars for purchase (porsche, maserati, ducati bikes, bentleys). There's a huge movie theatre, a whole slew of sushi restaurants plus more food, a bowling alley, a club/lounge, designer clothing stores, an awesome toy store, many stands of ice cream, fro yo, mochi, etc. my boyfriend and I were in complete awe! we aren't mall people, but went to the theatre and had a lot of fun walking around this place.

Good shopping mall. Siam Paragon is the best mall i have been so far, well designed with a large range of different products. From the jetset life to just the stuff you need on a daily basis. Spent half a day just wandering around and enjoying the place. Especially loved to see the expensive cars from a few inches away.

Leave The Wife At Home. Unless you have just picked up your lottery winnings then my advice is do not take your wife anywhere near Siam Paragon or you will be leaving with an empty wallet and a maxed out credit card.
All joking aside, some great shopping here and well worth a visit.

Puts Beverly Hills to Shame! . Wow, what a great complex! A family could make a full day of this place during a rainy or extra hot Bangkok day. The shopping is first class with all of the top brands. The eating is amazing with a 4th floor that has 15-20 restaurants, as well as a lower level food court that is huge with what appeared to be over 100 very nice eating options of all kinds and a gourmet grocery store that carries Japanese Wygu beef, among other amazing things. We saw Star Wars at the 5th floor Cineplex. Though a little pricy at about $30USD per ticket, it was in a large screen theater that had huge reclining lounge chairs. It is worth coming early to hang out in the first class lounge where you get a complimentary Starbucks drink and a dessert of some kind. If you are running late, a server brings the food/drink to your seat. This was a first class venue!!
Great. Paragon mall is very impressive, we did some shopping (was mostly expensive but nice shops), we ate at the food court (cheap but good food) and we watched movie (amazing cinema).

Foodie paradise!. I cannot stop missing the soup I got from the supermarket at the basement, even though I had it in February & then again in June. The crab bisque is simply heavenly. Siam Paragon houses 2 of my favorite brands- Uniqlo & Naraya. It's also my favorite shopping mall because it is simply bustling with stalls & restaurants serving wonderful cuisine. Spend a day shopping at the 2 other shopping malls nearby as well ;)

Huge High End Mall. Luxury mall ver expensive bring your life savings! Food court large many options personally I liked the salad bar in the grocery section. Safe to walk from hotels well lite enjoy shopping!!!
Excellence. This is definitely my favorite mall in Bangkok ;-) The selection is fantastic and the layout of the mall is very convenient.

HiSo Mall. Siam Paragon is "THE" mall of Bangkok. The shops, food court and movie theater are high end but open to all. I was there for the Star Wars weekend premier. The BTS/Skytrain stops in front of the mall for your shopping and people watching enjoyment.
Wow, everything you can imagine is here!. Shopping from high end to typical shopping along with an aquarium to IMAX theater. It is a must see!

Massive shopping mall. Many luxury stores and western chaines. The foodhall is quite unhealthy but they have a few good places to eat on the other side. You kind of forget that you're in thailand when you are there because there is hardly any thai shops or thai style items. Very beautiful mall though and if your interested in luxury of global chains definitely go there.
Good variation. I like the variety of shops, restaurants and events taking place in and around Siam Paragon. Not much I can not find here, but the price level is a bit high of course.

definitely no fakes in this Mall. When it comes to shopping malls, Siam Paragon has way more than the lot. If your a high end hifi nut, you will drool, audiophiles freak out!Every type of mid to highest of high end couture , one gleaming Jewel emblazoned leather tote after another . Fancy that new Bentley or Porsche 911, bring your platinum card and watch it melt!but this isn't exclusively for the obscenely rich few, the place is packed , and there's cool book stores and cafes which are dimply dripping in urban chic- easily at hand when one has seen enough bling.prepare to be dazzled!
Nice!. Biggest one yet! Omg huge foodcourt.. fresh supermarket,not to mention huge and have all kinds of fresh veggys n stuff plus great views,i love it! Childrens playground ground floor..
top shopping in bkk. in bkk you have many fake & copy but here you have all the shop of the mark like NIKE QUIKSILVER EASTPAC easy to go morning is better a place to see

Not out mall. The Siam Paragon mall is a bit overdone and unclear for who it is. For example there is a floor with all exclusive car brands like Maserati, Aston Martin and McLaren. Besides that, there is a floor with the fashion top brands like Dior, Louis Vouitton and Gucci. And then also floors with brands like H&M and Zara. Food corner on top was not the best
Great shopping and entertainment center. Great food court with huge options. Multiplex with imax and 4dx is great. Shopping is a bit expensive but look out for deals. Good location.
Nice shopping mall. Good array of high end and mid end brands. Especially love the food court and huge supermarket at the basement. A must visit when you're in Bangkok.
Top End Shopping. We came here mostly for lunch as the shops are designer. There is a great selection of food and the toilets were very clean and funny

Personally no more Dubai for me...... I used to go Dubai for the Dubai Mall, now I found this place, I think I no longer think Dubai Mall is my favourite....!!The food court is awesome and the supermarket is also great.....This is obvious a very biased review, but if you travel to EAT like me, this could possibly be the best mall in the world...!!
Mostly tourists and higher-end brands. The place is crowded as people try to take shelter from the heat outside. The brands and eateries are more premium here, so it may not be as wallet-friendly.

Huge and they have sea life. Very huge mall. Similar like pavilion mall, KL. With better food court ... so many yummy and cheap food here. Love it. We went to the sea life too. The kids love it. So many sharks we saw. So excited. The price a bit high though...

Great Shopping Mall. Siam Paragon has almost everything you need. There's a lot of restaurant such as local delicacies in food court, fine Thai restaurant, world chain restaurant at B1 floor and many more on 4th floor. If you are looking for good quality souvenir, you can find them here too. But if you just want to browsing for some stuff, high-end or even counter brand, there are plenty of things around.

higher end with the price tag to match. Siam Paragon is very different than street shopping offering authentic high end goods. There are also boutique style restaurants on the bottom floor which offer all kinds of Thai and international cuisine. You can find Ralph Lauren to Moschino here. It's humongous, so it includes other European and Japanese brands. Hordes of shoppers from other Asian countries go there to find goods.

Interesting mix. Many upscale shops of the type you could see in many cities. The difference is the food. A large very clean and exceptional food market and a large food court with a wide variety of cuisines and brands. Much larger and more interesting than anything I have seen in the US.

Paragon Shopping. I really enjoyed this shopping centre, it was a pleasant alternative to MBK as it was less 'markety' and more relaxed for the shopper. Great food court on the lower level which gave excellent value for money on local dishes too. Special tip - if you don't mind higher temperatures, take a jacket to this venue as the air con was set to cold!

Impressive shopping complex!. Very glitzy shopping complex offering big brand names, great food and entertainment. Great place to get away from the heat but more of a reflection of big city shopping mall that can be experienced in most international capital cities. Not a true reflection of Thai culture. The food choices are very good and the quality is great.

Great place to spending free time with my friends from all around the world.. Siam Paragon is really good place where I recommend it to people from all around the world who want to have good time at the shopping mall in Bangkok. Luxury shopping mall with really convenient to travel to this place and it has many many good products what we are looking for from all around the world.

Best Shopping Mall in Thailand!. This place is perfect for tourist and locals alike. It is situated near by Siam station, so it is easily accessible via BTS. Amazing light displays outside at its entrance! It has a very classy ambiance and was so beautiful inside! The top floors are mostly high-class fashion brands which is quite typical of 'Paragon' shopping malls all over the globe. It's beautiful, grand and majestic, but you probably wouldn't do your shopping here. It is at the basement level that Siam Paragon truly shines. It has a MASSIVE basement food court, along with a hypermart that allows you to buy your food and have it cooked by chefs inside on the spot! The hypermart sells an array of foods, ranging from seafood to premium beef. There were stations with chefs where the chefs cook up your purchases immediately! It was amazing! Not only so, there was alot of restaurants in the basement level! One of those was the Happy Beef restaurant, where we thoroughly enjoyed their beef noodles! I would be giving a more comprehensive food list/guide in my blogspot where I would be including many photos that I took! Do visit the site by clicking on my bio, where I have provided a link! Overall, this was my best experience in Bangkok! I would suggest taking the BTS or Tuk-tuk to the location as it may not be of walking distance to most nearby hotels (the walking path is rather complicated...)
Too many people!. Too many people from local to tourists. It might be shopping paradise to some people but for me just a place to avoid hot weather in Bangkok.

Amazing shopping. This will be the second time we have been to this Mall, but it never surprises us to be wowed by its size and glamour. The high end shops are all here, so unless you have nerves of steel, leave your credit cards In The hotel and come just to browse so as you are not leaving bangkok with a hefty credit card bill... If the shopping does nothing for you, the restaurants are plentiful and there is also a cinema which is quite common in Thailand malls

Another Glitzy Shopping Mall. you will find these shopping centres all over Asia. Parts of Bangkok resemble Singapore now with Uber glass filled "mega" shopping centres full of designer brands. Food Courts are okay otherwise its just another shopping centre that could be anywhere in the world
Wow. Very nice shopping center! You can go to the ground floor and have food from the many restaurants and bar or go upstairs and look for you next car... A Bentley maybe? 😉

Mrs. Larger than life Bangkok shopping centre !All the usual shopping on steroids.Large variety of shops,movie theatre but the food hall is something else .Well worth a visit to see this exceptional food hall where you can sit down and eat or takeaway a large variety of western and eastern foods.

Superb mall and aquarium. Large shopping mall with branded stuff, nice place with few people going around excellent food court. In the ground floor the Ocean world, one of the best aquarium. Buy both tickets for ocean world and madam tusade which you will have a small discounted price

Good shopping and amazing food court. A large shopping centre with mostly designer label stores, tech mall 10 mins away, but good practical options for getting phone SIMs for travellers, bookshops and more. Kidszania was a wonderful place within the centre to take our 8 year old for their entertainment. We were getting a bit sick of street food/local foods while in Bangkok and this place had many good reasonably priced alternatives.

5 stars . It's one of amazing shopping mall ,many brands , many shops always a lot of people there , location is easy by BTS (sky train ) I'm always there if I need to buy some clothes and even there's many shopping mall close to the mall like MHM and Siam centre , you will like the place of course specially the women , always if I'm in bangkok I need to go there so you always need to go and try

Nice. The shopping mall is big. Sea Life Bangkok Ocean World is inside the mall. You can easily buy entrance ticket at their display booth in the mall instead of long queue at the aquarium ticket booth.

A shopping centre to visit. It has everything! I don't get tired of coming here. It's like there's always a new restaurant, cafe or boutique to see everytime I visit. So convenient because you can take any transport (bts, taxi, tuktuk,bus).
great. amazing to see and well air-conditioned but the shops are very high end and expensive, e.g. Louis Vuitton. great to go and an amazing cinema

Good Centrally located shopping centre. We visit here often. It is adjacent to Siam BTS station and has everything for brand names under one roof. You can even buy a Ferrari if you want to. Great food court down stairs, the aquarium and Madame Tuasades (which I spelt wrong).Check it out

Not a shopper but the food court is quite amazing.. I went to Siam Paragon twice during my recent trip to Bangkok. I wasn't looking for anything to shop but I saw that it was up there on trip advisor in terms on things to do in Bangkok so it was worth checking out. The location is super central with tons to do around the mall. I took the BTS Metro to Siam station and there is an entrance to the mall without exiting the station. It's a good place to shop for Western brands or just to have a quick look at where the wealthy people in Bangkok shop and what they buy! I particularly liked the food court at the mall in the lower level. It had several options and was quite unlike anything I have experienced before. You can get all types of food and desserts.
