I really liked the restaurant named 'Peppery' (warning: food is very spicy but delicious). I would recommend this place for a quick stop to cool down and get a snack.

High end shopping mall . This is just a huge shopping mall with lots of high end brands and a few high street shops. Similar to any shopping centre in Europe. Not our cup of tea as we came to explore the depths of thailand. Very busy and pricey. They have a cinema and sea life aquarium inside too.

Generic, high end brand ghetto. Sterile mall environment, no atmosphere to indicate that you're in Thailand. Shiny, new and totally without personality. Okay if you worship the god of shopping. Otherwise don't bother - try MBK instead.
Shopping in the air con. Lots of shops but much more expensive in oz and fashions a little dated. Not really worth going to if you're a keen shopper, save your money for back home!

Upmarket shopping experience. Siam Paragon is one of the more upmarket malls around in Bangkok and houses all the major international brands offering shoppers a feast of apparels, clothings and f&b. There are no shortage of eateries scattered around the mall including a food court on the lower level. There is also a showroom for high end automobiles such as Maserati, McLaren & Rolls Royce. A great place to escape from the scorching heat & spend an evening with the family.

Awesome shopping paradise, food court, madam tusseuds, aquarium. I would recommend it for those who are brand product lovers and who prefer fixed price shop. Those who are food lover, it's there place to be. Japanese, Cantonese, Thai, fast food, ice cream, juice bar. Madame tusseuds the wax museum is there. There is also aquarium. This is a good one. Any one can buy two together in offer.
Nice and big. Very good place for shopping and also entertainment. There is also an aquarium, a lot of restaurants, many shops and a cineplex ( i can recommend the VIP tickets ).

There's Halal food here!!!!. We were here to look for Halal food court which we found online but couldn't find it there till we came across this Royal India which was Halal. The mall itself is very huge! And there's an Ocean Life something at the basement level. Didn't try that out.

Fun to visit. Went to this mall to check it out. It is very well organized and contains lots of nice brands. First floor has a gourmet market where you can find lots of fruits and vegetables. In addition, you find all sorts of dried fruits and Thai sweet treats. The place also contains a delicious sushi shop that you can buy from by piece. ( about 45 or 50 Bahts per piece). Upper floors have brands and a cinema floor ontop. Busy, nice vibe, well worth a visit.

Huge. Great place to spend time with friends and family. You can go to Thailand's best aquarium with great number of fishes and other water and even land creatures. Mall itself is very big one can spend full day there.

Excellent Mall. A great modern mall. It is right by the Siam metro stop. There is an excellent range of shops including high-end brands, but mainly affordable things. A lot of food options from all over the world, and a really nice modern cinema upstairs. A highlight of Bangkok - as a Thai friend of mine put it, it is a sign of how far the city has come in just the last decade.
Wow. This is a mall that you can go from bts.The stores are the most expensive brands like louis vuiton ,Gucci and others.Good to see
Great for foodies!. The food hall selection is mind-blowing. We went in to escape the sweltering heat outside and ended up staying for a few hours - eating our way through some fusion Thai food.

Upmarket and clean. Nice mall with upmarket products. Their food court is also exciting. Good variety of street food in an air conditioned setting. Prices are only about 10baht higher but you get the comfort.

Shopping and Food Paradise. Simply the best shopping mall in SE asia. After this mall opened, I doesn't want to go to Singapore anymore.
This mall also has many good restaurant even the food court has many good food stall.

Shopping at Siam. Great place for eating out and doing the shopping. The market on the ground floor is really very good with products from all over the world. You can get pretty much everything you want/need in a one stop shop.
For original from the top!. If You like the best and no copy! But booring for me... The fish and seafood restaurant on 4 floor are super...

Great store. Nice store with boutique and independent shops.
I bought some shoes and unfortunately couldn't fit into some nice shorts but that's another story.
Definitely take a stroll through and enjoy the shopping experience.
Nice place for shopping. Located in center of Bangkok. Siam Paragon contains a lot of well designed shops. Everything you want from shopping. Creative interiors.
U can find what do u want there. I love this mall u can stay all the day there u can find whatever u want ,a big food area with multi choice , the mall are very clean and the shops always on sale ,
Shopping centre. Everything you may need. Affordable shopping, but more shops for higher end fashion with more painful price tags. There's many eatteries here too though as well which is great.
Too Expensive . It is cheaper to buy the same clothes back home in Europe than here. It seems that this mall is for extremly rich saudis who doesnt care about the prices. Nice restaurants though

AMAZING FOOD COURT!!. High end luxury shopping centre, we came to see all the luxury cars on the 2nd floor. Very glamorous and beautiful. Stumbled upon the food court on the ground floor by mistake- WOW! Never seen so many sweet vendors! Amazing gourmet supermarket that's worth a visit. So many places to eat cheaply and rest your weary feet! Worth a visit just for the food court.
excellent. We go here often when in Bangkok as there is plenty of choice whatever type of food you like, great for kids and teens with lovely shops and salons, everything you could want at a mall!

Great Day.... Combined this with a visit to the IMAX on the 5th floor (to see Star Wars) and a visit to the tech centre Pangtip Plaza which is a 10 minute walk away. Great shops, lots of places to eat, stuff to do, my teenage boys enjoyed it, nuff said.

Great Upmarket Shopping Centre. We went there to get some CD's and to buy a new wallet for me. We stayed and had some food and went to see Star Wars 7 at the Imax cinema while there. I love Thai cinemas as they sell great merchandice of the the movies which you just don't get in the UK. (I got an R2D2 drinking cup).

Incredible! . Massive and stocks everything one could need or want! There is a huge variation of stores but also a huge language barrier. The center is large and is actually so big you can get lost at times and not know where you are.

Big and beautiful . The setting around This place was stunning that's why I had to write this review. So beautiful. Inside is gorgeous too but can't get over how lovely it looked from the outside. Similar shops again to usual malls but we liked here very much.

Excellent in everyway. This place has it all from outstanding food courts and different restaurants offering food and drink to a brilliant cinema and just amazing shopping...the world best shopping is here and it's here to stay...Highly recommended
Paragon Experience.... The layout was very organised and just have about EVERYTHING you need! Restaurants recommended are Fuji and Crystal Jade.

Expensive shops. A really big shopping mall and it had everything, even really expensive cars. So if you want to go out and spend a lot of money in these designer shops, this is the place to do it. There were many people and the christmas decorations were really beautiful.
Good place for everyone, old and young. Great place to visit if you have a big group, it has something for everyone. Lots of kids attractions. Great food hall and central location.

Excellent High End Shopping Mall. Siam Paragon is one of the best shopping mall with all the branded stores under one roof. They also have heaps of eateries to choose from. No shortage of food. They have a huge departmental stores that sells everything you need and all the items are the latest. There is a Kidzenia for kids to have fun. Love shopping there. Good place to shop, dine and relax.

Big mall and have everything here . It's a big mall, have everything under one roof. Lots of choices at the food court, very busy food court at anytime of the day. Price are quiet high for a food court meals compared to other places. Connected directly to BTS Siam, makes it very convenience and accessible. It's a must visit if you like shopping.

I love this place!. Everything you need in a department store. I love the Gourmet Market as for us it is the onestop shop for all our essentials. There are high end designer brands as well as beutiful expensive cars to look at. You cant go past the food hall where you can try a little bit of every style of dish for a small price. You will need to load up a card with some money to be able to pay for your meals in the main food court but considering meals are no more than $4AU you can't go wrong. One of the places high on my list of recommendations to visit whilst in Bangkok.

Amazing is the easy way to describe it!. So this quickly became our favorite mall! It wasn't far from our hotel and it had a wide range of shopping. And the food level is amazing! Can get so many different types of food in one place. Our favorite was a stand that sold various meats on skewers and had green chile which we miss from New Mexico. Also went to Sea Life here too. On the 4th floor of the Siam department store there is a place that sells lots of Thai crafts, clothes, silk, etc. Great place to get some good quality gifts. Can spend quite a few hours here.

Very expensive but good product range. Large shops, great selection of items. However very expensive despite our rand being slightly stronger than the baht. Easy to find from the street. Good coffee shops wishing the centers and the Asian department store was the largest we had ever seen. Such variety!

Amazing shopping. Went here on recommendation from a friend and it was amazing even if the shopping was high end. We were there for a couple of hours and still did not get to see everything. You could nearly spend the whole day here.

shopping extravaganza. very nice shopping mall with an excellent food court and movie theatre. offers a large variety of mid-range to luxury goods stores. If the heat and humidity get to you this is a great place to go to.

Best place ever. I LOVE The Siam Paragon Mall!!! Especially the food court!! The food court has such a large variety of foods to try at a good cost. The shops are top notch as well! There is everything you need and you can easily spend a day here!! There are movie theatres, Sea Life etc!
A shopping mall you'll never get bored!. Huge shopping malls where you can get anything you can think of. Just visited after Xmas and they have lots of discounts. Come! Shop until you drop!
Must visit : pork satay at basement. We always visited the basement stall which is selling the pork satay......one of the best in BKK and the crispy pork skin.....with the chili.....yummy
good shoppingmany brands many VAT return. Many famous brands and many shop give vat ticket for discount when fly back. Saved many money on big brands.

Good selection of higher end boutiques . A good centre if it is close to your hotel and you want a large mall experience. Typical high end designer shops with a few alternative designers.
Worth a visit.
High End Shopping. Lots of brand stores. Prices are the same as in USA. If you want high end shopping and not looking for bargains, this is definitely the place.
popular department store. It is suitable for shopping and easy to go　there. It is at BTS Siam square station.It is a popular place.

Pretty Cool. I live in Thailand so Siam Paragon is pretty cool. It has a lot of food offerings that I like to go to, and especially Krispy Kream. We like to window shop seeing as this upscale mall has nothing we can afford. We like to look at the shops that have 1,000,000 Baht cards for sale. It's fun.

Visit to aquarium and shopping at H&M. This shopping mall is pretty big selling luxury cars to cheap souvenirs. We saw the aquarium and ate at the food court. Even if you dont eat but looking around to see the variety of thai dishes possible is in itself exciting. You get pizza and pastas too.

shop till you drop. Siam Paragon is probably one of Bangkok's most exclusive shopping malls. You find all international brands for clothes, but also Thai shops, two really good book shops, Asia Books and Kinokuniya.
The Gourmet Market in the basement is food court and supermarket. You get a lot of imported stuff here, but also freshly grown organic veggies.
A Rather Japanese Shopping Mall. I personally think it is managed by Japanese, since there are so many Japanese shops and restaurants. Not to mention it has Japanese announcements too.
The pride of bangkok. The most famous department store in Bangkok located at the heart or Siam. It's luxury shopping which hi-end brand setted

Excellent. Brilliant for all ages
Huge mall
Very expensive goods
All branded
It has Siam Ocean World,Madame Tussade and Siam Discovery there

Shopping for die hard shopoers. Enough said from the title ... 👍👍
The place is well spruced up and very clean.
Wide selection of shops with impressive wall murals for those who love taking lots of selfies and wefies 🤗🤗

Underwhelling. After reading all the reviews we thought it would be a must see shopping centre. While it links to other smaller centres, there were a lot of high end shops with a Zara and HM being the only real mid range shops that were not that cheap even with sales in. The food court was amazing though,and so was the 4D experience at the cinemas on the top floor.

Huge, this is a shopping mall on steroids, very buzzy. I came across this shopping mall for the first time almost 10 years ago whilst randomly walking/exploring around Bangkok. I remember it was insanely hot and the Siam Paragon, newly built, was the only place I could find that provided shade and was air conditioned throughout. I found the mall in those days a very stale place, many of the units were either empty or waiting to be occupied and there was hardly any customers. It's changed a bit since those days. We visited Siam Paragon on the last day of our trip to Thailand before going to the airport. We found the food, shopping and general ambiance in this mall to be second to none and would stand up to any other high end shopping mall I've been to in Europe or the United States. The cinema on the 5th floor is huge and spectacular, replete with 4D and IMAX screens. Although the supermarket on the ground floor sells only the highest standard of ingredients and food, I found it to be very expensive (even by European standards) and would only appeal to the richer residents of Bangkok.  On the whole, we loved our visit to Siam Paragon and would highly recommend a visit.
Fantastic mall. Such an amazing mall. The sea world is fabulous. Wish we had more time here. Food court is superb and shopping is wonderful

Usual designer mall but there is jewelry shop on the 2nd floor that offers extremely competitive foreign exchange rates.. A high end mall with top designer brands as you find in most modern capital cities. Not more or less expensive than others I have been to although I must say that I was not really there for shopping. My tip is to use the currency exchange located in a Thai owned jewellery store on the second floor (can't remember the name) rates best I saw in Bangkok and much better than airport, kiosks, banks, etc. They give even better rates for big denomination foreign currency notes. €100 or €500 plus $. Food court great with plenty for all tastes and budgets plus gourmet supermarket at basement level

Great mall!. The Paragon is overall a great mall. The lower floor offers a massive food court with McDonalds to gourmet bakeries, ice cream shops, grilled vegetables and meat, and sit down restaurants.  The upper floors offer a variety of stores including Paragon, expensive cars, technology, sports, clothing and accessories.
One of the best shopping malls in BKK!. One of the most famous and luxuries malls in Bangkok you can find there almost everything you looking for! Also great selections of restaurant,

Nice to look at only. Siam Paragon is a high class shopping and entertainment centre. All the big brands and mostly originals (unlike the rest of Bangkok) However, it is quite expensive compared to nearby MBK. Really worth visiting just to stroll around. It also houses the Madame Tussaud Museum and the amazing Sea Life Aquarium.

Good Mall. The Siam Paragon is a good place go shopping and to get food. the mall has almost every type of food and shopping item there. The mall also has nice setups throughout the store and has good views from the windows. The Siam Paragon is a very gooc mall to shop at.

Great experience . I'm not a big fan of shopping malls, but I really like this one, you can find everything here, is huge. They have amazing cinemas, not so cheap, but at the end a you have a good experience. You'll find different kinds of food there. Go there watch a movie and refresh your self :)

Commercialism at its finest!. Wow, wow, wow! If you love shopping, this is the place to go. Every shop and every brand you can imagine under one roof. Oh and there is an aquarium in the shopping mall too.

Very decent mall with lots of shops. Very nice mall. You can find all the high brands and it is a good getaway from bangkok and its taxis and stress. You can find as well affordable shops like zara and h&m, etc... Plus there is a big food court and many restaurants.

The hipster destination of BKK. We tend to end up visiting Siam Paragon at least one time each trip to BKK, even though it's always mobbed, overpriced, and super trendy. Despite that, the design is unique and they have some great Hokkaido ice cream and milk stores that are just delish! I also had an amazing kanom jin one time in the food court. If you need to buy farang food you'll find some great ( yet pricey ) imported items.

Nice Shopping Area. The shopping complex have so many nice fashion shop including big shop like H & M,Zara etc.The ground floor have food court and Big Super market.The food court price is a little bit higher than Central world food court but not crowded.The taste is good.

Nothing like it!. I heard the Malls are all the rage in Bangkok, so I had to see for myself. I don't even like going to malls in my country, but I had to check out the popular mall in Bangkok, and it is everything that everyone has ever said! One stop shopping is an understatement! I've never seen a place where you can purchase a Bentley, a grand piano, high end apparel, go to the gym, go to the grocery store, and go to the theatre in the same place. And he food court! Never have I seen "white table cloth" restaurants at the mall! This mall is packed all the time and worth seeing! Put it on your list.

Fabulous shopping spot. Paragon was something. Many people, interesting shops and Star wars event! Many seemed to enjoy their weekend for shopping and it was great to have something very high-end and modern.

The best place to shop in Bangkok. It is unarguably the best place to shop in Bangkok. Right from plenty of options of dining to shopping for luxury brands to mid size spends - all under one roof.The icing on the cake is the kidzenia on the top floor where one can drop their kids for activities and they won't even call you as they would be deeply involved inside.

Siam Superlative. To write about shopping at Siam Paragon is like asking someone to write about all the fun things they did in the last 12 months ..it would take forever. There is always an exhibit just outside the mall and on my recent visit (a week ago) it was the Star Wars Xperience exhibition. As an American who grew up with George Lucas films, I was like a kid in a candy store entering the exhibit which had interactive games and displays of Star Wars characters.We have been here many times over last 10 years and always visit when we are in Bangkok. Be sure to see a movie at the Cineplex, and if your budget allows, buy the VIP seating or a 4-D experience. Just remember that only 1 or 2 movies are in 4D.If you are a foodie, a visit to the Gourmet Market is a must, on the ground floor level. I could easily spend 2-3 hours shopping here. Don't like shopping? Relax and nosh at the dozens upon dozens of cafes and restaurants. Enjoy!

Top shops. Shops with top brands, including shops we can find "at home"Beautiful exterior especially for night photosThis is also where you come if you go to sea world which is located at the far end of the mall on the lower levels

Great Department Store for any shopper!. There are many brand name shops both inside mall area as well as plaza area. Food court on the ground floor also deliver a savory taste from hundred menus with various style while value for money. After enjoy the food, you may choose to see some movie in the Paragon Cineplex theater on the 5th floor or amaze with underwater tunnel in the Sealife Bangkok Ocean World aquarium on the underground floor.

Cool. We went this shopping center 25 of Dec.2015 it was crazy crowded...Butlighting and decorations are amazing..also my doughter loves sea life ao we visited sea life part it was very nide aquarium and penguins and lots of sea animals you can see...shops and stuff are very kind but they do not know enough English so be patient..food court has also lots of choice ..Its huge mall..
The food hall is fantastic. Worth visiting for the fantastic food hall and abundance of restaurants .A real treat.There are designer stores as well H&M and Zara

A must visit mall in Bangkok. A really great mall with all great brands available under single roof. Very easily accessible by BTS. Loved the food court and enjoyed spending time and shopping in this mall.
beautiful mall. ts beautiful mall but i found a scarf at 3000 baht.that tells something about the place ..its an excellent place but surely someone was buying something.

A great shopping mall. An excellent shopping mall where you can find everything. The part with restaurants and coffee shops are fantastic. But it's always crowded so it's very difficult to get a seat, even if there are 50 restaurants. In the shopping mall you buy anything from luxury cars to a t-shirt.

Nice but nothing special as such . It is a good place for shopping but it is limited as such to fashion. It connects to Centre Point where you can shop for electronic items. Not a must see place for tourists but if you are in the area and looking for fashion - clothes, bags, shoes snd accessories, it is worth a visit.

So till you drop!. Not much to say other than this place has it all! From expensive brand stores to "normal" premium stores.Connected with several other malls next to, so set aside a full day for shopping!

Nice Shopping centre . If you are wanting to visit some boutique shops or designer brands then this is one of the places you should visit. Offers a variety of good quality shopping brands, along with a nice food court and cinema plex upstairs.
Good shopping place. This shopping mall has everything you need, and lots of restaurants. Easy access via public transportation and the skywalk. But can get very crowded at times.

Basement is the best!. Siam Paragon is like the usual shopping mall. If you are a foodie like me, just head straight to the basement as there is a pretty good mango sticky rice shop, to the corner there is the raved about After You cafe and all around various street food which are affordable and taste good. :)

Brand names galore. Good shopping centre to stock up on brand name items. Easy to get to via the BTS. Change your money at the SuperRich money changers at the BTS rather than at the shopping centre for a better rate.
gem of bangkok shopping paradise. top of most visited site in bangkok shopping district is paragon. it is a giant mall connect to skytrain so it's very easy to access. don't miss it!

The Siam Paragon and its exclusive shops, but there's more.... The Siam Paragon is of course an exclusive assortment of shops, stores and accessories, but for me it was where I had and fell in love with my first sampling on Tom Yum soup. This mix of meat, seafood, veggies, a dumpling and loads of spicy seasoning was such an explosive taste in my mouth, I knew I had to have this special treat again on this visit and future visits. Purchase your food card at the counter that can be used at any of the stations at the food court for that day. My first night in town I headed here and they were sold out of the Tom Yum soup, so I was disappointed and made it a point to head over the next day, earlier of course, and finally had the soup I fell in love with all over again.There is a great selection of other food shops on this floor and I will check out some of these other stores before leaving the country. It’s a can’t miss spot when touring around the city. All of the trendy youth also hang out here with their friends. The Christmas decorations are very nice and during Dec/Jan there is a special exhibit outside near the fountains of various decorated model elephants.FYI: The rabbit transit card also works here and you receive a 10% discount off each transaction.

Shopping . A huge indoor mall selling everything you would. need. Many many staff to help. A combination of Selfridges in London & Dubai Mall. Air conditioned to get out of the hot sticky Bangkok weather. A very good food hall with many choices. Our teenagers loved it.
Shopping . Go there for brand and so you don't find cheap staffWorth to see. Don't miss aquarium in the first floor

Loved the aquarium. The aquarium was the winner for us, food selection was nice and the shopping options goes without saying. Didn't see many malls in the city, but comparing it to what we have back home in KL, definately a 5 star for me.
5 star shopping at its finest. Blows away and mall in any country, almost overwhelming. No matter what you like, you can find it here. Simply unbelievable.
When U want the BEST. This is a high end mall but also great food court on lower level and Paragon Department store has some good bargains
Best shopping expirence in Thailand . Clean, modern, and luxurious this mall is A+. From the food to the cinema I was throughly satisfied with my expirence here. Will most definitely return.

Luxury and glitz!. Wow this place was huge and shiny! I loved walking around and just seeing what was going on.Mainly high dollar Western luxury shops. It even has an aquarium! It was so very different than the other Bangkok Malls but very similar to others I have been in other parts of the world.They had an interesting fund raiser in the main floor called The Elephant Parade- with basic elephant sculptures being decorated by artists. They were for sale and you could also buy various sized replicas. Apparently thy donate $$ to various charities that work with elephants. It was fun to look around at the creations

Movie with massage is very expensive. Went to Siam Paragon Cineplex to have the experience of "watching a movie on a comfortable chair with a blanket and snack, and have a 15min massage". At the end, I gave up - the price for the ticket was around 25 euros!!! Good news: all the movies have subtitle or audio in English, so I choose another option (for around 5 euros). Rooms are huge, really new, clean and comfortable chairs. Screen is huge and digital, probably the best cinema room I have ever been. Interesting experience when everybody stands up (including me, of course) during the national official music for the King)... Regular ticket totally worthy.
High end mall. Layout of stores is just A++The mall features mostly high end stores but is easily connected to the market and near shopping areas.

Impressive Mall. This is the mall for shopping , eating and entertainment everything in one place. There are Big Branded shops for people who want top end fashion products. Massive range of restaurants with very impressive decorations. Entertainments - for adults - 4D movie theatre, for kids- Kidzania, Aquarium etc. There was also elephant parade exhibition at that time which was amazing.

Shopping paradise!!. A luxury mall with many shopping options and window-shopping too. They have all top brands of the world and a food court too. Even if you don't want to buy something, just go and have a stroll in this mall and it will leave you freshened.

I love the Gourmet Market. My friends and I enjoyed shopping at the Gourmet Market located at the ground floor of the mall. It offers so many variety of food items. We enjoyed tasting and eventually bought Thai delicacies such as the dried langka, dried cherries, tamarind. I also got to buy natural organic stuff from the area in their market that sells those kinds of products. Do not forget to claim for your VAT refund for amount over 2,000 baht I think. You can only claim on the day of purchase.

Not too bad. Great shops and 1 bad one.... I only visited the swanky food court in the basement level and walked through the ground level. They had the Elephant Parade display when I was there and it added a fun element to the mall. Great shops: 1) Coco Bubble Tea (great pearls!)2) Nantsuttei Ramen (crab ramen is awesome! Great staff and smiley manager. The Japanese chef comes out to greet guests too.) Shops you should never visit: 1) Nippon Kai (basement level) - bad food, expensive prices and unhappy non-English speaking staff who are not interested in the customers. Worst restaurant of my Bangkok trip. We left hungry, dissatisfied, angry and frustrated at being ignored. Staff made us feel like we were a burden and it was a chore to serve us. A major ripoff.Siam Paragon should really screen the quality of their tenants, to ensure the satisfaction of their footfall customers.

Enormous shopping and food mall. Everything you could want including buying a Rolls Royce to having a hamburger. Foods from everywhere including a super market with gourmet items and foods from all over the world. top floor are movie theaters ideal to cool off on a hot day.
Huge Mall. It s a luxury mall, you will find here the top brands : Louis vuitton, Chanel, tods, Gucci...Not for souvenirs of thailandor good price...The food court is ok
Nice shopping. Nice place for both shopping and eating. A little high prices compare to MBK but here is no copies of the product

Incredible Luxury Shopping Mall. I consider myself a traveler that dives into local culture and tries to avoid touristy spots as much as possible. Malls are NEVER in my itinerary. It was a Sunday and I was walking around a relatively quiet Bangkok when I remembered I left my DSLR Macro Lens at home (I'm a photographer). I figured the next best thing was to find an attachable lens for my iPhone. I googled Apple stores in Thailand hoping to find something such as an Olloclip but to no available. However, under Apple's website listed authorized retail stores in Thailand under names such as iStore at the Siam Paragaon Mall (Asians are obsessed with knockoff apple names i.e. iCafe). Great... here we go.I waved down a Tuk Tuk from TKS road to Siam Paragon for 200THB (might be able to bargain less). As I arrived, I found out that all the locals hang out at the mall. Why? AIR CONDITIONING. Ok maybe it was also because it this beautiful mall carried amazing brands.I ended walking to 3-4 amazing electronic stores (iStore didn't have it), found my lens in a department store, and proceeded to window shop. Some of these stores carried accessories and brands I was only able to order online in the States (i.e. Element iPhone cases). Next thing you know I've ordered a latte at Au Bon Pain and started doing some writing at Starbucks for the next few hours.I must say I was pretty impressed. A good stop if you're in the mood for shopping or need to pick up some electronics.

Must go to mall. I love this place, pricey shopping and all!! Many shops where you can buy everything it seems. The department store always has what I want and the Gourmet Market is wonderful. There are so many dining options It can take an hour just to cruise the offerings. Now the 4th floor Food Parade has been opened there are even more choices,

One of Bangkok's best malls.. There is lots of space between retailers although some are overpriced, escalators work quickly and efficiently. It is a meeting place in Bangkok, ,with regular concerts out front beside the fountain park. Just opposite the BTS stop easy to get to and should not be missed, just for a walk or some beautiful purchases.

Joy of brand shopping . This is the one and only top brand shop in Bangkok you can buy here porosh, Mercedes, BMW, arrow, Polo lots of brand... shops are pretty expensive but you get original product.... most of the shop have individual interior with letest design.... wide space for corridor.... open space for spending time. You can come here by metro, taxi or bus also... but before that you must come here with big budget....

Execellent shopping Mall. Very good quality , up market shopping mall in BKK. Many varieties local, Asian & western food in the food court. The size of the food court is so huge ....it was pack with so many people. its rally a nice place to shop & eat ....ha2

excellent food court. There are an abundance of cafes and restaurants in the food court, catering for all tastes i ejoyed a lovely iced coffe and muffin for lunch. There are numerous shops and as far as i am concerned when you have seen one you have seen them all.

Love this shopping mall. Absolutely love this shopping mall.It has extensive brands but for people with deep pockets. It is okie to visit even if you are doing window shopping!Love the cafes and restaurants they offer!Food at the food court is good too!They have endless food choices at various stalls too!A must to visit if you like to dine in comfort and see various brands available there!

Top of the line shopping mall. If you fancy a top brands in Bangkok, this is the place to go to. The shopping mall has all of the known brands (Cartier, Rolex, Paiget, BVLGARI, Channel ...etc). They also have a wide range of cafes and restaurants including Laduree and London's famous Singor Sasi.This place will be ideal for a rainy day in Bangkok.

Wow. Very very big and one can get lost easily. Really amazed by the number of shops and food court available. This was more geared for the upper class and very impressed with the whole layout especially the cinema at the top.

English books. This shopping mall is exquisite in all ways. Here are lots of shops and restaurants. You may need more than one day to see it all. In one of the upper floors there is a vast book shop with a huge choice of English litterature. If you neither intend to buy a Rolls Royce when you visit the mall, nor anything else, just have a pleasent experience, perhaps a visit here will be of interest?Highly recommended.Look for more reviews by MulleEllum.

Teenager looking for clothes.. We arrived here by taxi at almost lunch time .We decided have lunch at Paragon Food court first before we begin our shopping. After lunch , my son roam the floor for his stuff.
He bought 2 bottle of cream and a
T-Shirt.The shopping area is crowded with shoppers and perhaps Christmas is round the corner.
A shoppers paradise. This mall is located within a stem reach of other malls but this has a nice mix of high and medium end shoppers. Obviously crowded, tons of people everywhere.

Love it. It is definitely one of my favourite shopping place. It offers a llot of things to do. Beautyhall is superb!! Many restaurants to choose from. Cinema is not too bad. It easy to go to just get off at Siam bts station and you will see it.

Massive with lots of shops. We visited Siam Paragon to go to the cinema and to escape the heat. The Siam complex is huge and has a wide variety of shops that you would expect to find in any capital city. Some of the more surprising shops included a Rolls Royce showroom. There are a lot of very expensive shops here but overall, nice to walk around to escape the heat for an hour or two.

Nice experience but very expensive. It's a great experience just being in the mall... The shops are typical of those one would find along the streets of Ginza Tokyo or Orchard in Singapore...However, do take note, unless the items are really in sale, these designer goods are definitely more expensive in BKK... That's just how things are...U could however try the gourmet section in level B1... A good spread of delicious food... They try to emulate Isetan in Shinjuku Tokyo and despite being a little small in size, the spread is pretty good...

The place to be for high-end shopping. One of my top two shopping malls in Bangkok. If you want to shop until you drop this is the place for you. But.. take notice.. this mall is also designed for people with serious cash to burn. You will notice that when you pass the Rolls Royce and Lamborghini dealership inside.The prices here are a little higher than most malls in Bangkok and the crowd is normally mostly tourist. There is an awesome aquarium on the bottom floor and an even more awesome movie theater on the top floor. I love the IMAX! Many great restaurants and high-end luxury shops.It is a very clean and very safe mall. Great place to visit and spend some money!
Amazing. All brands in one place good to have those and really worth very good collection and very warm place to spend quality time while having shopping and even good to hangouts with friends..

Excellent place to shop. This mall is high value shops like bulgari , cartier, lamborghini etc. But the paragon department store is economical. A great place to spend a day just window shopping or browsing. It is best to take the BTS sytrain to Siam station .
The biggest mall at bangok . A big and new mall... If you want to see something else, you can visit it... Big brands, nice area to have lunch and coffee.
Great for shopping. Get out of the heat in to the aircon and do some shopping, western priced good or roundabouts soo dont expect too many bargains!

Everything you need in 1 place. This place has everything you would need in 1 place.but most of the things are of higher brand names. So the prices are fairly high.Great for shopping, eating out, the cinema is very nice, or you could just walk around to kill some time.the location in right in the heart of Bangkok, and also very convenient to access from public transport.

Shopping the Hi end Brands. Shopping place in Siam Square area easy access by sky train.A lot of varieties in food ,fashions,cosmetics.With a lot of hi Brands here.Alway has some event in the event y'all.

Amazing mall. Very incredible mall, especially the food and restaurant section. So many amazing cafes and restaurants to choose from. Unfortunately there is no shared seating in the food court so you have to all go to the same cafe with your friends if you want to sit together.
Branded shop. You can find PRADA boutique, Gucci , Burberry and etc. The shopping mall was so exclusive , difficult to get halal food. But you will satisfied with the space of shopping mall.
Very good place for shopping, cinema and entertainment.. Excellent a must visit place when you travel to Bangkok. Well designed and decorated shopping mall. The cinema in floor 5 is incredible.

Nice to look at, lovely to eat at!. The Siam Paragon mall is very attractive and full of the usual posh shops, it's the downstairs food court and gourmet supermarket that are noteworthy here. We had a small kitchenette in our hotel room so bought something for a light supper here most days. Food can be eaten on site in the various little restaurants/stands or taken away for later. The supermarket had a really good range of products from all over the world and very helpful staff. A lot of the food was ready-prepared and made self-catering a breeze.Easy to get to from the Siam station on the BTS, there is also a taxi rank outside by the waterwall.
Amazing shopping mall . Great shopping mall where you can even buy a Rolls Royce on the 5th floor or Lamborghini if you prefer. Food court has an outstanding variety of foods thai and international.

Huge. The mall is huge - you can walk around it all day and still not see everything. There is a lot of different choices for food, and it is relatively well priced depending on where you choose to eat at. There are also a lot of stores, some of which get a ways expensive. It's one of the better malls for window shopping and just chilling around with friends and family.

Fantastic complex . Siam paragon is very easy to access with the sky train stop directly on its doorstep .A great shopping experience with everything you could need under one immense roof .Whether that be designer i.e Channel or high street brands .From clothes to electronics stationary it provides it all including food refreshments and a cinema ..I did struggle a little with navigation a between floors and the different sections that I found was my only issue ..They also give you a tourist vat return form to claim your tax back on your departure from Thailand ..Well worth a visit if you love to shop

Amazing food court. This is a lovely shopping mall with all the big names from around the world.Impressed to see Harrods there doing the very traditional British Afternoon Tea,loved it .Very well set out but the thing that really got me in was the Fantastic food court, it had every thing.well done Paragon you have done it well.When in the area give a visit and indulge yourself.

Nice place for shopping . # clean and nice for shopping
# interlink BTS station
# more shops
# more restaurants
# food court available
# buy top up card --> Order food use card --> Get balance in food court restaurant

Beautiful but just a mall. Another shopping mall of which Bangkok abounds. Every few km along the freeway another mall is being built. Sadly the prices at these malls make shopping here impossible for the majority of thais although there are still lots of people shopping. Nothing much different than any other mall but the architecture is beautiful.
Good place for food and leisure. My first stop of bangkok. amazingly big mall and at basement the food court is very very big. Great experience in this country.

Grand mall. . Ocean world, madam tussauds and Siam are Co located.. Dont shop here unless u got lots of money to waste
😀

Shopping with my mom. I went shopping with my mom at royal paragon hall floor 5
This event has 11-12 dec 2015 for this year
It's have more accessories , dress up , shoes, glasses including handmade
Good promotion and wholesale
And this time i bought girl handbag for me and my mom
I feeling happy :))

Good place for shopping. Siam Paragon is one of our favorite mall in Bangkok.They have a good department store with less pricey clothes with a good selection.But if you want and have afford then they have luxury brands such as Louis Vuitton, Jimmi Choo, Prada etc...We tried the food hall and bought from several off the ¨street food¨vendors near the food court but were very disappointed i rather by street food on the street. The taste was not that good, it was barely just heated and no rice or sauce added.They have many other places there also restaurants but we did not try them since we liked other places better more local restaurants or street vendors.

The most exciting shopping mall in Bangkok. When say about Bangkok, thinking about shopping at Siam Paragon. This new shopping mall is easy to reach by BTS skytrain (drop off at Siam Station). At Siam Paragon, you can enjoy shopping at brand name shop such as Dolce and Gabbana, Prada or Gucci. The price is average if compare to popular shopping mall such as in Hong Kong or Empirium (I am prefer Emporium but Paragon is better for food court). Anyway, the best use of Paragon is meeting point at the fountain. And also the event at space between Paragon and Siam Center.

Huge, Prestigous and amazing food court. Siam Paragon is a massive shopping Mall - right next door to Siam Centre and connected by a vast walkway on the 2nd level.The mall itself is high end - with lots of stores such as Luis Vuiton, Hermes etc. This place is beautiful but unless you have a rather fat wallet or purse you probably won't find much here to buy. There is even a series of high-end new car showrooms on one of the floors with brands such as Ferrari, Rolls Royce and Porsche, among others.The food court on the ground floor is amazing! The food is great and our family thought the prices were good. The prices are not as good as you can get on the street or some other places - however, compared to Aussie prices they are great. There's also an awesome supermarket and all sorts of yummy food and dessert choices here. Include this place in your list of places to visit.

Shopping at his best. All you wish to have is there, from kids activities to fine dining to movies, to supercars, to top fashion to daily shopping.A regular place for me and family to hang around and lots of activities to enjoy.Great job for the people there!

The closest to a Harrods for Bangkok/. High end shopping here - all the designer makes - but remember these attract a punitive rate of tax (30%) in Thailand so are NOT good value - only really for the outrageously rich locals to whom it does not matter.The actual Paragon department store offers a very wide range of Thai na dimported products at reasonable prices. The Gourmet food market has top quality fish and meat - and again great variety.English is widely spoken.The food court is expensive by local standards with a mains at 60 to 200 baht - but excellent quality, good value and packed with eaters. Recommend the 5 spice duck in soup with angle hiar noodles! 80 baht.It is also the only malll i know where the ladies can go and check out all the clothes, handbags and cosmetics, while the guys browse the Ferrari, Lambo, Maserati, Lotus, Porche, Rolls Royce and Aston Martins in the in store outlets.... ENJOY.Don't try to drive here, and a taxi mat get caught up in the traffic. Reccommend the Skytrain (Siam) where there is driect access to Paragon.

Fantastic Food Hall. Best thing about this place was the food hall. Had everything to cater all budgets, including fast food chains.
Definitely check this place out.

Good place for a walk and shopping well known brands. Siam Paragon is a great place for shopping well know brands of cloths, shoes, electronics etc... Notice an outstanding cineplex at the last floor and a breath taking food court at the ground floor!
Beautiful high end. High end shopping centre. Dont expect bargins just amazing brands. Interesting food level and on the basement
High end shopping centre with 4D theatre. Place to be if you want to shop higher end brands. Loved the theatre though, for 500-600 baht you get a pretty cool 4d experience!

A costly affair.... This mall is one of the famous malls in Bangkok and its nearly the centre of Bangkok. Mai is quite big, you can find all kind of "BIG" brands here that you may not find at other places. The place is very decently connected to the BTS so you can actually access it easily.
Typical mall. Very busy during peak times with lots of students and family's. You can buy clothes, food areas and last but not least security is tight.
Big mall. Was not able to see complete mall as we were there to search for indian food . We got it at ground floor. Many restaurants are available here.
Interesting mall . Here you can find anything you want from the food to the clothes. There are typical Thai stuffs and international big brands.

Siam Paragon Gourmet Supermaket. Besides getting Thai tidbits as souvenirs, Gourmet Supermarket has a wide selection of meats that you can take from the fridge and bring to the grill bar counter where you can sit and have the meat cooked to your liking. You can also grab a bottle of fruit juice from the fruit juice section. Before leaving, settle your meal (together with the drink; give them the bottle cap with price tag) at the bar counter.

Fat wallet required.. This shopping centre is certainly impressive and a welcome air conditioned respite from the bkk heat. Some will find it a place of wonders, those who are shopaholics. Sadly for the ordinary Thai or even most tourists the prices here mean most will do no more than window shop.

Everything is here. mostly High brand like Hermes, Prada or Dior are sold here.
there is a food kiosk inside Gourmet Market which you could have various kind of fresh made-to-order food.

Tenth Anniversary. On December 9th, Siam Paragon turned into 10th anniversary. Siam Paragon provides full services, ranging from food to highend shopping. Super market is superb. It's hard to give everyone a details. Go there and find out by yourself....enjoy...!

One of the best shopping malls in Bangkok!. You could nearly get lost wandering through here just browsing or doing some serious shopping.There are also many restaurants and a cinema for your enjoyment.

High end Destination. This mall is very luxurious and has all high end brands like Dior, Chanel And LV. Attatched to.it is the siam centre mall which has more affordable brands. The mall is well connected with metro so its easily reachable.
Shoppers paradise. Siam Paragon is shopper's paradise. You name it, you can probably buy it here. Also the many and varied food outlets. Every taste catered for.
Great shopping center!. Great shopping center and an awesome food court! Easy to navigate and get too using BTS. Head to the first floor after shopping to eat....great restaurants and drinks.

Spectacular. It's amazing how in 30 minutes you can go from being in an area of the city that is dilapidated to being in a 6 story mall with many amenities of a western mall. There was many western brands. In the ground floor there was an aquarium, while the top floor had a bowling alley, and a movie theater!
What a beautiful place . Loved this place the moment I walked in... Even if you're just window shopping, there is lots to see especially at Christmas time! Very festive and beautiful shops! ;)

A male shopper's odyssey !. I am a male who hates shopping. Siam Paragon, however, and in most instances suits my temperament, because I can find mostly everything I want in this mall.There is an excellent supermarket which caters to gourmet as well as normal European or American requirements. There are lots of restaurants. Most international cuisines are represented. The mall caters mostly to ladies, and apparently does so quite well, since the lady shoppers seem to be mostly in high spirits, probably because every top brand, of clothes, jewelry, cosmetics etc appear to be represented here. If there is any change left over from shopping, they can pick up a Ferrari, Lamborgini or Porche as they are parked on display in the aisles. The mall has movie theaters on the top floors, they feature all the latest western moving in English with Thai subtitles. My only gripe is that I occasionally get lost whilst trying to find something. Most of the shop staff don't speak English and those that do, appear to have no idea where anything is in the mall, other than their own shop. This can become quite frustrating, as I sometimes wander around lost, just like a mouse in a maze looking for a specific item.The mall exits to the BTS skytrain which is very convenient, that is, if you can get anyone to direct you to the Skytrain exits. It would be very helpful if the mall were signposted a bit better.

A world on its own. Its massive. So many high end shops but also amazing selection of food everywhere. It was nice to walk around the mall and see all the shops but our eyes widened when we looked at the food options. The main food court is amazing and huge (you can get lost in there) but there are also other food courts and food streets (dessert street). We spent majority of our time eating there and it has a good selection of everything. The cuisine reminded me of Toronto - multicultural - all types of cultures in this one building. Donuts, Popcorn, Macaron, ramen, sushi, burgers, tacos, mille-crepe cakes, higher end thai street food, japanese desserts, bubble tea, parisian food etc.It's such an experience and reminded me of home. Food is the way to the heart for sure.

huge mall. Well, it's a huge mall in the city center and directly accessible from BTS. There is a brilliant food court which has all kinds of cuisines at reasonable prices. It also houses a huge multiplex on the top floor with 4DX and imax .
Didn't buy anything as it is an expensive place ( many luxury brands)
a must see for tourists. though its mostly brand stuff, but having a walk around is nice, Siam Ocean World down at B1 is a good choice

Shopping and movie. I have been here before and like the other times I went to see a movie. It much cheaper than in my home country. Be prepared that it's cold and very loud but otherwise all good. The whole place is nice but only expensive stores so make sure to bring your big wallet if you want to shop!

Shopping travel. It is a place that can give you satisfaction of shopping sense. There are a lot of fashioning stores and up to date designs. Brand stores have discount items. It is suit for the one who love is shopaholic.

Stunning Shopping Centre. I wouldn't actually buy anything here as it's out of my price range, but it was good to visit. The people watching is awesome and who doesn't like to pretend they can buy a Rolls Royce at a mall?!

Window shopping . We always come here to check out especially, the food court lots food and dessert a must try. Different types of ethnic food from Thai , India, Malaysia , Singapore ,Japanese, American Italian and other countries

A shopping mall that has indoor child entertainment . A mall that is very busy with all walks of life people from working class to tourist like us. You can practically spend a whole day in this mall with the many different shopping levelsThe Kidzania is very fun for family with kids age 4 and above. As they have many different role play from a mac donald staff to a delivery man or even a superstar.

high end boutique malls and food paradise . If you are looking for branded stuff, this is the place to be. Situated adjacent to Siam BTS, the walk way connects directly to the mall and skywalk to other malls such as Central World.Plenty of branded boutiques, besides the mall has numerous food choices available, ranging from Harrods, Four Seasons etc. to local food at the food gourmet level.
Nice Mall. It's a nice, clean mall. If you're from Europe, America, no need to visit there. You can find all those brands in your country. You may be paying less though.

Nice mall. Close to all Siams and other malls. So many options for food and shopping. It's very fun to go on Comicon's day when you can see everybody's wearing costumes. This place is easy to go by BTS , bus or other public transportations.

Worth a visit. Home of the expensive international brands from fashion to jewelry to sports cars spread over 8 floors. Not much buying going on from the mostly upmarket retail outlets, seems to be more a place to wander around to get out of the heat. However ground floor containing the massive food hall and the large supermarket is very busy with locals and tourists, the popular aquarium is also here. Top floor has a big cinema complex. Kinokuniya bookshop has a large branch on the 4th floor.Located next to Siam Square BTS.

Shoppers heaven. Flashy and swish with the bling and bright lights- Essentially just a massive shopping mall, with the price tags to match. Pretty much everything is available that you would expect to buy from any major shopping centre in the world. Good just to wander around and browse but why spend your hard earned here when you can go elsewhere and save heaps? The quickest way to blow your holiday cash.
Lots of food, no value shopping. The food court is great and a must do but the fashion stores are more expensive than US prices and not worth entering.
High end. Lots of high-end shops. Worth the visit of you are into exclusive fashion items. However, there is not much to distinguish it from any high-end shopping centre anywhere in the world.

Holiday. When visiting Bangkok, I recommend any travellor to go to Siam Paragon.The atmosphere and the Environment is cool, and you can take photos and pictures of your Holiday there.The people are friendly and especially if you are a Tourist , anyone wants to know where you are from, and even some people wants to take photos with you.I was amazed how kindly I was treated and I felt like a royal prince.The people was very nicel and friendly, and also recommended me tgat I go to other places in Bangkok I have never heard of before.As for the food, Bangkok has all of it,, from Indian Cuisine, Japanese, Korean, Vietnamise, Chinese, etc and you will never go hungry if you are there.You just have to keep on sampling different taste of foods and I even tried Dorean Fruit, and it smell bad and it stink, but it is very nice.Its kind of a kiwi Fruit but smell bad.

Excellent. It's got the lot, every label you could wish for under the sun. What I like is it's all fixed prices so you have a rest from the bartering, you just have to sort through the sale prices instead but far better and quality goods.

Their slogan: The Pride of Bangkok . It's a high end mall with up to date music playing in the background, plenty of luxury retail stores and the key - floor G with the huge supermarket, food court and restaurants. Tip: Visit the public sitting area and order different varieties of food from the stores outside the supermarket. If you would like food from the food court, you have to purchase a prepaid card. Finally, do not miss the sea world one level down.
Convenient enough to spend all day in city. You can find almost-you-need at paragon, from food to vehicle. However, there are somewhat high price at Paragon.
If u like malls. Beautiful new mall with lots of restaurants and bistros. It is easily accessible thru bts central siam and linked thru by overhead bridges etc.
Fantastic Mall in the City. After several days exploring the nature, it's quite nice to be back in a cosmopolitan city. The mall is pretty new and has a lot of the major brands.

Shopping Paradise . A great place to shop n dine if you are looking for quality food and merchandise.If you find something nice from the local boutiques, my advice is try not to buy from them directly. You will probably find these brands at Siam Paragon mall. Buying from the mall will allow u to enjoy tax rebates for foreigners whereby the boutiques do not.

Not for shopping! Only sightseeing, prices double. This place is not good for shopping, although you have all the brands under one roof, its so expensive even compared to India and Hongkong. These malls are not the famous 'bangkok shopping' The food court is good.

Shopping Mall. Quite a big mall with high end shops and some 'normal' shops like Zara. A really big food court with all kinds of different cuisines - there is another mall next door which is more boutique and the outside is really pretty. Easy to get to on the BRS too.
all of the major brands available. the shopping centre is very big with many brands available for spenders... good restraunts available in the centre too.

Dinning at Gourmet Market, Siam Paragon. All tourists must have heard the name "Siam Paragon" the famous shopping mall in Bangkok. Due to its location that accessible from BTS "Siam Station" and a lot of goos shops and restaurants, this mall is all-the-time crowded. However it is worth to go, especially the gourmet market on G floor. Apart from shopping for groceries, the market has a section called "you hunt we cook" where you can buy meat (beef, fish, pork, and ect.) from the market and get your meat cooked and you can eat inside the market. You can also buy drinks and other items. I just tried dry aged beef of a Thai producer called "Company B". I chose a 300 grams of sirloin (THB 380). Cooking fee is THB 100. You can pick sauce and side dish with THB 60 per selection.

Such a huge mall. Huge mall! That's the best words to describe the placeWhat you can find in this place? Well, the very typical thing of malls. Restaurants, cafes, clothing stores and others.Well, you can also visit madam tussaud museum here.

This place has everything including much coveted air-conditioning. I am not really a shopping mall kind of person but after a few hours in 95° weather, I just couldn't take it anymore and headed into this mall. What a relief! And as far as malls go, it was nice. Very spacious, lots of stores, huge food court in the basement, and excellent people watching to boot. But honestly, my favorite part was the air conditioning.

Shopping at the High End. Awesome shopping center, could be anywhere in the world, all the Big Names are there, exceptional layout, anything and everything you would wish to purchase, not the least expensive in Bangkok, but well worth a look, allow a couple of hours there are a lot of Big Name Shops here, easy to find, public transport close by including BTS.One of the Must Do on your Bucket List.
great restaurants!. wow some of the very best restaurants at affordable prices. You will not leave hungry but stuffed. Great place to walk around..

More than just a shopping mall. . This place is right in the middle of city center. You can get off at Siam BTS station and get right into the mall. This mall also has an aquarium which is the best in Bangkok and the 4DX cinema that makes you feel like you are in the movie. The food court here is expensive though so you can cross to Siam to find something more cheaper to eat.
Very nice!. Really nice if you like exclusive shopping brands .. But they also have clothes for better prices. Great food too!

Nice Supermarket at Basement. There is a large supermarket at Basement of Siam Paragon. Have a good variety of different stuff available. Have bought some nice local fruits there before.
Good that they have box packing service at nominal charge for shopper and we got them pack which we can check-in.

Shopping center as many others. A shopping center as many others, all well-known brands are present, a very good food court.
Very easily accessible with BST stop SIAM. You will go straight into the mall from the train station.
Top shopping. I loved the shops! I could find the new collection, still the prices are higher then Europe. I did enjoy the food court after shopping. Is a must if you love shopping.

For everybody, something. A nice well organised place. Lots of shops and you can buy literaly everything. The groundfloor is a big, big mega food market. We loved the place and also the good and helpfull people. Next time again.
great shopping mall at the center of bangkok. lots of brand name stores located here and opposite of famouse evening street call "Siam shopping street"

luxury department right at center of Bangkok with the most convenient access. easy access by BTS, full range of shopping from standard to brand name. One stop service from Bank, restaurant, cinema or even the Ocean world aquarium
Hi end till great food. where u can find hi end brand, at basement fl. u can find great thai food,burger, ramen, snacks, dessert. travelling by taxi or bts skytrain (siam station).
Nice n huge. We spend 2 hours here, hardly shopped. It's a nice n huge mall with maximum brands. It has children area also. Good coffee chains available. Can visit.

It has one of the best Food Market. Been here everyday when I went to Bangkok for 3 days. The food market has many options to choose from. In Bangkok the food's price also quite cheap. It has many stores and also branded stuffs store.

Designers store. There is a great place for family with kids there to visit at level 5
Kidsania
A fun activity park for the kids while the parents can do some shopping around

Has the WOW factor . An amazing space.
Food Market is like a Thai version of "Fortnum & Mason's " (with prices to match).
Huge bookstore.
IT shops, etc, etc.
Cinema complex which was showing Spectre (in English ).

Basement must check . I was really fascinated by basement food selections. Just have a look also great experience. I really liked mandarin oriental tea shop. Not only coffee what I ordered but also bread was very delicious.
If looking for massage oil and small gift also easy to find. It might be a bit expensive but quality is there.
A good place for movie lovers! . Get gold class seats for amazing prices! Movie, sound, seat, food quality is superb! Even the toilet is amazing! Must try!!!

Beautiful mall. We know it's expensive there, but the mall itself is just beautiful for a sight seeing. In the mall youll find madam tussaude gallery and sea life aquarium, both priced start from 1500++ baht. (Basement floor) The eateries In the mall are quite interesting ranging from local to international cuisine. Japanese, Western, Arab, fast food joint.What made the mall quite unique is the waterfall + mirror + nature garden and the car gallery, can be seen from the garden

Good Food. We enjoyed quick eats here, the food court which had a number of restaurants with different cuisine was good. Good value & good range of local and international foods.The supermarket was also quite good, with a salad bar & oyster bar.

Lots of designer stores, lots of designer prices. This shopping mall contains pretty much everything, from a large supermarket through to an IMAX cinema and all the usual brands. You can find a Jim Thompson store (or a considerably cheaper "Exotic Thai" section of the mall's own department store on the 4th floor), plenty of Western brands, and so on. Average prices are high but it is a useful "catch-all" for when you do not want to go outdoors.

All about the popcorn. Not a great shopper at the best of times and less so when there are no clear maps as to what is where and which floor offers what.As a bloke the prospect of having to walk every square inch instead of just going to the places required sent that she erin down my spine. On the plus side it is air conditioned and surprising feels not overly busy. Transport is easy with Siam BST being main source of arrival/departure. If in need of a trat then head to food Hall on lower level and treat yourself to Garrets Popcorn, still the best I've tasted and as good as the Chicago original.
window-shopping. If you are rich and need a place to hangout and blow your money that a place for you. otherwise you can go for few hours of window shopping

Great place to visit. Huge shopping complex with varieties of options - one can spend a full day here. One can see Underwater world or Madam Tussad. A Dino zone for kids was quite attractive.Lots of food option and almost all premium brands to shop.
super chic place. if you are looking for brand name products or a ferrari, this is the place to be, also many high end restaurants to choose from on the ground floor, great food court also.

Expensive mall but lots of yummy food! . Visited several times and usually make a visit each time we are in Bangkok. There are lots of food venues inc. McDonald's, Burgerking, KFC, Subway and lots of nicer restaurants for eating in. Many cuisines. They also have a gorgeous Gourmet Market which is particularly good for Deli food (olives, hams, cheese) as well as imported goods such as Redbull and Doritos etc. We also visited Sea Life in the Paragon last Christmas which is a lot of fun!
a shoppers delight. three malls joined together, large shops, huge malls, all air con.. supermarket.. food courts,, many restaurants,, max-out your credit card here,,

Big interesting place for shoppoholigs. In my life it was the first time I've seen so nice and big mall. Before I didn't see, becouse in my country we don't have such kind of shops. There are you can find a lots of interesting things and aquarium, but I didn't visit it (hadn't time). I hope in the future I will visit BKK again and see all intereting places there.
modern shopping mall. contemporary, nice shopping mall. well organised, you would see a lot of brands which you can see everywhere in the world.not cheap though.

Upmarket mall with very good deals if you get to know it. Siam Paragon may seem like a top-end shopping mall but you do not have to spend a fortune to shop there. There are indeed luxury boutiques, (easily recognisable even if you are not into brands as the items displayed in their windows will not have any price tags) but you will also find branches of Gap, Boots, H&M and Uniqlo, to name a few, all of which have the advantage of being much quieter than their Central World counterparts, the reason being, I suspect, that most tourists do not know they are there. Orientation can be tricky in Siam Paragon and it is easy to get lost in the different wings, particularly since their signs are not always up to date, adding to the confusion. It can therefore be a hassle to find the shop you are looking for. But once you have a mental map of the mall it is actually a very pleasant place to shop for clothing, food and anything else, under the same roof. It will not the cheapest option (but this is central Bangkok) but it is a good option for mid-range shopping within immediate reach of the BTS. If you are after something to eat, restaurants, snacks & cafes are on all levels and worth discovering as often very quiet in the morning too but the main food area in on the basement. it includes numerous restaurants, stalls selling savoury and sweet food, a food hall and a large Gourmet Market branch with a very good pet department, affordable and well supplied (you would have to go all the way to Chatuchak to find the brands they stock). If you want to take away your meal, the grilled meat skewers outside Gourmet Market are cheap and delicious, a bit further up, still along the supermarket you will find authentic Chinese cakes and a bit further up again yummy custard. The delicious Japanese Hokkaido soft serve ice-cream can also be found there. All in all, a mall worth discovering, even if it takes some time to do so!
Shopping. Easy to go here by BTS SIAM. Many resterant such krispy kream / garret popcorn/ MK GOLD/ also have food court. IMAX Movie theater.
Shopping. This offers a huge range of quality shops but not cheap and not much more than you get back home though all in the same place

Amazing. You can find amazing restaurants amd food area. Best shops, so many different fashion labels in the Shopping mall. I loved new Zealand foods. So delicious. inside the food court there is Belgium chocolate shop. They are so yummy. :)
Beautiful mall. Very sunny and bright mall with all brands under one roof, good selection of cafes and restaurants too.

A mall for everything . The mall has almost everything you can find in a standard mall.
Their employees are professional and friendly.
Especially the staff in their Bowling Center.

high end mall. If you are looking for fancy car, fancy clothes, and other fancy things you should come here. It is good and big shopping mall though.
You can also find Sea Life Ocean World and Madamme Tussaud at the ground floor.

Tourist lounge (free wifi in-mall,free drinking water,sofas for resting). This is among the best tourist services and customer services I have encountered so far throughout my recent 5D4N Bkk travel. Even adjacent famous mall CentralWorld is not up to such service excellence level. In Siam Paragon basically you can feel the kind of prestigious shopping/dining experience. I enjoy the FitnessFirst gym workout in the mall too (normally grab an oversea pass from my home club before travel abroad).

Siam Paragon. One the most i like when visit Siam Paragon is the Gourmet supermarket which offers variety of delicacy of Thai foods. Siam Paragon has most of it, where from branded stuff to mouthwatering food court. Never missed the cinemas that offering more options and theathers then you ever find before. Yes a bit pricey but worth!

Not my thing . We had just gotten into thailand and did not want to do anything too strenuous right away, so we thought we would check out the mall, since we had heard so much about the malls in Bangkok. We were interested in going to the movies, because one of our travel books recommended it. It said that the movie theaters can be quite luxurious, and that, before the movie starts, there is an homage that is paid to the king, which can be a bit of a cultural experience. We did not end up having enough time to watch the movie we wanted to see, and so ended up walking around the mall instead. It wasn't for us. I would suggest figuring out how long it will take to get there in advance if you are on a tight time table; we learned that Bangkok rush hour can be from 7am-10am, and 4pm-9/10pm, which would explain why it took so long to get there from our hotel.

Nice High Class Mall. In that mall you get all the higher class world brands, like Dior, Louis Vuitton, Prada, Ferragamo etc but also a lot of middle class brands like Adidas, Nike, Guess etc. In the department store you get all kinds of cosmetics and clothing from European or Asian brands. The Food Court is really impressive, there is so much to try you do not know where to start. We can recommend the Pancake House which offers all kinds of pancake assortions, and very delicious.We also once tried the cinema with the huge beds (around 1400 Baht per Person) you firstly are guided to a separated area where you can have a small snack and 1 Cocktail which is included in the price. Then you are guided to the cinema with only about 12 beds, you get cushions and blankets and you can order drinks per button. Felt like at home on the couch only with a much bigger Screen:) Very nice Experience.
Beautiful mall. A mall which houses branded good and restaurants. Concept is similar to central world but siam paragon in my opinion is prettier. A must for shopping fanatics.

Great selection. An impressive range of shops and products in a spacious well-designed shopping centre. High end brands and reasonably priced shops are all represented.Wide selection of restaurants to whet the appetite too - Japanese, Korean, Western, Thai, of course and many others. Shops for snacks and desserts will tempt as well.For the tourist looking for local crafts and goods, I highly recommend Exotic Thai. It has relatively expensive but high quality merchandise from a good selection of ready made Thai silk clothes to specially crafted soaps.For those looking for bargain Thai silk bags, check out Naraya on the 3rd floor. The quality is definitely less than Jim Thompson but the prices are a fraction in comparison.We spent a lazy afternoon browsing through the shopping centre. The toilets are very clean and my only complaint was that the one I went to, did not refill the soap dispenser.
Beautiful and rich shopping centre. . Siam Paragon is very clean and has both "normal priced" stuff as well as luxury brands. Visit the 4D cinema while you are there!
big high end mall. the corners may get a little confusing, this is probably one of the highest end mall in Bangkok, i especially love the huge supermarket at the basement!

Might as well be at a mall in NJ. I'm not sure what the attraction is here but perhaps that's due to the fact we live near plenty of shopping malls in New Jersey. We much preferred to go shopping off the beaten path where we bought beautiful belts and other clothing items.
Best shopping mall ever!. This is "the place" for shopping. Many famous brands, excellent department store. A must when you are inBangkok!

Pure Shopping. All expensive. Just shops and shops. All expensive unless you have marina trench deep pockets. They even sell Aston Martin.
Many restaurants. Expensive, reasonable and food court with all major fast food restaurant.
Houses Ocean World and Kidzania. Read my separate reviews about these 2 spots.

Brand paradise!. Huge shopping centre- all the big brands you need. The air conditioning was a welcome change to the heat on the streets. A few places to eat and heaps of stores. Son't forget to keep your receipts as visitors can get their tax back at the airport.

A huge, high end shopping mall. Quite a big mall that one could get easily lost in it. There were a lot of shops but most are on the high end. The food court is big and has a variety of choices. Easily connected to the BTS Skytrain via Siam Station.
Shopping . We heard so much about Siam Paragon so went there for shopping and lunch. Lots of high end brands and great restaurants to chose from.
High end shopping area. Mainly the branded goods are all there. It's a nice place to walk around and get some food but I think it will be better to eat the street food as they are more interesting.

High End...Limited Shops. Hermes, Prada, Chanel. Not a huge rang of stores but the big ones are here.
Top floor - Face First great clinic for botox and fillers.

Must visit !!. It is one of the best shopping malls in Bangkok !!! A paradise for people who love to shop !!! However , no less for foodies too with a Gourmet section on the ground floor !!! Very child friendly !! Takes about 2-4 hours to cover all of it !!! The Ocean World in the basement is a must visit , although a bit expensive , but the standards are truly international !!! Use the sky train to get here !!

Viet cuisine upstairs. Excellent shopping mall however beware about some of the food!VIET CUISINE Located upstairs looked good.After eating some food I managed to see some very very small bugs worms on the lettuce.My Thai friend was not happy and complained however we still had to pay.Shame the food is unfit for consumption.
luxury mall. the most luxury mall in Bangkok locate in the hart of bangkok has a variety of shops and restaurants

Interesting supermarket and G floor.. -The Gourmet (supermarket )at ground floor of Paragon,- You 'll find plenty of ingredient for different kinds of delicious Thai food.- From most easiest for cooking such as as fish sauce, Sriracha sauce, even for Toom Yum Kung. (shrimp sour soup)- Food court of different delicious food for many countries.- Aquarium for children and adult.- Nearby Siam Center for Japanese buffet etc.
Exclusive shopping mall. Intense, glamorous, hiso shops- very expensive- however the food court on the ground floor is awesome! Usually very crowded, but irresistible.

Need More toilets . Consider the most popular malls in Bangkok with amazing shops and restaurants. The toilet situation is bad. At the weekend you have to wait for hour to use the toilet. So don't drinking or eat took much there because you find yourself wasting time standing in line to use the loo!
Top shopping!. Top shopping, excellent ranges! Some big and small prices. Great food in here also, they have pretty much everything and also a quality cinema

Everything is waiting you. At bts skytrain station is this temple of 5 star delight. About 6 stories of wow. Bangkok best retail is on display as well as a monster movie cinema and the new kidzana indoor theme park. Underground is the awesome underwater world. Outisde is many retail icons and tourist spots just endless allow a day here. Google Bangkok achiever paragon
Great. We visit this shopping mall at night. The food court was so nice. We took dinner there. We enjoyed 4D movie in the Theater of this mall

The food court was the main attraction . Amazing food court using an electronic card system. Great mall to visit if you're not keen on the hot outdoors in Bangkok. Very near Madame Tussauds in Bangkok.
