Activities include watching the super rich tourists buy cars and watches while grabbing a bite to eat in one of the many restaurants including western style fast food to 4 star dinning establishments and catching one of the many free events that are sponsored here. Of course the surrounding area is also jamb packed with many sights to see along with other similar shopping opportunities so plan on spending the day!

Fantastic boutique shopping experience. Some of the top luxury brands on display and are up for grabs! Definitely the most luxurious shopping centre in Bangkok. There is a great Aquarium in the basement of the shopping centre, but is quite pricey. The food court is absolutely huge. Shoe stores are in abundance, clothes stores even more so. If you're looking for any luxury brand, this would be the place to get it.Tip: I'd avoid going after 4pm as it can get flooded with kids from school. Best to go in the mornings.
Mixed mall with everything . Nice to see and shop around but you might find it very expansive and it has a huge movie theater nice to see . It's connected with other mall Food court is huge and nice

Spent most of our shopping time there. Very nice mall - on the main strip (where all other major malls in BKK). We loved the Cinema there. Booked the VIP (Bangkok Airlines theater) twice. Very enjoyable. It can get a bit busy and over crowded sometimes especially in the lower floors next to the food court. There is something for everyone of every age to do.

Best destination. This is the best destination in Bangkok, it's the best for shopping, eat, entertainment and waste time. It has some of the best Brands to buy from, the best cinema in Bangkok, many great Coffee shops and some of the best places to eat.

The only shopping mall which I completed all floors among Central World, The Emporium and EmQuartier. Came here on a long weekend holiday. The food halls and fast food outlets were bursting at their seams with locals and tourists alike. Found my "oasis" at the Laduree Boutique/Cafe which marked my virgin luxury cafe experience. Pros: Compared with its huge neighbour Central World, Siam Paragon is way easier to go around. Even a person with a poor sense of direction like me finished exploring the entire mall on my own. I was awed by the sights of car showrooms and also a beautiful jellyfish backdrop while going down one of the escalators :) Not to forget how convenient it is to take the BTS and also going over Siam Center and Siam Square. Don't forget to drop by the Paragon Department Store as they offer 10% discount for tourists.Area of improvement: Tried to take a touristy selfie with the Siam Paragon as the backdrop at night. Unfortunately the logo does not have its lighting.

Mall on steroids. This mall is awesome. It even has high end car dealerships. The food court is the biggest I have ever seen. Swensens, Krispe Kreme, Cinnabon, you name it they have it. Great experience. You'll love it.

A mall with everything!. You can easily spend a whole day here, with all the food options, places of interests and a whole galore of shops. My family had to pop by 2 days in a row. The children had a great time at Kidzania and the adults have so much to eat and shop, and caught a movie at the IMAX theatre.Keeps the whole family very well entertained.
Very bad compared to years back.. Noticed the prices are marked up over the years. Guess the foreign influence is quite high. Didn't really get to enjoy the authenticity anymore.

Nice place. We spent 3 hours eating and resting at the food court, and I bet you can find various dishes that match your taste here. The food was good, price was abit higher than at Terminal 21, but more various. The Aquarium was at base so your kids and members can have a good visit after the meal.

Big shopping mall full of designer labels and people!. If you've got money to spend on designer labels, head here but if you are wanting reasonable priced, high street shops, don't head here. It is a big mall and busy. There are plenty of places to eat as there is a whole food court. Before purchasing any food you have to put money onto a card which you do there. Within the mall there is a Sea World.It is easy to get to as is on the BTS Skytrain. It's two minutes from the stop.

Bangkokian's favorite shopping mall. This is my most favourite shopping mall and we often go there for eating and shopping. There are so many restaurants to choose from, from authentic Thai cuisine to Italian food, and for the quality of foods I have never been disappointed so far. I love the Gourmet Market in particular, it offers a wide range of delicious foods, and of better quality too. Plenty of toilet facilities. There are cinemas for movie goers, and we often indulge ourselves by choosing the large and comfy honeymoon seats. The mall is just steps from the skytrain (BTS), but you can also take a taxi or a tuk yuk (if the traffic is not so bad).
Good. This is a popular mall here. Quite big a good choice of shops.If. The food out lets here are varied. Lots of shoppers.

Designers Galore. If you're into designers and brand names ( we all are) Siam Paragon is the mall for you. It is a shoppers delight and the food court isn't something that should be missed. It offers everything from Thai food to Subway sandwiches. In the basement is Sea life aquarium Bangkok for kids but adults will enjoy too. If shopping Siam Paragon definitely bring enough Baht (money) because it's all the real stuff.
Super mall.. All flavour of shopping options available . From affordable to dream to purchase .Near from BTS/MRT.
Gem of the Malls in Thailand. This is simply the best mall of Thailand. Housing so many brands and gourmet store. A huge food court and cinema for movie lovers.
Lots of things to do and eat but crowded. You can spend the whole day here alone if visiting Bkk for the first time. Kidzania and Sealife is within the centre. Lots of food and shopping too

Best cinema experience ever!. We wanted a change from sight seeing in Bangkok so decided to watch the new Mission Impossible 5 film. The cinema is on the 5th floor, giving us chance to check out the mall on the way up, it was very impressive, even having car show rooms!The foyer of the cinema was immense, tons of space, and people on hand to help us with the booking process. We got a deal which included popcorn and a drink with our tickets, which was lovely. The cinema screen was massive, and the seats very spacious and comfortable. We worried that the film would be in Thai but turned out it only had Thai subtitles.Excellent cinema!!!

Exquisite. The mall is accessible through Siam station of the sky train.
It is a very elegant mall with may shops and a very good food court.
When we visited there was the Orchids festival with exquisite and impressive decorations at the entry of the mall.
It is a pleasure to shop or to enjoy a meal at this mall.

high-end shopping and more affordable stores as well. This is a huge mall with a variety of shops from high-end brand names (Gucci, Cartier, Marc Jacobs etc.) to more affordable stores. There is a department store in the middle of the mall and if you go to the information desk located on the 1st floor you can get a discount card if you show your passport. There is a huge food court in the basement (noisy) as well as on the 4th floor (more quite). The Sky train stops right outside.

Very Nice shopping mall with great food. Alot of food at basement and also foodcourt. Love the lava bun which contains the thai tea lava inside . Remember to try it there! Awesome bun... is just next to the one selling thai tea. Thai tea is awesome too. so cooling and refreshing . Love Siam paragon.

Large and Impressive. To really experience Siam Paragon, you would need an entire day. Can experience in much less time, of course, by just quickly browsing. The food court is like no other, full of sensory indulgences at every turn. The shopping is luxury goods and simpler choices as well, anchored by two huge department stores. Air conditioned comfort in the middle of hot Bangkok, you have to experience the theaters on the top floor... Siam knows how to put on a movie in style. Incredible!

Biggest chain of malls . It accomodates ocean world , madam tussads and with 3 wings is quite huge. The siam paragon as the main center iiself is huge with many branded stores. The food court is amazing with the ground floor fully dedicated to it. The siam center which is next door accomodates compartively cheaper brands and smaller food court. Its a recommended shopping and recreational destination.
Brand is good but not cheap!!!. Branded goods all around but u can also find good quality clothes at a decent price. A must stop for any tourist.

Best shopping experience. Spent a few hours in the comfort of the air con just browsing at the designer shops they are all here. The best thing with Paragon is the cinema on the top floor. Really high end quality picture and sound. The aquarium with shark tunnel at the bottom floor is also ok. If you are there at the right time you can see dance shows on the plaza or orchid shows inside the mall. All for free. And of course, if you have the money you can buy some amazing clothing, shoes and jewelry.

Excellent Restaurants and Delo, Luxury Shopping, IMAX Theater. Siam paragon is one of the most posh malls in Bangkok. Most stuff they offer is expensive and very luxurious, but on the other hand it is an fantastic food court, a great food deli and restaurant area on the bottom and awesome cinemas on the top. I love the IMAX theater and usually go there once a month. Also the convenient store is very well equipped. I always take friends and visitors there alike.
Not really into high end shopping. Great place to escape from the sunlight. Few malls linked together. Really convenient. Siam Paragon is possibly the most pricey one amongst the few malls.

Where to go for high end shopping. The Siam Paragon houses most high end international shops and designers all offering amazing selections. There is clearly a market for these priced wares. The Hermes store, for example, is amazingly stocked, better than in many major cities around the globe.

Wow!. Amazing mall with expensive and great taste. Immerse yourself in an upper class venue in a bustling city. Be ready to venture into the higher society place of purchase. It has to be seen and experienced to grade the other mall patroned.
Great high class mall. This mall got everything a mall can offer. But it's a high class mall, means it's not for budget shopping. Go to Platinum instead for budget shops.
Great Time. It was our great time to be at the modern shopping mall like this. Lots of brand store for purchasing, nice restaurants are available for lunch time. We spent a lots of time here.
Great place. Wonderful experience! The mall is amazing with unusual artwork and crazy technology and lights. Nothing like I've seen anywhere. Escalators to the sky!
Shopping mall. A big modern shopping mall with branded stores, restaurants, specialties shops, supermarkets, etc. A place where we spent a whole day just shopping, eating and people watching.

get lost shopping. This is a HUGE shopping mall with lots of great shops. Ranges from really high end to sharks fin to supermarket to eateries and restaurants. Located next to Siam BTS. If u r taking taxi, be sure to agree on price-many still don't use the meter. Can spend the whole day here. If u r tourist, be sure to check for VAT redemption. Have fun!!

its ...a mall. yes, it just another mall at the heart of Bangkok (hope its correct). Siam Paragon is modern and stylist mall with luxurious brand tenants at the ground floor, and well known branded on the next floor levels. I bought an iphone and ipad mini on iStudio with very good price here plus vat return at the airport departure the basement will full of crowd during lunch and supper time as there are lots of lots food stalls you can choose; subways, sbux, swensens, you name it... but you have to stop on "after you" if you wish to taste Bangkok nowadays deserts, it worth to try at the same floor, you can also found a big supermarket named "food gourmet" - this is the place for you to buy dried food if you wish to take to your homeland, many variety of dried food i.e; manggo, granola, banana, cashew nut with tom yam flavor etc with affordable price (relatively)well, if you preferred to stop at decent mall, Siam Paragon it is..it also connected with BTS Siam station.

Luxurious shopping mall. Conveniently located within shouting distance of the BTS station, Siam Discovery and Siam Center, this mall offers high end luxury goods and dining all in one building; no need to travel to Dubai, Milan or Paris!
Melbourne needs one. Great place caught the Sky Train from the Asia Hotel, it was only 2 stops. Luxury shops great square, full of people- locals, tourists? Lovely place to sit and people watch.
Siam paragon. One of the biggest shopping center in Asia. A great place for shopping and also going to the sea life Bangkok ocean world which is in the basement of the shopping centre.

From High end fashion to supermarkets in the one centre. Luxury shopping, luxury eating to clean cheap food stalls. There is a large super market with anything and every thing. You can eat in the supermarket if you so desire. Chemists, dentists , doctors etc can be located in this complex. Underwater world and cinemas are here too, a great day for the whole family.

Huge mall with variety of shops. The mall is placed close to MBK mall, Siam center & Siam discovery, so you can mix all together to have an enriched shopping experience. At the B1 & B2 level of Siam Paragon we have Ocean World (now called Sea Life) which is a good place to spend about an hour or two appreciating the amazing aquatic life. A local market nearby (opposite side of the road) is busy selling clothes, souvenirs at very cheap price. The Best way to reach Siam paragon is by BTS Sky train, next would be the buses (for locations not connected by BTS), then taxis or Tuk-Tuk

It is a very luxury place. The SIAM Paragon is really a good place for shopping, providing with seemless connection to the BTS. The place is very well designed, contempary style. When we were there, the orchid exhibition was held on the ground floor and gave us a change to know so many variety of orchid. The food court in the B1 level is also recommended, reasonable price, tastful food with wide range of food selections, the gourmet market is also good, we bought a lot of gifts for our friendds.
Love this place. There are always lots of activities and it's a good place to spend the afternoon shopping and eating.

High End Shopping in Bangkok. The Siam Paragon located near Siam BTS station is a modern multi-story shopping experience that deserves a look if visiting Bangkok.It is spread over 5 levels with a huge range of shopping and eating options with a large cinema complex on the 5th floor showing English films with Thai subtitles.You won't find any budget shops in this mall though if you are on the hunt for bargains but it was a surprise to see 2 Rolls Royces and a Maserati in their 3rd floor showrooms!

Simply the best!. Bangkok has probably too many shopping malls but Siam Paragon is one of the best. Whether it's just window shopping or serious buying, you can easily spend the best part of a day here. Easy to get to on the BTS, you will need some serious spending power to shop here....most of the top end brands are found here including cars by Rolls Royce, Maserati and McClaren if you've got upwards of 20 million baht to spare! When the time comes for refreshment, ,again you will be spoilt for choice with a multitude of restaurants and fast food outlets available. If it's afternoon teatime, try Harrods or the Mandarin Oriental shop ( afternoon tea for two about 1000 baht + tax). It's also worth checking whether there are any special events taking place...when we were there, there was an amazing orchid festival taking place.

I am a traveller. I must say this is a mall to see. Very clean and all u want to buy is here. Must see when in bangkok. We spent 12 hours her one day and still could not finish it. We have visited this mall 3 times and must say heds up to who ever made thes mall.
Too busy here. It's always super busy and crowned place to go on weekend. The theater here wasn't great either. The seat not comfy and funny angle which made my neck v stiff afterwards.

Always Great Shopping Mall. The best Mall the Bkk.Great food choice on the lower ground at ridiculously cheap prices or higher end with table service on the fourth flour.All top end brands inc Rolls Royce to H&M in a shopping Mall this place really is crazy. Great location next to Siam BTS station. One tip the Mall next to it Siam Central with smaller brands is Fab too. One gripe is the sea life centre ripping off the tourist more than double what Thai pay entry fee ie; 990 baht tourist420 baht Thai

High end mall with lots of food. I prefer to shop in the cheaper parts of Bangkok but this is a place you should take a look if you can. Just beside Siam BTS station, Siam Paragon is easy to get to. Plenty of food options and the market sells some good stuff. Although it seems to be more expensive than other markets, it offers other things such as making your own salad (charging by grams) etc. Many shops in here too!
Good for food. A bit frantic but well worth a visit. I preferred the food court than the shops. Easy to get to with the Sky Train. Nice mall.

Clean mall with many things to eat and buy!. There are so many foods for us to have lunch and dinner after being tired of shopping! We can choose whatever you want from the low price to high price. Will be good if you want to come here, better to have a lot of times!

An interesting mall. Siam Paragon is a luxury mall in Siam Square in Bangkok. As an American, it was fascinating to see the interest that Thais have with some aspects of Western culture, such as a Harrod's tea shopWhere you can have scones, tea, cucumber sandwiches etc... There are giant bears outside of the shop, like the ones in Hartod's London. For me, this was a mall to observe, since the store like Gucci, Chanel, Versace etc... Are too rich for my blood. After visiting more reasonable malls in Bangkok, I don't think I would return tobSiam Paragon again. I can see those kind of malls everywhere in the world. They don't seem to special.
The best shopping mall on earth!. A place to shop till you drop and eat till you explode! There are so many shops and eateries here and all reasonably priced too. A must go!
No floor map or signs. Not good for family with kids.... could not trace floor map even after wandering for 2 good hrs. Hence cannot plan what to shop for.
Nice International standard shopping. Nice place to hang around for international food and shopping. Priced high. Quality nice. Nice view at night lights.

Good food & many things to look at. One of the best malls i've been to, in Thailand and anywhere else. All those luxury cars 'showrooms' inside the mall itself really blew me away. The Krungsri IMAX cinema is the best, must try the IMAX movie. And the food court is great, many good food to choose from, especially Billion Beef & Svensons. The Harrods cafe was much more reasonably priced than in Kuala Lumpur or Singapore too. Good place to hang out and spend hours.

MyFavourite mall in Bangkok!. The best part is the food court, hands down! I was slightly disappointed because a lot of the small stalls I loved were replaced by the larger shops including .. Coffee bean?! But the must try is the fried roti, chicken yakitori, mango sticky rice ( inside the gourmet market) and the billion beef noodles! Even the mandarin oriental scones are there now! Though it's not as good as the original! It's much more convenient to get now

The no. 1 place to get ripped off by mafia taxis. Beware! . Paragon is ok for shopping but avoid the taxi queue. I've been living in Bangkok for 14 years and the only time I take taxi is when I'm with my children. Every time we got into one one at Paragon, they just drove off and refuse to turn on the meter and demand 200 or 300 baht if you are a foreigner and even when you speak Thai and how much more if you're a tourist. Paragon costumer services is hopeless and a waste of time.
Good shopping. The stores are mostly really expensive brands like armany, dior, channel. The gourmet market is really great with things from all over the world

Fashion. To those BRAND FANATICS , Paragon Siam shopping mall should be in your list of places to visit. the mall has almost every famous designer brands..DIOR..OACKEY..RAYBAN..BVULGARI...you name it. the shopping mall connects directly to the Skytrain at Siam BTS train station and hence conveniently accessible from many places.

Great place for hanging out. To me, shopping is the same all over the world. But the food court at the bottom really was amazing. Almost every night for my six days stayed at Bangkok my family of four ate at the Siam Paragon. The restaurants there are excellent.

Good mall but not very high end.. Clean and nice place to shop. everything has their sections, i.e. food, perfume dispensers / air fresheners, etc. some good high end stores but not exclusive high end like Central Embassy mall has which is 10 minutes away via "skytrain."there is a very large grocery store on the first floor. massive food place. lots of coffee, bakery and ice-cream places. starbucks also on the first floor. getting a taxi from here at late evening may be difficult. if i may suggest, take a walk to "Siam Kempinski" hotel that is linked via a small bridge from the mall and go to the front of the hotel and get a taxi. make sure that you either have the taxi start the meter right away before you take off from the Siam Kempinski or have a set price before you jump in. Taxi drivers are super weird and lot of them are super scary. take a picture of the taxi license plate or write it down and make sure that the taxi driver's information is on the passenger side dashboard. the driver should have his first and last name, picture and driver's assigned number. if you don't have that, it's not a real taxi driver. if you want real high end shopping only, go to central embassy. Central embassy also has currency exchange bank on the third floor (above Prada).

Feast for the eyes. The mall is easy to get to since it is connected with the BTS, all the upscale shops are located here. Its a beautifully done up mall so even if you dont intend to buy anything this mall deserves a visit, you will find all the local, international brands here, food court n the ground floor has a beautiful water fountain which makes for great photos.

Great Mall Shopping in Bankok. Just a taxi or tuck tuck away is the Siam Paragon mall in Bankok. While staying there recently we visited the mall twice. It has some great stores, a multiplex of theatres, department stores, and an impressive food court. Many say the some of the best mid-tier restaurants are located at Paragon. There is plenty of diverse options to choose from. Make sure to take good walking shoes and have at least a few hours to spend there. Some high-end stores are there, and discounts can be found. Be aware of taxi cabs that finish running meters at 10pm and start charging more for rides back to your hotels. Be a tough negotiator.
shopping inBangkok. Great place for shopping in Bangkok,clean,varius of shops, average prices.food corner nice and very good food!good with kids! water park

Super shopping and worderful eating !. I am more eater than shopaholic exept food department. Siam Paragon sure have all possible shops to serious shopper. From fashion T-Shirt to Sports Car here you can experience all ! I do like Siam Paragon food market department where you can eat exelent food from many many mini restaurants. Thai, Chinese, Pizza just name it and my favorite Bimimbab Korean. In Berlin there is KADEWE and Bangkok Siam Paragon super places to satisfied most demanding customers. In Siam Paragon smiles are more friendly!

Fabulous Construction , Display and Shoppers Delight. This mall is a beauty to look at. Inside there is a big food court and plenty of indian food including vegetarian food .several floors for shop addicts and branded goods .fabulous displays and shops very neat and clean , spacious lifts , walking areas no bargain an upmarket but a must visit for its beauty

all in one roof. yes, you will find everything that you need here...food, clothes, shoes, cosmetics, perfume, gadgets, etc. mane it, they have it! wide variety of food at the food court. gourmet market is a foodies' paradise! easy access to bts. for sure you will come out with many shopping bags on your hands!
Very cozy upscale mall. Complete brand names available in this mall. Also a huge grocery store in the basement with plenty of restaurants to choose from.
High End All The Way!. i didn't see 1 store that looked like a normal mall store. All name designers and independent type stores. Extremely high end.

Average mall. For me, the mall is an average luxury mall with lots of luxury branded boutiques. Walking around was great there. The ground floor offered a variety of food. Yummy food at the food court as well. Great atmosphere.

beautiful high-end mall. not going to lie, the mall ain't a cheap one, no fakes etc... Mall sell real stuff. if you are looking for some time kill you got inside the mall "ocean world" which can take away 2 hours, beautiful thing. great cinema as well (vip seats are a bit over-priced but are amazing!)

Fantastic High End Shopping Mall. Whenever I am in BKK, I usually visit this mall. During my recent trip there, there was a car show going on at Siam Paragon on the 1st floor. There were many expensive cars on show. Other then that, the mall is very High End and it's a nice place to go window shopping.

Big air con shopping mall. A big air con shopping mall with many international high ends boutiques
A good place to hang around against the hot weather outside

Nice but too expensive. It's fun the first time you're there, just to see all luxury stores. But second time you already seen it. The best thing with Paragon is the cinema on the top floor. Really high end quality picture and sound. The aquarium with shark tunnel at the bottom floor is also ok. And there are plenty of good food to choose between in the food area.

A maze but worth it. I went to buy a phone. I got one. Good price and good service. Having done the buying lark.....or more precisely, while still in buying mode, I had a wander. This place is big. Really big and a complete swine to navigate. But I found some shops selling higher-end Hi-Fi. I am in the market for a new universal disc spinner and Cambridge Audio make a very good one - the Azur 752DB. Guess what? 100 pounds cheaper here than the UK and you can claim the VAT back at the airport when you leave! Well done Siam Paragon!

Stunning mall well worth a visit. I loved this mall, it is one of the most beautifully designed I have ever been into. Spend a few hours in the comfort of the air con just browsing at the designer shops they are all here..... Prada, Channel, Louis Vuitton, Jimmy Choo etc ( our budget doesn't lean to purchases I these shops) but it's one location I did feel welcome to take a peek inside! Affordable shops up in higher levels and the 4D cinema was a fun night out. Food hall is great with every thing imaginable and the supermarket on same level is well worth a look just to see the range of fresh fruits and special juices avail all at affordable prices, we got a huge bag of about 25 passion fruit for 190 baht.... Only time I've seen them in Thailand. Great photo opportunities outside with the water features ..... Not to be missed.

High End Retail, Great shows. If you're in Bangkok and have a few hours free it's probably worth dropping into Siam Paragon. We're not in that class that can afford Dior, Cartier or Lambourghini but we often stop into Siam Paragon when we're in Bangkok because it's air conditioned, the food court sells speciality items like white chocolate frosted Krispy Kreme Donuts with oreo crumbles on top AND because of the shows. If you are there at the right time you can see dance shows on the plaza or orchid shows inside the mall. All for free. And of course, if you have the money you can buy some amazing clothing, shoes and jewelry.

Nice shopping in the centre of Bangkok. Siam is easily and best reached by the Skytrain or BTS. It is a vast shopping mall that is interconnected through skywalk with other malls in the area,... you find all the A brands like Hermes, Chanel, as good retail quality stores like Robinson,... you have cinema's and food and beverages,... a nice way to spend the afternoon,... a lot of students come and study here as a university is just around the corner,...So from all the malls in Bangkok,... one of the best,... not to miss,... and for the techies,... MBK is just next door!

Money and you can have it all!. Name the brand, and you have it! Shopper's paradise.
You will need days to visit each store and browse through. I loved the collection they have in their stores.

Bangkok shopping Mecca. There is no doubt that Siam paragon is a must see for serious shoppers visiting Bangkok - all the international brands are there and on top of that great selection of simple or sophisticated food outlets. You may also think about visiting emporium
And do not miss the weekend market. Enjoy your stay.

A great place to shop and eat!. One of the larger shopping malls in Bangkok with many designer shops Good food mall. Best to get there early as it can get busy late afternoon and evenings especially on Sundays. Siam Passage on the 4 th floor is well worth a visit. Mandarin Oriental coffee shop there is great for coffee and cake.

DESIGNER PARADISE. This is a very modern shopping mall with every designer you can think of it isn't a mall to look for bargains.This mall caters for the affluent not the average wage earner but it's nice to look around and their is a very good food hall with many different choices.

great for shopaholicskss.... From mid-hi to low-hi level brands are available.. plus sale is on round the yr...
Its a complete shopping paradise even for window shoppers....

Amaze with the center. A good place to shop and hangout with strategically located with the trains reach the entrance and my 1st time to view 2 rails on top of each other in a city.
Trendy place.
Great Shopping. This is a very nice shopping centre with al the designer buteques and for lunch treat your self and go to the Mandarin Oriental it is an oasis for good food at lunch time.

A good place to get away from the crowds!. This is a more upscale shopping mall but it is a good place to get away from the crowds in those lower tier malls. Also, Kidzania BKK is located on the top floor of Siam Paragon so it is a good place for families. There are also a lot of good food within the mall especially Japanese cuisine.

SHOPPING SHOPPING SHOPPING !!!. Different from Central World, this mall has lots of expensive high-end and luxury goods. Get somebody to buy for you ;) So easy because it joins direct from the BTS Siam skytrain station. Love it!!!

Many name brand shops. I've been to Bangkok many times and finally made a visit to Paragon this June. Decent place to spend an afternoon. Lots of high end and mid-range shops and restaurants in the area. I wouldn't recommend visiting here if you only have a few days in BKK.

One giant mall with everything (but not cheap). This is one giant mall. The BTS 'Siam', the central station, has direct access to the mall. You'll find everything in the mall, but if you're looking for something Eastern/Thai, this is not the place. I'm not a fan of malls, but this mall has showrooms of Lamborghini, Maserati, BMW, to the Ocean World (1200 THB for full tour) with Sharks, Jellyfishes, Stingrays, and many other kinds of sea creatures, to designer restaurants or other fast-food outlets, to all the big fashion industry brands. Also, if you have children accompanying you, you can take them to Kidzania, which is an amazing role-playing kids place with many activities.
Big. This place is large. All shops are mainstream or high-end so don't expect to find anything uniquely Eastern.

Even to watch the surfaced fountains it's worth to see.. Nice, light , holiday atmosphere, the fountains, beautiful gallery, impressive portrait of the King Bhumibol Adulyadej, also known as Rama IX. Well made Illumination helps to get the true, deep impression.

One stop department store. If you plan to buy any brand names products, having nice variety of food, shopping in supermarket or buy souvenir. You must come here. Also, all good coffee , tea , bakeries are all here as well. Siam paragon is easy reached by sky train and lots of parkings. If you are tourists, You might have to plan 1 day shop around this place.

Not bad but not impress. This is a huge mall at Siam station. There are too many shops. The information counters was not very helpful. Maybe they do not understand English well. I had trouble locating the shop I wanted to visit even after asking two information counters. Room for improvement.

Good shops and good food. We went to Siam Paragon. There are a wide variety of food available for your selection. However it is quite cumbersome as you have to buy food coupons from the front counter and produce them when ordering food from the respective stalls. The aquarium is interesting as it provides many kinds of sea animals.

A great place. I lived near this lovely mall.We would invariably visit it daily and did all our cosmetic shopping from there.The good courts were lovely though noisy.Breads with nuts were our favorite.The beauticians were helpful. Good VAT return system .My Pakistani credit cards were facilitated.Carry ur passport if u want VAT refund. Must visit this Mall.

Impressive and fun. My favourite mall in Bangkok, It has a fountain outside and place for people to sit and watch whats going on,also houses the largest aquarium in SE asia in the basement, Has all the high end stores you can think of, this place also boosts of a great theatres and a wide range of restaurants to chose from. I love doing grocery shopping at the gourmet market.

Food world. Honestly, this is truly a superb shopping mall, with lots of top stores willing to part you of your hard earned dollars, several floors offering loads of choice, impressive stores with helping staff that will wait on hand and foot with awesome smiles to impress you, But the real highlite is the amazing food court, there is just so much choice, of great food amazing cakes and sweets, all a excellent prices, you can even buy Harrods products to try....

Luxury Mall. This mall pretty much has every brand you can think of. Was surprised to see that they have a Laduree there, which was nice. However, unless you plan on spending a lot of money, it's probably better to window shop, and probably cheaper to buy in the US. Very easy to get to, just take the closest BTS station to you to Siam Station.

beautiful shopping mall. We loved this mall! Went to the cinemas here a few times. Its a very clean place and loved the fountains outside. There is also an aquarium downstairs. Good mix of food court food and restaurants!

Great Mall shopping!. If you enjoy mall shopping this is the place for you! It is uncrowded and has all the high-end stores one would find in New York, Paris or Milan. Customer service is unsurpassed. I don't usually shop in malls, but Siam Paragon was so inviting! Also, there is great seating outside to "people watch!"
Pricey end of Shopping. for the pricey range, come here. Lots of international brand to choose from. Lots of decent food at the ground floor. ANd not forgetting, air conditioning for summer.

Asia's largest shopping mall. As Asia's largest shopping mall, this place has a lot of facilities, not only for shopping, but also to the world of entertainment and knowledge, such as the availability of 15 cinema theater room and one of them is a theater with a screen and a capacity audience in Asia. In addition to having the largest aquarium in Southeast Asia, as well as many others.I advise you to visit this place!

Impressive. A very impressive shopping centre that is very clean and well maintained. Can access it directly from the sky train station. Although I wouldn't go there unless you have the funds, mainly top-end shops

Pricey, but fun. Always love going to the grocery. Pricier than the others but complete. I buy things to bring home from here. Buy a Bangkok Map at Kinokuniya, and Thai recipe books. Get pens, tapes, and everything else at B2s.
Review for the ground floor only . The ground floor of siam paragon, where some of the restaurants and food courts are located, is a food haven. Try the gourmet market and the food court.

Great food court . The shops are great but the big plus is the food court. If pretty much has everything you can ever hope for down there so if you are looking for a large choice then look no further.

Much smaller than I thought it would be. We buzzed through the whole aquarium in a couple hours, I guess I'm used to the aquatic parks in America with whale and sea lion shows to entertain the guests. This aquarium is just for walking through and viewing, no shows to see.

western style shopping mall. western style shopping mall where you can find originals of all worldwide brands, cinema, restaurants... I put excellent as there is nothing to say about it in a negative way, however, I think there is much more to see in this city than a shopping mall :)

Very good. After arriving in Bangkok from Dubai, the last thing I wanted to do was visit another shopping mall. I must say that I was very impressed with this mall (please don't tell the wife). Ended up having fish and chips from one of the many clean restaurants and was so impressed with the food and service. Sorry I can't remember name of restaurant but it advertised about their world famous fish and chips

Best place to shop. Siam Paragon has some of the popular global and local brands. The mall is just enough for you to spend at least half day of shopping. I also love the choices of international cuisines at the mall's food court. But since it's Thailand, we settled for interesting Thai dishes. You can never go wrong with Thai food.
luxury shops. High end luxury mall with international brands selling their top products. Also a great food court (try the Waterfront restaurant on the 4th floor - great food) and cinema complex.
Big & clean mall. This mall is huge and very clean. They have alle the brands from cheap to luxury. It's to freakin big for me. But hey, I don't like shopping.

Modern and a big mall. The place is in the heart of Siam district midway between Sukhumvit and silom. It is a good modern mall with excellent eating choices and there is an ocean world too if you have kids with you

Cardio at Bangkok's Pride!. I had the best cardio experience here. I never thought I would last the whole day in one mall knowing there are several others nearby but this was no ordinary mall and I simply got stuck. This mall sells Rolls Royce, Maserati, Lamborghini, Lotus, Aston Martin, Bentley, Porsche, Jaguar... among others! It has a wonderful all Thai store, and the endless wonderful display of beautiful things and friendly English speaking sales people and marked sale items here and there just won't make me stop walking. Choosing where to eat is also a major problem when there are so many tempting restaurants to try everywhere. You can dive or walk with the Sharks or choose a movie from their 14 amazing theaters or watch their upcoming Cirque du Soleil show! I really fell in love with this mall, this gorgeous and cool indoor is the place to work out in Bangkok!

beautiful,. Such a clean and pleasant place to either eat, shop, relax or be entertained by the many attractions. Even though it is always busy, you never feel crowded. There are many many shopping plazas in Bangkok but this would be one of my favourite.
Eat your heart out!. Must travel the mall's food court. Oyster omelet, boat noodle and fried fish cakes. It's located on the same floor of the supermarket.
One of the best malls in the world. Everything is expensive but boy is it pretty. Food options are fantastic!Check out the IMAX if you have time.Will return.

VERY upmarket mall a short distance from BTS. Attended Paragon shopping mall via BTS (Siam Station) which allows very easy access. This mall is one of the more expensive malls to shop in, which has approx. 8 floors of designer boutiques such as Guest, Coach, etc. etc. Also has a floor of electronics which is interesting to browse. There is also a floor for sale of VERY expensive motor vehicles such as Rolls Royce, BMW and more designer vehicles, some of which I have never heard of, but excellent looking for a few million Thai Baht. This mall is clean and easy to get around. Where ever I looked, the prices are expensive everywhere but there are sales usually throughout the months where if you look you can find a good bargain on an expensive watch, handbags, wallets, clothing and the like. This is not MBK style, more Hollywood Rodeo Drive type of shopping. So your credit card is going to take a hit!

Superb mega shopping complex!. Stayed at Amari which was within walking distance albeit via a long covered walkway stretching from Central World and connecting to Siam BTS station which is adjoined to the huge Siam Paragon Mall! Upon arrival we were greeted by this huge imposing yet architecturally breathtaking mega mall and we were not disappointed! Lots of specialty shops, branded names abound, eateries, cinemas etc! Nice air conditioning especially since it was scorching hot outside! Well planned and from the looks of it, very busy even on weekdays! There will be something that caters to everyone, from the wannabe fashionistas to the plain old Joe like myself! Overall a superb shopping complex in the heart of Bangkok!

For the rich. Either bring a fat wallet or don't shop here at all. Even has a whole floor catered to branded goods. Save your money, head to other malls like MBK. Only thing worthy of note is the kinokuniya bookstore which is the largest english bookstore in bangkok,on the 3rd floor.

Perfect spot for culinary. I think this is the best spot for culinary, especially restaurant Ros'ni at the lowest floor( if i'm not mistaken) . They serves tom yam soup, chicken curry, and many more mouth-watering food to eat. However, for tourists who wanted to find affordable or cheap fashion, i think this is not the place. I recommend you to go to platinum fashion mall, because I think it is so cheap and you can buy wholesale there.

Excellent. You certainly get alot of variety and options in here, but before actually buying something, should explore the local market as one may get better bargain there. The best place to visit here is the Ocean World. Too good an experience.Makes you totally forget about the shopping. If you want to visit this place, dont waste your time going from shops to shops, rather see other useful attractions they have within the premises.
Love this place!. How good is the food at the Paragon Food Court? Make sure you are stopping at the seafood counter at the food hall (basement floor) and enjoying fresh oysters from around the world.
Glitzy mall. Went here to see what it was like. It was so familiar - all the shops from the UK, same stuff, same prices. Lots of high end designer shops. We much prefer the street markets!

Wonderful shopping mall, well located. Centrally located in the city (Siam BTS station), it boasts plenty of foreign brands. Mall layout is clean, brightly lit and shop directories are in English and clear. Besides shopping, restaurants are aplenty. There's also a good food court at the basement level for those who don't want fancy restaurants. There is a cineplex (really impressive. See my other separate review), a bowling alley, and Kidzania coming up. The supermarket in the basement stocks a good variety of local snacks tourists can buy for souvenirs. Toilets are clean too. There are other shops meant more for locals eg language schools, dance schools, etc which I won't mention. Very enjoyable experience in the mall. Can visit its website for more details.

Too good. Actually so good we don't go there as its too busy. Great layout, excellent food and good shops the H&M and Kinokuniya in particular standing out. For kids there is Oceanworld, cinema bowling, probably the widest range of attractions under one roof. A total and utter triumph
expensive shopping!. really expensive shopping! I max cinema, which is good! there are lots of luxury cars!some floors has got good foods, just try it!
High end shopping. This is a high end mall with a lot of Signature shops, relaxing ambience, and one could walk for hours exploring.

Amazing. Amazing shopping. Huge, luxury brands, wonderful architecture.
Like it or not, you won't be indifferent to it.
It's a good place to spend a few hours and run from the super hot weather if you're there in April ;)

AWESOME!!!. If you haven't been there, you wouldn't understand my exclamation!
Just step into their endless food court run by Food Junction and prepare to be lost for words, choice and in amazement!

Get your posh fix here!. This is the place for you if you are looking for luxury products from LV bags to Maseriti cars! Visited this place on a Friday so understandably it was very crowded. However the crowd seem to focus on the restaurants on the higher floors and the food court in basement 2. If you desire some international food like Italian, Chinese, American (sic) etc this is the place to be. A humongously huge international supermarket at basement 2! Siam Paragon is right next to Siam Kempinski Hotel if you want to stay near it. My only gripe was very limited number of baby changing rooms available. Had to walk a distance from the restaurant (different floor too) just so I could change my boy's diapers.

The fancy mall ;). Nice mall to visit but despite the food nothing is different from other malls around the world, same prices everywhere but might be a different collections.Food hall is perfect and full of varieties :)
Big names. . Want the big names in fashion you got it here. Bring a credit card and you could stay the whole day in this place. A great way to beat the heat.

Expensive but good. I went there and expected the price of clothes to be much lower. It was a surprise for me, I thought it would be cheap because it is in Thailand. It has a great Food Hall and many high end stores.

Very classy and up market shopping centre . If you want the original name brands like Porsche, Hermis, Lamborghini or if you want to buy a boat or perhaps some department store shopping that has everything and you got the cash to splash then shop hereEven if you don't it's a beautiful shopping centre and worth a look with great restaurants that are affordable and that don't cost an arm or a leg

Classy department store. Ended up at this department store as there are a couple of English bookshops here. The clothes are not that cheap, but they allow tourists to use credit cards to pay in your home currency, there are also special desks to help claim back VAT when you return home.

A vast luxury place to cover in a few hours. Easy to get lost in this complex where one can find anything. Direct connection with the Siam center and Siam Kempinski hotel and sky train. If you love luxury cars and motorbikes, 2nd floor is all for you.

A large place with an equally large Food Hall. It is a large Mall with all the high end brands. We went on a weekend and the crowds were large. The queue for taxi can get pretty long so be prepared.Th food hall with its many eatery options is very impressive. It is a one stop shopping experience worth exploring

High end shopping and dining complex. This is more of a showcase mall rather than a shopping emporium, with Rolls Royce, Masseratti, Aston Martin showroorms held inside.
A great place to just wander and admire even covet those unaffordable luxuries.
All in one under one roof. very very huge shopping mall. All in one under one roof. electronic, restaurant, leather items, siami ocean world also there. madam tushhad near about shopping mall.

Incredible oasis of gourmet eateries. Spent the weekend here with a work colleague and had a dive planned in the aquarium in the basement of the shopping centre (every bit as good as the Monterey aquarium and better than the one in Barcelona!) when we spied the food court. This is NOT your average food court; we started at the back in the grocery section, from first-class real Wagyu beef from Japan through Spanish hams and a range of fresh fish that would leave you speechless. No hard sell, plenty of samples and in front, a plethora of eateries/concessionaires akin to an Eataly or the top floor of Galeries Lafayette. We decided on seafood; linefish & tiger prawns with rice and a simple bottle of ZA red. To die for. Head 20m across the mall to a coffee joint and get a killer Lavazza doppio and a truffle Would recommend this place in a heartbeat for singles and families alike. Foodie paradise.
Cool, modern and designer heaven!. Designer shops, kids play area , cinemas all very clean and modern, complete opposite to MBK (which I love). Sky train stops very close.

Unbelievably crowded. Suoerb shopping atmosphere. This is the most crowded mall I have ever seen in my life. Believe me, I have seen a lot of malls in my life, but this is beyond anything I could comprehend. You get so many discounts and so many offers that you can't simply walk out of here without a bag in your hand.

Spaciously Humongous !!!. Just coming out of Siam Sky train station , we can enter this fabulous Paragon Mall , water front lobby welcomes all the visitors , the corridors are very wide and absolutely spacious mall .We went there on 20.05.15 and enjoyed the brilliantly designed Mall. Very famous water world is situated in this Mall , we can spend one full day in this Mall.Must visit for all age groups when you are in Bangkok.Thanks a lot for everything ...Loving you so much...Peacefully yours.S M Bega Raaj.Happy travelling...

Huge Shopping Mall. This is a huge shopping mall - which is really amazing - but beware if you're buying brands which are a big hit in Europe, such as Adidas as the prices are higher than in Europe.It was still worth visiting and seeing the place - and we did buy stuff which are known in Asia sat cheap prices :)

Luxurious commercial centre. The first of this kind in Asia.. It had been the first luxury shops centre in Bangkok. Now with the Embassy and the new Phrom Phong Emporium and others mushrooming up, it will one of several.The supermarket is worth a visit as the aquarium on the underground.

Great Place to shop entertain and relax. Day started with parking at the car wash area on B1 so no problems parking . Up to the 5th floor to get VIP cinema tickets , back down to G/F to have lunch . The Chinese restaurant has the best Dim Sum in BK . Back up through the shops to get some quality items of designer cloths . Watch movie back to cleaned car and home with some snacks . Pleasure.

Coolest mall ever. Best food court in the world!!! Overwhelming at times so many choices, a whole level of luxury cars, a bowling alley, fitness center, and an imax theater could have spent two days there
Awesome mall. This is one of my favorite places to shop in Bangkok. Huge mall with absolutely every brand boutique!!! Simply awesome!

It's a mall, but a nice one. Visitors to Bangkok probably should go ahead and check out Siam Paragon and Central World while here, even though they're just malls. Paragon is as nice as any, with lots of higher end shops and dining options, including a food court. There's a decent aquarium in the basement worth a look for kids, and a higher end grocery store with good selection for picking up essentials or local snacks, along with lots of different specialty foods stalls.

Shopping complex at convenient location. There is everything at this shopping, so you don't have to wandering around finding things you want. There is many good and unique restaurants. Everything here is well organized. Things sold here are good quality stuff, but they come with the price of course. If you cannot find things you want here or it is too expensive, just walk across the road to Siam Square and you will find cheaper stuff. So, this is a very convenient shopping place to find everything at once.

5 star shopping. Walking into Siam Paragon reminded me of walking into Pavilion at Jalan Bukit Bintang, Kuala Lumpur.Siam Paragon has many branded outlets including the famous macaron shop in France, Ladurée. We picked on the prices and shock to see a piece of macaron will cost us 120 Baht at least. We've decided not to spend on macaron since we are afraid that 1 is not enough to sooth our craving.Let's get back to the main agenda.... Yes our main agenda was to visit Naraya flagship store. We came twice on the 2nd night and the next day morning before went back home. We bought so many NaRaYa product and I really love the NaRa by NaRaYa range. NaRa by NaRaYa is the premium product that catched our eyes immediately when we walked into the shop.I guess every visit to Thailand will not complete without getting ourselves some NaRaYa product. On our 2nd visit to Siam Paragon in the morning the day that came back to Malaysia, we had our lunch at the food court. HM tried their local cuisine and due to limitation, I only ate calamari ring with fries (seafood based). Lots of tawakal for me since no other option available unless I wanted to starve myself. I also bought my favourite cinamon rolls and I found the price is expensive compared to the one in Kuala Lumpur. Siam Paragon has a huge H&M and branded outlets like Burberry (coming soon), MNG, Superdry etc. We didn't manage to visit other shops than NaRaYa though they have Pasaya there.Maybe our next trip to Bangkok we should concentrate to the malls which is fun but we need to bring lots of cash to enyertain our shopping desire.

Trendy Mall. Good, modern and trendy mall for trendy all-round shopping--- from Rolls Royce to ClearAudio music systems to daily household & kitchen knic-knacks to latest BlueRays/DVDs to electronic gadgets.....

Quality Thai Shopping. Probably one of the biggest shopping mall in Bangkok, it's simply massive and you will find all you need. Just like another shopping mall is what you can think of this place, however on the 4F there's a "Exotic Thai" corner, and in that corner they sell all kinds of authentic Thai stuff with good price. Exotic Thai is definitely recommended for souvenirs or personal use.

Go ther for the food court. The mall itself is not so much interesting, unless you come from a country where products from international luxury brands are not available.The Jim Thompson store products selection is very tourists oriented and you will find a larger choice at the store located within the Jim Thompson House.The food court offers a good selection of restaurants at reasonable prices, from Fish and Chips to Indian Halal food.

Siam Paragon Shopping Mall. A nice mall for those who have bags of cash. Easy to get to from BTS Skytrain Siam station. Prices are high but did take my grandson to Sealife that sits on the bottom floor.

Mega mall. All brands rolled into one. Directly connected to Siam BTS. Convenient location and had other malls beside. Huge mall that can easily take up to a day inside. Food mall on basement levels. All sorts of international brands here.

Be Aware of Scammers!!. First incident happened few years ago. I was shopping at the Paragon Department Store and had decided to buy 3 items at one of its stores. The sale attendant asked me how I would like to pay for the items. I told him by cash. He then showed me the total amount I needed to pay, minus discount, for the total of 3 items using a calculator. I checked the amount which was correct. I gave him the cash. He then went to the cashier counter for the change and the final invoice. When he was back, he handed me the invoice and the correct amount of change. But when I checked the invoice, something was wrong. It only showed 2 items being charged...1 item was missing. Since I could get my VAT refunded, I told him to correct the invoice. He seemed a bit upset when I told him to do so. For this incident, I can't say for sure if the sales attendant made a mistake or he tried to pocket the money for the missing item. But, as for me, a Big Red Flag was raised!!Second incident happened just a month ago. This time it happened to my husband at the same place. He would like to buy a pair of shoes at the shoes department. He checked out the price of the shoes on display and found out there was a 10% off sticker next to the price on the bottom of the shoes. He handed that particular shoe to a sales attendant and asked him to get the right size for him. The sales attendant walked away a few steps, turned around, with his back side facing my husband and used his finger to remove the sticker. Luckily, my husband saw everything. At that moment, my husband didn't say a word. He went back to the display counter and checked out if all the same brand name shoes had the same 10% off sticker. He found out every one of them had it. When the sales attendant came back, my husband tried out the shoes and asked him if there was any discount for it. The sales attendant told him he could get a 5% tourist discount. Right away, my husband confronted him, told him he saw his dishonest action and showed him the 10% off stickers on all the other shoes. The sales attendant still stood his ground and insisted that 5% was right. My husband left immediately. At the end, he still got the same pair of shoes at the Central Department Store Chidlom with 20% off discount. However, if my husband couldn't have seen his action and bought the shoes with cash at Paragon, the dishonest salesman could have pocketed the extra 5%.By chance, both cases happened at the Paragon Department Store. But they could have happened at any place in Bangkok. Tourists and foreigners are huge targets for scammers. Be very careful when you shop.

How the Other Half Lives Perhaps - Rolls Royces and Luxury Condos!. Worth a visit just to see just what a luxury mall can be...there is something about auto showrooms on the third floor and condos being sold like cosmetics on the first that makes for a really fun couple of hours. The gourmet food store is a great place to find last minute gifts (wonderful spice mixes and terrific tea sets) while Exotic Thai offers an amazing array of souvenirs and high end Thai made crafts/products. Stop by the food court for a nice lunch and all in all, a very satisfying (and cool) way to spend an afternoon.

Not really worth it. I find this place a bit of a shame. Very few Thai people in here unless working.Its full of designer shops, but prices are the same if not more than Europe.This isnt the real Bangkok and only really any good if you really like shopping. If in Bangkok go to other malls and see Bangkok not just another European style mall.

Siam Paragon great for families with teenagers. Siam Paragon had everything, great food court with wide selection to feed the fussiest of eaters, and what you normally find with street vendors, moo ping - family favourite. If you get a chance see a movie in 4D it is amazing.

Popular Shopping Center. Siam Paragon is an popular shopping mall housing a host of fashion brands, and a selection of different cuisine. Located in front of Siam BTS Skytrain station - the interchange of the two BTS lines - it is considered by many to be the center of Bangkok.Banks at Siam Paragon open on weekends so you can exchange foreign currency without any hassle and good rate. Don't forget to bring passport

Must try Grilled chinese pastry.. Must try Gilled chinese pastry. G flr at Siam paragon. The taste was so amazing and packaging was so cute. <green bean, black sesame,red bean, taro , winter melon>. The shop was located front cashier no.16 near fried banana.

Amazing gourmet food mall. We are foodies and so we spent three happy hours in this amazing gourmet supermarket. From arrays of cakes to fruit to spices to oysters from around the world. The selection here is fantastic! Give me an enormous deli over clothes boutiques anytime! There are loads of places to sit and eat as well as ogle the deli produce.....and, yes, we did end up buying a selection to eat in our hotel, couldn't resist. Not the normal tourist attraction but highly recommended if you love food! Straight out of Siam station and then head downstairs

What A Cool Modern Shopping Mall In Bangkok. What A Cool Modern Shopping Mall In Bangkok . Went many times ,Solo , with my friends and I love this beautiful shopping mall so much . It is big and clean with a wonderful design from the entrain on the mall . I could find whatever stuffs i wanted and the quality are super too .There are many good brands of Cloths , Shoes , Skin Products and Make Up Products in this Siam Paragon .I am more interested on skin care products , Siam Paragon mad me so happy and I really enjoy my trip with beautiful day shopping . Only 45 minutes flight from Siem Reap to Bangkok ,So Siam Paragon < I will see you again very soon >

If you travel half way around the world to just see a mall..... I get it this is a nice mall and has some really fancy stores in it, but honestly wouldn't any high class mall in your city have this too? You travel half way around the world I would suggest that you prioritize the temples and other things before this, if you happen to have an hour to kill you could definitely pop in here and see some shops and grab a bite to eat. But I wouldn't make this a destination....

Glitzy Mall. This is a nice mall to shop in. The selection of food is great with many restaurants and smaller shops. The fashion stores are mostly name brand which is quite expensive. The ambiance is great though and the movie theaters are top notch.

Perfect for every function. Couldn't have any idea how the other mall can be more perfect than this. Elegant itself, The only thing that should be improve is the lack of hospitality service of few staff.
Great food. Lot of good food and restaurants, especially local food and Japanese food. Never miss to shop at the basement supermarket.

Designer Heaven. This mall is unbelievable, has Dolce & Gabana, Pucci, and many others well worth a visit to look, there are the usual suspects at a more reasonable level H&M etc, good food court with lots of choice, good place to spend a cloudy morning or afternoon.

great mall, great brands. very well located mall, connected to the other 3 SIAM malls. all are so well laid out & stores are well stocked.
the food court was just ok

Enjoy shopping and watch the show.. I like to shop here. Despite its high price, but the quality is excellent. And many want to do. Getting to this place was by BTS. I was lucky to meet a range of concert performances. Shopping is a lot of fun. I want to come again and take my friends to come here.

If you need a new Lamborghini or Rolls :-). Huge luxury mall in central Bangkok. You get almost everything at this mall. Gucci, Lamborghini, electronics and foods. Good food court in the basement. This mall is also connected to other malls in the nearby. There is no need to buy exclusive european brands like (Gucci etc.) in Thailand, they are even more expensive than in europe. Huge mall so bring good shoes :-)

Extremely fast paced, and huge! . Siam paragon is very easily accessible by car, Sky train and taxi/tuktuk. Everything is expensive but the food court and cineplex are worth going to if you don't want to spend a lot on shopping. Beats Emporium by miles.
Expensive mall. Expensive mall filled with branded goods. Nothing much if you're looking for cheap bargains. Classy mall.
Siam Paragon, Bangkok Thailand. Most exclusive shopping mall in Bangkok, You can find everything here such Fashion, Lifestyle, Technology, Food and Drinks !!!

Best mall in Thailand. Yes. It's indeed the best and most upscale mall in Thailand. Lots of eateries but in terms of shopping quite pricey. It's a large mall connected to Central World and so the mall looks even bigger. Amazing cinema complex. So if you are in for a movie, a good place to relax from the heat and watch a movie have a coffee at Starbucks and the usual stuff... But the mall has its own charm and has its own positive energy which you will not find in any other malls in Thailand except probably Bic C and Lotus independent hypermarket stores. A must visit with Family...

A modern shopping mall... A modern Shopping mall with brands (which you can find all over the world)..A good place to shop for brands and not soo good if you're looking for cheap items (I would recommend Palladium mall for that)...Easy to reach through BTS (although it is one the busiest stations..esp. around 2PM and around 6-7PM).

From needles to cars. Whether you are looking for the smallest or the biggest item surely at Siam Paragon you will find it.This big shopping mall has become by default the center of Bangkok.I personally don't know if Bangkok has a different city center.It has a vast range if restaurants and food outlets, a department store, lots of shops and cinemaplex.It's always kept clean and well airconditioned all the time.This is a must see for all Bangkok visitors

Just another shopping mall. You get to shop at international brands at this shopping mall. The fruits at the supermarket is very expensive. Mango cost 190 baht per kg. And cherry cost 1,500 baht per kg

Siam Paragon. Another excellent addition to the retail therapy scene!A good choice of almost any conceivable good you could want to buy from differing shops and stalls, with banking facilities open far beyond the normal banking hours to boot ! Food, as always in such places, thrives in abundance, and your choice is almost unlimited. A thoroughly worthwhile retail experience.
everything there. . Enjoyed shopping, movie and dining here.also good central location. I like the gourmet supermarket and the food paradise on the same floor.
Retail Heaven. Every luxury brand, every high street designer, great cinemas, an impressive food court and restaurant selection and even has an aquarium. Amazing.

Great Venue and Location. This is probably the best shopping experience one can have in Bangkok, there are a vast mixture of shops and international brands the food outlets are many and many choices of local and international restaurants.I enjoy visiting the iStudio store as they stock the very latest of Apple products and the knowledge and helpfulness of the staff is exceptional. Also close to the BTS which is the best to travel around the Sukhumvit area

Huge shopping mall with lots of food at basement. I always go to the basement for their huge variety of international food. Shopping here is a little on the expensive side so you could just window shop n go down to basement for some refreshments when you feel tired.

Like no shopping mall I have ever seen. Top end jewelry and watch stores, brand name designers - great for window shopping. Even has luxury car showrooms such as Lamborghini, Rolls Royce, Porsche etc. We had lunch at the basement food hall - believe it or not, some of the best food we have experienced in Thailand, and so cheap! Worth a visit.
Luxury Mall. Huge mall with luxury branded shops!! U can shop til drop haha... maybe u can bang into some Thailand celebrity here... Nice food court too... visit the coffee shop too.
Halal food. I found halal food in paragon foodhall, name is yusuf briyani. Grilled chicken briyani is perfect for lunch. And they have chicken satay too.
For reach people . If you have money and you want buy some luxury here are the top brands it's good place not too much crowded good restaurants in Grand floor

Nice and expensive. Lovely place and eat at the bottom. Then take a walk around the mall and see all the new, beautiful things and the new way from Europe and elsewhere in the world. It is expensive and often much more expensive than at home, but it is worth and see and incredibly beautiful.You can take the sky train to Siam and go into the center. Simple, fast and straightforward.

Amazing Shopping. This is a well designed and high standard shopping mall with International standard. Here is where you can find high class international brands of clothing, perfumery, shoes and handbags plus whatever you can think of in terms of household items, clothing, sports items, etc etc.The centre has food court, coffee shops, restaurants and entertainment centres. This mall has even Muslim praying room. Do not miss this mall if you are visiting Bangkok.

Upmarket Shopping Experience n Bangkok. Siam Paragon is located on Rama I Road and may also be accessed from Siam BTS Station. It has high-end stores such as Hermes, D & G, Coach, Cartier, Jim Thompson etc. There is an excellent food court and supermarket in the lowest level and Asia’s largest Aquarium. An unusual feature is the large number of car showrooms in the centre. Amongst others, Bentley, Porsche and Maserati are represented.An amazing Thai Handicraft store is located on the fourth floor where you can purchase high quality Thai-made souvenirs. A fabulous watch department exists on the level above the food court with thousands of models to select from all the best-known brands.This mall is not cheap, but although busy doesn’t attract the frenetic crowds of, say, MBK.

Have almost things you want. When I go there at the first time I very excited because In Siam Paragon at the basement have a very big aquarium call Siam "Ocean World" Over there have many fishes such as shark, jellyfish, and turtle.They collected many fishes in there.It's very beautiful and it's can make you excited.After we can go up to shopping. Siam Paragon also have many shop for you. When I go I can find everything I want. And at the first floor they have a supermarket and the food zone such as Ootoya, Zen, MC,etc. So I recommend you to go here. How to go?- The easiest way is to go by BTS.

Big department store with supermarket. I went there on a Sunday. It was a bit crowded later in the day, but it was alright. The mall was air-conditioned. The price of most stuffs are more expensive than most other places in Bangkok, but quality of the products is largely guaranteed. The prices could still go pretty cheap for items on sale (e.g., a t-shirt for 200baht).The supermarket at the lower ground floor was great. I bought most of my food souvenirs that I had to get for my friends from there. Given that I don't have a lot of time and want to do shopping on a same day, it's very convenient! But if you are more oriented to low prices, you may want to seek other supermarkets like Big C.

Great food!!. Before going to bangkok, I didn't understand why everyone was recommending this mall..But after being here, we were sold! This mall has a great selection of brands from all over the world...And there was also an aquarium on the bottom floor for you to explore! The food court on the basement was amazing..They have a wide variety of restaurants ranging from thai, japanese, Chinese to western and they're all very reasonably priced. We ate here for 4 days at night and the food at different restaurants just gets better each night. They also have a huge grocery store, that offers organic freshly squeezed juices, and any other product you can imagine. It's the biggest grocery store I've ever been to, with a wide selection of choices!

Huge shopping mall. In Bangkok without shopping is nothing, so many shopping mall and market with easy access. Siam Paragon is one of the best shopping destination in Bangkok offer you alot of selection of Local and International brands. Love to shopping in this mall. Just take a train toward Siam and you will find yourself in a huge shopping complex.

Shopping Heaven. This shopping center could be the easiest access as also it has the interchange station for BTS train. They have top western brands, shopping boutiques, restaurants, groceries, food courts, cinemas, etc. A must-visit and go stroll around.

Great on a hot day.. Have been here many times and always found it comfortable and affordable. Some really good places to eat and a fantastic place to do a bit of people watching. Is part of the shopping precinct of Bangkok and is very easy to get to. If you catch the BTS then just get off at the station with the same name. On a hot day the fully air-conditioned centre is a great place to spend a few hours. Guys a great place to let the ladies loose while you have a game of golf or a quiet beer at a nearby bar. Why not see a movie while you are here, on the top floor.

Good place to visit. I visited with family. It was great for children because there is an aquarium on underground floor. Many quality food shops are on ground floor. Especially Japanese food shops quality was good. Can spend half day in this mall. Highly recommended.

Quiet large, especially the super market. You can buy anything in SIAM PARAGON. Especially, you can buy many kinds of foods in the super market. But some imported foods are expensive. It's supposed to be the most luxury mall in BKK.

Haven for Shoppers or relaxation. Siam Paragon is just one of a mass of shopping centers in the Siam area of Bangkok but Paragon is probably the biggest and the most luxurious,If this is your first visit (and you have children) you will want to visit the Sea world center style aquarium in the basement. and on the ground floor is a food center with more restaurants than I have ever seen in one place, there are all the usual McDonald, Starbucks, KFC, Ice cream parlors etc etc but if you walk further you will find there are many other establishments including Italian, Japanese, patisseries and tea houses.On the next floor there is an array of designer shops and top name high street brands and these are interspersed with coffee shops banks etc going higher you will find exclusive car showrooms and all types of technology furniture etc etc.Access to Paragon is very simple there is a walkway direct from the sky train and all taxi drivers know this though if the traffic is bad it is not a good choice, you can also walk via an elevated walkway at least some of the way form many other centers including MBK and Central.
Siam Paragon . Beautiful mall. Great place for branded stuffs. Like the Lambo car show room. A must to visit mall. Easy access by skytrain

Tip top upscale mall. This is an indoor version of LA's Beverly Hills. Top notch shops, recognized name brands. Food court. Not very funky - but that's not a bad thing. I went with a friend from the Vietnam back country who kept telling me he'd never seen anything like it. Big, gaudy, glitzy and on every doorman's list of places to send you to. Just go and submit...but don't buy much, there's a knock off somewhere near by.

Upmarket shopping mall. This mall is very high end with branches of Harrods, the four seasons, gucci, hermes etc all under one roof. Good for window shopping and the wide selection of good restaurants. The food court was huge and carried all sorts of weird and wonderful produce

Luxury Shopping. This shopping mall is different from the MBK mall; it can be categorised as a 5 star mall. The mall sells real branded products from top designer branded such as Coach, D&G etc,. On the ground floor, the mall has a huge food court area selling local and international food. The mall has easy access from BTS Siam Station. Nothing much interesting about the shopping centre itself except it provides you with a useful cooling down before proceeding to your next destination. I recommend it for its food court and huge variety of different foods.

Nice high end brands, huge mall, less crowded compared to other near by malls. Out of all the malls that I visited in Bangkok, this one had good brands, was huge, posh and less crowded. Other malls looked more like a fish market, they were really so crowded!!!!! This mall not only had great brands but also good eating joints. If you love shopping and spending, then go to this mall when in Bangkok!

Wonderful and clean. An amazing basement level dedicated to food, and what an outstanding choice they have! The popcorn cafe is an absolute must but just be careful of type 2 diabetes! I must go back again the next time I am there

Big nice mall.. I enjoy going to this mall admit ja very near to the hotel that we stay in . It is very big with many branded goods stores. What I like most about this mall are the many restaurants, cafés, the big supermarket and good court. Without going too far , you can get a place to have a good meal, a cuppa coffee and shop for some snacks. I prefer the Central World but this mall is a good alternative.

Huge mall, check out the first class movie theater.. It seems like the malls in Bangkok are worth visiting themselves. This one is no exception. Simply put, the Paragon Mall is just massive and there is everything there, from an ocean marine visiting park to first class cinema to one of the largest supermarket. You can find anything. You can also find every international brand names. Obviously, the brand names are not the reasons for the visit but the mall itself, which is accessible by BTS skytrain, is a cultural experience. We were recommended to see a movie at their first class cinema (Bangkok Airways) and that was one of the biggest treats. You can get wine and snacks at the lounge and the chairs are reclining with blankets just like first class on airlines.

Upmarket Mall with good Restaurants.. This is like any other upmarket mall elsewhere. It is not a ‘must visit’ as it is nothing unique to Thailand or Bangkok here. The mall has all the big brands and if you pick something you may as well get a tax rebate at the airport. However, the mall is a good one with good restaurants inside and has connectivity with the BTS.
Huge.... The whole complex is huge and consists of several malls. One can find everything you need...all brands, but it's not the cheapest way of shopping there.

Good for shopping but very crowded. This shopping center offer a variety of things to do, fron shopping to bowling and 4d cinema it is great for you average teenager, but not recomended for tourists or adults because besides shopping, it may not be attractive due to it's ammount of people, traffic to get there and also parking, the place gets too crowded and it is not good for a day off if you want to have a calm and nice day. It serves it purpose which is high street shopping and good dining, but not my favourite.

Newest of all the shopping malls in Siam Square. Right at the Siam Square station, more brand names and upmarket restaurants and the big hit Siam Ocean World. You can also watch a film in style at their Cineplex and eat lovely Italian food at the Amici@Siam Paragon

Great shopping mall!. I think it's a great place. Inside has a lot of the shop, restaurant and dessert><I recommend you to eat "Vanilla Brasserie", it's kind of restaurant but they also sell the dessert too and it's very delicious. In the Siam Paragon has a lot of brand name such as Louis Vuitton. Siam paragon is so big but smaller than "Mega Bang Na".  I think it's the central of the shopping of the thai people because it's near Siam Square, Siam Center and etc. If you want to go by BTS you just choose station 'Siam'.
