Great grocery store, wine store, food. If you are anywhere near this place, its worth a visit for the grocery store, wine store, and food court. I'm not into western brand-name stores or restaurants, which are also at this mall, but the grocery store has everything you could dream of.

Don't spend long there. This mall is crazy in terms of size and luxurious items so I'd recommend dropping by for the experience but it isn't half as interesting as visiting a traditional temple or somewhere else more authentic. Only visit if you have the time.

Fantastic place to spend your time. The mall is a fantastic place to spend hours just window shopping. The number of restaurants will leave you spoilt for choice. A few hours in the day wouldn't do justice so make sure you free up an entire day or maybe a week if you're a shopaholic.

SHOPPING. All of the Siam shopping centers are good for different types of products but we enjoyed walking around all of them and the food was very nice. worth a trip if you have time and convineant as on the BTS line.

For Particular Reasons. When I visit a city like Bangkok, I have little mood for luxury good shopping, preferring to make my buys in Europe, Korea or Singapore. This would mean that 85 per cent of the shops at Siam Paragon would not appeal to me. What I like most about Siam Paragon though are (i) the comfortable cinema; (ii) the clean and well-organised supermarket; and (iii) the large and enticing food court at the basement. All these three are good enough reasons for you to make your way to Siam Paragon, whether to relax, buy snacks and souvenirs, or have a taste of local Thai food. If you're in the mood for desserts, you could hop by Siam Centre next door, where there's cafes like Mr Jones' Orphanage.
cultural exchange. excellent shopping place n food dtall like it very much try to go another time n will do the shppping again really a beautiful place
Nice shopping mall. Enjoyed with the environment. Just walk if you have nothing to buy. There are many choice of restaurant/cafe with delicious food. Enjoyed my day at there.

Wonderful experience. This was probably the most amazing experience we had during the trip, getting to see deep sea creatures in a mall so close. the way they have built the aquarium is amazing. Should try out the underwater vehicle ride if you get time.

All you need for a day trip. Took the girlfriend here as part of our trip to BKK. There is a large selection of shops on offer here. At first I was put off from going due to the nature of the shops (designer labels) but there are plenty of other shops in there including Paragons own department store. Also visit the sporting goods store which is hidden away near the top. Prices are much the same as the West, although I was laden with clothes by the time we left. Staff range from very helpful in the Paragon Department Store to contemptuous at worst or oblivious at best in the designer stores, despite going to these shops to purchase goods the attitude annoyed the girlfriend so much she decided to buy elsewhere. There is a very large food area with a huge selection of food types, we ate in Fuji, not much for me (vegetarian) so I settled for a beer (shame). Be warned the food hall is always really busy and caters to a lot of non-shoppers such as school kids so you might want to aim to ear earlier or later.

Huge mall could do with better signage. This is one huge mall located in Siam area of Bangkok. There are actually three interconnected malls with one of them housing the flagship Ocean World which we did not visit this time. One can easily get lost in the mall. With most Thais inot speaking English getting out of the store the way you want is a nightmare. The mall houses most international brands including Harrods. The Gourmet food section of the Dept store is a must visit with an amazing range on offer.The mall is conveniently approachable from the sky train stations.

The biggest center shopping mall. Nice and big shopping mall. There are many store but they are all expensive. My favorite store in this mall is H&M store. H&M store at Siam paragon are very big, they have all the clothes that I like. Siam paragon always crowded. The BTS skytrain that near Siam paragon is Siam. I think use skytrain to transport to Siam paragon is easier than use car. I recommend to go to the movie theater because there are 4D cineplex. It is an amazing movie theater ever! The seats are very soft and comfortable.I love this mall.

One stop shop. It is a high end mall with a lot of popular brands present in almost each floor. Stores, restaurants, and services are varied, plus Sealife Bangkok Ocean World at the basement of the mall makes this huge establishment a one stop shop for everyone, kids and adults alike.

Biggest Food Selection & Top Brands!. Loved this place. Even though it has all the top designer brands and I couldn't really afford anything, I still loved being seeing everything. Everyone knows this place, it's cool to have a look around and dream of having everything in there.. Even the cars! Check the food places out on the bottom floor though. Wow. I swear, anything you want to eat you will find. There were so many things to choose from I ended up eating a doughnut from Krispy Kreme because I was that stressed from having so many options. I suggest go at night time because it's very beautiful on the outside, awesome for photos!
Just a mall you can find at your hometown.. Just another mall with designer stores, expensive foods, people and high end shopping that you can waste your time there.

Luxurious lifestyle mall with all the exclusive brands. The malls in Stockholm have nothing compared to the malls in Bangkok. Every detail is thought trough and the range of local and international luxurious brands are huge. I love this place where you can spend the whole day! Start with a breakfast at the food court or at one of the many cafes. Continue shopping or just people-watching, the Bangkok residents never look the same, always wearing their trends with attitude and self esteem. Not like here in Sweden where it feels like everyone is more or less dressed in Acne or HM. Have lunch in the mall and ask yourselves what country you would like to travel to for lunch? In the evening we buy tickets to a movie and of course we choose the VIP-package with drinks and snacks, lounging before the film with our friends and then when the film starts we share the room only with 8 other people while laying down in big comfy seats with pillows and a blanket. And if we wanna go crazy we try the 4XD experience. So, if you want the real deal, a visit to Siam Paragon is a must!

$ Money Mall. Took the skytrain to the mall. This is a gorgeous mall with beautiful shops and a fantastic food court. Compared to the United States I think the food courts in Bangkok a two thumbs up. Definitely worth the trip for window shopping and eating.

Alive with water festival activity. We visited during the fun of the water festival when young people spray everyone with water for good luck. Squitrts are fun but the buckets of water are less appreciated by watchers. The stores that were open had no shoppers. this mall is not the luxury stores which are for window shopping only for most people.
Nice Mall in Bangkok.. A nice shopping experience with restaurants as well as kids attraction inside the mall. easily approached area by BTS sky train

Beautiful but expensive mall!. I enjoyed going to the Paragon Mall. The food court was exceptional and the variety was incredible. This not a cheap mall however. The reason I went here was to buy quality merchandise for friends of mine that live in Bangkok. Beautiful mall but personally I prefer the cheaper alternative markets in Bangkok. Bangkok is truly a shoppers paradise and there is something for everyone.
Nice Theater. There is a pretty nice theater on the top floor, floor five. Where I watched fast and furious seven. Really nice seats. The mall was very clean and high-end

Fancy Mall. I don't like it but it gives you a taste of luxuries that are normally very far away- Harrods, Fauchon, Mandarin even though I think they are not the standards not what they should be.Don't buy the locally produced items. Only what is imported.

Shopping center. We were here by Mac 2011. We came here because The SEA Ocean World is located inside this building. It is located at the busy district. The shopping mall itself is very big. A lot of office tower are nearby. A lot of tourist. Bus stop just outside the shopping mall, very convenient to go any place from here.

My favourite mall in Bangkok!. Great range of high quality items can be found here! Bought several fantastic golf shirts, as well as other great looking outfit here. This mall also have huge food courts and restaurant area on the ground / lower floor with lots of selections from Thai street food, various dessert shops, restaurants, to the more expensive Thai and International restaurants / cafes.The location is also very convenient as the skytrain is just in front of the mall, and Siam Square directly opposite it, and other shopping centres like Central World and MBK is within walking distance!

a great reprieve from travel. After 3 weeks in less than comfortable surroundings, the Siam Paragon was a great break. Our whole family could find foods that we had been craving. We enjoyed a movie in very comfy seats and looked at lots of fun and high end merchandise.

food,fun,shop,ocean world,luxury cars and what not. Siam Paragon is very lively and interesting. The food court is just extensive and has tons of international varities to suit every shoppers need. They have free wifi. Their is a section of Autos on the third floor and its just amazing with all top brands. Siam Paragon is connected with Siam Center , Siam Tower and further to MBK and its very convinient to drop at any one of the above malls and continue with your shopping spree.

An enormous and enjoyable mall. This place is huge. Unlike some other malls there is a great feeling of space. I like the food floor (below ground level) with its enormous food court and dozens of separate restaurants (and big grocery store). Other highlights are the Kinokuniya book store (3d floor), True Coffee, and the IMAX movie theatre at the top. Then there's the Paragon department store for sportswear and other clothes. What is truly staggering is the experience of walking west into adjoining Siam Centre which itself is a very big mall, or taking a stroll to the east to Central World, which is gargantuan. Basically in this area you are within walking distance of a whole sub-city of malls that has few equals in the world for sheer abundance. Of course not everyone likes malls. But the Thais do, not only because they love shopping and eating but because these places are air-conditioned.

Great high end shopping, good way to spend a few hours. If you are looking for higher-end shopping this is the place. Not the type of shopping we look for, but we went along to take a look and spend a few hours browsing. Fantastic facility, very clean, organised and great maps/tourist information. Amazing food outlets, had one of the best non-street vendor meals during our trip at a restaurant here in the centre. Unfortunately can't remember the name of the restaurant, but it was Japanese and had excellent food for an equally excellent price. Even if you come and don't buy anything, this centre is definitely worth a visit.

Smart Mall with Unique Eatery. This is really a smart mall , they have so many eatery restaurant from small to big outlet. I visited so many of the restaurant there during my stay in Bangkok. One little outlet call Kyoto Lifestyle Cafe ....I like the ice cream - mocha ice cream cone ..... The ice cream was smooth and not sweet at all. They have caramel, sticky ball and red bean paste ... I give a bite off it and I feel good. Unfortunate the outlet of this restaurant is very small.
SIam Paragon shopping Mall - a nice place to shop. I love the super market at Paragon, the salad corner are fresh & nice...many choice to chose ...Food court are clean, nice ...

If you are looking for Naraya varieties, its here!. Thailand is famous for its Naraya bags and accessories, and Siam Paragon is the place to go. But if you are looking for older designs, can try Asia Hotel shop. The Naraya at Siam is located at the 6th floor ( correct me if i am wrong) next to Kinokuniya book shop. Must try After You dessert, but go there in the morning, it is very crowded later at night. Many choices of food also available from all around the world. Only the card for top up is needed for the food court above the aquarium. Money changer rates are also not as good as it is a luxury area, so bank fees are higher. if you need to change money and can walk a little more, head to super rich exchange near platinum mall. (go to central world, exit and turn left exiting isetan , walk along the road and you can see starbucks.)
Best mall and food court in the world!. AMAZING! This mall has everything, from high end stores to one of the best food courts I have ever seen in the world. I can't say enough about this place.

Good mall with plenty to see. The aquarium is situated under the ground floor - brilliant and worth the look. Shops are pricey which is expected and the food hall, though many restaurants sufferers the double VAT sting. Had coffee and cake at the "Coffee Shop" and was scammed with the tax, very expensive for ordinary food and non drinkable coffee.

Highly accessible. All the high-end shops can be found here. A nice place to relax and unwind. The BTS Sky-train Siam station is just outside the mall. Wasn't able to spend a lot of time here, though, as I came from a previous temple tour.

Siam Oceanic was a marvellous place to be. Visited with my family and kid, it was fun for all. Exciting to see so many fishes and the sharks. The penguin were so adorable. It is a must visit. After which you could spend the day in the upper floor shopping complex.

really big department store. very popular, sell a lot of high-end brand. If you are looking for brand name products then this is the place for you. Very crowded. under ground have a super market where you can find a lot of thai stuff.

Same same but different. It's a mall, and it's large, and you could be anywhere in the world, it's "same same" as they say. All westerners expect things to be cheap in thailand, here where there is a shop selling Rolls Royce cars and another where you can get an Armani suit to match things are "different".It has a large cinema multiplex upstairs, do be careful which screen you choose some are very expensive and lots of air con.
Amazing. Amazing mall with plenty of things to do with kids. They have the siam ocean world and kidzania. There's plenty of food to try. Worth a visit

Good selection of Local and Foreign designers.. I did enjoy seeing great local brands in this department store. Check out Paul B on the mens wear level and some other lovely Bangkok based high quality brands.

Big, nice but overpriced. As one of the biggest malls in Asia, Siam Paragon takes your breath away. Visited the mall back in Nov '14, took a slow stroll along its expensive boutiques, shops, Siam Ocean World (1000 baht ticket)... Well, there's literally lots of what you can buy there, food, drinks, brand clothes, pretty much everything you need. If you're up to flushing with money, of course :) Up to you, anyway.OK, here's some info you need to know if going to the mall is on your agenda these days. It is located close to the Rama I Rd & Henri Dunant Rd intersection.The closest BTS stations is 'Siam', head to exit #5, and you're there :)Working hours: 10am - 9pmSee for yourselves :)

Up market but watch out. Big shops with big brands. Could drop by if you have extra time or around the area. Side note, Beware: on our way to siam paragon there was guy claim to be a "teacher" told us that if was a Thai public holiday and the malls don't open until 11am... And tried to convince us to go on a tour to a temple... We rejected him and head to the malls.. Turned out he was cheating us! We reached the mall at 10 and it was opened with many patrons already.. So beware!

down in choice up in price. A year ago i enjoyed the food store and eating downstairs with a million bankokians,the supermarket is a disappointment for falang food and expensive for thai.The food court surprised me,not so special food and 2 adults with three kids got through 1000b,I know it's Bangkok but......still good aircon walking space.

Outstanding, expensive shopping mall. If you like shopping, even just window shopping, then you should definitely visit this shopping mall. It may well be the most expensive mall in Bangkok, and it's worth walking through even if you don't buy anything.
number one mall in bangkok. Beautiful luxurious mall with everything that money can buy! The foodhall downstairs in amazing! Really worth spending an afternoon there.

Beware. This is a beautiful shopping centre, truly made for retail therapy. However, I just want people to know that they should be careful. My husband (Indian origin) was approached by a person (Indian looking) who struck up a conversation, and then asked to see the currency of his country (Australian). My husband had been forewarned so he kept walking, but my brother who had travelled to Bangkok a few months earlier was not so lucky. He indulged this person by showing him some Indian banknotes, and later discovered that USD800 had been taken from him. Does not exactly remember how this person managed to dupe a well travelled person like him. So fellow travellers beware, do NOT engage in conversation with this person.

Luxurious and upscale. Siam Paragon is a shopping center in the heart of Bangkok which has everything from designer clothing to famous sport cars like Lamborghini etc. The atmosphere is relaxing and the toilets are spotless. Compared to other shopping malls in the area like MBK and Platinum, Siam Paragon is more upscale and luxurious. Inside, there is also one of the best cinemas in Bangkok. Definitely recommended for someone who likes branded goods.

Malling. This shopping center is where everything is available like designer clothes, bags, shoes, luggage and name it they have it. Their is also restaurants that you can indulge with foods. The place ambiance is very clean , so with their toilets very well equipped. The lobby is so impressing that their are sits available where you can relax when you are tired or while waiting for your companions while they are shopping. All of the shops are offering different things, some are jewelries, gadgets, swimming accesories etc.

Great Shopping. We didn't go to Bangkok to shop, we're from London so have plenty on our doorstep - but if you like a bit of retail therapy - this is heaven! Designers a plenty, plus highstreet stores too! Lots of choices for restaurants too! Get the skytrain here as its right on the doorstep!

Love the gourmet food hall. If you are looking for Thai snacks to bring home to friends, or just to indulge yourself, then you MUST visit the food hall. Combinations of fresh and packaged food, you will be spoiled for choice.The is always an essential food stop on any visit to BKK.If you want a yummy fast Thai meal while shopping, don't eat at the food court, walk around the back to the many restaurants. Try Cafe Chilli!
Spoilt for choice. The shopping mall has everything that you want, it is huge! Food court has two floors of options and at decent prices too, it's got lots of variety too for all the family.
It's where the Naraya flagship store is. Went to Siam Paragon just because of Naraya flagship store, the goods sold at the flagship store are a bit different from the other Naraya stores (I suppose).

best shopping mall in Bangkok. for me, its the best shopping mall in Bangkok, especially if you want to have a relaxing shopping experience.the food court offer lots variety of meal, and its not too pricy comparing to other hectic street food
Lots of choices. This mall has lots of choices of shops and places to eat. You can find just about anything and everything in this mall.

Time limits for buying alcohol. Great Upscale shopping mall, with a wonderful Gourmet Food Market. But we were very surprised when we went to buy some wine at 3 pm, and they couldn't sell us any. The Government rules only allow alcohol to be sold from 11 to 2, and then 5 to midnight.

don't let the cars blind you!. seeing a showroom with lambos, bmw's astin martin's etc. will give you an idea of what kind of mall this is. Lots of high end, very nice shops. Really liked the gourmet food market in the bottom floor. Products from japan, Korea as well as local thai products. You can even by Wagyu grade 5 beef, as well as Australian beef here. very nice. Not your corner grocery store

Whatever you need.... Whatever you need, you'll find it here. It is easy to access, massive and has every store you can imagine. The gourmet food section has all types of foods and treats. If shopping is your thing, this place is for you.

Siam Paragon is the most popular mall in Bangkok... I wouldn't go here to do actual necessity shopping.. Siam Paragon is the most popular mall in Bangkok, especially among the locals. The tourists naturally fall in because of its location. In the center of the shopping district that is cluttered with malls, Paragon is reachable by BTS skytrain Siam station. The walkway from the train leads right into the mall. The attraction is the multi screen cinema, Ocean World is a fantastic aquarium also on the basement floor. Also the hundreds of restaurants and food hall on the ground floor in addition the huge gourmet market. A great place to eat, there are more than enough choices, maybe too many. There is also a food passage on the fourth floor with restaurants. I wouldn't go here to do actual necessity shopping but you can spend the day here going through the wonderful food court.

Awesome mall !!. If you're in Bangkok you should go there even if it's just for something to eat. This is not a cheap mall but if you have the money you can buy a super car on the 3rd floor or maybe just check out the cinema selection on the top floor. You can walk directly in from the BTS sky train Siam stop. If there Is something you need buy, I reckon they sell it .

You will find it here.. If you are looking for the ultimate shopping experience then visit Siam Paragon.From top end luxury Prada, Chanel and Hermes to the familiar European stores - Gap, H&M and Zara - it has it all.On the day we visited -a fabulous orchid show !!Food courts for every Nationality and the best place for authentic Thai gifts and clothing is on the 4th floor.Luxury car- no problem Siam Paragon has it all.Easily reached by Skytrain - a cool retreat on hot Bangkok days !!

One of the best malls in Asia. Our middle class American family loved it here. Yes, there are many stores which are luxury level, but there was so much to do within our more humble means. I wouldn't go here to do actual necessity shopping but you can spend the day here going through the wonderful food court. My wife and family ate at a Mexican food truck theme restaurant while I ate some wonderful sushi next door. If you have been to Harrods in London and enjoyed it, you will enjoy this place as well.There are other activities connected to the mall as well, namely the Kidzania and Ocean World, which you may or may not also want to do.
Mustsee. Mustsee - nice place to spend some time. My children like it very much because of free space - we visited many times when we visiting Bangkok and it was never crowded.

Highly recommended. There are lots and lots of shops in this mall. You will find luxury as well as ordinary shops of different kinds. You may also eat your lunch or dinner here and choose among all kinds of restaurants. Or buy a Rolls Royce. If you prefer, you may use a day or more to see it all. Highly recommended.

Beware of the taxi that you get outside the siam paragon. I don't like shopping. What i want to say is about my bad experience of getting a taxi there. I got a taxi to siam paragon from my hotel and it costed 70 baht. There is a taxi stand outside siam paragon with a guard helping people to get a taxi. We got on to the taxi and the diver immediately told us that there was accident on the way to our hotel and no meter would be used. He insisted to charge us for 450 baht. As we have got 2 young kids with us, we dared not argue with him. We end up paying him 350 baht. I could spot that it was almost the same route as before. So, no matter where you take the taxi, make sure the meter is on before you get on. Go to other hotel to get a taxi if dont want to be charged more. Hotel staff is reliable as they have to be responsible if anything happen.
shopping. one of the best place to go for shopping in Bangkok,you get all exclusive brands at one shop. very nice decor and food court is amazing,

Luxury mall. A mall that has many high end shopping stores. One can shop at cartier, hermes, chanel, prada, louis vuitton etc. Besides that there are retailers like zara, gap, h&m and more to indulge. The Siam departmental store has wide range of brands too. This is a shoppers paradise ! There are plenty of cosmetic, electronic etc brands to shop from too. The mall is connected to the Siam BTS . The Ocean world here is worth a visit too.If you tire of all the shopping there is an excellent food court to satisfy the hunger pangs after all the walking or one catch a movie and relax.

Enjoy the mall, but no shopping. Paragon is probably the most popular mall in Bangkok, especially among the locals and expats. The tourists naturally fall in because of its location. In the center of the shopping district that is cluttered with malls, Paragon is reachable by BTS skytrain Siam station. The walkway from the train leads right into the mall. The attraction is the multi screen cinema, bowling alley and convention hall all on the top floor. Also the hundreds of restaurants and food hall on the ground floor in addition the huge gourmet market. A great place to eat, there are more than enough choices, maybe too many. There is also a food passage on the fourth floor with restaurants. If you are looking for classic, authentic Thai artifacts, handicrafts, clothing and souvenirs, the Fantastique shop is on the forth floor. Also Ocean World is a fantastic aquarium also on the basement floor. As for shopping, the mall offers you every high priced brand name store at prices no different than elsewhere, so why buy a coach bag in Bangkok, the knockoff capital of the world when you can buy it in Hong Kong or Tokyo. Shoppers come to Bangkok to buy knockoff junk that will break or wear out soon after getting home. Would you go buy a Rolls Royce at a Volkswagen dealer ? So why buy these brand name goods in the knockoff capital of the world. Go for the restaurants, market and cinemas, but leave the shopping for other cities.

Can spend a whole day here.. It is one of the more pricey places to shop in Bangkok but I was there in January and February 2015 when the new year and Chinese New Year sales were on. I got Ben Shermin pants and shirts 50% off! You can also get duty free (VAT Refund). The place is immaculately clean and I love the food court on the bottom floor! Boots pharmacy as well as many Japanese and Korean places to eat are down here as well. Not to mention the usual fast food joints and MOS Burger plus a supermarket. I head straight for here for my papaya salad whenever I arrive in Bangkok and check in to my hotel. Access is straight from BTS Siam. I like the Kinokuniya book store upstairs as I am used to them in Japan (having lived there 2 years).....huge and so so many foreign books and books about Thailand and Thai language etc. On the top floor is a multi cinema complex and seeing a movie in Thailand seems to be much cheaper than Village Cinema (the ripoff merchants) in Australia. The men's clothing section in Siam is huge.....anything you want is here.

Good Mall. We came here after wasting our time in MBK. The mall is very nice and luxurious. They had christmas sales going on in all the stores. The H&M here is one of the biggest.They also have many good restaurants.Overall a day well spent.

Waste of time. Nothing special with this mall except you're helping multinational companies make more profit. In a low-cost country like Thailand, the brand-name retailers at Siam Paragon (which you can find anywhere in North American or European malls) charge the same amount as retailers in the West. I do not understand people who would shop at Chanel or any high-end store at Siam Paragon when you can find the same products at the same price where you live...it's a waste of precious vacation time. Also, when inside this mall, it feels as though you are back home unless you step outside.

Love the Paragon. It's one of my favourite malls in BKK. The have all kind of stores there, designer and mainstream fashion. The even have car shops, Bentley, Rolls Royce,Massartti, BMW and so on. Also motorbikes, Ducati. They have a great food court downstairs, with a great supermarket. On the fives floor they have a cinema and I max theatre.It is on the BTS and easy to reach. It's always a good option during dry season, because it A/C and rainy season because it's A/C and dry.

Amazing mall with top brands and awesome food court.. the Siam Paragon is the mall of the rich people in Bangkok and it has all the top brands you can ask for. the best thing in the mall its his food court, very good restaurants and not so expensive, but remember that its at least double the money you will pay in the MBK .great place for everyone. also go visit the supermarket is really nice and interesting.and don't forget to go to the water world on the basement in of bangkok best attractions.

Top luxury mall in the heart of Siam Pathumwan shopping area. Top luxury mall in the heart of Siam Pathumwan shopping area, nice set-up and pleasant walkway. You can find almost everything here: from luxury fashion brands to casual or elegant restaurants...A paradise for shop..coholics fans.
High End Shopping. This is one of the top luxury malls in Bangkok. Well deck out with very nice outlets.Provides access to BTS and the Ocean World as well.

a Wow for the senses. This mall certainly has something for everyone. I do mean everyone. From the casual browser to the rich and famous. Want a snack? Sure. A fancy restaurant or catch a movie? Its available. Want a Rolls Royce, Jaguar, BMW, Aston Martin? But, of course...right this way please! Need plastic surgery, your hair done, a manicure, a massage, a dentist it is all right here in one ginormous location.Worth a visit even if you don't want anything, just for the wow experience.
Quality. This place is for the people who are looking for quality stuff and are ready to spend more that they would spent on other markets or streets in Bangkok.

MOVIE AND SHOPPING. now let me start by saying wow I have been to Bangkok with my mate for more than two dozen times in the last decade or so. But why didn't I go the Siam so often is beyond my understanding. Guess it's just got bigger better and so classy.Being a vegetarian both of us I guess the variety of food may not be too much, but hey whose complaining mix and match when on holiday remember not to be too stuck up About food. We enjoy the company of the locals and the way they respect live and tourist. Amazing movie theaters went twice to see the 50 shades of grey. Loved the experience and the set up clean as a whistle. Gonna make this a shopping spot even better than central or pavilion.
Fancy. Everything you need is here, including luxury cars! Good place to cool off from the heat. There is a good movie theatre here as well.

Variety. I'd specifically like to comment on the paragon food hall at the basement. It offers an interesting range of local dishes which I did not dare try at the street hawkers. Food was generally good. Our Thai friend commented that the prices are very exorbitant compared to what you can get outside. There were many baby cockroaches running all over one of their drink stalls on top of their coffee machine but when my husband pointed this out to the ladies in attendant, they were pretty nonchalant about it.One thing we notice is that baby cockroaches seem to be ubiquitous in most places in bangkok.

Shoppers Heaven. A shopping heaven where you can find all the luxury brands under one roof. The mall is huge and there are a lot of food outlets to choose from. Read from few blogs that there is a thai halal outlet at the food hall but couldn't find it. But i saw a halal indian restaurant there.

good all around. The bookstore there has the best selection of books in town. The mall itself is more spacious than other similar malls in town and one of the most organized. Their supermarket is easy to find things and have a good selection of Thai food packets to buy for souvenirs. The take-away food selection is also wide. But the restaurant selection might be better in Terminal 21. Eating places at the ground floor is quite congested, one feels like we are eating in an open market. The Thai souvenir section also has the best collection in town. Extremely convenient access from BTS. Parking is more spacious than other malls, but the floor at the parking lot is so slippery so need to be a bit careful.

BIGG. Siam Paragon is really BIG!!! Will take sometime to really walk around and shop around. There have a wide range of choices from designer shops to standards retailers. The food courts and resturant also have a wide range of choices and availability. The price there is really not that cheap, buy with caution.

Crowded but worth a visit. One of the biggest malls in Bangkok, with all the big brands one can wish for. Feels a bit crowded at times, but well worth a visit, even if huge malls are not your thing.Also has a nice modern food court where you can try food from a ton of places.

The Most Luxurious Mall in Bangkok. It's the most luxurious mall in Bangkok where you can find so many international and original brands. The mall is connected to two other malls called Siam Center and Siam discovery. It is also within waking distance to MBK mall. It is an expensive place to shop as expected, yet I managed to purchase a pair of Adidas for a reasonable price since they were 50 percent off. The place is so big and fascinating, and even if you are not willing to purchase anything due to the high prices, you don't want to miss it as you can see so many exotic foods and desserts in the food court, and there is also a very big aquarium in the basement. Therefore, be sure not to miss it even if for window shopping.
Must see. This is shoppers heaven, you have from a range of choices from designer shops to standards retailers.Definetly try the cinema complex inside and the range of food courts available.Enjoy

Big. It's a shopping mall in Bangkok, but it's one of the biggest shopping centers in Asia. It includes a wide range of specialty stores and restaurants as well as a multiplex movie theater (consisted of 15 large size theaters with one of them having the biggest screen and seating capacity in Asia) and the Siam Ocean World (Underwater world) aquarium (the largest aquarium in South East Asia) and an exhibition hall and the Thai Art Gallery and also an opera concert hall. It also has a large bowling alley and karaoke center. But to be honest, we didn't buy anything because the prices were really not that cheap and didn't feel like packing them and bringing it home.

I hate malls but I loved this place. Yes, this mall has all the designer shops, Louis Vuitton, Coco Channel, etc. What they also have is the great italian jewelry designer Balenciaga, the second floor has a car showroom. Actually several car show rooms. A Lamborghini Showroom, BMW, Porsche, and Bentley. Fun to see these big bucks cars all in one place. The supermarket in the basement is a panoply of every cuisine imaginable. I was malled out in the USA. This place actually was fun and interesting. Prices same as USA (some a lot more due to import duties) so don't expect any great deals. Wheelchair access is problematic. It's a big mall but only a few entrances that are accessible.
Great shopping. Beautiful shopping center which is just 1 SkyTrain stop away from Central World. More upclass stores as well and even luxury car "shops" where you can buy your new Lamborghini...

"totally bliing bling". 1 word-Expensive! It’s apparently a high-end shopping center with just designer shops like Louis Vuitton. Prada, Christian Dior, Hermes and the stores go on to the next floor. There is no sign or direction as to where exactly is their comfort room or Toilet (Hong Nam in Thai). It’s right in front of the central station. All train maps would mark it as Central or Siam Station. Even the food at their foodcourt is expensive. So just for the heck of it it's worth the visit. My wife & daughter were able to buy a few stuff. Guess they found some sale items as it has a department store with items/products ranging from clothes, shoes and bags and jewelry. Some other malls or shopping places near Paragon are Platinum Mall (wholesale), MBK (mostly gadgets) & Siam Square. To maximize your shopping experience in these malls you need at least a day since the malls are really big with an endless array of goods and products.

Lots of luxury, no bargains. Unless you're very well-off or a passionate window shopper, I would advise you not to spend too much time there. Yes, you can find all the top notch brands there and no, they are not cheaper than in your own country, not at least in the Euro region, sometimes even more expensive. The few mid-price brands are neither of European taste and style nor exotic. The building itself is very beautiful and worth seeing with luxurious, spotless restrooms free of charge but a big disappointment if you're looking for bargain prices.

Big shopping mall. It's big and you can find everything from general to hi-end luxury brands. There's aquarium if you wish to visit you may. In addition to restaurants, there's a food court that provides a variety of dishes. However, the prices here are a bit high.

Lots in there. Easy to get to by BST to Siam. All sorts of shops in there and there is even a level with great sports cars on view.There is a very good cinema complex at the top, though the posh seats (Nokia Ultrascreen etc) are getting very expensive at about £20.There is even an IMAX cinema.Good wine shop on the ground floor and lots of places to eat.Lots of good clean toilets.

Shopping paradise for the rich. You can find a lot of branded outlets in this mall. Most of the shops here are meant for the rich, or whoever is willing to pay for those price. You may not want to waste your time here if not visiting the aquarium, if you are a budget traveller

Huge mall. Golf buggy required.. This place is massive massive massive. Got Game of Thrones series 3 and 4. Ate delicious food in the 9th and ice cream in Swensens. Admired the Lamborghinis BMWs and Maclaren. So many shops you need more time and a golf buggy to ride around in. Great place and of course the sharks and fish downstairs.

The best shopping in Bangkok. Although the City has many shopping Malls of various levels the Paragon is surely the best if only for the variety of what it offers. You can find the best of the legitimate French, Italian and Spanish high class shops as well as the cheaper kind which offer imitation (copies) at low prices. The restaurants are good too if only a little on the expensive side. At all events its a great day out!
great upscale mall. Amazing shopping and people watching. 5 stars great food and choice of restaurants. They even sell Ferraris and Bentleys in the mall. All the designer names are here.
Complete. Very nice and big mall, everything you need can be found here, it also has lots of restos to choose from, trains are also near this mall.

Great shopping out of the heat. All western shops and could be in any western city in the world.
Close to rail and easy walk to other shopping centers.
A good place to base yourself for a day's shopping.
Some great little food outlets on the upper levels

Big, expensive shopping mall. This is the place if you have arrived in Bangkok with a fist full of Yuan burning a hole in your Gucci bag and your mission is to get your hands on a bunch of designer swag to haul home. If you have come to Thailand for Thai culture and atmosphere then Siam Paragon is NOT the place for you. It's a big, generic, flashy shopping mall, and pricey as can be. There's nothing here that you can't get somewhere else cheaper. It's biggest attraction: the public restrooms are fairly clean.

The Icon of Bangkok Shopping. The place to see and be seen in Bangkok. It has everything from pop-corn to luxury automobile for you to buy. Collection of all great brand names of the world and fine dinning restaurants. Large department store, deluxe movie theaters and concert hall, and modern fitness center, etc. All luxury under one roof. Best to use BTS Sky train to get there. This is the center of all activities, so traffic can be bad most of the day.

One of the biggest shopping malls in Bangkok.. Paragon is a very exclusive shopping center. Easy to find.Reachable with Taxi, BTS (skytrain) Great shops and restaurants.Personally I use Paragon different times for a coffee break in one of their coffee-corners.

And another big shooping mall. I visted a number of shopping malls whilst in Bangkok. They were all really similar, generi cbrands, high end fashion and few bargins. I said in another reshopping mall review that i could have been in any country in the world. I do not understand how this could be a good experience. I find the food sections of these malls to be the most interesting places.

Big Mall. You can find most of the known brands here. It is impossible to finish exploring each floor in one day. If we go about seeing everything in the mall.We went there as we had to go to Ocean world and also to see Lamborghini :) They have a showroom here inside the mall.You can find Jimmy Choo, Versace, Louis Vuitton, Prada, Coach and what not.Ample of food options as well.Visit in with ample of time in hand.

They got it, but it can be found cheaper. This mall/shoping center has a wast selection of goods if not in the actual Siam paragon you can find it in some of the connecting malls and it is all equipede directly to several skytrain stations.If you need something you will most likely find it here. One of the shops even sels Lamborghinis (or another top end car) - BUT the prices here at also high and you can find similar products in other malls at the same price, but here you are sure they are not fake. Good and well equiped food court, though mostly established chains and not the real Thai experience.

Great shopping in Bangkok!. This is definitely the best shopping mall on Sukhumvit road. They have discount stores, offering quality merchandise, like Zara and H&M. The food court also has a lot of options, includng many Asian dishes. A must see.

Very high end shopping experience . I visited the siam Paragon today. It is full of shops that I would never shop in at home and there is no difference here I'm afraid. Maseratti and Luis Vuitton are all surplus to my requirements although the shops do look very extravagant. Last time I was here I'm sure I ate in a fantastic food Hall in the basement but I couldn't find it this time unfortunately.

Great place for foodies. If you love food please visit the food court and Gourmet market on the lower floor. The Gourmet market has so much to see and so much to sample. Plus the Paragon food court offers great food at a very reasonable price

Food court and food section is amazing. If you have been to a big department store in Japan, this is exactly that. The bottom level is the food section which is amazing, with so many choices at good prices. It is constantly bustling with people but not so packed that you are uncomfortable. The upper levels are your typical higher end stores. Must visit!

One of the best malls anywhere. Paragon is an absolutely huge and amazing shopping mall and able to compete with some of the best malls anywhere out there. The mall is synonymous for luxury brands but you can pretty much find everything under one roof, from UniQlo to Prada and Louis Vuitton. The actual paragon department store is amazing, not to mention to myriad of retail shops, books stores, electronic stores, to even luxury sport cars and motorcycles on the higher floors. The selection of restaurants and grocery supermarket are all amazing and designed to tempt you to spend all your time and address all your needs under one roof. Once again, you can step off the BTS Sky train and walk right into Paragon.

Upscale shopping mall. Bangkok certainly doesn't lack from shopping malls but this one is a cut above most. Situated along the BTS line it is easily accessible. Top fashion and jewelry stores and a large department store. And if you are in the market for a new Aston Martin, Lamborghini, or Rolls-Royce you can find them there too. Lots of restaurants and a huge supermarket in the lower level.

Fantastic Shopping Paradise for the Rich !. My 2nd day in Bangkok and I visited Siam Paragon Shopping Mall. It is a very huge, fantastically illuminated mall, ion what appeared to me as a 7-storey structure. This mall is located right outside the Siam Station, which is the main station for metro travel, a junction of sorts for 2 seperate lines of Metro. If you have been to Mumbai, this station is just like Dadar, how it connects the Central & Western lines. Now because the Metro Stations are internally connected to the Shopping Malls, be it Siam Paragon or MBK or Emporium, it has become extremely easy for shoppers to tour the place, rather than going through the ordeal of getting out of the station, crossing busy roads and then going inside the malls etc... Something that can be implemented in India !On reaching inside, I was actually taken aback for it's huge size, first thing. Thereafter I noticed the hundreds of brands that probably I haven't seen in India. Okay sorry, may be I wasn't particularly into this brand & stuff like that in India, and now since I came to a different town, I was trying to be more attentive :)Secondly, I realized that just like in India, there are designated spaces allocated for seperate brands (or Companies, say Vermoda), just like the shops. But other than that, there are 1-2 floors marked wherein there are no shop-like separate structures. Different companies just display their products in the open (on hooks or hangers) for viewers to see, try and take. So, my curiosity led me to talk to the Supervisor there and very casually, he confided in me that this is a great way to save space, accommodate more brands & earn rental revenue. It also helps in pack & unpack, without closing the doors of the shops and keeping 10 security guards. Products are on the costlier side but good to go atleast once. The food court is on the ground floor itself and is pretty big with a lot of Thai food items to eat. Else, there is McDonalds as well. Cheers !

Expensive even to Look.... Massive luxury shopping mall were the rich of southeast asia splurge. The mall itself has a lot to offer for the normal tourist as well, with konokuniya book store as a must and the basement gourmet food court as a mandatory stop if you want to treat you with really good snacks. There is also a good supermarket and lots of restaurants as well for the western palate. So if you need a break from Asia, Paragon might be an option but not a cheap one...

Glittering shopping complex. Luxury mall with plenty of world-famous brands, such as Louis Vuitton, Versace, Bulgari, Prada, Armani, just name it. Pretty expensive as well. It is in the shopping heart of Bangkok, easy to reach by BTS - Siam station.On the 2nd and 3rd floors there are car showrooms for selling BMW, Maserati, Ferrari, Lamborghini,etc. There are also cinema, a large number of restaurants offering food for every taste. The Sea Life Bangkok Ocean World (ex Siam Ocean World) aquarium is located in the mall on the basement floors B1-B2 as well. It is very interesting too.
Nice Shopping Mall. Siam Paragon is an upscale shopping mall at Siam Street, Bangkok. We really had a great shopping experience here with all the brands around. Must Visit.
Dubai is cheaper. If you're after branded products, this mall has the big names but it's not competitively priced. The area is fill of other malls though.
Nice shopping. This was a nice shopping stop of our Thailand adventure. Bangkok seemed very futuristic and the shopping mall was in line with this impression.

Heaven for the Rich. This is paradise for the rich. It is a humongous beautiful and modern mall. Everything is expensive. Average people can only look, touch, but can’t afford to buy. You have to see the place when in Bangkok. Across from this mall is the MBK Shopping Centre which is a good mall for the average shopper. There are tons of vendors and lot of food courts. There is also a big grocery store and a few places to catch a taxi or a tuk-tuk.

Luxury, at its best. Like I have explained in a previous review, this place is chic. Houses designer boutiques, has an amazing ambiance and is centrally located. Connected to the BTS, it is one of the most accessible addresses in Bangkok. Not for the budget shopper. But no one will stop you if you just want to indulge in window shopping. Or have a classy meal . There are some great dining options in the international food court.Must go place in Bkk.

Luxury,Style,Huge,Beauty,Branded,Then Costly where is the offers???. The Huge Neat branded Kingdom in thailand but giving excellent for its style not for its offers. If you are a buyer like always closing your eye while Buying then this is the Best place for your pockets . anywhere you can get offers for the branded items even in customs duty shops,online portals,but here don't expect the offers imagine a Coffee price is 200bhat in ground floor . as My opinion I can able to get the same brand and same quality lesser than this in MBK and Big C and somewhere. ,sorry My Opinion is Siam paragon is a Grand costly Exhibition that's all for me may be you may like its your wish. Thankyou

High Taste for High Fashion. Yes, one can get one's Prada, Chanel and Gucci over here as well as make a downpayment for a Maserati while nibbling on the delicious La Duree macarons. Plenty of nice restaurants on the lower ground floor for you to energize yourself again before another round of shopping! Siam Paragon did not disappoint with all things "high."

Fantastic mall with abundant choices of shops and eateries!. Love this mall! They had plenty of luxury stores and eateries. The environment is great and it's quite a sight to see luxury cars being sold in the mall too. Would definitely visit again!

Lots of places to eat. We had a walk round and had dinner in one of the many restaurants, which was very nice. The choice is great, the centre was very clean and tidy, very busy also but over all a good experience.

The Secret is in the Basement.... Siam Paragon is a very luxurious shopping mall - similar to many other affluent shopping malls anywhere in the world. If you have never been, I recommend a stop here. However, unless you have bottomless pockets, come here mostly just to window shop ;-)....THEN... find your way to the basement! The basement is a maze of stands, restaurants and even a grocery store selling a cornucopia of delicious foods that will intrigue and delight!!! The SkyTrain is a very convienient mode of transportation to get here; it stops just outside.

A super mall. If you are looking for some upscale shopping , this is the place to be. If you head to the lower floor, you will encounter a whole variety of restaurants. You would need a whole day to filter through.A great place to spend the whole day eating

the atas side of thailand. i can get iced tea for 5baht in the village and i can get ice tea for 150baht in a cafe in this mall. Well, when i stepped into this mall i cant help but think about the huge income gap between the thais, and naturally evoked a sense of sadness. ( i don't know why ) ALL THAT ASIDE. if you're sooo over cheap tshirts that goes out of shape after a few wash, and you're looking for real, authentic, quality stuff (this is the place). There's a lot of international cuisine you may want to go for too!

Superb. Actually, initially I had planned just to visit the Siam Underwater world in the basement of the mall. And I was to go to Kidzania situated on the 5th Floor of the same mall, and for the same, I had to enter the mall....and I was simply awestruck by the beauty.Every inch speaks style, elegance, and charm be it the best brands of food or lifestyle.The Information Desk is extremely helpful indeed.This mall surely rocks!!!

Mall having all the top brands.. This is a super mall with all the super brands. The mall is big having great ambience and very spacious. They also have a car segment which have many big brands including Lamborghini. The food court is also very big with lot of options.

Fine and friendly. This is Bangkok's most posh mall indeed. Very elegant, huge, yet friendly and inviting. All the major and luxury brands are well represented, prices are competitive but not necessarily cheap. There's an endless array or restaurants and cafes with AMAZING interior designs, you will be wow'd and spoilt for choice. A must see even if you're not into shopping.
Must See.. All MNC Brands are available here. teh Gourmet Store here is a msut visit. High end brands are highly priced. Food courst are excellent. Connected to SIAM BTS station.

Nice . It's very nice shopping mall during my visit there was huge sale so I had great shopping experience the standard is very high the food curt was great I discovered many new Resturants with Tai fusion I had great time and meet many nice people

Luxury mall. Its a mall full of branded stores, so on the expensive side. Has Oceanworld in it too.
Even if you don't want to shop, the food section is very well decorated, worth to just have a look at too.

Luxury Brands.. Siam paragon is the type of shopping center with many large brand names.I recommend this shopping center for those either to spend A LOT of money or NOT spend at all!Siam paragon is very large with many levels of places to walk around.Although this shopping center is VERY expensive, it is a nice place to have a look around.

To see this will astound most people from around the world. To experience the shopping centre as many time my family has makes us a bit of a expertThe different foods ,the department stores Delicatessen ,the bakery,super market as good or better than anywhere in the works.Anything you can think of or wants it is there

All international brands in one place. Exactly the opposite of the market-size MBK - here you can find a decent variety of international brands all under one roof. Not to big and not too small, it has a Louis Vitton, 2 Patek Phillipe and a Rolex shop, all tucked between beautiful surroundings.

Something sweet. The shopping center Siam Paragon has a lot of favorable shops with famous names. On the ground floor there is the sweet avenue. There you can find different kinds of cakes, sweets and ice cream. My favorite is Moone. They have not too many different sweets but they offer only tasty ones. I prefer their Tiramisu, which is sold in a cup made of glass, and the Vanilla kiss, milk with vanilla. The staff is helpful. The prices are not too high.

Best I have been in Bangkok! . Large, many shops, expensive but very nice,The largest and a very pretty Super market that I have seen in a mall.Very pretty food hall with many café and restaurants. Enjoyed it many times!
Amazing shopping mall. Amazing place where you can find many attractions, shops and good food. Will definitely visit this place again next time i be in Bangkok. :)
huge and posh. The whole neighbourhood is good for shopping. What to say about shopping mall - it's huge and posh, you can find all range and brands of goods.

Wonderful shopping complex. All brands under one roof. The size of this mall is jus amazing. The good complex is full of choice and life. Wifi free inside the mall.( gotta get the password from the front desk) great place to jus chill out and look out for deal$$$

good shopping mall. The Siam Paragon is a shopping mall which offers different variety of shops. There are some high end stores and the mall is quite modern. Even if you don`t intend to buy anything there, it is a good experience to walk in the mall.
Great mall. Huge mall with all the big brands. You can find Dior, Prada, Chanel or even H&M, Victoria Secret and Forever XXI. There are lots of things to do in this mall. I recommend.

Clean and Strategic. you will find thousands of shops here. BTS was reachable, and Siam itself was an interchange for several directions line.
food was affordable, shopping items were unique and branded. it was not just a mall facing a train station, it was relaxing although it was crowded. you will find men and women walking fashionably.

High End Shopping Center. This shopping center has some of the high end shops not available elsewhere in Bangkok. You still have a lot of products readily available at other shopping malls, but what sets this place apart is the sheer amount of high end shops.A lot of restaurants are located on the basement-floor - the place is crowded so if you don't want to wait, you should avoid normal lunch and dinner times.The Royal Paragon Hall - where many concerts and events are held - is located on the top floor of Siam Paragon, on the opposite end of where the Major Cineplex is located.

Just like any other international shopping mall. This is the smart version of the three Siam centres. Yes it's got all the brands and it's close to the sky rail. So if you want the big brands this is the place for you. The best bet is the food hall in the Siam centre. It's great. Food discovery centre. Lots if variety, reasonably priced, and good quality.

Top notch shopping. We took a BTS from our hotel and you need to get off at Siam Station and walk around 5 minutes to Siam Paragon Shopping Mall. The place is adjacent to Siam Square & Siam Discoveries. The place is quite huge sometimes overcrowded. You can find many international branded boutiques such as Chanel, Hermes, Prada, Valentino, etc as well as Paragon department store inside the building. Not to mention that many restaurants and a food court as well. Love this place!

a better shopping mall. A nice shopping mall with all famous brands. But not more. Nothing special. You find places like that in other capitals as well. Often the place is packed full with Thai teens and tourists who come here to take a look but in fact buy nothing. Maybe go ther efor a snack in the food hall.All the products you see in Siam Paragon you can get cheaper in other shopping malls not far away. As tourist take a look, go for lunch but buy your stuff somewhere else.

Definitely one of the best malls i've ever been in. It has a ton of stores a lot of new things and great products. i blew a ton of cash on body stuff and spa things, all made in Thailand and all natural, very cool n highly recommended!
Big Mall. Siam Paragon is a shopping center with a great foodhall with a lot of different Restaurants especially japanese ones and a great Gourmet market.

Gourmet shop at Siam Paragon and around. Siam Paragon in one of the most important places to visit. You can find all kinds of shops, branded items and little costly. Number of entertainments; under water world, cinema and so on.At the ground floor, you will find gourmet shop which I found excellent. Do remember to get a "Tourist Privilege card" before shopping here. You can get this card instantly by showing your passport at the information just around the entrance of gourmet shop. This card entitles you to get 5% discount on number of purchases.In the gourmet shop you can buy quality house hold goods, cosmetics, spices. At the end of the gourmet shop you will find "pet shop". For pet owners, you will find everything you need.Number of quality food outlets around the gourmet shop. Remember to put last order in food outlets before 9PM for dinner."Boots" is a quality outlet for quality medicines and cosmetics. On the same floor of gourmet shop, you will find "Boots" outlet but I will suggest not to visit "Boots" outlet of this Siam Paragon. Reasons are:1. I should say this outlet of "Boots" is not a tourist friendly. I visited twice this outlet at the end of December 2014, staffs are not so willing to work. Not friendly. 2. Most of the "Boots" around Bangkok (approximately at all shopping malls has "Boots" outlet) offer "vat refund for tourist" for purchase of equal or more than 2000 baht but they don't.I found helpful staff of "Boots" at the Big-C opposite of central world/Isetan or Gateway shopping mall at BTS Ekkamai.
High class mall. Paragon is a high class mall and is a cool place to meet friends for lunch in the food court and then have a walk around. Some great shops but all expensive.

Excellent. Great mall with everything in it. you don't need to go anywhere else for shopping or eating. it is a bit expensive though with all branded shops. H&M and Uniqlo is a must visit!good food court as well.

Shopping Mall?. I was blown away by this place. Where else in the world (Except Dubai) would you find 2 Rolls Royce's in a store, and the shop next door 2 x Aston Martins, a Bentley, 3 Lambo's....need I go on..All the designer label stores you want...It even has a Harrods.

Huge mall for Brand Consious. Huge mall which will take couple of hours to cover from start till end. You will get all big brands and food court joints inside. Small aquarium as well. Close to MBK Mall. Worth a visit!

Beautiful!!!!. A place must go!!!! I love it! All designers shops are there. Heaven for food lovers. It's huge, luxury, pricey. Shopaholic dream. In the basement is the Siam Ocean World, fantastic attraction for kids. Also Cineplex at the last floor. Floor with cars, Lamborghini, Bentley.....shops, shops, shops..... all !!! Is huge, connected to other 2 malls.
Food Court and Spices Shopping. The Food Court Restaurants were good with alot of choice Dessert was amazing The Supermarket was excellent for authentic Thai shopping
<3. Love this place,, just love it ! Lots of branded stuff and foods ! Wish it was bigger ! Very close to Siam Center and Siam BTS as well.

Bowling, karaoke, cinema, everything. It can be reached by train very easily. It has everything you need and you do not need. Bowling area was simply too noisy because the music was extremely loud. The deal they offer for bowling is nothing much, but if you have nothing else to do, you can give it a try. Karaoke area with separate rooms is available as well. There are many restaurants, but it toook us some tiem to find what we like, food corner was simply not as interesting as in Siam (which is right next to Paragon). We spent here our last afternoon in Thailand, did not shop much, but it was still interesting. Again, feel free to miss it if you are irritated by bright lights and shopping spree.
Boom-Shoppers Paradise. Everything you could every need from everyday items to high-end luxury brands all in these connected malls. Do visit the aquarium!

Nice shopping mall in the heart of the city. Siam paragon is one of the most famous shopping in Bangkok. There are various shops and restaurant to choose from. It's very easy to go for instance, bts (siam station). This mall is very very crowded in weekends. :))

Great place for shopper. I liked the Siam Paragon Seaworld, cinemas, restaurants and I enjoyed shopping here very much especially during Christmas month. I disliked and dissapointed that not all shops have vat 7% tax refund in this shopping mall.

Classy and modern. This mall is the more luxurious one of all shopping malls. It therefore offers more "high end" stores. I did not find it so interesting and the whole place was just filled with either bypassing tourists or just to shoot random pics of every single corner. Yes, we are also tourist there but I surely come to seek for something, not just shooting photos of over expensive stores I'm not going to name.The food courts were great though! I advise you to go to the one at the upper level. The one at the ground floor is over-over-over crowded and not so well priced. Also the food they offer there is motonone; mostly dominated by either Japanese or Western franchises. The upper level offers better pricing, more spacious, less crowded and more Thai food! The food market was amazing. A recommendation to do your groceries there!Overall; great BTS location(BTS station Siam) and great offerings in both selling and eating of food

Shopping place to go to in Bangkok. If your into shopping, then this place is worth visiting in Bangkok. You can find all sorts of stuff (Thai and international brands). If you are a tourist, they give you more discount and some stores also provide VAT refunds.

Amazing Mall. This is an amazing mall, no tourist should miss this one. You can get everything in this mall, literally everything. From a Small Pin to the Majestic Rolls Royce Phantom. Its huge actually there are several malls which are interconnected to each other. I really had a good time roaming around here.
Everything. You come here for one reason or purpose wise but do a lot more than what u thought of. This is called Siam Paragon where everything u do is little bit more.

Must check the food palace in basement !!. Generally speaking this location isn´t too much different from other modern Asian shopping cities with a lot of well known brands stores (mostly in pricy sector), but is stands out a bit for two things: first it is perfectly connected to BTS Siam station, second and much more valued it was the food paradise offered in the basement. It is simply a must try !! If you are hungry or not, you will find a bite and you won't be disappointed. OK, it's not the cheapest place and can be a bit noisy around lunch time, but we found it hard to beat in diversity - from hot to sweet, it is all there !

High end mall - better if you have deep pockets. Siam Paragon is a very high end mall with all the big names and brand represented. As such much of what it offers is to those with deep pockets, so many are there just for window-shopping it seems.There's the good Paragon department stall inside though it is very much comparable with the Central Chitlom and Zen department stores in terms of what's on offerThe Paragon Cineplex at the top of the mall is one of the best cinemas in Bangkok, and in the basement is a good but busy food court and also the Gourmet food supermarket.Definitely worth visiting even just to browse.
I love this shoppingcenter. Great deals, cheap prices esspecially really good deals for foreigners like myself! Go there and check the night market out in front of the shoppingcenter as well!

Expensive, crowded and pretentious. Apart from the IMAX and cinema complex which offer a good but expensive experience the complex is not for those wishing to find ease of wandering about in a friendly environment. Resembling more and more like a luxury train station this place is an expensive unsmiling nightmare. There is nothing Thai about this complex and unless you have a great deal of money to spend I suggest you move to other less pretentious centres. The real beauty of Thailand lies elsewhere.

High End Shopping with good food options. Your typical high end shopping mall with big names = big prices. Nice for an afternoon stroll if you have nothing to do (don't bother if you are from the city and are looking for a more authentic adventure in the THAI city!) Food there was lovely (but definitely more expensive then your local mall @MBK or Platinum) with many options. We went there for NYE 2015, which was great. Shopping centre is clean and staff are overall rather friendly. Near to BTS station Siam as well - so very convenient to hop on and off the train line. There are also many shopping centres around so you can venture around.

Huge modern mall . 5+ levels with everything you'd imagine a modern mall having; name brand clothing, jewelry/watches, gourmet grocery store, food court, spas (hair salons, facials, etc). Pricing was similar to malls in the States. It was packed mostly with tourists - I was told by my taxi driver that locals shop across the street in the lower end mall which has cheaper goods.

Nothing special . It's a mall...filled with branded goods and branded shops....Worth walking around in if your wallet feels a bit light....but if you have deep pockets, then you can do more than walk around...The restaurants and cafes are nice though and the whole mall is a nice place to wander and relax (cos not as crowded as the street outside)It's right next to the siam station

high end. if you like to shop at platinum fashion mall or pratunam market, you won't like siam paragon. It's all high end and not stylish like platinum. I find this place good for international food though. If i visit bangkok again I would like to go to Siam paragon to get some tiramisu and coffee.

Great Gathering for Family.. Siam Paragon in Bangkok is the gathering place for most family since it is centrally located and the transit point of Bangkok Transport System (BTS). The family normally meet, shop, dine, and even enjoy a movie in the complex. Ever since the opening of the giant shopping complex in middle of the city, the number of daily visitors of locals as well as tourists had been continuously increasing. The only problem which result from its success, the traffic in and out of the parking building can be difficult at time. Make sure you allow plenty of time for your gathering.

Something worth while visiting. This mall is really something else. It is great to visit and do some shopping. even if you would like to buy a new car, this is the place to go!! Also great restaurants and nice atmosphere

How the other half live. Great to walk around and gaze, unfortunately I wouldn't be able to buy anything exact perhaps from H&M! Absolutely lovely the food hall in the basement and picked up a couple of hits, the supermarket is also very good. Expats can get anything they are missing from home there.Also visited the cinema which was fairly standard and did the job!

Utterly Amazing!. Probably the biggest shopping mall I've been to. It is a stunning mall and with so many shops you spend hours in there without realising it. Definitely worth a visit although I would do a 2 day trip just to get through all the levels.
My favourite. Super super mall with every shop and also nice place to go around. The food hall with many Thai foods is very nice and cheap!
Good shopping options. Brands range from high end to mass. Kinokuniya bookstore is here. Madam Tussaud's is over at Siam Discovery.

Spend a whole day for shopping. Siam Paragon is the popular shopping mall in Bangkok, the location is nice and situated in front of Siam BTS Skytrain station. there are a lot of high-end fashion brands inside, like Paul Smith and Armani, you can spend a whole day for shopping in the mall.

Siam Paragon, amazing food court. It's always good to combine shopping and eating. What can be more enjoyable for women? Usually I am having a late lunch break here, after a few hours of window shopping and some real shopping. You will find a lot of western and American food, like Starbucks café, Cinnabon and a lot of Thai food. Sometimes I eat at the food counters in Paragon's Supermarket and mini restaurant. It’s good quality fresh food, made on the spot. You'll be surprised by the large amount of bakeries and patisserie shops at the Food hall.

High class Shopping Mall worth visiting. This is a place for (genuine) brand-lovers. They have a really nice foodcourt as well. You can even buy Lamborghini or Aston Martin here in the Showroom on 3rd floor.Expensive place but nice to walk around
Beautiful Christmas decoration. Nice for shopping, kind of pricey tho  but the Christmas decorations are stunning, something must see this year great spot for taking photos in Bangkok

Elegant Extensive Shopping in the heart of Bangkok. I realize that for most people traveling for business or leisure to Bangkok spending time in a huge modern shopping complex is not there top priority however Paragon is worth a visit. Yes there are the complete repertoire of high end designer shops along with Rolls Royce, Bentley, Maserati and Ducati showrooms which are interesting to peruse. The fun of Paragon is the extensive lower level food court and Gourmet Market where you can eat, sample and buy an enormous range of gustatory delights then vista the sea life exhibit if you are with children or still enjoy such experiences yourself. I find it an excellent resource to see what the current state of the "Best of the Best' is in retail products, electronics, toiletries and handicrafts. Ifs easily accessed via the Siam BTS station. Its huge, especially when taken with everything that it interconnects with such as SIam, Central, etc. Worth checking out if only for the food court.

Everything is here.. Just stop at Siam Paragon and you can find all in one. There are some nice coffee shops inside such as True Coffee or Secret Garden with delicious cakes and can take a rest if you are tired. Nothing to complain about, just too busy. If someone doesn't like crowded place, you can visit to Central World, Central Embassy, Terminal 21, a bit smaller and a bit less people :). Maybe they should have locker service, actually u can deposit at Gourment Market, B floor no matter you go inside supermarket or not and maybe should invest some bathroom also!? :-)

This mall has grown on me!. I didn't like this mall when it first opened. 80% of items sold could be found at other malls with better discount. Typically Siam Paragon would offer 10% whereas Central and others would be 15%. However, it has grown on me. Rack prices are still high but if you know what you are looking for and are prepared to shop around and/or have the time to wait then bargains can be had.High end fashion from well known brand names e.g Burberry,Gucci , LV etc will very rarely be competitive with the US or UK/Europe so not a lot of bargains to be had on these lines. I suspect these brands sell to wealthy Thais who can't wait for their next trip to Europe and must have the latest model now, this instant.The same can be said for luxury watches but the dealers are often willing to give you a significant discount. I just got a 35% discount on an exclusive Swiss brand watch. Admittedly, this discount brought the price down to the same as you could buy online in the USA but I got to see the watch and the shop and the warranty/box etc so there was much less risk. The discounts are there. Do not be put off by the price tag, especially for watches. If you are prepared to negotiate in Paragon there are some good deals to be had.I also agree with a previous poster. Anyone spending time in Bkk who fancies a trip to the movies should buy a 1st Class Cinema Ticket at either Paragon or Central World. This kind of experience is not readily available in the UK/Europe and if it is it would be 2-3 times the price that you pay in Bangkok. I recommended this to some young Kazakh friends of mine. They were unsure whether to spend the extra (it was 700bt a ticket at the time compared to 150bt for a normal seat) but they took the plunge and they were glad they did. It was just a nice way to experience a movie - an experience that may not even be available in your home country.

The Best Bangkok Mall. Believe me when i say this is the mall you need to visit when youre in bangkok.Very accesible using BTS.Grocery at the lower grounds is convenient to buy stuff to take home with.wide range of shops from mid range to High end

Large and moden mall!!. A very large and modern shopping mall. There was a big food court at the ground floor, but very crowded.Many restaurants on the ground floor as well as at the food passage on the 4th floor. A lot of upmarket shopping in the mall.Siam Ocean world is located at the basement. Very conveniently located, next to Siam BTS.Walking distant to Siam Sq and MBK.

Fantastic Food Court. Food court in the basement is fantastic! There so many selections with international foods on offer! We feel like ordering all the food to our tables :p Hope could have more time to eat here. Must try Vino Crepe and all the street food stalls!

Beautiful Luxury Mall. Lovely mall filled with luxury shops and much more. Spent at least 2 hours here wondering around shopping up a storm. Staff in the Mulberry shop were so sweet. Had lunch at the twinings tea cafe it was really nice. This is a must for anybody visiting Thailand to shop or even if you just go to look at the architecture and displays.

Food Court is Amazing. The food court in the basement of Siam Paragon is really amazing. There are so many different international foods on offer and I really wanted to spend more time to explore and taste everything!

One of the two must-visit Shopping complex. Siam Paragon is huge with a multi-storey departmental store. Everything you need can be found here. It is one of the two must-visit shopping complex in Bangok.
world class mall. food options.. Piri Piri Chicken and Swensens. Naraya store for bags, cosmetic bags etc. with branded and affordable rates.

They had Bentleys on the 4th floor... and today I still don't know how they brought them all the way up there.. Impressive.And the Cinema, a MUST. Get the VIP ticket. It's a bit expensive and something that has never happened to us before, when we were ready to get in they told us that the film was delayed half an hour.. But you get to stay in a quite fancy living room and have a soft drink and a snack before going to lay down in your sofa to watch the film. Literally sofa with blanket and pillow included. There are so many things that can only happen in Thailand.. Enjoy!
very good. very good place for shopping , good food court and good 4d and 3d imax cinema in top floor , and aqua land that you should see

Go!!!!. Wow! we do not have places like this in Europe. It worths seeing what money spending means in Asia. Everything under a roof plus excellent food. It worths a visit if you have time in Bangkok and already have seen the Palace and the River....

Great Place to see at Night with the Lights and Fountains. This would be a place to shop if you were looking for expensive designer items. We were not, but it was a wonderful place to stop at night. You can take the BTS and exit at Siam Central. We visited at Christmas time and everything was light up! The fountain at night was beautiful. One of the businesses hosted a rabbit painting contest so there were large rabbits on display in the mall. It was a very festive atmosphere. There were a lot of beautiful decorations.We neither shopped nor ate anything here, but we did enjoy looking.

Best mall in Bangkok. This is a 5 star mall with all the luxury brands on site such as Chanel and a Ferrari showroom, as well as regular stores such as H&M and Zara. The complex also offers many food choices - Japanese, Western style, Thai street food, dessert bars and a mini Harrods. The department store food market also offers a vast array of groceries, fresh produce and ready to eat or a la carte food!
