This place seems popular with tourists and locals alike, all enjoying the air conditioning and the 400,000 square metres of shopping.

Everything is here . Been here as it's our last day we realize it has almost everything but the pricing is almost the same as singapore which I feel not much different , went around to take a walk after all didn't shop as much as I would.
quality with price. variety of quality products but all expensive all international brands were available excellent location

Everything under one roof. Keep your wallet ready to spend. This place has all the big shopping names under one roof - from your everyday H+M to your supercars by Lamborghini and Bentley. Yep, the most interesting thing was finding car and bike showrooms on the 3rd or 4th floors of this mall!Tourists can also get VAT refunds on products bought here. Check with the stores you give business to!The food court on the ground floor offers a great variety of Asian cuisines, but remember to buy the Food Court Card before you wait in the long lines to order.

Huge mall with all the international brands. A huge air conditioned mall with easy access from the BTS station Siam . Great food court with very clean toilets and every luxury brand you can think of . Prices are not cheap though depending on where you live and not sure how many bargains you will find here .

one of the big shopping center. civilization, grand, great shopping district, appropriate eating, walking, watching cinema with the family, lovers etc .. But to Bangkok, the busiest transport crab ,makes me tired and sickness...poor . But i was happy,and have fun thanks you all my friend because they take the time to travel with me.

A place of air conditioning. This has a huge food court, and many restaurants, serving a variety of foods from around the world.Some of the shops are very expensive! It really is a place for people with money, or for tourists not bothering to check the price in thier own currency. There are some bargains, but these are few and far between.The coffee shops are superb, with vast arrays of tasty cakes.It is nice to go in to take advantage of the air con and clean toilets, and many people visit the Siam Ocean World aquarium in the basement, although I think this is over-priced- some discount is offered if you live here or you are Thai.A decent place overall, and easy access via the BTS skytrain.

A wealth of restaurants. Siam Paragon is a super shopping centre. It is inclined to be a little expensive on Thailand standards. For eating the choice is wide from Mc Donalds upwards. There are restaurants on every floor with the most on the ground floor. I met a friend for lunch there on a Monday and the ground floor was rather noisy and crowded, tourists and locals. We ate instead at a much quieter, and more expensive, Chinese restaurant on the 4th floor where I had one of the best sweet and sour fish dishes I have tasted. The dessert menu dd not appeal so we went back down to the ground floor too one of the icecream parlours and ordered a wicked banana split with stawberries and other fruit, ice cream and cream. It was served with two small jugs one with strawberry topping and one with chocolate topping. After that I am ashamed to say that we went on to another coffee bar for a satisfying cappochino to finish the repast.
Siam Paragon - Great for all.... There is so much to experience and do here that you will use it for good measure on more than one occasion...

High end shopping in Bangkok. This is a mall for your eyes to feast with similar prices too! High end shopping, great mall, food hall with lots of choice. Nice to see if you can - but no so many purchases as other places unless you can afford the more expensive labels
Great shopping destination.... So many attractions and awesome food court at the basement. Worth a few days of visits, if you are staying for a while.

Siam Paragon Amazing shopping center. Amazing shopping center and possibly one of the best in the world. There's everything humanly possible to think about. Fashion floor with all the newest brand of all fashion designers and even a long line to enter the Louis Vuitton store. The ground floor is like a food market with a huge supermarket and great to walk around there. Aquarium was a lot of people waiting to enter and we gave up on it. The mall is very clean and the air conditioning is very good and it is very easy to find a store or a place you're looking for. BTS Station: siam

shoppers paradise and more!. We loved it! Why? It has a super air conditioning. It is so cool inside that one needs to wear a scarf/light sweater to stay mildly warm! It also has everything for sale and more. From cars to funky shoes and glittery evening bags and oysters and sweets. I liked the shoes best! It also has a great choice of eateries at ground level and on the 4th floor as well as a mega supermarket and a super cinema (IMAX). The top priced IMAX seats have a blanket thrown in - much appreciated given almost arctic temperatures. If not, bring a sweater. It's shoppers' paradise and more. My advice: go and try it out!

Lot's of choice, but generic. Good place to shop till you drop, but nothing special here. Why waste time in a mall that could be in any city on the planet? That being said: impressive choice of outlets. Prices only slightly below Europe though, as far as I could tell

High-end shopping Mall. The Siam Paragon mall is a high-end luxurious shopping in Bangkok. The food and restaurant are great. There is aquarium call Siam Ocean World, I had a great experience with my kids. The cineplex is also large and nice for movie time with family. What I don't like is too crowded for weekend.

shopping temple. Well, if you've had enough of Bangkok's beautiful temples, this is a temple of a different sort that doesn't offer anything Thai.In turn it has clean toilets on offer.Recommendable 'Kunikuniya' bookstore, probably one of the best in Thailand.
Great. It is a great place with heap of options to shop.Very closed to the centred of Bangkok.Negative: You need tlo have some bargain skills.

Shop till you drop. Every brand name is here at this shopping complex, including the adjacent/connected Siam center. Lower level food court is amazing with so much variety. If you're into shopping, this is the place. Layout is not bad, not many sitting areas.

Nice place . Nice place with high end luxury brands boutiques . Classy atmosphere . Lots for food and restaurants . Lots of people too esp school kids . Easily access through bts station . Will Definitely be back for more food and shopping .
world class shopping mall. it is just an amazing shopping mall with no dislikes. From shops, to food courts, everything is good. The Kinokuniya bookstore is one of the best, I have been to.
Good shopping hub. Supermarket is fabulous ! Choose your meat and they cook for you straightaway ! Food is great and cheap !

Nice . Stunning shopping mall, with a huge range of shops and restaurants to choose from. Was disappointed in the type of restaurants: I was hoping to find a stylish Thai restaurant but the nicer looking restaurants were Japanese or seafood only. Probably wouldn't come back as it felt a little clinical to me.

best shopping mall in the world, hands down.... Siam paragon has everything.....and the best of everything....no mall in dubai, singapore, china, india, or even thailand......comes close to it.....i have been here 1000's of time...it is really good....

Beautiful decor. If you're after high end shopping in Bangkok then this is the place to be.From my experience, the sales staff are very friendly.This shopping centre definitely taps into the western part of the world but the complex is beautiful and full of elaborate decorations.Do not be afraid to venture out into the streets to get some Moo Bing and Cao Niew from the street vendors- trust me, the street food is the best food in Thailand. I personally would have not gone near the street food if it wasn't for my half Thai girlfriend insisting that I try it - this was possibly one of my best decisions.The centres surrounding this complex also host medium priced fashion, and a market with cheaper clothing where you can barter for prices.Siam Paragon is an enjoyable experience and if you have time in Bangkok I would highly recommend going and checking it out.
My favorite place in Bangkok!!!. My favorite place in Bangkok!!!This is "The place" for shopping,eating,cinema,kidzena,aquarium, can spend at least two days here.
Awesome Shopping Centre. Everything you could want from an Imax theatre to a Lamborgini shop and everything in between. A bit upmarket but good for a wander around.

Another Decent shopping mall. Good posh shopping mall, nothing great. Massive food court in basement with decent choices. All kinds of shops with amenities are there. Easily accessible with BTS skytrain.Good escape from hot weather. After sunset atmosphere is electric.Keep this in your itinerary.

More for locals than tourists. This shopping area is more high end than other places. Great place for families as there is a lot of edutainment opportunities. Nice food area as well. It is well worth a visit.

A (wealthy) shoppers dream come true. If you are fortunate enough to have a big, thick wad of cash or a big credit limit then this is the place for you. all of the big name, high end fashion houses under one roof. And if you are a watch enthusiast, guilty as charged, then this is a must visit shopping complex.
great shopping mall. The food court was great with many selections. I'm a foodie so I enjoyed this shopping mall so much.The movie theatre is huge, you can pick your seat when you buy a ticket.

Great Place. Siam Paragon is a best place in Bangkok, a place where everyone can enjoy. Good shopping+delicious food+nice People+Cinemas+underwater world+department stores= Siam Paragon....The best thing in Siam Paragon is its departmental store we visited here seven times during our 2 weeks stay.

Shopping, eating and cinema. I actually like going to shopping centres in foreign countries, they're cross-cultural but always a bit different. They're usually cool and clean too, which can be a nice break after days on the road.

Top mall. This is one of the most photographed places in the world for a reason.its superb. The BTS is opposite.It has actually everything.from superb food courts, gourmet and fine dining to boutique shopping;Cineplex and imax to ocean world aquarium. Can easily spend a week there

Not really my cup of tea. . A very large, very clean and fancy mall. The selection of shops is not really what I was looking for (designer clothes etc.)
But if you are in the neighborhood and want to kill some time then sure it's a must visit although i personally preferred the MBK mall instead.

Non sense service from the packager staff at the supermarket. This evening we bought the salad with the others, during the packaging of the staff at the cashier who was very idiot of the packing by mixed up the salad and the roll on cool together in one plastic bag - The bottom on the receipt shown the user-Matchuree.

Everything under one roof. This mall is huge but the stores seems to be more uptown brands. They do have a wide selection of restaurants and food court at the basement that should satisfies your particular craving for your next meal. Humongous supermarket at the basement as well.

High-end Mall. We got a tuk-tuk here from Nana and got the sky train back which was cheap and very straight forward. The mall is huge and filled with high-end shops, eateries and even car show rooms on the 4th floor. It is very clean and well air conditioned for those hot days you want to cool down. Although very large, there are touch screen maps throughout. The ground floor is filled with restaurants, cafés etc catering for all. Some of the prices are fantastic if you get the tax refund otherwise, it's pretty much what we would expect to pay back home in the UK (or more).

Superb super market and wide selection of food. Siam Paragon is a place that I must visit every time I am in Bangkok. There many eateries of reasonable price available ...particularly Japanese food. Like its supermarket as it stocks the widest selection of products one can find.
Food court becoming average. Nice new reno but food court has lost its edge. Go out to the back streets if you're looking for local delights.

Too crowded. My favorite mall is now getting more crowded with locals and tourists mix together. Every restaurants will have a long queue especially on weekend or Saturday nite. However, I will always come back here to shop and have lunch or dinner. Don't forget to visit the satay section of the food court at lower ground floor where you can find a great choices of satay and sausages.

Great place. Here is a huge shopping mall that offers a lot of hi-end shops. I especially liked to have a meal in the basement at the food court. You have to buy a chip card and then you can get the foods. There are quite excellent Thai food at a reasonable price. In addition, the selection is huge. Should still be available balance on the card, you can simply return the card and to get the money back.

Super foodcourt and supermarket.. For me the Siam Paragon is the one with the most great choices of food. The prices at the foodcourt are a bit higher than t the Central World mall and here you buy a deposit card to pay the food. The suoermarket has a lot of local dishes and sweet, wow.

Twice in 3 days. I live in a city that invented food courts. But Siam Paragon is truly a fantastic experience.5 reasons to visit:1. See the vertical green wall 2. Convenient. Next to Siam station3. Siam Ocean World at basement4. Shopping for presents. Lemongrass and pandan tea, the rice crispy (best on BKK) and other snacks in the food gallery. Best rice crispy I've eaten. Fresh.  5. Food court - where the mango for mango rice is only cut when you buy. Not earlier. The skin of Vietnam spring roll is made fresh and on the spot. So is the Tom yum soup - which means that the queue for these stalls take longer. Get a fully refundable food card at the main entrance to purchase food. 6. Food mart is amazingly huge with rows of Perrier, Evian, San Pellegrino. Chacuterie. High end living. I was told there's a BMW showroom on the top floors. No idea.
Shopping and having dinner at the food court. Great supermarket - A very good place for you to shop for your souvenir.Amazing food court - Provides a lot of great foods in a very good price.

Modern and full of designer shops. BKK's rich or pretentious crowd.. Stumbled into here after being directed from pillar to post by shop assistants on the quest for krispy kreme. Eventually got here. On par with modern European style shopping centres. Only issue we had was krispy kreme woman would not give us a small box to to put 4 donuts in. I the crumoled up the big bix to carry 4 dounuts and she imnediatley snatched it from me. You can take the krispy kreme to bangkok but you cannot take customer service there. "God bless Amerikaa"
Beuno !. Nice mall, nice shopping, nice food, nice people. Very fun spend all day here and try aquarium park downstairs. Location in city centre near hotel, near sky train. Many people but very nice.

exercise park. on hot bankok days take a walk round every floor for a cool and entertaining part of your healthy living program.back to the basement for a full on city lunch break,the foodstore has everything from everywhere.toilets immaculate.great way to absorb the bankok atmosphere.

Great place to shop & eat. Food court are very clean & very clean. many nice food to eat. reasonable price....supermarket are good place to go & many choice of Thailand product to be purchase if you want to bring back for relatives...

Great foodcourt!. It's a nice mall packed with lots of luxury shops.So therefore it is more expensive than what locals would pay for clothing, but then again it depends what you are looking for. There are a couple great bookstores as well.A very large on Kikonuya with a huge selection of foreign books, There is a fantastic foodcourt and also there are many restaurants, so for those who like luxury shopping and great food, this is the place to go.

It's sad how this replaced its glorious predecessor.. This is a very successful shopping centre. It has successfully combined mid-market with upmarket places (plus a few downmarket eateries). I *do* go here for a few things.But it's a real shame that the glorious, original, Intercontinental Hotel had to be demolished (instead of renovated for its next 3 decaces of excellence). One can only wonder what "arrangements" might have been made regarding the non-renewal of their lease and the subsequent overdevelopment of the site into Paragon.

Good range of shops and food. Like this place for the wide range of food it offers: from the food courts to specialised restaurants.There is a wide variety of stuff available here too... However prices of crafts tend to be more expensive compared to places like JJ market. A tip for tourists is to apply online from the siam paragon website for the tourist's foreign shoppers society. This little paper card entitled you to more discounts at participating stores, which is good for the supermarket, Gourmet Mart, located at the basement- it has a good selection of local food souvenirs!

Shopping is nice but the food court steals the show. The shopping here is quite high end. Large complex. But go for the food court. Absolutely amazing. Best in the world as far as I have seen. One of every possible type of food, it seems. And all very reasonably priced. Plus there is a whole wing for desserts!

Mall for every need.... Good shopping mall... a place where everyone can enjoy... It has kidzania and a water world ...Amazing place for kids to have fun time in central bangkok... A good place to shop around strating from clothes to furnishing to books... Great place ... Good food court too...

Typical high end shopping mall. If you are wanting to shop here, prepare to bring a lot of cash or get the credit card out. This shopping mall was extremely clean and easy to walk around, but if you only have a short amount of time available in Bangkok, this is NOT on the must do list. The upper levels had some excellent car show rooms (rolls royce, maserati etc) and an Italian car show was on the day we were there (free beers were offered!).

Clean and Nice Mall. One of the biggest malls in Bangkok. Has a lot of places for shopping but prices may not be as cheap as others. Dining here was a great experience from the European buffet offered in one of the restaurants in the lower floors.

Excellent high end shopping with out of this world food court. well this is truly a superb shopping mall, with lots of top stores willing to part you of your hard earned dollar, several floors offering loads of choice, impressive stores with staff that will wait on hand and foot with awesome smiles to impress you, But the real highlite is the amazing food court, there is just so much choice, of great food amazing cakes and sweets, all a excellent prices, you can even buy Harrods products to try,

Waste of time. What a waste of time! Takes so long to walk around the place but everything is either too expensive or impossible to find. If you wanna hang around and people watch its ok, if you are looking to buy this then move on.

fantabulous. One among the best malls of Thailand. It is huge with all the best of the best brands spread across the mall. The best part of the mall is the display at their showrooms. I have never seen so good and innovative displays. It will really attract you to purchase. A very good marketing concept. The food court is with many options and is for all countries. Worth a visit

Siam Paragon is the best Mall to shop and especcially to EAT.. I've been like so many times to the Siam Paragon and still I can't get enough of it! In the basement the foodcourt with a lot of restaurants, bakerys etc. Don't forget Starbucks, Krispy Kreme Doughnuts. Ow I don't remember every brand but there are so many delicious things to eat that every time I HAD to go the Siam Paragon. Don't forget to step into the supermarket because you don't know what you see, that much and even more food. Don't forget to watch a movie in the Siam Paragon movie theatre. It's like sitting at home with a lot of space for your feet and the sound is the best in the world. All the great designers in clothes are there. My favourite brand M.A.C. make-up. There are stores for massages, put on eye-lashes, even a new shape eyebrow like in Oprah Winfrey. Down in the cellar there is a huge place to see everything that swims in the see. Really beautiful. A must see. From shark to clownfish. You also can swim with the sharks. If I stay 12 days in Bangkok you can see mee about 10 days for a few hours in the Siam Paragon :) It makes you happy even if you don't have enough money to buy everyting!! If you have a baby they have strollers for you.

Nice mall. It was first time going to Siam Paragon, I checked the net before I go there I thought it is the high end mall in Bangkok as it was advertised in bangkok.com. When we went there, I was a bit disappointed, though the mall is big and you can buy there almost anything you want, I was not able to relax while i'm doing my shopping because people are very busy especially when we went to the foodcourt. It was a big mall and we didn't have plenty of time to explore everything so probably that's the reason I didn't enjoy it that much but I still give a very good score because I was still amaze how big it is. You can also buy signature clothes there and you can relax as Starbucks coffee after shopping.

Suitable for heavy spenders.. If you have a heavy wallet and love to spend / shop at top brand stores. Then this place is ideal for you. If i win a million dollars to spend at Gucci / Marc Jacobs then i would definitely revisit.
Only upside? Is the food court! Loved it!

Super mall. This is what I call a super mall. Anything and everything you want you can get here; but most impressive is the food court on the lower level, which is more like a food paradise. I visited here three times during my three week stay.

Awerage mall. Just shopping centre, nothing special.
Overpriced, busy, huge, western. I have nothing much to say... I expected more according to tripadvisor reviews.
If you ´re shopping maniak and have full wallet and you aren ´t afraid to spend it, you ´ll enjoy this place.
I like MBK center better.
(We have much better malls in Prague to be honest)

One Heck Of A Mall. This is a great place to spend some time. It has a very interesting food court with all the major cuisines well-represented. It has Siam Ocean World in the basement and a great movie theater on the top floor. It has every shop conceivable. They even sell Aston Martins on the third floor!

Goodbye Money. Impossible to visit this magnificent shopping venue without parting with a wad of money. From amazing restaurants, designer clothing, fabulous leather handbags and shoes, to the best fresh food market I have ever experienced, on the lower ground floor.

luxury. Imposing building. Famous, very expensive stores inside. Cool inside, superb after some hours outside in hot, humide Bangkok.
It is nice to see, but there are more important sightseeing points in town than this.

Amazing food amazingly cheap. Shops galore mainly high end but it's good to look aroundGo to the toilets on the ground floor they have a musical staircase so each step you take makes up the tune longest trip to the toilet ever ! Haha The food here really is the best, I had green chicken curry rice and sautéed spinach for £1 !!! Beautiful so nice I wanted to go again

Has everything. Siam Paragon is a huge shopping mall where you can buy everything from a Rolls Royce to a tie pin. You probably need at least 2 days to see every shop and there are good restaurants that cater for every taste as well as a supermarket on the ground floor that caters for expats.
Wow - worth a look. Aquarium in basement.. High end shopping, but worth a look. Fascinating shops if you have a thick wallet. Very opulant surroundings

Bought some snack at food court. This is one of my favourite things to do when I go to Bangkok : going to Siam Paragon to buy some local snack. Yes..., I like to buy some traditional snack and dry food at supermarket near food court of Siam Paragon, located on ground floor. They even can pack your snack with box for free.
Shoppers Heaven!. One of the best places to shop outlets in Bangkok. Be aware that the prices there arn't Thai ones, but more western ones.

Shopping conveniently. This shopping centre is linked to branded luxury centre of Siam as well as not far from MBK mall. The best thing in Siam Paragon is its departmental store where all products are organized floor by floor for his or hers. And, don't miss the foot court on basement, Ocean World and KidZania.

It has everything! . Siam Paragon is so huge. You can find anything here. Even for dining you will be spoilt for choice. Cinemas, underwater world, department stores. Also you can walk from Siam Paragon to the mall next door Siam Central.

Lovely Food Variety, Great Connections. I actually really like this mall. Yes, it sells high end stuff so that's quite expensive. However, its still fun to just window shop in well-appointed and relaxing environs. More importantly to me, Siam Paragon has an absolutely great mish-mash of food outlets, concentrated mainly on what they call the ground floor. Something for everyone, something for every appetite. The main western joints are well represented (Macs, Crispy Crème, etc). But they also have many small stalls scattered around selling local or local inspired food. There is a food court too with good variety. For Muslim travellers, one stall is halal certified (think its called Eusoff) and it serves excellent chicken based dishes. The murtabak and satay is different from what I'm used too back home but delicious nonetheless. Just in front of the supermarket on the same floor, there are many desert counters selling lovely sweets. Speaking of the supermarket, the one here is a big one with lots of items sold that may not be stocked in other supermarts in nearby malls. For example, we were looking for a small bottle version of a powder we like; could only find it here. The mall is also very well connected. By that I mean two things. Firstly, its easy to get to as its directly connected to BTS Siam Station. Secondly, its a great hop off point to a large number of malls. For example, if you walk to the connected Siam Discovery Mall and continue walking in the same direction, a series of overhead bridge connections will take you through a few malls all the way to MBK Centre; without you ever stepping onto the street. In the other direction, leave the mall via the back entrance facing Siam Kempinski, hang a right, walk past the carpark and the small roadside food stalls and in less than five minutes you at Central World. And Central Worlds is of course only five minutes walk along the road to the popular Platinum Fashion Mall in the Pratunam district. So start and end your day at Siam Paragon and explore the rest of Bangkok's wonderful world of mall shopping in between. Lovely.

Upmarket shopping mall. High prices and upmarket. Out of reach of most Thai people. But worth a visit to look at the goods and the prices. I can buy things cheaper in Australia than I can at Paragon. The prices are outrageous! Go and look but buy if you can afford it. A pleasant shopping centre where one can even view brand new Rolls Royce and Maserati cars on display. The electronics store has lots of variety but they are overpriced. The staff have no interest (or training) in serving me while I was browsing, probably bcause they saw I was a farang and they cannot speak any English. So they missed out on a sale due to the fact I was going to buy some ear buds for my phone and I wanted to buy some bluetooth speakers. But no one served me! So I walked out! Non of the staff came to me asking if I needed some help. Amazing! Don't they want any sales???

Nice Mall. I went there, to try its ski rink, but it was under maintenance, the shops in there are quite expensive. Didn't buy anything there, just to look around, ate snacks in the cafe and wanted to ski.If you look for souvenirs, there will be a market below the bridge, outside this mall, or you can find more in MBK.

More than just shopping. I don't do shopping so this was the last place I wanted to visit. But we were hungry and nearby. Not the sort of place I'd usually try out but was really impressed with the vast choice of foods available. Very comfortable seating and food from top notch to quite basic.

Good shopping!. It is a very luxurious mall, there's something for everyone from the expensive brands to the more affordable H & M and Zara. Lots of places to eat. Try the gourmet supermarket, many choices for all!
Shopping. Its a very nice shopping. But its that. You have to go there, in particular the electronic floor was my favourite.
Nice Place. You can find brands in this mall but prices are not so cheap if you visit this mall do not forget to visit maddam touso museum

Excellent shopping at Siam Paragon, Center and Discovery Malls. I decided to write a review of all the Siam Malls in Bangkok since they are all connected to one another and the shopping and dining experience of all were fantastic. The complex is easily accessible by BTS but we walked a short 15 minutes from our hotel, The Renaissance, through the overhead BTS bridge. The shopping is diverse from all the Westernized (Marc Jacobs, Victoria's Secret, Sephora, Au Bon Pain, etc.) and European designer establishments (LV, Furla, Bvlgari, H & M, Topshop, La Duree, Harrod's Tea Room, etc.) to the local boutique and handicraft stores. There is a huge cinema complex at Siam Paragon and the Gourmet Market (supermarket) is one of a kind. Much better than any of the premier markets that I have been to in Europe, Asia or the US. The food court is massive, all cuisine imaginable being served to anyone's particular palate. The malls offer tourist discounts at certain stores so bring your passport (actually I just showed them a copy on my phone which sufficed). They have their own department store, Paragon, equivalent to any middle-high priced department store in other countries and they were having a huge sale when we visited. Since we love shopping, this was a shopper's heaven.

A different experience. This is a mall with all the expensive brands gathered. There are lots of options when you get hungry and you can try very different things. On the ground floor you can enter a sea world, but we didn't go there. Overall it's exclusive and something you don't see anywhere.

Great shopping. All designer brands are available and I have to say that Bangkok is one of my favorite shopping places in the world.Siam has got all facilities but is not the best in Bangkok. Still enjoy it and always have a nice family experience.

Nice mall. A huge mall right in the heart of Bangkok. Easily accessible by BTS train and has everything you would want in a mall; a cinema, dozens of food outlets, aquarium (Siam Ocean World), bowling, Kidzania, etc.We tried bowling and had a good time.

Huge Modern Super Mall. If you want to get out of the Bangkok heat go by the BTS to Siam Paragon.This super mall has every kind of restaurant from bagels to gourmet dishes of the world. Movie theatres. Exotic Car dealerships. Furniture stores. Gourmet grocery store.Every brand of fast food to 5 star coffee and tea shops.Amazing and eclectic people watching. I call it the Paragon All Day Fashion Show.This place has everything under one roof.

Great mall, modern and central . I love Siam Paragon. It is in the middle of everything and is huge enough for pretty much anything that you need.Ignoring the big branded stores (you'll find the usual big international brands), you can even find car showrooms to entertain the men.For a more local flavor, The basement supermarket is great to roam. Lots of local taste and produce, get stocked up with your favorite thai seasonings and spices. Prices may not be as cheap as on the streets but the variety and quality is definitely better.Within the paragon department store, if you go up to the top floor, they have a whole section on thai scents and local artisans. This is great if you love aromatic oils, diffusers, etc. some of the brands are very high end where you find them in luxury spas and hotels around the world.Plus: paragon gives a tour yet discount of 5%, and they also have easy tax refund counters on almost every floor.  Go!

A wonderful shopping mall..but.... In Siam Paragon, The Longchamp shop's staff is not responsibility and impolite. As a tourist, wish to have the tax refund, but the staff have made the mistake on it, make it could not be refund the tax, so beware on it...the invoice name have been input wrongly, and did not ask the customer check on it before they left the shop...and ask they take 1 bag and another bag again; she will ask you: Are you sure you want which one...it show impolite...

Awesome. This is a place to be even if u go for window shopping. Just amazing place. The price are very much on the steep side. If u looking for cheaper stuffs then try Platinum in the nearby or MBK just across the road or for souvenirs hit the market at Pratunam. I loved this place..nice food court but again expensive. Siam Paragon should not be missee when in Bangkok. U cam find sales on the higher levels. So please try it.

VERY CONFUSING LAYOUT. Much nicer than it's opposition (literally across the road) Top label shops, clean mall environment. But we found it a very confusing layout. Initially we were searching for Kidzania to take our boy to, but by the time we did get there it was too late in the day to enter. So we browsed the mall. Very nice place to visit and also Siam Square across the road for dinky little alleys etc.
More shopping. Siam paragon and it's allied building shopping complexes will keep anyone busy all day.Easy walk between the other 2 Siam buildings.

Best mall ever!. We ended up at this mall mainly because we forgot to pack a few items... So glad we went.First, we didn't know there was an aquarium there, since we have 2 little ones, we thought we should check it out. We all had a great time! I wasn't expecting much when we went in, but we were actually impressed. I think we spent about 3 hours there.When we finally walked around the mall, we were in awe. It is massive and has everything you may need... Including Lamborghini's, Porsche's, and BMW's. ;)There are plenty of food choices, a huge movie theater area, and many, many stores. We plan on heading there one more time before going home.

Luxury brands.. Beautiful shopping centre with the luxury brands. Window shopping is just as much fun. Head towards the upper levels and these are more affordable stores, a great book store on one of the top levels. Aquarium on the lower levels. Quality, fresh & clean food court on the lower levels. Supermarket and food world to Siam Paragon standards. Worth a visit. Change of pace to MBK. 15 mins walk on the sky walk from MBK.

The luxury of a world-class brand. Fancy mall with high-class brand, the atmosphere is cozy and classy. Filled with world-class shops, invites you to shop. We just walk around window shopping's in this place, enjoy the comfort provided. We crossed over to Siam Center and having dinner there because there is Thai food festival.
super makan and shopping trip. lots of high end shopping centre for our high class shopping experience. so just relax and have fun shopping and eating in bangkok

Brands Galore. All the top brands in clothing, watches, shoes, handbags, etc can be found here. You get a feel of the high quality as soon as you enter the mall. To sum it all up – top dollar and quality. A visit to the supermarket on the ground floor is worth the effort. You will see all sorts of fruits and veg and plenty more. There is whole floor for a food court. And if I remeber correctlythere is also an aquarium somewhere inside which had a long queue.

“Luxury to the Extreme”. This shopping mall does not only have extremely luxurious stores, it's building and décor are amazing. It is enormous, it's around 7 floors with gigantic stores and a huge cinema at the top floor that puts to shame tons of movie theaters. Must see even to just get away from the heat of Bangkok, such easy access from the Sky Train. There is a floor dedicated to food with a variety of different restaurants with great food and beautiful interior design, and if that doesn't fancy you there is a buffet style food hall. One of the nicest supermarkets I have seen in my life "Gourmet Market" is also on this floor. The Siam Ocean World is also located in the bottom floor of this mall.
Great Mall. Plethora of shops many restuarants and excellent marine park to visit. Something for every member of the family.

brands meet food. a lot of brands you can find in here, this shopping venue will spoiled your shopping desire, when brands meet food will the perfect place for shopping addict. they have tentative period for giving discount or promo for some brands and of course the gourmet too! only a few bench for break available in here so, don't fasten your wallet! :)
Recommended . A bit smaler than CentralWorld. But just as good. Maybe a bit more cheaper shops. But absolutely a place to visit.

The ultimate Shopping Complex. The shops and everything is so well kept and it creates an ambience of class. Anyway, all the shops are world brands and the amount of young and old people you see on weekends is scary. Pack and people are actually buying. There is actually a car parking for luxury cars only ie porcshe, ferraris and so forth....Must visit, the food court is also big and luxurious. Get off at Siam BTS and it is right on the right hand side.

In Heaven!. Oh my goodness the food court at the SiamParagon is amazing! Any food you want, it's there.Make sure you go into the Gourmet Market (supermarket), as it has a huge selection of fresh and cooked foods. You can also taste test most things.There is an oyster bar, sushi bar, soup stand, salad bar, antipasto stand and many more. You could easily spend hours just wandering through this market.

Walk around. Loved the sophistication of the mall. The retail stores are more high-end and for the more well-off visitors. But for budget travellers like myself, it's nice to just walk around to see what they offer, like the cars and bikes on displays. The food hall is awesome though. So many choices to choose from! We bought a ton of food, but not clothes and stuffs.

Drink, Eat, Shop and Repeat. The level dedicated for dining was practically our home for the last 4 days. We never leave being dissatisfied. Restaurants and small eatery kiosks are aplenty. From Europe to Asia, you get to experience and taste it all. It's of course a lil on a high side with the prices but, we don't mind it cause, at the end of the day, taste that matters. Countless shopping stores and is connected to SIAM bts. Will always visit when in Bangkok.

For the lazy shopper wanting the hassle free shopping experience. The supermarket, it's fantastic. We got everything we needed for our trip to koh chang, our western comforts, the thai delights, and the mosquito repellant, a/c powered, spray-ons, rub-ons, local and foreign, it's all here!

Impressive. I think this has one of the most interesting interior decor plan compared to other malls in Bangkok. High end shopping. Lots of restaurants/cafes etc and a cinema...great place to spend time with friends.

Well worth a view. All your lush & exclusive brands in one place. You can buy your Rolls Royce, Lamborghini, Rolex, or even a sofa! It is mad up of 3 buildings which also have an Ocean world & Madame Tussauds. Must see just to look at as cannot afford anything other than food.
Expensive . Its a nice mall but very expensive. Lots of world class brands are here.Food court is nice too.Ocean world is really exclusive if you want to have a different vive.

high end-priced finds here!. Siam Paragon houses several international high-end brands so there's not much to shop for bargain hunters here. But it was fun to walk around and do groceries after a short window-shopping trip here :)

Amazing place but expensive!. It is most probably the most amazing shopping mall i have ever visited. you can find everything here. But all dresses and cosmetics are all premium and very expensive. Good place to see around but will drain your pocket.

very luxury for consumer. it may be the most luxury shopping place in Bangkok. I can meet almost every fashion brand as far as I know. Atmosphere in here is very similar with Tokyo, Seoul, Hongkong and any other famous cities for shopping. Still here maybe the most interesting place for wandering.Siam Paragon arrange taxi service in main street, but don't believe them. In my experience taxi that they arrange for me is fraud case without taxi-metre. Fortunately I just take off that taxi, still it's unpleasant for me.

Has it all. the closest you can get to a an upmarket US mall, Siam Paragon is it, next to the Kempinski hotel on SIam Square, has all the exclusive stuff whatever a woman can dream of..... Worth taking the trip even for some of restaurants....

Food court at Basement. The food court at the basement is a better option compared to Terminal 21. Similar types of food at both food court. The food at Paragon cost a little more but you get very appetizing food here. It gets quite crowded at lunch time. All food court in Bangkok uses a prepaid Value card to buy your food. BE sure to get a refund of your unused amount of the CARD.

Excellent food court and shopping area. One of the main "mall" type shopping and eating places in the heart of Bangkok. They have an amazing food court with dozens of places to choose from and just as many cuisines you could think of.

Luxury to the Extreme. This shopping mall does not only have extremely luxurious stores, it's building and décor are amazing. It is enormous, it's around 7 floors with gigantic stores and a huge cinema at the top floor that puts to shame tons of movie theaters. Must see even to just get away from the heat of Bangkok, such easy access from the Sky Train. There is a floor dedicated to food with a variety of different restaurants with great food and beautiful interior design, and if that doesn't fancy you there is a buffet style food hall. One of the nicest supermarkets I have seen in my life "Gourmet Market" is also on this floor. The Siam Ocean World is also located in the bottom floor of this mall.

Quite boring place with amazing food shopping/eating possibilities. Despite Siam Paragon is the most Instagrammed place in the world, I do not personally think it is something special, unfortunately. I even consider the place for quite boring and uninteresting. However, what deserves maximum rating, is the fantastic food court and gourmet paradise – food supermarket. Altogether I recommend the visit with 4* (very good)

Upscale Mall. Really upscale mall in bangkok...nice selections of stores and there are also car dealers inside the mall for the top brands like bmw, mercedez, bentley, ferrari and more it's a huge mall with lots of choices for food also at the food court.
spreeeeeeeeee. calling all shopaholics, this is the place where you want to be. if you need to buy a gift, a souvenir or shop for yourself. I can stay here for 24 hours and i won't get bored.

Shopping Paradise. Greta place to shop and grad a bite. The food court at basement is huge and you can get almist anything you want but the local Thai dishes are best. Also the mall has a good department store and many other good boutiques. Also Kinokuniya bookshop and the cinema on the 6th floor make Siam Paragon a good place to visit when in Bangkok. You'll never be bored and time will fly by

Too big, too flashy. I like shopping center to going around shopping, eating and spending time with my wife. But Paragon, is a mess.... So big and crowded with food outlet being avarage. Not impressed at all

Most instagrammed place in the world. Good place to shopping, eat ,buy Thai souvenirs and see all the big worldwide brands. This place has everything - clothes, shoes, hats, jewelry, watches, jackets, vests , Thai cookies,Thai fruit, Thai fried lotus seeds....

luxury. Good for seeing & dinning.
Located on Siam Square, the comfortable area.
Convenience to get there,
but maybe a lot of traffic jam!!!

one of the best. easy access from Silom BTS
the food court & the supermarket on the ground floor is nice
luxurious mall; with many famous brands (clothes, accessories, books, and even cars!!)
has access to siam center

Convenient with wide range of goods. I love it that they have Kinokuniya, one of the biggest bookstore in Bangkok that has books in English and Japanese as well as Thai. The ground floor has a lot of restaurants and food court, ranging from food stalls, fast food chains, to fancy restaurants. Nice super market.The location is very convenient since it is connected to BTS Siam station. Luxury brands are here as well as mass-product brands. You'll find what you need from basic grocery to super car!

Large luxurious shopping complex. Paragon is really large and you can find all those branded stuffs at the shops there. I just managed to go to the Naraya due to time constraints. Cause when you are in Thailand, you have to buy their signature bag which is Naraya! Naraya in Paragon is the biggest outlets.
Good!!!. A Department City of Captures, stores fashion and luxury goods is hare. You can go to paragon by BTS siam
You name it, they got it!. amazing shopping mall, all brands&shops available. close to MBK and big big big food court. awesome place!

Big Fan. As far as shopping malls go, this is one of the best.Amazing variety; you can buy a 10 baht bag of sticky rice, a 30,000,000 baht Bentley & everything in between.It has one of the worlds last remaining mega bookstores, with titles in many languages, you'd be hard pushed not to find what you are looking for. Plenty of parking, no charge if spend a little money shopping.

I'am Not a Shopper......................but. This Mall is different from the open friendly spaces to the Great selection of stores. Clothing, jewelry, to fresh food this place has the best selections.
Great shopping centre, with great food court. Great shopping centre, with great food court, spacious, easy to get around, well lit, even if only window shopping
Full. When coming on sunday a mall really full, but they give a many place to get an eat like ottoya japanesse restaurant....hmmm yummy

Food court. The food court at Siam Paragon has one of the largest varieties and selection of food in Bangkok .All air conditioned and caters for all tastes .We also visited the huge supermarket for Thai products ,Very happy with both places
Atas Shopping. This shopping mall is more of overseas brands and is more expensive than street stalls. A different experience from shopping on the street

Loved shopping there.. Siam Paragon has H&M, Zara, a great food court, excellent movie theatre, fat free frozen yoghurt, a gourmet supermarket & ocean world - so you can spend days here & be kept amused.
The food court had endless choices of noodles and soups & we had an awesome meal there for a very low price. We'll certainly be going back.

The Beat Taxi Q in Bangkok. I have to admit that Siam Paragon Shopping Mall in Bangkok offered the best taxi service I never seen before. The Security Guard not only writing down the taxi number but also calling the taxi to your destination and ensured it's on meter. Furthermore, if you carry heavy items and many shopping bags, the Security Guards will assist to open the taxi door as well as carry your items into the taxi. Not to mentioned the Security Guard will thank you for coming with the Thai greetings. Where else can you get this amazing service. I guess that is why they called Amazing Thailand. One have to experience it to know the real feeling. Well done Thailand!
Food glorious food. We spent 4 hours in the downstairs gourmet food market and had a ball. This is a must see if you like to eat. Try the hot out of the oven egg tarts!!!

International Shopping at International Prices. Great place to visit, but not necessarily the best place to shop. Shops are very trendy, and tend to be pricier than other locations in BKK. Good court on ground level is excellent, as is the Gourmet Market.

the Best Mall In BKK. I loved this mall,i visited often,we went to Siam ocean World on the ground floor and the cinema on the top. But the best part of this mall is the food hall.The food here is truly fantastic at an unbelievable cheap price,we visited here on numerous occasions just for tea before going out at night.come here for almost anything and you will find it.

Really good. Okay, so this is not the MBK or anything like it. This mall is where the high society of BKK comes to hang out. Everything in here looks great, the design of the restaurants, the architecture etc. I recommend to go the "ocean world"- it is not just for kids. You can see really amazing stuff there. Also there is a cinema which is very good and very cheap (high end facilities). And the food courts are great.

Great Mall. Sia Paragon remains arguably one of the best shopping malls in Bangkok. Centrally located, the mall has all the usual suspects - designer stores, food court, etc etc. If you are into retail therapy, Siam Paragon is an excellent place to visit.

My most favourite shopping place in BKK. U can find whatever u want at Paragon. Although it is not that cheap compared to other street shops in Thailand, it is international standard and can make you fulfill. It is my favourite shopping place.In the city center. There is a BTS stop just in front. convenient parking area connected inside the building. Usually no problem with finding a parking. Plenty choices of food, both take away and eat-in, on G floor. Also a food court there. Some more restaurants on 4th and other floors. Huge supermarket. Can also find varieties of Thai food products -- can be a nice gift and for own consumption.Kids and hobby-kind of lessons such as music, dance, tekwando, etc. on 4th and 4A fl. Spa, body care and hair cut. -- i can get my life done here too. Don't have to mention shopping- ranging from shops, brandnames, and department store - which I find so many varieties and easy to get things.

Everything under one roof. A visit to Siam Paragon is a must for any visit to Bangkok.This has remained as a very popular shopping mall with international and local merchandise. Its competitive advantage is the gourmet market, gourmet hall, food hall and food court.All kinds of cuisine are available at a broad price range.The upkeep and cleanliness of the mall is very good.One easily loses the passage of time whilst wandering in this mall.

Another yet amazing shopping arcade for the whole family. It is a whole family entertainment. With a special kids place in the basement.All type of shops, fast food is available. The special thing is the 4D cinema and madame tussauds.
Luxurious. Amazing shopping complex with everything you could ever think to buy, not to mention amazing food outlets

Reviewing a shopping mall?. Why not, there is a first for everything. It must be one of the most expensive places to shop in Bangkok. But be aware that you can get western brands here at prices that can be remarkably cheap compared to your home country. And they are the real stuff unlike 98% of the rest of Bangkok. The foodcourt in the ground floor is good and only a tat more expensive than eating in the streets.

Great Shopping Place. Great Shopping Place. Just like centralworld, things there not cheap. Food court noodle can cost 100b . Many small eatery place and shopping malls. Can alight at siam bts station and travel around there.
Simply the best. The most beautiful place in bangkok at night especially colorful fountain and LCDs. Located in the heart of bangkok. And it's got everything I need; all kind of brands and stuffs.

If you want High Fashion and Brands. Taking a quick BTS trip to Siam will plonk you right outside Siam Paragon.This place is ritzy and glitter on display. Prices to match as well but well worth the experience and take it all in.It's an inpressive bit of consumerism and capitalism, to say the least :)Though I resisted buying anything, we did spend 3 or 4 hours wandering around the place so that must say something :)
Perfect!. 8 floors of goods! We entered it at 10:00 AM till it closed. Good Gourmand Department. A special discount of 5% is offered to tourists (you can take a card at information desk).

Very Impressive Futuristic Building. Just take the Skytrain and get off at Siam and there you are at Siam Paragon. It is definitely worth a look. The outdoor plaza is stunning at night time but any time is a good time to go. I have never bought anything there but enjoy eating in the food court. Great movie theater and IMAX.

Tourist Privilege card. Excellent shopping mall. You can buy anything you want, eat any food you want. Do not go in the evening as the place is very crowded. Order any food by 9PM. You will be charmed by smiling invitation from most of the food outlets but once it is 9:30PM, everybody of them will be unknown to you.Before shopping, just get a "tourist privilege card" just in front of the gourmet shop. This card will give you some discount not only in the Siam paragon but at the Emporium shopping mall situated just at Ekkamai MRT.

overpriced branded goods. There is a lot of stuff here but once you start looking you will notice that it is mostly overpriced branded items. Unlike shopping in the UK, you cannot return anything. So if you buy shoes for your wife and the fitting is not good, tough luck. Even if it is still completely unused and in its original packing, you will not be refunded. So the shopping experience her is quite unpleasant unlike in UK.

Center on everythings/ Nice Mall. This mall is located in/ surrounding of everythings nearby for tourists especially. There is the best cinema and aquarium ( with fee). Even most stores are pricey but you would get the best experience to visit and shopping there. Only bad thing is parking if you need, is always crowned. I like the most the bastment- food court area!

Best Food Court. I love the food court, many choices, many people, you need to ask your friend to guard the table and take turns to buy food, otherwise its hard to find place to seat. I always eat chicken rice in here.

Best Cinema experience ever. I would definitely advise this as a tourist travel experience.Impressive ,domed atrium foyer.Extensive choice of films ,either English,or Thai or Chinese with subtitles.Reclining seats with comfortbale seating.Remember to stand for the Thai National Anthem

A cool mall!. This was one of the better malls that I have seen. There is a number of name brand stores and restaurants here. An ice skating rink was on the top floor along with a wax museum. There was even an aquarium on the basement level. The stores were pricey here but I still had a great time wondering around in here.

Luxury. While my kids had fun at "Kidzania" I had fun at this huge shopping mall, I recommend strolling between the luxury car display, If you like books there is a giant store "Kinokuniya", also tons of shopping options, if you're tired of carrying your staff you can go down to the food floor and near the "Gourmet market" you can leave your bags there. I heard over the speakers that there is a hotel delivery for free to 10km radios if you buy for 2000 or 5000 Baht and more (sorry my hearing is not that good anymore).

Prices are steep!. We went here for Ocean World. The mall seems to be a luxury mall. Food Court is one of a kind! One thing i noticed is that the commercial restos prices like KFC are not the same with other KFCs located in other places. It seems that it's higher than other KFCs. Otherwise this place is worth the visit.

Prices are very expensive, even by US standards. We came here our last 3 days of bangkok trying to go to every mall in the area which is impossible, as each and every mall is massive and you get tired just walking from one end to the other. Siam Paragon is no exception, as it is huge! Food court is very impressive with many things to delight the eyes and stomach. Prices for clothes, shoes, and other brand name items were more expensive than what you pay for in the states. Was not going to purchase any, but they had lamborghinis, rolls Royce, and other high end cars on display. I really wondered who shopped here or bought stuff? Because most working Thai wages aren't that much, and even for us, it was very pricey. Pleasant place to walk around on a hot day though

New and Grand Shopping Mall. Is located at the Siam BTS station, a large and new shopping mall with major branded outlets inside it. Should pay a visit if you are looking higher end products to shop in Bangkok.
Great place . Love this place for shopping and coffee . I.bought brand jean grom lee . Is reonabl price and good quality . Feel cool and relax .

Great place for wandering around. This is such a nice place to visit in Bangkok. There are many restaurants, coffee shops and shops here; however, the price is quite expensive for restricted budget. One thing I like about it because it has the victoria's secret shop inside :)!

What a great day out.. After being deprived of decent shopping in our last country of residence, Siam Paragon came through in a big way. All the major brands, great restaurants and an Aquarium to add a little education to the experience. If you like shopping, this is a must.

Caffe' Chicco D'oro. Came upon this fabulous machine with gold outlet. The shop is decorated with coffee beans simulated the words of its Swiss brand.
In a mechanical design standpoint, the machine has smooth outlook, and with one strong enough handle which allows portable mission to anywhere to meet coffee-holic people demand!
Great place to hang out. This place is the center of everything. Many events are taken place here since there are many people visiting for food and shopping. But it is expensive.

Yep, it's a mall - another Bangkok mall. Let the hi-so's have their fun - this upscale mall will make you think twice about how much stuff costs or send your head into a converting frenzy. It's pleasant, upscale, and first-world, so it's hard to complain about facilities. It's great for when you need a break from the humidity and heat outside - that said, you didn't come to Bangkok to visit the malls, did you?

Very posh, and they have their own Lambo shop. Got dragged here by the GF, but as I did not need another Lamborghini or genuine Armani suits, I really did not find much of interest. This mall is aiming for the high end customers, but also has some normal priced shops as H&M, Mango, Zara etc. I actually liked the "department store" area with Diesel, Lee, Quicksilver shops etc.

Second largest mall in Bangkok. Mall is was nice to look around in. High class fashion and shopping with luxury cars to see. Lots of food to choose from. Various items to choose from. I purchase a Steve Madden high he sandal. The IMAX theater was really huge, clean and comfortable.

Siam Paragon offers fantastic shopping at reasonable prices!. Siam Paragon appears at first to be a huge, modern but High End Shopping Centre. After you scratch the surface you can find a great variety and some great shopping at good prices. There's a large department store, offering good discounts on most goods, clothing, shoes, handbags etc. A few boutiques at reasonable prices and some really good food outlets. Very close to the sky train so not far to carry your shopping.
Cool mall to visit. This is the largest mall in the world. You can find items ranging from a sweater to a luxury car. Great place to get out of the heat and indoors.

Great mall! Won't disappoint!. We hung out at Siam Paragon a lot. You can eat a cheap good meal at the food court then go off on a shopping spree at the mall. They have everything from upscale designer wear to normal outlets like mango, Zara and H & M. They have a departmental store at the ground floor as well which proved very convenient for us. At the end of the day after you are done eating and shopping there is always the Cinema which is on the top floor.

One of its kind. Siam Paragon is a massive upscale shopping mall, having all leading brand stores, Dior, Chanel, YLS, Gucci, you name it they have it. So do not expect bargain or any sort of negotiation on prices. Mall is very trendy , and if you have missed Madamme Tussauds of London then here you have the chance to visit. Ocean world is also in the mall, but Ocean mall ticket is over priced. Its better to take a combo ticket if needed, but mind it these other attractions in the mall are a bit pricey.

Concert at the Royal Paragon Hall. We went for Nantida Concert The Show Must Go On, on 12 July 2014. I think the venue is central and well located, with easy access to public transport. The crowd control was reasonable. Espeically at the end of concert, where large crowd were guided through the exit without much of a fuss. The number of security staff present were helpful in making the exit orderly, without stampede.
Shop till you drop. This would have to the one of the best shopping areas I have been in.You can quite easily spend a full day here and not see everything.

High end isn't the word. Great place . By far better than most western malls , if you want to escape Bangkok heat or dinner or shopping at night it's amazing. Great food market and hall in basement . Aston Martin shop, Bentley shop , sunseeker boat shop . Best movie theatre you will ever visit , you will be baffled by diamond , VIP, first class options , well worth experiencing ( I know you don't go on holiday to see a movie, just trust me ).
shopping in Bangkok. HUGE shopping complex - with variety of upmarket shops. Located right next to the Siam train station which makes it very easy to get to from anywhere in Bangkok.

Standard Western Mall. This Mall does have all the designer brands & cool stores from Zara to H&M. I personally don't travel to Thailand to shop at these kinds of places because they are everywhere at home in the US & in Europe. But if you need to pick up some Western brands then this is the place to go.

The BEST Shopping Complex in BANGKOK. You can find everything here... Chanel, Hermes, Prada, and too many luxury brands. And the food is great also! Recommended Thai restaurant at 4th floor, Food Passage zone, Leam-Charoeng seafood... Yum-yum :)

Siam paragon. Easy to access to get there . It is beautiful and amazing mall. But only for rich people because all is available from the world famous brands to local brands .. I was really happy to be there and recommend to all , should not miss there while in Bangkok

Lovely memories. Siam Paragon as a mall is just like any other trendy, modern, glitzy mall along the likes u may have seen in other cities. So what made our trip really memorable is the Ocean World housed in the mall where we had a fantastic time. The Madam Tussaud was another attraction and we closed off the tour with a miniature Porsche model from the car show room in the mall. That made my son's day !

Best shopping mall in the world? Yes maybe. You can find all you need and things you never seen before, watch up for the prices, something's can be more expensive than outside Thailand but other things can be cheaper even at the brand shops, during July and August there is summer promotions with many discounts given on brands and others, good time to buy the new watch I wanted

Large modern shopping centre with a surprise. Siam Paragon is a large modern shopping centre with the usual shops etc, bus has a surprise in the basement. On the lower level is the Siam Ocean World, an attraction that houses a marine attraction as well as other wild life. This includes a walk through under water tube so you can view sharks, sting rays and may other sea creatures. There are also animals, such as reptiles. The price is a little high, but worth it.

Fabulous Shopping Mall. My main reason for going here whenever I am in Bangkok is to visit Kinokuniya as I am a bibliophile and this outlet is the best in Thailand (they have a smaller store in Emporium). I can happily browse the shelves, but I always carry a list of wants and the staff are superb. I give them my list, they check the computer and then happily go off and collect up my books for me... all with a happy smile. Also, if we are with our grandchildren we are dragged into Underwater World for yet the umpteenth time (I sure I should have a season ticket) and then up to the cinema again. There is a great food court with a wide variety of foods available and the food hall is one of the best there is. If you are an automobile fan there are showrooms for a vast range of makes including some of the more exotic ones. Practically every name in fashion and design is present here as well. Lose yourself for a day here and dream.

Mall 100% recommended. I've been in Japan, England, USA, Israel, Australia, Argentina, Mexico, Panama and other places that I do no remeber at the moment but I can tell you that I have never been in a mall so classy and nice as this one. The prices are are really god for the mall status and the athmosphera is excellent.Additinaly, It has an excellente acquarium inside.I strongly recommend going to this mall and visiting as well the malls around the area. There are so many options in everything in the area!!

Luxury mall. Great little escape from the hustle and bustle of markets and tourists in BKK. It's quite a high end designer mall, and even if you're not into that kind of thing - still a nice place to cool down. :) I would recommend getting some delicious macaroons on the ground floor and thai iced tea.

Good experience. I arrived in Thailand on my own at 7am and my friends were arriving at the hostel we had booked later that evening so I had some time to kill. I asked about shopping at the airport and they pointed me in the area of Siam where the Paragon, Siam Centre is and MBK is nearby. I got off the BTS at Siam after the interchange at Phaya Thai from the airport and proceeded to walk around the Siam Paragon. When walking around my jaw was dragging along the floor for most of time as I saw a TV show being filmed there, found there were 3 floors to this thing which I didn't manage to explore. There was an aquarium, cinema and to my amazement in the middle of it all was an area of car showrooms on the 2nd or 3rd floor. Most of the shops in there were high end shops like Adidas, and several other branded shops. It is a great place to stay cool and you have to experience the food court on the lower floors. All in all it is a great place, but slightly expensive for my budget travelling as a backpacker. Killed some time though.
Classy mall with good food court. A centrally located shopping mall with huge food court in the basement .. Brand stores throughout the centre but not the place you seek for any good bargains.

WOW. Got to be the best shopping mall I have ever visited6 floors of luxury, including great cinema, and the food hall in the lower ground flooris just so amazing, for choice and qualityIf you are ever in Bangkok, you must visit here !!

Impressive. A mammoth shopping centre, with cinema's, ice skating rink, Imax, aquarium and amazing shopping to be had, it was a very impressive experience. It can become a bit disorientating, so not bad idea to get oriented with a map, or stop at one of the many information desks. There are many convenient Tax Refund desks to organise your tax invoice. Tourists can apply for a Tourist card at any information counter which gives a small discount at various stores

Amazing shopping and food court. Even if you don't have a lot of money to spend shopping it's worth visiting just food court which is the absolute highlight. Shopping is mainly luxury brands but the paragon department store has something for all budgets. Good place to escape a hot afternoon and great baby changing facilities.

Shopping. It's the best place in Bangkok to make shopping,you'll enjoy to walk inside this great mall and buy from the too many shops there or eat in the ground floor we have good time there but be careful you are going to spend lots of money for shopping
Huge... A huge mall where you can buy really everything. Food area is also big. And of course there area many people. But nice to experience it and visit it at least once.

Shopping Haven in Bangkok. It has been ages since I was in Bangkok. In my recent trip back to Bangkok, the 4 days that I was there, I would say, I spend about 1 full day there. It has the branded stuff there, like LV, Cartier, Armani, and etc. But you will not feel that this is the place for the rich and famous only, as they have other brands in them that do not burn a hole in your pocket. Mainly lifestyle items, from ladies boutiques, men boutiques, cafes and many others. They even have an entire floor (Level 4 if didnt remember wrongly) catered to the electronic items, gadgets and its peripherals. They also have a huge commercial gym there too.They also have on the basement 1 level, an entire level specially dedicated to F&B. So you have tons of options to choose from should you feel hungry for a meal or just seat down for a drink.At Basement 2 level, it is an entire level dedicated to a marine/ocean themed exhibition, like some sort of ocean aquarium. My family and I didn't go in, so can't share much about that. The place is huge, if it is the first time there, you may feel a little lost. You just need to get your bearings right, then you are pretty safe. It is also right next to the BTS Station. And beside it there is another 2-3 shopping malls that are connected with sheltered walkways. In fact, it is also near to the famous MBK Centre. Though it seems to be about 1 BTS Station away, you can actually walked from one to the other, 95% sheltered.So in fact you can just spend 2 full days or so just to shop among all the shopping centres.Definitely a shopping haven in this area.

Best shopping experience. One of best shopping complex in the world. All branded, various types of products you can find in siam paragon. Also best cinema experience can get with paragon cinema complex. . Don't forget to visit to this amazing place when you are in Bangkok.

Grand Mall. This is definitely a Grand and High-end Shopping place.The mall has over the years become grander in itself. I have been coming to this place since 2008 and it has always got something new to offer.The food court on ground floor has matured extremely well and has a host of opportunities.The shops are huge and offer a complete branded experience.It is a place to spend beyond any doubt.

It has it All. What mall offers luxury cars and exotics for shopping in a mall. Rolls Royce, Porsche, Lamborghini, Maserati, Lotus, BMW, Jaguar, as the 2nd floor of Siam Paragon, High End, High Class, and Shopping. Audio high end international equipment also on 2nd floor.Designer clothiers and all the best can be found here, from food to eat and the best food selections to take home in Thailand. Service and luxury from storing your groceries to pickup later with service to your taxi, auto, or BTS. Entertainment from aquarium to IMAX.What is not to like. The #1 mall in Thailand.

A high end mall.. If you want to shop for signature cloths and other branded thing then dont miss this mall. We visited the place last May 2014 just for window shopping and to experience a classy feeling. We tried the foods and we love it.

Don't miss the food hall. The Paragon is yet another department store in shiny mall full of shops you see everywhere but the food hall is fantastic. I love wandering around there. They have about 20 different varieties of rice and lots of good fresh fruit and vegetables as well as food from all around the world. They also have a reasonable wine shop. There is also lots of places to eat in the complex and heaps of shops

High end mall. I went to this mall every single day i was in Bangkok since it was near our hotel (Ibis Siam). It has a lot of branded high end stores such as Prada, Miu miu, Balenciaga, Tods, and more. On the (if i remember correctly) 2nd and 3rd floor are some of the high end automobile brands such as BMW, Maserati and more. Basically this mall has everything from high end automobile, high end bags, clothes, restaurants and supermarket. Their supermarket is awesome since it carries not only local products, but also international goods. And it is accessible via bts siam station.

Everything Under One Roof. This mall is large and has everything, from a very well stocked supermarket which has all the imported and local foods, to a multi-plex cinema, a Kidzania and even a good sized aquarium.

classy but only for those who really want to spend big. we had an expectation of discounted top brands but frankly nothing tempted us. some markdowns proved to be misleading when compared with other shops. actually quite dispiriting as there was hardly anyone there, and the sales assistants looked forlorn. very smart and lovely, cool place to hide but didn't hold us there for long.

Don't take your lady...... One of the biggest Malls in Bangkok and I guess there is nothing you can't buy here (fancy a Lamborghini?!?). Lots of stores including all luxury brands of the world. Try the food area - wonderful.

Mall Welcome but Price Unwelcome. A big central mall in heart of City; Located in Central Station; 6 Story floosr for High End people who mostly rich. Brand name Logo clothes/ jewellry/ luxury car station / theatre / amphitheatre. Local mostly came shopping here only when shop owner do Grand sale promotion; Great places for get away from heat outside/ International food taste / Bookshop Lingering / Indoor fitness spot /film entertaining.

Spent the whole day here.... All the brand names are here and plenty of classy restaurants if you're not up to having local/vendor type food (which I also love by the way). Get your credit card handy! A pretty cool and hip mall to hang out in.

Ridiculously Overpriced forget shopping here. Okay if you are a millionaire then eat your heart out cause the range here is enormous and every brand you can imagine is in this shopping centre (there is even a Lamborghini dealership in here!!) but the price is RIDICULOUS you will find much better value in Europe or the US or Singapore or Hong Kong then here on the equivalent items. Forget it unless you are rich would be my recommendation.
center located mall. located at the heart of bangkok, you can find almost everything here. The food court is abit small, and pricey.
Everything you need is here. Almost all brands you want to shop is hereFrom department stores to high end brands, they got it all covered.Great place to shop and dine.

The Best Mall and Location in Bangkok. While there are many malls in Bangkok, Siam Paragon is #1 on the list to visit when in Bangkok for shopping. While it is known for high end authentic brand name shops, it offers plenty for people of all budgets, nationalities and age groups. Families with children can find plenty to do here. On the ground level there is Siam Ocean World which is a very famous aquarium with plenty to look at and some additional activities available too. There is also a 5D theatre right next to it. On the fifth floor is Kidzania. This is for age groups 4-15 years old. It allows kids to roll play in various dream jobs such as working as a dentist, staffing a Boeing-777, saving a building from fire with real water and so much more. There are 80 different jobs and is something for all ages 4 and up to be seen here. The mall also has a Game Zone arcade too.Food is another main attraction of Siam Paragon. On the bottom level the food court called Food Hall which uses a coupon system is excellent. Here you load up a prepaid card that can be used for purchases. When finished you take the card back to redeem the remainder for cash. Vegans and vegetarians take note that Food Hall has excellent Vegan food with 10-15 different dishes to choose from. It however is mostly mock-meat dishes and looks so authentic, you probably will be forced to ask the staff to confirm it is all vegetarian, and yes it not only is it vegetarian but it is all vegan friendly too. Just look for the sign that says vegetarian. That is one particular stand of Food Hall. Meat eaters will find tons of options here too.There is of course much more than just the food hall. All your international fast food chains can be found here such as Starbucks, McDonald's, KFC, Häagen-Dazs, Swensen's Ice Cream, Fuji Japanese etc. There are other delicious shops for Italian, Thai food, is a Fish Café branch which is one of the most popular Fish and Chips chains in the area and so much more. If you like higher end dining this can be found here too for most all tastes. Thai, Italian, Japanese, Indian food, you name it and you’ll find it here.As for the shopping, featured is authentic shops of the major high-end brand names Gucci, Versace, Louis Vuitton, Giorgio Armani, Coach, Bvlgari, Fendi, Jimmy Choo and literally dozens more.You can even purchase a luxury car right at Siam Paragon. There are showrooms that include Lamborghini, Bentley, Porsche, Jaguar, BMW and other high end vehicles.Despite all the luxury, there is still plenty of shopping for those with mortal incomes, with local stores selling a mix of generic and brand name clothing and other merchandise.All in all, when traveling to Bangkok basing yourself as close to Siam Paragon as possible is very ideal. This is right across from Siam Discovery Zone which has other attractions including Madame Tussauds wax museum. It is also in walking distance to Central World which has additional shopping and food opportunities and other things for children such as coin operated rides, an arcade and a play section with slides. In the other direction it is a fairly easy walk to Platinum Fashion Mall too. Outside shopping can be found right in the area here called Siam Square too. There is a BTS right here, so it is easy to get around other areas of Bangkok and this is also one of the easier places to grab a taxi too.The hotels I’ve stayed at that are in walking distance to Siam Paragon include Novotel on Siam Square, Centara Grand at Central World on my more recent stay in June (great 26th floor pool here), and for a bit longer walk more of a great value budget option Evergreen Place. For that one, while walkable, you might be tempted to just take a BTS ride at the Ratchathewi Station which Evergreen is right next to. There are a few others in the area in walking distance too, and again this area is a great place to be based in Bangkok, with Siam Paragon being the highlight of it.

Heaven for Shopper. This is one of the biggest shopping in Thailand. You can find all brand name in this shopping mall. Varieties of restaurant in the underground floor. Mall is easy to reach by BTS Siam station.

good brands shopping.
