I was taken here by a friend of mine for a look around after going to the MBK center, this is a great place to get anything that is a branded product, they have a lot of stores all selling genuine branded products from many different manufacturers, what stood out for me was that they have an amazing perfume, cologne and makeup area with lots of attentive staff, try out all the new fragrances and no doubt grab a bargain with the tourist discount and VAT refund scheme that is available to all tourists (remember to take your passport). The food court and eating area was full of many different selections which made it hard to choose what we wanted, however we decided on an Indian restaurant which we were not disappointed in.

Wonderful shopping mall for brand items!. If you want buy brand items at one shop stop, this shopping mall can fulfill your expectations! The foodcourt is a great place to dine, there are varieties of food, you probably will have difficulties in making decisions!

convenient shopping mall. It is a central shopping mall, really convenient to travel to. You can catch the Sky Train to this Siam Paragon as there's a direct bridge to the mall. The next to the shopping mall, there's a space where host a big events quite often too.Many new nice shops and restaurants are opened here.The area is near to Siam; the center of shopping and fashions. Recommend to walk around first because there're several nice restaurants there, really.

High end shopping. Be here if you want to have high end shopping. The prices of things are not cheap here, and one will more likely end up on the streets stalls that offer more exciting things at at much lower price.The food court is great and offer a good selection of food.

Good place to spend lots of money. Siam Paragon look great, many fancy shops with a pricetag that would bankrupt me pretty fast, but is nice to just go around and look.There are some shops that are affordable for us mortals, but for the most part I went around looking at cool stuff. Thecoolest part for me would be the floor with the car shops, looking at Lamborghinis, Porches, Rolls Roys and so on made the motorhead in me weap of joy.Well worth a visit for everyone
One of the best shopping mall. Best for branded stuff. you get good pricing with lots of varieties I loved shopping here its branded and nice.

Shopping mecca. Siam Paragon is a fantastic high end shopping mall. All the designer brands are represented in a very classy environment. Fantastic food court with just about every dining option covered. Skytrain at the door so getting there is not a problem.

SIAM PARAGON..Elegant Mall. Siam Paragon is huge, you could wander here to kill time, Window shopping all the designer shops, luxury cars on display or eating in the amazing food court full of delicious food.Siam Paragon is amazing. There are 400+ stores where you can find almost anything(very expensive items)

Siam Paragon Mall, Bangkok, Thailand. Siam Paragon was the number 1 place in the world for "selfie" photographs in 2013. I am not much of a mall person but Siam Paragon is amazing. There are 400+ stores where you can find almost anything imaginable. Albeit, some very expensive like a Rolls Royce or Lotus Sports Car. The food court and super market represent foods from all over the world. The Cineplex on the top level is world class and includes a huge IMAX theater. People watching is one of my favorite past times and it is incredible here. During the Christmas and New Year Season there is always extraordinary decorations in the open spaces outside the entrance and often live entertainment. During the hottest times, the mall air conditioning is an oasis in the desert, so to speak. Easy on and off the BTS (sky train). A great place to visit even if you don't like malls.

You could spend all day here. Siam Paragon is huge, you could wander here all day, window shopping all the designer shops, oggling at the luxury cars on display or eating in the amazing food court so full of delicious food you wont know where to start. Worth a visit even if you just want to get out of the heat for a while and enjoy the airconditioning, but you will love it.

Elegant mall in the center of Bangkok. There are 3 major parts of this mall. The first one is modernized big movies theatres,equipped with quality sound and large screens. Even 4D and Huge screen iMax theatre are also existed. Secondly,there are many luxurious brand-name shops and well-known restaurants,both locals and imports. Lastly,Food courts of so many various and international kinds and of foods. You could see the food court,being very crowded with thai and foreigners all day long.

The Best Place In Bkk !!!!. Its the best food court in bangkok and best for shopping and hanging around...its got bowling and a cinema too...probably the Best Crowd of bkk comes there too and its crazy on weekends...dont miss the queue in krispy kreme for doughnuts !!!

Shopping paradise. This is a great place to visit especially if you're with your family. This mall has something for each of my family members, from kids to adults. They have a great food court. You could spend all day there

Shopping Mania. This is a high end shopping mall, you will find all brand name goods, leather, good food all THAI Western, Chinese, etc. and many restaurant, located at central area of Bangkok near by another shopping mall connected by sky walk.

Top brands top buys. If you are looking for top brands and top buys, here is the place you can shop almost every high end dresses, bags and accessories. All European top brands can be purchased here, however, at very huge crowd of the shopping center you will ever shop. Needless to say, Siam Paragon is always top 10 instagram photos, So make sure you take one and share one.. because the decorations and buildings are quite lovely for that.

A shopping mall with their own BTS station. Siam paragon is a shopping mall with - high-end brands- supermarket - convention (event) hall- cinemas - bowling - vendors - an aquarium- franchises and food courtFor me, what make this place interesting to go is they have a BTS stop almost park into their building.It is comfy, i don't need to find where and how their parking lot is.If you can handle the crowded, the baby screaming and have no idea where to waste your time and money, it is one of the shopping malls to go.Avoid going on Saturday and Sunday for your own peace of ears.

Luxury and variety. Good for shopping and for eating too. All brandname, chanel,LV,Tods, Patekk Philippe,. Food to eat from Thai to International. Many price ranging from buying coupon to sitting down in famous restaurant. This is the best department store in Thailand. Charming. You can shop until you drop. Also , many closed by departyment store such as Siam Discovery Center is so cool!!
This the place to go for the finest in quality. This is the most upscale mall in Thailand. They have a complete selection of the most upscale retailers throughout the world here.

Matches the high end malls in largest U.S. cities. I'm not much of a "mall shopper", whether in the U.S. or elsewhere. This is a high-end mall, lots of variety and luxury brands. Clean throughout, easy to walk around without bumping into people, clean restrooms. Have purchased a couple of items from this mall that I could not find at King Power Duty Free.

The Ultimate 5 Star Mall. It doesn't get much better than Siam Paragon in terms high end luxury stores and by far the best food hall of any place in the world I have ever visited. This mall is so high end I couldn't believe my eyes when I saw a Rolls Royce and Maserati dealership in the mall! I think they were located on the 3rd floor and in all of my years of global travel, I have never seen a car dealer let alone a Rolls Royce and Maserati showroom on the 3rd floor of a shopping mall.The food hall is immaculately clean and hygienic and is much higher standards than many place around the world. The choice of foods is amazing, the quality is fantastic and the prices are very cheap especially the local food choices of various noodles, soups and Thai dishes.If you are looking for a very high end mall with an amazing food court, please do not miss visiting Siam Paragon.
to much. I never sam so many quality shops in one street. the hottest, but also very expencive shops of Thailand all grouped in one mall.

it has everything!. We visited Siam Paragon for a few hours during our recent trip to Bangkok. We were able to eat a lovely Thai meal when we first arrived on the ground floor food court. Then we browsed a huge range of shops. There are all kinds of shops from the extremely high end e.g. Hermes to the cheapest high street stores, e.g. H&M. It really had something for everyone. It is also a lovely spacious shopping centre that is a great design and is enjoyable to walk around! I would definitely recommend shopping here.

Gourmet/high-end experience - even if its just window shopping. This is one of the more high end shopping centres in Bangkok - the mezzanine level is their luxury brands level, with everything from Chanel to Longchamp. The higher you go, the less pricey the store offerings are. The top level has a cineplex, which we attempted to buy tickets to see a movie but we simply got too confused by the structure of several different cinemas, ticketing system and prices, and the automated touch screen buying processes. Even if you just wonder around to window shop in the Paragon, it is well worth the visit. There are luxury cars in display within the centre (think BMW, Porsche, Lamborghini) as part of the store Niche Cars. Must go experience, even just for the cars on display in the centre.
Spend a day here. We spend a whole day, because Siam Paragon has everything. Best food, best shops, even car dealerships. It's gets busy, but never too busy for us.
Great Shopping experience!. really high end shops and has a really good food court with loads of swanky eateries. mainly trendy Thai students there but really worth a visit!

Food Court and Gourmet Market. The food court at the ground floor sells good Thai food and international food for normal prices (take the number of locals, also students, who flock there at the end of the day as a testament).If you're wary about real street food, the food court here serves Thai street food in a non-street setting. Atmosphere aside, this was a culinary delight.

Exclusive oasis in the Bangkok jungle. A visit to the Paragon is already worth to escape the hectics of Bangkok for a while and enjoy the Airconditioned exclusivety of stores of all the big brands... even a showroom of Maserati can be found...It can be easely reached by boths sktrainlines (Get out at Siam)However we dit not find the spectacle and attractions that we've seen in for instance Dubai Mall.Also the foodcourts were not as good as we've experienced in Singapore.
Nothing Special. Just like another shopping mall that you can find in your country's capital city. Reminds me of Grand Indonesia at Jakarta.

how can you miss this?. you can basically find everything under one roof here.plenty of GOOD food. do not miss the paragon department store and you can find plenty of international brands not found anywhere else in BKK.supermarket is BIG plus!

Cool (aircon), modern, clean, and good food. The two features worth visiting are the high level Cineplex with many screens including good value luxury ones and 3D screens, and the basement food mall. I wouldn't touch the overpriced aquarium nor the pricey fashion stores. There's a large bookstore half way up with an enormous english language selection, and also some tech stores useful for stocking up on Apple accessories, but the Food Mall is the best.Indian, Japanese, Korean, New Zealand, Chinese, Taiwanese, Vietnamese, western - an endless variety of food from stalls or restaurants. Some are so popular they have queues in the evening. The atmosphere is a little soulless, and the prices halfway to western, but I have enjoyed some good food and drink - at Mosburger, Royal Tandoori, the bread shops, the toast shop, the NZ icecream parlour, Krispy kreme donuts, etc. The typical fast food joints are here too but go for more interesting fare.There's a gourmet supermarket at the end too. All a convenient step away from the BTS Siam Square, and plenty of parking available. It's not real Bangkok but a useful respite from the heat and crowds outside.

Another Shopping archade..... Not really interesting. quite old fashioned not and interesting decor either. you would find all the brands that you would find in your country so why you want to have additional luggage back home with same stuff?? rather try something new.But one thing is interesting is the live shows happening outside the mall in evening. its good to see when in lights...
Much better than MBK. Quite trendy and spacious. Tons of seating but definitely more expensive.There are some great little cafes and department store shopping

Excellent food court. Extensive food selection at the food court- amazing local dishes and also western style food. Deserts were wonderful- too many to choose from. Shopping is great even though it is a bit on the more expensive side of things.

Boring mall. looks old.. Not fantastic and got bored really quickly. There were three complexes linked together so we could view the other associated malls to kill time. There are some dainty cafes within. Foodcourt was expensive and yucky. Prefer Terminal 21.

best mall. this is definitely one of the best malls i've ever been in. it has a ton of stores a lot of new things and great products. i blew a ton of cash on body stuff and spa things, i am still working thought all of my lotions, potions, creams n shower gels. all made in thailand and all natural, very cool n highly recommended!

Amazing Selection of First Class merchants. Living in BKK for three years, I consider Siam Paragon the top Farang Shopping Center for high class merchants. An amazing array of world class merchants covering clothing, jewelry, watches, electronics, and vehicles. Even if you are not in the market for anything, the offerings, sights, and people are an entertaining afternoon.

One of the best!!!. This is one of the best malls I have ever seen...it has all the brands and lots of food to eat...desert place is a must try...one day is not enough to finish this mall... I stayed in bangkok for 5 days and I went for all the 5 days at least for a while...one of the best places in bangkok

Excellent food court! (also they have a CINNABON here!!). I am not going to write a review about the shopping, because I didnt really shop here.The food court however, is another story. They have it all! from a variety of traditional asian outlets, to the the western fast food ones, the best coffee shops, speciality dessert cafes and of course Cinnabon.whatever you feel like eating if you're in sukhumvit, just turn up here and you wont be dissapointed.

If You're Into Shopping, Here it is!. The first time I visited Bangkok in 2001, I stayed on the site of what is now this monstrous mall, at the Siam Intercontinental, an oasis in the city! I read, at the time, that this mall was coming. Now I see it for real in December 2013. I'm not a great shopper so this doesn't appeal to me. But it seems to appeal to everyone else in Bangkok! The only thing I did like was the immense food hall in the basement; such a huge variety of food from all over and Siam Paragon is certainly worth visiting, if only for this.

Not your dream cheap shopping in Bangkok. Everybody has this hype about cheap shopping and buying clothes in Bangkok. Well, guess what guys, Siam Paragon is not that place. But if you wanna have a fantastic time walking around in the AC with fine dining and excellent brand name goods, then this is the right place to hit on your list. This place got just about everything. If you are seeking a romantic dinner with wife or girlfriend, this can also be the place in ground floor by the Japanese style pond and garden. They have some of the finest and posh international restaurants down there.

Luxury Brands and Clean Food. This was the last mall that we had in our list. This one is for the brand conscious only . You have all the Louis Vuitton to Gucci .. Maserati to Rolls Royce . Sony and Samsung have their flagship store here , bought a blu ray player here as I was wary of the other shops after burning my fingers at Pantip Plaza. The food court is very neatly laid out and you are spoilt for choices . The 6th floor is the cineplex. You have the IMAX and the full bed theater and a few other luxurious seated screens . A must go if you guys have time . This place is not for the value shopper . Only brand conscious can enjoy here . We wanted to shop at Louis Vuitton , but did not as they wanted us to stand in a queue to enter the shop . It was ridiculous . Keep this mall as the last place you visit , if value shopping is in your mind .

Not as good as Central plaza.. It is big and clean but a bit over crowded. The biggest problem is that it is not easy to navigate ( like central plaza) and some areas are not accessible by all elevators. For example we had to take a big detour in order to get to kidzania. If you go there spend a moment to understand where you are and where to go or you'll spend a lot of time for walking back and forth.

Excellent Variety in Upscale Shopping. Siam Paragon Shopping Center offers excellent shopping for upscale merchandise, and a great variety of eating choices, from their food court, to fast food options, to fine dining. Most premium brands have a shop in Paragon, including Gucci, Fendi, etc. The department store also has a great variety, often for more moderate prices. The Kinokunya Bookstore is quite large and offers a books and magazines of all types. Asia Books is another good book choice. If you can't find what you want, Paragon is located near other shopping venues which may have that special item on your list. Shop until you drop!

fantastic food galore. Food & food & more food!We spent our last afternoon here after popping by Platinum mall ealier in the morning.In the food court there's this giant fish tank which is quite impressive…let's skip this & go to food.Prices here are not cheap, but the flavor is good. We ordered the Thai style kwai chap which is really good. tender bits & fragrant gravy.. sweet!But what impress us most is the food corner next to the food court. Arrays & arrays of snacks! There are so many that we don't know what to try & buy!Thai pancakes with crispy skin & savory /sweet fillings. Meat skewers & thai sausages. Thai sweet & desserts, doughnuts & what have you.can just go on & onGo there & experience it yourselves man! Just thinking of it makes my mouth waters all over again!

Foodies food hall!!!. I love love LOVE this mall!!! The foodhall on ground floor is a goodies heaven. It's reasonably priced. Extremely clean. And the variety of options leaves u feeling dumbfounded and drooling!!! We ordered small dishes from a variety of eateries here to try out a selection of different foods. It's so clean despite the numerous small restaurants and fast food joints. The gourmet supermarket is remarkable!!! I could spend hours walking around the stalls and aisles. It's fascinating!!! The fresh food is laid out beautifully and wrapped up so perfectly. It's 1000 times better than the Harrods foodhall! The designer stores are boring. I spent all my time in the food area. And loved it. A must!!!

Upscale with character and variety. I'd normally sneer if I heard people exclaiming about a shopping mall - any shopping mall, especially in a foreign country. Why spend your time indoors while you can be people watching, experiencing new culinary delights, exotic landscapes, studying the culture...? But then I was introduced to Paragon Mall. I can do without the Gucci, etc (you can see that anywhere else in the world if that's your thing), but the ground floor Gourmet supermarket where I restore my supplies of Thai ingredients on each visit is amazing - as is the entire food court. Spotless, colorful, billiantly aesthetic it's a photographer's paradise. Close by, in the long lobby, you can find the Harnns soaps, aromatic oils and frangrances and creams - uniquely Thai, top quality cosmetics by any standard (I'm afraid I'm hopelessly hooked). Don't miss out on the endless selection of clothes at Paragon department store (especially undergarments) - good quality and reasonabe prices. Shopping here becomes a special EXPERIENCE...!

Five worthy stars. You could spend the day here easily. A huge upmarket Mall that is spotlessly clean with lovely indoor water features. It has everything here from furnishings & electronics (4th level), the ground level is a dedicated foodie paradise. One thing to note if you go into the gourmet wine shop & want to buy you must do this before 2pm or after 5pm. There are no sales between these times, just browsing.The other floors (M, 1,2,3) are fashion and some very high class fashion wateches and jewellery are represented here!Cinema is level 6. Suitable for all the family, good air con so a great escape from the hustle, bustle and heat.

Luxury all over and plenty of it!. From Prada to Gucci to Louis Vuitton, from Rolex to Cartier to Patek Philippe, from Porsche to Bentley to Rolls Royce and from fancy hiso food courts to fancy eateries and even an English Tea Time House...it is all here and spread over several floors and thousands of square meters of lavishly decorated retail space! Impressive and a must see and if one has the deep pockets a must buy!

Love this mall! ^_^. It's huge! Haha love it there. I like how they have an indoor fishpond where the coffee bean and tea leaf is located. ^_^ we went there around march and it was soooo hot in thailand -so you will really appreciate the aircondition in malls. Haha

A utopia for shopaholics. If you are brand conscious, this place would be perfect for you. Though not the biggest mall in Bangkok, it certainly is the grandest and has perhaps one of the best tenant mix. Be prepared to spend a good half day here because shopping is not the only draw. Food is big. Very big. In fact, almost a whole floor is dedicated to F&B and there are many other eateries scattered throughout the mall. You would be so spoiled for choice you wouldn't know where to begin. Seriously! Then there is the cinema, which is state of the art and most probably the best in town. In terms of accessibility, it too is perfect considering the Skytrain Siam stop is literally at its doorstep. As it is located along the "shopping belt", there are plenty of malls on either direction of Siam Paragon, all within minutes walking distance so this would be a good spot to start your day.Chris Lee
Shopaholic. everything you can find every brand here it was abit sad cos the pandora is so small that i almost couldnt find it and they don't have much collections

Must see!. One of the biggest shopping center in Asia. A must go place for shoperholics. their products provide many popular brand name to the most luxury. They also have restaurant and cafe shop for people enjoy after shopping time. The most delicious Thai red curry food.

Perfect place to kill your time.. I visited Siam Paragon when first I went to Thailand, I didn't know about it before, actually I was going to meet a friend a BTS Siam Square where when was supposed to pick me. When I got off the train I was encountering this fabulous modern architecture. That's when I decided to visit here when I had time. So one evening I took time and went inside. What a beautiful structure It is. You can do shopping, dinning, you can go to underwater world. I recommend everyone who is going to Bangkok must visit here.
Very Modern Centre. A more expensive higher end shopping centre. But it is the food court on the lower level which I enjoyed the most. A great choice of different restaurants and worth a visit.

Wow...it's perfect!. This is my first time to Bangkok and I arrived to Siam paragon first and I was like...Wow,am I in heaven?Because almost everything were there!Fashionable,designer's clothes,international foods,beauty products like M.A.C,Bobbi Brown and skins,high tech movie theatres,It mall and even Luxury Cars... :-o you can get whatever you want,well...if you have a lot of money:-D But peoples for who didn't crazy for nonsense price things and not greedy people ,it will be okay to go shopping at there.Its have everything that you hope for.it's one-stop shopping mall in bangkok.

Shopping and Culinary. Siam Paragon, located between another shopping mall. I drop here just to eat dinner at Foodhall after walk around. There's so many people come to this mall and eat. The foodhall was so crowded.

The best of everything!. Expensive brands, massive food court. This is the place you want to be if you have the money for it. If you have ever shopped in Australia, The Paragon department store is a lot like Myer or David Jones. A good place to get quality goods, within the comfort of air-conditioning.

What a mall. Despite a short stay of 4 nights in Bangkok, we somehow managed to visit Siam Paragon three times. One of these times was even during an 8 hour layover in Bangkok on our return back to the States. There are so many shops, from the most common all the way up to the most luxurious in the world. I especially loved the 3rd floor, which was reserved for luxury car stores. Rolls Royce, Lamborghini, Porsche, etc.

Rat infestation in food hall. Paragon Centre is amazing at face value. We went for meal in food court. A large rat ran from the kitchen into the seating area. the restaurant staff smiled. I was shocked. I complained to the restaurant staff. I requested money back. this was not given. I was told all food venues pay paragon monthly rent which covers pest control. Their restaurant is not the only one with rat problems. Planning a visit? Fine. Enjoy. Remember to look at the ceiling, or lack of it, it is a rat run. I have complained to Paragon Centre. I will not be doing business there again. Some may say that rats are part of the culture of Thailand. I agree, they are seemingly accepted in some areas. Surely they are not acceptable in this setting.

Very Nice!!. Wow, this beats any malls here in LA. Huge mall that has everything. Very nicely decorated. There is a section filled with artistic decorations. Alot of high end brands as well. This is probable the only mall in the world with a Panerai Boutique. Nice!! Afterward we went to visit my wife's favorite restaurant just outside the mall.

Shoppers paradise. A huge mall with a great selection to please all shoppers from high end designer brands (LV, Prada etc) to your more mainstream labels (H&M, Zara etc). And if you get hungry after all your shopping then theres a fantastic food hall again catering for all tastes and budget! Easily accessible by BTS. Heaps of people but big enough that it doesnt feel crowded. Pay a visit to the Paragon department store - it may look pricey but i grabbed a few bargains on label items (Nine West, Adidas, Speedo). If I had time to try mote stuff on (we arrived an hour before closing) I wouldve bought more as some of the Thai labels for ladies dresses (same floor as shoes, bags) were on sale at 50-80% off and saw some gorgeous looking dresses at only 990baht!!
eye max. love the experience we had at Eye max movie. It was our first experience which we can't get in sri lanka. cost they charged is very low compered to the satisfaction we got
Fancy place, easy to wonder around. Nice place in otherwise so crowded Bangkok. Mostly high-end boutiques but also several good restaurant and other activities.

Great mall to visit. The stores are great. Plenty of high class Brand Names from all over the world. Blah blah blah... What i really enjoyed was the food court. Plenty of fun stores to eat in and try. Went here twice during my stay in Bangkok.

Great food court. Siam Paragon is a quite interesting place where tourists can use clean bathrooms, rest with good working AC and eat different types of food. After several hours in the sun, the mall like this is great for deserved rest.
My favourite mall in. Bangkok!. Has everything I was looking for? even their Department Store is great! Food was awesome too! Also where Ocean world is, so very convenient :)

A WOW Mall. SIAM Paragon is quite simply breathtaking Take in the very large mall .. newly built, so spotlessly clean .. add high street fashion and accessories stores .. throw in a huge aquarium in the basement .. a grand food court .. an absolutely fabulous Gourmet Market .. and then add to that a skywalk access from the MRT ... conclusion .. incredible experience We visited in early January .. and the decorations inside and outside both took our breath away A MUST VISIT in Bangkok
Pretty excellent shopping....... Great shopping destination...So many attractions and awesome food court at the basement.Worth a few days of visits, if you are staying for a while

Expensive Designer All In One. Shopping-wise, it's a standard "high-brand" shopping mall, same kind you can find in most big cities. It has a sleek look with shiny floors and creamy colors, and about every designer store you could think of. If that's the kind of shopping you want, it's great. Personally, we found it simply expensive, providing nothing I could not buy at home for around the same price. We much preferred the Chatuchak weekend market or night markets, though I must say they had a really nice bookstore upstairs. However, the real reason you should go to Paragon is to go downstairs and visit their Ocean World for a magnificent aquarium.

Branded Stuff Mall. From luxury fashion to fast retail fashion. Not beautiful facade but inside is so good. you can find nearly the most popular brands such as Gucci and LV here... the price here is the same... the place is really cool and really nice to walk. Gourmet food court along with the regular Thai food.

Brands excellence. This is definitely one of the must stops for those looking for some of the best brands shopping. For some of the best and most famous world brands under one roof, look no further than Siam Paragon. If you want Jimmy Choo, Prada, LV, or any of the world fashion brands, then Siam Paragon is a must check on your list.

Ultimate in shopping malls. The Siam Paragon Mall is a must see while visiting Bangkok. High end designer stores, nice restaurants, wonderful cineplex and even a Rolls Royce dealership . It's fun to walk around to view the high end fashions and don't pass up a meal in the food court! I have never seen a food court like this one-it's like dining in a finer dining establishment. The displays in all the stores are unique and one of a kind. I especially liked the larger dept stores with a dedicated Thai section of goods. Also easy to get to by sky train.
Designer mall. One of the top malls in bangkok...good collection of most designer brands. Has the ocean world in the basement and a very nice food place in the ground floor

Shopping... shopping... shopping. This is a place to shop for branded stuff... you can find nearly the most popular brands such as Gucci and LV here... the price here is the same... the place is really cool and really nice to walk...

One of the most beautiful malls in the world. You can find almost everything here. From the most exclusive to the completely ordinary. And the shopping mall in itself is just beautiful to walk around in. A must in Bangkok for shopaholics.

Beautiful shopping centre. I've visited shopping centres around the world (also, my dad has either built or controlled many), & I think that this shopping centre is very classy! The food court looks high-end, but the food isn't expensive. There is also a large Gourmet Supermarket onsite. I would recommend that anyone who comes to Bangkok visits this centre!
Designer + luxury goods.. Foodcourt is great! A bit too many luxury shops, which in my opinion makes these malls a bit dull. Liked centalworld and Siam Centre better:)

A shopping mall. Nothing special about this mall, except it in the city center. It has most of the big brands store in it. Most imp that it has a sea world at its ground floor which is certainly nice if you are travelling with kids.
The best shopping mall in Bangkok. From luxury fashion to fast retail fashion, every store is large. Not beautiful facade but inside is so good. You can selfie with big bear, play and watch.

All the fabolous & glamorous brands from all around the world in one mall.. If you would like to see (or loaded enough to buy) the best quality and the most beautiful designer items about clothes, watches, jewelry, cars (!). Definitely worth a visit!

Very expensive time. Visiting this Mall in the heart go Bangkok suggests bargains ,bargains and more bargains,but alas No bargains to be found,very expensive,even Wifi costs you a drink,dissapointed to say the least,the Mall was however clean,with security at every door and every top named brand within the store,but not as I pictured this to be,loads of people within the Mall,but very little bags suggests no one hardly was buying the goods!

very big and beautiful. the Siam Paragon is a very big and beautifl shopping mall in Western style. on the lower level there are many restaurants with delicious food and a supermarket with a big range of goods. the shops in the upper levels are great. a shopping tour would be a great event, but most of the prices are the same as in Europe.

If you have to visit only one mall then let it be Siam Paragon. Pret brands along with luxury brands, gourmet food court along with the regular Thai food it does not get better than this. I loved their Gourmet food hall and all the restaurants there . Take a pick from world cuisine, you are spoilt for choice. The variety is mind boggling. The kids can enjoy the aquarium . It is massive so wear comfortable shoes.

Food Heaven. I went to Siam Paragon to have dinner almost every night I was in Bangkok, and its first floor is food heaven, full of restaurants and food stalls, its hard to choose where to eat sometimes, I enjoyed walking around trying to figure out which place I wanted to eat in, theres lots of different types of food to choose from, from fast food to Japanese food to coffee shops and desserts, and of course Thai food.
Nothing special. This is a really big shopping mall, but nothing special beyond that. The prices are high compared to other places but the food store was pretty nice.

Bring your money!. Siam Paragon is the epitome of Thai conspicuous consumption. If you not only want a shopping mall, but want it oozing ridiculous amounts of luxury, Siam Paragon is the place for you. Not only do you have your typical assembly of clothing shops, but you can also pop your head in the Lamborghini shop or the Rolls Royce shop (among other high-dollar autos), peruse the Rolex and Tiffany stores (if you can get past the guards), and if you're feeling particularly ambitious you can check out the Ducati kiosk (yes, you read that right). Take the SkyTrain to Siam Station, the mall is directly connected by skybridge to the station.

Shopper's Paradise. The shoppes/malls between Central Mall, Zen Department store and Siam Paragon are a shopper's paradise. Super high end, and super convenient. However, if you're not very small, you won't find clothing to fit, and if you're American (U.S.), there probably won't be much new or unique. However, it's good eye-shopping and kills a lot of time if you're a shopper. The metro walkway between the venues offers a convenience that actually makes the experience worthwhile. You'll be tired, but excited to see how much walking you've managed to do! Fun exercising!
Gorgeous shopping mall. It is a very beautiful shopping mall with some great stores but very expensive...worth a visit though

Family Friendly Mall. We certainly enjoyed our time in Siam Paragon. Great Selections of Restaurants, Excellent place for kids because of the Siam Ocean World and my daughters favorite place Kidzania. A place wherein you can just spend your whole day eating, shopping and family fun activities.
Shopping, shopping. This is a place where shopping and style make the whauu....combination. When tired you can recover your energy over a latte by the bookshop.

Everything for everybody. Modern, clean and great mall, where you can easily spend whole day. If you are tired of shopping, you can go to Madame Tussaud's etc. Expensive in Bangkok standards, but still I got brand clothes cheaper than in Finland. Car section is real eye candy for "petrol heads"

Beautiful shopping mall. It was wonderful. Clean, spacious and full of branded products. The car showrooms were awesome. Maserati, Porsche, BMW, Lamborghini, Rolls Royce and Aston Martin warrants a visit if you are in Bangkok. The cosmetics lounge in the ground floor is worth a look. Enjoyed and planning to visit again.

Simply Amazing Mall...bring your credit cards!!. Siam Paragon is a shopping mall in Bangkok, Thailand. It is one of the biggest shopping centres in Asia. I have been around the world and it is probably the highest end mall I have ever visited. Every designer label has a storefront. When we were there it was spectacularly decorated for Christmas. It's right on the subway and was only a couple of stops from our hotel. We didn't find any deals there BUT it was great window shopping and a place where you can find something for everyone. This place is not to be missed.

Would visit again. If u hapen to visit ocean world, spare a few hours to check the rest of this mall. Most noteworthy is the basement level full of food stalls and restaurants. Of course since its a mall u need to pay attention on the price, look for original thai brand that u won't see in ur country, but never miss a discount opportunity, got lucky with a few shirt at h & m for less than us$ 10

just like any other store but over priced. I visited Bangkok recently and got a chance to visit Siam Paragon department store to do some shopping for my family. Surprisingly, the place is highly over priced. Instead more expensive than the stores in USA also, not really worth the trip

A lot to see. We went to Ocean World here, which was really good, then on the 4th floor is a great shop called Exotique Thai, if you like hand made crafts, jewellery and clothing etc, this is a great shop. Not cheap, but good quality and traditional crafts. Also lots of good eateries here too.
Great shopping mall. Have been to Siam Paragon every time I am in Bangkok. The place is always clean and well organized. It also has a big supermarket in the basement level.

Not honest about food pre-paid card. Siam Paragon is a mall with mostly international chains, clean and sparkling, very well designed to grab you inside and pass your time consuming overpriced goods instead of living something original and authentic which we found in other areas of Bangkok. Of course, you should visit for once if you like malls. You can find almost everything.About the food hall. There is a good selection of food BUT not honest about their card system. They advertise their prepaid card system but they did not mention or alert you the time you get it that it stands for only that day. So, in the end, we lost 380baht, got a sorry and many smiles - you should have known better style. Bad behaviour from a posh place!

Go for the Food Court - you won't be disappointed. I can't say much about the shops in Siam Paragon... pretty much a standard shopping mall you'd find in London or Oz. But the food court. It's awesome. You may THINK at the start of your trip you can never possibly get tired of Thai food but it does eventually happen. This place is the remedy. There are SO MANY different options in this food court... everything is clean and fresh... you can get anything you might possibly ever imagine. We tried Coco Ichibanya (Japanese curry chain which they don't have in Oz or the UK), some crazy okonomiyaki style pancake thing, and this squishy white bread they chop up and slather with chilli paste and pork floss! FOODIE WONDERLAND.

Upmarket Bangkok mall. Siam Paragon is one of four malls in a row (Siam Paragon, Siam Centre, Siam Discovery, and across the cross roads, MBK). Of the four Siam Paragon is the fanciest.They have a good selection of restaurants, a very good food court and the Gourmet Food Hall is one of Bangkok's best supermarkets.They have Ocean World in the basement and the mall also has the Japanese book store Kinokuniya.The mall is well connected by the Bangkok Skytrain. The taxi stand is also well managed and regulated.

Big, glitzy and $$$. Great shopping mall with all the brands and labels you could want. What impressed me the most was their food hall. The best and greatest range of foods when compared to the food halls at Central world and Terminal 21.
Good Shopping, Amusement & Entertainment. Enjoyed our visit here. Speechless. My son enjoyed the most. Food, toys, clothes everything one could expect to find is available here.

Big shopping center. Siam Paragon Mall is a nice spacious shopping center. After shopping in Europe seems well overpriced. Compared the prices in Zara Home and Massimo Dutti. In this mall they are about 20-30% more expensive than in Cyprus where I live. Most people just go around without even buying a smallest thing.The food court is full of people and has things to offer for every taste.Was disappointed by IMAX. They had only one movie to show - no choice at all.
Siam Paragon. We like this mall because of Paragon Cineplex. Typical mall but Paragon Cineplex is what we like most. Take BTS Siam exit.

One of my favorite mall in Bangkok. This is one of my favorite mall in Bangkok. For me you can spend more than half a day here even for doing nothing. Have a cup of tea or coffee or even lunch or dinner. Or go for a movie or visit the Aquarium.

Gigantic, convenient, clean. One of the ritzier malls in Bangkok, with every store you can imagine and then some. Most of the stores are upscale. There are several attractions inside the mall, such as Kidzania on the 6th floor, the Siam Ocean World aquarium in the basement, Madame Tussaud's, a movie multiplex etc., so families with kids can spend all day here.Multiple food courts - the one in the ground floor is ginormous, no other way to describe it! I had a great sushi lunch at Sushi Den on the fifth floor.Direct entrance from the Siam BTS station.There are two wings, north and south, so you should pay attention to which wing each attraction is.Bathrooms are clean. Lifts (elevators) take a long time to arrive.
Too Westernized but good selection of shops. Nice place but may as well be in a shopping complex in UK. All same brands and shops and same prices or more expensive.

If you like shopping.... Siam Paragon is a big shopping center with a lot of restaurants and other attractions. The Siam Ocean World is in the bottom of the shopping center. Restaurants are good and the food is OK not so cheap but not so expensive also. The shopping is not cheap expected to pay European prices.

Shopping heaven. I was very fortunate to come in the January sales and picked up a few bargains. I would recommend this complex and spend up if you can. I mainly went for clothes that I couldn't get in Australia and the food court is wow factor. Downside queueing up for a taxi to load all your shopping in.

Brightly lit mall. Siam Paragon is probably the most famous mall in Bangkok. Get off BTS National Stadium and walk a short distance. The mall is spacious and brightly lit. The shops sell prestige brands so the quality of the products is well assured. If you're looking for cheaper products, then go to MBK mall which is nearby but do practise your bargaining skills before you enter. For Siam Paragon, there is a great food court and I would recommend trying authentic Thai food. Cafe Chili and Manna serve spicy Thai Food, however, if you're on budget, try Kalpapruek which is more affordable.

Best mall in BKK!!!!. My favourite things are..... "Super Market"in the basement, it has everything. Don't buy the food from the first shop you see....walk around lost of shops to eat. Basement level can be bit hectic, try the level 4 "Food Passage" nice restaurants. My other favourite is the movies on level 5, best ever movie experience for me. Plenty of coffee shops on each level. Open every day 10-10.

Beautiful and lots to do. Lots of shops to get around. My friends loved the variety. I particularly enjoyed the car showrooms within the shopping mall. The food court has plenty to choose from. Immaculate and lots of variety for families.

One of my favorite mall in Bangkok. Siam Paragon is one of my favorite mall in Bangkok vs the other malls (Terminal 21, Central World, etc)Why?- Great location – connected to Siam BTS station- Huge and loads of shops for everyone (from Gucci to H&M). You will definitely need more than 3 hours here. - Big and spacious. Love the clean and classy look as well. Makes shopping comfortable, although branded goods in Bangkok is more expensive vs Hong Kong, Singapore and Kuala Lumpur.- I love the restaurants and food choices here. So many to choose from. I recommend G Management for delicious Thai food. Love the roti with chicken/pork curry, roti with fried chicken, fried rice with yellow curry pork and tom kha kai. Dessert place is ample – so many selection from Western to local.- Kinokuniya book shop – one of the biggest book shop that I have ever been to. Bought 2 books :)- Entertainment – big cinemas and bowling alley if you are interested. They even have an aquarium here.

Luxury SUPER MALL. This mall is packed with luxury shops ranging from fashion, accessories, electronics to cars.Even if you don't plan to do any shopping, do come here for the food court! Huge, large selection and you're sure to find something to please everyone in your group. You can also find Harrod's on the foodcourt level.

Great Aquarium...Not much else.. The Siam Paragon has a great Aquarium to visit on the lower level with lots of interesting critters although the shows fall short of entertaining. I also disliked how they overcharge foreigners to the aquarium at 900 Baht for a very small variety of sealife. The cinema is great and the 3d IMAX is always fun (I saw the Hobbit 2 with my fiancee). The shopping is okay but nothing different than any other shopping center except in the amount of available stores. Most of the stores being for people looking to spend very high amounts of money rather than causual spending. I am a big fan of reading so I do enjoy the massive bookstore that is in the Paragon called kinokuniya. I recommend Central World for a more casual atmosphere for shopping with more affordable stores.

Great shopping, cinema & aquarium. Good bargains to be had in the pre New Year sale. Footwear pricing especially keen (Lacoste/Footjoy golf shoes). Other premium brands in plentiful supply and good value when compared with HKG/SIN prices. I'm not really a shopper but could happily spend a half-day here. Excellent cinema upstairs @ THB220 per person standard pricing.

Big, Sterile, very expensive, YAWN. Siam Paragon is one of those malls where if you were dropped into it with no warning, it would be very difficult to tell where on earth you actually were. It is big, very expensive, full of global brands, and has a sterile feel to it, which is like an operating theatre were they remove money from your wallet. Yes, it is luxurious, and yes, you can buy anything here from a Rolls Royce to a bowl of noodles, but it is soulless.One of the things that you can do for free is people watch, especially at the shameless brand junkies that are drooling over very high priced items, and the mindless drones that are watching the crowd carefully in case they see someone famous, or fail to spot a trend developing... I think the current trend is to wear a scarf, even in the tropics.By all means go to have a look at the name brands, but then walk the 400 metres to MBK, and have a fun shopping experience.

Shopping on steroids!. What a place! The food court is phenomenal! So many choices it is hard to decide. There are some great shops that are located on the main floor. Not in a store but in the walkways by the stores. There is something for everybody, from the top of the line Hermes to uniqlo to H&M. Don't miss it!

Tourist Discount Card a Must. Most of the popular shopping malls in Bangkok have the option to get a tourist discount card. And it's pretty useful when shopping within the shops in the malls. For Siam Paragon, my partner and I mainly used it for the department store. Any additional discounts was also a nice welcome.
Luxurious. This mall is where you can find all your favorite international brands in one place, although they aren't any cheaper. The basement of the mall is a gigantic food paradise!

Big and overwhelming. Siam Paragon, one of the newer, fancier malls in Bangkok has lots of luxury stores and the Paragon department store. Though it is big and modern, it is actually quite overwhelming and can get very crowded and congested. This is especially true on the ground floor where they have decided to build a massive food court right by one of the entrances. For a better retail experience, try the the nearby Central World Mall, which is neater and better organized. For a better food court experience, go to the Food Republic at Siam Centre next door, one of the best food courts in Southeast Asia.

very pretty christmas decorations. upscale shopping mall but with very very pretty Christmas decorations inside and outside! great for taking photos and shop at siam centre next door for more affordable things.

The fanciest mall ever. When visiting Bangkok, there are two malls that you should go to: One is MBK (which is something like a huge marketplace packed into a mall) - and the other is Siam Paragon, which is the fanciest mall we have ever visited. Here, they sell Rolls Royce and Ferraris - in a mall. So you get an idea of the kind of stuff they're selling here. Don't come here to make a bargain - that's MBK - just come here to have a look. It's really something, and I would definitely recommend watching a movie at the cinema on the top floor. That's an experience of its own ;-))

Amazing Shopping Center. Hundreds of shops and restaurants, thousands of visitors, quite busy and crowded , right in the center of Bangkok. Most of the restaurants offer a good quality at reasonable prices. Stay away from the Royal Indian Restaurant in the basement.Generally the items in the shops are a bit overpriced.

Exclusive Mall. No bargains here. Massive food court. Home to the Aquarium which is a must see. Great place to buy top quality goods at top prices to match. Extremely big mall so plan for a lot of time here if you want to see the whole place.
Be very careful. Very poor security. Sometime even security cameras blocked by some decorations.I was robbed there twice!!Food - overpricedShopping - only on sales.

High class, so don't expect to find bargains !. Siam Paragon is the most exclusive shopping mall in Bangkok which are reflected heavily on the prices. Only the top designers and brands will be found here. Standard layout with different levels and tons of shops, very clean and cool environment.The restaurants are not so expensive so you can enjoy lunch or dinner here.

Great food at food court. I have been going to the Siam Paragon food court since it opened several years ago. The food price is reasonable, the quality and serving size is generally large, and there is always seating. They have maids who immediately clean the table after the customer leaves. A great place to eat while shopping in this huge mall.
Woohoo. Greatest place on Earth! Really liked it! Especially the cinema

A place to shop. We have been always intimidated a little bit by the sheer number of people visiting this place - we are afraid of being in over-crowded places, so this time when we walked in with many others for Christmas shopping, it actually was the first time. Inside was much more spacious than we expected and we actually enjoyed the Paragon Department Store within much more. If you are not looking for big brands in Bangkok (they are simply the same everywhere, how boring!!!), this department store is probably where you should visit. They have a whole selection, with small and unique brands all over the world, especially Europe. And honestly the merchandisers have done great jobs - they have tastes when they select products and the price range is so wide that I believe literally everybody could find something here.There is a food court Gourmet Market underground, nice place for a quick bite and normally fully packed during weekends as I have heard.

Big and impressive, typical mall in Bangkok.. This scores 4/5 instead of 5/5 purely because it's expensive to shop here! The cinema is great value but the mall is definitely best suited to wealthy visitors. Still makes a great day or night out though. The place is very impressive, and even if you don't buy anything you can still enjoy wondering around admiring the place.

Luxuryshopping mall in the center of bkk. If you are interested to shop;it is good to see there;on the other hand ı didn'tsee ans speciality of this mall from other countries; prices are not cheap or the range was not wider.

Huge and centally located. The mall is easy accessed by sky train and it features huge variety from upmarket shops to H&M. It has a great food court and also very big supermarket on lower level. If you have some extra money and time to spend in BKK this is a great place to do so.

Good Place. This is a mall with lot of variety targeting premium to budget shoppers. If it has Hermes then it has H&M too. But I wont say its the best place to shop for an international shopper. There are other shopping malls in other parts of the world that are cheaper compared to prices in Siam Paragon.

Not only for shopping. Siam paragon is a place not only for shopping but to roam around. There are many famous car brands outlets and you can watch their new models. There is a big multiplex including an IMAX and a 4DX. So you can watch movie in you own choice. There is also a park for kids. You can enjoy thai food in a neat and clean place. The shopping complex is nice.

The best in Asia. We tried to go the Vimanmek Palace, but couldn't get there because of the demonstrations.So we decided to go the air conditioned Paragon instead. Glad we did. The aquariumin the basement is terrific. The mall also has a huge choice of restaurants. Unfortunately,we chose to eat at the Thai restaurant, which was awful. We did have good ice creamafterwards. As for shopping, there is one large upscale section devoted to Thai products,where we found quality items not found in the street stalls. There is also a CinePlex,but the film choice was limited mostly to low-end Asian action movies. The Mallis right on the SkyTrain, and it was only a 15 minute ride back to our hotel. Best mall in Asia.

Window shopping and shooting!!. We rented the hotel far from the downtown and thought Thailand was freaking old but we were wrong. Siam Paragon is super fancy and has awesome amount of inventories. We felt like in NYC. Prices were competitive compared to The US but great new collection.

Too much to take!. This mall is located in a good location. It is so huge that it would take quite a while for you to get around. The mall sells branded stuff like Longchamp, Coach and so on. All in all, the mall is really attractive and it will take time to indulge in the experience.

An experience in itself. Definitely slightly overwhelming given its size, but the sheer number and quality of the shops makes for a great shopping and dining experience.I literally spent a day there, perusing the various shops on offer, although sadly didn't go into Oceanworld. A must visit, even for the non shoppers coming to the city!

Bangkok's Complete Mall. This mall is complete with literally everything you can do in one place. We returned to Bangkok recently and spent two full days here eating, watching movies, ocean world, and ofcourse shopped! IT has everything. Centrally located in Bangkok.

Love it!. This is a really good mall, lots of shops, paragon Cineplex, Siam Ocean World and a really good food court below! Its also right next to a Sky train station so very accessible! You wouldn't need to spend all day here just a couple of hours but there are other malls within walking distance! If you don't want to shop here just go for lunch!

You can buy almost everything here. A very large and modern shopping center in Siam Square area. Lots of big brand name stores can be found here, including very prominent car brands like Rolls Royce, Porsche etc..The building houses two local attraction, Siam Ocean World and Kidzania.There is a large food court at the basement with a large variety of food to choose from, however please note you can't pay cash, instead you need to get a pre-paid value card at a counter and use that to pay for purchases. The cost will be deducted from the card.A nice and clean place for the family to shop and explore, however not necessary the best place for bargains in Bangkok.

Great supermarket on the first floor. Initially I was debating about visiting this mall because I had only two days in Bangkok and wanted to have enough time to see The Grand Palace and the major temples, but then I decided to go because it was only one train station stop away from my hotel. We only went to the supermarket on the first floor; there, we got some very delicious Asian snacks and coconut juice. I took my chances and bought a couple snacks that I have never heard of before; my only regret is that I did not buy more to bring home, as I certainly had enough space in my suitcase. There are specialty sections selling various goods that are great as gifts on the same floor, as well as some eateries and bakeries with unique looking Asian goodies.

Wasted Opportunity. Look - this complex of malls isn't bad, it's just a wasted opportunity for your vacation.The complex is a set of three nice higher-end malls. With a BTS Skytrain station right outside, it's is very accessible from anywhere in the city. Inside, though, expect to find mobs of fellow tourists looking through mostly the same brands that you'd find at a luxury mall back home (for the same expensive prices). Basically, with how much else that Thailand has to offer, I don't see why you'd bother. It's not a cultural experience at all, and the shopping aficionado won't be finding any deals here. Your vacation time is precious. Don't waste it here.

Great variety of high-end shopping. l liked this mall because of the fact that it carried plenty of high-end Thai brands (Siam Center) in addition to the typical international brands (Hermes, LV etc.). There are also plenty of food options, gourmet or otherwise. Very accessible location too, although there are currently protests and some violence going on around the area so perhaps stay away till that's over.
Amazing food court and gourmet food shops. Great mall but I really liked the food court and the gourmet food hall in the lower level. Even had a Krispy kreme!

Huge!. The concierge at our hotel recommended Paragon as the place to go for a pedicure. It took us over an hour of wandering around before we could find a place in this massive building. While we searched, we came across every high-end shop imaginable. By the time we hit the 3rd floor we encountered the automobile dealers...Lambourgini, Rolls Royce, and the like. This is not the place to go if you are looking for a bargain, and certainly not the place to just nip in to pick something up. Rather, the building is an experience in itself.

enormous mall, high prices. The Siam complex is made of 3 malls - siam paragon, siam discovery (only intl' brands, extremely expensive) and siam center (local brands yet expensive).This mall is very impressive and located in a key location. Visit there but don't expect to find cheep merchandise :)

Massive shopping centre with huge variety. Paragon has a huge range of designer clothing shops which are typically very expensive. It was designed to fill the gap in the market for stores like Chanel, Fendi, Marc Jacobs etc. there is also a lot of food stalls, restaurants and cafés.The most amazing part of Paragon is the massive gourmet supermarket with specific delis for each different product. There is a tasting option for every thing you could imagine including a fully operating oyster bar and soup kitchen. To cap it all off there are more staff to help you with anything and everything.

amazing food court. I always get lost there/ there is so much to see - to do - to shop! It has the best stores from high end Louis Vuitton to basic shopping at zara & Mango. The Theatre - Krung Sri - Has the best IMAX experience. The food court is amazing with probably over 200 choices(maybe there are more) with numerous restauants/ WOWThe flipside is sometimes you just get tired even before you start since its quite loud!nevertheless - A MUST GO!enjoy

Nice and Clean but overprized.. The mall is talk of the apparently. It was very clean and nice but offers nothing what you can't get on high street. However almost double the price. I was happy to find a boots as well though. Food Court was disappointing. I Find the foodcourt of MBK still the best.

Remindws me of shopping malls in the West. During our September 2013 visit to Thailand, my wife and I shopped at Siam Paragon. This place reminded me of shopping malls in Europe and United States. The prices there are higher but you can also notice that the quality is also higher. Siam Paragon is an upscale place intended to for the person that enjoys the fine things in life.We spent 4 hours there including shopping at the super market on the premise. We bought a few items that we brought back with us.I recommend this place for the western shopper who like to shop indoors and does not want to mingle with crowds. The place is air conditioned and very comfortable.

Enjoy the experience, but only if you have the time. Siam Paragon is called “The Pride of Bangkok” and it’s easy to understand why they are proud of it. It has everything from Hermes and Chanel, to Cartier and Bulgari, to H & M and Zara, to electronics and book stores, to kitchen appliances and cars, including Rolls Royces and Maseratis. There is also a store devoted to Thai souvenir items. I particularly enjoy the very large Gourmet Market – and often purchase gifts there. The food court is quite large and has McDonalds and KFC, as well as Thai, Japanese, Italian, Mexican and American cafes and restaurants, as well as several places just devoted to deserts. I don’t go to Siam Paragon with the intent to make large purchases, but with the intent to enjoy the experience – it is a vibrant and fun way to spend a couple of hours, if you have the time.

Bangkok's exclusive shopping center. Siam Paragon is a wonderful place for tourists. When you get there you notice it's a place for Thailand's upper class, tourists, and locals who want to be seen and to see what Thailand has to offer. The prices are lile every other high class shopping mall : expensive. But, once it's really accessible by skytrain and has a lot of attactions like to Siam Center , Siam Discovery Center and MBK Center.

Great Supermarket at Siam Paragon. Overall, I liked going to the Paragon while on visit to the BKK. However, in addition to the loads of branded, both local and international, stores spread over the mall, for me the best part was the supermarket and the gourmet food stalls. Loved those and the quality of the food. The variety was excellent as well.
Shopper's paradise. Good selection of fashion and next to Siam BTS! Be prepared to spend a good portion of the day on retail therapy.

Good shopping mall. Before coming to Thailand. My friend suggested me that I should see Siam Paragon. It was the best mall in Bangkok. I took many pictures when getting around the mall. It was splendid and very attractive. The food zone is good also. Many choices, many cuisines.

Loved spending the morning here. An easy trip via sky train. Enjoyed window shopping and made purchases of Thai products in the beautiful department store. Lots of food choices. We particularly enjoyed the supermarket, where we found a number of things to bring back as gifts. As I missed about half of the place, we may come back. One of the nicest malls I have ever visited, and I've seen many.

Amazing Siam Paragon!. From your hotel make sure to visit Siam Paragon it's a world class destination within reach easily by bts SIAM station with a connecting bridge going inside. You will be surprise seeing different interior design of each boutique with high class accent... After your visit here a few walk can take you to Siam Center where you can find Madame Tussauds at 6th floor Siam Discovery... Another place from few steps is MBK almost similar to Greenhills shopping center in the Philippines ,where you can buy good bargain products such as souvenir shirts for 99 THB tamarind ,dried fruits,sea weeds &good tasting durian chips prices are double when you buy this items at the airport,so make sure to drop by here... Most of the tourist enjoy their shopping moment here so affordable!

Local supermarket. Only headed straight for the supermarket at Siam Paragon, my friend & I ended up buying a lot back to our home country. Must say it's quite big and neat. :) Didn't have time to explore the rest of the shops.

If you like malls visit this one too. This is a clean and beautiful mall. However it is not a cheap place though. You can enjoy the cafes in ground floor, window shop or see a movie in the cinema at the top floor. If you have enough money to spend there are lots of shops too (though I personally prefer to buy these kind of things in Malaysia because it is much cheaper)If you like malls, visit this one and "Central World" (nearby this one).

Only go for the supermarket. We decided we needed to by some food for a short stay. We had already been to MBK and siam discovery. And as travellers we wanted to check out the local supermarket as we have done in every country we have been to.As we walked into the massive supermarket it was clear to see this is where the people of the city shop.We saw proper waygu beef. amazing things to eat. The supermarket was upmarket, but clean did not smell. had friendly staff. quite cheap. On 2 occasions while were stayed in Bangkok we shopped here purely because of the way it looked.

Check out the supermarket. We only check out the supermarket of this up-market mall.
To our pleasant surprise, the food prices are very reasonable, comparable to shops outside, for fruits, snacks (presentable packaging as gifts) etc. We even bought some fruits (pink pomelo) for home, cost only half of what I pay in home country.

Nice big pricy mall. Nice n clean big hotelnothing special the same western style mall with many big brand but i notice few ppl buying while many were just browsing and n chatting with their friends etcfood court downstairs is busy with many options that suite many budgetnice to have the mall attached to the BTS train systemWil sure come back for the food but not for over price items !
Mini cafes. The best brand shopping at BKK. Authentic brands indeed. Loved the caffe's distrubuted along the mall with the creativity of decorations.

Getting down so much. Year after year I can clearly see that Siam Paragon is going down. What was or still call the Pride of Bangkok, lost a bit of it's aura.Cheap brands started to appears since couple of years and do not really understand what they are doing here.Food Court is not clean anymore, packed and smelly. Many students around, another cruising places.Just avoid now to go there as it just show off...Terminal 21 is definitely much better and more interesting.

Great for Window Shopping. Very upmarket and expensive all the top designer shops to ogle at. Some nice tourist souvenirs top floor. Great cafés to relax and get your breath back before more window shopping. I love the food court again to wander around looking at but they also do little tasters which is fun.

Out of the World, never thought in dream that a shopping mall can be so big. Hi Guys,Its a must visit place in Bangkok. And best place for Window Shopping, no need to buy anything just take a look at it. I can bet that u have never seen such a big mall. Its the finest Example of Luxury and Elite . But dont forgot to visit the food court. I bet u will have to hold ur GF/Child /Wife hand otherwise one can lost in it.

Must Visit if you like Malls.. I wanted to visit the outdoor weekend market but we arrived to Bangkok on a weekday. The concierge said that just had to visit Siam Paragon if we liked shopping. I was not happy about going to a Mall in Thailand but it he sounded convincing that this was a must-see mall. I have been to malls in Los Angeles, Las Vegas and many other high class shopping centers in the US and other countries. This is hands down the most impressive mall I have ever been to. I would say that if you like shopping malls - Siam Paragon should be on the top of your list if your in Bangkok.

Very up market. We have shopped in malls around the globe, but have not seen one like this - it seems to have all the designer brands - Dior, Prada, Chanel. Boss, Armani, Lois Vitton, Versace, Estee Lauder, Cartier, etc etc etc and all their competitors. We actually visited to buy a book at Kinokuniya - what an amazing place - crowded with locals and a huge English language section (see pic).We were amazed to see showrooms for Rolls Royce, Porsche, BMW, Ducati and my favourite was the matte black Lamborghini Aventador.We didn't do all the malls but spent time in MBK, Siam Discovery, Siam Tower and Siam Paragon was the most impressive for high end goods.
It worth a visit ... It's a large place with many shoppes brandsAnd very close to central world mall.It's located next the tramp station and you can find many taxis around ..

Entertaining afternoon. My friends and I searched around the city for a few hours and wanted a place to kind of hide from a rainy afternoon so we decided to stop here. We didn't end up leaving this place until four hours later. It IS HUGE!! Tons of things to see and do and it cant be a little overwhelming to a first timer. Arcades, Car rooms, Aquarium, Movie Theatre and of course shopping centers. The food court is also some place to go and see if you want to spend a few hours inside. Really great experience and I recommend a visit when you are able.

Disappointing. This is an extremely upscale mall with many ultra high-end "designer" shops. I don't shop in these places in Canada, so why would I in Bangkok. We needed some light cottons, but couldn't find anything suitable. I don't know how the place survives because we saw a lot of people looking but very little actual buying. A complete waste of time.

Very nice high-end shopping mall in central Bangkok. Siam Paragon is very easy to reach by public transportation: Siam BTS. You will find all the high-end brand such as LV, Hermes, etc. There are also many coffee shops and restaurants. Banks are open 7 days a week and the mall is open open until late every nights

Relax and enjoy.. Don't expect to see it all in one visit. Take your time and explore. There is something to see for everyone and every taste. Have a plan or you will wander for hours. Find a comfortable place to sit and formulate your plan for seeing the things you really want whether shopping, eating, site seeing or whatever. If you are in a hurry you will be disappointed.
Great restaurants. The Siam Paragon is a nice shopping complex which has many excellent selections of food courts and restaurants with a wide range of ethnic food choices.

An OK (or better) shopping mall. Each time in Bangkok we visit Siam Paragon, a huge shopping mall. The basement has a large supermarket which is worth a look see...if for no other reason than to take advantage of the free samples. If you are in town for a while it is a good place to stock up on some munchies.There are places to eat. Beauty parlor...manicure and foot massages...the place is typical higher end department store. If you find a bargain, then you are ahead of the game. It would be more worth visiting if/when they are having sales.There is so much to see and do in Bangkok (touristy things) you are going to Siam Paragon because you have already done all the other things! (Although interesting to visit there, you shouldn't "go out of your way" to see it!). We've purchased nicknacks there as well as food and used their beauty parlor too. Bottom line: we've been there on four different occasions, so obviously there is an attraction...but only if you've seen all the other Bangkok sights.

Cool place to visit. I thought this mall is the same with the other one. But, it really different. So many cool brands. Awesome theatre. Even has a large aquarium place on the basement. Worth ur time.

upmarket shopping at its best. took several hours to explore here and loved it and came out with lots of cheap shirts $10.00 AUstralian and very good quality cotton ( myers in Aust would sell for approx $80.00 +) there are the usual high end brand names Dior Cartier etc plus a big department store tucked inside that sells great clothes cheap plus a big food court please go and take a look

Quick guide to Siam Paragon. You can spend many hours in this shopping center and waste a lot of time wondering around. I will try to make some order in this complex and make your experience easier. First, Siam Paragon, located in Rama I street, opposite to the Thai police HQ, is also the CENtral station of the Sky Train. The Sukhumvit line and Silom lines meet here and you can interchange between them.Siam Paragon is quite new. Opened in 2006. The core of this shopping mall is Paragon department store holding 4 floors with all the high-end stuff: Jewelry, cosmetics, watches, high style fashion, home appliance, electronics etc.In the open space around the department store, you will find almost everything. From shoe lace to a Maseraty car.The basement floor holds the Ocean world. A magnificent attraction for all ages. The ground floor is the food court and a giant deli. On the right side there is a Thai traditional food court where you buy a local debit card to deduct at any food station. The sitting is close to big fish aquariums. On the left side you find numerous restaurants of all styles with priority to Japanese.The M floor is the main entry from the Sky train station. It is the Luxury floor. In this floor there are many fashion shops and coffee shops.2nd floor occupies Life style shops and leisure. 3rd floor- Living & Technology. Floor 4-Paragon Passage & IT World. 5th floor-Entertainment. Cinema halls, iMax, Bowling and exhibitions.You should dedicate at least 5 hours for this mall. Not including movies and dinng.

Everything you need under one roof.. If you are a shopping mall fan or it's a rainy day in Bangkok there are several huge malls in the city where you can spend the whole day. One of the largest and most central is Siam Paragon. It's very convenient as you walk straight off the Siam Skytrain station into the premises without being exposed to the weather. It's got everything - all kinds of restaurants, an enormous supermarket, shops of every description and brand name (including two excellent book stores), about a dozen cinemas, banks, a huge aquarium, etc., etc. Besides the supermarket the one thing which draws me back almost daily is the extensive food court. There are a couple of vegetarian outlets which actually provide brown rice - a rarity in Bangkok restaurants! A plate of rice and several varieties of vegetables will cost about Baht 100. It's a good deal and you know the produce is fresh as the place is always packed. In the same area on the ground floor the supermarket also has an excellent salad bar and, close by, a soup bar with an extensive range of soups. Plastic cutlery is provided by the cashier's assistant when paying for your purchases.Siam Paragon is also conveniently linked by overhead walkways to several other malls such as Siam Center, Discovery Center, the Arts Center, MBK, Central World and Gaysorn Plaza.

Beautiful Centre - definetly high end shopping. This shopping centre was well laid out and easy to get around. Had all the high-end shops: Gucci, Prada, Hermes etc, so be prepared to spend. The movie center on the fifth floor was amazing! We did their equivalent of Gold Class, and it was pure luxury: fee of ~$35 included a 15 min massage before the movie, luxury reclining leather seats with a blanket and pillow, and each seat was in an alcove that gave you total privacy. Popcorn and a drink were included in the price also. As for the other shops in the centre - beautifully presented. Food hall area gave enormous variety of eastern and western food. Worth a look if you are visiting Bangkok.

Quality shopping. If you visit Siam Paragon you will find quality shopping with great service. It is a bit more pricey but you can take advantage of sale items. I was assisted constantly by helpful staff carrying and items i wished to purchase. Large range of clothing/shoes/homewares etc just like our Myer. Actually visited in September 2011.
Great supermarket. Love the supermarket section in the basement. So very inviting, all the displayed food and other items there.

Very well laid out.. Siam paragon is very well placed very near popular shopping malls.
Also the Aquarium is tastefully done with a very large selection of fish.
Complete mall. Great for shopping, eating and spending the day. Located at busy siam square, next door to 2-3 other big malls.

Shopping Mall of choice in Bangkok.. The more and more I come to Bangkok and try to extend my visits to places I have not been to before...I end up coming back to Siam Paragon....I love the cinema, bowling, Kinokuniya. I visit the hairdresser, beautician and the food options are endless. Then they always have something on: a festival, whether food, Thai, new apartment complexes and then there is the shopping. It is a one stop shop. There are a number of alternatives shopping venues in the area so you cannot go wrong.

Awesome mall. This is a very impressive mall with lots of space to wander about.Shopping is rather high end prices but it is nice to look.Easy location at the end of the Skytrain service from our hotel in Sathon Road.

Expensive but worth a visit. Siam Paragon is a very modern shopping mall. It is more up market than a lot of malls in Bangkok and the prices tend to reflect this, but there are still bargains to be had. The food hall on the ground floor is huge and has a wide variety of food, ranging from Asian to McDonalds. Once again it is not cheap though.Overall I would recommend a visit,but don't put it at the top of your list, especially if you only have a short stay in Bangkok

A Shoppers dream. Siam Paragon, is one of Bangkok's top shoping complex. You can buy anything from mango and sticky rice to a Rolls Royce. The centre is right at the Siam BTS skytrain station so access is very easy. The fifth floor has movies houses, the forth floor has a large varity of restaurants. The rest of the building is mainly clothing and designer shops, luxury cars, jewelers and just about anything one's heart desires. The lower ground level there are more restaurants/fast food outlest and a Tops Supermarket which sells groceries from all around the globe. Naturally it can get very busy on weekends.
