Great. Very nice place: luxuous shops, a good food court with a various restaurant, the aquarium is a nice experience.Sometimes there is some musical shows.The "Le notre Restaurant" is very nice, good location with very nice garden.The Thai restaurant is very good.To be visited a least one time.

high class shopping trip. we always visit here on my travels to Bangkok. we have enjoyed the cinema here, we have visited siam ocean world many times to see the sharks and other water and land related animals.you can have tours of the shark breeding programmes and go on a glass bottom boat trip and see the sharks and other fish at close contact.a very good selection of products in the high class supermarket. good selection of restaurants and your well known designer clothes shops which are famous around the world. also outside at certain times of the year they have many functions on, including concerts. I took some very good photos when they had their christmass litt decorations. if you are visiting Bangkok I recommend you visit here.

Shoppings, food and Ocean World. Siam is the neighborhood more western style, where you can find the most important shops of luxury goods and international brands. I really enjoyed the shopping and the Siam Ocean World, found it a bit expensive 900 bath/person but for those who like oceanaria, worth it.

Siam Paragon is a shopper's paradise !. What I love about travelling to Bangkok is finding Siam Paragon, one of the highlights of my Bangkok trip. It's a shopper's paradise and is generally very crowded and the food court with its wide array of Japanese, Korean, local Thai food is still fun to explore !

Expensive. The things sold there are more expensive than other malls where locals frequent. Very touristy atmosphere. Walk around if you want to enjoy the large windows diplays. The food court offers a plethora of selection of they have the seasonal food fairs.
Places of interest here include the Siam Oceanworld and the Paragon Cineplex.

More than a shopping centre. Siam Paragon is way more than just a shopping centre. It is up market but is a great place for everybody. If you are needing to get away from the heat and action of the busy streets of Bangkok, and you want some really good foods of all varieties at good prices, this is the place to come. Apart from food, there are hundreds of specialty brand stores from Louis Vuitton to Naraya. There is an IMax cinema and downstairs you have Ocean World which worth a visit. All up makes for a good day out for family's or couples or even on your own.

Amazing hip place to be. Paragon is definitely THE place in Central Bangkok to be seen and to visit. The main boutiques are all here including my favourite tea place: TWG Tea which moved to the ground floor with their sumptuous teas and white linen food a few months ago. The whole place feels positive happy and magnetic. Don't miss out ! Visit Paragon today!!

An interesting mall. Every time we go to Bangkok, we spend every day in Siam Paragon.The food court at the basement has lots of local food.At the basement, there are also lots of stalls selling local and food from all over the world.There are so many restaurants, cafés and eateries.The supermarket is so huge you need a day to see everything.On other floors, there are high end boutiques and there's Siam Paragon Dept Store.All these are enjoyed in air con comfort.

Huge. This is a great shopping complex for quality , variety and those not looking for a bargain. The massive food hall on the ground floor is brilliant with lots of quality food, lots of snack food, groceries, restaurants and in a lovely setting. It's a huge complex so you may need to know what you are looking for. Not much bartering here only set prices but good quality and still cheaper than Oz.

Great Shopping Mall. Even though Trip Advisor uses a very bad picture to display the place, it is really a wonderful facility where you can have excellent food, you can watch a movie on a IMAX theatre, hang on in a cyber cafe, and buy whatever is available in the global market, from a pair of socks to a.. Roll Royce last model ;-)

High-end shopping centre. Siam Paragon is my favourite shopping mall in Bangkok. It has all the high-end labels under the same roof. The prices for imported labels are consider high as compared to Singapore. What I like about this mall is the amazing spread of its food and beverages. Italian, Japanese, Chinese, Fastfood and Thai food, the spread is endless. From foodcourt to restaurant depending on your budget for the day. There is a place that will fit your wallet as well as your apettite. The amount of spa products on sale here is also awesome. All the different local brands ofspa products can be found here in Siam Paragon. There is also a section of the mall which houses branded cars such as Rolls Royce. The supermarket is really fun to walk around in. It house lots of local produce as well as imported products like wagyu beef. Enjoy a nice afternoon tea at one of the many cafes after your shopping. I recommend Mandarin Oriental Shop, Vanilla Brasserie or TWG for their lovely cakes and drinks.

Huge & Awesome place. If you are a Brand Freak or like Super Cars or if you need entertainment for your kids & yourself too....This is a place to be. Everything under one roof.Siam Paragon has all the top class brand stores including Armani, Dior, D&G, Gucci etc....so you might wanna keep your wives away. For kids it is a total package. You can buy a all in one deal for Siam Water world: A huge aquarium for your kids with an option of Shark dive, fish feeding etc,Madam Tussads Museum: A replica of the one in the UK. You can be close to stars & get your pictures with them,4D movie theatre: Another fun & thrill filled experience for you & your kids.The total package costs somewere aroung 1600-1700 THB. Which is a good bargain.If youve been to MKB & youve like that, you will love this place.

Stylish Shopping Mall. We have been to this mall many times and never tire of walking round the wide range of shops from the designer outlets to the department stores and the great food court with such a wide variety of foods to try.There are also a wide selection of restaurants as well so you will never go hungry shopping here!The mall is often home to various exhibitions and displays and the orchid display we went to see was amazing, so many different colours and varieties of orchids.If you have several hours to spend in Bangkok for shopping you must come to Siam Paragon.

be ware of pickpockets in bangkok. we visited bangkok last year...and on our second day we went to siam paragon mall...after having coffee in food court at basement level...we decided to go back to our hotel.and took escalator to go up ....suddenly two people pushed me and came in front of me ( i thought HOW RUDE.. ) and my husband was behind me..so two or three people just pushed him and came between me and my husband....at the end of escalator the TWO PEOPLE in front of me just stopped and thinking i will fall i put my hands on their shoulders to ask them to move...in the mean time people behind me opened my bag and took my wallet....and i was so busy pushing those people in front of me...never noticed that they have taken my wallet...by the time i realized ( about 20 minuets ) and called my bank about stolen cards... they had finished shopping to the full limit.....so please be ware of these gangs they work in a group ( men and women together).....and i think some of the employees of some stores are also involved as we saw ( after police report and mall cctv footage and security of the mall helping us to get papers to take back to our country to prove to our bank about the theft ) the receipts of shopping done by thieves were not signed...but i would like to add mall security people were very helpful...

Very good sight to see. I really liked this Mall or shopping area because it was so much to see inside. The Gourmet Market inside is a must. This is the best Market in Thailand to me. Its like a WholeFoods, Publix's, Trader's Joes to the 3rd power all rolled together. I absolutely love the shopping there. They had upscale high in stores along with all other type shopping as well. It's a must see/go.

Huge high-class high-rise mall. This place is huge and it can be hard to find what you're looking for. There's often a queue to get into the classier shops like Louis Vuitton, which I've never seen before. My favorite places are the stationary dept. on the third floor of Central where you can check out the latest toy and stationary trends from Japan and Korea. It's also surprisingly cheap to buy basic stationary there. There's also a good book store called Kynokinoia or something on the 2nd or third floor which is good for buying English books. Another useful store is the ASIA Books where you can buy a waterproof bus map for 99B - that could save you a lot on taxi fares!The food court is on the ground floor and is predicably more expensive than the food courts anywhere else. If you have money you can get any designer you can name here - if you don't you can walk around dreaming that you really afford all the shiny things in the windows!
Smart. Very clean and organized mall.it is vey easily accessible,has all the international big brands. Shopping there is quite expensive,but the mall itself is of a very high standard.

good food. The basement level has a food court that boast more than 100 stalls. For visitor that does not understand Thai, having a meal at this place is a pleasant experience. Pick and choose what you see, do not need to understand Thai. Clean and value for money food.
Food Mall. Have many restaurants there and a supermarket there. Have a small mooncake booth with five stars hotel mooncake booth. Things there are expensive for shopping :)

Rats and roaches at the food court level. Don't eat at the mall. The food is great but the rats and roaches are very discerning. There was a rat that ran along one of the restaurants that serves Vietnamese noodles and no one did anything about it. They stood there and laughed about it. I can't imagine what kind of job the mall management is doing when there are rats and roaches running rampid. I hope someone at the mall management sees this.
A regular shopping mall. A regular and deluxury shopping mall with many people. You could find this kind of place in Hongkok, Singapore and mid-east........

A Big Mall... A mall which is big in every aspect, all brands you can imagine is there, all kind of food and lots of money to be spent..If you have a half day in Bangkok to spent, then this is the wright place, and its just stairs always from sky train station. Perfect.

Great Shopping. Great place to shop. You can find anything your heart desires to buy. They have an Int'l gourmet supermarket in the basement level. Lots of items from all over the world. Great food court bakeries, ethnic food, desserts etc...You can spend the whole day at the mall. Best of all its clean and efficient.

Rats and roaches at the food court level. Don't eat at the mall. The food is great but the rats and roaches are very discerning. There was a rat that ran along one of the restraints that serves Vietnamese noodles and no one did anything about it. They stood there and laughed about it. I can't imagine what kind of job the mall management is doing when there are rats and roaches running rampid. I hope someone at the mall management sees this.

Good for shopping and a great place for dinners. Have been to Siam Paragon every time I am in Bangkok. The place is always clean and well organised. It also has a big supermarket in the basement level. Great if you want to buy a few things (drinks and snacks) to bring back to the hotel.

Great supermarket. We enjoyed this mall with the enormous supermarket that has so many variety of goods! We even can taste the local food before purchasing them! I bought their lemongrass tea and herbs. We also took pictures outside the underwater world. Good local food in the mall and it's relaxing just to sit around after all the shopping!
Various Food and good service. they have various types of food there and the services are good but.. there are alot of tourist there and there for the queues are really long.

Great day out. Rare for us to spend an entire day in a mall but Paragon had enough to keep the whole family occupied - an underwater world, load of shops - quite expensive but the dept. store was great - an enormous array of restaurants and a wonderful cinema too. highly recommended and attached to the skytrain so easy to get to

the best mall i ever been. This is the best mall from all the shopping malls i have visit.The interior design is very nice,the food court is huge,and the restorants inside are the best!I recommend 100% have everything inside,even Lamborgini and Maserati!
Regular shopping mall. Siam is a regular shopping center, nice to see and walk around, maybe some light shopping.Food court is ok, but not great.

Comfort mall. Siam Paragon is somewhat a comfort place because it's very accessible to everyone. The food court can be quite crowded at times but if you're around to do some "brand (not necessarily high end) shopping", I would most recommend this place among the other mall options. What more, Siam Center and Siam Discovery is just nearby so you have more places to go to for shopping, window shopping, or just strolling.
a high end mall. A very high end mall with designer boutiques and even showrooms for Rolls Royce and Maserati. Nice place to look around and is connected to two other mall in the vicinity.
Big and plenty. The food hall at the basement is like a maze, but the food stalls are quite good and supermarket is not to be missed.

High End!. A new, luxurious and high-end mall in Sukhumvit, Bangkok. Great for window-shopping, not so much for actual shopping! The cineplex is great, and the food-court is pretty good too. Worth a visit when in Bangkok. But if you want to do budget shopping, there are much better alternatives.

Shopping trip/Food. Excellent location from hotel. Something for everyone, great for beauty therapy, shopping, food, spotlessly clean. Lots of genuine "poor" people so you need plenty of change
Difficult to cross the roads, need to use overhead walkways because the traffic is a nightmare

Huge and style mall. Everything to me is class and top notch by ASEAN standard.Nothing of this mighty crowd seen before even in my country where everything is affordable to them, not expensive and not cheap either but the urge to buy and buy.....Many outlets to choose good and fantastic shopping for those who have not seen a shopping mall of such ...Food court is big and has all the varieties to fill your stomach and even indulge after doing "marathon " in the mall.Price of food not really expensive in such premium mall I would say OK lah or okey ...Something I don't see elsewhere or any other countries I have visited is the table provide hygienically sealed toothpick free flow if you are cheapskate, sorry to say that...you can even discreetly take dozen and dozen of it to use when you are back home, must give a thumb up to this brilliant guy who recommend this good idea to the management.The cleaner is so efficient ,their eye prey on the patron and will "attack" immediately and clear the table and even usher us to the vacant table.Game centre is another place to visit drawing large crowd many games available and charges is reasonable and affordable.Their prize (stuffed toy) of the game is of quality with your prize big or small they give nice bag to carry and proudly displayed Siam Paragon when you walk with it also got style men....Easily accessible a must visit when in Bangkok.
The best I have seen in Thailand. There are a lot of high end stores if you like luxury items. We spent several hours here. The place is big. Don't miss it.

Easy to get lost and shop forever. This is a super sized shopping centre with many additions for families and foodies. There is a great range of shops and price ranges, but I imagine many miss half the centre due to its size. Located at the Siam stop of the Skytrain, both Skytrain lines are perfect for reaching this impressive centre. A must if you want to purchase non-market clothing, electronics, books etc.

Very expensive high end mall. This mall has all the top high end designers under one roof. From Louis Vuitton to Prada, very nice to walk around but far to expensive compared to the UK. You could even by a Rolls Royce if you had the cash. Not really a practical purchase for Bangkok. There is an aquarium in one of the lower levels and 4d cinema on the 5th floor so all in all a lot to see and do.

Too expensive for me but fun!. Top dollar designer gear to be found here and at western prices. However, there are shops like the Lamburghini shop and the likes so it's a fun place to explore! The food court downstairs is much more affordable than the shops upstairs and with a really varied selection, try it!

Great mall with big cinema. The mall is huge. Shops are mostly like the shops in Singapore's ION or Paragon. Was there at night where most shops were closing. Managed to get tickets for a movie. Cinema is located at the highest level. Big theatre with comfortable seats. Will recommend this place for luxury shopping or late night movie.

High end shopping. A huge mall that have all the big brands and glitzy shops. It also has a large foot court and some nice resturants. Every thing in it speaks of class and the surroundings out side are the same. There is a nice sitting area with fountains outside where a lot of people just come to chill out listening to blaring music. Worth a visit

NOT gourmet at the Pomodoro Group. We had "Italian" food at Pomodoro Gruop, which was very far from gourmet and Italian. The bar was a mess, the staff where not very kind and the food was cold. We ordered 2 pizzas which where extremely bland. I realize that maybe pizza is not a Thai chef speciality, but it could have been so much better. We also had a so called "fresh tomato soup"....it was cold and tasted like Heinz canned tomato soup (maybe not even that good) It was the most we spent on a meal on our entire trip and it was so not worth it.

Huge mall, crowded though. This is one of the biggest malls i have been to. It has its pros and cons. First of all, you will find almost every brand here, but I guess for me the prices were too much to buy anything from there.I enjoyed the IMAX, 4D movie and Ocean World. The IMAX is fantabulous, to say the least. Ocean World was good overall.One of the biggest hassles is getting back to the hotel from there. You have to stand in a long line to get a taxi which is a bit hectic. Overall, it's a great mall with lot of avenues and options for enjoyment ranging from brands, apparels, movies, and miscellaneous things like Ocean World etc.

Glitzy mall for designer goods. Siam Paragon is the most upscale mall in Bangkok with a huge selection of designer & luxury brands. While most of these goods are beyond the budget (even after factoring in 40% sale at place such as Hugo Boss) but is a great place to do window shopping. The food court is one of the biggest that we have seen with an amazing choice of cuisines. There is a large aquarium (Ocean World) in the basement of the mall which is a great place for kids. A good place to spend a few hours in Bangkok.

Stay the whole day -- something for everyone in the family. If you're travelling as two families with 4 children ages 3-9 to Bangkok, make sure you block off at least 1 day at Siam Paragon. For parents, this mall is heaven -- at the basement is Ocean World, like Hong Kong's Ocean Park (minus dolphin/sea lion shows and roller coasters) but fully air-conditioned, with boat ride on shark tank and underwater photo op; on the fifth floor (different side) there's Kidzania. It was our kids' first Kidzania experience and compared to Kidzania Japan, in Bangkok there's kids ticket option to play all they want. In parent speak, this means at least 6 hours of educational playing (kids will need more hours to participate in all careers). Shopping wise, almost every imaginable brand is there including the fanciest car brands, such as Bentley. Feast your eyes on food choices. From food court to restaurants, there is surely no hungry tummy. What can I say? Every imagineable good thing is under one roof in Siam Paragon.

Luxury Mall. First, many reviews are wrong. There are 3 Malls: Siam Discovery, Siam Centre/Mall and Paragon.Many Reviews treat them as one Mall which is worng.Paragon is the most luxurios of the malls. Mostly with higher Brand shops like Channel, Versace etc. Its nice to walk once through, eat something, visit the Aquarium and maybe buy some Cosmetics / Parfumes otherwise there is mostly only expensive stuff.

Huge Mall with Designer brands. Everything here with the exception of food is expensive which is not surprising because there's many designer brand stores. Many variety of stores here from clothing, electronics to furniture. The food court and gourmet shops is like food heaven! There's many different cuisines. You can find many good food to eat here before heading off to the convenient adjoining Central Mall by walking across the Skywalk but you have to do it in the heat (it's not long if you walk quickly). I like the idea of using a card like a gift card to buy food and when your return the card, any unused amount is returned to you.. Though some of the clothing stores in Siam Paragon don't have good fashion, you don't see people walking around wearing clothes like that. There's also the movies on top floor (like Central World), too. I really enjoyed visiting Siam Ocean World-it's a must do here.
Interesting. If you like shopping, you'd like this place. It's just like takashimaya or ion in Singapore. Do visit the gourmet street below for some interesting local food.

A shopping attraction with something for everyone. Need an inexpensive pen that writes well? Looking for the best available ingredients for making Thai food? How about a selection of restaurants that ranges from KFC to superb Thai cuisine, and everything in between? Hoping to show the kids an aquarium filled with coral reef fish and many other denizens of the deep? Take a date the the cinema, with luxurious, and private, seats and a monster screen? Looking for books in English, Thai, or Chinese on almost any subject that strikes your fancy? How about upscale furniture, or Thai motif decorations for your house? Or perhaps you would like to purchase a Lamborghini, a Porsche, or a Morgan? All of that, and much more, is available at Siam Paragon, an exhausting, excessive, intriguing, and diverse spectacle of consumerism seeking to reach its excessive limit. You might not end up buying the Rolls-Royce for sale at a mere US$3.5 million, but it's fun to look at and trying to imagine what somebody had to do to be able to afford that ride, or many of the other luxuries available. Thank goodness for the food court, where you can enjoy a quiet cocktail or pastry or ice cream cone, or bowl of noodles at a reasonable price, and watch the world go by. An amazing way to spend a few idle hours.

Super chic mall. The furniture places, design shops etc here are super amazing. Forget the food hall...try the many other stalls in the gourmet section that serve better food (and not much more expensive either) or the many excellent variety of restaurants around the ground floor. The supermarket is a dream - imported items are super fresh and cheap (compared to KL).

The place to shop and hangout. Access to the mall is really easy, just use the BTS and stop at Siam Station, follow the signs, and there you are, inside a mall that a blend of luxury and classiness on top of being huge (2nd biggest mall of Thailand after CentralWorld).It is really nice to walk inside, everything is well located, and make access easy to all the stores and parts of the mall.There is a cinema complex (Paragon Cineplex) inside the mall at the 5th floor, and the Siam Pavalai (one of the theather) is really impressive (1200+ seats).They have a great good court, where you can choose from a wide variety of food. They use a card to that you top-up with an amount of your choice, do not forget to give it back the same day if you wish to get the money remaining on it back.As for stores, a lot of designers store such as Chanel, LV, Gucci, jewelry, electronic, shoes, sports stores, they also have a store where you can find Thai handicraft, ideal for souvenirs. Let's not forget Siam Ocean World, the biggest Aquarium of South-East Asia, well, they are definitely not lying, worth a look.

Luxury Shopping mall. Very luxury shopping mall there. It was big and luxury place. All branded stuffs were inside there. Very enjoy the shopping at there.
Recommend for those who are looking for branded stuffs.

stunning mall. absolutely huge. Very pricey. I much prefer the malls where you can bargain but def a must see.I did go to the cinema. Tickets were expensive but comfy seats. There are like 3 diff pricing structure for seats in the same cine. For example you pay more to sit in the centre of cine as those are considered premium seats. Toilets at the cines were verrrry nice.

Designers..designers. If u're a big fan of designer brands, this place is definitely for you. LV, Hermes,Prada, Jimmy Choo etc etc you name it, all the brands are here. But if u're on a tight budget, then maybe only the cooling aircond in the mall is for you. Just like me. ;)

Interesting food court. Once we figured out the food court purchasing card idea it worked out well. You have you pay the cashier to put credit on a food court card, the sellers do not accept cash. We had Tom yum soup with noodles which was actually very tasty and surprisingly cheap. The mall is pretty huge and the cinema is in a separate complex.

The best commercial center in Bangkok.. Siam Paragon in Bangkok (Skytrain stop Siam) is certainly the best commercial center in Bangkok.Beautiful luxury boutiques of the best luxury names of the world and plenty of cheap restaurants as well as more expensive.We have made good bargains in August, month of sales. For example a child Lacoste polo costs only 22 euros instead of more than 80 euros.A must see !

A nice upscale mall. Being in the center of the mall area of Bangkok, it was not surprising to find Siam Paragon to be the most expensive of the bunch. Here, you can find authentic brand name goods for expensive prices. This is the place to shop if you are looking for something more than knock off goods like the next door MBK mall.
A Perfect Complex to Be!. It was an amazing experience. Roamed around for hours, still I feel I'll be back there again & get amazed again & again.

Best shopping experience. The last time visiting Siam Paragon was more than 6 years ago. Extremely impressed by how Siam Paragon has been able to maintain its ability to still awe me.High end boutiques throughout the mall, food related products at the basement and cineplex right on the top floor.It even has a swanky car showroom within the complex itself located at one of the mid level.

Super shopping place. Visited there in August and found the place to be excellent for shopping. A bit of a upper class shopping center comprises of a super cinema on the 5th floor. A one stop shop I would say and is a great shopping complex.
creme de la creme. thailand's pride! bangkok's gems! welcome to siam paragon, a luxurious retail mecca in bangkok but with a price!!!
Fantastic shops.. Wow. This shopping complex takes your breath away. Many shops on many floors. All varieties of clothing, electronics, shoes, anything you wish for all under one roof!

Excellent top class Mall. If you want to check the power of Asia, go to visit this Mall where all boutiques have its place and burn your Visa. It is nice even to visit and not going shopping. Some boutiques have queue to enter.
Amazing. Rolls, Lamborghini are present as well.

Worth visiting. It has almost everything you might want, from clothes to food and groceries and even cars
However, the food there is not the best choice available, unless you wanna pay several hundred dollars for dinner

Pretty much full retail prices. The prices in the mall are very much full retail prices you would get back home, so there are no cheap stuff in here. If you are at Siam Paragon and have nothing to do for a couple of hours i would actually encourage you to go for a movie! And above all you get to experience the Thai King's part that shows up before the movie. Remember to stand up! It's a great cultural experience.

Go, even if only to eat!. Great shopping with all the high street brands! Nt for souveniers and bargains! Paragon mall has many stores for many different goods! There's a home section, a kids section , a car section, tons of electronics shops and more! The main thing to do is hit the food court for some of the best local cuisine! You can tell how good it is just by the amount of local Thai people eating there! Yummmyyyyyyyy. Don't forget the gourmet food mall for some of the best Asian snacks and delicacies .

Huge & best mall in Bangkok!. Absolutely love the convenience of this place being next to Siam BTS station.Gigantic place having a brilliant H&M store, branded labels (Hermes, Burberry...) on the main floor and car showrooms (Lamborghini, Rolls Royce, BMW, Maserati) for the public to view!There is also a well furbished cinema on the top floor and a newly opened Fitness First gym (good for travellers who want a workout and have an international club membership).Cafes and good restaurants are aplenty here not to mention the nice basement food court (although food is mediocre).A must visit is the supermarket which houses thousands of products and fresh fruit. Never fail to make this my last stop to bring some goodies back home!
If you want branded stuffs. This is the place if you are looking for LV, Coach...But there is also uniqlo and H&M for affordable prices.

Top Mall in Bangkok. One of the biggest (and most expensive) mall in Bangkok. The perfect playground for those with money to throw away. Branded goods outlets are everywhere in this mall. They even have a floor dedicated to luxury cars.Very well maintained mall with ample parking spaces with great food and beverage outlets.Certainly a place to visit when you are in Bangkok, if you can afford it. If not, still a great place to do some window shopping :)

Best Upscale Shopping Mall in BKK!. Bets upscale shopping mall in BKK- with great selection of restaurants and shops! High end but deservedly so, this is BKK's best for me. I notice though that even how nicely made the mall is, its surrounding is very bustling and prone to heavy traffic.

Love shopping? Must visit it!. Diversity of the shops, brands mixed with the people's attitude and design adn the size of the whole shopping center makes it an unbelivable place to go. SHops are just great

Luxury mall ... don't tell your bank manager you're visiting. After visiting a couple of the more familiar malls we decided to pop in to Siam to have a quick look around.Siam Paragon is full of high end luxury shops and brands, after a lottery win you could easily go berserk and blow the lot.Worth a quick visit, tourists passing thru (who don't have private jets) are unlikely to buy much!

best shopping mall in Bangkok with great food. I was a little shocked to see such a large shopping mall, and equally shocking is the fact that there are so many people all across, many tourists come shopping to this mall. I think the price of stuffs inside the mall is just too much. They are overpriced, but the quality of brands is worth buying. The food inside the mall keeps you occupied. There are so many cuisines, in fact, I came everyday to Siam just to have the food.

shopping overload...if you have the money. The place was huge and we actually got lost inside. My wife virtually shut down when we got to the shoe section. LOTS of selection and all the well known brands where represented. When we visited this place there was a sale so you can imagine if your a girl on a shopping spree here.

Fantastic mall. Shop till you drop! Everthing is available, from cinemas, resturants, shops, cars trendy, luxury and the department store is huge there is also an aquarium and madam tussad wax museum. You can easily spend a full day having lots of fun especially when its raining outside. Highly recommended.

Worth a visit. Its a very well built mall. There are mostly designer showrooms here so if you want to buy from top designers this is the place to be. There is also a big electronics store on the 4th floor. I bought a TV from there and it gave me the maximum discount.The store also had a VAT refund counter for tourists. There is a decent food court with variety of cusines.

window shop, see a movie, go bowling visit the aquarium(fee) or even sing all under the same roof. First off, I love seeing movies at the Paragon. BIg theaters, clean, great sound system. You have so many choices of movies, theaters and even an IMAX screen!! The prices of movies depends when you go and the seat you pick.( bring a long sleeve shirt because it does get very chilly in the theater). I've been to the bowling alley on a number occasions and found it clean and trouble free. The mall itself carries all the name brands that you could ask for and none are low end!! Prices are expensive, so don't think you can find any bargains!! Even the Paragon department store is expensive. The food court on B1 has lots of choices and not that expensive if you pick thai food. I like to spend a few hours window shopping and seeing a movie whenever i visit Bangkok.Easy to get to from the sky train.

Wau what a shopping paradise!. I visited Siam Paragon shopping Center today. I was mainly interested their Gourmet Foodstore. In Berlin there is KDWE and in London Harrods and in Paris Galleries Lafayette. All have exelent food department. I was stunned for selection of all products. I wish Finland would be bigger country to have someting like that. Spices all kind from Thailand and all over the world. If this is not enough, go to the restaurant level. So many people and so many different cuisines. We found Mexican what we missed so much. There it was Margaritas and Fajitas etc. We spend one hour only food related department. Yes I see Maserati, Rolsroyce as well to buy if you have thick vallet.You could live in this magnificent place without leaving the house never.

Spend some time here: It just might surprise you. I went here with a friend on my first in Thailand, largely because my friend wanted some luxury shirts and I figured that given my jet lag I'd last longer in an air conditioned environment. I thought I'd defer any insights into Thai culture until I was rested enough to brave the Grand Palace and Wat Arun.What I found instead was a panorama of contemporary Thai consumerism,itself based on that mothership of consumption, the USA. The Siam Paragon however, is a mall like no one in America ever conceived, with Lamborghini and Rolls Royce showrooms, a audio salon where a sound system could cost as much as one of the aforementioned cars and enough luxury goods retailers to put any mall in the US to shame. Throw in SouthEast Asia's largest aquarium and you've got something for the whole family. Pair this mall with the MBK Center and you've got the high a middle of ground of consumerism. Go to the Patpong Night Market and you'll have plenty of low-end consumer culture, too.What I really found captivating, and ultimately very educational, was the food court area in the basement of the mall. My firned and i must have spent a hour or more just walking through the food vendors before settling on something to eat. Check out the unusual (for American tastes anyway) baked goods, such as the green curry naan, and the chicken curry buns, survey the unusual desserts, the list goes on. Not to be missed: MosBurger -- Japanese hamburgers like you've never had them before.

Mindless Consumerism to the MAX. Siam Square, giant shopping mall, next to giant shopping mall, across the road from giant shopping mall and to top it off, Siam Paragon, proof of mindless consumerism to the max, part of the Siam Piwat Group operating shopping center and retail business including Siamparagon, Siam Center, Siam Discovery, Paradise Park, Loft retail shop and other prominent subsidiaries.Come and see it, while it and the fraudulant banking system our society is based on lasts.

is there is any michael kors store. hi i will be going to bangkok this september, and i just want to know if there is any michael kors store ,or is there is any oulet store that selling a GENUINE Michael kors wallet or bags? thanks..

expensive but loved it. If you are looking for branded stuff, then this is the place. I also loved the food it had, extensive area spread out with many different kinds of food restaurants. However, buying stuff is quite expensive at Siam. I was at Siam just before the Christmas, and the entrance of the mall was decorated with a huge Christmas tree. The whole mall looked gorgeous.

Great mall!. The mall is huge with so many facilities. Rows of branded boutiques, upscale restaurants and department store are the main fixtures but they also have a really nice supermarket along with an excellent food halls. The mall also have a nice aquarium for the kids to wonder and modern cineplex for you to try if the weather outside is not too friendly. But my personal favourite is their traditional Thai snacks vendors right in front of the supermarket. If you have a weak stomach and too afraid to sample Thai snacks from the road stalls/market then this is the place to go. They have every little parcels of goodness from banana fritters to thumb-size sausages to coconut milk pancakes for you to sample (sorry, cannot remember the names, just the taste). You should try them out! And oh, the mall is a stone throw away from Siam Kempinski Hotel and have direct access from BTS Siam station.

A great place to shop. The added attraction, if you have young kids, is the aquarium, Kidzania and the cinema.The food hall has delicious food and it's all extremely clean. Highly recommended if you want to spend some time with the kids but. It melt outdoors.

Huge New Mall. Definitely the best of the Siam malls. New and ultra modern. Seaworkd is in the basemenet and is costly but the food court is worth a visit. All kinds of food available and pretty cheaply.Good range of designer stores

Upmarket mall. Interesting place to "people watch". Lots of designer fashion brands in this mall and a huge department store. Some smaller shops in amongst the international chains. Food court in the basement has a good range of cheap food - buy a card from one of the booths as the food stalls don't accept cash and get get any change refunded after you have eaten.

Expensive shopping but Bangkok's best mall by far.. With direct access from Siam square BTS you can easily spend a day here if a shoperholic. Well laid out with huge range of shops, but what sets it apart is the basement food court which has something for absolutely everybody. The designer shops are of course very expensive and no bargain halls here. Great bookshop and HiFi floor with all the specialist names and prices to match of course. Also has a large aquarium though did not visit.
any food you want. all you could think of from any country , high class to hot dog stand , great market and bakery , lots to see and taste.

Great Mall. Siam Paragon is definitely 1 of the best mall's to visit in BangkokIts connected to Siam Centre, Discovery etcThe Mall itself is very well equipped with all world class facilitiesYou name it, and all the boutique brands are available hereincluding a Rolls, Maserati, Lamborgini etc showroomsPrices are not any much cheaper than what we get back at homeAmple selection/variety or food availableCinema was great too.A great place to spend a few hours..

Nice Mall. I loved the food selection in the basement of the mall. The gourmet supermarket was my favorite place - lots of goods with lots of opportunities to sample many different types of local tidbits. The mall boast a huge range of goods - my husband and I particularly enjoy browsing through the home-ware section in the mall.

Great shopping mall. Siam Paragon is connected to Siam Discovery, and all the Siam(s) that are beside it. They take up a whole section of the same street. The prices in the mall are very much full retail prices you would get back home, so there are no cheap stuff in here.If you are at Siam Paragon and have nothing to do for a couple of hours i would actually encourage you to go for a movie! For about 7USD, you'll be given a seat that's really comfortable with lots of leg space. And above all you get to experience the Thai King's part that shows up before the movie. Remember to stand up! It's a great cultural experience.
Wonderful Mall. All your favourite shops and more. The best food court I have ever seen. Spend a day here easily. The cinema looked great too. A little oasis.

The place to dream. Here they have everything from Lamborghini to toothsticks. its a special place to walk around and to see a lot of the best products. Clean and always a Theme . This time it was Orkideparade. Beautiful

the best. We did some shopping at Gucci @ Paragon recently and though it's just another mall with a huge multi-storey department store. There are some good brands and labels there and some good discounts on selected goods too!
Very expensive. Everything is super expensive. They sell lambourghini and Bentley in the shopping mall... Seems like H&M is the most popular store.

Go for the food!. The shopping it uber-luxury (Chanel, Prada and so on.) That can be had in any top mall in the world. The gem of Paragon as far as I'm concerned was two fold: 1) Siam Square location connected to other malls and close to local stall shopping and 2) Ground floor food choices. Massive collection or western and eastern sit down restaurants and a great food stall (but sanitized) collection of local Thai and regional Asian cuisine. For the stalls, you buy a prepaid value card at the desk. If you don't use all the money, you can get it refunded same day. Local Thai dishes for the equivalent of $2.50. Yum.

Window Shopping. Not much can buy here but The Siam Ocean World is located at the Lower Ground Floor in this mall worth for a visit. Before proceed to SOW, make sure fill up your stomach at the foodcourt here. Go to the counter and get a prepaid foodcourt card before placing your food and drinks order. And you just need to return the foodcourt prepaid card to the counter to get your balance refund.

Large and modern shopping mall, definitely worth a visit. A very large and modern shopping mall.There was a food court at the ground floor. Many restaurants on the ground floor as well as at the food passage on the 4th floor.A lot of upmarket shopping.Siam Ocean world is located at the basement. Kidzania Bangkok is also located in this Mall.Very conveniently located, next to Siam BTS.

Nice but expensive!. We usually go to Siam Paragon for special occasions. It is a tourist, expensive, high-class, and busy mall. It is crowded at food court. The foods are good. The movie theaters are nice. We like to go there by sky train or car.

Great variety in a huge mall/dept store. One of a number of major shopping destinations off the sky walk, Siam Paragon was a two time destination on a short business trip. Lots of electronic stuff, good selection of clothes, and the sixth floor had a very good selection of home goods, including packable ones. Head for Exotique Thai for a nice and good selection of local home ware, some interesting contemporary takes on thai clothing, and arts and crafts and jewelry. Some great food options on the sixth floor and in the basement. If you want to take things home or back to your hotel, I'd highly recommend the upscale grocery in the basement. Wonderful selection!

The best in bangkok so far. It's inarguably the best shopping mall in bkk, everything in there! Quite upscale too,first floor dedicated to all the cuisines around the world,upper floors to all the rest of shoppinf needs, enjoyable
Great!!!. Shopper's haven in Bangkok; and it surprised us to find them selling Lambos and Rolls Royce inside the mall! Amazing...and the foods great

Looking for a great bookstore or just a high quality gift to take home - check out the 4th floor!. Siam Paragon is one of a group of large malls that connect to the Siam BTS. You can wander from one to another. However, if you are looking for the largest bookstore in Bangkok (with English titles as well as others), head to Kinokuniya on the 4th floor. If you are tired of haggling at the street stands and want something special to take home as a reminder of your trip to Bangkok, head to the area known as Passages. Here you will find beautiful metalwork, wood, wood inlay, and silk. The quality is high so do not expect rock bottom prices. There are also some very good Japanese restaurants on this floor as well.

Good food court. The food court is good. wide selection at reasonable prices. you need to buy a pre-paid card and buy your food with the card.unspent amount can be refunded on the same day.there are also many shops in the shopping mall. Siam Ocean world is situated here at the basement. children will enjoy it very much.

Foodies -check out the mega supermarket at the bottom. I spent hours (I kid you not) walking around the bottom of Siam Paragon in the giant supermarket looking at all the stuff. Any foodies out there will love it! For a meal, jump out of the food court (remember to get your food court card before trying to order anything). The food is delish and cheap as chips.Must-do for foodies!(H&M and Zara are well worth a peek too on the second floor)
Best place in Bangkok. Paragon is the best place in Bangkok for meeting friends, shopping, getting hair done or beauty treatments, even eating here is good because every restaurant is here!

Really High end. I'm having nice experience shopping and eating there. They sell nice clothes,brand new, and reduce my stress lot! The grand food court is crowd but multicultural people, no wonder of it because the grand food court sell very delicious food, I recommended to eat korean food there, try to buy Kyochon's chicken It's chicken you've never had before and I bet you would like it especially for super junior's fans.

Great shopping experience.... ...a perfect mall for experiencing shopping on a huge scale and without having huge crowds of people. And, the food court has a great selection of eateries which are all really nice, and looked fantastic.

Not User Friendly. This is the least user friendly mall ever. It is so massive and there are not any "stations/ signs/ pamplets" that provide directions. The first floor is filled with high end boutiques that are so crowded you can not even get in IF you happen to find the store you are looking for, they only allow one person in the door per sales person so unless you want to wait in line forget it. In the food court downstairs they had these amazing counters of local food however NO seating unless you were dining at a specific restaurant so one had to eat standing up, these are just a few of the reasons we left and never went back.
Best place to shop. We loved shopping here as it was a huge mall with all kinds of stuff, both high end and middle end. Their food court is also another big plus when you visit the mall.

nice place for shopping, but expensive!!. I visited siam Paragon, but clothes were more expensive than MBK, JJ mall, Platinum fashion mall.. I liked the toys shop (big one) for toys (in 3rd & 4th floor i think) i could found kids laptops & electronics that i haven't found somewhere else. Also, the Siam Ocean world looks great. Food court was big with all tastes as well. I believe it's worth a visit (especially if you've children ), but don't expect bargain clothes from there..

excellent food court!!!!!. I did not really shop in Siam Paragon (other than at Uniqlo, which is an excellent clothing chain), but the main attraction for me about Siam Paragon was the AMAZING food court downstairs. They call it the "Food Hall", and for good reason! The selection of food stands took my breath away! There are so many different kinds of choices: 1. desserts, both western and asian, including Japanese style ice cream, french patisseries etc 2. traditional thai dishes 3. bakeries 4. chinese restaurants 5. indian food 6. korean food 7. japanese food 8. fast food chains, like burger king 9. coffee e.g. starbucks..... My eyes were overwhlemed by all the amazing colourful dishes, and my nose was in heaven from the lovely aromas!! Some food outlets I really liked: 1. toast box: this is a Singaporean chain I believe that sells thick toast with kaya (coconut) jam 2. bread talk : this is a bakery chain with yummy asian style western buns (yes, sounds funny, but you will understand when you see it.) I am a big bread fan so these two places made me happy! The supermarket is also amazing and has great souvenirs. (e.g. spices, teas, coconut oil, beauty products using Thai ingredients.) This is definitely my favourite mall food court in Bangkok!! You must try this!! It can be very crowded though so just take care of your belongings.The washroom in this mall is very high class and are very well maintained. The other stores in the mall are nice too (high end) but the main attraction for me was the food!!!

Big Luxurious Mall. Home of many high end brand's store and variety of food. It's located in the middle of Bangkok busy district and it's connected to the pedestrian sky bridge. There's a lot of restaurants and cafes to choose from and the walkways are nice and big.

Great Mall of Bangkok. This is a huge mall with high end shops (Louis Vuitton, Prada, Hermes, among others) and a great food court on the ground floor with lots of international choices (there's a Starbucks!) and local Thai restaurants and establishments. Air-conditioning is good which was a relief after coming from a tour under 36 degrees Celcius of heat and humidity. At the lower ground floor, there's a grocery but I was surprised to find some items more expensive than the ubiquitous 7-Eleven (there were 3 7-Eleven stores right next to our hotel). The ladies at the information desk were very helpful and the toilets were very clean. You should know that after a tour, you can choose to be dropped at your hotel or at Siam Paragon. Choose the latter and extend your tour of Bangkok with some retail therapy.

shopping heaven for girls. I'm a shopaholic and this Mall has got it all . The aspirational big labels like Prada and soon to come Miu Miu will make you drool and for the more realistic wallet the Paragon has lots to please the savvy fashionista. They have regular sales and if you buy over 6000 baht worth of goods they help you claim the vat back. They also run a tourist card scheme so you get an extra 5% discount. I got a dress, skirt and accessories to match and once all the discounts added up I got the lot for the original price of the dress. Again the choice you get is amazing and the thai designs tend to be colourful, super feminine cute and unusual.

Great gourmet food section but no quality bargains to be had. The cheap stuff was on sale but the quality stuff - of which there is a great selection is actually more expensive than buying in Europe. Geox Italian Shoes that I paid 115 Euros for (aprox $230 NZ) worked out to be $250 NZ here. The gourmet food section was great.

Busy as always. This mall is always bustling so it seems like it's business as usual - but service at the anchor tenant (Paragon) definitely has fallen - it's perfectly fine when you're paying for your purchases etc. But it's when you're out there browsing and trying to make a selection, the sales attendants are aplenty - but they are all busy talking among themselves and don't seem interested to assist at all. It's like "Oh, this one is just looking, so no need to bother". I mean, we get a lot of that same attitude at the stores in Malaysia, so it was always refreshing to shop in Thailand where service was much more warm and friendly. Now it seems like things are going the same way in Bangkok - I found the same poor attitude among the sales attendants at Central stores as well. What a pity!

Expensive!. Up-market and designer's labels. Expensive place to shop. Food there is good though... General ambience - classy & crisp. You certainly won't see ppl pushing trolley-loads of goodies here!It's just beside the Siam BTS, so location is definitely great!

Upmarket!. What a mall it is! Huge and Amazing! All branded stuff,from flashy cars to high fashion, enormous food court with great variety, Siam Ocean World, and lots of places to sit when you're tired! The same group has 2 other malls - Siam Center and Siam Discovery which has Madame Tussaud's, all located in a row and equally flashy! Great place for window shopping (not a place for 'authentic' experience though, for that there are other markets). So do visit even if on a budget just for the heck of it!
Excellent mall!. LIKED: amazing food court, enough stores to shop around with beautiful people all over the place!DISLIKED: nothing!

A great place to chill and find quality goods. This is a very up market shopping centre with a huge department store which sells quality items. I went looking for a food processor and they had many to choose from and some on sale.Great food, coffee etc. A good place to escape the bustle and heat of Bangkok.Lots of things to do all around this part of town and it is on the train line so very easy to get to.

Bangkok's VERY BEST Shopping Paradise !!!. What ever you want & what ever you dream of ... you get it at Siam Paragon! And if don't have enough money for all the luxury brands, it's still like a museum trip .... & you have very good food, cafés, SPA, Beauty, Cinema, etc .... Come & enjoy ... perfect for a Sunday open till 22.00 PM ... that's exactly what Bangkok People like to do!

Gourmet food market is a foodie shoppers paradise. Awesome variety of high quality, organic dried fruits, fresh local produce & unique packaged items presented in clean attractive displays that are a shoppers paradise! Convenient to have an opportunity to collectively purchase everything at one location!! Very smart idea that both locals & tourists benefit from.also a large food court with tables to allow dining closeby.

A must!. The complex of Siam Paragon, Siam Center and Siam Discovery is teeming with energy; live musical performances, interactive exhibitions, amazing food courts, shopping at all price points and just such a huge part of Thai pop culture, you have to visit. Perfect for a rainy or sweltering day. Come late afternoon/early evening to feel the pulse and on a Sat or Sun for your best chance of seeing a pop or rock performance.

Fancy western style mall. Beautiful mall with lot of western style stores. Not the place to bargain shop. I guess I didnt come all the way to Thailand for this kind of experience. Prefer the street malls with real Thai people and culture. The AC was nice on a really hot day and I found a Starbucks for my coffee addiction.
Rodeo drive of Thailand. Fancy mall with high end name brands...only good for people watching and checking out thai hotties. Name brands in Asia are like 20% more expensive than America
Beautiful mall. Even i dont like malls, this is very beautiful!Try even a walk on it. I didnt check the stores thought. There are cafes and rivers inside. Very good atmosphere!

great mall and movie theater. location is central and easy to access through train, also have directed connection from y\train station - really huge, and the movie theater insdie is huge - i saw Iron man 3 in 4Dx - was a superb experience. good dining options in the ground floor.cheap and good taste.

Bad experience!. I hate this branch in Siam Paragon! We went there last weekend, it took time for them to get our orders...we ordered two main dish and two fried rice. Its been 40 mins, the other table next to us ordered at the same time and they eaten and left the restaurant and we are still there waiting! We've been waiting for my fried rice to arrive and Im starving to death specially I'm pregnant! Until I decided to walk out! The manager didn't even explain or do something to make us feel better...he just said ok go go its free and push us away! What kind of system is that??? If you are a manager you should find a way to make the costumer feel better. It was your fault in the first place! I don't recommend this place! Specially this branch!

Large food area. Only manage to stay 2 hours in this place. But first thing that impress me is that the whole Ground floor is filled with nothing but foods. So there lots of variety of foods to try. Easily accessible from the Metro station, right besides it. The basement is the sea world (I did not go in). The department store is huge with all kind of products.

elegant place to stroll. if you are looking for an elegant mall where there are less crowds and cool signature brands in Bangkok, then Siam Paragon may be the best place for you. The place offers a great number of stalls that you don't see in other malls in Bangkok. This is a good place to shop, dine or simply hang out.

Mixed high to medium end mall. Became quite the shopping institution since it was completed a few years ago. It's a large mall with a department anchor store, with all the requisite brands like Armani, Gucci, gap etc. the prices are usually higher than the US and europe though, and maybe even singapore and hongkong. apart from these, it's got an aquarium that you can visit if you really can't find anything else in Bangkok to do. The food court is also interesting especially for non-Asians as the variety is much larger than the western hemisphere.

its complete entertainment. Its an amazing, cool and perfect place for shopping, fooding and entertainment. You will get everything there starting from a packet of chips to Rolls Royes. Almost all the brands of the world are available there. You can enjoy 2d, 3d, 4d movies there. There is also an underwater world which is very attractive. When you are visiting the place, you will think that you are really roaming under a big ocean. I have visited many countries and malls, but have never seen such a great and wonderful mall like "Siam Paragon". All kinds of foods are also available there- western, eastern, local............

This mall has everything.... I spent quite some time in this mall to escape the Bangkok craziness, although really by going there I put myself right back in it. It's crazy crowded...if you're from the US and have ever been to a mall right around christmas, it is like that times 5. It is by far the biggest mall I've ever been to, there isn't anything that you need that isn't somewhere in that mall. The food court is actually just a whole floor of different restaurants, with everything from Dairy Queen to authentic Thai restaurants. No matter your taste, you can find something you like there. I would avoid the basement aquarium, I thought it was horrible. As someone that has gone to many different aquariums, I thought it was by far the worst I've seen on my travels. The rest of the mall has name brand stuff you can find anywhere else. This mall isn't cheap, if you think you're going to come from another country and find great deals...you aren't. I did a lot of comparing prices there versus in the United States and they were about equal, and some things such as Apple products were actually more expensive. One of the most interesting things about the mall is that even though they are blaring american music, you will not find a person that works there that speaks english. Trust me I tried finding a face shaver and stupid me forgot to at least take a photo of one and bring it when I came. So if you're looking for something in particular, you would be wise to either have a photo of it or be able to mime what you need. It sounds ridiculous, but when you're in a mall that big it can save you a lot of time (and I'm speaking from experience).
High end shopping. do go if you are well to do as luxury brand name is all over the place such as LV etc etctry the 4d cinema but it is often fullthe bowling is funthe mall is big with helpful guards

On of the best!. This is a very nice mall, and it includes the Paragon Department Store, that also has all the right brands, and a very nice sports mall inside. The mall itself has everything, more upscale shopping, but also lots of nice offers. Connected to Siam Center and Siam Discovery.

Expensive shopping compared to MBK but great window shopping!. High end shopping complex with ritzy brand stores but amongst these are some reasonably priced stores catering mainly for mid-high end shoppers. We had dinner here on two separate nights at two restaurants which were reasonably priced. Great selection of sit down restaurants on level 4 & a fantastic food hall on lower level towards Siam Ocean World which has an amazing range of food & you can choose seating around amazing fish tanks! We also watched a movie on top floor at Cineplex which is just huge compared to Australian cinema standards. An enjoyable place to spend a few hours!

Best food hall in the World!. It's hard to describe how excited I get when visiting this mall. I love the lavish decor and the scale of the high end shops but my favourite spot is the mega food hall. It seems to go on forever and covers about every cuisine you can think of. It's my food heaven in Thailand and have spent many happy hours sampling different things. I'm sure the shopping is also amazing, there are floors of fantastic shops but I never seem to spend much time in them.....

Best shopping mall ever. Hugh, lavish, with a lot of restaurants.. The title says it all. You can find everything you need here. It has well-organized zone for super-expensive stuff and a separate zone for something you can actually buy as an ordinary person. I went here a lot just to have dinner since there is so much variety to choose from. The location is very convenient thanks to Siam BTS Station. If you want some greater variety for food, visit the nearby Central World.The Uniqlo and H&M stores here are good for clothes shopper. Also, if you have some time, watch a movie at Paragon Cineplex as the cinema here is probably the best in the country (and among anywhere I have been to).If you come in the evening, this place is super-crowded. Parking is really hard to find, so prepare sometime to drive around hopelessly before being able to actually get out of the car.

Amazing Food Hall. I am giving it a high rating based purely on the Food Hall. Definitely worth the visit. The rest is just glitz and glamour and of little interest to the average tourist. Excellent supermarket I would liken to Harrods. No roasted scorpions on sticks or deep fried grasshoppers to be found here, just an abundance of fresh, interesting, appetising fare.

High-end shopping but when there is a sale, it's worth it to check it out!. I happened to be there during a sale of shoes and handbags and got a good deal at 50% for Scholl sandals. Really worth it! All the high-end brands are here but the Paragon department store has a mixture of goods that would cater for mid to high end shoppers.

Amazing design!. I just fell in love with the design of this shopping centre! I think I took more photos in here than of my whole trip! Unfortunately the style of merchandise (up-and-coming Thai designers) didn't suit me or the sizes didn't fit (I'm a tall Western woman). It was still really worth a visit. (And it was a great respite from the April heat.)
Window shopping at it's best. One of my favourite malls to window shop, there is just about every high end fashion, jewelry or toy to be found here, from Ducatis to Rolexes.

Swanky mall, good food court, and a GREAT bookstore. We always spend some time at Paragon each time we are in BKK - the food court has a huge range of different kinds of food, which is great if you are in a group and some want Thai, somone wants a burger, and someone wants sushi. There is an H&M which sells (some) Western-sized clothes. The Paragon department store also has some really good shops - and the maternity section at Mothercare is really good for Western-sized maternity underwear! The clear favourite thing in Paragon is the large bookstore on the 3rd floor - a great resource for the book-starved expat, and it's not just stocked with airport-lit either - a huge classics section, as well as contemporary fiction, a good non-fiction section, with political/economic/geographical/anthropological titles. Also a great kids section. The movie theatres on the top floor are really lux - expensive - but so much fun to splurge if there is a good movie - VIP comfy sofas, a blanket and a big tub of popcorn - bliss.

Designer shopping. This modern and stylish mall wouldn't look out of place in Beverly Hills, LA. all the designer stores you need are here (Cartier, Hermes, Louis Vuitton, etc) plus there are some great restaurants, a large food court and premier supermarket.

Good selection of shops, and extensive food court. Siam Paragon is located very close to the MBK centre, and can be accessed via the BTS Siam station. We enjoyed the selection of shops in this mall, ranging from designer to many branded shops and a good departmental store. There are also activities to keep children interested, including an aquarium and a good Cineplex.There is a great food court with an extensive choice and variety of food. T
Heaven for Kids Toys!. Planning to visit Thailand? ~~Family trip? Then if you have kids, and want some toy for them~~directly visit to Siam Paragon center~~its thye exact place :)

Prestige mall. Branded stores for sure. Huge selection of food at the lower ground food court. Just drop off at the siam bts station. You also can walk to mbk.Dont forget to try the cineplex in here. The best in its class. It has imax theatre.You will love it. This place always stick on my must visit place to bangkok.

Not bad. Go if you are looking to kill some time; you want to eat at the food court; or if you don't have a mall at home. Food court is great if you;re traveling the skytrain and don't want to eat in the temple district. Otherwise you can skip this. It's really just a big mall.

Everything you could want. This is a huge Mall with both high end and normal range stuff.. it also has a fantastic food court area located on the lower level.. it must be seen to believed,,, there is also a wonderful supermarket down there

Beautiful shopping place. Located in the most crowded street of the city, the Siam Paragon is among the top luxury shopping centers in town. Every thing in side is beautiful from shops, goods to .. the staffs. However, like any other modern shopping center around the world, the goods are repeated with most famous international brands such as H&M, LongCharm.. The price is not cheap at all.I try to find a longcharm bag to complete my collection but it was more expensive than I bough in UK.

Upmarket shopping mall with lots eating places. This mall is linked to the BTS. Alight at Siam. It's an upmarket mall with shops like Prada, Gucci etc. There's an Oceanarium for visitors at a fee of 900Baht per Adult.Head onto the Exotic Thai which is on Level 5. You can find all Thai made products. We bought lots of aromatherapy stuffs and managed to claim VAT refund. You'r spoilt for choices as there are many restaurants and cafes on Level 5. But be prepared to pay a little more.For cheaper options, head onto the basement level where there are many eateries plus a food court. We bought lots of Thai street snacks from the eateries which is much cleaner. There's also a supermarket called Gourmet Market. We bought some Honey Thai mangoes at the fair to bring home.For those with younger kids, Kidzania (from KL) just opened on Level 6. It's an indoor play area for Kids as old as 12yrs.

Great customer service!. My friend lost her shopping items when we left the Siam paragon in a taxi, We back to the customer service in Siam paragon, the response from the staff was very polite & fast. They showed us the CCTV in the taxi stand and we managed to find the taxi driver and the taxi driver sent back the lost items to our hotel!! Really a delighted experience in Bangkok!!

Very Good Shopping Centre. This contains many high end shops (I would recommend you go to MBK for shopping though) but it has two things which make worth a visit. First, a very good food court and, secondly, an excellent aquarium, which my daugther in particular enjoys (I like it too apart from the snake....). This is part of a line of quality shopping arcades that run from MBK to CentreWorld - I suggest visiting when the sun is very hot so you can keep cool.

Very Glitzy Shopping Mall in Centre of Bangkok. The Siam Paragon is a very glitzy Shopping Mall. There are many shops and an excellent Multiplex Cinema with 15 large theatres and one having the biggest screen and seating capacity in Asia. There is also an Aquarium in the Paragon (The largest Aquarium in South East Asia), a Concert Hall, an Exhibition Hall, an Art Gallery and a Bowling Alley and a Karaoke Centre. This Mall is worth a visit.

Really beautiful shopping centre!. We visited this shopping centre during our stay in Thailand and it is definitely a sight to behold - it is very modern and looks brand new! Although the majority of the stores in this shopping mall were out of our price range, we did enjoy walking around and looking at the centre itself. There is also a very large food court so a wide range of choice for places to eat. We visited early evening, which was a really nice time because we still had time to do excursions and sight seeing during the day. Would definitely recommend, if only for window shopping!

My favourite mall in Bangkok. The food court is fantastic, its not TOO huge (unlike Central World, which is just enormous) and it has a great department store. Well worth a visit. A/C is great when you are hot :)

Shopping Heaven. For those ladies, Siam Paragon could be heaven for most of you. Excellent spot for especially when you are looking for cheap clothings. P/S Always ask for discount when you purchase items from here. You will always get a better and lower deal if you ask.
wow mall. its the place where all the fancy shops are here from all over the world ! from Armani to LV to whatever u think of. they have a very big aquarium in the mall go see it as its worth it

great. well,to be honest,we first went to mbk shopping centre! but we found that everything was fake and low quality so we decided to go there,in siam paragon. and there,we found a great environment full of high quality original stuffs! on the other hand, everything was more expensive .so the place suites those with a pocket full of bucks. there are as many as four floors and hundreds of stores,from perfume to pencil case...stuffs are quite uniqe and finally,i enjoyed it a lot!!!!

5 + Star Shopping Centre. The Siam Paragon Shopping Center is the flagship of the Thai Mall Group. Almost every top brand name, clothing, electronics, sport cars in the World has an outlet here, there is a world class aquarium in the basement and a multiplex cinema on the roof,access is easy via the Sky Train.The restaurants cater to most tastes, ranging from fast food to fine cuisine.

Excellent foodcourt. The food court at Siam Paragon is huge with many varieties of local food available. The food court uses a card system, which cuts out a lot of hygiene issues related to handling cash. It is a clean and organised eating area where plates and bowls are cleared away promptly by the food court workers after meals. There is also a napkin dispenser on each table which comes with complimentary toothpicks. This is a plus for all diners.

Fancy shopping centre. Paragon is easy accessed, it's clean, bright, modern and there are a lot of shops!When I was younger I lined up to get into night clubs, then I lined up for football and theater tickets, but I bypassed the line up at Louis Vuitton at Paragon.The shops range from super luxe to affordable. I was in the market for a new handbag. I felt the sftest lamb skin purse ($2,500), the shiniest Prada bag ($4,500) and settled on a lovely leather French made handbag for a lot less!The department store is comparable to David Jones, with one exception, staff who actually want to assist you!The food hall is exactly what is says, a large space with lots of food. Excellent quality (we had dinner at the Indian restaurant)I visited a fabric store that made me swoon.Paragon is great if you want a break from the heat, the flea markets and touts!

Great place to spend time & money.. its a big and beautiful mall. Loads of eataries. there is an indian restaurant we liked. the range of cakes & their decoration was mind boggling. Beautiful high end shops to window shop or spend your money in. the oean world in the basement is really nice. kids had a great time lookin at various fishes. they come in all shapes and sizes, from big to small, cute to ugly. got to see sharks from the glass bottomed boats. it was nice. not spectacular. but really nice. i found the sting rays very mesmerizing. the penguins were cute too.

Everything you need under one roof.. Everything you need under one roof. Lots of places to eat and drink from cheap to expensive. Air conditioner very cold so do please take a cardigan or wrap for your shoulders. Taxis available for drop off and pick up right outside.
lots of shopping. Gorgeous mall! Lots of upscale stores, some unique and some brands that we have here in North America
beautiful shopping. I experience beautiful shopping and was so big and very good layout many many good things to buy here and I enjoy so much come here many time
expensive mall. expensive mall with not a great selection of shops but does have a huge department store where u find almost everything on lots of floors

Gourmet Market. We were lookingfor organic foods. The Gourmet Market has a wide selection both local and imported. Store is large and not very logically organised but comprehensive. The food courts at the mall on the ground floor are also numerous. We ate at the Asian Cuisine area where you get served and pay a bit more. What a massive mall. On a Wednesday early afternoon the place was packed with visitors.

bhai re bhai its endless. its a place to keep in your travel list and it will take a whole day. acquirium, shops, movies, foods you just name it and they will throw that to you. you can run but you cant hide :Dwe spend one very eventful day here

LOVED the Food Court. We didn't do anything but eat in the food court in this mall, but have to say it was one of the best meals of the trip. The selection of counters and sit down places was huge. My two teen boys and I were all able to find exactly what we wanted to eat - prepared to order and delicious. They were thrilled to find liquid nitrogen ice cream. My only regret is that we didn't have more of an appetite to try more of the selections on offer. Literally, this is a world apart from any food court I've been to in the states. And, hate to admit, I enjoyed my meal here for $4 more than my lunch at the Mandarin Oriental that cost me $40.

Siam Paragon, a place you must visit!. This is a place for high end shopping. It's very big and crowded most of the time as it is just next to the Siam BTS. There is a wide selection of food eateries, stalls and a few restaurants at the basement. You must visit the gourmet supermarket also at the basement. It sells a wide variety of merchandise. We especially love the fruits there!

Nice break from Bangkok. Place to get yourself centered, get a DTAC SIM card so you can use your phone, get a good Thai meal, use the web at a internet cafe, find books etc etc etc Easy access via the subway !
Very chic. But very high end of the market. I suppose I would have liked to be able to shop there. Not difficult to get confused and think you are in either Bond Street or Champ Élysées .

must visit while in Bangkok. got all you need from lowest to highest ends. the super market is unbelievably complete. we stay at evergreen place nearby which has kitchen and been buying fresh food to cook on our 4th-5th days...

Siam paragon the pride of bangkok. This is amazing mall, with the luxury things and class things.I think zara store here is better than the one in central world, I spent 5hour to discover this mall, have many interesting things for a shopping alholic

nice place for shopping. a nice place for shopping, clean and convenience. Staff are helpful and know how to speak english, there is 2 mall that connect with paragon, siam center and siam discovery. If you are sophaholic this place is a nice place, high end product and branded are everywhere, even if you plan to buy a car, u also can visit this mall. Lambroghini, Ducati, and porche are all here. Overall, a nice place to visit and look around.
Nice. Liked the variety of restaurants in it. Didn't have much time to do shopping there but enjoyed the supermarket which has a very good range of products. Enjoyable.
Nice upmarket mall. You might enjoy the markets but sometimes its nice to get some air conditioning. All the big brands with some local variation. Good food courts.

Luxury spot in the heart of Bangkok. I believe you can find all the brand name things from here, kind of a very big department store. Since it is in the middle of a very crowded traffic, keep in mind that people are everywhere especially prime time.

Shopping galore. Siam Paragon is a great place to shop and eat. It has any number of designer and standard shops as well as an extensive food section which cater for all tastes from western and asian takeaway to any numbers of sit down restaurants, although there seemed to be a large number of Japanese style eateries. There is a dumpling restaurant on an upper floor whcih was extemely popular. In the same bulding there is an aquarium which is said to be the biggest in asia, so this gives you an idea of the size of this complex.

high class shopping for the upper society. the siam paragon is the biggest shopping mall in thailand, maybe in whole southeast asia. unfortunatelly it is not allowed to take photos inside the mall. the exclusive ships offer a whide sortiment of luxery goods for horrible prices. because everything is so expensive not so many customers frequentate this giantic high class shopping mall and it was very nice to have a little bit more space like in the other shopping malls. we went there maybe for 2 hours to look around, but we bought nothing. for mall fans a must!

Impressive but expensive!. They definately know who to design shopping malls in Bangkok although it was very expensive. I found the same shirt I bought in Montreal at the Gap for $8.00 on sale and it was there for $30.00 on sale. Of course they probably have to import stuff but very expensive and tiresome because I am not one who has a lot of patience to look for hours for bargains.I prefer this mall than the Terminal 21. The food court was great and all the fun ice cream places.Definately worth a visit and if you have giftings in shopping, you would do better than me!

Expensive Mall, air con turned off early - sweltering pit. Siam Paragon is a very impressive mall and department store - all the high end shops etc and lots of food outlets.
