They advertise being open until 10pm - but they turn the aircon off at about 8.30 or 8.45 - the place rapidly becomes unbearably hot. For the prices they charge they should at least give their shoppers a level of comfort better than the street stalls outside which are a fraction of the price. They can afford to keep the aircon running until 10pm - disgraceful customer attitude. There are plenty of other malls to go to which don't do this.

On the Higher End. If your looking for cheap deals, this is the wrong place. If your willing to splurge then be here. Shopping is very much on the higher end with alot of designer labels. The Ocean world is located at the basement and a must visit if your bringing kids. BTS Siam is located just right outside the mall so getting there is definitely not an issue.

Very upmarket. Shopping centre like no other.All the designer names and more.The ocean world is fantastic & the food court is huge & not expensive.BTS station is infront of centre,so it is very convienent.I also like all the car makers & their showrooms.The cinemas is spectacular & I like the IMAX theater.

Expensive shops but good food court. Seems to cater for the high end tourists and rich locals , this place has all the designer labels and expensive shops. The great thing is that the food court is very clean and has a lot of variety of foods. There is also the Ocean World which is definitely worth a visit. This shopping is quite easily accessible by the train.

Best place for shopping. Definitely its the best place for shopping, ground floor full of big brand and good collection, then others floors full of different level brands which for sure can find what u need. Underground have ocean world and big food court,restaurants also around, there always crowd but still can find a place to take a rest during shopping. My husband and I can stay inside for 8hrs for shopping, tough but still comfortable and easy to find stuffs. Best option for shopping in Bangkok.

fantastic mall right next to the BTS. This is a large and elegant mall with lots of shops and nice interiors. It is attached to a BTS station so it is very accessible. You can shop in comfort here, because the air conditioning is good enough to withstand the heat of Bangkok, and the variety of goods is amazing. In addition, they have a large food court that sells practically everything under the sun. You can have your pick of cuisines and they all look delicious! The pad thai at the Asian station is the best I've eaten in Bangkok! There are also stalls selling fruit juices and local delicacies, so it is a nice place to go to if you want to sample the local food but want to be sure that it is clean and sanitary.

A fun place to see (and shop) if you have some free time. I stopped here for dinner after a day at the Jatujak market and I was glad I did. It's next to the BTS (sky train) and you can easily access a taxi or tuk tuk. This place is huge! There is a large sound stage out front where performances are held. There are many floors and it's a lot of high end shopping but I went to the food court and got some great Thai noodles and soup still at a reasonable price. You can really spend a lot of time people watching. The bathrooms are easy to find and clean and there are many elevators and escalators. It's worth a look if you've got some time to spare, even more so if you have fat wallet. Bring your camera, there is so much going on you're bound to snap some fun photos.

Big brands in the mall, bigger wallet in your pocket. The most glamorous mall Bangkok, it has all the best brands and if you have a big wallet on you, you are going to love this place.Big brands isn't all, you'll find other great brands as well, like Zara, H&M, Mango, etc.This mall is huge and is connected to the other small Siam malls and also connected to the skywalk.Of all the malls, Siam Paragon probably also has the best food court. Its not as big as the one in CentralWorld, but it probably is the best in terms of the variety. Compact but not congested.

star stud in crown of bkk. its like a diamond in crown of bkk. everything in under single roof. me being an avid golfer loved this place and since i could c my maserati on the second floor i couldnt ask for more. must visit.

GREAT SHOPPING MALL IN BKK. Modern shopping mall, full of designer shops to independent boutique's.
Zara to Gucci.
A great mall with a super food hall to end the shopping.........

Glitzy Mall - Good If You Are Into Brands. This is arguably Bangkok's most glamorous mall with all the high end brands under one roof. There's even a sports car sales office here!However things are quite costly here (even the foodcourt! You can eat cheaper and better elsewhere in BKK). If I want to visit such malls I'll find them aplenty back in Singapore or in most cities.I visit this mall for a cool respite, admire the pretty ladies, or use the bathroom. Other than that, I'll rather be elsewhere in Bangkok.

My favourite shopping mall in the world!. I spent a lot of time here, I loved it. The restaurants and cafes are endless and all good, it's easy to get to and close to all the other shopping centres. The food court is a must - very cheap, plenty of choice and lots going on all around to look at. It really is my favourite mall in the world.
Huge. The mall was huge with all the possible brands you would know. The collection was up to date and exceptionally good.

Class of its own. This shopping mall is a class of its own. It has a fair number of branded outlets and it also is home to the famous Tank store located on the 2FL. SPORTS MALL ZONE of this mall. It is not only an ordinary mall, but it also has a hotel named Siam Kempinski hotel. Though I didn't stay there, I liked the fact that this mall is spanking clean. Love to go there again.

Ahhh.. what a mall. a very beautiful and a very high end mall. too expensive because it has all the brands like LV, ZARA, HS etc...all those who are going to siam ocean world,its right beneath the siam paragon mall.

Great mall... Most of the shops in here are expensive but it a great place to visit and has a huge variety of shops. The food court is excellent, with a good choice of dishes. Easy to get to on the BTS too, definitely worth a visit while in Bangkok!
Expensive. All sorts of branded shops here and expensive. Nothing much local. Much like the Vivocity back in Singapore. The food court has an excellent selection of food .

Mall, Food Court, WaterWorld.... Paragon is not just a Mall...that ofcourse it is, probably the best in Bangkok, but expensive. But the food court in the basement is where you could eat to suit your pocket. There is also a food market and loads of food stuff from all over the world.If you are worn out shopping, relax in the courtyard alongside of the musical fountains.The water spray will also help cool you down, as its always hot in Bangkok. The Mall also has a WaterWorld attached to it. The kids will love this paradise of water creatures, fishes, plants and even a snake, which lies coiled over a tree stump, and can be touched and petted.

best mall in Bangkok.. this has to be my favorite mall in Bangkok. the stores are more on the high-end, but the selection is amazing. all the big stores are located here and even a luxury car dealerships. you could easily spend an entire day here shopping without even knowing it. right off the Siam BTS which makes it easily accessible to everyone. Paragon is massive as well as it boasts 6 floors. if you're into people watching then it's probably one of the best...lots and lots of good looking folks shopping around.
Shops Galore. 6 Floors of Shops and then more shops.Fountains and loads for the kids to do.Don't forget to claim your tax back.
Nice Mall- Exp Price. Though the Mall has all the brands and is beautiful- with competition in the city there are many more Malls opening up and have better prices than them now

siam paragon is the best mall in thailand. Siam paragon is propably the most popular shopping center in bangkok, and one of the biggest in the country.Apart from a long list of world class brand shops, first class cinemas , a gym and many other attraction, is has the biggest selection of restaurants and variety of foods in any one single mall in thailand, most of them in very high quality and reasonable, not to say redicious, prices. Christmas time is one of the best time to visit, and of course the whole place is lit with extraordinary ligths, as can be seen in this video :https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qSXnNOJ-i0YAccess to the place is very hard by car, and not reccomended to take taxi cause the traffic is bad, but very easy to get there by BTS, with direct access from the train to the shopping center..https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qSXnNOJ-i0Y
Good shopping. Good shopping place. we were lucky to get hold of the end season sales. Got some very good deals. Plus tourists can claim the 7% VAT refund on the shopping bill.
Very nice and modern. The shopping mall is pretty much the same as any other large cities ( Dubai, Paris, London, Sydney), very nice and modern, however a bit pricey. The food court was fantastic
A multi-purpose destination. Good for food, shop, entertainment (the ocean world), all in one easily accessed lcoation via BTS skytrain and in the heart of Bangkok.
Got Money - Will Spend. A high end luxury Mall..even if you no longer have the big bucks to spend here...you may still find a bargain...

high end...nice place to people watch and the food court is divine. I love the food court..very stylish restaurants...good selection...you can have your fill of Bangkok street food too. It does get crowded though..but its a very interesting place to people watch. Enough mix of tourist and locals.

Amazingly Big, lacking savings. Very big mall that is worth seeing in Bangkok. Stores were more expensive than I expected, but I think that is the higher end of shopping in Bangkok. Had a great bookshop and food hall!
Good place for food, cinema and shopping. Good place for food, cinema and shopping. A lot of choices on food and lots if brand. Easy to reach by BTS

Where are the smiles?. Generally I felt the service staff (information counter not necessarily Siam Paragon) are not as cheerful, friendly as expected to be. As new travellers to BKK, we did asked friends whom have visited BKK (often) and they do agree, that the level of friendliness is now hard to comeby and lacked the lustre, unlike how it was years ago.

Good place to shop and eat !. A very famous mall in Bangkok, it is a must for tourists, especially the "water world aquarium".
Good location and with all the brand name shops in the mall. The food court, atrium restaurants and the supermarket is highly recommended.

Barbara Barry Store is here!!. Amongst all the branded store that they have in Siam Paragon, my wife is too excited about Barbara Barry furniture store in Bangkok. This mall is also equipped with muslim prayer room. There is a huge food court with wide selection of food to choose from. Look out for the Halal-certified food stall at this food court. However, the mall need better air-conditioning system as the few times we were here, the mall was quite warm.

playground for rich Bangkokian kids. It's a suberb shopping mall, with all the major fashion rip-offs. If you know your way through the maze, find Kinokuniya, the best bookshop in Asia. The basement is just food, and the various smwells mingle to make you vomit.Keep your wallet or plastic close to your skin - it's easy to spend it all.As an alternative, I suggest surrounding malls like MBK or even Chatuchak Market.

Classy mall.. Reminded me of the Marina Bay Sands. Stores that would put a hole in your pocket lol. Plenty of varieties and I fell in love with their grocery store. Wonderful honestly. They provide cooking service on the spot and have great options :)

Shoppers paradise.... Where to start?! This mall is huge and has pretty much anything you would want (except Gucci :(). In saying that, there's a lot to look at and if you're not an advanced shopper (like me) it can be quiet overwhelming. I was like a kid in a candy store and went a little bit nuts! Remember to take ID so that you can fill in all your paperwork to claim back you VAT. Another great point is if you spend over 2000thb in the Siam Paragon Department Store, you can claim the VAT for all purchases. So it's worthwhile making a few purchases ;)The luxury brands will do your VAT paperwork for you, while purchasing through the department store you'll need to go to a VAT claims counter. There were two on the food court level, but staff will happily direct you there.The food court is great. There was a Chinese restaurant we ate at (I think it was red dragon). But Fuji is also a great place to eat at (if you like Japanese).

A nice shopping mall.... This place is more or less the same as KLCC in Malaysia.However, this place is well decorated with Christmas decorations.The Siam Ocean World inside this building was very interesting and nice to visit.I like the food in the food court.There are lots of selections for food and drink in the hypermarket inside this building. The atmosphere in this place was nice albeit it was crowded with people. I think I will return to this place and try out some delicacies that I have missed

Comfort shopping mall!. I really like this place although it was well-known for its luxury goods. But heck, I came here for the atmosphere and their food. The first place I love to go will usually be the basement where they sell all the finger food at an affordable price; there are a great variety of them and you don't even know where to start from! After that, me and my gf will usually settle down at a place called Jelly Jan at one of the upper level for their tasty cupcake and hot drink. You don't really have to buy the goods here to feel great, the mere experience of just going around window shopping is sufficient for us. Hence, a great shopping mall to chill out at, and not to forget they have really fine restaurants, which are also pretty affordable and consist of great ambiance. Overall, a must-go if you're here at Siam!

Upper class shopping. If you are after the real Chanel stuff and not the fake this is where its at. you dont se many tourists here but it has all the legitimate shops and good resturants. its less crowded than MBK but still pretty busy.

Yet another temple of commercialism.... Why go hear when you can go to the same shops anywhere in the world. The place is so sterile it could be Houston, or Frankfurt or anywhere...I suppose if you want to witness firsthand the rise in Asian consumerism then stick your head into the 3rd floor with the Porsche, RollsRoyce, Maserati dealerships.. then get back down to street level and shop in some real Thai shops!

The top luxury goods mall in Bangkok. New York has 5th Avenue, Los Angeles has Rodeo Drive. In Bangkok, there are tons of places to shop. From street stalls to floating markets as well as malls of varying quality and selections. But when you want to get GENUINE luxury goods (Gucci, Prada, Channel, Versace, etc. (you know the deal) there are only a few malls that have what you need. The largest and most extravagant one is Siam Paragon. All the names are there and then some along with the Siam Paragon department store which carries all of the American (brands from Diesel to Reebok) and Asian brands of clothing, electronics and kitchenware. There's a Blackberry store as well as a Nokia and Sony stores. There's no Apple store, but there are at least 3 stores on the 3rd level that try their best to keep Apple products in stock such as the Ipad mini and Iphone. The food court has almost every kind of food you can imagine. Mostly available in sit down restaurants. The Mandarin Oriental has a restaurant here as does the Four Seasons. For quick bites there is McDonalds and Burger King or Krispy Kreme! On level 5 there is a multi-screen cineplex and an IMAX theater! Outside the mall there is the "Absolute" plaza where you can buy glasses of Absolute vodka drinks in various flavors from a vending machines after 7 pm. Whether you are planning to buy, or just looking, it's easy to get lost in the luxury and other distractions at this massive mall.

If you like shopping and food, you'll like this place. This place is huge! A lot of designer shops and reasonable prices compared to the designer shops here in Australia. Heaps of restaurants and eateries as well.There is Cineplex on the top floor if you have time to catch a movie.

Show me the money!. This is a mall for the rich so if you are just an average guy like me, just do window shopping.Still a nice mall to stroll around though with a good food selection at the ground floor.

The way a mall should be!. Just as the title says, with seven stories the bottom a marine park featuring scuba, shark swimming and weddings of course. The first floor is just an elite display of name brands which can get anyone's heart racing. They separate the floors by grouping similar stores on each level. So many stores it is very easy to get lost and or twisted around. A must see though!!

High end shopping, great food court. Most glamorous mall you will find in Asia if not in the world. Even if you are not into designer labels, stroll and take in the mall, have an afternoon tea at the peninsula cafe, watch a movie, and browse the amazing selection of Thai and world delicacies in the food court. A good leisurely place to go after a day's sightseeing.
Luxury place to go. Siam Paragon is confirmed a luxury shopping mall, full of luxury and there is a showroom of super-cars which you can have a closeup to your favorite cars~~
A mall for those with gigantic pockets... :). A lovely design for a mall. Has everything one can expect from a high-end mall.. Supercars, High-end stores, IMAX, high-end restaurants

The upper class of bangkok. This place is extremely elegant. It has your Chanel, Louis Vuton, Prada etc and is huge. All the high end places are here. They are a little cheaper than in Australia but it depends on the exchange rate at the point of purchase. You cannot buy fake goods in this place so don't come here expecting cheap handbags because they will all be 50,000 baht!

The upmarket mall. Unlike MBK Centre, if you're into designer items and branded stuffs, this mall may suit you. But then again, it's not just the shopping - there's also other attractions here; like the food court serving all kinds of cuisine + Siam Ocean World located on the basement floor.

Siam Paragon. Love the vicinity of Siam and this big shopping mall. For brand buyers, it is definitely a must for me everytime i visit Bangkok. Just walking around is always fun even if you dont actually go there for shopping and its huge food court in the basement is food heaven. Myself, I enjoy going to Orange on the 4th floor (?) and relaxing after a long day of walking around the city and having some sweets with a great view. The sea world is a great place and in my opinion is as well as or even better than the aquarium in london especially with its fish massage with the bull shark swimming in the background.

Classy, modern, spick & span..... After the hustle & bustle of shopping adventure in the "mayhem" of Pratunam Market...the Siam Paragon is like another world, as if you are caught in a time warp...sort of teleported into a clean, cool, modern and classy mall...with many international brands represented here. The shopping is what you will get in modern Singapore's Orchard Road...although the prices are not as low. Even Hongkong will give you better bargain for comparable shopping.To enjoy the VAT refund for your purchases, single receipt should be 2000bht and above. And passport must be presented. There's a great foodcourt with seafood, Japanese, local, western, etc ...at the basement...with payment for orders via coupons. However, be advised the foodcourt using the coupon payment system are within the foodcourt compound. Stalls outside the compounds accept the usual cash, not coupons. So do not be confused as not all outlets operate under same management.Certainly worth a visit for a few hours of branded goods therapy...for easy access, take the BTS and alight at Siam station...

Presence of international brands. It was a great experience and I could see well known brands from West available as far as Bangkok. However, the prices were much higher, perhaps because of high rental.
Food. Large food court with wonderful food choices. A wide variety of local, western and fusion food to choose from. Clean and good quality of food.
Classy. Very nice shopping centre with a lot to see even if you cant afford the stuff there (such as the car showrooms on level 4)

Nice place to look around.. Nice shopping mall with lots of shops to look around. Even if you can't afford or not looking for something it's quite good just to have a look around. Great food court with lots of different eateries from western to Asian! Even had a Krispy kremes!There is also a cinema & aquarium, I didn't visit these.

Great for cooling down and window shopping. Liked: The AC and the decorations. The Vanilla Brasserrie.Disliked: Outside of the food court, I can get cheaper food and merchandises of the same or better quality in the USA. For foreigners, the aquarium entry costs more than the great Monterey Bay Aquarium.

Good experience. You name the brand and you find it. Though shopping is not at all cheap here but the ambiance is good. The underwater world is a wonderful experience for first timers and Madam Tusad's is another cherry on the cake. A must go for every traveler.

Brilliant food court and gourmet market. Vast array of choices at food court! Clean, efficient service and good food. The gourmet market is one of my favourites with their excellent variety of goods. Always return to it when I go to Bangkok!

awesome mall. A visit by subway to this mall is a great way to spend part of an afternoon if you only have a short afternoon stay in Bangkok. The subway station is right across the street form the mall and you can easily ride to the Novotel airport hotel. This mall is at lest 5 times larger than the one in Water Tower Place in Chicago. You can see Rolls Royce, Maserati and Bentley cars for sale. Every brand of clothing known to mankind must be available here. On a Sunday afternoon, it feels as though all of Bangkok is either at this mall of trapped in a traffic jam trying to get to or from this mall. If you are hungry, there are many restaurants and foods to choose from.

for rich asians, but not for tourists. siam paragon is a huge, very expensive shopping center that sells everything that has a 'brand'....at prices much more expensive than in europe. the food section and market is terribly expensive, more than 20 euros for a simple meal! ok to stroll through and have a coffee somewhere when it's hot outside and you want to cool down, but a NO NO for shopping!

Big modern shopping mall with late night discount. We are waliking around 500m from national stadium station, just realized that the mall also has a bts station.Modern and clean mall, branded item (not fake) with a competitive price.We are watching a movie at the imax cinema, the ticket price is based on the seat location, very worthy to try.

Noisy and busy. This is a very large shopping mall. I admit that, but it is so very busy and noisy! Even in the large restaurant section you can hardly understand each other and it is too crowded there too. The stars are for the shopping possibilities. I prefer, however, nearby Central World.

Food Court amazing. We arrived late into Bangkok and the day's pretty much over except time for dinner. Our hotel suggested we check out Siam Paragon's food court. So many choices from self service, to reasonable restaurants to fancy ones, it's all under one roof. We didn't even have time to look at the shops. Oh well definitely need to return to Bangkok again.
Very nice. Not really a shopping centre person, but went to see a film - very impressive cinema. Modern, cool, clean, decent sound.

fantastic mall with glorious shops, cineplex. When you enter the mall from the skytrain, you are confronted with excellent examples of "green walls," which transition to a cool marble and glass interior peopled with shops ranging from the highest calibre (e.g., Bulgari) to the merely excellent (Paragon Department Store). The mall has a similar range of eateries. My favourite store is chabatik at 4F Paragon Passage. Their Thai silk art pieces are unique and very reasonable for the exceptional quality. The cineplex on the top floor has such comfortable seats that you will be spoiled for North American cinemas for ever.This must be the top mall in Bangkok for sheer elegance and diversity.

More than just a shopping centre. More than just a shopping centre, it is no surprise that the Siam Paragon is considered the pride of Bangkok. One of the largest shopping centres in Asia with over 270 different shops, restaurants, cinema, aquarium, concert hall, bowling alley, karaoke centre, exhibition hall and the Thai Art Gallery, so with a lot more to offer than just shopping!I warn you Siam Paragon is just a part of a huge shopping area which you would never explore in just a day. Siam Paragon caters more for luxury items for well off Thai's and international visitors but it is definitely the place to buy something extra special.This text is taken from my post on my Travel Tales blog.

very upper class shopping centre!. if you want the real thing you're likely to find it here no imitations and all your big name bargins like H&M, Zara etc are here! great place to spend your millions!

High End fabulousnes!. Yes, there are deals to be had at MBK and the Chatachuk Market but when you're looking for THE BEST in quality and selection this is the place to go.We've gone here so many times it became our go-to shopping center.It is also at here that you can catch a movie on the top floor at the Paragon Cineplex or Imax where we caught Argo and Skyfall

Huge mall. Coming from a country like Bhutan, where there are no shopping malls of that magnitude, it was a huge shock for me. I just couldn’t imagine that such shopping malls exist. Siam was a little too expensive than some of the other places around Bangkok.

High end mall in central.bangkok. We like the paragon shopping mall. It is quite big and modern. Very clean and good shops. Good movie theatre on top floor. And decent restaurants in food court one floor from the top.
High end shopping at Siam Paragon. Posh Mall and spacious but if you' re bargain hunting that wouldn't be the place to go. They have a very nice but small bookstore though.

Give a miss. Unless you are looking for high end stuff, you can give this mall a miss. Price tend to be higher here even for. Ood. You better of at central world which is connected by airwalk and about 10 mins away.The aquarium is excellent though..definitely better than SG underwater world or HK ocean park.Try to arive by 11am when u viit the aquarium since the feeding start at 12 noon. U can take the glass bottom ride and proceed to watch the various feeding sessions which arranged back to back till about 2.30pm.

Hadn't found our bearings yet. This isn't strictly a restaurant but a huge mall with a food court. The reason for the review is the cheapness and diversity of the food court.We decided as we hadn't found our bearings yet in Bangkok this was good for the first night. The shops here are no cheaper than the uk and in some instance more expensive, however the canteen part of the food court is very good value for money (£6 for dinner for 2). There are chains here also which are more expensive and so called high end restaurants but the canteen seemed to be doing more authentic food.You pay money on to a card then go eat, the card is swiped every time you make a purchase then at the end if you have money left they redeem it.No service no fuss and very cheap, I can see it working well if your there all day as it would cover a couple of meals. As for the food it's ok soup noodles, rice dishes, noodle dishes.For me it's on a BTS and close to Bangkok business district so was good for the convenience.

simply brilliant. Shopping in style, the variety of shops, designer rubbing shoulders with everyday department stores, a huge choice of places to eat, the choices are endless, you can easily loose a whole day here.

Great mall & Great food court. Located in the city center, Siam Paragon can be reach by taking BTS train and get down in Siam station. This mall offered you variety choice of items from clothing, bag, shoe, food and many more. It is definitely a place you should visit for your Bangkok modern shopping experience, and over here you are not only being pampered with load of brand and choices of items but also on food. Go visit their food court and you will get to eat a lot of local made food, do aware that this food court use a prepaid card system to buy anything but you can claim back unused credit so no worry on this. And do visit other restaurant that is here beside the food court, you will be furthered pampered as well. I tried Ging Kalpapruek located on Ground floor, food prepared is quite good but pricing wise is a bit high. After your meal, do visit the Ocean world as well, over there you can see wide range of wild life and insects. (they offer bundle package - pay 1 price and visit 2 location : Ocean world and Maddam Tussads)

Awesome. the food court experience was very well done and had a lot of variety, you really felt that you were not in a mall! How did they fit in the Ocean experience center in the basement! Great collection of shops to satisfy both window shoppers and compulsive shoppers!

Huge shopping mall. Though expensive, for me it was a very good place not just to buy stuff, but more than the goods, it was my place to have food. They had one section where they offered only food. It is a place to buy shirts, branded ones, and the prices were not very expensive. You don’t mind paying a little extra for foreign brand good quality shirts, especially on a visit to a different country. Most of the other items, however, were expensive.

This huge complex rates as the best shopping center in Thailand. Built less than a decade ago,this huge shopping complex dwarfs the original grounds of the famous Siam Intercontinental Hotel and open grounds where peacocks wandered the green park and enclosures.Now the complex has a huge carpark to cater for the thousands of daily visitors both tourists and locals who visit the top brand shops within,all found on the many floors and kept secure and immaculate.Top brand boutiques and jewelry stores are here in abundance dazzling the onlooker with gold and fine diamonds of the quality rarely found.Fashion minded individuals will have to look no further if they are prepared to pay the price.Cinemas and an aquarium onsite assure children will be catered to especially the richer Thai locals who are seen shopping here with their children's nannies in uniform following close behind. Short of money there are quite a few banks within the complex and lots of ATM machines.Security is very good but spare a watchful eye on your purse or wallet as such a place draws the occasional pick pocket due to locals shopping wearing their best bling,bling.Do not expect to bargain but to pay the full retail price for the privilege............................

You have to Visit it at least once. Very easy to get to by BTS Skytrain. Loved this mall, unlike anything I have ever seen, about 7 levels, 1st floor goes on forever, they have every kind of food you can think of, it is just amazing, anything. I had Indian food there and it was excellent (House of India), very flavorful, not too spicy but just the right amount, naan made to order, very fresh and it's mall food, in the mall and it's cheap! They have 5 star restaurants in there too, btw don't eat at Taling Paling it's like the McDonald's of Thai food, it's bland and disgusting. We found an Italian place up on the 6th or 7th level, excellent, This guy fr. Washington D.C. opened it up and runs it, very good service. You can spend an entire day in here, literally. They have a floor dedicated to electronics, some dedicated to designer wears, some dedicated to up and coming Thai designers, luxury cars, this place is really amazing. They had a place called Thanni I think, like a British tea place 5* with sandwiches, etc., very cool, worth it, do not go to MBK mall you will be very disappointed, go straight to Siam Paragon and other malls around the area, it's pretty interesting.

Excellent shopping Mall. Located in front of SIAM BTS sky train station, this amazing mall contains over 250 shops along with South East Asia's biggest Aquarium in the basement. A 16-screen Cineplex, and a comprehensive selection of world cuisine. Fine luxury shopping experience offered by world famous designer brands.
Good Shoping. All you need from shoping. Also Ocean World. I like the Food Court at the ground level. very good and enjoyable

Stunning shopping centre - designer galore!. Louis Vuitton, Chanel, Prada... if it's designer, you name it, it's there. Definitely not for those with little to spend, but well worth a look anyway. Lovely restaurants in the food court if you're looking for a snack, fairly well priced, too.

High End Shopping. This a a HUGE shopping mall located just at Siam BTS at Bangkok, Thailand. The building houses almost all kinds of shops selling electronic goods, high-end brands, supermarket, restaurants, food court, cinemas, services and even a gym and high-end car showrooms. The eatery is at the basement floor has a huge selection of food variety, all kinds of cuisines and even desserts. Prices are not really cheap as compared to what other eateries but you get extremely wide selection of choices. Good for shopping but just be reminded that this place is expensive to shop and dine at .

Just Like Malaysia's KLCC/Pavilion. Siam Paragon reminds me of KLCC or Pavilion in Kuala Lumpur. There are branded stuffs all over the mall. The latest addition to the brands would be H&M. Also, if you want to have some family activities.. there is Madame Tussaud Museum and The Aquarium. Do remember to purchase the tickets online because the prices are much cheaper online as they charged differently for local Thais and tourists/foreigners. If you love Pork Ribs, head over to Tony Roma's for some grilled pork ribs. Love it!

pride of bangkok. as its motto, really a good shopping center, i can say best ever in thailand and probably in southeast asia. if anything luxurious is not here, it probably is not available in thailand. there is even a lamborghini gallery in it!! besides, department store is also nice to find affordable things in a wide range of variety. 6.th floor cinema complex, food court and also a gourmet market is available in ground floor. and siam ocean world is also here underground floor!
Shop till you drop. Cheap, Modern and a good selection to choose from. The air con is a welcomed treat too. Better tan Siam!
Huge shopping centre. Shopping centre with all you need. Bought a camera in this shopping centre. Lots of entertainment for kiddies as well. Worth a vist.

great shopping plaza. always have a look around in here ,an eye opener if your from australiathis place is big and the movie complex up top is great and the lower food court will give you plenty to choose from..

Siam paragon was attractive but expensive. Everything about Bangkok attracted me, because it was my first trip aboard. However, Siam Paragon was too exciting for me, primarily due to the number of branded stuffs in each floor. And even the food centres - there were many of them - shop and eat, that could be the mantra. If you have money, then you can definitely make merry, but I did found the prices too high. I am not sure if that is the right place for the average buyer. There are other places, around in Bangkok that was much cheaper.

Great food choice but clothes are 25% too much. The food hall is the best ive seen for choice, there must be 200 places to eat. If you are travelling and need clean and safe food on a budget come here.
The shops however charge at least 25% more than the UK.

I like the food court :). I am just a budget backpacker so shopping is not in my list, at all. Especially on high-end, designer products. Nahhhh... I went to Siam Paragon to watch a movie after months of traveling. I like the cinema, very posh, very cozy, very comfy and not too expensive although the ticket is slightly higher compare to same standard cinemas in Malaysia. I like the food court. It is big and clean and also serves variety of foods at reasonable price for a huge mall like that. Not complaining at all. Much better than MBK, imo. Just I feel a lil bit bad for my Muslim friend as they only have 1 stall that serves halal food. Awww... The public restroom is super clean, too. Without any charge.

Simply massive. Siam Paragon is huge. There are all sorts of shopping options, and there seemed to be a few events going on when I visited. Easy access from the Siam BTS Station. It is one of several centres in the vicinity so Siam Paragon could be a part of the mother of all shopping sprees! Yet another interesting and jam packed mall in central Bangkok.

Just a usual shopping mall.. Is a shopping place as well as entertainment for high income Thai. Just like the shopping mall in other countries. Many products are imported. Don't go if you are tired of shopping mall.

for dining rather than shopping. This is probably Bangkok's premier shopping mall, but Central World may argue that point.Not a great shopping experience unless you are a lottery winner, but it is worth a wander for a couple of hours and there are loads of nice places to eat at OK prices.I can recommend The Fish Cafe for genuine fish & chips, Piri Piri for spice chicken, and Tony Roma's for the best ribs going.There's plenty of parking and it's free if you get your parking ticket stamped.

Huge shopping mall with lotsa food. 1 of the more popular shopping malls where there's lots to buy, and lots to eat as well~~Prices are not as cheap as wholesale prices at Platinum Mall but worth a visit.

Big nice Mall. Siam Paragon is a nice big mall. It has anything you are looking for. Money exchanges, Banks High end shops, normal shops. it even has a wonderful aquarium with in the building.There is plenty of help thru the concierge desks as well. There is a very nice theater located on the upper floor which has many cinemas that play primarily to international films of the day.On the lower ground floor there is a huge food court with fantastic food from all over the world.. it also includes western style cuisine Burger King Mc Donalds Subways and Starbucks as well as many many others. There you will also find a supermarket with an excellent choice of local Thai goodies as well as normal international products.In all, other than the aquarium, I would not call the Siam Paragon a tourist attraction but it is a very nice place to go. Its is also located directly on the monorail line. next door to central World (another great shopping center) and across the road from MBK (another great shopping center)

Just another mall. The concierge at my hotel suggested this for shopping. I was underwhelmed. Like the title says, it's just another mall full of stores you can find most anywhere in the US and probably most other countries. Even the designer stores are easy to find in larger American cities. Worth a visit if you're trying to kill time or need to find some air conditioning, but not really worth a trip in and of itself.
Big. Got everything.. It's a big shopping complex. Not much more to say!It has a huge selection of shops and the aquarium at the bottom is great. Also has a large selection of food.

Just look.. We came to look at this shopping centre one evening when it had started to rain, we used the skytrain to get here. When we had a little look around we quickly realized you need to be a lottery winner to shop here. All the designer shops are here.

Paragon shopping center. Thai Top quality commercial Center. Siam paragon (BTS - Siam) is the best and first place to visit if you have a half day off or if you are looking for an elegant place where to spend your cash and time. Excellent organisation, cinema available on top floor, restaurants and if you have kids visit the fantastic aquarium at the ground floor !! Top recomandation

Ok for a first visit. We came here for the aquarium on the basement level, which was satisfactory but not spectacular. The food court was large and disorienting, with good food in the mid-price range. The first floor is a haven for shoppers fond of luxury goods like LV. We gravitated more towards the huge bookshop on the third floor which is allegedly the best one in Bangkok. Overall, it is a nice classy place, and the best part is, it is connected directly to the BTS.

Shocking Service & Attitude!!!. I’ve been going to Paragon often for the past 5 years as it feels like any other shopping malls back at home (but for Thai living standard this place is considered up-market). Noticed that the service has been declining over the years i.e. The sales-personnel just stand around & look uninterested in serving the customers. Anyway I experienced it myself first hand, encountered the most unpleasant event at the ground floor perfumes section (Hugo Boss & D&G counters). I was with a Thai friend and we are just browsing through the perfumes i.e. doing the usual girls stuffs testing the perfumes out. First scenario: the Hugo Boss counter female staff was rather reluctant & unwillingly to serve us. So we ignore it & popped over to the next counter just beside Boss which is the D&G.Second scenario (the “highlight”): As we didn’t buy anything, the D&G male staff blatantly said in Thai “..why see if don’t buy… & added the ‘F’ word”!!!!IMMEDIATELY my Thai friend pulled me away from the counter & told me what the staff just said. OMG!! I can’t believe Paragon hires such bad attitude staffs!!!Overall, the staffs are totally lacking in customer service relationships i.e. politeness, willingness to serve customers, etc.. It seems the sales-personnel are just chasing the potential customers away with their bad attitude!!I have never encountered such similar bad service in my own country.

More of an upmarket mall with fantastic food hall.. Right next to a skytrain station in the centre of town means that this is one of the most accessible shopping malls in Bangkok. It has an upmarket feel about it but it wasn't quite what we were looking for. Clean and comfortable.The food court on the basement floor is amazing!!! Everything you could possibly want - local and international cuisines are catered for. All at a reasonable price. An oddity (at least from a Brit) is the fact that the food court operates on a cash card system. You purchase a card loaded with credit which is then used to buy food. Obviously any excess is refundable. Convenient if you plan on eating here on more than one occasion (a distinct possibility).

Amazing mall. Outstanding multioption cinema from the sofa on the Enigma lounge to the 4Dx experience.Food-court on the ground level with every possible choice you can imagine, from fast food to international at every level and for every pocket.Prices on the Big Brands stores are even higher than in Europe and you don't feel like you should debate on the price as you are not on a street market, but it puts you off if you want to shop for big brands clothing for sure.The Ocean world on the basement level was actually quite good, you can often get multiple tickets like Madam Tussaud and Ocean world for a good price too.A must see if you are in Bangkok

Pretty cool mall. Love the supermarket of this mall, I prefer this one than BIG C, though the price is higher.If you need to buy the food products of blue elephant thai restaurant you can get it here.

Good value food - with variety of different cuisine.. The food choice at Siam paragon and the ground floor really amazes u. There are a street food samples that are safe, food court that combines 2-3 cuisines and u can order them at a single table. Shopping is higher than average as u know this is Siam paragon. If u are new to Bangkok or Thailand some of the goodies are worth to bring home where they specify local produce. Things like durian chips, their mango slice, pork tidbits and etc...but of course if u have more time these items can also be brought elsewhere. This place is really accessible by bts (sky train) . U would want to avoid paying more on cab if u are traveling after hours of shopping. Plan ur time well to reduce transportation stress especially if u have elderly with u. Overally it is a major impressive mall , should be one of the most comprehensive malls in Bangkok .

An Impressive Mall. A must visit mall in Bangkok. It had all designer stores.....excellent variety of food court. Outside supermarket with wide variety of food, beverages and alcohol products. Classy mall. Its connectes to to sky train.

Huge Huge Mall. If you are looking for a high end mall with the largest possible number of brand name stores, this is it! So happen that they have a Timepieces Trade Show going on when we went there the other day. Was able to buy a new model brand name watch at a good discount. Make sure to get refund for the Tax Free Credit at the airport upon departure from Bangkok to another country.

Very impressive mall - very expensive too. The mall is a classic western style mega complex including tens of eateries, a whole level of exclusive shops, a multiplex and very good variety of shopping. However if you are westerner, prices for clothes shoes accessories and electronics are slightly higher than home.

Good mall but expensive, one of the world's best cinema!. Very good food court and food market, shopping is not amazing, it caters for richer Thai people and tourist i guess. I didn't like much stuff there in terms of shopping.But Damn...what a cinema! The Imax and 4D cinema are just amazing. i saw Batman in Imax it was amazing (take a seat far from the screen), then I saw bourne legacy in 4d...even if I was not crazy about the movie the 4D effect are really putting you in the middle of the action, particularly when car pursuit...and high action scene!
Five Star Shopping. You could spend the day enjoying this Pride of Bangkok shopping center and hop on the sky train to wherever you are going

A great place to shop and eat. Siam Paragon is an upscale mall easily accessible from the Siam BTS Skytrain station. You can find high-end stores like Louis Vuitton, Fendi, Prada, Hermes, and many more. So ladies, if you are looking to shop for a new purse, this mall will get you excited.In contrast to the high-priced items on the main floor, the Food Hall at the lower level offers a wide range of food choices at reasonable (or even cheap) prices.While we were there in August 2012, we sampled all the street foods at the Food hall; those that we were hesitant to try on the streets of Bangkok. The small Thai sausages were good, so as the coconut chicken on sticks, roti with condensed milk, and of course the Thai iced tea.

One of the 'Siam Trinity'. Clean, spacious, upmarket. This stretch of malls feels like home so we bought nothing. The youth seem to like hanging out around here too. Come in to escape the heat if anything.

Where you can enjoy a whole day. siam paragon is where you will be sure to find an interisying thing for every member of the family. Shoping is great, food court provides something for every tast pud, and kids of all ages will diffenetky enjoy siam oceanic world. If you have time for only one shopping center to visit then you wont be wrong to visit siam paragon

Icon Mall. This is like Bangkok prestigious mall, they sell premium branded items on the ground floor. The food court on the basement was full with selections of great foods.It also connect with one of the busiest BTS station.

Everything you can buy anywhere, unless you live in China or Iran. The mall is grand and stylish. It houses all the brand names you love that are most likely located in your local mall. This is not the high end mall but the brand name middle of the road mall. The mall for the masses.Unless your government suffers from an embargo or limits what can be imported you won't see anything new or different that what you could buy in your home town.Skip this mall and try the others like Grayson, Platinum, or MBK for something different.

Excellent supermarket and food court. Was blown away by Siam Paragon's Gourmet Market where you could buy all the Thai spices and curries you're looking for. Also a good place to buy food souvenirs.The ground floor is also a haven for restaurants and the extensive Food Hall where guests can have all the Asian food they want.I also like the fact that Siam Paragon and Siam Discovery have a complimentary shuttle service that brings shoppers from one mall to another - a welcome treat considering Bangkok's humidity or rain.

Simply amazing. I visited Paragon a few times during my one-week trip to BKK, and found it to be the best mall for a bit of everything. The food court floor is incredible, the movie theatres are a lovely haven for tired feet, and the Paragon department store had some great reasonably priced clothes (womens size 12 to 14 Australian). There were plenty of sale items, and the Thai souvenir section on the top floor had exquisite high-end souvenir items and clothing at good prices. I would normally shy away from places like this due to the prices, but maybe it's the great Aussie dollar at the moment, because every time I looked at a price tag my first thought was "Seriously? Is that all? I also got some really nice clothes from Dorothy Perkins, Wallis and MNG. My main disappointment in BKK was the tacky glittery costume jewellery, I got much better and more tasteful items at Platinum Fashion Mall at super-cheap prices.

Choice And Convenience, Not Bargains. The Department Store is huge (like the other big DS in BKK, Central and Zen) and you'll find more or less everything, same brands, same products, same prices than anywhere else. With a Thai Characteristic: especially here in Paragon, you will get 5% discount on more or less everything (in addition to other offers): so you can buy at fix price, but saving face. You get convenience and choice, do not expect great bargains: interesting enough: the collections of the big brands are the same than everywhere else: this means that on winter sales, you'll find a still good choice of warm garments (useless in Thailand, therefore unsold). Lots of staff, not necessarily useful. Paying can be a pain, redeeming coupons is definitely a pain. Crowded on weekends. The supermarket in the basement is great: you'll find all the Thai products: lot of Italian, Spanish, Japanese, Chinese... all what you need to cook in all the best world cousine. again, not cheap, but vast choice. Outside the DS, lots of fashion shops, luxury stuff, cinemas, restaurants, and Ocean world aquarium... you can spend all day into it, and still do not see it all of it: but this is neither the biggest, nor the most luxurious mall in Bangkok. Asian Tigers...

Worth checking for electronics. Paragon is famed for the International Brand Names in fashion, which are moslty beyond the reach of the average traveller. But after looking through several various kinds of shopping places for electronics, I think some good deals can be found in Paragon. Sometimes the deals are better than other aces famous for cheap electronics. But all the products here are genuine.

A nice place to eat. Well, there was no chance of me actually buying anything at this mall lol, but it was good window shopping experience anyway! Even though I couldn't afford to buy anything from the designer boutiques, I still ended up coming to this mall more than any other mall because of the Gourmet Food Market. The gourmet food court was affordable and had so many interesting and yummy things to choose from. And the cineplex is amazing!! This mall is HUGE

Awsome shopping experience - if you have the money!. This is a huge shopping mall opposite Siam Square. There is a direct link to the Siam BTS station. Inside you can find a huge range of designer goods and expensive restaurants. Most of these are incredibly expensive but it's fun to browse. In the basement there is an Underwater world - I can't comment on this as I've never been in it. On the Ground Floor there is a range of more affordable eating places. This is the best part of the mall and it is always packed with Thais. It's air-conditioned and you can find a wide variety of restaurants catering to all tastes.

If I was only rich...:). Stop in here every time I go to Bangkok, which is 1-2 times a year and never had a bad time. It's a bit pricey, but you can find what you need and the food court is amazing. Go see a movie on the top floor, nothing like theaters in the States for sure.
Nice Place for shopping, eating, and relax. You can find almost all you need inside this mall. from electronic, supermarket, food, cinema, underwater world, expensive goods...

One Big Mall!. This is a huge mall. What I found interesting was not just the big fashion names ie DKNY, Calvin Klein, Prada etc ( somehow they have decided to put them all in one floor shop after shop), not just the restaurants i.e. Japanese, Chinese, Thai etc BUT the Gourmet Market at the ground floor. There is this "everything Thai" area where you will find everything Thai!... scents, beverages, tea/coffee/ the never ending spices/ curry pastes/ rice/ locally made snacks.. and I can go on and its quality stuff. Also, unlike other places, the staff here speak fairly good English. Enough to explain to you the products. Also, don't miss out on Paragon Mall in the same building. They seem to have sales all month round. And i found the quality of goods original and better than you would find elsewhere. You might want to buy only stuff thats on sale.

ZARA. We just got Zara in Australia but for some reason the fashions and quality of clothes are way better in the Paragon store. Of course it has all t5 star brands as well if you feel like dropping few grand...

Place to chill out. First impressions: Huge, colourful and busyPros: Easily accessible by SkytrainCons: Not for bargain huntersLiked: Food choices at the Food CourtDisliked: Random crowds and trafficVerdict: Not a must see but, if you have time to kill, chill here.

Worth a visit. Definitely worth a visit while in Bangkok. The food court has a good variety of choices. It gets a bit crowded at night but the atmosphere is very pleasant. The location is very convenient. You can get there by taxi or public transportation. Good for shopping but prices of brand name products are much higher than in the U.S. It is probably the nicest shopping mall in Bangkok. There are a lot of locals and tourist and most people speak English. We really liked the menus of the restaurants on the first floor. Thai food was really good and reasonably priced.

Excellent food court and big shops!!. A wide variety of eateries to suit all taste buds. Shops were huge, so great for shopping!! The sea world and Madam Tussauds is conveniently located in the basement.

I've never seen anything like it. I would go back to Thailand just for this place!. Apart from the great shopping, brilliant food court.. or should I say... level of food there's also a food hall. I love tea so I found plenty of unique ones like Lemongrass and Pandanas leaves. There are loads of samples of the different foods to try. I spent hours in there.
best in thailand with great food choices. its just next to the skytrain station. the ground floor is full of restaurants and cafes. great atmosphere.

Fancy Shopping Mall with a GREAT Foodcourt!!. Honestly it is just a mall filled with all fancy named-brands and you dont need to shop there. However the food court, which is the basement level, is worth going!Since Siam Paragon is just right next to the rail station, you cannot really miss it. It has storage service where you can have your purchases or bags kept there until 9 pm. Grocery Store: Advice: Eat as much FRUITS as you can!!! You can get some of them from those street booth, but if you are concerned with the hygienic issues, get the fruits from the grocery store. The grocery store inside Siam Paragon has variety of fruits. I would suggest you to try a fruit named LONGKONG! I never have seen or tasted it before, and it was good! Of course the mangoes, and if you would like to experience that smelly fruit, Durian, go ahead! I think they are great!! My Experience: We bought a bag of mangoes and was peeled and cut, placed in a bag, costing us only 40 Bach, which is not even US$1!!!!!! Mochi:There is a booth located inside the grocery store selling all different kinds of mochi! Try that!There are many different types of food just outside the food court, try them all if you have the time!
Huge shopping complex. Horrible traffic. Go by BTS if you can. The shopping centre itself is awesome and located well (opposite Siam Square and close to MBK shopping centre).

Just another shopping complex. While Siam Paragon is impressive with its range of dining, shopping and entertainment options, it does not differ significantly from any shopping centers found in the west. Connected to Siam BTS, Siam Paragon is suited to a short respite from the Bangkok heat while passing through the area, rather than being an attraction to visit on its own.
very overpriced. fashion a bit old ,terrible service a bit evrywhere ,it looks like the staff can't be bothered, and very over priced.

Great foodcourt and supermarket.... Good place to try great Thai food "western way", I mean not on the street, but in clean place. Great supermarket with a lot of seafood, vegetables, fruit - great quality, but a bit expensive.All other floors with brand name stores are too expensive, better go shopping to London or New York City, so nothing exciting for me.

Good for window shopping. This is one of the best mall of Bangkok connected with BTS very good built up but all luxury only there top brands of world available there, but food court is good i enjoyed there , if u r in bangkok must visit this place :) and Do visit cinema hall too they are awesome!!

Sale!. We were lucky to have gone shopping during the sale season and apart from good discounts at the boutiques, there was a branded bazaar sale happening at the hall! We snagged a couple of good buys! This mall boasts a good selection of brands and certainly worth a visit and at least a half day of shopping!
Good Place. You can shopping brandname product and enjoy shopping with your friend when you finding for good place, I can reccomend to you is a very good place for meeting also.
Shopping at its best. Love the sprawling mall and lots of activities! They have a tourist privilege program so bring yout passport! Do visit their underwater world.

Shoppig and MORE. Consumer`s Palace , no question, but also action : We visited Madame Tussaud and this great aquarium. We had a nice lunch with a scenic view on the town. Nobody has to cross a street- go just from the skytrain with pedestrian`s bridges to the shopping center.
Nice, but shopping out of reach. For a family on a budget Siam Paragon is definitely not a shopping destination.But the food court, Ocean world and cineplex are worth a visit.

Nice walking around Siam Square and shopping at Paragon. It is a nice spot to do some shopping with the locals.
Siam Paragon is fancy and impresive, but just 5 minutes walk is Siam Square with lots of independent designers stores. A good combination for a shopping experience.
not worth it. Not worth it, check out terminal 21 and Platinum. Paragon is just big and mainly have flagstores for famous brands.. Rather expencive

Branded shopping mall. Very nice shopping mall with a lot and branded big shops Also a very nice restaurants to visit at the 4th floor of the mall. Very easy access as the mall is located next to the BTS Siam Station.
Wide selection. A great, big mall with a wide selection of shopping. We go here mainly for the IMAX cinema upstairs. Shopping is better next door, however, at CentralWorld.
over priced food. it's hard to get a proper restaurant with reasonable prices. every restaurants were over charged on the same food I can find in Malaysia!!!

Nice shopping. The range of stores is not exactly huge, but the variety offered is good enough to keep my wife happy. Coming from Singapore, we tend to see the same franchise stores appearing in different shopping malls, so it was relatively nicer to shop here, especially when we get to see the works of local designers who have distinct styles not cut from a mould.

Great Place to shop in Bangkok. With great accessibility from the BTS, this place is a shoppers paradise. The Siam Paragon is where one would go to shop for clothes, acessories, cosmetics and sports equipment.

What's not to like: great people watching, window shopping, and food galore. Yes, it's a mall. And there are so many in Bangkok. But, this one is my favorite. It's a great place to hang out and get out of the heat. Really high end stores offer a feast for they eyes. But it's the literal feast that i really love. There are so many great places to eat or just grab a snack, you be hard pressed to choose. So, just keep going back and enjoy the sites. If you have time, hit up the movie theaters - a real treat, with plush seating and good sound and screens. You'll have a great choice.

Shopping and Dining. Good place to spend your time, good shops and good location. Must visit if you have time to kill. The attractions for childrens are good, you can visit the Siam World which is worthwhile.

Amazing Shopping Mall!. This place is huge a d has every shop imaginable. It is upmarket shopping so don't expect too many bargains. It's so clean, modern, air conditioned, easy to get around, easy to get to by sky train. If shopping is what you want in Bangkok then go here. There is a floor dedicated to food and a cinema with IMAX on the top floor.
Another high class mall. this is just another high class mall, nothing special.. you will see similar mall like this everywhere you go.

Posh Shopping - Cookie Cutter Top End Tat. What can I say that might not offend? I've travelled extensively over the last 35 years - and I always get a bit depressed when I see cookie cutter 'premium' malls like this arrive. Well, you can get everything here that you can get in absolutely any other posh mall anywhere else in the World - nothing more to say. Hey - if you want Bond Street brands at Mayfair, Gstaad or Monaco prices you came to the right place. Awful, just awful.
World class. A world class's shopping mall with great choice of food varieties. It is too easy to spend big $$$ as everything looks so nice and class

Not unless the kids get cranky or you need a good book in English. Here is the glistening, steel, marble, glass multi-storied monument to hi-so (high society) excess in the center of Bangkok, Thailand. Along with its sisters, interconnected Siam Center and Siam Discovery Center - access via SkyTrain's Siam station - this houses some of the most expensive shops and food court in Thailand. Upstairs is a Maserati/Ferrari dealership. In the basement of Siam Paragon is Siam Ocean World (admission fee required) where the kids can marvel in air-conditioned style at the indoor acquarium and walk through the gigantic fish tank in plexiglass tunnels viewing the sand sharks, mantra rays and fish. This is also the location of the Japanese bookstore Kinokuniya which has one of the best English language collection of books on Thailand, Thai culture, history and cuisine that we've found. And you'll find the Asian Book Company in the same complex and while smaller it is a good book store.
has everything. food..shopping..siam ocean world...suitable for all ages ;) We are a mall lover family so Siam Paragon is an easy choice to make.

can't wait to get out. the mall itself is HUGE... i'm just not a mall person... felt like trapped in a big maze. was just there to buy some swim trunk. but if you like shopping and mall i guess you would dig this place.

Food court amazing.. Siam Paragon mall is more for high end buyers. It also has ocean world down stairs on the bottom floor. If I wanted to buy high end and see ocean world, I can have these things in Sydney where live. But the the thing I liked about the mall is the food court. Food is of good quality but inexpensive. You get to choose from many of their local dishes that are just really yummy food.

SIAM PARAGON is the best mall in Bangkok, for those, interested in BRANDED products, You will find all te best brands li. SIAM PARAGON is the best mall in Bangkok, for those, interested in BRANDED products, You will find all the best brands like Versace, Dolce & Gabana, Jimmy Choo, etc. at Siam Paragon.This is located at BTS SIAM Central, which is accessible from all parts of bangkok. Moreover, the food court at Siam Paragon is very big and is having huge range of dishes to offer. Reasonably priced.At the basement of this mall, is the Asia's biggest artificial Aquarium, the Siam Ocean World, where you can experience the Underwater world with the live sea creatures, fishes & sharks.

Shopaholics Haven!. I feel as if I am back in the 80's when I visit a Bangkok mall!You can find everything here that you didn't know that you couldn't live without in a comfortable and conveniently located setting just off theBTS line. Also, many restaurants available at different price points.

A top-class shopping complex. You will find many exquisite retail stores here. They are too up-market for most Thais and for tourists. The restaurants there are, however, of high quality and comprise both Eastern and Western cuisines.

average shopping mall with average prices but amazing food court!. a shopping mall like any where else but the Food court is a place to see, experience and eat at. Great Asian cuisine, cleanly presented ( try the wraps and the steamed buns) and a chance to be adventurous with your taste buds!

Massive. We had a tiring but mostly enjoyable half-day here. The overall place is quite impressive due to its huge size and (slightly OTT) decor. The choice of shops is unbelievable but mostly a bit pricey for me. We had a nice cheap lunch though and it was fun just to walk around and see the people.

Occidental. The biggest mall in Bangkok is a very elegant and cosmopolitan place, with big brands and big prices. It offers a oasis of cool air and the chance to take lunch in one of the restaurants inside it

Over priced. Bkk is not cheap shopping if you go here, some are more expensive than where I come from (Sydney) all the international brands are there, food court downstairs is good with variety to choose from.
Great shopping Centre. I bought great perfume here and also MAC products duty free. In Myers same items were doubled in price.. Great range of products to buy..
Favourite mall. Our favourite mall in Bangkok, along with the department store Central Chitlom. Had more of a cozy atmosphere to it than the likes of Centre World, MBK, etc.

gr8 place. very entertaining place with a large food court...go shopping with the premium brands and do visit siam ocean world which is very nicely made and is probably the largest in south east asia. One may also add siam discovery....

More suitable for the people who wants to buy the luxuries. It is a large shopping mall,connects to the BTS Siam station.On the basement,there is a large food court,many restaurants are there,too.Terrific!Excellent place for dinner.The supermarket is fantastic,I think it is better than Central World's supermarket.There are many international famous shops on the 1st and 2nd floor.It is suitable for people who love to buy the luxuries.On the upper floor,there is a cinema.In Siam Paragon,there is ocean world,too.Overall,it's a good place to spend a day.
Great shopping amazing food court. Amazing food court at basement - every type of food you could want - lots of cages and Japanese inspired foodMy favorite is Talinping for Thai food

Amazing mall for day spend. caters to all age groups. the sea world has its own fascination for all.the shopping caters to every need and the food court offer variety of good quality cuisines. nice, clean place with very friendly staff at all the stores and eating joints too.very intersting to simply sit outside and watch the people and the sky train hustling by.
About to be renovated. Siam Paragon was scheduled to close for renovations when we visited, so while there were some bargain sales, there were quite a few empty shops.
Fantastic shopping centre. Whilst some of the shops were very out of my price range there was an amazing food court on the ground floor.

Various choices for shopping. We loved shopping in Paragon mall. There are various of choices for us and our children. Lots of restaurant and Food center with many choices of international foods. Dont miss!!!
awesome shopping centre. I love this shopping centre. I love the food hall the best, and the supermarket. Theres something for everyone here.

One of the best malls in Bangkok. Even though it's not the biggest (that claim belongs to Central World) mall in Bangkok, it is definitely my favourite upper class mall in Bangkok! It's absolutely huge, has many high st brands, a fantastic food court in the basement (as well as a very impressive gourmet supermarket for expats) and a HUGE Asia Books upstairs! Everything you could possibly want from a mall in bangkok, you would be able to find here! Want your cheap DVDs and fakes, head across the road to MBK, too easy!

Try the gourmet Thai delicacies in the grocery section.... Aside from comfortable shopping ambiance, the basement also offers interesting and good fastfood choices.Don't forget to visit their grocery section where they have nicely packaged gourmet Thai delicacies ready for taking back home.

Upmarket shopping. Higher quality and cost of shopping in Bangkok.
Located in the middle of the square.

mall -shopping. its a nice place for shopping and well connected by the metro .... ! , you can get some good deals on clothes /electronics/ toys/ etc... also if you are just tired sight seeing outdoors and need some aircon and food , this is a good hop ! The other attraction is the seam ocean ... if you are with family , then its a good place to spend some time ..

Pricey but a tourist mecca. The mall itself is pricey, upscale, but it's fun to walk around and look at the eye candy. Ever stand next to a Mazerati? Ever touch a Ferrari? Here's your chance. There are showrooms on the 2nd and 4th floors, as well as special car shows that will let you do just that. I don't even like cars that much, and I enjoyed seeing them. Also, for those of you into textiles, there are some of the best, most luxurious fabrics you will every see or touch -- some of them up to 100,000 baht -- that's about $3000 a meter! There are also great restaurants, with some Western additions such as Cinnabon and Krispy Kreme (only ones in Bangkok at this writing). You will also find some uniquely Thai variations like Butter Bread available here.

Fun place to spend the day. Siam Paragon is great. The Aquarium is honestly the best one I've been to and definitely worth stopping by, especially if you have kids. The shopping and food options are also pretty good. It's a great place to take a break from all the site seeing and touring in Bangkok :).

Do you want to go shopping and see fancy brands?. At Siam Paragon you can find a lot of fancy clothing brands. Sometimes they are expensive, sometimes you can find good deals.I bought some crazy Thai toys for my little nephews and my girlfriend found some cheap clothes from a local thai designer.You can visit Siam Paragon to eat good Thai food as well, there are a lot of restaurants on the first floor.Take the Skytrain and get out at get down at Siam Station.
Big shopping mall with nice food court. Very big, very crowded. V good if you are a shopaholic. Nice food court and supermarket.

quite pricey. Great to have a look around at this very huge and clean shopping centre. The BTS Siam station is where you would get off and walk directly into this shopping centre. A lot of designer brand names, can be very expensive, but did enjoy looking around. I couldn't see a lot for kids to do, although they do have Siam Ocean world and a wax museum also.
The only place which is not bad smelling at Bangkok. It is clean, have good restaurants and brands. The luxury brands are all in.

A big shopping mall with a HUGE food court!. The shopping mall is upper class, its great to look around.The food court is incredible here - you can put money onto a card and chose from a large selection, or you can go to one of the many amazing restaruants within the dining area.Japanese food is a highlight here.
Up Market Shopping. Its a great place to widow shop, but prices are on the high side, remember import tax is 144% in Thailand.
huge. you can find 1 stall offering halal food. cheap but nothing to brag. just a place to fill a hungry tummy

Mall for Upscale Shopping. If you want to do upscale shopping in Bangkok, this is the place for it. We mainly went to Bangkok for bargain shopping so we did not spend as much time in this mall, but it was a nice place to see and experience.Note: We visited Bangkok in December 2010, but since it is no longer available in the drop down, I chose the earliest date available

Great Mall. This is a great mall for shopping and for simply hanging out. They have a wide selection of shops - mid-range labels, high-end, international, and local. It seems like this mall is always packed even on weekdays. Don't forget to grab something from their foodcourt - it is awesome! Huge, huge selection !

I love shopping. We ate and shopped here pretty much everyday. The variety of food is excellent. You get a ticket and put money on it and then order your food and drink. If you have credit left on the ticket you can get the money back. There are different kiosks selling different foods and a lot of it we hadn't ever tasted. The mall is absolutely huge and the shops are great. There are great designer shops and the prices aren't bad either.

When you say Paragon in Thailand you say ''Quality''.... As I mentioned before about the Paragon Cineplex, anyone who knows Paragon in Thailand knows that they have the top of the line verything. Whether you are looking to buy quality whatever or just looking at all the beautiful things on offer - Paragon will have it. Love to window shop and enjoy people watching at Paragon.
Very good malll. Siam ocean world....that is the best for this mall.

nice upscale mall. its a nice and pleasant upscale mall with a huge underground aquarium (theme park). its a good place to visit as the BTS skytrain is directly connected to it. there are also a few high end car showrooms in here. if you're looking for designer brands, this is the place for you

Shopping mall. Certainly this a very nice shopping center, there is everything, an aqarium, a cinema and plenty of designer outlets such zara, mango, gucci, chanel, balenciaga, etc... Street food is recommended in the basement. Easy to see it widely, it is useful to buy or souvenir. Dried fruit is sold or there is a measure, it was also delicious taste. Them in his pack for a souvenir the high percentage is not very tasty, long shelf life is short, but is recommended to buy here.
A great place for everything. great place to find a place to eat dinner or go see a movie or do some shopping

Great shopping. When we were there, there was a mid-year sale on almost every things. Prices were discounted as much as 70%. There were plenty of restaurants and variety of great selection. But we also found the shopping next door which offer even cheaper products. The shop close quite late into the evening.
Great Shopping. Bangkok has some magical shopping centres and the Paragon is no exception, spend a few hours and search out those bargains, prices are low and quality is high!

A bit of an eye Candy. Nice place, very posh shopping mall, and easy to get to by sky train. However it contains mostly the brand shops and all of them are very expensive. Its the flagship mall of Bangkok city, I understand that, but if you are after brand items then why not go to London or NY, why will you go to Bkk!!?The shopping mall is very fancy looking and nice place to take pictures, especially the water fountain at the entrance is nice, but otherwise nothing much in there. We didnt have time to go to the bottom of the mall where I guess the sea world was, however may be we will do it the next time round!!
Love Siam Paragon. Siam Paragon is a luxury mall. Its food court and supermarket is something to see. Went to Siam on a saturday and the atmosphere was amazing.
Lots of choice. A great huge mall with lots to do. A huge range of restaurants on the ground floor, the only bad thing was how crowded it was!
Best shopping mall in Bangkok. Don't forget to go down to the food hall & taste test a few of the many free samples

A place to chill out.. Shopping Mall trecking is not high on my wish list when travelling. But after a week of showing freinds about central BKK we were ready to get out of the heat and crush of the streets. We headed for Pantip Plaza. I had visited the excellent book shop before so we went there first to equip our friends with Nancy Chandlers map of Chiang Mai; our next destination. The selection is amazing with some of the best art and architecture books I have seen for a long time - a whole wall of them. Priced at half what I would pay in Australia. I bought a couple of heavy weights and posted them later - BKK post is very cost effective and they have a wrapping service at the offices I have been to. My friends had a coffee in the small but nice cafe at the rear of the shop and took advantage of the view from window seats. Meanwhile I caught the elevator from inside the shop up to the top floors where the IMAX and other theaters are situated. There is also a large ten pin bowling rink. I booked us in for a film later that evening which worked out at about $5 each. By the way, cinema is a major deal to Thai people. These cinemas were very comfortable and they have a serious VIP lounge and a private option as well.Meanwhile the ladies had booked in for some vital nail refurbishment, which I was assured was a snip at $70 for a full set of French nail "retreads". I understood their experience was an outstanding success.We boys headed for the Supercar showrooms on the 5th? floor. It seems odd to see gleaming Porche, Ferrari and others at such an elevation. There was a small porche shop that had some really nicely designed gear - we didn't buy anything.We met up in the basement for a late afternoon lunch in the excellent foodhall - you buy vouchers and exchange them for food. There is also a brilliant produce hall whith superbly presented quality fruits, pastries and all the other comfort foods you can think of. This hall was our favourite. I would rate it with Fortum and Mason and David Jones in its own way.We felt like a breath of air and we had "a smoker", so we wandered outside onto the plaza. This area has a large fountain water feature which is fun and attracts a lot of locals - a great people watching area. We soon got into conversation with several locals.
