There were a lot of "beautiful people" about and they all seemed fine with having their pictures taken.The kids soon took off to check out the massive aquarium that is in the sub-basement. I am told you can go out in a boat and even arrange to swim with the sharks.Meanwhile, we found a huge music outlet and selected some authentic Thai music tracks. After which we met up for the evening cinema treat. By the way, you have to check in all cameras at the entrance I was a bit concerned at this but it was fine and is obviously a routine thing.I pointed out to the kids (in their 20s) that opposite the main entrance and on the other side of the road is an area set back that has a lot of evening music and bars where the younger Thais congregate.Siam Paragon is near MBK and can easily be accessed from the overhead rail system. This links via a walkway to MBK so you can stay off street level. If you need to catch a cab East to say Khao San area then you are best to go to MBK and at the back of which is a cab rank and they will tell the driver to put the meter on.
Check It Out. It's a huge mall with many brands. If you have spare time after visiting the local attractions it might be a good change of scenery. Get off the Siam station and you can't miss it.
over priced. nice place but if your looking for a bargain this is not the place!
fashion place. shopping centre and many food and everything if we want.
Awesome place!. I loved the shopping mall. We went to Siam Ocean World which was right at ground level (below the building) which was totally cool and exciting!
Hiso Zoo. Bangkok's high society likes to spend their "hard earned" cash at Siam Paragon, an icon of Bangkok.
BKK shopping mall is huge. And it's not just paragon, there are tons of other malls in the area for all your shopping needs. Easy to get lost, but you won't complain when you do get lost.

Luxe and CO. Not the place to bargain as all the majors luxury brand are represented. Otherwise, take the oppurnity to go to the Food Court or the Supermarket to test asian dishes for a good value for money. Nice place to eat and discover also some designers.
Directly connected to BTS sky train station

Great Food Court in Basement. The Food Court in the Basement is the highlight of this shopping center. The rest is new, but overpriced. Compare Emporium Shopping Center (BTS Phrong Phong) or at BTS Asok Terminal 21.

just another mall.... simplicity it's a mall n very big
many various shops n u can find anything in it

Great shopping & dining spot Love the Supermarket!. A great place to shop for the big luxurious labels. No lack of dining options. And I absolutely love the supermarket at the basement. Loads of fresh local produce which of superb quality. If you're looking to buy some snacks back, this is the place to go. Though it won't be as cheap as buying off the streets or at the avg. shops around town.
Great window-shopping!. Nobody buys anything here... Just looki...But great ambiance. Great design. Fun.

The showoff in Bangkok. Actually is not my perfect visit when im travelling, but avoiding the streets for a couple of hours is a good option in Bangkok. This mall has every single big signature in the world, the architecture, services, safety and variety is huge, the food hall worth a visit, although... not for every pocket
PRICEY BUT, A SHOPPERS DELIGHT. Great for browsing with wide choice of restaurants at the food court

Yet Another Luxury Shopping Center. Just another standard shopping center with high end luxury items. Similar to any shopping center you find in Singapore or Hong Kong. Nice for an air con break, but that's about it. There is an underwater world at the basement, I didnt enter as it was way over priced - obviously meant for tourists, which is a same as the locals should be able to enjoy such attractions as well.
great for shopping. loved this place it huge would take a full day to walk every level looking a all the stores it has everything must see when in Bangkok
Shopping Temple of its Best. shopping, shopping, shopping, not cheap, but exclusive, and the more interesting for me: lots of top class restaurants
Awsome. Have everything and more, the basement habve a LOTS of food places, everything you can imagine. They also have some echibitions there, when I was there they had a beautiful orchid exhibition.
Siam Paragon?. It is a good browsing shopping centre although you can find pretty much anything sold here at any of the outdoor markets in BKK.
Typical. Like any other huge mall with brands you can find in any other huge mall. Meh.

Paragon--maybe.. Classy shopping centres are not what we come to see in Bangkok,although this one is very smart and glitzy,but unles you are very wealthy and after brand names not much fun for shopping.We can go to these places at home.

Great Mall Can Spend Hours There!. It was a beautiful, clean mall. I particularly liked the department store. The food court was great!Great quality purchases were made for a good price. Great bookshops, clothing and food.I bought two very nice corporate dresses for $30 each!(aud) Bargain! It's great because you visit so many malls in siam as they're right next door to each other. Make sure you check out siam centre.
Clean.. Like: variety of shops. Bowling centre is world class.Dislike: can get 'too busy'. Cark parking gets relatively expensive after 5 hours (40 or 60 baht per hour I think).
Like a Palace. Huge place... however we felt the stores inside are too expensive for us... the food here are okay-not that good compared to other malls.
upscale shopping. great place, plenty upmarket shops in this complex and great outdoor entertainment area
Easy shopping. If you want air conditioned smart shopping this is Bangkok finest mall
Worth a visit.... ...especially if you're travelling with children, as they'll certainly love the aquarium.
Great food court. It has a big food court you can choose from Thai , Japanese , Chinese etc. Cuisine very big and air conditioned ;)
What a shopping center. This is the place for serious shoppers. It has it all including a wonderful lower level of restaurants. Everything from fast food to serious sit down places.

An awesome Shopping place. Awesome shopping place, a big shopping centre complex and easy to reach by sky train, the shopping place is clean, and has beautiful shops inside. Near the place you can find Madamme Tussauds museum.

Good place for shopping brand names. You will find the real brand name with reasonable price you can find in abroad. Very to access via skytrain. There are another 3-4 department stores nearby. Enjoy shopping.

Uninspiring. We visited here briefly and were disappointed with the whole complex. If you want to shop for the BIG NAMES, this may be the place for you. But there are better places to do so.An aquarium, IMAX, Madamme Tussauds were all there for those that had the time to spend. Unfortunatley we didnt have that luxury of time. We certainly preferred MBK.

Shopping Square. Siam Paragon & its 2 adjoing malls with MBK in front and Lots of small shops around is a shoppers dream square. The Paragon mall itself is very good, with almost everything a shopper need is available , food court is nice. You can spend 2 days in and around the mall and still not visit the same shop again.

shopping area in the heart of city. shopping malls were very good but costly. no bargains in the mall. Items were displayed very nicely.Almost all shops were having sale upto 50%.Very convinient for everybody as it is located in the heart of city with good transport facility. Taxis available. Only problem traffic jam

Endless shopping.... Literally everything under one (gigantic) roof - we found all we looked for and ate very well enjoying admirable & friendly service) at an Italian on GF which name escapes me but right next to the yummy Oriental Boutique. Only thing it was a Sunday afternoon, so if you're agoraphobic you'd better chose another day!

amazing!. Huge shopping mall full of exclusive shops, but not only!
The Water World is Fascinating, you can spend a whole day there without feeling.
Great restaurants, a huge food court where you can find everything you wish to eat and affordable, and much more.

A huge mega size mall with the biggest luxury brands of the world. Walking around this place makes you feel like you need a lot more money to feel happy shopping here, this is in line with the other two lesser value malls and stands out as it hosts the most premium of brands and designer labels
A place where to find everything you are looking for.. Nice place where you can spend few hours and find almost everything that you need.

Worth a visit. An impressive collection of leading brands under one roof.Many of the stores had a Sale during our visit and so we where able to pick up branded stuff at interesting prices.The goods on display spans the whole gamut of branded stuff.
Love this place.. Ocean World + Madame Tussauds + good shopping. Great food court too. Modern.

Great Shopping Experience. Bought some branded stuffs at bargain - Since It was on sale. They do have an Aqua world/park which is great to visit - costing 700 or 800 Bhatt. It has some great a food outlets too. A truly one stop shop.

Don't miss this place. 1st choice in BKK that give you everything you could ever ask for - internal & local brands, from fashion , gourmet world , fitness , movie to waterworld .. right at the entrance of Siam BTS station which connect you to Central World , MBK , Siam Square. Make sure this is your first stop while visiting BKK.

One stop shopping, eating, groceries. For a short term visitor, Siam Paragon is an excellent place to go. You get authentic products - local and imported. You also get access to some of the established local designers and their products. As a tourist, you can get a discount card that entitles you to a 5% discount on all regular priced merchandise. Additionally, tourists can also get a VAT refund (at the airport) if they spend more than Baht 2,000 in one day - however, the claim for VAT refund at the store requires a passport and MUST be made on the day of purchase. English skills are limited - however, almost all sales staff will understand you if you speak slowly.The food court in the basement is clean and has a wide variety of food from Asia, some global fast food outlets and some bakeries. The Asian food is very good.The gourmet grocery store in the basement is a great place to buy local and imported fruits and other items you may need for a short stay. And it is very very clean.

Luxury mall. One of the biggest malls in the heart of BKK. You can find most luxury brands here even cars! Humongous food court and also many different restaurants on the ground floor where you will be spoilt for choice. There is even a seaworld in the basement to park the kids while you go shopping...
Expensive Shopping. Good shopping centre you find the most luxury brands that are available. Have a look into the food court at the basement level, it very good.

If you want to understand the meaning of "Asian luxury" please go. I work in a luxury company but believe me this is amazing in terms of layout, design, and variety of brands. The service and the performance of goods is unique. The prices are the standards of luxury brands but you will be in the middle of all the luxury brands of the world.
It is beautiful and bright!. We used to go there to have some lunch and ice cream ..shopping was expensive there..

QUALITY JEWELLRY-TIVOLI. We stumbled across this Jewellry store in 2011 and went back this year. Ut the owner has great English and she is amazing to deal with. Highly recommend anybody who is looking for a ring to pay her a visit if you are looking for diamond jewellry. Simply great value.

Shopping Haven!!!. All amazing brands under one brilliant roof with an amazingly huge foodcourt where u will be spoilt for choice! Definitely my favorite shopping mall in asia! Even a whole day is not enough for this hugeee mall!

Wow, don't miss it. Fantastic food court, many nice shops and many restaurants.
Good place to spend at least half a day in the coolness of the indoor mall. A really nice place to bring the family.
Really clean ...really expensive. No fakes in this very high end complex.. It's beautifully presented well air conditioned but only quite exclusive shopping

Could spend days in the food court alone!. What a tricked out mall with tons of high-end shopping options. But I especially loved the food court--a restaurant for every taste and budget. Including several with bars and amazing wine lists!
nice with kids. 5 d is amazing also the glass tunnel...thoguh its small but very good for kids

Shoppers paradise. We stopped in BKK just for the shopping before heading to Pattaya and certainly werent dissapointed! The whole Siam square shopping district is amazing and if you can take the walking you will be well rewarded. 5 huge shopping centers next to each other and if you head over the road to the complexes opposite there are loads of small locally owned shops. All the 5 malls were spotless and air conditioned and staffed by very helpful guides at the info desks. Travel light as you'll return to your hotel fully loaded with bags!
Great food. Try Coffee Beans at the basement, as well as B Naturale, on the third floor

Siam Paragon. A very beautiful mall with lots of food choices. Grand cineplex available. I love their supermarket and I'm spoiled for choice. I'd love to do my grocery shopping here in the supermarket as I can practically find anything I want. The mall itself is a very high end place for many luxury brands and also cars. Getting here is very easy as the train serves directly to the mall.
Shopping in Siam Paragon. Big supermarket and different kinds of cuisine you can taste. Buget, fine dinning are also available. Good for buying souvenir too.
Shopping Excellence. The Siam Paragon Shopping center is a great place to do some shopping, dining or sightseeing. I highly recommend the Siam Ocean World on the ground floor.

Food heaven. Excellent local and international food at food court at very affordable prices. Very busy durng lunch hour, avoid that time. Pre purchace card then get refund when finished. Excellent supermarket with the best quality fresh food. Besides all the local food you want almost every American and Japanese chain is here also. Clean and civilised. Up market shopping at up market prices.
The best of the many. At the heart of the shopping complexes at Siam. Beautifully kept and presented. Impossible to come away empty-handed!

Good shopping, great food court. There is so much to do. You can people watch, shop, go to the aquarium, eat any type of food you can think of or catch a movie. Having the BTS stop right by the mall makes it so easy to get to.

Over prices and dull with a good food court. The shops are fancy but expensive - compared to what you would pay fo rht esmae brands in the west - don't bother.However the food hall is absolutely fanastic and nearly as cheap as street food!

Mostly Womens fashion. Shopping at paragon was not as cheap as I was led to believe. I could get shirts and women's items same price or cheaper in Manila. My male friends weren't satisfied with the choices as there were hardly any shops selling menswear.Going back to our hotel from Paragon was a disaster. we tried tuktuk but they charged more than taxis and we had to stop at a tourist spot so the driver could earn a stamp. Taxis are the same, they urge you to stop at a tourist spot (jewelry etc) although a nice educational stop, if you are tired and in a hurry to go rest at your hotel, best walk and take the train.

Escape from the heat. It has everything and everyone in there. Quite ok during weekdays but super crowded during weekends! Good escape from the mad heat. Everything you can find in there is rather expensive so quite pointless for cheap shopping.
Excellent place to shop and eat. Great shopping and food. Plenty of great restaurants inside with great shopping. Has a great manicure place in there as well.
Great shopping center. it's connected with another 2 shopping centers and can walk to MBK and Central World by the sky bridge.

Great shopping center. If shopping is or isnt your thing this place is worth a look, from top to bottom it amazes on every level. There are tennis courts and schools on the upper floors and on the lowest floor is an aquarium. The food court is fantastic with a vast range to suit everyone needs

WOW for the gourmet store. High branded brand is here. Check some sale that the price still around 4,000b after discount (what a sale!).
But the mall is so nice especially the gourmet store and the food court.

1-stop shop. Siam Paragon is probably my favourite shopping mall. it has alot of shops, a nice food court, cafes, eateries, a supermarket, boutiques etc. and it's not as huge as CentralWorld or as old as Emporium.
So I'm happy that my hotel is just across the road!

Large and exclusive shopping centre. This place is enormous - trying to get around everything in a day is hard work and best tackled in parts. Decide what you want before going and try to stick with the plan (and best of luck!)The place is very modern and you can buy just about anything. It's not the knock-off place such as MBK (great in it's own way) but a really good shopping experience and often very crowded.

Nice Foodcourt. Downstairs is an extensive foodcourt with restaurants - from McDonalds to Sushi and Thai. The foodhall looked amazing - you fill a card with 1000baht and go around choosing bits and pieces including Japanese, Thai, Vietnamese and Chinese and then only pay for what you used. Thai restaurant near toilets was very nice.

Over The Top. Exceptional, wish we had malls like this in Canada, airy, chic, sophisticated wow!!! Cool, clean, lots of high gloss, unbelievable variety of shops, the ground floor food hall is over the top! Don't miss!

Forget about the branded goods. Go to the food hall instead.. If you have seen all shopping center, they all looks alike but for Siam Paragon, we love the food hall where there are many food outlet for us to try. They have a food court where you need to purchase a store valued card in order to buy your food and the remaining value that you have in the card will need to be redeem on the same day from the counter. There are many other eating outlet like Fuji, Toast Box, Mcdonald and etc.

Brands and Expensive but NICE!!!. I did like Siam Paragon even though everything was a brand name. If there are sales on then you can get some good deals knowing that what you are buying is of good quality. The food court was great and the choices were really good. Their department store was also a great place to shop especially if there are sales. Since MBK did not have many toy shops we found that the paragon department store had a big section and my kids went crazy selecting their toys. Definitely will visit Siam Paragon when I go to Bangkok next.

Shopping and Relaxing in Siam Paragon. Likes - Many things and people to see and watch while the day goes by. Upbeat market for both branded (more of this) and unbranded stuffs. Located in the heart of this busy city and easy to locate.Dislike - Close rather early, around 9pm, shops started closing.

Great food fare and grocery store. Extensive international restaurants, fast food to casual dining.
Has a great movie theatre to cool down in hot afternoons. The shops are mostly high end and very expensive shops.
Love the shopping. Try to get to this place everytime I am in Bangkok

Top brands. A big mall for the upper class, nice windowshopping for the avarage tourist.
You can even buy a Lamborghini, porsche or a Lotus in here.
Or do you prefer a $100K watch? It's all for sale in this mall.

Upscale mall in the heart of Bangkok. This mall presents most of the the upscale brands you could think about. From clothes to shoes to bags to jewelries. The atmosphere has that hotel-like feeling on it. It offers a different kind of shopping experience. The mall is well maintained. The food court offers a wide array of authentic thai cuisine at a reasonable price.
Cool place!. Plenty of eateries! Great cineplex and lovely gourmet supermarket!
A nice place for hanging around. Great place for shopping and finding either local or oriental cuisine.
Great place to shop. Great Mexican and Margaritas in the food court, we always eat here when in BKK

Nice. Big and widespread of food, from restaurant to food court to fast food.
Nice Ocean World
perfect. i love this place, new shopping experince, food is good and if you with the kiddos you can go to madam tussad and aquarium
great mall. Excellent all round, nothing bad about this place at all.
shopping place. great shopping place and great finds for food lovers
the best shopping experience i have ever had!. if you like to shop you can literally spend a whole day in bangkok. all of the shopping malls are located together

Best Shop & Dine (with aircon) in Bangkok. You could never find this comfort in Bangkok 25 years ago. The mall appeals with its fascinating aquarium, top-notch boutique, fine wine, and most importantly - Great Choices of Food.Frankly, not every outlet serves the best you could find in town, but at least they are relatively fresh, and still at reasonable price.Moving away from the street stalls, if you are looking for a place to indulge yourself in some higher end service when you are in the city, Siam Paragon is a must-go.
Nice place to shop. Great place to shop but be prepared to have a big wallet as its labels labels and more labels

Very Chic!. This is a beautiful mall which stocks all the branded products so expect no cheap bargains here. You are more likely to max out your credit cards because the range and variety in this place is endless.
great shopping area. good place for shopping, especially some thai massage oil, spa items , armoa all these price ok with reasonable
Shop til you drop!. A fabulous place to shop and be entertained. Love it!

Great Food Court. Siam Paragon was across the road from our hotel. The mall is very busy and very clean. It was easy to navigate with a pram, though I have to wonder why people who can walk always use the elevator when there is an escalator nearby. Meanwhile those in wheel chairs and prams are waiting.The food court is brilliant. There is such a large variety of places to eat. Predominantly it is actually a floor filled with a large selection of restaurants and cafes. Loved it!
just a mall?. tons of shops + high end boutiques. not sure if this is a great place for a tourist since you dont really get to see the city? but thats just me.

Great. We were fortunate to visit this shopping complex during their Orchid festival and the display was impressive. This complex is great and my only downside here is that it is tailored more for shopping at the higher end rather than having a bit for everyone.

Awesome place. Really great place to spend time with family, friends or alone as well. Got lot of options to explore from. Shops, restaurants, serving almost all kinds of food, electronics, gadgets you name it. Also got attractions like Ocean's world, Madam Tussaud's wax museum , Ripley's believe it or not etc. The best part, you got BTS station right next to this complex. need not worry about reaching this place. Happen to visit this place at least 4-5 times during my stay in Bangkok, used to walk from my hotel (Intercontinental) in Chit Lom, using skywalk walk way.
Tempting Gourmet place. Lots of food variety and very tempted to try everything which looks so palatable. Prices are on the higher side, compared to other food courts.

modern and luxury shopping mall. this shopping mall may not for everyone as it is more for luxury and medium high class brands. but you still have to say it is very modern and beautiful shopping mall even compare with the others on the same level
Typical Shopping Mall. Siam Paragon provides a good change of pace from roadside stalls around the area

Worth a visit for shoppers. Yes this place must be on the list. Not top but good selection of stalls and shops. Most places hace similar things but you may spot a bargain. Many shoes and handbags...imitation or ?
Great shopping experience. This place is full of great brands and loads of people around. Good for shopping. I love this place
Too expensive. If you are looking for designer labels that you cn get in any western country. - this is the place to visit - otherwise go to MBK as its more reasonable

Expensive and exorbitant western shopping centre. This place is a divorce from reality in Bangkok, where shopping is cheap and great value. In this place the tourist should expect to pay more than you would at home, with huge markups on all products
Orchid display. really expensive shopping but great place. Beautiful orchid display was on at the entrance
Take your credit card!. Lots of cool shops to buy clothes if expensive compared to the markets. Make sure you go next door to Central World as well.

very nice, but very expensive. Lots of restaurants (from hamburger joints to posh japanese restaurants), lots of banks, ATM's, stores with about anything you can dream, but the prices are high. Sports, clothing, books, shoes, jewelry ... you name it, it's there.
It is on par with international standard. Love the food hall ! everything tastes good! and there is Prada, Gucci , Chanel and many other international brands.
sleek & elegant. love the food court and supermarket, but too expensive so settled for the tastings only!

Love this mall. I love this mall.
very big, clean, and has a lot of place to eat...

something for everyone. Lots of yummy food, oooodles of stores to make you go mad and wonder If you brought enough cash to shop!!!
but definitely try the food!!! <3 the food court
Place for everything. Love this mall. Got everything you need. Food court was fabulous. You can try local food with good price.
great mall but lots of empty shops. not sure why, a lot of shops at siam paragon are closing down. busiest part of the mall is the food court in the lower ground area!!
Siam Paragon, a place for everyone, on everything!. We have to be here every time visiting BKK as this huge complex offers loads of goodness from dining, shopping, entertaining, etc. Worth a visit!

Lots of food. There were lots of choices for food at the basement. The food selling at the small stalls look so much more appetising than the main meals selling at the food court. The food taste great and cheap.

Great shopping :). i think besides than shopping, the food court is a must go...
Food range are wide and its never get disappointed what kinds of food you chose. Thai food, Japanese food, Chinese Food or dessert bar... fast food

you name it, they have it!. almost all the famous restaurants are located here, MK, Fuji, Coffee beans by Dao. try Krispy Kreme donuts, they are very fresh and very good. supermkt is huge, try their local products. i love the yogurt drinks.
Must Go!. I visited the mall in 2008 and am itching to get back here this year! Convenient location and great shopping.

Spent a lot of money here. A well set out shopping centre, we saved this big splurge for our last day in Bangkok. Though like everywhere else in Thailand, it is hard to buy clothing/shoes for a 6ft4 Australian male.

Upclass Shopping. Best part of this place is that its just across the street from my hotel at Novotel. A very big shopping centre with many stores. If you are looking for food, you can come here too. The basement has a huge selection of food, including foodcourts, smaller stores and cafes. There is also a huge "Gourmet Market" that feels like Walmart/Carrefour.
Immense shopping experience. They sell almost everything here and some very high quality products. It is also a great place to eat or have fun. One of the best malls in the world...

Shopping for Luxury. One of Bangkok's leading Mall, Siam Paragon is definitely a staple for all the shopaholics out there who love their branded clothing. This is one huge mall that offers international brands as well as very well known local brands of Thailand. The mall is connected to different mall complex, all of which is just a walk away thru the over pass / walk way that was built in the heart of the shopping district of Siam.Think of it this way, if you want to buy Chanel, Dior or other world famous luxury brands you head to Siam Paragon. Nothing fake there, just pure luxury for those people who have a taste for expensive things. Now if you like local brands that are high end you can visit the neighboring Siam Discovery, it is also part of the mall complex. In this mall houses expensive local brands that are uniquely Thai.If you want to see more international shops that are not in Siam Paragon you might want to check out The Emporium.Now if you want to get a (sort of bargain) for Thailand local designs go visit Siam Center, it is very trendy and all the young hip locale go their to find unique designs that they can take home.Note that all of these 4 shopping centers are connected by a walk bridge so you will not have a hard time going from one place to another.Be SURE to ask for the Tourist Card, its a gold card printed in paper that you get if you are a Tourist. Just present your passport to the outlet of which you are purchasing your item and they will give you the card or better yet ask for it at the information desk of each mall.it will give you 5% discount to the department store and up to 70% discount in the shopping complex plus 7% VAT Refund at the airport.Have a fun time shopping!
Great place to shop. I just wana say that if you're in bangkok then you'd buy something by siam paragon, really very awesome place for shopping, you'll nearly have all the good you want.Regards

Best thing about this place is the skytrain access and the bookshop. This is one of those shopping malls where 99% of the shops are just empty except for the staff. The best thing about this mall is the gourmet supermarket where you can buy a lot of imported goods as well some of the little places around there where you can buy street food which is cleaner and not tarnished with street pollution. The bigger restaurants around there are just tourist traps, higher priced with kind of boring food. The exception is probably Mandarin Oriental which has good cakes.The Kinokuniya bookshop is probably one of if not the best bookshop in Bankok. It is there version of Borders books. The cinema is also good and shows a fair few western movies.It's also handy that Siam Paragon has direct access to the Skytrain on the 2nd floor. Overall though I'd say that if you were in Bangkok longer than a week you'd probably give up going here unless for shopping at the supermarket.

Everything here. This is a great destination.Fairly high end fashion and style but probably something for everyone,except market type.Enormous food court with absolutely everything.They even have cars for sale.Good access to Skytrain.

Great Shopping. I never miss a few hours shopping here when I am in Bangkok.It has the best costume jewellery section and the handbags are fabulous.The ambience of the store is lovely and has that "upmarket " feel.Enjoy!

Just love this place. We go here every time we are in Bangkok, it is the best shopping in Bangkok, has great resturants and lots of entertainment.The food hall is always packed and lively, you could spend a lot of time in this complex, and the good thing is that it has easy access to siam square and Discovery, if you run out of stores to shop in
Good experience for shopping!. Just like others in Bangkok. Hugh collection of super stores. Girls will love this!

21st century Shopping with so much choice..... Amazing shopping experience. There is a world class Aquarium below and a choice of dozens of cafes and ice cream cafes As well as products you would expect to find in a shopping centre. You can even buy a Porsche or Lambo.
Good shopping mall.. Is worth visiting the mall if you are around the area.

What a mall.... Biggest attraction of this mall apart from very big chic upmarket superbly clean is the siam ocean world. A very different experience in a mall! Go here for great snaps with family n friends. Do lots of window shopping and if pocket allows can buy the hi end brands sold here.

Siam Luxury is this mega shopping centre. Siam Paragon is one out of 3 Siam mega shopping centres. Paragon is a massive shopping centre that caters for authentic luxury goods, brands and gourmet foods. Just some of the shops you'll find in Siam Paragon are: LV, Chanel, Marc Jacobs, Swarovski, car showrooms for BMW, Lamborghini, Jimmy Choo and some very expensive diamond jewellery stores.Quality is second to none in the stores at Siam Paragon and the price tags also match. The gourmet food hall is exciting and there is something for everyone, the only trouble is deciding what to eat because there is so much range.Getting to Siam Paragon is easy and cheap via sky train or otherwise taxi.
good for shopping. probably the best in bangkok. my favorite place here is the restaurants with flavors from different countries
2nd Favorite Shopping Mall. I love book stores and cinema from Paragon. It really beautiful inside.

Best Gourmet Market in Thailand. You can find anything here in the reasonable price, good restaurants around in almost every floors. Good service staff; you can have personal shopper and the delivery to your car. I love the food hall on first floor and gourmet market here is the best as I have visited every shopping malls in Thailand. Fresh and Quality food not so pricey as you imagine. You can have fresh cooked food inside with Thai Nam Prik with varieties of Thai food and dessert. The beauty hall contains with some exclusive and luxury brands. The name brands shops are around. Come here with the BTS is the most recommend as very easy with the huge main station of Bangkok.
Expensive. Its real nice, but for me, i thought it was a little bit expensive
this place has everything. great place to get out of the heat. food court has everything. movies on the top floor are 100b.

Total luxury. At Siam Paragon, you can buy anything if you can afford. But it's nice just to wander around even if you do not have the big wallet with you. On the ground floor there is Southeast Asia's largest aquarium, really cool. Siam also has a good foocourt with reasonable price

Great food court. This enormous shopping complex is unfortunately little different to anything like it elsewhere in the world with all the generic brand stores - what does make it stand out though is the fabulous food court in the basement with a abundant choice of local and other foods. It is cheap, clean and efficient. You have to buy coupons before going to the actual food sellers and the unspent part is redeemable at the end of your meal. It's chaotic and crowded but that's so Bangkok. There is a great supermarket there too as well as KFC and that other American giant that purports to sell food.

Great shopping mall. Thai's really know how to do shopping malls in my opinion; much much better than we in Australia do anyway. The food courts is great here (the local office workers pack the place out at lunchtime everyday) for cheap tasty thai food. Easy to spend 3-4 hours just wandering around here window shopping, which on a hot Bangkok day is one of the better things to do.
Beautiful Aquarium!. Great place to take kids. Amazing display of marine life from sharks to small fish.

high end shopping. Big mall, with lots of designer stores.The best part is the Siam ocean world, which is located in the basement. A wonderful aquarium with lots of marine species & activities for the visitors.
Fabulous Shopping. Easy to get around. Found all I needed and didn't have to leave the building. Clean, well kept facilities. Lots of places to chose to eat. Everyone helpful.
its all about shopping. nice, clean, luxurious shopping mall with all high end labels. be sure about the prices you would pay at home when shopping!
The food are nice. The price is ok but the place is a little too crowded during meals time

Huge luxury shopping Mall. The biggest in Thailand where you can not only buy cloths and computers but also books (best Japanese bookstore) and even cars! Of course you can also eat here, try Cafe Chili in the basement all the way at the end!
Great place hang out with the locals. Loved this shopping center there are so many places to sit and eat and people watch. Great atmosphere and lots of locals
Nice Shopping Mall. but its too crowded when i came in to saturday night. really couldn't enjoy it. Choose another day

Great Mall. 3 malls linked to each other with shops and brands of varying price ranges and tastes. All kinds of shopping, especially the Paragon Department store (though had a bad experience with one of the sales clerks). In general, a lot of the satff do not speak or understand english very well which is surprising for a mall which attracts tourists. Food court was great. The restaurants along the canal are fantastic. Easy to get there.
Splendid. If you're into malls, Paragon is so far the best high-class mall in Bangkok.
Great shopping mall!. Go here for all your shopping. When you need a break the food outlets are very good> Don@t miss the aquarium downstairs
Very good mall. Some upmarket shops, including amazing gourmet supermarket. Also some more affordable shops. Good food court
best super market!. they have the best super market...well stocked & plenty of choice!

more expensive than siam center. Shopping center, good to walk around but bad to spend money.many luxurious shops.Prefer the siam center just a few meter away beside, more accessible with a lot of shops at good prices.Anyway if you want to deal, prefer the night market.Excellent japanese restaurant on the third floor.good atmosphere outside with water spring and a big screen.crowdy at night, and justbeside a night market.

Liked their Food Hall & Siam Ocean World. Really enjoyed Siam Ocean World in the basements of Siam Paragon mall, hardly seen anybody from our country visiting that place as most of us do not know about it yet, but once u have visited the place, it will be one of your unforgettable memory.Also liked the food hall in ground floor of Siam Paragon, they serves large varieties of fish and meats, had a large salmon fillet with rice for just 130 Thai Baht, which surely would cost approx Rs. 800 in India. This food hall was cheap with clean and hygienic food, but one thing, u must be one who likes to eat Thai cuisine to enjoy this food hall.

A must visit shopping mall in Bangkok. The most impressive thing about this mall will be the food court. It has tons of food from eastern to western. The taste is good and the price is reasonable! Thai food is yummy!
Nice place to shop!. I am used to buy things for me by siam paragon because of the affordable price and quality.
Nice shopping mall for higher end products. great place to walk in and chill from the humid weather. We will visit this place after our usual visit to nearby MBK.

PARAGON PERFECTION.. Situated walking distance from Pathumwan Princess Hotel, this new Mall is a tourist experience without even opening your wallet- though I am sure you will.
Every brand of importance is on show tastefully and spaciously.
Don't leave Bangkok without walking through Paragon.
SHOP TILL YOU DROP. This is a great mall with a 5 star supermarket and superior food court. Lots of thing s to see and do. Enjoy!

Shopping for Name Brands. Siam Paragon houses some of the best known name brands in the world. At the basement level there is a huge food court serving international cuisines but there is a large area where you can sample Bangkok's famous street foods!

MASSIVE. This shopping centre makes any centre we have here in the UK look like a small corner shop in comparison.From the massive food court with a massive selection of western and eastern restaurants to the 30 lane bowling alley, massive cineplex and full exhibition centre located on level 9 this place has to be seen to be believed.Each floor is dedciated to various types of stores from fashion to home to technology, the best way is to start from top to bottom and and with a meal in the food court
Questionable. Over priced luxury goods if you want them, that it

Wow. We just went crazy here. Loved the food court. It was amazing to see so many people and such a large variety of food. The Ocean World was out of this world. And the 4D theatre was even better. Being a car lover I spent quite a few moments clicking away at all the beautiful sports cars parked there.
luxury shopping in Bangkok. air conditioned and full of luxury shops, this is a great place to cool off after the open air markets!
beautiful. quite a place, this mall. the ocean world was truly marvellous

Beautiful mall. Beautiful mall on Sukhumvit Rd.
Great variety of shops.
The food court has amazing (small) restaurants with cuisines from all over the world.
The Paragon Cineplex on the top floor(s) is amazing and there is also an aquarium in the basement (which I haven't visited).

Foodcourt!!!. These points go only to the foodcourt, everyone has to eat there! Go there first thing so you wont regret! We went on our last night and we were a but sad for not eating there ...ehh like everyday:)
Otherwise the shops were for the more expensive taste.

Great food!. I highly recommend the food court in this place. There is a plethora of fast food chains and restaurants, but the food from the stalls are a must try. A variety of delicious Thai foods can be tried for a surprisingly low price. Shopping wise, the usual Western luxury brands can be found here, if that's what you're after. The place is massive too.

A department store like most others. It's a department store, with full-price mostly high-street, branded products. That made it more interesting to be than the surrounding complexes full of designer labels. I bought a few things I needed there. The prices were reasonable (better than Sydney) but not amazing. The staff were absolutely brilliant - they knew their stock, and nothing at all was too much effort. There's a good food court on the ground floor, very much like those you get in western shopping centres, but with Asian food. It made a nice change for lunch: obviously a bit dearer than eating on the street but it was clean and air conditioned.

Great Western Shopping + VIP movie seating. Siam is a great, gorgeous, upscale mall. You'll pay the same as back home (if you're an American) and you'll see predictable cuisine in the food court, same as you would back home.HOWEVER --There are three great reasons to go here:1) The movie theater, with its VIP seating, is amazing. Imagine: the world's most comfortable, cushy recliner, blanket, all in front of a huge, state-of-the-art movie screen.2) When you need something Western, from sneakers to gym gear to designer handbags, you know it will be there.3) There is an ex-pat grocer near the food court that has many of the culinary delights you will inevitably miss from your Western home. A bit pricey, but worth every penny.

Good for people watching, but not for shopping. With it's 7 floors it's huge and you will certainly find 1 shop of every know european store. But the prices are also european. So don't expect to do any bargains at all! It probably better to go to the JJ market during the weekends to do some better/cheaper 'tourist' shopping.
Shopping!. An up market shopping complex with some very reasonably priced shops. The food court is also amazing - loved it!
Everything you want!!. I love super market on ground floor. You can find every thing you want. Good quality Thai fruits.

Huge mall with lots of delicious food options!. This mall is some what upscale. I thought my Bahts would go far here, but they did not. It is your standard mall but it is very clean and very big. My favorite part of the mall was the large food court on the lower level. They have so many delicious options. And the gourmet market is amazing, it's like a Thai whole foods. I went back like three times during my stay at Thailand for their delicious coconut rice. It is out of this world. They make it on site so it's fresh. This mall also houses the Thai aquarium which is a great place to visit if you are in the mall. You get to ride in a glass bottom boat among sharks. Overall I would recommend checking out the Siam Paragon. Also it's very accessible from the BTS.

Typical big mall. The most interesting thing was that when you walk outside (in early morning), there are people on the streets scraping the gum off of the concrete...this is how much they keep their city clean! The mall itself is really like any other Western mall...
Great shopping mall. One of the biggest shopping malls in Bangkok. Lots of brends, from mass market to real fashion. Few bars and restaurants inside. You can spend there all day.
Shoping tour. Her you can spent a day with shopping and dining in a nice surrounding everyday.

Siam Paragon, a class in it's own. Ooooo this place was fantastic! Lots of shops to check out, and lots of things to eat. It is more upscale as compared to MBK or Platinum mall. They mostly sell REAL retail goods with international brands. You will not get bored walking around this mall, and the ambiance is akin to Singapore's ION Orchard.If you are on a budget though, MBK and Platinum mall would be more advisable as their products are much more cheaper, and you can bargain, whereas Siam is all fixed prices, and products are much pricier.
COmplete mall. Good mall mid to high price goods. Food choices are aplenty, there is a food court and restaurants around the hotel. Perfect location too
a great shooping place. eating with international flavours and shopping @branded stores great place
Big and super modern shopping mall!. yes, if you want to spend the time in a modern and luxury shopping mall, don't miss it!

For shopping addict. You can easily spend a whole day chacking all the shops in this huge shopping centre. It is very clean, well organised, relatively quiet (compared to noise levels in other shopping centres). prices are very interesting, also teking into consideration tax refund for foreigners.

A great Place to shop. 3 large shopping complexes are connected together to provide an amazing shopping experience - no fakes here! On top of one of the complexes is an ice skating rink whilst another has a full on aquarium with sharks!

Everything You need!. This is one of the biggest shopping center I have ever been to! All types of shops, from the cheap ones to the most expensive ones. All thype of restaurants with all variety of food. It is not an obligatory point to see while beeing in Bangkok but if You have a while definietly worth visiting, at least to eat something in a typical thai restaurant! :)
one great place to shop. one great place to shop - don't forget to bring your creditcard!don't miss the food corner on the lower floor
lovely food court. lovely shopping mall. Did not buy any shopping from here but went to the food court often Plenty of choice of foods from all over the world and reasonably priced
What a big and luxery shopping mall. Her you get everything. Luxery goods and international food.

Great place to get into the Thailand groove. Just step off the sky train at Siam Station and your there. Great place to get climatized to Thailand and still have a firm feel of the west. Not to mention the climate controlled interior which helps prevent one from melting...I spent a half day and still did not get to see it all. The food court is huge and you can find everything under the sun no matter what your taste.This mall is a must see.

Big shopping centre. Very nice and clean shopping centre, typical western style with many usual and upmarket stores. Unless you like to shop you can give this a miss, if you enjoy shopping then this is a good place to do it.

good for the food court..otherwise.... Prada, gucci, dolce and gabbana, diane van furstenburg, Chanel, Versace, Burberri, balenciaga, Chloe, Armani, Hermes, jimmy choo, marc jacobs, yves st laurant...and on and on and on, I mean there wasn't one store I felt comfortable going into! This is not a place for the average shopper, not even the upper class, this is for the super wealthy! Who shops here? Not the average tourist and definitely not the average thai shopper. I have been 3 times, the mall is always full but if you actually look into all these shops all you will see is idle sales people. How often is there someone buying a 4000$ Chanel bag or a 1000$ hermes dress? There were only 2 stores I saw that I felt comfortable going into, Mango and Zara, but I always shop there in Montreal so I didn't bother. This was a real disappointment, I was at least hoping for a few more mid range options. Terminal 21 is a bit better as far as the stores go.The food court is great though, I ate there 3 times and picked up some stuff at the gourmet market. If you aren't part of the 1% don't expect too many shopping options.
A tipical western shopping center. Not my cup of tea. If you like clean shopping center, european stile, with no special attractive prices, and can't without shopping - that's the place.
Huge mall. amazing mall with oh soo many brands. It also has many restaurants on the ground floor and also a thai food court. The mall is made beautifully.

A very expensive shopping complex. A lot of shopping malls in Bangkok are expensive and the Siam Paragon is no exception. But the coffee shops and restaurants are well laid out and it's worth a visit.
If you like shopping. Then definitely don't miss this place! It's reasonable, with nice food and beautiful women
Huge. Countless shops and restaurants in this mall. There's even an underground aquarium. YOu could get lost easily...

Your average mall. Siam paragon is at the center of town and close tothe otherbigmalls like platinum mall and mbk center. They have the usual american designerbrands and more upscale labels like hermes and prada. Nice to window shop but its the platinum mall or the night marketfor me where i did my most serious shopping!

Mid to upper class shopping mall. Located at Siam skytrain. There are Siam discovery, Siam center and Siam Paragon, which is the best of all.Siam Paragon is equal to central world (zen) shopping center at Chit Lom skytrain station. But paragon has waterworld at basement level and huge cineplex at top level. The Siam Cineplex itself has 4D cinema (extra feature than 3D cinema). The purple food court is using a top up card as a mean to pay food n beverage. Deposit some money at counter desk an they will give you card to pay with. The balance of the card can only be refunded if u ask the counter desk in the same day u get the card. Many currency exchanges so easy to get Baht when u need it. However be advised that branded imported clothes in Siam not always cheaper than in its origin countries due to import tax. (if u want cheaper local brand fashion head to platinum mall in front of pratunam market. If u want cheap Thai souvenirs I recommend chatuchak market on weekend only. Or u can try many stalls in front of Big C department store near central world)
Nice movie house. Take the more expensive seat, very nice. You will get a blanket, luxury seat and please do not fall asleep
yay, free and nice toilets!. Can you tell i was 22 weeks preg when writing this? Very nice shopping centre, quite upperclass as expected but good food too!

The big shopping mall for everyone. I just want to mention that the food court has the best selection I've ever seen.The rest of mall was all opened for different tastes.I even find a place for internet cafe over an hour for 50 something local $.The paragon department store is also Hugh for everyone's need.overall this is very good.

Where do you start.... When you try and describe this amazing place.I have been to Siam Parago a few times and it's always the place I head to for shopping when in Bangkok.I love the automotive stores on the upper levels, an experience in itself.The paragon department store in the middle is a great balance to the high end stores surrounding.The waterworld is underneath and I visited that a couple of years ago and would highly recommend.

Everythingny under one roof. Great mall to take a walk around but loads of designer shops so might be a bit expensive for a normal shopping trip, there's everything you could wish for so worth taiingna walk threw even if just to window shop.Food court has good variaty to make any taste buds happy
Fabulous shopping. What a fabulous shopping centre where the quality of the shops and the remarkable layout is as good as you will find in Bangkok.

Great for a look around. This mall is for the very well heeled and has every fashion brand name represented. I have never bought anything from Siam Paragon as it is simply out of my price range but they do have a a really good food hall selection and a Gourmet Market (supermarket) that selss everything you could need. Also a cineplex if you fancy a movie.

Loads of choice and utterly enticing. If you are ever stuck for something to eat head to the SP and the lower floor for a sintilating array of choices. A top class food court and you cannot go wrong here.
Shopping for the fat walleted.... This is a wonderul shopping area for all your designer needs. Make sure you pack all your credit cards.

Aquarium is very good - worth a visit. We went to the paragon mainly to see the aquarium. If you are interested in marine life do not forget to see this place. In many ways it is quite as good as the Monterey one! It was fascinating in the tunnel section to see sharks and mantas around and above you.What is confusing though is the bundling of tickets. With the aquarium ticket you also get a ticket to the "5D Movie experience". We thought that the movie might have anything to do with the sea or nature. It did not so if you have small children - see the move. If not - skip it.
wow food court...... Excellent variety of food at very fair prices. Shops high end but great to wander around this beautiful mall.
Pavilion Shopping Mall in Bangkok. Temple of brands are there...oppersite of it, there is a lot of night market in the evening.

Go here to eat or visit Siam Ocean World. This is great because it is right off of the BTS (the skytrain's Siam station). There is plenty of food to choose from and you can visit Siam Ocean World--a must see while in Bangkok. Behind the main food court is a great supermarket. If you are into cars, head up the escalators from the food court, and keep going up until you see the shops selling exotic sports cars. Other areas of interest above the food court / Siam Ocean World area is a gym and a large book store. Warning: this can be very crowded, especially the food court, and I got pick pocketed here--the first and only time I have ever experienced such a thing in all my years in Bangkok.I don't go here to shop in the shops because I find them too upmarket for my taste. I go here to eat, work out, watch a movie in the excellent theatres, or buy books.

A Feast for the Senses. Siam Paragon is one of my favourite malls to visit any time I am in Bangkok. It houses Siam Ocean World aquarium basement level and a massive theatre complex, including IMAX theatre, top level. The ground level offers mouth watering array of foods by many different food vendors: bakeries, ice cream, candy, savoury snacks. There are also many restaurants with international menus. Every business has its own innovative, unique signature design. The fashion floors are beautiful, with high end designer stores on the first level and boutique chain stores on higher levels. There is also a floor which features arts and crafts of Thailand with some beautiful things to see and buy. There are coffee shops and restaurants on every level to make it a relaxing experience when you spend a day there.
Food Court at Paragon. Paragon has a great food court downstairs. Lots of choice from Western food to Asian food to Thai food. Mostly very good quality and taste.

Awesome on a rainy day. We where recommended to visit the Aquarium on a rainy day by the hotel staff and it was fantastic. Travelling with our daughter I think Mum and Dad had just as much fun !Superb value, we chose to by the all round ticket which included a soft drink and pop corn mid way through. Chloe our daughter fell in love with the penguins and there is also a touch tank for the kids. Sit down and relax and get your feet cleaned by the fish !See-through boats going over the aquarium and you can feed the fish / baby sharks at the same time.Great for photos and the kids will have a great time. Easy to get to using the Sjytrain and again great value.
Boring. No character, hardly anyone shopping there, all expensive designer shops...only go if thats what youre after
very hi fi department store. as other cities in the world , very beautiful , all brands available , price is high as other cities but has lot of visitors , many food shops as well

Nice. Reminded me of shopping malls of Dubai.Good place to visit. Lots of quality food and areas to visit and enjoy.You can shop as much as you can, but do not forget to fill you pocket with lots of BUX as stuff here is almost double in the price.This place is mostly visited by the foreigners and has all the charm, one may like.
lots of food, lots of shops. Basement food court has a big variety of Thai food. Supermarket at the basement too.

Spent more time here than we expected.. This was close to our hotel via the skytrain and really has everything you need. We had a shoe emergency with my size 13 husbands shoes not arriving with us in Bangkok and got really lucky to find a pair of shoes for him here. Amazing to find a shoe that big in Bangkok!We came back to the food court several times. Tons of great Thai, Chinese, and if you have to have it, Western food, from KFC to KrispyKreme donuts!something for everyone.
Good for shopping. Just a regular mall with lots of good shopping points and eating options. Though you will be able to get better deals on some of the good brands on your lucky day.
like all malls.. But i found Krisp creme, starbuck, Macdonalds, KFC, burgerKing there!! I love it!!
wow what a shopping centre. This has it all, knocks any shopping centres in the uK into orbit. It is a welcome relief to be in the cool air conditioned well designed malls.
Large shopping complex for higher end shoppers. Siam Paragon is a beautiful cntre worth visting for high end shoppers and has an amazing food hall for a great lunch.

For the serious shopper. Well...it is a shopping centre...granted it is huge, but why travel to such a beautiful country full of culture and lovely people just to go shopping in department stores..can do that at home
Upmarket shopping. Lots of upmarket shops, but worth visiting to go to the excellent Kinokuniya Bookshop on a higher floor. Substantial English selection, as well as many Thai books.
shop to you drop. wonderful,elegant shopping, 5 star building at a slightly better than 5 star price, wonderful eateries everywhere and fabulous stores and beautiful people every where
Most Open Space I've Ever Seen At A Mall. This mall had so much open space, was state of the art and beautiful.

Always a good time to roam about this huge mall. Things here are expensive, food here as well. Nevertheless, you can pretty much get everything you need here. Also, it is a good escape from the mad weather.
You can visit most of the restaurants at the basement. Clean and pretty decent food.

Great mall ,plenty of food ,free wi fi ,lot of things to do and shop!. We spent our last day in Bangkok visiting Siam paragon.It was a great experience.Don't forget to take a tour to the Siam ocean center which is located under the mall.Quite expensive ticket if you want to try everything in the ocean center but it worths every euro!
A good place to spend time on a hot day. It has everything in there...but most are branded stuff.

great shopping, great food. Big, shiny shopping centre with all the A list names such as Chanel, Pucci, Prada and Gucci. The Thai food in the food court was cheap and delicious. I ate a big plate of steamed vegetables, baby clams (pipis) in a chili sauce and fresh tofu for less then $3AUD. My husband had an amazing tom yum style soup loaded with mushrooms, chicken and chilis but not too spicy for the same price. Check out the top floor of the Siam for the glamorous car showrooms like Lamborghini, Lotus, Mazerati and BMW. Try and work out how they got the cars in there.

Designer labels. massive airconditioned shopping complex. great if you love shopping and designer labels. There is an aquarium on the basement floor with sharks, fish etc which is worth a visit and a large food mall with restaurants etc

A great shopping mall!. A great variety of food choices at level 1!! Restaurants of different cuisines are available and the environment at the restaurants (high end) side are very quiet. There are food courts as well with choices that will spoil u greatly! A great choice for window shopping (as most of the shops are selling designer labels).
Biggest shopping mall. Siam Paragon has everything from movie houses to aquarium, big food courts and all the shops from Hermes to local Thai products.
Visit to Siam Paragon Shopping Mall. Very good shopping venue with lots of choice. Amazing selection of eateries.
shopping thing. nice place if you had budgets a lot to choose from and also near the train Station

Amazing shopping mall. This is the main shopping mall in Bangkok. It is very crowded during weekends but the mall is huge and i can accommodate all the crowd. There are two food areas in the mall: fast food area at the ground level and seated restaurants at the top level. There are about 12 cinema theaters showing the latest international movies. The mall is worth a visit of course.

Probably one of the best shopping centers in Asia. Asia is famous for its huge shopping complexes in places like Singapore and Hong Kong .This complex, in my opinion is better than any others.It is the variety of shops, restaurants and entertainment options in Siam paragon, along with its design that beats the competition hands down.You can find just about anything in this complex, including an aquarium to cinemas to high end restaurants, luxury shops, supermarkets and can even buy a BMW and other cars here.One stop shopping at its best.

Best Shopping Mall in Bangkok with an Excellent Food hall !. Siam Paragon is without any doubt the best shopping mall in Bangkok. A close second is CentreWorld (10min walk from Paragon).The food hall in Siam Paragon is fantastic, with so much choice, you will need to go back 20 times to sample everything. The place is very clean, and full of Thailand's upper middle class society who simply go there for lunch/dinner and don't even bother with the shopping.You will also find the best supermarket in Bangkok. This place is well stocked with all sorts of products, local and international, and would rival the finest supermarkets anywhere in the World. It looks classy, very clean, and quite clearly aimed at the wealthy.A must see if in Bangkok.

A Shoppers Dream. A wonderful array of retail outlets from all the designer labels to a great department store to a gourmet food court and supermarket. One of the nicest shopping centre anywhere and a must see if in Bangkok.
Great Mall. Great mall to shop in. Also has a cinema. Has the most A-mazing bookshop, they will cover the book free of charge for you :)
nice for a break. this place has some very expensive stores but just walking around looking at their window displays in aircon was entertainment enough for me! great food court - huge variety.

Classy Shopping Mal;l. Great big super clean shopping centre, right in the heart of Bangkok!if your visiting the MBK etc drop into the Paragon and have a look around, this place is extremely flash and the food court is unreal!
Paragon Department Store is Super Fun & Unique. Yes there are plenty of high end designer brands in this mall, and the Paragon Dept Store offers a unique mix of more affordable local designers.

Great shopping. This is a must shopping experience. It is beautiful for window shopping looking at Luxury stores such as Hermes, Louis Vuitton, Paul Smith, car dealerships etc... It is amazing. On the ground floor has a large variety of food stores ranging from MacDonalds to Vietnamese to cakes and ice cream. We recommend the Nitrogen Ice Cream - Mango.... It was yum.Within the shopping mall is the Paragon department store, which has every well known label. Depending on your currency exchange there are some good bargains.We could spend days looking in each shop.There is also an aquarium in the shopping mall which has a fee.
Excellent. shopping if you want to enter the "higher" price range. Wonderful and very ambient stores.

a temple of commerce and excess. a vast temple of excess and great place to wander in air con comfort out of the humidity and heat of the afternoon. good food court and restaurants if you want a break from the street food
Shop til 10 pm. Paragon is filled with high end fashion at great prices, the food is great, there is plenty to occupy the children here.
Most brand is here. Worth to walk around. Spacious and i bet you will find all the brand here.
Amazing shopping experiance.. The most luxurious brand or huge brand name and nice food and desert at B1.
Favorite mall in Bangkok. Everytime I visit Bangkok, I have to visit this mall. The food court has a variety of food and desserts to try and I absolutely love the aquariums there as well.

Huge mall with shopping options for any budget. I was positively impressed with endless eateries and coffee shops. The mall itself is well maintained, and I could find all brand stores I ever shopped in both in Europe and in the US. Great selection!
Mindblowing. Definitely worth the walk around if you are into brands. The department store can keep an avid shopper busy all day! We went twice, in a 4 day stay.
Great shopping. I wish they would have had more stores with Thai collectibles. We weren't able to get to Chatuchak and didn't find much at Paragon. It's more high end stores fashion and furniture.
Siam Paragon. A more upmarket shopping center but I still found a few bargains!

Dont miss the Gourmet Market and Canal on the Ground Floor !. Centrally located mall, with easy access to sky train. The floors and shops are paired in themes such as Luxury, Living and Technology, Entertainment Centre,etc so you can shose the floor as per your needs and taste. Use the elevators instead of the escalators in case you want to get to the theatre on the fourth (a time saver).I personally enjoyed the Canals on the ground floor with the greeneryand the gigantic food court.Super place, can spend the entire day here.
Nice expensive feel about it.. If you are looking for class and luxury at half the European prices this is it.

Truly one of the world's best malls. I finally had to time to enjoy the food in this place and am embarrassed as a New Yorker at the sewage we have masquerading as food courts in the U.S. I tried numerous restaurants and food counters here and all were superb. they also offer top quality food and at very cheap prices - just the opposite of the U.S.I can't stop being amazed at the variety of shops and the entertainment that goes on this mall. It appears there is always a some event going on whether it is a fashion show or special promotion going on. I love this place!

Shopping gone mad. This is where the Thai people go for bargains and you'll find a lot of tourists there too. Any taxi will know this place and there are lots available to get back where you come from. They sell everything you can think of.
Nice shopping mall. For those who are travelling with kids, Ocean World can be something that kids may enjoy.

Designer Mall. This was one of the surprise hits of our trip. It was great for people watching and gave us a good feel for the city and the people living there.The mall has all of the designers you'd expect (Pucci, Versace etc) including a car shoroom at the top full of boy toys (mercedes, ferrari, lamborghini etc). It also has a good department store, a book store with a large English language section and an aquarium in the basement, great for kids.The food hall had an amazing choice of food from around the world as well as local, all at a good price for excellent quality. It was wonderfully cool and airconditioned which was great hanging out in April (very, very hot).

Siam Paragon Designer Mall. Siam Paragon is a designer mall with a large department store, book store (large English language section) designer shops (Pucci, etc) including fast cars at the top - mercedes, ferraris, lamborghinis etc -and an aquarium in the basement. It was great for people watching and a real contrast to sightseeing. The food hall offers an excellent choice and great quality and all air conditioned which in April (very, very hot) was a blessing.My family don't really like shopping so we didn't expect a trip to the mall to be one of our Bangkok highlights but it really gave us a feel for the city.
Imax Studio. first time i watch in imax studio... really love the big screen! wohoooiii
busy location. The Siam Paragon offers a lot of shopping. A very modern shopping facility. Prices are high but a nice place to shop. Terminal 21 is also a good place to vist on Sukhumvit.

Gigantic shopping mall with a massive movie theater.... I want to start by saying, I have been to the Mall of America.The Siam Paragon shopping mall is massive. Most Americans may think we have nice big shopping malls in the States but this one puts many of those to shame. I can't say that this beats Mall of America but it comes pretty darn close.The movie theater is enormous and they have seating arrangements that I've never even dreamed of. There are VIP seats, premium seats and all sort of other extras. The lobby of the movie theater is a spectacle in and of itself.The food court is mind blowing. I nearly got lost walking around in the food court. There are so many choices and surprisingly there are so many American franchises I nearly fell over when I saw them; Krispy Kreme Donuts, Subway, Starbucks, Burger King, Tony Roma's just to name a few.The location is perfectly situated next to the Siam stop on the BTS. This is truly a fantastic shopping mall.
Great Food court. Stop here for coffee or a meal. Its worth it, go to the basement its just great. Ignore all the top end shops and just go for the food.
Probably one of the best Malls I've ever been to. Huge Mall with a variety of shops. It's a great place to escape the heat of the city. However, unlike many things in BKK, it is not cheap.

Specifically what I love. I love eating sushi at the food court. It is among the best. I also have an obsession for the Bourbon Tart at Mandarin Oriental Shop. Oh and I think Siam Paragon is a great place to shop for books. Ching-ching.
I love this place. High quality shopping and just beautiful. I love Siam Paragon and make it a destination anytime I can.
Shoppers insite into heaven. Any brand you ever heard of havnt is available in these 3 malls and with Madame Tussauds and own Aquarium, really is a unique experience.

Upscale mall right in the middle of BKK. Nice shopping mall in the middle of city.
VERY VERY easy to get there and BTS skytrain would be the easiest way.
This mall has almost anything you can possibly need.
For example, aquarium, food center, hi-end shops, luxurious car gallery, movie theater, exhibition hall.
You should spend at least half a day at this place!

Great place to hang around. The elegance shopping mall to hang around during weekend. The place is just next to "Siam BTS Station".This shopping mall is suitable for visiting with friends, family, couples, or solo. You can enjoy many activities there such as "Siam Ocean World" on the basement, Bowling & Karaoke with Friends, watching movie with your couples, or enjoy brand name shopping.There are many nice restuarants on the 1st floor and 4th floor. My favorite restuarant is "Another hounds by grey hounds".

Huge shopping complex, Delicious food. We eat here at the food court daily when we visit Bangkok. The shopping center is huge (we mainly window shopping here as stuff are rather costly) and so is its basement food court. Hundreds of choices, affordable and delicious.
Shopping. Many brands both Thai and high end brands here. Two hours re not enough;)

Good time for holiday. We went to The Ocean World at Siam Paragon for relax there are very nice and made me so excited to see a big shark and i feel like i am an adventure in the forest there. Nice for relaxing and if you feel so hungry there have a shop for sale a snack and drink as well.

Like to hang around. This place not only for shopping, food and other activities (movie, museum). center of everything and i like it has fair (food fair or other products or concert) from time to time.
great food choices. lots of food choices, affordable prices for tourists
Expensive. Great place for young fashionistas but not so fantastic for overweight seniors but well worth a visit

Excellent for it's purpose!. This mall is heaven if you are not looking to buy cheap! All your classics are here; Louis, Chanel, Jimmy Choo, Prada, Armani etc and they are definitely not the fakes. We got here via tuk-tuk but it is right on the SkyTrain line. If you are looking for something ALOT cheaper with your fakes and the ability to barter, head to MBK mall which is a short walk across the road. We did most of our shopping there. I also heard there is another mall which rivals this one called Gaysorn but we didn't get time to visit this one.The mall itself would take hours to explore every store - but the department store is great if you are looking for something in particular (the designer stores are on the outsides of the department store) and they seem to incorporate many different brands.The eatery downstairs is overwhelming. They do however have the cheat option of getting McDonalds or KFC if you just cannot figure out what to get (which was my case) and they all speak English well enough to help out. I found out later on they have a cinema, 'Ocean World' and hotel connected as well, and there are always events happening in the surrounding squares.
Bangkok Mall Experience. Very good location, it's a one stop shop. You can find all things that you need during your stay in Bangkok. Awesome experience.

Every weekend there is something new happening, even a Ukulele festival on the time that I went.. This mall is a bit more expensive than other ones, but you can find more special items that aren't available elsewhere. Good mountain bikes, unique Japanese package foods, Italian gelato, etc.
Western style shopping. No fakes here. But some expensive shops. Good eating places too

A Short Walk Through Was Enough. As the title says. Its another huge mall in Bangkok that is filled with the same old shops at higher than average prices. If you really need something then sure, but did you come to Bangkok to pay the same as back home?
Paragon the real super mall. i bought couple of gifts for my friends and family by paragon its just cool place to surf and shop.

One of the most popular shopping center for the local people. It is a great mall. You can find whatever your desire is. Food and shopping possibilities are endless and they often have some extra promotions and exhibitions.

Wow. What an amazing shopping centre. Exceptionally clean, and the shops are all organised by type on each floor, eg designer clothes, home wear, bling etcBe warned through, the prices are significantly higher than the UK.

a must go for all ur shopping needs. go here for all branded stores , and the best i like about this mall is there food bazar on ground level , lot of grocery items and exotic things to choose from , fresh salads , fresh fruits etc etc.
electronice floor on top, book stores, entertainment area , aquariums are other attractions here
Huge shopping mall. Within walking distance to our hotel and a more mid scale shopping mega mall
Great Shopping & Eats. You can shop until you drop and then have a bit to eat after with a wide selection of foods on offer for a reasonable price.
Neiman Marcus of Thailand. Pretty, clean, lovely but the priices and selection were no different from Neimans.

dont worry about westfield. Siam paragon u can get and see everything for clothes ,aquarium (the best in the world) and i have seen them in canada /london/u.s.a./australia (queensland /sydney/manly/ ect but this dont miss

Don't miss out on the aquarium or food court!. On the lowest level of this shopping center is a great aquarium with thousands of fish and great exhibits. It's worth the cost ($30US I think). Also the lower level just above the aquarium has some great food displays and lots of tasting areas which was a fun hour. You will see stuff you've never seen or tasted before unless you've been in this part of the world before. They also have lots of western food if you want or need it but the asian stuff is really fascinating and beautifully displayed.
So big. It is so big, almost too big. We felt very overwhelmed. STILL! A must see place and a great day out. Totally agree that it is a must do in BKK

Ocean World!. Referred to as the grandest mall in Thailand, I loved the ambiance outside with the waterfalls. Make sure to visit the Siam Ocean World at the basement. Definitely enjoyed seeing the penguins! And the 5D cinema. Make sure to have your photo taken where there's a shark baring all its teeth. The aquarium is magnificent too!

Another excellent mall. This mall is so big, it has its own aquarium attraction in the basement! It has everything you could ever want, and the food court has tables with large aquariums built in. More to see and do than you could fit into one day.
:). nice clean good shops! but like every department store in bangkok, it closes early! even the restaurants...
A Shopper's Must. All the name brands in one central location. Convenient to the Sky Train to avoid the Bangkok traffic.
Best place to shop. BTS can reach here from the city, we take BTS from phromphong station.
Interesting. Bit expensive for some things. On the plus side wide variety of designers.

Perfect for lunch. Visited the food court in Siam Paragon for a quick bite to eat with my wife and two daughters.
Two Pad thai's, one fried chicken with rice, one fried chicken with curry and rice, three large cokes and a bottle of water, less than £8.00.
Quality food at a bargain price, everything was polished off!!!

shop till you drop...then shop some more!. You will just be blown away here.Designer shops, single branded outlets and its own department store.....just a shopping overload!so easy to get to right outside BTS (skytrain station) Siam Square and also right bang next door to another two shopping malls!!it is a must to go when in Bangkok and i am sure you will not be disappointed....except with the amount of money you spend of course!!..lolhave a great time,regardsPerry
Thai brands!. If you skip the "Luxury floor" and go for the floor with Thai designer clothes, very nice and special things - and the prices are ok.

Shopping Centre. Large shopping centre with brand shops i.e Nike, Addis, MAC not as cheap as you think it would be. Better off going to MBK centre which is connected to it. Plenty of shops and stalls for better value and you can haggle prices!! You can spend hours here!!
