great mall- little to big and crowded-always!. nice overcrowded place were u get everything!-very good food hall in basement - with excellent cinema 6th floor!dont miss food hall!

HUGE. This shopping complex is probably the most grand of all of them. Very clean and lots to buy. A great aquarium too, which I highly recommend. The cinema is the biggest I've ever seen. They actually have a 4D cinema too. It's cool for the first 10 minutes, then it just gets annoying. Honestly, 2D is probably the best bet for any movies, at least for now. Anyway, you could spend a week in this mall, no shortage of things to do.
Shopping Center. You can find here a "Food Court" - set of oriental restaurants. The lunch is very tasty and cheap (less than 10$)
Awesome shopping mall. The department store is sufficiently vast. The kinokuniya bookstore is fantastic. The dim sum in the food court is the best though.
Luxurious shopping. Can do brandname shopping e.g. Prada, Hermes, Channel or just everyday-use brand e.g. Mango, Zara. Many restaurants and also biggest movie theathre here

Shopping on another scale. Its simply fascinating to look at the stores here even if you buy nothing. Try eating at one of the restaurants, all the food is excellent and there's free WiFi in most cafes.

Great location. Lots of shops, restaurants, Theatres and a big food court and suppermarket. This is a big place that centrally located. Right next to the Siam Interchange of BTS. Right in the middle of great shopping and a wide choice of restaurants. can get rather crowded and vefry touristy.

Yummy. Great food at Food Hall in basement, buy the food card and refund the balance within the same day. The small snack stalls are very good too and you can keep eating non-stop here. The ocean world is also here but quite expensive to enter. Opens at 10am

the most luxury mall of Bangkok. You can find many world brands there , but more expensive than many other countries . And if you are M or L size in Europe forget to find anything for yourself. Their Large size is equal to Small size of Europe. To shop in all Thailand means for me , to buy local art , antiques etc. not anything about clothing.

Huge shopping complex. This is a huge shopping complex, you can easliy get too from the skytrain. All the top end designer shops are here, there is also numerous eateries on the ground floor, well worth a visit but do not expect a bargain here.
great, if you want glitz. It's hard to imagine a fancier selection of tenants, but there's nothing particularly Thai about this place.
food shopping. great place to buy food and wines to take back at hotel and have a beautiful buffet in your own room. great prices and good deals on currancy exchanges

MUST GO THE AQUARIUM. The complex itself is just a BIG complex with high price. But the aquarium near basement is a MUST GO Place. 900B is reasonable price, because it is equal with Singapore Sentosa.
Large shopping complex. Good food, great shopping and conveniently located at Siam BTS
Huge mall with great oceanworld!. Oceanworld in Siam Paragon was great and fantastic. 5D cinema is cool!

Just a huge mall, but with French cheeses :-). Nothing special, except the presence of cheese, bread and wine, from France!!!
They saved me ;-)
Best shopping location in town. Still the best shopping experience in town. Must do food outlets are "Vanilla" and " the mandarin oriental cafe".

decent mall, food and entertainment. the mall is connected to SIAM Bus train station w/c makes it too convenient to shop and to hang around. Food court was also fab! you can choose from a budget to fine dining ones...

Upscale mall with great restaurants. We went here because we visited Siam Ocean World--which is located in the basement of the mall. It is a worldclass aquarium and truly worth the price. When we went there, it was also the opening of Madame Tussauds Bangkok but we did not try it since we found the aquarium more interesting. This mall is considered to be one of the, if not the most high-end mall in Bangkok. The shops are high-end. We really did not shop here but we enjoyed the great variety of restaurants there. If you are into eating places that offer quality food, great romantic ambience, and privacy, then you can find them here.

Aquarium. This isn't a review or rating about the Paragon,which is a big expensive shopping center, but it is about the aquarium in the basement, which is massive and must rank as one of the better ones in the world. We bought the multi-ticket, which gave access to the back areas of the place (a real eye opener how much goes on there) and a tour on the glass bottom boat. It also included the fish spa (not that great - maybe the fish were full when we were there!) and the 5D cinema (same as 4D with a wiff of perfume!). Staff were friendly and knowledgable, and the feeding times were well advertised and worth seeing. Plan for at least a half day there, but make sure you take a sweater and socks - we were freezing as the air conditioning was on high, as in most places in Bangkok!

Feast your eyes and your taste buds at the food court..... Located in the city centre, it is an unavoidable destination when in Bangkok. The huge mall houses all the well known brands for a great shopping but it is the food court that takes centre stage. You will be spoilt for choice with such delicious aroma of food wafting through to tempt you. The display of food is everywhere and is appealing to the senses. The thai pancakes are a must try which is as much a wonder to watch being made as it is to eat.Another attraction worth mentioning is the Siam Ocean World. We enjoyed the experience and would certainly recommend if you are travelling with children.

Siam Paragon Shopping Centre. This shopping centre can be reached by using the skytrain which stops directly at the front of this complex. It is quite beautiful inside but do not go there expecting bargains - it is an upmarket shopping complex with all the very well known brands but worth a visit.

Excellent window shopping!. You could spend all day just walking around the centre and looking in all the shops. It is easy to access from the Skytrain. The foodcourt has an excellent and varied selection of restaurants.

Great place with a lot of dining options. As I'm from Indonesia, Siam Paragon is a good place with a lot of dining options, but not for shopping. I think things in Bangkok is more expensive than what we have in Indonesia. However, it;s good to spend time here just to watch how most tourists and locals spend time in Bangkok.

Fantastic food court but generic international brand shops. Go for the great food court with variety of foods at cheap to affordable prices. Shops seemed to be either international luxury brands (Gucci, Louis Vuitton, etc) or high end Thai shops and if that's what you are looking for, it's good here. But I don't always want to see brands that you can get at any airport shop. Some of the Thai fashion brands like flynow or senada were too frou frou and expensive. Jaspal had some decent selections but also pricey.
Great Shopping variety. With many places to shop at discounted prices this is a option for when you want to buy true quality. Its great for the eating, air conditioning, and variety of clothes.
Shopping heaven. From local silk to European haute coutour there is something for everry woman at the Siam paragon - husbands beware

Excellent food hall. Bangkok has a lot of cinema complexes that are new, modern and have a lot of brand shops. I think this is one often best complexes mainly because of the food hall on the ground floor. Extensive range of tasty food at good prices. If you want a break from street food give this place a go. Shopping here is also very relaxing.
Good food court. Food court is good which is in the basement level beside it also has numbers of branded stores ...bit more expensive then all the others as well

Wonderful selection. I bit high in price for shopping, but the food selection and the variety of restaurants is wonderful. The cinema was very cheap and the location is so easy right off the sky train.
Best Gourmet Market. If you are unsure where to eat, You must try the Gurmet market inside paragon in the basement. amazing choice of foods and you can buy great sushi for close to nothing.

cool and hip and trendy place to see and be seen. if you are looking for bargains, keep going! this is not the place for 'designer knockoffs.' you will pay real prices for real products, but the movies are in Eng, the food courts have amazing variety, and the aquarium is a decent place to take the kiddies.

Favourite Mall in Bangkok. Its my one-stop shop for everything I seek in a shopping trip to Bangkok! The restaurants are outstanding too and even after so many visits to the city, I've yet to finish sampling all the restaurants!Very well kept mall too.
Shoppers Paradise. Wonderful shopping centre overall, but we think that the dining options are absolutely incredible...dont miss the ground floor as well as the cinemas on top floor.
Great shopping and a great cinema. All major named brands under many floors, especially the food court yum yum. All at the top is a very good cinema for those rainy days

Aquarium. The Aquarium in the basement is great for adults and children.
There is heaps to see and it is huge!
Well worth a visit but expect to spend half a day there!
Make sure you buy the ticket that includes the Fish Spa, the little fish nibble your feet.

Right up there with any other major city for class.. Sometimes it is easy to think of some parts of Asia as second world. Siam Paragon is where you go to remind yourself that some of the greatest shopping in Asia is located in Bangkok. 8 Stories of magnificent. Some world class shopping. It also has a great western food grocery store the bottom to fill any cravings you have. The main advantage to Siam Paragon in my mind is the Aeon ATM located on the bottom floor down the escalator from Mc Donald's. Why is it important? Because it is the only ATM network that does not charge the additional five dollars to use a local ATM. You can't miss the ATM it is purple located right next to a watch repair kiosk.

Huge In Every Way. Basically, a shopping mall, the place has something for everyone, at least, everyone with some money to spend. Expensive stores and moderately-priced cafes. An aquarium. And even a car dealership on the fourth floor!

Good & Bad. Siam Paragon feels like a junction point, or traffic intersection. If you just looked at the entrance point where water fountain square BTS and huge food court sit you'd think this mall was a bustling hyper shopping experience. None could be farther from the truth. The layout of the mall is not user friendly and the shops are high end and for the most part, irrelevant. I think most people come here for the AC and to get out of the sun. The life of the mall begins from the lower level food court up through the car showrooms, California Wow and ends at the awesome cineplex on the top level. The IMAX and quality of the movie theaters is very high end. The shopping part of Siam Paragon can definitely be skipped.

Luxury Mall in Heart of Bangkok Shopping District. Siam Paragon is a large mall located right in the middle of Bangkok's flashy shopping district. The mall itself is huge but well set up (generally similar stores are grouped together). It is convenient to get to as it is directly by the Siam Skytrain station. It addition, you are also close to Central World, Siam Discovery, Gaysorn and a host of other shopping complexes all within 5-10 minutes (walking) of each other.In addition to shopping, it also contains a cinema, an aquarium and a host of restaurants.There is nothing uniquely Thai about the mall. It is just a huge flashy shopping center filled with luxury brands. When you are inside it, you could just as easily be in Hong Kong or Las Vegas. Great place if you are looking to do some high end shopping (or window shopping!). If you are looking for something a little different, you can visit Siam Square across the road. It's an open air cluster of small shops and will give you much more of a feel for the Thai street shopping experience in all its crowded glory.In addition, the Siam Discovery Center (connected by walkway) is specifically branded as a teenager hangout (think Shibuya in Tokyo). So if you want to check out more cutting edge designers or just see what Thai teenagers with disposable cash do in their time off, it is worth checking out.

A little luxury in the heart of BKK. There's pretty much something for everyone in this big mall - from the Siam Aquarium in the lower basement to the cineplex on the top floor.There are high-end boutiques, loads of cafes and restaurants and a Thai-style food court in the basement.Situated right next to Siam Skytrain station, it's very easy to get to and from.

Large shopping mall but expensive. High end shopping mall with a very cool food court . We were spoilt for choice with all the food outlets. We didn’t really buy anything here as all the prices are similar to what you would get back home so thought it was pointless to shop here.

Brands Brands and Brands. Missing the glitz and the upmarket feel in Bangkok?Siam Paragon is the place to be, while most of the stuff is frightfully expensive, its a window shoppers delight. They have a wonderful aquarium which is recommended esp for families with kids.

A Very good Shopping Centre. . .. Huge shopping centre selling everything you can think of. The Highlights though are the food court and the cinema, both are huge and there is something for everyone in both.
Best shopping centre in Bangkok without a doubt.

Busy but fun. Lots of people around, shops and the foodcourt are very popular on weekends. Great food and great to sit at the fishtank and eat! We went to Ocean world and I highly recommend the 5D cinema!

Madam Tussad and The Ocean World. I haven't had the pleasure of visiting the Madam Tussad's in London, hence, I decided to see it in Bangkok. Some of the Wax Figures were spot on, unbelievably similar to the actual people. However, their take on for example: Will Smith, George Clooney and Oprah was extremely disappointing :(

Siam Paragon is comparable with any shopping centre worldwide!!!. All you need to see and buy!!! From postcards to Farrari's!!!!
Top elite shopping complex.

best but expensive. evert thing orignal branded in this place from cosmetic to clothing it has a very good it and mobile floor also plus on that it has one of the best movie thetres with the only 4 d theatre in bkk
Not need to go!. This is not a great shopping center, I think we all have seeing better
Excellent Mall. Connected to BTS Siam, Lots of Food Joints, Madam Tussad's, Sima Ocean world, Beautiful water fountain facing the BTS Siam ... Definitely worth a visit
Just more shops. Just a glitzy shopping centre - the same type that are in every country. I prefer to haggle in the markets.

A worthwhile high-end shopping mall. Access is really easy since it is right next to the Siam BTS station. There are also plenty of good eating options from budget to expensive. If you want to buy international luxury brand products in Bangkok, this is the easiest place to look for them. Don't expect to find any bargains unless you are around when they have a sale.
Very cheap products. this is a very good mall for getting good prizes. People here get offended if you do not bargain....so don't feel humiliated by doing so

High end mall, during sales period you can get great deals. I always like to browse Siam Paragorn whenever I am in Bangkok. It is more of a high end place but I only normally shop here during sales period anyway, you can get very good deals then. The shopping choices are endless. The food court down at the lowest level is very good. You can get many different options from the lower end food court "stalls" of different food types or you can have a sit down meal in one of the restaurants there, the choice is endless. Also the supermarket there is very good with a wide range of items both local and international. After all the walking, I always ends up at the L'Espace cafe for coffee and sometimes cakes and to people watch. Normal days the crowd are reasonable but in the afternoon/evening can get crowded when the schools are out. On weekends can be pretty crowded.

eat till the cows come home. I have never been in such a wonderful food hall in all my years All tastes are catered for. Well worth a look and maybe something to eat. Go with an empty stomach.We went to Cinnabon for their amazing cinnamon whirly cakes.To Die for!!!!!!!!!

Great for sight seeing. This mall is so beautiful, I enjoyed the food there more than the shopping itself. The stores are very expensive though and actually not my style I got couple of things from the Gap and mu new favorite shoes =) hang out at the food court in the first floor, it is really nice...I sound silly, right!

Most awesome shopping centre!!!!!!!!!!. Awesome places to lunch at! 9th Cafe and Cafe Fish were really good. Most incredible shopping! And wow the gourmet food market - I didnt know where to look first! My friend and I had makeovers at Bobby Brown - such wonderful and helpful staff. It was just the most amazing shopping experience. And every fashion label u could wish for!Okay it takes you two hours to get back to your hotel by taxi which is around the corner - but hey, your're on holiday!
Best Hi Class Shopping. If you have the money, they have the products. Lots to do, even for the kids - good food in many shkops
Central. I liked the shops outside the paragon! grab much more bargains than inside the paragon.. way too expensive.
The place for shopping. Not just Paragon, but all the 3 malls in this area are worth the visit.You will find amazing food and great shopping (not the cheapest one).
Shop till you drop. This place has it all, boutiques, food from every corner of the world and more. A real easy place to do that shopping.

Shopping, Shopping, Shopping. Spend a day indulging in the Thai's national passtime .... "Shopping"Spend, spend, spend in one of the nicest shopping malls in town ..... or, really enjoy your time in Bangkok, and take a water taxi along the river instead, and keep your money in your pocket!

Lots to see, but perhaps a bit too big. Let's get the bad points out the way first; it's a big, modern shopping mall, a cathedral to commercialism, an inauthentic bubble hermetically sealed against the real Thailand you get by eating street food and riding in a tuk tuk.Now the good stuff: it's a big, modern shopping mall, etc etc. It's full of Thais, so it can't be *that* inauthentic, any more than twelve vodka and Red Bulls in Phuket would be. I assume most people holidaying in Bangkok don't need to buy a Lamborghini; just in case you do, there's a showroom on the 3rd floor. There's also an aquarium (overpriced), a pretty good food court and an exceptional movie theatre on the top floor. Perhaps when in Bangkok you should be outside getting sunburnt, not inside relaxing, but this also gives you the unique Thai experience of everyone standing up immediately before the film starts, while the national anthem plays. And who'd want to miss out on that?

Have your wallet ready!!. Massive & ultra chic shopping complex, all the most expensive stores are here, great to if you need to cool down from the heat of Bangkok!! Basement floor aquarium, & ground floor eateries are more than interesting too!!

Found it very expensive. An extinsive selection of designer shops, Well laid out, comfortable and pleasant to visit. But seems hugely expensive compared to UK prices.
But the food court in the basement is very well worth a visit.
Siam Paragon food court. I love the food court and the shopping! Go around the food court for free tastes, and you'd get you're dessert already:)
High end shopping mall. It's a nice place to escape the heat, but better to look and not buy. Import tax is killer!

Shop till you drop. The Siam Paragon is a modern Shopping Center with almost everything you want. From cars to pens, the several floors offer a large variety of goods. At the ground floor there is a nice Aquarium and a Food court with all kinds of food. Sometimes they build a catwalk to present the new collection of designers. Go for it!
Good experience. Good place to eat and shop. Very modern compared to many shopping malls in Bangkok

So big shoping center. The one of bigest shoping center in Bangkok, where everyone can find what it needs. The food couner is very large with a wide selection Thais and the entire international dishes, not at all surprising kick expensive.
You can find more.. Good choice for shopping in this elegant department store like the Siam Paragon.It's a must to go..

Makes most malls here look like Walmart.. I can't afford to bye a bobby pin there, but lust to look... Everey designer the world over is reprisented. The place reeks of money. Don't miss the food dept. down below by the aquarium. It's just astounding.
Holy Toledo!. I have never seen such a happening mall. The hottest stores, but the food court is insane. There are endless stores with unlimited options. Millions of people. What an experience!

latest mall in Bangkok. Modern, big, testefully decorated, mostly fancy international stores,with restaurants and whatever you would expect from a shaopping mall. Nicely located in the middle of the busy shopping area of Bangkok.
Big Shopping Mall -_-. Just a typical upper class shopping mall with branded shops you can get almost in any country

Chic shopping. This shopping center is owned by the Royal Family. It is a high-end venue with many international products. Whether just window shopping or making a purchase it is very convenient. The basement has many food concessions and a very extensive food shopping center.
Everything you need is here. Taking BTS to Siam Station. Siam Paragon is on your left hand side. There are good food, brand name clothes, kids zone and, also, The Siam Ocean World is awesome.

Good place for shopping and everything else.... Here you really have everything from shops of all kind, cinema and restaurants. Easy to get a bit lost but good to spend a day with family or friends. Would not say its interesting for tourists because its just a ig big mall but if you live in thailand its good to give it a go.
Just Looking!. VERY expensive. Just go for a squiz at the shops and the people who can afford to buy from there

A mall is a mall is a mall....... It surprises me that a mall will be among the top attractions in Bangkok - after all, how different can this one be. In fairness, Siam Paragon offers a lot in terms of entertainment: they have an oceanarium at the basement, a cineplex, a convention center and a massive food hall where we had several of our meals. Unless you come from the Paris Hilton school of shopping and money is of no object whatsoever, please indulge and load up on Hermes, Gucci, etc, etc. Although prices here are much higher than in the US. Don't expect bargain shopping here as this is clearly not Walmart, Target nor Macy's. Think Barney's...Instead, head straight to the food hall at the upper basement for a selection of places to eat. Price range from very cheap (B60 for rice plate) to moderately priced (B200 rice meal). The gourmet shop though offers items great for bringing back home. We found bags of dried, crispy fish for only B60 and its so addictive.

must to visit if you want fancy items. it was neat and tidy and could see all brands of clothes and shoes , had a international cuisine section at the base where yu would have a difficult time selecting which dish to opt for , a must to see once
Big and modern shopping.. Is a very modern type of shopping complex. Lots of foods to choose from. Don't expect cheap buys. Is for higher ends Thais to shop in.
Centre of Shopping. i like this shopping mall many things for Shopping at BTS Siam they did many event best one is IT event and they have DHC Shop i always do a spa
Confessions of a shopaholic. shopping shopping shopping!! need i say more.. shopaholics stay away!
Upscale shopping, valet parking. The grocery store is fantastic, with food from everywhere.
Shops galore. Like many other upscale shopping malls in major cities this one is full of the same name brand shops. But enjoy the air conditioning as it provides much relief in the hot humid climate.

good on a hot day. It seems to be Bangkoks high end mall so like many places round the world. However-do not miss the food hall on the ground floor..and a vast array of tempting food outlets but Greyhound on the first floor is outstanding and after 2 visits still want to go back
Expensive.. It's a nice mall, all of the luxury brands are there which I find boring. The supermarket is excellent though.

Wow not a cheap place to shop but good to visit. This shopping complex has all the boutique labels that you would want if you have deep pokets and its a real nice place to go and walk around have coffee. I preferred MBK just minutes walk from this place as you get such good value from that place. Im not saying not to come to this complex but its not cheap but beautiful It ttruly is

Too big to negotiate. Once you are inside Siam Paragon you could be in any larger mall anywhere in the world. It has little character, and is so big, it is hard to find anything. Go to Terminal 21 instead.
Probably where the "well heeled" shop. Not possible for me to recall what you couldn't buy there. Really excellent (& well priced) Gourmet Food Market on 1st floor (?).

You have to see it. The quality of this shopping center is just unbelievable. A great place to see you too expensive for us normal people. We had a treat and ate the buffet at the Italian restaurant in the food market. More expensive then most, but when you have a craving for italian like home, it's well worth the splurge.

Shopping Fantastic. I work in an upscale shopping center in the states that doesn't compare to this one. Amazing shopping but don't rise early to spend your money. The stores don't open until 11:30 AM and the most fabulous Food Court opens at 10. Go and be amazed.
Excellent Gourmet Food Market. If you're a foodiee, you've got to see their Gourmet Food Market. Beautiful and surprisingly large. Outstanding quality of food.

Great food court. Enjoyed wondering around the mall but didnt buy too much there. Has one of the best food courts around with everything you could want - prices start from 40-50 baht per dish so very reasonable for a high end mall, the food court is ground level. Also has a first class cinema complex up the top floors and Siam Ocean World at the basement.
very nice place. I really liked shopping here and the other advantage was that it has other malls near it
Great Place. Very good shopping and the Aquarium is well worth it.!
Very Suave!!. This place is huge and has all the brands..Didnt get to see more than 2 floors..will try and cover it in my next visit.
What a shopping experience, of ethereal elegance. A masterpiece of surreal, high class shopping experience, built and maintained to the highest, old-world class standards, congrats!

Good PLace!!. SIAM PARAGON is a huge shopping mall. I loved the place but was a bit confusing for me as its too big. I think that it was confusing for me as it was my first time there.they have almost all the brands there.I had gone there to buy CROSS pens and found them in teh stationery shop. They have "Paragon Shopping" store where they sell a lot of things...shoes, sports wear, stationery, etc. Slightly upmarket, but the choice is varies.They have a huge food court with various choices.BUT, for me, the best was - AQUARIUM on the bottom floor!!! the Aquarium is AMAZING!!!!! Do not miss out on it!!Happy shopping.
food is the best. mall is okay if your into designer threads however an amazing restaurant on the lower floor cal the Tha ling bling serves great Thai food
Nice day shopping if you love brands.... If you love funky clothes, go to terminal 21 instead!
Fun with money. Good shopping, fair restaurants, great acquarium, good-looking young hi-so Thais.

Don't miss thé planfloors !. Very huge shopping place, Nice restaurant !
We get lost several time because we did not check the floorplans you can find at each floor of the main rotonda.
One of thé best place of you want to bring some presents back home.
Easy to relâche by skytrain
Go by Skytrain. Over the top shopping where one can see nearly everything and spend days.

Superb Shopping Here. A beautifully laid out shopping centre with direct access to the BTS system. This is one of the better shopping centres around with no cheap knock off's available. One of the many jewels in Bangkok's crown.

Nice mall. Good prices, good brands...air conditioner ! ! ! Many places to eat.
BTS skytrain conected!

Amazing people-watching. You'll blow through your cash quickly here, but this international mall with the world's top luxury brands is a great place to people-watch, catch a movie, or take kids (to the Siam OceanWorld on the basement level.) The food court has pretty much anything you could possibly think of to eat, and the spa services are also fabulous.

High End Shopping. Excellent high class shopping centre for those who love high end stores, brushing shoulders with the elite and simply dreaming for many. If you feel liek planning your spending spree once you win the lottery, this is a perfect place to start.
Shoppers paradise. All the names brands plus a movie complex, bowling and karaoke! I always make it a point to stop off here and see what movies are showing. I Love the IMAX screen!!

Huge shopping centre. Everything you could possibly need under one roof, the Siam Paragon is a luxurious shopping centre in the heart of Bangkok. Traffic outside can be chaotic and crazy but once inside the centre, all is calm and tranquil. The choice of shops and eating opportunities is immense.

Concentrated High End Shopping. Siam Paragon is along the BTS, and if High End Shopping is your thing and you pay high end prices - this place is your Mecca.If you don't like high end, then this is not the place for you to shop and you would rate it low. This rating is based on what it is and who it is aimed at. It is an amazing concentration of high end, major label stores. If you don't shop like that (I don't usually) it may be worth the stop just to see how the "other half" lives. Across the way is the Digital Gateway, a mall of nothing but electronics. For more reasonably priced items go to the MBK.
HUGE MALL. There's a underwater world/aquarium in the basement of the mall! Nice!

Great shopping mall. What else can we say? This is one of the premium shopping complexes in Bangkok. Next to the Siam BTS sky train station. Lots of branded shops and the food court at the lower floor is overwhelming with too many food choices to choose. We had to go back several times. We were there during the X'mas period and there were plenty of midnight sales with fantastic bargains for tourists.

Only for the SUPER RICH!. Don't get me wrong, I like the mall but things are just super expensive. As a budget traveler, what can I do is just window shopping. : ) For those who is rich, this is the place! Enjoy!
"One could spend days here". Siam Paragon has something for everyone at price points that make it a magnet for tourists and locals.

Definitely not for the cheap travellers. Siam Paragon is pulled straight out of the upper class world. Luxury brands and uptight staff who think the sun shines out of their behinds. I ended up buying one thing ($300 AUD) for the pure fact we went all the way there for nothing. My boyfriend and I also got lost as every level is the same and so so confusing!! (We ended up meeting at McDonalds- a great meeting spot ;) ) The best thing about it is the aquarium attached on the outside. i wouldn't suggest taking your kids to this shopping mall. Scary place ha ha.
The biggest and fanciest shopping center. If shopping is your thing, this is the place to go .it even has high scale auto dealers and and a large English bookstore
Grate place to visit. Manything to do, very interesting place and more stuff to buy
Excellent shopping center. Great range of shops although more geared to the luxury end of the market so if youre looking for cheap bargains then this is not your place. Great Food hall too!
Big shopping mall & trendy. we love this place and awesome. the place can reach by skytrain and big place and many things in there to spend around.
Nice Mall. From fashion to food,everything is in this mall.nice deco and with events inside and outside the mall.luv the food court and the market hall!

Upmarket Mall featuring excellent Design. Modern and beautifully designed mall. Canals in the walk ways in the basement, plenty of restaurants there and the reasonably priced food court decorated with large aquariums.Further down is Siam Ocean world, a large aquarium with walk through glass tunnel, sharks all around. Certainly worth to see. There's a glass bottom boat and scuba diving with the shark as well at extra cost.Shops are mostly upmarket and brand names, so not the place to go for a bargain. Features a large branch of Kinokunya as well, this is Bangkoks largest English language book store.Cinemas in the top floor complete the picture of this modern and well designed mall.
Nice upscale mall. The Gourmet Market is the best place to buy packaged Thai delicacies for export or travel.
great place. Nice place to walk around and make sure you come at night also as there are vendors outdoors all around!

Monster mall. Paragon is huge and caters to an upper-scale shopper, which it does very well. I get a little fatigued with all the little rich brats in their 20s, but this place has a great cinema and some interesting independent fashion and housewares shops, as well as many restaurants. (my fave is Piri Piri Portuguese grilled chicken...

A great place for kids, or for people who need A/C.. Great mall with Siam Ocean World in the basement. Siam Ocean world is a tourist trap that I really enjoyed. It's also on par with any aquarium I've ever been to. Add into the paragon store with the kiddie area, and even my 2 year old did not want to leave.

Beautiful Mall-- Expensive and Crowded. As an American tourist, this mall was definitely a unique shopping experience for me. First of all, it is absolutely beautiful. The architects did an incredible job designing it. The mall is very easy to get to using the skytrain (it takes about 30 baht to get there-- or $1.00 USD). It seemed like the mall always had something going on--- Wednesday night they had a wrestling match, Thursday a concert... etc... And the mall was ALWAYS crowded. I went on a Friday night just to eat at the magnificent food court, and almost got stampeeded. The mall is very high end--with stores like Marc Jacobs, Hermes and Lacoste. There are some mid-tier stores like Zara and Mango, but if you are looking for a deal, this mall may not be your best bet.
Executive Mall Experience. All under one giant roof. High end brands, exquisite multinational cuisines, entertainment for children and adults, luxurious interior design and good large spaces.

Fun and cool. Nice cool place to retreat in the heat of the day. Great mall, with so many food options it is difficult to decide. Movie theatre is awesome as well, offering 4D (moving seats, blowing air jets and scent).
Over my budget. Great shopping mall but way over my budget. I did a quick walk around and hit the food court downstairs - they have super pastries.

Siam Paragon Food Hall and Market Hall are Must Visits. Delicious street food like Thai sausages, crispy pancakes (Khanom Buang), papaya salad, grilled meats prepared super hygienically before your eyes - a treat for the eyes, nose and tastebuds!Go to the Market Hall for daily necessities like tissue paper, wet towels, sanitary pads, toiletries, and a whole range of Thai food products you can bring home as souvenirs at non-tourist prices - curry pastes, spices, mulberry tea, Thai snacks and more!

Not your average mall. First of all you're in a big city in the tropics... you'll need AC and this place has plenty. Bring a sweater! Plus some great shopping. Leave the international brands to ladies that lunch there and check out some of the local designer boutiques (many located in the mall right next door). One of my favorites for fashion forward goods is Greyhound. Bangkok originals you will NOT be embarrassed to wear back home. Buy something there every time I go. Also check out the fabulous food court in the basement and the IMAX theater on the top floor. And take a rest at True Cafe filled with with vintage chairs, great coffees and all the high tech gadgets you need. Also great for people watching. See how the the growing Thai middle class live!

Extravagant!. Probably the largest and most amazing mall I have ever seen. The mall is crowded, but it's definitely worth it. However, the best attraction of the mall is the bottom floor with all the eating establishments. There is a vast selection and you could spend an hour just wondering around the food court/restaurants trying to make up your mind for dinner.If I were you, I'd definitely visit Siam Paragon and plan on staying for a meal.

Fabulous food court. Shops shops shops. The thing that really made this place for me was the food court downstairs. Not only is there a supermarket selling a huge variety of stuff from all around the world, but there are fabulous stalls and mini restaurants selling amazing Thai food treats. You have to walk past all of the franchises from the US, just taking up space, but this place is a gem underground.
Huge. huge shopping centre with a big range of shops. girls could spend days here.
Bling. Nice shopping centre if youre looking for upmarket items - including some very expensive cars. The food court below is perhaps my favourite in the heart of the city

Nice and quiet shopping Mall. This is a more expensive shopping Mall than most in Bangkok. Nice to visit but did not do a lot of shopping there. Still would recommend visiting. Great food court. Many varied cuisines.
Siam. Great shopping centre but too much to see and do in one trip. Take a couple of days to shop here. Put on your walking shoes.

Super for Bangkok. I thought shopping malls like this only existed in Dubai. This one is great. A little overswhelming with people on a peak day, but a great chooice of all kinds of shops and services....

designer designer. If you like designer products this is the place to be, the supermarket is one of the best I have seen in Bangkok, food court is unbelievable, they also have an aquarium to visit in the basement area

Huge!. If you're looking for some air-conditioned relief from the heat of the city head to Siam Paragon for a spot of retail therapy. this place is huge!! prices are not especially cheap though, not too different to home.
Paragon. A place where you can find everything although at expected elevated prices but that should be no surprise.
My favourite shopping centre in Bangkok. You simply get everything at the Paragon, from Maseratis to green tea. Try out their foodcourt and get some lovely Indian or Thai food at the Asian Corner.
The place to be in Bangkok. This where all the action in shopping is happening

Amazing Mall - great 6th floor movie theatre. Most amazing mall I have ever seen! They have showrooms for exotic cars, Lamborghini, Maserati, BMW all had their best on display. Saw Star Wars Episode 1 in 3D
Gorgeous mall. Of the mall in the Siam area, this one seemed to be the nicest. It has a great food court in the basement.
name brand shopping. great mall offering high-end and upper-mid brands. I have done a lot of shopping here over many trips to bkk, last being in May 2011.

Luxury in a building. All the high-end shops can be found here. A nice place to relax and unwind. Wasn't able to spend a lot of time here, though, as I came from a previous temple tour.
Highly accessible. The BTS Skytrain Siam station is just outside the mall.

Only the Best. Siam Paragon is the one of the best malls if not the best in Bangkok. There are shops here to suit every budget. Very easy to get to on the BTS. If you love shopping then you must visit the Paragon.

Shoppers Delight!. Loved its displays, food, people and all the goods you can get for cheap :) Better and more stylish than MBK and yes a tad more expensive but the Aussie dollar is doing well, so, what the heck!! It's still a bargain....

Beautiful Mall. This is a very modern high end shopping centre that will impress anyone! Make sure to check out the car dealerships on the 7th floor (Lamborghini, Aston Martin, etc) and the Aquarium in the basement!

One of the best malls in Bangkok. Beautifully laid out shops with international brands, a multiplex, several food outlets and bowling alleys. What more does one want to spend a pleasant half day at the mall? Don't forget to visit Madame Hings shop for some wonderful smelling soaps made from natural substances. It is located near the food court.

Very good. Good for shopping.
Have large brand shops and also small ones.
Aquarium is must visit spot there.
Taxi service is very well organized.

Very upmarket. Great shopping mall but not the cheapest place to shop in Bangkok. However, the food court in the basement is excellent and Siam Ocean Park in the sub-basement is definitely worth a visit. There is also a great movie cineplex on the top floor with some super-luxurious theatres!

Central but there is much better shopping malls. Siam foodcourt is ok and the supermarket is fine. However I prefer Centreworlds complex. Many of the shops are pretty much the same same all very pricey but look nice. For shopping in Bangkok go to MBK or Chatuchak Market many bargains to be had and a great deal of variety
Best Mall in Bangkok. Easy acces from Siam BTS, you can similar or bigger and hig end mall in Jakarta, but this mall easier to acces with public transport

Easy entre to the Big Mango. Easy to find and get to, especially using the BTS. Aircon! and a great range of shops, food and entertainment. Although some may not consider this "authentic Thailand" it's a nice respite from the heat and a cruisey, enjoyable way to pass the time. Unique stores including specific high end Thai design and crafts. We visited on a week day, manageable numbers of people yet still plenty of opportunities to sit back and people watch. On the days we visited didn't see too many western tourists which makes a nice change. Visited Loft where a very friendly, hip young Thai couple (also shopping there) offered the use of their discount card when we were purchasing goods, and gave us useful tips on other places to visit!

Best food court!. and best mall on the planet. Really fun way to beat the heat. There is a multi-level souvenir and handcraft shop here than has some amazing finds. I was impressed by the huge range of oils they had for aromatherapy. Some quite unusual and unique to Thailand. Great place to get gifts.
hudge. the best centre in teh world, you get lost and need lots of money to shop here
Fancy!!!. A truly luxurious mall in the heart of Bangkok, with numerous international brand stores and a great food court.

No: 1 Shopping in Bangkok. Big, beautiful, busy, noisy, glitzy, glamorous shopping/eating/entertainment complex..... Every designer label you could want - and more.. Even if you don't want to shop, it's worth a look.

Underwater World & Madame Tussaud's Museum. An absolute posh area with a plethora of shopping malls including the MBK, Siam Centre, Siam Discovery etc. The underwater world and Madame Tussaud's Museum will entertain u for the whole day and its easy to commute by the Skytrain SIAM & NATIONAL STADIUM Stations... Don't miss the 5D show at Siam Underwater World though u may wanna save some bucks on the Glass Bottom Boat Ride & Back of the House Tour.

Bangkok's best mall. This place is GREAT on weekdays especially as it is not so busy. The ground floor is sometimes heaving with people (more like a zoo at feeding time sometimes).
But the selection of shops is second-to-one in Bangkok.

Nice Shopping. This building houses Siam Ocean World in it's basement.So you can have a dya of shopping and then visit Ocean World.Totally different shopping here not at all like MBK.It all looks classier but the prices are good.So many restaurants it's really hard to chose.Not sure you would get to see everything in one day.Well worth a look.
Good food hall. Good shopping, wheelchair friendly and plenty of places to eat to suit all pockets and tastes.

Giant altar to Asian consumerism. This is the high end mall in Bangkok. You want Prada, Gucci, LV then its here. High end dining as well as an extensive food hall with fast food and everything else in between. Giant cinema complex on top floor complete with the latest 4DX screens (although I find being blasted in the face with compressed air generally adds little to a movie). Also contains 2 large bookstores well stocked across the spectrum of fiction and academic works hard to find elsewhere in Bangkok.

Great food options, worn out movie theatres. The amount of food options on the lower level of the Siam Paragon is almost overwhelming! And I mean that in a good way...choices beyond comprehension. I settled on a place featuring thai and japanese food and had some delicious curry.My experience at the movie theatre on the top floor was quite different, though. Despite its flashy and modern looking exterior, the actual theatre I was in (#6) had a very strong mold smell (causing an allergic reaction for me) . It also had sticky, worn seats with tears and soiled spots. I had to pull a tissue out of my pocket and put it on my arm rest to stop my arm from sticking to it during the film! Seats are asssigned so you can't just move. The Siam Paragon Grand Theatres bills itself of one of the best in Bangkok but I hope for the locals that this is not the truth!
A big shopping mall. It is big so you can by anyhing there, it is big so a lot of walking
Classy. Enjoyed the bargains as it was January sale time.
Large shopping centre. A large shopping centre that has everything that you could want to buy. Prices are not cheap as this is a centre that has goods that are more upmarket. Worth a visit.
This is a big shopping Mall. We was in shopping mall with our baby. When we make choise in store our baby play in playground near us.

Mecca of shopping centres. I don't like shopping, but had to go to the UPS drop off centre there. We used it as an opportunity to explore. Truly spectacular in service, shops, food courts, etc.My girlfriend even spotted a local superstar, so she was happy :-)

Food Court Siam Paragon - a must visit. At lunch a very busy place.You have a good choice of local Thai food at very reasonable cost at the food court.Pre-buy the cash card and non used credit is returned at the card buying cashier.It is relatively clean establishment and food - different choices - tastes good and you should try it for lunch.It is an open area and the noise is as loud as a large local restaurant in Hong Kong.Beside the food court there are a lot of fast food and other restaurants. You should try the Fuji chain whilst some others are not worth visiting or mentioning.

Bangkok's best mall!. Paragon is by far the best mall in Bangkok. It has a great layout and you can find everything form the most expensive to normal stuff. Go there every week for shopping in the Gourmet Market downstairs which is one of Bangkok's best grocery stores.It might not have much cultural value for tourists, but for people living here (in Bangkok) it is a great place to shop and eat.
Impressive mall!!!!!!!!. If u really Love to shop for hours, this is definitely the place to come and explore!
Luxury Mall. Not the place to go for bargain-basement deals unless your annual income is in the 7+ digits ... but still, a beautiful mall.
best desserts in town. in the lower level are the most amazing assortment of dessert place you can imagine. I'm talking dozens of choice here.

Shopaholic heaven. Siam has it all for shoppers. Siam Paragon, Siam square, Siam Discovery and the daddy of them...Siam Centre.Siam Paragon (The Jewel of Asia) is BIG. Like think of 400,000 square metres so have on your best walking shoes.Cinemas galore and a food hall to pile on the kilos. There is an aquarium to keep the kids, old and young, enthralled.It is very bright, smart, flash and full of all the top designer labels....yet it also has some good value shops. The Skytrain stops right at the front door!Definitely good for a look around and to eat.

Not my cup of tea. Prices were higher than the UK - maybe shopping just bores me a bit - would be great if I had loads of money and space in my backpack - but nothing special, wasn't much different than going to the Metro Centre in Gateshead. It's great if you want shops but we just went for the sake of it really!

shopping paradise, with a price. This posh mall, with all of the big designer names and high end jewelers, is still a must see for the food hall alone. From Japan's Mos Burger to the Mandarin Oriental's cafe to the Gourmet Market food store, you can spend hours eating, watching people and then eating some more. There is also a nice store for Jim Thompson's fabrics for buying exquisite Thai scarves.
Good place to shop. Central is nearby and is also good. There are many restaurants here that are pretty good. Try the Sukiyaki it is pretty good.

Yes it is upscale but much more. The food court/ restaurant options are amazing. you can find just about anything to eat there. Many lovely handicrafts made in Thailand can be found at Exotique Thai on the fifth floor. For the beset in regional books don't miss "Asia Books"
Luxury shopping. If you wan a pick up a nice gift for the wife then this is the place to go. this is a top notch mall all the big brands all the nice fancy labels end of the day its a mall :)

great location. one of the most modern mall in Bangkok whereby you can find all your shopping needs from designers brands to home grown boutiques, also have a great food court on the basement where one can find all sorts of local and international eats and bargain items at Siam Square just across the street

Beautiful Shopping Centre. This would be my favourite place to shop for shoes, handbags and clothes in European styles but Asian prices. There always seems to be a sale on and the latest designs from Europe are here too. Check out the local up & coming designers from Thailand & Asia they are funky, fun and cheaper than the European ones. The restaurants here are top class and just like eating a-la-carte in Australia with better service.
Great place. Expensive! Place is beautiful...many lookers, but few buyers...unless ur are Western.

Very cool mall. This is worth stopping in to for a different taste of Thailand. Lamburgenes in the mall?! What! haha. It's crazy. Beautiful cinema where apparently a VIP ticket gets you a couch & your own personal waiter.

5 floors of extravagance. I'd rarely advise people to visit a mall while on vacation, but five stories of extravagance are a sight to see. Check out the aquarium in the basement and the awesome theater on the 5th floor.
Shopping Extra. One of the more expensive shopping malls, purely due to the class of high range shops, you can even pick up a porche, ferrari etc. Good food hall etc.

Fantastic Food Court in an upmarket shopping mall. I never really entered Siam Paragon since the shopping there is mainly very expensive and mainly for ladies, plus I am not a shopping person anyway; until someone told me that it has a fantastic food court. So, last December me wife and myself were in Bangkok for a couple of days, and we decided to try it out. Wow, in keeping with the upscale shopping upstairs, the food court is really a collection of really good restaurants, bakeries, and beverage places. There are no stalls like in a food court, but rather a open plan collection of eating places, each with its own staff, seating and proper kitchens. The eating places are too varied and numerous to list in the review. In summary, you can eat Japanese, Thai, American, Italian, French, Mexican, etc. etc. all located in one pretty large floor space. You can have proper meals with wine accompaniments, you can eat Japanese sushi, burgers, whatever. There are some great places for desserts too. And a supermarket selling gourmet specialties.Worth a visit - more than once.
Great food court. Fantastic plac eto eat, cheap clean and easy. Put mony on your card an deat like a king, perhaps too much choice!

Great mall - great foodcourt and grocery store!. I love the food court here, their Pad Thai is great!! They also have changing food exhibitions between the food court/paragon supermarket area. I've seen Japanese and Chinese stalls so far. Supermarket is great, lots of taste testing options and lots of western foods if you need to stock up.The mall itself is good, lots of the big international brands, and very cold airconditioning.
Shopping shopping shop shop. Love love love so many great designers all under one roof. Greyhound, Marc Jacobs, Zara, Chanel, YSL and the list goes on....

Great shopping area. Beautiful mall and great selection of high end stores that are found all over the world. I found the prices to be similar to what we would pay in Canada....if you are looking for bargains go to MBK. mall instead just around the corner.
Great Shopping!. One of the best shopping malls in Thailand, great deals and a variety of the best designers in the world!
Nice. It's just like any other big shopping malls in any asian cities..you won't miss much if you don't come here. It's nice when the weather gets too hot..haha

Very Busy, but good shopping. heaps of shops, good variety, no hawker style stores and all seems legit.
check with the phone providers for free Wifi connections

Classy. Its pretty much the fancy version of the mall across the street. It's full of some pretty flashy brands, but they are not cheap, and I don't believe worth the price if you live in the West. By the way, they have car dealerships inside the mall with Lambos and Porsches. Apparently they have to drive them through the mall every night to park them. It's a nice place to hang out and when I was there they had a catwalk with models which I got to meet.
Good for the rich. Branded shops everwhere here. Decent food court. need to buy a coupon card at the cashier box.Make sure you keep your card and get the deposit or value left on it. I forgot mine!

5 Star!. The mall, as any other luxurious mall is super huge and very comfortable. It can be easily accessible by either MRT or the BTS at Siam station.Varieties of branded and designers' items can be found here.Lots of food can be founds at the lower ground floor, including halal food.The mall has a very good ambiance even for relaxing after a tiring day at the mall.
Modern in Front Line. Huge shopping mall, modern, I bought all the items here. Very impressed with its food and beverage restaurants everywhere.
Shopping paradise - but no bargains. A huge choice of shops with all of the top brand names. This is a place to be seen shopping rather than a place to get a bargain.
home of Bangkok Fashion Week 2011. huge place,nice prices..you can find real sale there.It is a big complex with restaurants and cinemas.

A shopping, eating and entertainment Meca.. Pretty much a one stop place for just about every thing....even a Lotus car if you are so inclined. The Movie theaters are amazing and so is the Food court down stairs. Super easy to get to..the BTS Skytrain stops there. You are in the center of the Siam shopping district here. If you are unable to find what you need here just walk on over to MBK and you should find it there...plus the prices are more reasonable.

Good Shops. The thing I liked most about Siam Paragon is the collection of good shop. All the world famous chains are available here.I also watched a 3D movie in the theater and it was a pleasant experience.Though I did not go to the ocean world situated downstairs, I have heard it was a good place.So when you are thinking of shopping in Bangkok, you must visit this place.

a place of great mystery. Who exactly buys the $100,000 Patek Phillipe watches at Siam Paragon and the $200 ties? That's the mystery. Most of the shoppers at Paragon are of the local window variety dressed to the nines. They go to meet their friends and have a coffee and wander around in air-conditioning. Can you blame them?The mall has a number of upscale spas which seems to be doing quite well. The basement has a huge super market, a good one, and lots of coffee shops and over priced restaurants.There are also a couple of very good bookstores. The economics of the place are mysterious but it's really at the heart of Bangkok. It is amazing how many ordinary Thais have never been here and wouldn't consider going.

A lot more than just shopping..!. Sure this is the biggest and best shopping mall in Thailand... But, it is a lot more than just a shopping mall... Sure you have Paragon Department store with just about everything you could want... In addition to this you have many other shops for a wide variety of goods... For me the biggest attraction in this place has to be the Gourmet Supermarket and all of the restaurants on the same floor... This is the best 1-Stop spot for just about anything you could want to eat from Krispy-Kreme Doughnuts, MOS Burger, Auntie Anne's Pretzels, Au Bon Pain and many other alike... For a person that spends a lot of time in S.E. Asia, these things mean a lot..!If you are with others that are shopping and you are not up to that kind of thing... Then head to Siam Ocean World which is located just below all this excellent food...!

Shopping & movie pleasureland!. If you love shopping and love your brands, this is a must do on your trip list. Any trip to bangkok see me visiting here on multiple occasions. As a big movie buff, I can;t pass up the IMAX as well as the Nokia Experience cinema with the best 'Gold Class' cinemas that I've enjoyed anywhere. Cheap prices, large comfy seats with silk blankets & pillows and multiple popcorn flavours :-)

The beauty of Air Conditioning. Okay there are a plethora of lovely shops and a plethora of lovely little coffee shops which I love to visit in Phuket (http://bit.ly/jOgQfl) and it is a beautiful respite from the heat (or the rain)

Mmmh... ?. This is just a conventional western style shopping center with expensive stores and reknown designer names. What I think is worth about the place is the huge food court depicting dishes from all over the world although the restaurants are a little expensive.
Great disigner shops and fantasic food court. Its all there all your favorite designer shops.Add to that the food court is fantasic with choices for all.

Expensive but nice food court. The mall itself is a bit pricey, but it has two things that I liked. The food court on the ground floor has a great variety of offerings. Coffee bean by Dao has some great coffe and tea. Also gourmet market has wide selection of products if you are homesick

Like western shopping centre or even more. This a place where you want to take few moment of relax, after some hours outside tours in the city. Patagon is one of large shopping centre in Bangkok, together to Plaza, Emporiuom and few other in the shopping district. It's the only having a large court food and you can eat almost every worldwide foods, before or after shopping activities. If I'm not mistaken there are 7 floors including alst one where ther is a movies centre. Nice to get refresh and relax.

Designer paradise. This is where you get all you REAL designer gear!! Lovely centre, you could spend a whole day here and not get bored..( unless your like my husband, who just loves shopping with me, NOT).
More atmosphere and choice. Kids loved the cinema complex, dad liked the cheese flavoured popcorn plus you can have a beer in the cinema - very civilised!

Shop till you drop (and eat!). There are 3 main shopping centres in this area - the Paragon being the newest (and best) - there is a lovely food court on the ground floor which is a great place to eat local Thai food at very cheap prices

best mall in bangkok. if you are looking for brands,this is the mall you can foun what you want,realy mall for the high class customers and dont forget to take the tax free refund in you are non thai resedents
Great cinema!. Especially the Nokia Gold screens.Thoroughly enjoyed reclining on the leather sofas with a lovely warm blanket!
World Class Shopping Mall. Having travelled extensively and worked in the retail development business I can confidently recommend a visit to Siam Paragon

Very good shopping experience. Siam Paragon is right at the Siam BTS station. Very convenient and accessible. I particularly enjoy the Thai brands available at the department store, and the gourmet supermarket in the ground floor. Information booths well located. One of my favorite shopping places in Bangkok

AMAZING MALL, HIGH END, LAMBORGHINI DEALER!!. We went to this mall when we were staying in Bangkok. It was amazing. Its 5 floors of high end, amazing stores. There is everything in there, clothes, electronics, movie theater, food, aquarium, and even car dealers, including a Lamborghini Dealership. It was amazing, and the food there is great. I would highly recommend going there if your in Bangkok, take the Skytrain there, its quick.
enormous shopping mall. This is an overwhelmingly large mall. The food court was amazing. The stores did not seem to have as low prices as the shopping areas outside of the mall.
Lots to do. Great movie theater, great bookstore, super shopping, and easy to get to by metro.
Upmarket mall with great shopping options. Huge mall - great options for food, shopping. Even the Siam ocean world is housed here!
Wonderful gourmet supermarket in basement. Not much different than other malls but I did enjoy shopping at the gourmet supermarket there.

Massive shopping mall and food options. All the usual food outlets here, KFC, McD, Swensen ice cream, MK (infact this is an MK Gold...a great experience where you cook your own food). Banks offer currency exchange service. Well worth a visit.
shop shop shopp. Siam Paragon is a brilliant shopping centre for eating out, and getting those much needed supplies.....you could also pick up a new Lamborghini.

Nice shopping mall. This is a huge shopping mall that offers exclusive luxury products but also some affordable brands for clothing, cosmetics and other things. It's worth spending a day there. Visit the aquarium etc.

Food wonderful food. Amazing top end shopping centre. This place has all the top brands on sale, and you could be in any of the most expensive shopping centres in the world. Very high class. However, the bands are more expensive than Europe so you may not want to shop here for clothes. BUT the food court on the lower ground floor is a delight, not expensive and just wall to wall food fun and a great place to get lost in. TIP: put 200TB on the food court card, then go to the food court stands to buy your food. All the money you put on the card is fully refundable on the same day.
Great foodcourt.. Another mall in Bangkok but with a very good foodcourt on the basement floor. There is something for everybody.

Lovely to look at Lovely to Hold but if you.... Enter here and pay the same prices as you would in ANY WESTERN country.I did not find Bargains but a lovely reprieve from "hello Mister Massage" and so forth...MBK was my personal fav for bargains as I got prescription glasses made in an hour in REAL DESIGNER - not copy - if you can tell - frames at one third of the cost back home in Australia.

Good Food Good Shops. You can find many namebrands as well as gems shops here. Various restos to choose from. Kabuki is one of my fav offering fresh jap food with reasonable price and private dining experience.

Typical Western Boutique Shopping. The Siam Paragon is a typical western style shopping centre filled name brand boutiques selling the usual designer stuff at inflated prices. These places are the same all over the world; and anyone who has visited one elsewhere needn't waste their time visiting this one.
One of Many. I'm not a shopper and was in a shopper's paradise. But I made 2 trips to this mall and bought both time.

Krispy Creame Donuts. We went the 1st Day Kispt Kreeme opened here we waited one hour and a Half in que and gave up.
went back 6 weeks later still waited an hour but got my beloved Donuts Very Yummy worth the Wait
Good location and best shops and restaurants. Everything you need is in the Siam Paragon. Best shops and restaurants. You can spend the whole day there.

No impressive at all. Ok, you get to see Maseratis and Lambos - fine. But beside it is just a shopping mall - with all the European brands (ok, original and I wouldn't buy the fake stuff anyway...), but a lot more pricy than back in Europe. The food court is excellent.

Sealife aquarium is really worth visiting!!. We did not intend to go to the aquarium because the entrance fee is quite high (approx. 20 EUR p.person), but be sure - it is really worth the price. After having walked beneath the sea (in the underground) we had a rest in the food area of Paragon - also worth the experience - as if you were walking around the whole gourmet world.The rest of Paragon is a huge shopping mall according to all the others in Bangkok.

western prices in Bangkok. The mall itself is very impressive but who shops here? Really? Most people dont afford anything, even westerners due to shops being all Gucci, Armani, Luis vutton and so on... Nice to walk thru once but thats about it.... Movie theatre on top floor was maybe the best I have been to.

"Luxurious" shopping mall. well it's one of the most popular shopping mall for everyone , most of people hang out here , have a meeting etc. it's good for both single, couples,group or family though things selling here are kinda expensive. Haute Couture brands like Chanel, Hermes,Gucci etc. are provided here. Another shopping mall (which i still take it as the most luxurious one in Thailand) is Gaysorn plaza, close to Intercontinental Hotel, its pure luxurious and Louise Vuitton shop is here. and It's lots quieter than Siam Paragon in case u r looking for a really luxurious shopping
Modern, good variety of sops. Large, modern, marble shopping mall with access to ocean world and cinema complex.Excellent choice of shops and a welcome escape from the humidity of Bangkok
Extremely High Prices. Almost deserted probably because of the prices but it is worth it just to look around. Go to Robinsons or Tokyu for good shopping in MBK mall.
Nice shopping. A large open and modern shopping mall. Very spacious and a wide varitey of designer shops. Also a very nice food court at the bottom level with a range of different meals and snacks...
Great Shopping. Go there and also go to the Ocean World, an experience not to be missed. Great shopping experience and great food outlets
great shopping mall. Fantastic for shopping or even just to wonder around and watch the people do their shopping. :)
Everything you need in one location. You will find all you need in this indoor air-con super mall. Just name it. From food hall to high brand. From Siam Ocean World to Mega Movie complex.
Shopping, shopping, shopping!. For those who like window shopping, up-market shopping - this is one of the places to go. Bangkok is certainly a place for shopping

Uh... whatever. It's another shopping mall in a city full of them. Yes, it's very nice but replete with hi-society types trying to show conspicuous consumption of things. Emporium or Gaysorn are much better if you need to get your high-end shopping on. I go to Paragon for the great movie theater.

Great Shopping Arcade. It is a huge and grand shopping paradise. But if you are looking for a cheap deal, this is not the place for you. Lots of fancy shops around this mall. Spatially all the well known brand shops are here to amaze you. The luxury items found here are no less than those found in Paris. And so the price is very high. But still, great place to visit never the less.
excellent shopping. Great range of shops to suit different budgets, excellent boutique cafe on 1st floor

Up Market Shopping with all the Brands. Bangkok is renowned for cheap shopping but you can find all the big Brand names at Siam Paragon with the associated price tags. A very modern shopping centre also catering with a large food court and other attractions

An awesome shopping centre. You won't find any sensational bargains here however when it's 35 degrees on the Ploenchit Road, this is a good place to be. Lovely northern Thai restaurant downstairs also with outdoor seating.

Just step in by BTS Siam station.. Wow, this a big Mall with food, food & more foods. A Big Underworld Aquarium is located within Mall. Nearby is Central World, Erwan four Face Buddha Shrines & Somboon Seafood.

Clean Toilets!!!. Good shops - although a little generic - but as the title suggests - most importantly - there are clean, western style WC's located in the ground floor of the Paragon. When traveling with a teenage girl - this is great to know!!!
Good variety but not the best. Central is always better organised, as the long haul to get to the top floor is irritating. Good food court with a nice variety of restaurants.

All Inclusive shopping experience. Siam Paragon has everything and it is a crowded venue which is great for people watching. One word of caution, do not buy the TRUE (cellphone SP on one of the upper floors) hourly or daily service as it does not provide good coverage.Price points are high in Thailand for quality goods. Hong Kong is still the best place for shopping!

The best shopping in Bangkok. Very nice, clean and big. With a lot of good restaurants }( one is shabu-shabu japanese food) and there is a Tony's Roma too.A very big department store (siam paragom) and very good services ( exchange , tax free, etc)

Yet another shopping center. This is a higher-end shopping center. The best area is the gourmet market and food court on one of the bottom floors. The gourmet market has a great fresh food section where you can easily stuff your face for lunch. There's a pretty good bookstore that sells English books, as well as Thai and other languages. The dept store here is decent to wander around if you're bored. Ultimately, it's just another shopping mall.
Great Place for shopping, eating and people watching. Spent a great few hours here, shopping - has a fantastic choice and price range.Great Food outlets, perfect to people watch

Yes, a mall....but AMAZING!. Huge high-end mall... The main attraction (for us) was the food court in the bottom: prepay and select your dishes from an amazing selection of stalls - some quote high-end. At least go down to wander. We also visited the cinemas and splurged on the "Nokia" viewing room (the reserved seating luxury cinemas). It was a splurge (700baht/person) but a break from the backpacker beaten track.

for the "rich" and those who wants to be seen. Lots of young Bankokians, expensive shops, ordinary food. I prefer terminal 21 at the Asok junction. The local food at level 5 are surprisingly very nice, even by Thai standard. Go there instead!!
Always crowded!. Great shopping complex! You can do everything here from shopping to eating and visiting Siam Ocean World!

Huge!. Is huge indeed! And the shopping is great and the food court is huge also! They have Blythe at the 3rd floor in 2 locations (on "this is blythe" site it was just one listed but the prices not at all as good as in Hong Kong). This information is useless for most of you but useful for some ;) sorry!

Gourmet food hall. The best luxury supermarket that I have ever been in, anywhere in the world. In house sushi bar, a great ice-cream cart, beautiful fruit and veg display. I would get a take away salad for lunch and eat on the steps outside the centre in the sun. As a backpacker, my budget is limited, spending money in this store is a treat. Friendly staff with loads of free samples of their amazing foodstuffs. If I lived in Bangkok, you would find me here.
Good Mall. Everthing under one roof. Good food junction, cafetaria, restaurants and good variety of shops.
Fantastic food court. Food court is out of this world - has absolutely anything you could think of to eat, loved it.Great cinema at the top floor too

Thai corner in Siam Paragon. If you like to get some high quality Thai crafts like silk, pottery etc to bring home and don't have time to visit/ patience to sweat it out at JJ market on the weekends, try the Thai corner in the Siam Paragon departmental store itself. Not cheap but if you hit it during sale time, there are actually lots to pick from and get some VAT tax refund back too.

Everything you need in one giant mall. The Siam Paragon is about 5 floors of everything imaginable, from designer shops (such as Hermes, Chanel, Burberry...) to automobile lounges with exclusive cars, including Porsche, Lotus and Bentley. On the ground floor (G floor) are a large number of restaurants ranging from very exclusive to very simple... and there is even a crispy cream for donut lovers. There is a fantastic movie complex with the latest movies and if you don't mind spending a bit more for a ticket (800 baht/ticket) you can get the luxury seats in a special theater (you even get a blanket made of Thai silk) which includes complimentary coffee or soft drinks (juices) and small cakes/cookies. This is a must stop for people who like to shop, eat, and window shop.
a upmarket mall. luxury brand stores, nice restaurants. kids will enjoy the display of luxury cars
try the food. Some great restaurants downstairs...try the chinese or Japanese. Value and taste is excellent.

Shopping Anyone ??. The best place to shop in bangkok. there is a sky train too which takes you there and not to mention the food courts and pizzas are really worth a visit. Prices are a little on the higher side, but as its said - Quality comes with a price ! So happy shopping all of you !

Love it!. This is one of the Top Class Department Stores in Bangkok. It's so beautiful inside with lots of Top World Brand Name Shops. Also one not to miss is the basement food court area, it's to die for... ^__*
Wow!. This puts all shopping centres in the UK to shame. We got lost as it was so big!!! Dont miss Bangkok's shopping!

Biggest Mall I've ever seen!. We loved Siam Paragon! In the midst of the chaos of Bangkok - it was fun to find this normal, huge, extravagant shopping mall. It has everything! The Siam Paragon Department Store is like nothing I've ever seen - I could have spent hours just in the "Beauty Hall."
SIAM SQUARE. We went across the street to the boutiques in Siam Square-greta shopping! A MUST STOP- MANGO TANGO CAFE- for MANGO STICKY RICE!

A noisy echo chamber. This place is a huge mall filled with the same luxury boutiques that line every major airport of the world as well as the shopping malls of the globe's big cities. The ground floor is a maze of food courts. Most of the shops are overseas fast-food joints or Japanese shops. It is loud. It is crowded. It is hectic. And there is absolutely nothing special about it. Do not waste your vacation here.Instead, walk to the next mall over, Siam Center. It's been around since the 1990s. Nothing special about the architecture, but on the third and fourth floors you will find boutiques owned and operated by Thai designers. The fashions are just as lust-worthy as what the luxury shops are selling down the street, but they are also totally unique and much, much less expensive.If you're into fashion, if you like shopping, spend a day in Siam Center. But bring plenty of credit cards.
Very pricy but very high quality. Especially the aquarium is not for a low budget but big and great fun for the kids! European prices but also matching quality.

This river is a great way to see some fabulous wats - and one pretty cool modern bridge!. We took a trip down the river one night on one of the dinner cruise boats. While the food and entertainment was ok, the views of the lit up wats and palaces was pretty spectacular. Next time, I'll bag the dinner cruise and just take the water taxi to take in more of the local flavor.

Another city, another (relatively) anonymous strip mall. Writing a review about a shopping mall is always going to be a tricky exercise and highly subjective, and there's always a better-than-average chance of offending someone who chances upon my thoughts on these things. So be it ... On a general level, the shopping mall is the transmogrification of Olde Worlde hometown markets that had personality, character, and life, into something that is culturally crude, aesthetically anonymous, existentially sterile, and strangely Stepfordized (see: the film 'The Stepford Wives' to understand where I'm coming from here) so that if you were to be transplanted inside one without actually knowing where you were, you'd be hard put to recognize this temple of Mammon from another. They all look exactly the same. But, could we live without them? a moot point .. Hailed as some form of shopping paradise, the SIAM Paragon is nothing of the sort; sure it has lots and lots of consumer-oriented outlets, and is a cool and antiseptic retreat from Bangkok's oppressive daytime heat: there's places to eat, places to gawp at imprisoned 'wildlife', places to look at goods a-plenty, places to salivate over sexy foreign automobiles that are way outside the price range of the majority of the car voyeurs, and (breathless) somewhere that actually sells a decent range of books! (Kinokuniya) Gosh! (I also like it because I typed my name into the electronic author index and my name naturally appeared - there's nothing quite like a bit of self-indulgence, shameless as it may well be :-) ) I can't bring myself to really recommend the Paragon (a misnomer if ever there was one) because there isn't really anything that sets it apart from other, similar establishments; it's too linear, too architecturally global, and is bereft of style. Okay, I quite understand that many people feel comfortable in places that are more or less there to help one part company with one's money, but at least one may applaud a place that can do it with panache. Paragon emphatically cannot. I also understand that many folks will disagree with my comments. fair enough, that's your prerogative. I suppose it's worth a visit though just to make up your own mind.Anything really positve to report? Yep - the toilets are pretty good.
Go there!. Amazing....you have to see it..its almost all Thai goods of wonderful quality, so a great change from the rubbish in some of the other malls.

Not the Best Mall in BKK. While Siam Paragon is very easy to find due to it's very central location, it is no longer the best mall in BKK. Terminal 21 at the corner of Sukhumvit and Asoke Montri Roads is far more interesting and fun, and should you crave high-end designer goods, I'd recommend shopping at Emporium instead, which also gives you the incentive to go for a walk in the lovely Benjasiri Park, right next to it.
a great shopping mall in town. this place has a really big food court. Many varieties of food can be found here.
A very sophisticated mall in BKK. Largest mall in BKK. The place is awesome! Please dont forget to check the ocean world :)

Great shopping.
