This is a cool mall with lots of luxury brands, though check the prices versus home because it isn't cheap.The aquarium is great (featured on The Amazing Race Israel series 2) and the there is a fantastic gourmet market and wine store within the downstairs food market. Check out the Taling Pling restaurant, the food is great. It is next door to the Siam Kempinski if you a looking for a sensational hotel to stay.

One of the best shopping malls in town. Located at Siam Square, this is a huge and luxurious shopping malls. The Aquarium is at the basement. Kikokunya, one of the best multi language bookshops in town is on one of the top floors. It also has a huge Cineplex with the latest movies. Most of the branded names are located there. The basement food court is particularly amazing and offers a vast array of foods from different origins among live aquariums. Needless to say, it is a must for serious shoppers.

The King of all Malls in Bangkok. The absolute best mall in Bangkok. Check out the incredible cinema complex at the top floor!. Want a Lamborghini? Go to the 3rd floor. Want to eat Japanese? Ground floor. An aquarium with sharks? B1 floor. Krispie Kreme Doughnuts? Ground floor. Have fun there but do plan a day out of it!
High End Shopper Paradise... Love the Gourmet Market and the Food Court on the basement. Connected to Siam BTS.

Nice upscale mall next to MBK. I didn't have much time to explore Siam Paragon but I did have lunch here and got to people watch and it was definitely worth it. When you go on a weekday, you get to see lots of cute local girls in their business attire! Just outside of Siam Paragon is MBK and an outdoor shopping center so there's lots to do.

Big and beautiful (in places). Come here for anything you could want from a shopping mall. You can even buy a Maserati here. It's got it all (at a price). It's big and it's beautiful (mostly), and even if you don't like shopping there are plenty of places to just 'be'. The best way to get there is by the skytrain (BTS) and driving in and out by Taxi is usually horribly busy, and the taxi rank after about 3.00p.m. starts to get quite slow. We live in Bangkok and come here regularly with our two small children. Good for killing time and for escaping the heat. There is a huge Aquarium in the basement, complete with sharks etc. Well worth a visit, even if you've been to lots of these kinds of places before - expensive for tourists (Adults pay 900Baht) but for residents rate it is nearer to 400Baht which is good value. Under 3's go free.

Luxury mall in Bangkok. Exclusive shops, brand names, gifts, homeware, shoes, shoes, shoes! Amidst all the same-same markets, what a pleasure to browse in a/c, luxurious mall. Quiet coffee shops serving pastries, ice-cream, good coffee. Thoroughly enjoyed my breakaway from outside stalls and cheap fakes morning in Siam, Paragon mall. Easy access from Nana skytrain.
Nice. Siam paragon is a beautifully made and designed mall with lots of things to enjoy and explore.

I Don’t Get It. Ok if you live in BKK fine go to Paragon but if you are visiting BKK don’t waste your time. Everything at Paragon is beyond overpriced and if you are visiting from America most of the products here are imports you can buy at home for 25% the price Paragon wants for them. If you want to shop for local goods this is not the place, go to a street market or check out MBK around the corner. It is neat to see a Maserati dealer inside a shopping mall but I don’t really think it’s worth wasting a day of your precious vacation. Paragon is trendy and pretentious and offers nothing of value to a tourist to BKK.
A Shopper's paradise. Wow! You will find all the upmarket brands at very reasonable prices. The vast array of restaurants are also good and the quality superb.
Commercial Shopping Centre. Nothing special except the huge food area at basement
where you can get your Gourmet Thai. Go to the supermarket and get your haul of Gourmet Thai specialties. These are stuff you HAVE to take home.

High-end fashion mall. This mall has all the exclusive brands you can think of! Apart from the fashion, it's got a cinema, aquarium and one of the best food halls I've seen. You might not be able to shop for clothes but definately go for lunch/supper/dessert. The mall is located at a skytrain station, which is very convenient.
Upmarket. Great shopping centre with upmarket shops and prices to match no fakes here

OK for designer. if you are into expensive designer goods then head to here, a very good range of top of the line products never seen before (by me) in one place. good department stores, otherwise save some money and shop elsewhere, Central World, or at home if you have a factory outlet.

No different from what's available in the States.. It's just a shopping mall! Granted, it's nice and has all your high end brand stores. However, you can probably buy those "high end" items back in the States for much cheaper. It was nice to browse around but that's about it. Pretty much turned into our air con stop every time we walked by it.You can find cheap food on the ground floor level. Some plates are as low as 40B. Go into the restaurants and you'll be paying double. We made that mistake trying Talin Pling (or something like that) based on the info desk recommendation. Food was good but not worth the super tiny portions and $15USD bill for 2 dishes.Go to MBK if you want to do local shopping and negotiate prices.

Expensive but impressive. Went to the cinemas twice, grat experience. Food in food court expensive but range is amazing and lots of high quality stuff. The grocery store has everything from everywhere but expect western prices.
A city. One can spend the whole day day and more. You can take metro to get there. There is the biggest oceanariums in Asia and Madame Tussaud's wax figures museum.
Never miss this shopping mall!. Very divers and nice to visit!All the high end brands are here but also a great food place and the best cinema's i have ever visit!

Suh-weeeet!. This is probably the nicest mall I've ever seen. They have stores that sell everything from Lamborghinis to clothing. The cinema is awesome and their food court is anything you could possibly want. There's even an aquarium on the bottom floor! Prices seem to be a little bit higher than in other malls, but that's to be expected. Paragon is the best of the best when it comes to shopping in Bangkok.

Best place for name brand shopping. If you like name brand shopping, this is it. Very modern, clean and just a great place to go window shopping. Many other shopping areas close this but, none as nice.
Seemed like we were in an upscale mall in the U.S.. Moderately interesting, but not memorable. Just a lot of upscale stores, most of which are not unique. But easy to get to on Sky Train.

Nice and well decorated shopping mall. It is not as cheap as MBK shopping mall nor the famous week end market of Chatuchak, but we fond a considerably a big discount for clothes and woman accessories on this pleasant well decorated shopping mall.

Very western but good fun. This is essentially one of the two western shopping malls in Bangkok with prices to match. You will almost certainly find things that are cheaper elsewhere for the same things. The food court in the basement is worth a visit if you want a bit of variety from Thai food and there are interesting things to try in the food hall where you can see names of things in English so it removes some of the guess work of other places but beware, you will pay for the privilege!
great mall. great mall, with an excellent cinema, and fab food hall. The aquarium in the basement seemed very expensive so i didn't visit.
Excellent,large world class. Loved the entire Siam central specially the Ocean World had a super duper time with Hubby and daughter.Food choices in the Food Court were great .Super place to visit.
Excellent Food Court. Had the best pad thai ever in the food court for about AUD 1.70. Who would have thought a bit of chilli would make so much difference!

Hilarious entertainment. I'm on a long term travel experience and budget so shopping at Siam Paragon is simply not in the cards on this trip. That being said it was quite the spectacle to visit and we stayed longer than we expected. Vast hallways 5 tractor-trailers wide span the gap between 7 level of high end boutique shops, space for a runway fashion show, a food court bigger than most malls, and an Ocean World, complete with a glass bottom boat tour. The top floor featured showrooms for porche, lotus, mini, bmw and ferrari, it also housed True Internet cafe, which featured an apple store, an internet garden, a wall of accessories and more computers than the largest internet cafe. While we were there, there was a big spectacle involving some big name stars which sent hordes of teenagers and adults to scream while scrambling to take pictures. At the same time there was indeed a fashion show going on surrounded by glass displays of beautiful jewelery. All in all it was quite an experience. Whether you're looking for a high end shopping excursion or just to kill some time this place is a great spot to hangout and live the dream of a life very few will ever know.

Shopping day at Siam Paragon. I have to wait when they have discount, otherwise everything is quite expensive for me. The good acitivies that I love to go there because of foods...most of them are so delicious.

Not for small pockets. The only reason I rated it as average is because I can't afford anything in there, so it wasn't an awesome experience for me. It is however a very lovely shopping centre with lots of designer brands and the department store is relatively affordable with a wide range of items

Huge international mall with little Thai flavour. In Bangkok al the mall are along the same road so it des not help for the traffic. Siam Paragon is one of tehm as Central world, MKK, Central.... This one is very very big with all international luxurious brands a very impressive aquarium on the basement and a huge food court and supermarket onthe ground floor. Do not go on Sunday since it the best destination for local youngsters and you can have to wait to get a table in the food court, for the shopping you will find all what you need except cheap souvenirs that you will find in the other smaller malls round the corner such as MBK...
Top Notch. Very clean toilets! Good sales at the end of December.
Fun ! And a great Mall, as well !. We went for a 'swimming with the sharks'...eventhough it's a walking on the reservoir basement with special equipment - we've had a lot of fun there !

Premier shopping in Bangkok. For upmarket shopping, Paragon is hard to beat. The huge shopping center linked to the Siam station of the Sky Train has everything from the largest English Language bookstore to a fitness center and large grocery store and food court in the lowest level. Has iMax movies, a 4D theater and many regular theaters with seating ranging from isolated pairs of powered reclining chairs to standard theater seats. If you are looking for lower prices, go to MBK which is a few minutes walk but for quality name brand goods, it is all in Paragon.
Huge shopping center. even if u not at shopping, u should pay a visit to see where shopping frenzy can lead. Also home for the biggest acquarium in SE Asia.

OMG! I love that place!!!. Siam Paragon has everything!!! It is a shoppers paradise. Bring plenty of money, because you will find so many things to buy. I will always go back every year to shop til I drop!!!

Not newest but still one of the top malls. I go to Siam Paragon every now and then. Used to patronise it a lot more but there are other newer malls nowadays. Not the newest but still one of the best.The departmental store is Paragon but there are other shops, branded and unbranded, outside the departmental store within the building. All the luxury brands are there including luxury sports cars. Jim Thompson is also situated there, at the back of the building. The ground floor food area is fascinating to visit - all the various little eating outlets serving many types of cuisine and the variety of cakes is amazing. Food is mediocre - you go for the variety and ambience which is pretty 'classy'. One of my favourite restaurants is 'Another Hound', part of the Greyhound chain, which is on a different floor.Gourmet Food Market (supermarket) is also rather posh and stocks many imported items.There is a very large Kinokuniya bookshop on the 3rd floor and cinema/bowling alley on the 5th floor.A huge aquarium called Siam Ocean World is at the basement. It's well kept and lovely to visit but pricey for foreigners. Locals or residents pay local rate showing work permit or Thai driving licence.All in all - a great place to spend the day with lots to do.Take BTS (Sky train) to Siam station.http://www.siamparagon.co.th/v9/index.php
Shopping delight. It has a nice ambience -- although have found its air-conditioning rather cold at times!Nice array of shops

Tina Turner has a song about it..... Simply the best.............of everything that Bangkok has to offer. There is a Massive food Hall in the basement with foods from all over the world!Shops, stores and showrooms, where you can buy everything from a Massaman curry to a Maserati.

Probably the most fun shopping mall IN THE WORLD. This mall has everything, both high end and very reasonably priced shops too. There is always some big event going on, there is endless free entertainment. The supermarket in the basement is, for whatever my opinion is worth, the best in the entire world. And affordable too. Adjacent to SIAM BTS Skytrain station. Novotel hotel on Siam Square across street, also a Kimpenski 5 star Hotel on the opposite side. You can stroll around here in air conditioned comfort all day and all night, and not be bored. Best shopping is the Exotic Thailand high quality souvenirs on the 4th or 5th floor of the department store. So many restaurants in all price levels. Have fun!
Large Mall. Very crowded, we liked the more affordable MBK next door. Easy to get to on Skytrain.

Shopping for those who have money. But the food court is for everybody. Try the fried oyster with egg and bean sprouts and the rice noodles with seafood and sticky gravy. Then head up to the fourth floor to lounge at the huge Kinokuniya bookstore. Best selection of travel books ever!

Cool place to shop. Very fashionable and upmarket. But expect the prices to match. It is a pretty place to wander. If you can afford it enjoy. I find MBK sells things at a more affordable price but of course you are one of the swirling crowd there. At Siam you do feel 'special' like the price tags.
excellent shopping mall. Here you get buy the real staff and value for money, great food court and generally attracts the right growd...the mall looks good with excellent landscaping and features
FOOD COURT!. The food court is worth a visit! Have huge variety of different food nationalities to choose from when you feel like a break from Thai food.

Bangkok Mega-Mall - luxury shops and vast food selections. A visit to Siam Paragon is a must for visitors to Bangkok. This mega-mall is the best place for luxury goods shopping in Thailand. The food court is unbeatable with an endless array of selections. Great place to people watch and escape the heat and humidity too. Don't miss it.

enjoyed the food section!. one of the upmarket that link to a few other shopping centre, so easy to spend a day around these buildings. check out the food court and the cooked food section of the supermarket level. you get to sample some of the highlights of Thai food.

THE best shopping mall in BKK. Hermes, Mulberry, Ferrari or, perhaps, Lotus? What kind of luxury would you like to indulge yourself with? You name it - it is in Paragon. IMAX cinema, gourmet shop, high-end audio shop, Ocean World and many many other places are good to spend time staring and/or shopping!

Great choice of places to eat. The lower ground floor contains a range of places to eat at all prices. Some restaurants are walled off from the main throng and are a lot quieter! There is also a good supermarket.
Expensive. Very clean, nice and expensive shopping centre. You'll find all your handbag and shoe needs right here!

Simply The Best. The Paragon department store has it all, I love the cosmetics and the sport department, they got all the write brands. Don't forget to make a turist card, which gives you 5% reduction.

Great place for people watching. This is the biggest shopping mall in Thailand which is as big as 10 football stadiums!!!! From luxury product to fitness centre to movie to fine dinning to even aquarium!! One of the most active place in BKK with all events, concerts, etc....Good place for people of all ages.Since this place is also very popular among Thai people, it's great place to check out what Thai people are up to/ fashion/ other trends.... great place for people watching. Crowded on Friday - Sunday so if you want some quiet relax, you'd better go somewhere else.Easily to remember because it opens 10 to 10 (10 AM to 10 PM).... until midnight during the festival holiday such as New Year and Song Kran.Highly recommend :)
Excellent area. surroindings are an awesome fun for an evening. Highly recommened to stroll in the evening time

Great place to shop and try good food. great shopping mall and ots of things to do ....got all the brands from europ and specially car shops of fancy cars very good . also have cinema which has 4D movie and experience was just amezing .
Food haven. Lots of variety from restaurants to food court.I do not like the shops though, i find the prices more expensive than back home.

High-end mall for a luxury shopping. My favorite place to have a luxury shopping. Great place with interesting restaurants to try on, well-known branded and complete collections for stationaries and books (they have the biggest Asia Books and Kinokuniya in town).
Shopers Heaven. Real (not fake) goods at amazing prices. These are all proper shops and department stores without the need for bargaining.
Many assortment in food court. If you are a foreigner, firstly, you should go there and find what you can eat. After that you can venture to eat at out.
Mega shopping in Bangkok. Enormous shopping centre with every brand plus some car dealerships!The food hall in the basement is nice - many varieties of cuisine in a small area.
Hi-Class shopping mall. Well, I know it's not cheap compare to Europe (original place) but at least you will find how are the Thai teenage's fashion here ;)

Good Mall. If you are looking for branded clothes or goods, then this is the place for you. If you would like to enjoy shopping with "not branded" but with bargaining on the side. Well, better go to a night market or the weekend mark like "Chatuchak Market"

Nice centre. This centre is ok pretty predictable, high end shops Hermes chanel
Then the Asian department store...where unless you are a size ten which I am less than half the clothes will fit
Large shopping mall with everything!. Amazing food court area along with multiple restaurants. Many luxury stores as well as typical mall stores. Loads of people. Fantastic!
No surprise. I got all these brands in my country and no different on the prices after tax refund.

Shopping at its best !!. For ALL you Mall shoppers this is the best, with all the big names to look out for.
The basement level has the finest selection of little restaurants to ease the pain on your legs and credit card !!
Great Selection of Luxury Global Brands. Be sure to check out the car dealerships, I think they were on the 4th floor.

Good to keep the kids quiet after shopping. I'm a typical tourist and couldn't resist a trip to the Aquarium even if I was in town on business. It's worth paying the couple of 100B for the VIP as it gives you the backstage tour (not great but informative), the short boat trip on the shark/sting ray investid waters (doesnt last long but kids will love so long as they dont fall in), fish pedacure (somethng that has to be done while in Thailand, even for a man), there's a 4D movie thing which the kids will see themselves swimming with sharks) and you also get popcorn and a drink. There's lots of different animals in here and even the touch pool for the kids to hold some of them. Not cheap, especially as you're in BKK, but as I say, if you've been dragging the kids round the shops (MBK for example), this is a good treat for them (and you) at the end of the day.

Nice Mall for Shopping. I liked this large mall for shopping and it is also great for taking pictures. Apparently this building is one of the iconic thailand buildings. It did not feel as such to me. I wished they had complimentary Prams for children as some other malls did. This mall had a lot of the high end designer stores.

Crowded and vibrant. Love the variety of food available! Ate at Fuji and tried out many of the different food stalls at its basement selling snacks. Watched a movie too and the seats were very good! However, no shopping cos it's expensive.
Great Shopping. Super clean all upmarket brand label products every thing from Hugo Boss-Pucci to Lamborghini..yes you can but a lambo here if you want..or a BMW..or pretty much anything you want..

Very cool Mall with everything under one roof !!!. We enjoyed the Siam Ocean world the most and the Siam paragon kids section a lot as we were travelling with my six year old son and this holiday was mainly designed to please him.The Aquarium was awesome with a few free throw ins like a happy Fish feet massage,etc for tourists. The food courts of the mall are also awesome with a great variety at all kinds of prices are available.we had the best Tom Yum soup here from an ordinary restaurant shop.We went thrice to Siam Paragon while in Bangkok.
The shop with the lot. Great food and the Ocean aquarium was great for us and the kids.
Shopping shopping and more shopping. A huge choice of shops. Great food court. A little too big for me!

Westfield, turbo-charged. More high end brands to shop for than you canshake a stick at and a superb food hall in the basement with a huge range of restaurants. Right next to a Skytrain stop - v easy to access from the Sheraton.
Everything Under One Roof. Shopping and food is excellent over here. Great to be here to do all that or to chill out in a coffeehouse. The only set back is the long cab queues...

Super center with full service facilities. Food, shopping, Cinemas, art, tourist attractions. A global shoppers paradise with all kinds of events and other happenings on a daily basis. Super cinemas with the best food and drink options around. Highly recommended
Aquarium well worthwhile. Definitely take a skytrain free map 10% discountSo many different attractions inside Mammals,Amazonia,PenguinsGood zoological information on all fishes etc

Excellent mall. Love the food court in basement - superb array of local and international food.Disliked? Nothing.All great.Found some excellent bargains at the department store - very good range of merchandise.
I loved it.. My wife loved the fancy shopping, and I loved the food. But i also did some good shopping. The are 3 or 4 major shopping centers in Bangkok. This is the most elite.
nice !. the paragon deparmental store has a great sportswear deptt !!
biggest mall. new and trendy mall everything in there for shopping, you can reach by skytrain and a few minutes walk from hotel on prime location.

typical luxury shopping mall. if you are looking for designers and high prices stay on the lower floors. If you are looking for expensive/affordable head to paragon department store. The movie theaters are really nice you can also obtain tickets at Thai Ticket Major for events like opera, sporting events on the same level as the theaters at Paragon. Cheap electronics are on the level below the theater level. Cheap is all relative...cheaper than going to a name brand store, not as cheap as MBK and you can't bargain at Paragon where you can bargain on many levels at MBK for what you want.
If you like HUGE SHOPPING CENTRES!. Wonderfully over the top and loads of choice - make sure to wear comfortable shoes - you will do a lot of walking!
Shopping at Aussie prices. For a modern cool and trendy place to shop, this is it, but be prepared to pay the same price as you would back home. For us, there was no point shopping there.
Something for ll the family. Great shopping, good food places and pop down to the aquarium, defianatley worth it to give a break in the shopping

I go there EVERY week with family and sometimes wid friends - best mall in Thailand for me. it's very pricy, but it's a nice atmosphere. Has some great restaurants. Has the biggest bookstore in Thailand (Kinikuniya - LOVE IT) and it's amazing.

Just another mall with "luxury" goods. Would you like fries with your Louis Vuitton?Just another "luxury" mall experience with the same old saturated brands. Did you really travel to amazing Thailand to see this?
Luxury Mall. Most of designer label was here but the price are not cheap if compared to Kuala Lumpur.
Just another mall. It's a shopping mall. Beware of all the people taking pictures like it's a tourist destination.
GOOD EXPERIENCE. I think this place is for kids, they can enjoy a lot. many big and small fish of many kinds.

Everything you need, like any international city. Luxury global brands, food court, cars, real estate, coffee shops, jewellery, spas, local Thai emporium.....a one stop shop for quality brands and products. Definitely check out Thai Emporium for selection of silks, potions and spa care!
Very Flash Centre. This place is massive,you can find anything & everything here,we don't have places like this back in Darwin.Well worth the visit even if you don't buy anything.

Don't miss the food hall!. Siam Paragons food hall is a great find. I like the foodhalls in Thailand, as as a foreigner you get to see and eat lots of fantastic food at reasonable prices. The one here is really good and has a wide selection of great things to try. Is it as good as MBK? Not sure about that I do like MBK a lot though for some reason.
Shopping heaven. Great mall with everything from top designers to electronics to eateries. Cinema in the mall is exceptional.

Nice place to visit. I think the price they charge is little bit high, but a nice place to visit. Be aware of PHOTO graphs taken by the staff. They said a normal size photo graph is given free for full family package tickets....but when we went to collect it we had to pay about 400 Bath to collect it and that no FREE photos are given.
mega. I don't even know what this is, a mall? A department store? Major food court, good supermarket and seems like everything else.
high end. $$$$$$$. very high end stuff. I dont really go to thailand for high end things, unless its a girl with really long legs.

One has to see this a different kind of Temple in Bangkok: Rising Consuming Power Temple. The title is a bit ironic, but this is where affluent Bangkokian middle class regroup :) . I like it because fo the great choice of food outlets (from very exclusive Mandarin Oriental to Food court to all you can eat Italian buffet for 399THB++) but also because of the Imax and 4DX on the top floor, and because ti has the biggest and best book shop in Bangkok: Kinokunia.

Ideal shopping venue. The department store has a lot of goods to select. Tourists privillege card can be obtained in the customer service counter with 5% discount on regular price items. This is more useful in the supermarket. VAT refund applies in both department store and supermarket. Unexpectedly price in the supermarket are even cheaper than another supermarket in the town.

always visit my next car. This is a up-up scale mall with top of the line items.I always stop for some window shopping at the Lotus car dealer. Great food court and an Imax movie theater are also reasons to visit here.
Good Mall. Go to Madame Tussauds Wax Museum in Siam Discovery and the Ocean World in Siam World. Nice malls!

Great mall. You can find almost everything there. The Aquarium in the base floor is a must!
Great options for food and all the western shops around.

Great Selection, although not Particularly Bargain-filled. With the weak pound or dollar, the prices are not terribly competitive, but for those from China, Singapore, Japan or India...shop away! Great people watching, both farangs and of the posing offspring of "unusually rich" Thai politicians and generals.
well - all you need, sort of. huge mall, all labels, mostly expensive stuff, has got a GAP!
Nice spend some time there. Try the bowling and the cinema's. Good connection with BTS. Nice restaurants. Definitely worthwhile visiting.

Luxury in every direction. Siam Paragon is THE place to be seen in Bangkok for shopping. All of the big name brands are there, along with many boutique stores. There are even car showrooms occupying one floor!
The food court is great - cheap and tasty, and the cinema and bowling on the top floor is reasonably priced and not too busy.
Best shopping centre in Bangkok. All different varities of shopping to be had here from top end designers brands to department store shopping, along with a great selection of food

Just like any other mall/shopping centre in a big city. Siam Paragon was not very different from any other major shopping centre I have visited elsewhere or even in my hometown in Sydney. If you're after the premium brands you can buy elsewhere then it will satisfy your needs but don't expect better prices.
Beautiful mall. This is a lovely mall but most of the stores are designers so expensive.

Outstanding food hall - and some real gems on the 4th floor - For ladies of style, a visit to Chabatik is a must. Love Siam Paragon - and think that the food hall located in the basement ranks amongst the world's best right up there with London, Tokyo, and Hong Kong. Great choice of foods for purchase as well as groceries and produce. Superb assortment of stall and restaurants to cater to every taste.Found the 4th floor Paragon Passage worth a visit. This is were one of my favorite shops in the city is located called Chabatik (www.chabatik.com). The have fantastic hand-woven ikat (single and double) designed silk shawls, silk materials and a small selection of ready made clothing from these materials. All articles are designed by a well know textile designer and artist and handwoven in Northern Thailand using traditional methods passed down through generations. Designs are unique and absolute stunning - real "wwwoooowwww" pieces at very affordable prices.

shoppers paradise, golden oasis of self indulgence. Probaly the classiest shopping Mall in Bangkok. Fantastic food hall on the lower floor, food from all over the world, all served with style.Especially good are the Japanes style cafe's, excellent food at a very good price.The cinemas are fantastic. All the leading top clas brands are available on many floors in stylish, slick shops.
premium shopping mall. Mall of international standard,very good exclusive shops for premium brands of jewellary,watches,mobiles and clothes.delight to visit

Shopping centre.. This place has to be one of the top places to visit, a fantastic aquarium in the basement, ferrari cars in the 4th floor, the best food on the groung floor, and lots of jewlery, fantastic shopping.

Great way to see city. We took an evening boat cruise complete with 5 course thai menu and traditional dancing ! Was a real tourist attraction but offered a great experience and view of the city at night ! I would recommend this !

big clean new shopping mall. it's actually 3 buildings side by side, Siam Paragon + Siam Centre + Siam DiscoverySiam Paragon is big, with food court below, shopping above. didn't spend too much time here as there are other more "local design fashion" shopping beside Siam Paragon such as Siam Centre (looks to be a place for local designers) and Siam Square - somewhat like the Bugis Street in Singapore
My favourite shopping mall in Bangkok . . .. A modern shopping mall, with all manner of high-end shops and a departmental store and book shops. I love the supermarket and the food court!
expensive. Prices are the same or more as in USA and Europe, but for real shoppers, who want to spend money this place can be great.

Shopping Paradise. One of the best shopping malls you could see. The layout is comfortable and the whole design is so friendly. I like the fountain at the main gate of the center not that it is unique at all, but because it attracts plenty of tourists to gather around happily to take photos what gives a lovely atmosphere. We took some takeaway Sushi from the skytrian station and had a seat beside the fountain and enjoyed a nice Sushi meal that we recommend to everyone :)You can find all kind of goods you would imagine, even luxurious cars such as Maserati. Many real discounts as well. There was some Piano festival arranged by Yamaha when we visited this year (end of November 2011) and we were able to see the best Yamaha pianos in a lovely piano exhibition.Just next to the Skytrain station what makes it easy access from all around BKK, food court is rich and provides many selections to all tastes.

It is huge !. If you are into shopping... then you can find it all in Siam Paragon. You can also enjoy lunch or dinner, massage, gym, and movies. There are live music shows and many activities to choose from.

A lovely shopping Center. So many different shops to see. You can even visit to relax for some time one of the Cinemas. And for the hungry one, do go to the six floor with all sorts of Kitchens to choose from. You pay when you leave.
MUST SEE. BEST MALL IN BKK... Movies, Shopping, everything you can imagine and more... If you do nothing else in Bangkok, go to Siam Paragon....

Atas Place, Shopping Mall. Most of the things are expensive over there. But there will be crowded with people during weekends. You can find a supermarket there too. I would not recommend people who are looking for cheap clothings or having tight budget to go there, as the things there are expensive.

Shopping haven. Coming from a country where there are no real shopping mall, I found it awesome the shopping in this mall where you can find good brands, good shops and excellent customer care. On topo of this, foreigners can get special discounts and vat refund.

Largest mall in Southeast Asia. One should not miss visiting the largest mall in Southeast Asia as it is conveniently linked to the Siam Skytrain Station and has features catering to everyone in the family. Siam Ocean World in the basement should appeal to children and teens. There is also a cineplex for non shoppers. The huge supermarket in the basement has a wide range of fresh and processed produce catering to both expatriate and local lifestyles. The cavernous food hall in the basement is a one stop venue to try all types of Thai dishes from the ubiquitous Phad Thai fried rice noodles to more exotic stuff like braised sharks fins chowder at very affordable prices. Throughout the mall are many restaurants and cafes so there is something for every palate. The Paragon Department Store and most of the retail shops in the complex are geared towards the upper middle class and high end shoppers so do not expect to find bargain basement stuff here (with the exception of the supermarket and food hall in the basement).

Many restaurants!. I have only bought a few small things here as this is not my kind of shopping when I go to Thailand. I can buy expensive branded stuff at home and in some cases cheaper. Still it is nice to go to Siam Paragon just for people watching and cool down from the heat. There is a very good food court and also many nice restaurants in the basement, thai, japanense and all other kinds of food. Also all kinds of fast food. If you have time go and see a movie. We had a big couch for ourselves! If you have kids it´s also worth checking out the big aquarium: Siam ocean world.

Shopping Extravaganza. The Mall is huge.International brands like Ferragamo, Tommy Hilfiger, Burberry, etc are housed there. The collection is very nice. There are exchange counters available for the flexibility of shoppers. They have a huge Food Court area. Also there is an Ocean World in the mall, which is excellent.
Wow. just wow. Big complex. All the fancy and ligitimate items here. No knock-offs. Bring lots of cash if shopping here.
Just great. Everything you need, from shopping groceries to Armani jackets.

High end mall.. good restaurant selection downstairs. Siam paragon has it all. Good location,easy to get to by Skytrain. Layout is understandable enough, check the upper floors for local items (silk etc). Downstairs has a supermarket for food and beverages and very goood selection of palces to fill your stomach. The mall was not extermely crowded when we wisited it so not a bad day to spend an hour or three..

The Siam shopping area is an expensive pig's breakfast.. Nothing much to like here. Expensive shops, going round in circles to get to just a few shops on each level. Some eateries will be worth a visit though. Not tried the ''attractions'' like the sealife centre as they seemed overpriced.

Good shopping - if you have the money!. Good shopping centre to visit if you want to visit the big name brand stores. The best shopping is in the department store - about the only place in Bangkok I was able to find decent men's neckties.

Every shoppers dream - a day is not enough for shopping here. Hundreds of shops and great restaurants, beside this shopping centre is another famous shopping centre named Siam Centre, with cinemas and Underwater World of Bangkok.
http://www.siamparagon.co.th

Just like any major shopping complex. Although I came to BKK to shop, this wasn't my main priority. I prefer to browse through the street stalls (more fun because of the local atmosphere) and MBK. Siam Paragon sells well known brands so unless you are after these, this place is just like being in any other major shopping complex, anywhere else - why come to BKK for this then? The food court is probably the main attraction for me in this place.

Shopping. Good shopping as it is connected to Siam discovery and Square with supermarket and food outlets and connection to skywalk. Closing time should be extended to 10 pm esp during festive seasons. Clean public toilets.
big and cool. many things in there for shopping! we like the place and fashion
So huge. Have all the brands and lot of food variety to eat, went with wife for wax museum and it was good
Must see. All I will say is must see,I had them pick us up at hotel to include dinner and show
great shopping mall. The best shopping mall in Thailand. A bit expensive though. If you look for bargains, avoid this mall.

Love the Christmas Decor. My spouse and I took the BTS and stopped at Siam Station. Just out from the BTS Station, we are able to access Siam Paragon with my kid on stroller with ease. Siam Ocean World was at the lowest floor, but we skipped that. Most of the shops are of high end brands but there are some on higher floors which are high street brands.The food court is huge and full of choices, however, I needed to pay in advance at the cashier counter in exchange of the card which function as a debit card and 'pay' using the card when I order. There are seats next to some Aquariums in the food courts, a good diversion for children. Make sure you return the card at end of your meal at the cashier's for the refund of the balance.Check out the Christmas Decor outside Siam Paragon, captivating even during daytime!
Shopping Mecca. If you like shopping you'll love this place! Full of Designer brands & Hi-So Thais ogling the farangs & vice versa. Dress to impress & bring the plastic!

designer mall. Just for interest this is a worthwhile place to walk through...it is great to be able to walk into all the really big branded shops and experience the decor and quality of products. Shop attendents are not snobby so u feel comfortable in the store. The Siam department store will have u totally overwhelmed on where to start shopping due to the HUGE options for what to buy. Was a great mall to visit!

So many food places. We went in search of one particular food place called 'Spice Story', which sell odd icecream flavours and has great reviews. We got lost for over an hour trying to find it, under the impression from signage that it was in a different part of the Paragon. We finally found it in the middle of the Gourmet Market (which is overflowing with different types of fresh food and all other supermarket-like products). If you want a wide range of foods to eat then definitely go here but beware of crowding.
Nice place to enjoy the day. Its a very nice place to spend a day relax, shopping .The mall is pretty big with variety of brands

High End Mall but Cheap Eats -Local to International Cuisine both!. This is one of the nice new malls in Bangkok. It is a high end mall with a Hermes outlet amongst many other brands. As an international visitor, make sure you goto the info counter to get yourself a Visitor Discount card that gives a further 5% off purchases at participating stores. On the lower level, you can enjoy both local Thai as well as International cuisine at reasonable prices. What is unique with this mall is that in the heat of the Thai day you can "shop" in air-condition comfort by walking from this Mall to Siam Centre through to Siam Discovery & end up at MBK. Suffice to say that you may take a whole day to explore all 4 malls. I know I took about a 3 days to slowly explore MBK itself!Happy shopping!

High End shopping mall. This mall is really the center of the shopping area in Bangkok. For us we go here because A) it is full air conditioned B) Has GREAT food outlets and C) has a great bookstore on the 4th floor....Kinkuya.Otherwise....There is Guffi and Prada eveywhere else in the world far cheaper so to us it is a bit of a waste....but nice to wonder and have a look.

Great range of international brands and entertainment. The Siam Paragon is very easy to get to using either of the BTS lines and getting off at Siam, the junction station for both lines. Another option is to use the sky walk that links Chit Lom BTS with Siam BTS.Siam Paragon has a great range of international brand names (although prices are not really different to the same items in the main European centres).The entertainment options are significant, certainly something for all the family, including a Madame Tussauds Wax Museum that was very good. The ground floor fountains are also quite entertaining.There are security checks at all entrance points and a helpful directory of all the shops available near the escalators. There is a good range of book stores on the 3rd floor.The newly re-opened Central World Plaza (about 100 metres away via the skywalk) is offering some stiff competition.
Amazing!. Amazing shopping centre in the heart of Bangkok.. You could spend hours in there. Its fully of desinger stores so make sure you have plenty of dosh!

The other side of Thailand - a busy mega-mall. Definitely worth an hour or two as you are passing through central Bangkok. Stop for lunch in the Lower Level Food Court. Great place for people watching. See how the urban Thai spend a weekend afternoon. The walk on the elevated platform between BTS Siam and Chit Lom stations is comfortable and gives you a bird's eye view of the city center.

a wonderful mall. This is one of the best malls in Bangkok and you must visit if you want to shop. The variety of brands is superb. I also liked the mall design and the ground level food court area which offers excellent choice in food. Also in the basement is the AEON bank ATM which is Thailand's only bank that does not charge you for withdrawing cash using a foreign card (you save 150 THB every time you use an aeon atm)

Nice mall but not cheap and same same. Typical type mall has all the brands etc - its for me no different to many of the malls in other pars of Asia. Great for a shopping fix but its not the real Asia for me

I like Siam Paragon ^^. In Siam Paragon.. got a gourmet market together with big food court... i like here most..
can found alot thailand food here.. amenities..
shampoo.. instant mee.. a lot of choicess :)

High End, and Fun. As a seqestered and culturally isolated American, I never expected to find a mall like Siam Paragon in Bangkok. Fuhgedaboudit. This is the classiest mall I've seen, with a damn Ferrari dealership. It is connected to the Skytrain, and has movie theaters that are far better than what I am used to here in L.A. Try the Nokia luxe theater and really be shocked at luxury movie viewing.

Iconic building in the city. Carries the familiar brands that you will find it back home.basement foodcourt offers a wide array of cuisines but it failed far from portraying what bangkok really offers.lamborghini in a shopping mall? quite a sight, but who buys 1 from there really? :)
Nice fancy mall, but nothing special. It's quite a fancy place to hang out with all houte couture shops, but we are more into authentic Thai experience

Great ! Big ! Noisy ! But cool. The most luxious mall in BKK, top Lux brand ( hermès, Cartier, Gucci...) , on the grownd floor Thérè is food center and restaurant and supermarket. Thérè is also aquarium.... Very Nice.
trendy. Nice mall for all kinds of shopping. Luxury theater and big food court

Wow, has Bangkok changed!. Everything is here, from a cheap foodcourt to great coffee and cake places, stylish restaurants and many world famous brand shops. People watching is fun, you could easy spend most of the day here!

Amazing Shopping at Drop dead cheap rates. This is a one stop shop, for anything and everything if you wanna shop till you drop and not make a huge dent on your wallet.Clothes, accessories, bags, shoes, souveniers, perfumes...name it and you will find it here. The mall ahs excellant connectivity and you can spend a whole day here and still not be done!!
Good but expensive goods sold there!. Great Christmas decorations with lot of branded goods for men and women. Good if you are a good spender.

Just take a look!. Paradise for eyes, hell for wallet.
we went there few time but we finally found out we never buy anything there, so i recommend this place if you want visit place with many "bling-bling", definitely the place to go.
Also for Christmas, they installed pink tree, for battle with "Central World" and "Terminal 21"

Window shopping only for me. Seriously high end retail. Worth a wander around if you want to fantasise how the wealthy shop. Do go to the top floor to find the 'Made in Siam' area for some reasonably priced keepsakes. Take lunch or afternoon tea at L'espace restaurant on the ground floor, a taste of the famous Oriental Hotel.
great mall. was nice and has variety of stuffs! liked the theatre

Quite the "shopping center". This multi-floored "mall" is the most impressive shopping are I have ever seen. It is beautifully designed with all of the top end stores, including Ferrari, Maserati, etc. Don't miss the "food court" on the lower level---an incredible array of small restaurants with delicious and very affordable food, both Thai and international.

Amazingly luxurious mall. The foodcourt on the ground floor has many choices for a quick but tasty meal to prepare for shopping heaven with all the major couture brands on the M-floor. I personally love the Kinokuniya book shop with plenty of choice in English books. Furthermore, Siam Paragon has many reputable jewelry stores and it's a heaven for luxury watches with all major brands represented. Go to the top floor to find a huge state-of-the-art cinema...splash some cash on the first class cinema for GBP15 a ticket to watch a movie in fully reclining first class seats.
Great Food Court. We stayed close by and the food court has an endless selection of high quality food (moderately priced). Easy to access via the Skytrain.
Expensive yappi place. Pro - Many japanese/sushi places ,Nice & big bookshop , my kids found the latest berg guns.

Shopping Mall. Its just a shopping mall. There are so many now. If you want something different try Terminal 21 shopping on Sukhimvit. Or MBK also on Sukhumvit (just say MBK to taxi) go to the 3rd floor and buy you fake watches and clothes!! they are all good quality here. Pay 1,600 Bht for a 'real' Rolex - and you can't tell the difference for the first couple of years!!

An Eye Opener. from the basement aquarium, eateries, grocery store, to the stores that sell Maserati, Porche, etc and even a Cal WOW fitness gym along with just about anything your heart can desire.......this is the place
Nice but do you need it?. Very crawded place, young guys hanging around, hundreds shops, expensive items but FOOD served at bars are good, chep and ready Thai.
shoppers heaven. great place even if you arent a shopper the boys toys are on the 4th floor the food courts are great go to see the people
Huge and high end.. Just like any high end Mall in the United States. I was on a budget, so had a better shopping experience at MBK.
Nothing like this in Europe. You can even buy a porsche. Bring enough cash, it is mot as cheap as you might expect.. Very modern, very luxery and very big. Food-court is crowded.

MEGA LUXURY. Siam Paragon, an enormous upscale "mall" is an experience for travellers who love shopping. Every designer and every luxury is present. Inside the complex is the department store, Siam Paragon. Eateries small and large representing most world cultures are everywhere offering everything from sashimi,to pizza, pasta, Vietnamese pho, Chinese, Japanese, British, French... Papa Beard cream puffs to Starbucks, Au Bon Pain, KFC, McDonald's, and a food loft for cheaper thai eats. The Gourmet grocery store is also housed here along with a complex of cinema's. On the 5th floor, in Siam Paragon, are a complete collection of beautiful (EXPENSIVE) Thai goods and products.Nothing cheap here and no bargaining, but a shopping complex that few elsewhere in the world compare to and attesting to the great prosperity and wealth present in Bangkok. It is well and truly an awesome, serious display of upscale Thailand.

very eleant mall with all he brands. yu have everything in this mall whatever you name it and they have it...prices are expensive but thats what you pay in europe and us anyways...but good shoppig experience

Modern Mall. First off it's huge and like shopping any high end stores, most major brands but hard to find what you need but you do get a lot of exercise.best part is the movie theater SUper awesome !

High End Shopping / Dining One Stop shop. As a resident of Thailand, it's fair to say Siam Paragon will have the best representation of international grade top end goods and food (both supermarket and dining) to be found in Thailand under one roof. It's for this reason you may want to overlook the fact there won't be many deals to be had. Bangkok can be a tough place to get around and you could easily burn up days to find what will essentially all be here. If you're looking for deals you'd be better off heading to Seacon Square (recently remodeled) on Sri Nakarin Road, about 150 baht taxi ride from downtown but plan on anywhere from 45 min to 2 hours to get there depending on traffic. Seacon Square is a great place to find wide selection deals under one roof but doesn't really have any high end shops. It's a place where local middle class Thai's will shop.If you're downtown, short on time, in need of shopping and don't want to mess around with copies etc. this is your one stop shop. Happy Traveling
HAS EVERYTHING. They something for everyone. You will get lost it is so big. Movie theater is amazing

Another upmarket mall. Seen one upmarket mall, seen them all. The only thing somewhat novel about this mall is the stores selling exotic sports cars. Unfortunately they would not fit in my luggage allowance so I could not buy the lovely little Lotus I saw there.
Siam Paragon an amazing place. Everything you need and many things you don't, great shopping! Wonderful people watching and some nice little eating establishment. Always worth a visit!!

Siam Paragon Food Hall. Nice shopping mall in Bangkok. Inside you can find a wide range store, restaurant and also Siam Ocean World. A reminder : In the food hall, you need to use their prepaid card to buy food. Just do not forget to redeem back your card as it is only valid for that day only. It happened to me and i lost the money inside that card.

good shopping. It is one of the biggest shopping malls in Bangkok, and is one of the most organised one. You will get most of the biggest brands in the world over here. There are a lot of resturants and food counters in this mall. It is huge.
excellent mall. one of the most shopping mall in bangkok.have many brands and the price very good

High End Shopping. I'd never been to a shopping center that sold luxury cars before. Excellent cinema complex with western prices and some cinemas having leather business class seats. Great food selection. Well wort a visit. The Aquarium downstairs has dual pricing, foreigners pay much more.
Everything you need...nice supermarket...just bring money!. It is not cheap.....So bring money to spend on what you need! haah. Nice area and nice shopping!

A 5 Star shopping centre. This is a place to shop for not only the top end products but also for the daily need items. And if you want something very special then visit the second floor motor showrooms of Porsche; BMW; Ferrari and many more. The food court and restaurants cater to everyone's tastes. A definite place for a must stop and shop.

I'm lost, again!. This is a huge shopping complex, on several floors, so it is very easy to get disorientated, but I guess that means you get to see more things than you planned, which can't be a bad thing. Great variety of food available on the ground floor. The fish and chips, and Japanese ramen (curried noodle) places are highly recommended! If you are in need of bakery items (bread, scones, croissants, Danish pastries, etc.) there's no shortage, either. Ozzies will be pleased to know that the Supermarket also has Vegemite and Cooper's Ale.
shoppers delight. everthing you need can be found here,but its nice to look at the others
Aquarium. Great Place to go with kids. We were ther twice and each time spent 2-3 hours. Kids had a great time.

Very nice for a break. All the main facilities of a big and nice shopping mall - air conditioning, nice restrooms, exchange,etc.There are lots of very fancy and expensive shops but you still can find great bookstores and "normal" shops like GAP, Boots..There are many nice options of restaurants which are not that expensive.

I shop at Siam Paragon almost everyday. This mall is actually connected to Bangkok Sky train (Siam Station). You can find everything in this mall. It has a great range of big brand name shops and restaurants. I just found out recently that there is a golf cart service available at the exit gate next to Lenotre shop on the same floor as Food Court . It will transport you to the back of Siam Paragon mall and from there only a short walk to Panthip Plaza. This is very handy if you want to visit Panthip Plaza for computer stuff later or even "the famous Platinum Mall" located next to Panthip Plaza:)

The biggest mall I have seen (incl. MBK& Discovery) with anything your heart desires, for cheap!. A bunch of outlets, expensive in comparison to side road vendors and fake products, common in Thailand but cheap/ affordable in comparison to Champs Elysees or Oxford Street. Multitude of shops that offer everything + designated entertainment area including cinemas and food section
Relaxed shopping. things are quit expensive here, but you don't have to worry about buying cheap copies. here you get the real deal.

Very high end shopping, best cinema in BKK. There are many shopping malls in the Siam area of BKK, but this is the most high-end, with the most designer shops, such as Gucci, Prada, and even Lamborghini. Yes, they sell luxury cars alongside designer bags and watches. The main department store is fun to walk around, they sell just about everything you could ever want or need. Also a great place to see a movie. I spent a whole afternoon wandering around and did not get bored.
If you like shopping. Difficult to beat for choice. Crowded, busy, noisy...
Too busy place. Too big and too busy with lot of students. Department store merchandise is poor in branding selection.

Lifestyle mall in City Downtown. I love to be in this mall, because there is a seaworld tank in the basement, the foodcourt is excellent, and the supermarket was superb. So many thing that you can buy here especially thailand's food

An amazing paradise for shopping and architectural wonder. A lot has been said about this place. My opinion is, this place is worthy to visit even if not for shopping, just to marvel at the beautiful and luxurious decor, which is surprisingly tasteful. Lots of nice shops to browse, a huge Kinokuniya bookstore to keep any book bugs happy. Wonderful food hall, luxury shops by abundance. A perfect way to spend a hot afternoon, or when it's raining outside. This place is huge and can easily get lost, and you may not be impressed by the high prices if you are on a shoe string.
If you like to shop...you have to be there!. Very big shopping heaven! We ran into a movie star there too that day when we visited. Big selection of food in the food court and nice restaurants!
major shopping center. amazing place, huge aquarium on ground floor, wonderful theatres, ferrari dealer on 3rd floor, every shop u can imagine,and great restaurants

Food Court - Post Visit... Need to Tie me to a Treadmill. Siam Paragon is full of over priced global brand stores - Hermes, Dior, Prada, etc., No thanks, I can buy those at home (although sizes are localized - a size 4 US is a large overseas... SIGH).The allure of Siam Paragon for me is the grocery store where one can go on a rampage buying all of the exotic fruits one doesn't find at home... Mangosteens, rose apples, longan, mangoes (and an excellent mango and sticky rice stand!), durian, rambutan, you name it you can find it from their extensive stands...If you're looking to experience local flavors check out Siam Paragon!
Big Mall. Its a huge malll with lots and lots of shop ...have all the famous brand ....very well decorated and nice facilities

A must-do experience in Bangkok. Just LOVE this centre. Apart from the massive food court with lots of great fine dining and takeaway food, I enjoy the engligh bookstore. Great selection for the traveller. Take time to see the Motor Car dealers - 5th floor! Have been to the cinemas and recommend their premium class. For A$20 you get a drink and snack before the movie - try the massage chair- a recliner chair in a 2 person booth and a movie. And just to help you relax they provide a silk comforter and cushion, Don;t miss this when you go to Bangkok
Good selection of ethnic food. Spacious food court. Like the idea of a card loaded with credit which is then deducted when paying for meals.
massive food hall, great choice of food. really good for shopping, similar to westfield, you name it, they have it here.
Great Shopping mall. Large food area in basement, cinemas at 6th floor, lots of shopping, close to skytrain
nice shopping mall. very nice mall but very western feel. this is kind of a mall you know from all other citys.

Mega shopping centre. If you are in to shopping centres then a visit here is worth it. The paragon department store is impressive just for the shear size and number of employees! If you need a ride home, there is Lamborghini, Porsche and Lotus dealers here! The food court is good with a varied selection of world food, not so much Thai food however. The shopping centre, Gourmet Market, is impressive.

Siam Paragon- A huge shopping mall. You do not get to see such huge shopping malls in India. As I entered 6 Lamborghini's were lined up for sale. The size of the shopping mall made the cars look like toy cars. It was just huge and it holds the largest aquarium in Asia. One needs an entire day to check out the complete mall.

Great shopping, movies, restaurants. I always like Siam Paragon - quality outlets and loads of nice little places to eat. There's a cinema on the top floor as well. Recommend The Lit and Siam at Siam hotels if you want to stay nearby.
Love it. Been all over the world but this is the first mall that I loved. The food court is amazing and varied. The shopping is chic and trendy. But the prices are like NYC.
Good for shopping. Central location just next to Siam BTS/Skytrain station. Nice shops, no bargaining, but little expensive.

posh!. Siam Paragon is definitely one of BKK's most fabulous shopping malls. One can easily get lost in its spacious marbled hallways while checking out the numerous shops there. And one can go on a food trip and experience different foods from all over the world at the Food Hall which includes a Gourmet market and a 'take-home' area. And of course there's Siam Ocean World - the biggest aquarium in Asia! One day is definitely not enough to explore and enjoy this place!
impressive. no shopping centres like this at home! Must see, it was fun to wonder around ...expensive children's toys and clothes

The food court is amazing.. Plan to wander through the food court on the ground floor. Snack and nibble your way through all kinds of fun food, or grab an entire Thai "fast food" meal. Try Mangos and Sticky rice, the traditional Thai desert. Yummy. If you have extra money there is a BMW car dealership on the third floor.
Great shopping Mall and up market. Great place to shop.. its an up market shopping mall but I like it

Siam Paragon. I have visited there atleast on four occasion......you name it they have it .. the have a dedicated multi cuisine food court... a huge aquarium at the basement... i think it is th biggest mall in bangkok city .. you must spend some time in the food court.. you can splurge as much you wish to in this place and i promise you would not feel guilty ... rather you would take a vow to return once more...paradise for shopaholics..Regards
Shop, Shop, Shop. Definitely top of the list for shopping. Beautiful. From budget to luxury, whatever you need you will find it here.
Get ready to shop!. Make sure you have lots of credit on your visa card because its shopping at its best. My sister and I were over whelmed with the choice and range of everything.

Great upper class shopping centre in heart of retail district. One of my favourite shopping centres in Bangkok. Very extravagant, clean and good choice of shopping and eateries. The department store has good sales most of the year and the supermarket has a wide range-really enjoyed roaming the isles and finding new products! The food court is cheap and pretty good. Ate at a few of the restaurants- which were all excellent. The shopping centre is home to all the big international brands from Burberry to Prada. The Chloe store has wonderful staff. Big Zara and Gap- both have a wide range. Japanese book-store chain Kinokuniya is on about level three or four and has a huge range of books and magazines! Also, the cinemas on the top floor are great! State of the art facilities and standard tickets are quite cheap.

Best of the best for all categories and age group. Amazing food hall....
Amazing shopping and great brands from the mid-end to the luxury
The SP delights all ages!

Great Selection of Stores and Dining. My favorite mall in Bangkok. The food court and the restaurants in the basement are outstanding. Try MOS Burgers for one of the best hamburgers you will ever try.

High end shopping, with a nice 'Gourmet Floor' with a wide range of restaurants for all budgets. The 'mezzanine' level has all the top brands -- from Hermes to Tod's, and a soon-to-open Prada outlet. The ground floor is devoted to restaurants and a food court. Treated myself to desert at Lenôtre.

Mall you should not miss Visting on Trip to Thai. - Awesome Ambienece
- Best Crowd of Thai
- Lamborgini Showcase
- Next to Sky Train
- Siam Underground World Experience
- You can feel inside the sea world
- Best for Shopping freaks
- For High Class society Only
- Round the world Cusine Food Court
My favourite shopping mall. Love the big supermarket there! Great variety of snacks and daily supplies.
It's a mall.... ...and with MBK right nearby, why would you shop here? Everything's expensive!

Can we shop?. If it ain't here it ain't classy! Really one of the newest and most fashionable department stores (malls) in Thailand, loaded with fabulous shops from all the finest designers to reasonably priced shops, has great movie theatres and bowling alley on top floor, or go to the Gym, and if you are hungry there is an amazing food court and supermarket on the lower level, and other fine resturaunts on other levels, all connected to the Skytrain Station (Siam - central station). Oh yes there is also Underwater World , an enhanced aquarium. There is something for everyone at Siam Paragon!

Shopping Heaven :). Siam Paragon is something which you shouldn't be missing if you are on shopping spree. You can say that it's a Brand heaven :) you'll find all big brands in Siam paragon. Also there is ocean world in the basement of Siam paragon which is a must visit if you are visiting SP.

Shopper's Paradise. This is something that needs to be experienced in person. There is no other shopping experience like shopping at Siam Paragon. Also if you like fish and aquariums. The basement of Siam Paragon houses the largest underground aquarium in Asia. Very cool to see and highly recommend.

High-class shopping mall. It is a mall where u get the usual big brand names or where u want to get some genuine good stuff/cloths. Specific target group. Generally as a tourist I don't prefer shopping in there knowing that else where in BKK, i can strike better deals and get much more interesting goods, more achievements in the local bargaining process... All in all, the expensive shopping mall will never give u the real authentic experience of living in BKK. Go Local is my advice.. if u want to fully appreciate how the Thais live

Exclusive shoppingmall. A very modern mall, very expensive...
Easy to reach by skytrain.

A shopping mall with good restaurant offerings. Besides up-market stores, the basement has a large variety of restaurants. Fuji for Japanese and MK for hot-pot cooking are both recommended - they are excellent values for lunch or dinner.

So big, you need a map. Siam Paragon is one of the larges shopping centres in South East Asia. It's so big that, ideally, you need a map to get around. It's only been opened for a couple of years, so it's very new and very clean. It's also easy to get to as Siam is a stop on the Skytrain service. If you have time, a visit to the basement Aquarium is well worthwhile - much bigger than you might expect.
VIP cinema. nice experience watching movies in recliners with a blancket.however, overpriced. for sure compared to BKK costs.
GOOD local food in food court. There is a food court on ground floor -cooked to order but you may have to wait in line as meal times can be quite a lot of local people waiting for their meals too.
High end shopping. If you need a shopping fix, then this is it.If you want lots of great food choices, then the food court on the ground floor has a variety.
Nice mall. A good mall for a really good brands... if you are looking for cheap shopping, then do not enter here...

Great international shopping. A stunning shopping mall with great modern international shops and restaurants, although i would also recommend going to MBK shopping center if you are looking for bargains

First Class Shopping Mall. This is a great mall! You can buy a BMW, Lamborgini, Tech products, top fashion, great food, first class theaters that should be experienced, bowling, IMAX, anything you'd want or need can be found there.
Saim Paragon. Amazing site, shops with everything one could want. Gourmet food court in asement is out of this world and food wonderful and inexpensive

This place has it all!. Bring money... The shops were all to over the top for me. The basement has an amazing food court. If you go, you buy a credit card for say, $10.00 and whenever you buy some food, they swipe it and take the amount off. Great idea eh, unless you do what I did and go back three days later to use it to buy more food...the card expires after two days :(

Well worth spending a few hours in. This is a luxury shopping mall right next to Siam MTR.The Main floor certainly isnt for the fainthearted with shops like Chanel,Cartier,Rolex and Armani around but it does get a little cheaper on the First and Second floors.Some decent eateries,in a nice setting,on the Ground floor and a good choice of cuisines,that arent too expensive,on the Basement floor.Overall,Siam Paragon is worth a visit....you might glimpse a Thai actress or two shopping on the Main floor !

Pleasant and expensive....... bring a full wallet!. Easy to get to via the BTS to Siam station and is a bit of an oasis from the heat, humidity and chaos of the traffic.We are not fans of, nor do we have the budget for the high-end brand names in this huge complex. Plenty of floors to look at with several key attractions to while away a day if you have it to spend here.It’s a pleasant exercise to stroll around window-shopping in the department store or the other shops and as they all have top end prices there are not too many people to get in your way.On the other hand, downstairs in the Food Court area that changes and it is hard to find a seat in any of the plethora of eateries.The food here ranges from your ordinary McDonalds through to up market mini restaurants serving good food as are the Gourmet food sections which made our mouths water. For us it was the best thing in this shopping mall.We spent more time here in the food hall than looking at the shops, as it was way too expensive. Better to hunt for bargains at MBK for that mass-market tourist item.
Good place but just confusing. I like the stuff they sell is quite posh and update. The Cinema is nice too and our kids like to visit the sea world every time we visited Bangkok.

Very expensive. Take the sky train to here, very cheap. The mall is beautiful. There is a Ferrari dealership and Porshe on the 4th or 5th floor.A sea world type thing in the lower for kids, you pay to get in, It looked good but we were pressed for time.Walk across the road to the MBK mall for some fantastic tourist prices.If you love expensive things of good quality the Siam paragon is the place for you.
Upmarket Mall.. Many shops, restaurants etc. Good location as it is connected to other malls such as Siam Center.

Great place for shopping & window shopping. If you are visiting Bangkok and have some spare time or would like to shop little classy & branded stuff - this is the place to be in. You have a huge mall spread over five floors offers close to a whopping half a million square meters of shopping pleasure. Its very elegant and very up-market unlike most of the street shopping and Indra Square mall. You can get a tourist discount card at the information desk on ground floor that offers you a 5% discount on select merchandise. Its very easy to reach via BTS train and Siam station is right in (almost) the mall.The floors are well demarcated into Luxury Living, Fashion Venue, Lifestyle & Leisure, Living & Technology, IT & Paragon Passage, and Explorium & Global Entertainment.The Samsung showroom offers good rates on its products.A must visit for fond memories.
Awesome!. Awesome place to shop if you like the more expensive line of goods! fantastic food mall with hugh fishtanks and a great array of foods to choose from...
expensive. Big shopping centre but a bit expensive, but if you have unlimited money this is a great place to shop.

Fantastic shopping experience. The Siam Paragon is the place to go for any one that loves to shop, and even those that don't.It is a mall with 6 levels of shopping in which you will find stores like Gucci, a Lambourguini dealership, an Apple store, music instrument stores, an IMAX theater, the Paragon department store, an enormous food court, a grocery store, and even an aquarium.But if perhaps you don't find what you are looking for, take the pedestrian bridge to MBK; or perhaps to the Bangkok Center for the Arts.

shop, dine and adventure in one place. this is one of my very recommended shopping mall in Bangkok, because it has branded store, all international food and traditional food, Bank, Money Changer, and the best thing is they have an ocean world on the basement. the entrance fee is not too expensive and i enjoy it this ocean world due to they have many kinds of view and promotion in there. must try it the dr. fish therapy as well

One of the biggest in Asia. It's like Pavilion Mall in Kuala Lumpur but very much bigger. A classy shopping malls with almost everything under the roof, with Underwater world, Karaoke, Bowling Alley, Art Gallery, Event Hall, Hotel, Gourmet Market, brands and foodstuff items from various nations. Very impressive design for most of the outlets especially the cinema level.
Nice bowling centre to spend an hour or so. If you like bowling this is the place to go. New facilities and in a prime area with easy access by BTS.Nice to spend a few hours with friends.
HUGE. this mall has everything. clothes, electronics, purses, books, everything. Huge food court (including starbucks) bowling alley (top floor) cinema, and aquarium in the basement.
Food. So many optionsPeking duck on -1 eating for a couple at a price of 500 bhtvie resturant on the 4 floor very good for 1000 bht
beautiful luxury mall. everything you want to see in small is here.. a lot of food choices and luxury shopping options!!!
luxury brands. if you have the money ...treat yourselfchanel, gucci, prada, lamborghini!!!

A great way to spend a few hours. The one bad thing is that the Siam Paragon is extremely crowded on the weekends, but on the week days as well. But it offers so much, so I think most people can put up with the large crowds.It includes a wide range of specialty stores and restaurants as well as a multiplex movie theater with one of the them having the biggest screen and seating capacity in Asia) and the Siam Ocean World (Underwater world) aquarium (the largest aquarium in South East Asia). It also has perhaps the best super markets in Thailand.

Shopping paradise. Siam Paragon is a lovely spacious shopping mall with Bangkok's best bookshop, Kinokuniya, on the 4th floor. The Food Court on the lower ground floor is excellent too, great choice of food, very modest prices

Siam Paragon Mall. Huge, massive, expansive, never ending, full of activities. This place is a must visit for good shopping deals and the best of luxury brands. Its connected with Siam centre, Siam Discovery. Closest station- SIAM.
Amazing mall. Very beautifull mall. having lots of branded showrooms. every thing u get here. prices are too high. must see the malls when visit to bangkok.little walk way distance to Bts siam.

Shopping Heaven. A great mall, great branded, great location, just infront of Siam BTS.. there are other shopping malls around which can reach within walking distance. Spent whole day in the area till night and there will be a night market opposite Siam paragon. Remember, to take a photo of the night scene of Siam paragon... NICE!!

Arguably the best mall in Bangkok. A big mall with a presence of all major international brands and a great atmosphere. Conveniently located, attached to the metro station and has a taxi stand just outside the main entrance. Definitely the best place to buy branded stuff in Bangkok but do not expect the prices to be low.

Best n Premium Brands. Fantastic Mall, comparable to the best in the world, with a Sea World in the mall itself.
Very Very expensive brands like Prada, Gucci, LV, etc. For the average person, nothing to shop n lots to see!

Supermall, with a lot of attractions. If you come from outside Bangkok, don't bother to shop here. It is filled with upmarket retail stores (hermes etc), which you can get it in the same price (if not cheaper) in your country of origin. However the shopping mall is pretty cool where you can go only to this place to enjoy Seaworld, Madame Tussaud, various Thai food in the food court, and other events if you're lucky (there was Japan fest when I went there).The shopping mall is conveniently connected with the sky train. Of course there's a lot of taxi and tuk tuk too, but the area is very very crowded. It is the centre of traffic jam in Bangkok, you'll spent at least 50 bath only to get out/in to the shopping mall drop-off area.I suggest to visit this mall only if you are staying around the area or you really want to go to the Madame Tussaud.

Best shopping mall in town. You will find all world-class brands and more in this mall. There is a cinema incl. iMax, a aquarium (might be similar to all major city's) and a foodcourt that offers all sorts of food you can imagine. Our family liked especially the super market where all known products with local products can be found. I recommend to go there by the SkyTrain (BTS) since the Sukhumvit road is always traffic jammed. BTS is anyway the most convenient way to get around in Bangkok.

If you are a fan of shopping centres.... Siam Paragon is probably the most beautiful and luxurious shopping centre in Bangkok. Here you can find all the most luxury brands as well as a good food court, but the prices are quiet expensive, even for european standards.However, if you are really a shopping centre fan, this is the palce to go.

Wow, very upscale & great cineplex. Very easy to get to on the BKS skytrain Siam stop.When we were here there was some kind of wild Japanfest going on with live music and tons of people in costume. The shops are mostly very upscale and quite expensive. The mall is very clean and shiny. The food court and the gourmet section is incredible! The only downside is if you buy something from a food court stand that does not have seating you are out of luck for seating, there is none for you, because the seating that is there is only for the restaurants that sell the food for that area. Krispy Kreme just opened and the people were lined up and buying 6 or 7 BOXES of donuts!The cineplex on the top floor has 14 theatres plus an IMAX. we got VIP seating, a comfy leather loveseat with a blanket for 600 baht! it was great!great mall!

Great upmarket mall. The best mall in Bangkok by terms of upmarket stores roles Cartier and others inside a great looking marble clad mall dip through the mall to Siam paragon for the normal stores, next door Nike adidas etcThe food floor on the ground level is amazing Tony romas vanilla brassiere to name my favourites and don't forget Siam ocean eorld on minus one!
Quite impressive. Overall a nice place to spend a day and catch a movie. Food courts are very good and the aquarium in the basement worth a look.RegardsJTS-7

Amazing super mall. This place is HUGE! What an amazing impressive place. I went to the movies on the top floor where they had a vip seating area for about 1000 baht. Really nice experience. Also they have cool cars like Porsche and Lambourghini showrooms and a sea world in the basement.
Really good!

The best shopping mall for food and designer. This is the best shopping mall for food and designer clothes.Of course it is expensive as the reason d'être of this mall is to cater for those with money to burn.
