To give this mall a low rating for being too expensive is like doing the same for Harrods or Bloomingdales.The food court on the ground floor should get special attention which serves all kinds of savoury and sweet dishes from all over the world (at a very cheap price by European standards). Salivating as a type.

Go see a 4DX movie here. We don't have 4DX movies in the US yet, unless you count Disney and MGM. It combines 3D, motion and smells to create a great movie experience. It's worth the visit to the mall alone. The food court downstairs is great to. Krispy kream donuts is here too ;)

best food court mall. The basement of the Siam Paragon is amazing! It's got everything from Thai food - the typical food stalls - to international food outlets representing almost every corner of the world. There are also cafe and restaurants. One of my favorites are the Lenotre, Vanilla Brasserie - both have tasty cakes. There's also a northern Thai restaurant that has tasty spicy Thai food and nice decor. Really - there are so many choices at Paragon - you wish you could eat everything. There's also the Gourmet Supermarket - which is huge and has EVERYTHING. Just a really great food haven - recommended for those who don't have time to taste all of Bangkok. Just come here - it's a one stop shop.

VERY VERY CLASSY. This is a very classy mall. i love this mall. it is huge but it is a bit on the expensive side , with prices in some cases more expensive than malls in Australia. The food court is huge , and is very well priced and has so many nice restuarants on the ground floor. you can easily get lost in this mall as it is quite large.
For those who love shopping. This is a very modernized mall with large selection of restaurants from Thai cuisines to Dunking Donuts. It's a huge mall with plenty to see.

Premium Shopping Mall with Attraction for Kid. The shopping mall is big and you can walk and don't know which direction you are. The mall is full with shops of premium brands and big food court with variety of selections. At the basement there is a well-done aquarium to spend time with the children.

Impressing mall!. This place is a great alternative to the airport if you have a few hours to kill. It is easy to get here from Suvarnabhumi, take the train and then the skytrain. PS: Remember coins for the train ticket!.We did some window shopping, but also ended up with some toys and clothes ...And we were at the aquarium! A wonderful place to take your children! Simply stunning, the aquarium had everything from creepy to cute sharks penguins! Admission cost a bit, but it was worth every baht!

A mega shopping mall in the heart of city !!. Everytime I 've been in Bangkok, I definitely go to Siam Paragon for shopping. This mega mall is amazing. It is adjacent right to Siam Center and Siam Square so you can go directly from this sites to another very conveniently. To fully explore this area, I really suggest you should spend 1 day . It offers a lot of fashion brand names from mid - range to the luxury ones and a vast selection of delicious, reasonanle fast food and restaurants. Especially, we do really enjoy some local fashion design and brand name there. They are very chracteristic with affordable price.

Great Selection & Varieties of Food. The food court in Siam Paragon offers a vast selection of food of all kinds, from local Thai delicacies, to Chinese, Japanese, Western, to McDonalds. We tried the Thai pineapple fried rice (which literally comes with half pineapple filled with tasty fried rice), fried noodles with pork, and fish meat with special Thai sauce. The food tastes great for a food court standard, and is quite reasonably priced. The pineapple fried rice is THB120, and the noodles and fish is at THB60 each. This place is very crowded.
everything is busy. Many people come to this department on weekend, everything is nice, only the food court, the food is over price, the taste is normal and not much place to sit.

Great place for movies, supermarket and books.. First off the top (7th) floor has the great Paragon Cineplex movie theatre, one of the best places to see movies in Bangkok. The movies are in original language, subtitled in Thai or English. Usually priced at 120 Baht. Can be cheaper or more expensive, depending on time, screen and theater.The 7th floor toilets on the exhibition end are very good. Almost no one there, many clean spacious western toilets. Always soap, towels, paper and no-touch water-taps and big mirrors. Very clean.The 3rd floor Kinokuniya is perhaps the best book store in Bangkok. Highly recommended. The military history, martial arts, philosophy and religion departments are very well presented here. To find similar, one would have to go to Singapore or Kuala Lumpur. The average cost of books is usually 200-500 Baht. Here you can find very specialiced books in English and Thai. Other languages presented too. One floor down is AsiaBooks, which is small but has good gift books.The G (ground) floor has a food-court, many restaurants, internet-cafe, McDonalds etc, but also the great Paragon Gourmet Market, which is basically a big supermarket, with huge and specialized selections. It has it's own liquor and tobacco place also. The prices are not expensive, unless you opt for something rare and imported. I highly recommend.One floor down on the basement is the Siam Paragon Ocean World, which claims to be the largest aquarium in Asia. Very good place to visit also. It is similar to the great aquariums in Singapore and Kuala Lumpur.Siam Paragon is situated at the central BTS SkyTrain station, (CEN) Siam. SkyTrain is connected to the MRT subway system. A ticket for either will cost 15-40 Baht. There is a walkway to Central World, and to the other way you can walk to Siam Center, Siam Discovery and all the way to MBK.On the Siam Paragon square outside there are often some happenings like concerts etc.This place is definitely worth a visit if you are on the area and find yourself interested in anything described above. While here you can visit the Madame Toussaud's Wax Cabinet on the nearby Siam Discovery Center's top floor.

Everything in one place!. An aquarium, bowling alley, 3 cinemas inc an IMAX, Porsche, Lamborghini etc showrooms, department store, restaurants... Everything in one place!! It's incredible! Obviously have all the brands here so quite pricey, but a good place to hang out and eat. I'd recommend another hound cafe on 1st floor!

Expensive but great range of brands. There is a lot of high end brands like Hermes, Versace, Bally etc. I didn't buy anything from here, so expensive! But it had a great range of make up which wasn't too pricey. I would recommend going to Platinum Mall instead for clothes shopping...you can get beautiful dresses etc for under 250 baht (NZ$10) but their one size fits all is about a size 10. Also there isn't much authentic food in the mall but you can cross the road for some local street stalls. Worth the visit.
Great sophiscated mall. I love this mall in Bangkok, and will always return here for window shopping for European luxury goods and eating my favorite Thai cuisine at the food court.

Visit even if you don't shop. This shopping is worth visiting even if you are not going to shop. From the beautiful stores, to the hallways, it's all perfection. Very expensive shopping for the upper-class; all designer and specialty stores. Pick up a brochure, if nothing else, to see what's available. We didn't go to the movie theater but having read about it, it would have been quite a experience. Ocean World in the lower level to entertain the kids. Amazing! Fantastic dining options too.Coming from the US, I have to admit that the infrastructure is just absolutely amazing, unlike anything I ever saw here either in the east or west coast.

Shopping and entertainment. this is a mall with a large number of branded stores.the ground floor is filled with food... you have Mc.Donalds, Burger King, Thai food and lots.the stores had a wide range of styles.there are movie theaters on the top floor.The theaters are well maintained and comfortable.one can spend hours here and forget the track of time.

Shopping freak. Siam paragon the giant mall where you get all the thing from all the corner of the world. you will find all the big brands and lovely food court to have diiferent cusines . nice oceans world wher you can see marine life.

Super expensive. Cool for people watch. I came with the idea of this being the shopping paradise and I made a huge mistake visiting first this mall. It is very expensive, it features the big brands that can be easily bought cheaper in the US.It is cool though to see it. It is very big, they fancy. Has a food court that is only ok. You will spend lots of time looking at the young tais, they are so fashionable! I loved to watch their clothes! And then I got to the real paradise for me, the little street shops in Siam Square!
Siam Paragon. Fantastic shopping mall, you get there everything what would you ever need !

Good change of pace....You will forget you are in Bangkok. Visited on 14 September 2010. Located adjacent to the Siam station of the BTS Skytrain system.It is comparable to a very high end mall of a major US city. Its target market appears to be the affluent Thais and other Asians seeking brand name luxury goods—electronics, jewelry, artwork, furniture, and even sports cars.There did not appear to be any mass market tourist souvenirs or stores that would attract the average tourist. To me, nothing screamed “Thailand” or “Bangkok”. The highlight is the large food court on the bottom floor. There is a wide variety of Thai, Japanese, and other Asian food. Very nicely decorated, so it blends in with the rest of the mall—no a wide open space. There are also free standing restaurants—Italian, Japanese, Chinese, etc.—along the edges of the bottom floor. Adjacent to the mall on its west side, there are a couple of other smaller malls (Siam Center and Siam Discovery Center) with less expensive clothing stores and fast food restaurants. Due east is the Central World Plaza / Zen Mall, but the majority of it is closed and under reconstruction. It was severely damaged during the Bangkok riots of April / May 2010.All of the above would be great places to visit on after a long day of visiting the sites and/or if the weather is especially bad.

Not a good place for shopping. All products in this shopping mall is very expensive even it is branded stuff. Travelers will find it difficult to shop at here because of the overprice stuffs. This is very high class shopping mall for rich people.It is recommended for sightseeing only and the mall design is very nice and lucrative. There are many spots in the shopping mall where you can take nice photos and enjoy the pleasant environment.There are other places where you can enjoy unlimited shopping experience like Pratunam, Platinum Mall and Chatuchak at reasonable price.

Mall, Aquarium, Food Court, Cinema complex and Gourmet Supermarket. Siam Skytrain brings you to a series of 3 buildings on several floors covering both ends of retail scales and everything inbetween. You can spend all day here wth a family - great to while away hours after checking out of your hotel before a late flight without getting all hot and sweaty! Siam Tower building on your left has an Apple repair centre on the3rd floor where you can get our iPod fixed in a couple of hours. You can also walk to MBK Mall (or go to National Stadium Skytrain) and discover the delights of anything you could possibly find in any Bangkok street market (and more) and learn the true price of items - you can even bargain here, but they start way lower than tourist market stalls.

#16 of Bangkok's attractions a shopping mall?. OK, it is an impressive mall. The food options on the first floor are immense, and probably worth a visit (I just upgraded my rating to 4 stars, thinking about it). The book store on the third floor is one of the best English book stores in Asia. Below it on the second floor you can act like you are a high roller and check out the Porsches and Lambos and Beemers - a first for me, luxury car dealers in a mall. The IMAX on the top floor shows the latest Hollywood production (currently Avatar in 3-D). And in the basement is a pretty decent aquarium, particularly when you think it is located in a shopping mall. Of course, there are also the stores - but they seem to be the lesser attraction here, given that many are the Prada / Gucci / Armani type that I myself don't frequent. Perhaps if I were richer - but then, I would be down on an island and not hanging out in a shopping mall.

nice aquarium, great food court. The aquarium is in the basement of this upscale mall. We did the package (950 baht) deal which turned out to be a much, much better deal than the 850 baht (a bit pricey for Bangkok, but good aquariums are not cheap to maintain) ticket and just one of the extra items (4D movie, behind the scenes tour, glass boat ride, fish pedicure, soda+popcorn). 4D movie was about Santa and a snowman and could be skipped. Enjoyed the shark feeding, huge crabs, seahorses, pipefish, water rats (they don't have these where we're from), fish pedicure (since it was part of the package and fun to try as a novelty), car aquarium. We had lunch at the food court one floor above and enjoyed the variety of choices and the reasonable prices.All in all, a pleasant experience. It was nice to escape into the bright, clean, air conditioned mall after days in outdoor humidity and hanging around dirty streets and markets around town.

Giant shopping centre. I was in Bangkok at the end of September with my boyfriend. We are from Perth, Western Australia so we were expecting some big shopping centres. Nothing prepared me for Paragon! There are 3 shopping centres all linked, the main one (Paragon) is about 6 levels of shops, as well as a food court. In the basement is an aquarium. We could not believe our eyes. It is absolutely fantastic.

worth the visit!!. Initially we spent the day at the Aquarium at the basement of Siam Paragon in order ro celebrate my son's birthday. Good choice, to combine such an attraction with shopping. The shops are higher end of the market, with 30% higher prices than Europe, however, the Thai fashion designers, are fantastic and great value for money. Their garments are beautifully done and look a million dollars! The staff in all shops are outstanding. They actually took care of the kids while we shopped! They smiled and helped and advised us about the vat refunds and how to get them. The major plus in Siam Paragon is the food hall in the basement. A mecca of food, with fantastic stalls with all kind of asian dishes one can wish for. If you feel hungry this is the place to have a value meal. The bakery right there in the middle of the floor does the most delicious cheescake bread ever tasted. I tried to re-create the recipee but that was impossible. Could go to Bangkok just for that! Siam Paragon would leave many western malls to shame with its' plethora of shops, dining options, and attractions! Definetely a must visit fo someone who opts for higer end of the market goods.

Check this place out shopping paradise!!!. I had forgotten my cannon camera charger. So the staff at my hotel suggested we go check out this shopping area. The station on the sky train network is "Siam". This will allow you to enter Siam Center and Siam Paragon. It has so much to see and taste and do. It is not like any shopping malls in the UK, it is great. Had a good wonder about and in the Siam Paragon centre the last floor a hidden tresure of a food court. Oh my god how much food was there, everything you can imagine, well presented and it was so busy. We had a good lunch and shopped on. Round the corner is another shopping mall called MBK Centre, this is for everything electronic, phones, watches, TV, Videos, Games...... you name it. you need to barter to get a good price and use cash not to get charged % fee. That's where I got my chrager in the end. Enjoy spending money...I know I did!!!

Great Shopping MAll. Do check out this shopping mall when in bangkok. The Ocean world in this shopping mall is a life time experience, as you can watch a 4D theatre movie, travel and see fish in a glass bottom boat and an aquarium tunnel where you can see sharks and much more. Its an up market international standard shopping mall with good prices.Food court is alos great and you can find a wide range to choose from.

Siam Paragon is an easily-accessible shopping centre in a good location. First I would just like to point out that the Siam Paragon shopping centre is a completely different shopping centre to MBK. The MBK shopping centre is not as up market as the Siam Paragon and is also very popular with Thai teenagers and most of the clothes, bags and belts etc… are copies/fakes! Siam Paragon is of international standards and while there are many expensive designer shops, there are also some more reasonable prices to been found. My wife bought some underwear, for example, that she said were high quality and good value too!The BTS goes right to the door so getting there is easy. If you are visiting the nearby Siam Centre, Siam Discovery Centre or the MBK Centre you can walk pretty much all the way through them to get to Siam Paragon Centre. Across the road is an area of shops, restaurants and bars/clubs called Siam Square, which is popular with young Thais.The Siam Paragon Shopping Centre has lots of good features but my favourite one has to be the Siam Ocean World on the bottom floor. This was a very interesting look under-the-sea with lots to look at. On the way out I held a big Lizard on my arm for a photo too!

Good mall, bad prices. This is a huge mall, selling almost everything. However, so many tourists visit it that prices are inflated by up to 10 times. Also, it is impossible to get a taxi around SIAM Paragon and MBK without getting totally ripped off. I highly recommend taking the BTS (the sky-train) on your way back.I'm not saying you cannot get a deal. Mobile phones are well-priced, so is mostly anything in the very small stores. Jeans are good quality and around 1000 Baht (compared to Pratunam where denim jeans can be bought for 150 Baht).Also, I personally had a bad experience at SIAM/MBK. I was treated with a smile and as soon as I asked for a discount (I said, "Oh come on, give me a good price"), suddenly her face changed and she was angry. She turned her back on me and started touting people walking outside her store. This is at a jeans store on the main floor of MBK. To me, it seems SIAM Paragon/MBK is a good mall if you want to walk around and see the wares (and pay near-American/European prices), but not good if you're looking for a good deal. The sellers here are a bit spoiled due to the influx of tourists. I recommend checking out Pratunam or Chatuchak.
Quite Remarkable. Easy to reach - by BTS in particular, the Paragon is an oasis of luxury. Even with only two/three days in Bangkok, worth a visit - if not serious shopping.

Maybe the best mall in the WORLD.... To escape the mid-day Bangkok heat, head for Siam Paragon. This mall makes any U.S. or European mall look like NOTHING, really nothing at all. The movie theaters are probably the most luxurious in the world, with incredibly deluxe and spacious seating, with food and champagne service, lounges, etc. There is even an OPERA house on the top floor. I like the food court on the lower level the best... hundreds of choices, amazing variety, and reasonable prices too. Also a wide choice of full service restaurants. Virtually every major designer has a big store here, and car dealers too. Large boookstores (the Kinoyama ? is the best). There is a BTS elevated high speed train station adjacent (Siam Square stop), with two lines there, right in the center of the City. If you want to spend the night, there is a Novotel very close by, maybe 3 minutes walking. There are other large shopping malls nearby: the Central Plaza, even bigger, but not as nice as Siam Paragon; M.B.K. is close by, and best for bargain hunters. Adjacent to Siam Paragon is Siam Center and Siam Discovery Center. Around a very large block, or a 10 minute taxi ride, is Pantip Plaza shopping area, for electronics, computers, cheap movies, etc. The supermarket in the basement is amazing... what a selection, and reasonably prices... you can buy for example, a can of Campbell's soup, made in the U.S.A. for LESS MONEY than you pay for the same thing... IN THE U.S.A... it's true. The Ocean Aquarium in the basement is supposed to be Asia's finest. Siam Paragon makes even Singapore's malls look rather dreary and small. There is always some kind of event or entertainment going on there or just outside too, day and night. For those on a budget, Soi Kasesam nearby, across from MBK Center, has many cheap hotels and guesthouses.

Gorgeous Oceanarium................ The Paragon is a fantastic mall with beautiful stores.The highlight for us however was the amazing oceanarium in the basement with a15metre high bowfronted tank containing a full coral reef and schools of fish ,as well as other lovely displays .

Most opulent shopping center i have ever seen.. A flabergasting shopping center in a city of flabergasting shopping centers. This one tops them all. More dedicated watch company boutique stores than any place i have seen. even IWC has its own store. Ferrari, Lamborghini, Porsche, all have dealerships inside this mall. In fact, one could call this the Ferrari of shopping malls. The food halls in basement are worth the trip alone. There is also a pretty decent aquarium in the basement.

A US-style mall in Asia? This one could be better!. Whoa... what a mammoth mall these enterprising Thais have built! There's a full scale oceanarium in the basement, a never-ending food hall, an indoor lake, omni-max theatre, cineplex, exhibition/conference halls, dual-floor gym, Ferrari showroom, not to mention acres and acres of shops and more shops. All this and more packed in one 7-storey building. I've never seen anything quite like it in Asia. This could probably be the best. You can easily spend a whole day here and still not complete everything. Make sure you wear comfy walking shoes. And don't forget that GPS, just in case you get lost!
